Reviews.Title: “Peaceful oasis”
Reviews.Author: trigger019
Reviews.Content: We picked the Vdara for our first trip to Vegas, and we were SO glad we did! It was so peaceful to return to at the end of a busy day. The front desk staff were very pleasant, and I appreciated the security staff who watched the elevators - it made you feel safe. The elevators were fast and always available. We wished they had not played the loud music all day by the pool. We could hear it through closed windows in our room on the 16th floor! and it discouraged us from going to the pool at all ( a shame). It is advertised as "eco friendly", but there was no evidence of any recycling, and lightbulbs were incandescent. It was great to have a kitchen, but the fridge was very small. We asked for kitchen supplies, but needed to be more specific perhaps? we got two plates and cutlery. We made do though, and I'm sure they would have supplied other things had we asked. I would return for the NO casino, and NO smoking alone! it was a great alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet elegance within the frenzy of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: YVRTravelGirl_10
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my mother to Las Vegas and the Vdara was a great place for us. My mother has difficulty sleeping and having a hotel that was close to but not within the craziness of Las Vegas helped. You then have a choice to see all that Las Vegas offers but then can retreat to your hotel for reprieve. The room was good. Clean and sophisticated. However, rooms of this type only have one king bed and a pullout sleeper. I had asked prior to arriving so it wasn't a surprise. If you are going to use the sleeper couch, call them for sheets and to make up the bed. Interestingly enough, the sheets and blankets used for the sleeper are not the appropriate size for the bed. It worked fine though. The bathroom was just a marvel with the great soaker tub and shower. You need it for all the walking that one does in Vegas! The one thing that is strange is that the rooms do have a small kitchenette but NOTHING in the way of cutlery, pots, kettle, plates or mugs. I did call housekeeping for a kettle. They didn't have one but did supply a pot for boiling water. I also asked for a few mugs for tea or coffee. If you want to use the kitchen, CALL them for some household utinsels. They have a small fridge for you to use and they supply 2 small bottles of water each day. Wireless internet is also available. The internet is included in the resort fee that is charged here. This fee also includes gym usage, newspapers and the water in the fridge. Although the Vdara is not directly on the strip there is a monorail to connect to other hotels and the hotel is connected to the famous Bellagio. My mother is a senior and she needed to have some quiet in the afternoon to take a bit of a breather before going out at night to see shows and such, so this was a great spot for us. I love the gym and the personnel who work there were really friendly and helpful. There is the whole gamut: elipical trainers, treadmills, weights and universal gym equipment and yoga mats and such. I used the gym every morning and it was busy. All the staff we had contact with were great. One annoyance: I had a package sent to the hotel and I have to say that the $3.00 charge to accept a package was a bit much given that we are paying for resort fees and such. Also a warning, there is a sensor on the fridge with the beverages and such. They bill you $9.00 each time the fridge is opened, so check your bill before you leave the hotel! During check-out I had this removed but remember to verify. All in all, a great stay at a bit of a quieter spot in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: b o
Reviews.Content: Stayed about four days. The rooms were extremely clean. The person who cleaned out room each day actually organized our things each day; which made it easy to locate our stuff when we were in a rush. Our room had a mini fridge and stove; you have to request any type of utensils and plates. The view was AMAZING! The room has powered blackout screens and curtains. Stay was extremely quiet! Only complaint was the shower seemed to have low pressure, but that wasn't that big a deal. We stayed on a high floor. It was really nice to stay somewhere that was smoke free! Security was surprising; as you entered the lobby you must show your too key in order to take the elevator to your room. Nice little cafe and market in lobby. Close proximity to Aria where they had a few Resturants and places for desserts and coffee. Would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Vadara Hotel,, the best of the best !”
Reviews.Author: BiggsRiggs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara Hotel & Spa the weekend of March 24-26 for our anniversary. I must say that this hotel is awesome ! From checking in,, the front staff was very friendly and joked with us while making sure our room was ready and checked us in very fast. As soon as we walked into our room, we could not believe how nice the room was. My wife was in heaven ! Our room had nice sitting area with a couch and chair, along with a nice big TV. A small wall separated the the sitting area from the large King sized bed. We also had a small fridge, microwave and stove,,which we never used but it was nice to have. Our room had a view on the 22nd floor of the Rio and the Palms Hotel and they looked cool at night. The bed was oooooh soo comfortable. We go to Vegas quite often and try to stay at different hotels and gambled on the Vdara, which we now know was the right choice. I like the fact that that it did not have a casino in the hotel, which made it not as noisey or smokey as other hotels. We only had to walk across the walkway to the Bellagio Casino when we wanted to gamble or we could take the tram to Crystal's Casino or the Monte Carlo Casino, which we soo convenient. I would highly recommend the Vdara to anybody looking for a nice and comfortable stay. We will definately be back !

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: ElizaAnneAldrich
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the Vdara in October of 2010, It was great! I loved the hotel because it was quiet and was close to the City Center. Alot has changed since then, the hotel lobby was so crowded, we had a hard time just getting to the elevator! There was always a long wait at the Market Cafe and the Valet was so crowded, we often had to wait 15 minutes and more for our vehicle.There seemed to have been alot more noise this time too, we could hear loud music playing from a nightclub playing at the Cosmpolitan all night on Saturday. The best part of our stay was definitely the comfortable beds and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: guffsham26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the vdara between 24th and 27th. Good location, right in the middle of the decent part of the strip, 10 minutes either side of hotel got a bit more tacky and blackpooly! Great views from a very modern room, overlooking bellagio, Paris, las Vegas and Rio hotels. Loud neighbour on first night of stay but overall pleasant. I wouldnt go back to Vegas but would stay in the same hotel elsewhere. One thing though, tethering an iron to an ironing board makes it very difficult to use!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet stay in the heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Sean O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Wednesday night til Sunday and were pleasantly surprised by the overall look of the room and the view. Separate soaking tub and shower was great. When we arrived, we were informed that the pool was unavailable, but they'd made arrangements with the Aria for access to theirs (about a 5 min walk door to pool). That was great, but once Vdara got their pool halfway up and running (short staff, no bar or services) we were informed by the security at Aria that Vdara guests were no longer welcome. Vdara management apologized, but offered no other remedy. Other than the snafu with the pool, everything was above expectations. For the price, Vdara was exceptional in decor, amenities, view, location, etc. Also, its a non-smoking, non-gaming hotel, which kept the noise level and sinus irritation to a minimum. If you're a gambler, however, the Aria casino and sportsbook are only a few steps away, along with all of the clubs and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: B D
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel on the Strip that is near other casinos, hence, no smoke to walk through. The staff was nice and the rooms were clean. My room was just on the verge of showing some rough-around-the-edges need for some updates. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Hotel & Spa, the new Las Vegas Winner”
Reviews.Author: Suddrethks
Reviews.Content: Up until now, I thought the Bellagio could not be beat for a classy place to stay in Las Vegas. Then I discovered the Vdara Hotel & Spa in the City Center Complex and it is to die for. It is a smoke-free, casino-free hotel and it has every amenity you could ask for. I had a corner suite which was like a small apartment. The overall design of the suite was very functional and user friendly with all the trimmings: Bath Robes, Full Kitchen, Separate Sitting Area, etc. Power curtains and black-out drapes completed the picture. The Vdara is connected by a short walkway to the Bellagio which is the center of the Las Vegas universe (in my opinion). MGM has very smartly connected all these venues -- City Center, Bellagio, Aria -- with either walkways or trams so you can get around without a lot of walking on the strip or using cabs. Vdara has a basic coffee shop for all three meals with groceries for your in-room kitchen if you choose to eat in or you have a family with you and want to save money eating out. It is a very short walk to the new Cosmopolitan Hotel which has the best buffet in LV, in my opinion, called The Wicked Spoon. The Cosmo was going to be my new hotel choice (after a stay earlier in the year) until I discovered the Vdara. From checking in to checking out and everything in between, you cannot beat the service and facilities of the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Ian W
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 6 days at the Vdara with my fiance it was our 1st time in vegas and how right we were to choose the Vdara for our stay. Would definately recommend the Vdara for anyone to stay at on a trip to Vegas whether it be your 1st trip or not. The hotel is not directly on the strip although walking 10 minutes through the Bellagio to the strip was not a problem. The rooms in the hotel are fantastic and the bed was probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in and we got a room with a view over the Bellagio fountains and the Paris hotel which added to the whole vegas experience. I you are indicisive as to where to stay in Vegas then choose the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: babyimp
Reviews.Content: We stayed Vdara one night, and that is sufficient time to feel how excellent Vdara is. It doesn't have Casino,so there is no noise and no smoke in the lobby. The room has a small kitchen. Very close to Crystal shopping center and Bellagio hotel. If I travel to Las Vegas with my kid again, I'll definitely stay Vdara again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Ladrea C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and it was the best!! We had the corner room suite and the views were amazing! Service was great. Location was ok. We learned toward the end of our stay how to navigate using the trams and that was a big help. The food there is a bit pricey, but what isn't in Vegas or on the Blvd. We have already recommended this hotel to all our friends and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: amandapanda386
Reviews.Content: Like all of you I spent hours reading reviews before booking a hotel for 11 nights in Vegas - and so glad booked the Vdara. As everyone had said - great location (10 mins walk to Bellagio), great size rooms and view, very central on strip, 10 mins walk to Aria monorail, nice to get away from hustle of the strip. Room service/cleaning excellent. Great to walk into a hotel and not have to walk through casino to get to room. Only disappointment was pool was closed (which we had not known about). Make sure you take a kettle. Would definately stay there again and our deal included the resort fee (look out the for this or it could catch you out). Best meal at Ceasers - Trevi italian restaurant. Oh and the beds are really comfy!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and never dissapoints!!”
Reviews.Author: sambuddi2u
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my bachelorette party last week (March 22-24) and we stayed at Vdara. This is my second time checking in Vdara and I really love this boutique hotel. I booked the Vdara suite but when I checked in, they offered me a Vdara suite with 180° view(corner suite, 33002) for only $30 a night and an early check in (10:30 am instead of 3pm). You can see Cosmopolitan hotel, Bellagio (dancing fountain), Paris, Planet Hollywood. It was beauitful at night with all the lights on. I love the spacious room and the extra half bathroom located near the kitchen. There is also a washer and dryer. One disspointment was the pull out sofa bed. You can literally feel the springs!!! We ended up sleepign on the floor (more comfortable than the spring). I wish I complained on the front desk but I totally frogot about it until our last day. They do offer a pillow top but that did not mitigate that uncomforatble spring feeling when you lay down. Overall, the stay is pretty good. My friends love the boutique spa hotel and vow never to check in cheap hotels from now on. I love how it is non gaming so there is no smoke smell lingering in the lobby area. Cosmopolitan and Aria hotel are just walking distance. I will definitely be back at Vdara!!

Reviews.Title: “Low-key luxury, March 23-25”
Reviews.Author: FamilyontheMove_12
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is small-scale luxury. A parents only trip to Las Vegas where we go quite often and have stayed everywhere. It is smoke-free and the pool, gym, lounge and cafe are all two minutes from your door. If you have been to Vegas you know that all these things can be a very long walk from your room through a large casino. Highlights: service is stunning as always, although we were only able to get a standard room, we had a beautiful view of the mountains; the food in what looks like an everyday walk-up cafe is great, better than some sit-downs in other casinos, try the sandwiches and breakfasts, worth the $10; the lounge luckily lacks the drunk, smoking, loud groups (this is not where the bachelor/ettes parties are hanging out); if you want to let loose and still be able to talk to the partner you came with, this is the place. It is close to all the craziness you desire since the Cosmo and Aria is literally steps away and Planet Hollywood and a slew of shops on the miracle mile are across the street. Lowlights: We did have a very loud group next to us that had to work extra hard to be disruptive because other than them, I did not hear anyone else talking or even opening and closing their doors.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: JazzyCazy
Reviews.Content: We chose Vdara to try something different and I got a great deal on a city corner suite (41024, awesome view of the Bellagio fountains). The ambience as soon as you walk in is calm and serene, a world away from the bustle of Las Vegas. What the other reviewers have said about this is true, if you want calm, this is your place, if not, you might want to try somewhere else. So the things I loved about Vdara. Non smoking which is great, the décor is sleek modern and sexy. The rooms have excellent amenities and are clean and comfortable. The bed is to die for. We ordered room service for breakfast both days of our stay and it was impeccably presented and delicious. We used the gym and it was well equipped but maybe could have been a little bigger? The café, although a little pricey was good for a snack too. The staff were friendly, efficient and accomodating always following up to make sure everything was satisfactory. My main gripe I think is the location. If you walk through City Center you have to walk via Aria then Crystals, or via Bellagio or via the road then the Cosmo, or if you’re feeling adventurous/crazy, via the non-pedestrian road bit on the side of the Cosmo (don’t try this!!). You weren’t right there is what I’m trying to say. But for my husband and I who wanted some quality alone time relaxing – Vdara was an awesome oasis in the Mojave desert.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the vdara”
Reviews.Author: Dawn H
Reviews.Content: Just spent 11 days at the Vdara in las Vegas, Our 2nd stay there, we have stayed in most of the 5 star hotels in the strip and would highly recommend this hotel, . We had a wonderful strip view from our suite, the room was spotless and the staff were all very polite and friendly. It is nice to have the smoke free environment and a peaceful place to stay but still enjoy the shopping and entertainment on the strip. Added bonus was the small kitchen area including the refrigerator/ microwave and 2 complimentary bottles of water each day.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Lana117
Reviews.Content: For convenience, you cannot beat the Vdara. It is only a 5 minute walk from the strip, a short walk to the Aria and Bellagio and access to the tram that runs from the Bellagio to the Monte Carlo. You also do not have to negotiate a walk through a massive casino to reach the outside Our City Center Corner Suite was huge with a large kitchen, bedroom, living room and enormous bathroom. It was very clean and luxurious. On the negative side, for a hotel of this class, they need to upgrade to toilet paper that does not dissolve on contact. It was not even white but a dingy gray color and extremely thin like you would find in a cheap restaurant bathroom. The shower, although very spacious, had the shower head mounted up so high that combined with a very poor flow, made rinsing your hair difficult. It was funny that when a cab driver asked us how we liked the hotel, we mentioned the shower and he said he hears that from a lot of people. Does the hotel read these reviews??? The large windows gave an outstanding view of the city and the blinds and blackout shades lowered with the touch of a switch. Unfortunately, the blackout blind directly across from our bed was broken. We reported it on the first day but it was not fixed until after we had spent 4 nights waking up to bright light in our eyes. We were also absolutely astounded that a hotel of this caliber chose to chain their iron to the ironing board. We have never even seen this done in cheap motels. Very tacky and insulting. All in all, I still give this a very good rating and recommend the Vdara. Just bring your own toilet paper next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillymadam
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for quite a few reasons but mainly that it did not have a casino. It is a fairly new hotel and in the middle of the strip and we accessed it by walking through the Bellagio. Our room was very large and the king sized bed very comfortable. The bathroom was very modern with a large shower and bathtub. There was a small kitchen but not really required as everyone ate out anyway. We thought we would have tea and coffee facilities but they did not provide that for a 'deluxe' room. We did ask for a room with a view of the Strip and got one on the 20th floor with a view of the fountains at the Bellagio as well. All in all, a good choice only draw back was the $20 per night + tax resort fee which we though a tad expensive!!!!

Reviews.Title: “High Style With Subtle Sophistication”
Reviews.Author: KeiraAnneM
Reviews.Content: When my friends and I recently planned our first trip to Las Vegas, we decided on staying at the Vdara Hotel & Spa. Not only was it located in close proximity to the Strip, but it is one of the only smoke-free hotels around and that was important to all of us. Upon entering the lobby, we were instantly struck by the fact that the Vdara has no casino. That can be a plus or a minus for you, so take it as you will. The front desk staff were friendly and incredibly helpful. We were travelling in two couples and, though we had booked separately, Vdara was able to put us in adjacent rooms on the same floor. Bonus points! The rooms in particular are spacious by hotel standards and very well-appointed. Entering through the kitchenette, the room opens up to include a dinette area, roomy couch with a flat screen TV and an ahhhh-mazing king-sized bed. Near the bed is the ensuite equipped with a sink, major counter space and even a deep soaker tub. While most of our time was spent exploring Las Vegas, the Vdara proved to be a restful place to recharge - and in a bed that induces heavenly sleeps! It's a quiet hotel, far enough from the Strip but close enough with access through the Cosmpolitan or Bellagio hotels. Though the pool was closed for renovations, we were able to use the Aria's pools (across the rotunda) for no charge and enjoyed every minute of them. The Vdara no doubt impressed us and was a wise choise for our accommodation. Though the Vdara is a very nice hotel, I doubt we'll stay there on our next visit... and not because it's not a great hotel, but because the Strip has so many other hotels that exude far more excitement and Vegas-esque character than the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms, Friendly Staff, Great Location, NOT SMOKEY”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseAdvice
Reviews.Content: We booked a spur of the moment Las Vegas trip (yes, shocking, I know) and chose to stay at the Vdara Hotel and Spa. The hotel is located in the city center cluster amongst Avia, Cosmopolitan and right next door to Bellagio (one of our favorites) - right in the heart of the strip. We frequent LV yearly at a minimum and have stayed in a number of places, which is always part of the adventure. Our experiences have included (in order of preference) Bellagio, Venetian, Mandalay Bay, Wynn, Paris, Luxor, MGM Grand, Excaliber, and Tropicana. Vdara has two distinct advantages: 1) It is new and, 2) It is smoke free (BIG bonus). Upon arriving we found that the check-in line was a bit on the long side (never a great thing to do to people who are tired from traveling) but the check in staffer was great. We already had booked a nice room and we still received a free "birthday" upgrade (thanks so much!) The bell hops outside were really great and efficient both coming and going. The guy delivering bags to the room was without fun or frills or any enthusiasm whatsoever. The room itself was gorgeous, on the 40th floor, overlooking the Bellagio water feature and strip. The room had a lovely little kitchen, a good-sized refrigerator, an honor bar, sink, dishwasher and stove top, but no coffee or coffee maker - weird! The room itself was beautiful and complete with a bedroom, half wall that divided into the den/office, two large plasmas and all bordered by a wall to wall window which included power blinds and black-out curtains (touch of a button). The bathroom was large, luxurious and included a large bath, glass shower, closet, plenty of counter space, but very few amenities (only soap and shampoo). As a side-note, I'd like to add that the shampoo smells exactly like public bathroom deodorizer - funny until you wash your hair with it. The other oddity was in the fact that this place calls itself a "spa" but there are no bath robes or any other such pampering amenities unless you ask for them. We asked about them (asked the bell hop who brought the bags) and he pointed to the phone and told us to ask "them" if we wanted any robes. Hmm. The bed, pillows and sheets were lovely, and I'm really fussy about my bedding, so that's a big plus. If I pay money to stumble blindly into my room and collapse into a drunken coma on my hotel bed, I don't want to wake up with extra kinks in my neck and back in addition to my hangover! Last little bummer - nobody told us that the pool lacked a drop of water and the hot tubs weren't running either...oh well. Guess that makes them harder to review. Bottom line: Nice, nice new, greatly located, smoke-free hotel with a few kinks to work out. Definitely recommend this place, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “return visit as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl905
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I returned based on our enjoyable stay last year. Once again the service was excellent from the front desk to the concierge, to the housekeeping staff. If there's one thing LV knows how to, it's to make every guest feel special. The Vdara is an ideal location because of its accessibility. On arrival, there is no long trek through a crowded casino to check in and find the elevators, they are right off the main lobby. Joining the constant motion of The Strip takes only a few minutes walk in any direction. And when you've had enough of the the fun, crowds, music, and flashing lights returning to the serenity of your Vdara room is only steps away. Best of both worlds. Downside is the resort fee. However, every suite has its own mini kitchen and fridge - great for chilling water, wine and snack foods or light breakfast items that can give your days more flexibility.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Smoke Free”
Reviews.Author: mariaCourtice
Reviews.Content: Vdara was a relaxing, clean and a breathe of fresh air in Vegas. The service staff were fantastic and our room was gorgeous with plenty of the amenities. It was good value for the money we spent. The bed was very comfortable and always cleaned very well! It was located in a great spot, literally in the middle of the strip. We just wish the pool was open when we were there. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roberval
Reviews.Content: It is a very beautiful hotel. People working at the Vdarra Hotel were very nice and helpful. They were very attentive and made our stay there fantastic. Rooms were great; lots of commodities. I would have liked to have an indoor swimming pool but would we have had time to take advantage of it. There are no restaunts in the hotel but the Aria offers many restaurants. I would recommand this hotel to my best friends. The only negative point is that I forgot a picture on one of the desks and they never found :( Don't hesitate to book a room there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, but some staff issues.”
Reviews.Author: lokey3
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Vdara for 3 nights. The room itself was lovely. Modern with great views. We were in a executive corner suite, but I wouldn't waste your money on the upgrade, the other rooms were just as spacious (for the exception of the Vdara Suite, which is still nicely appointed). Check in was a bit of an issue as they couldn't find our reservation at first, lucky for us I did have the confirmation number. The young lady who checked us in should really not be working in the hotel industry. This became acutely obvious after dealing with another staff member, who was very polite and helpful) on an unrelated issue. The hotel is a little off the strip ( a couple minute walk) but no big deal considering all the walking you do during the day and it was very nice to come back to a quiet serene environment after all the noise and bustle on the strip. There is also a walkway that connects the hotel to the Bellagio. After reading many of the reviews, both positive and negative I would say they all have some merit. The pool was closed and there was no mention of this at check in. We didn't find out until my husband and son rode the elevator down to the pool only to find the door padlocked. Very disappointing especially considering you still pay the full resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “NOT TOO FAR AND AWAY”
Reviews.Author: KATINCIBOLO
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Vdara Suite. I requested a room with Bellagio fountain view but it was not available so they upgraded me to a corner suite. I appreciated that. I looked to see what the difference was between the rooms. The difference was that the corner suite had a media hub, 4 burner stove and maybe some other ammenity but it is the same size as the Vdara Suite. Either way, the rooms are very nice and the beds are spectacularly comfortable. Both the Aria and the Cosmopolitan are very close but I suggest before you go out, you speak to the concierge and get your bearings and directions straight because you can spend alot of time walking if you dont know how to get to and from the different hotels. You can also get to the Bellagio easily and there is a tram that can take you to Crystals and the Monte Carlo. Then right across the street is Planet Hollywood. So there are alot of options without taking a cab. The other things I liked about our suite was the soaking tub and I like having a living room and a refrigerator. Even though my room was just right of the elevator; I never heard any noise or other people so that was nice especially since we were there at spring break. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location that is not a casino”
Reviews.Author: knowhowtotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days. The rooms are excellent, the location is very good and a bonus is that it is not a casino but it is a shortish walk to the strip. The rooms are provided a small kitchenette and we requested some cutlery from housekeeping and it consisted of a 2 dinner plates, 2 bowls and cutlery. A major disappointment was that the room did not come with a coffee maker !!!!.nor could they provide any microwave containers so that we could heat some water. We have been traveling for 6 weeks and this is the first accommodation (and the most expensive) that has not provided coffee making facilities. When I enquired I was told to order coffee from the room service or get it from the small cafe on the ground floor. This in my opinion was unacceptable. If you are thinking of Staying in one of these rooms so that you can make some meals to your own liking or make a coffee when you feel like it......bring your own utensils or stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hsbstone
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner suite with a great view, right on the strip without all the hustle and bustle. Our reservation was wrong but the receptionist was very helpful and straightened all the things out for us. We had an early check in and a late check out with no charges. There is no cassino, what I don't mind, but there is a connection to the Bellagiocassino and the Aria cassino is right across the street. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite center of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: TravlinfoolSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here just before Thanksgiving and had a great time in Vegas. The all-suite hotel was perfect. There is no casino in this hotel and it is non-smoking which suited us just fine. It is virtually attached to the Bellagio, so gambling is near as is most of the main LV Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights March break, room was beautiful and spacious, clean and safe as elevator had guard. Walkway attached to Bellagio and tram provides very convenient access to several hotels. Centre strip very ideal. Room was quiet on 29 th floor with great view of Bellagio fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: My girls and I went for a weekend in Vegas and stayed at the Vdara. I would highly recommend this hotel! It was really spacious and very comfortable for the 5 of us. The staff was all very friendly. The hotel room has a kitchenette which is nice for bringing back leftovers or drinks. The bathroom is huge with a nice tub and a great shower. This hotel doesn't have a casino attached, but it is tram connected to the Cosmopolitan and also a couple minute walk across to the Aria. There are great restaurants close, and the whole complex is easy walking distance to the strip and many of the popular sites in Vegas. I would definitely stay here again - great place.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara - Great place”
Reviews.Author: Craig A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara a few weeks ago and put simply we really enjoyed our stay. We stayed in one of the "Vdara suites" with a view of the Billagio fountains. The room was very spacious and nice. The kitchen was very nice but we did not have much occassion to use it. I had the men's cut and style at the salon and the service was excellent. The staff was very friendly. One small drawback that, though on the strip it is set back a little ways and is a short walk. An exellent bargain and a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JillD09
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect choice for a 5 night stay. A non-gaming hotel just one block from the Strip - an oasis of calm amidst the buzz of Las Vegas. The rooms are huge & we had a fabulous view overlooking the Bellagio fountains - our very own show-time every 15 minutes! The pool area was closed due to maintenance but we were able to use the facilities at the sister hotel the Aria which are far superior. Also the Buffet at the Aria is one of the best on the Strip & very reasonable prices. I would definitely stay again & have no problem in recommending if you are looking for a relaxing stay in Vegas, if that is possibel!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooms”
Reviews.Author: busyme1
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying the rooms were incredible. Just what we needed after a night on the strip. Our view of the fountains was nice. Kitchen was nice, though we did not use it. We loved that it was connected to the belligo and aria was a short outside walk outside. You wont notice your not on the strip.Nice alternative to a casino. Everyone was very nice. My only complaint is that the elevator attendents were a little annoying at night. I was tired one night and went to the room earlier than my husband. I told the hotel attendent for the night to let my husband just come up if he gives the room number. He agreed. 1 hour later i get a call from my husband saying i need to go to the lobby to get him bc they wont let him up.I know this is a safty concern of the hotel but come on I had to get out ouf the shower and go down stairs. Very inconvent for a five star hotel. Other than that it was a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A True Wow Factor”
Reviews.Author: TampaLeon
Reviews.Content: How is this property not rated higher? This hotel checks all the boxes that I would want in a Vegas hotel experience. It is ultra clean, very chic and stylish, the room made me say "wow", I had great views of the Bellagio fountain, and the mountains, and the service was outstanding. The cool modern features such as the powered (at the push of a button) shades and blackout curtains did not hurt either. Coming from a hotel earlier in the trip that did not hit allt hose marks, I was extremely excited to have the Vdara experience. The hotel is very quiet, and smells great. That is probably due to no casino in the lobby. But for my casino lovers, do not fret. The Aria hotel has a casino that is a brief (1-2 minutes) walk away. The Bellagio is connected via a walkway in the other direction as well. Overall this hotel is ideally located in City Center. You can walk to just about anything your heart desires. There is also a tram available if you do not want to walk to some of the other hotels in the area. I would definitely stay here and recommend it to anyone wanting to be in the center of the Las Vegas strip action. By the way, there are great deals to be had for the rooms here. Several people talked about how expensive they thought a stay here was or would be. I was able to get a very good rate plus $100 food and beverage credit during my stay here. Just keep an eye out for deal offers. Simply Wow.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MartiniRosssi
Reviews.Content: I return from the Vdara after a 3 night stay for my birthday weekend. I read most of the reviews before booking in January so I knew what to look for a expect...and after experiencing the Hotel for myself, I honestly have no complaints! When you walk into the hotel the environment is so different, no casinos, no smoking which I loved. The woman who checked us in was very nice and helpful. We knew ahead of time of the resort fee of $22 a night (thanks Tripadvisor reviewers for the heads up). We told her we wanted a great view of the Bellagio so she put us on the 20th floor with a great view. Our room was spotless, nicely decorated and comfy. Our bathroom was full stocked with towels, soap, shampoo, and lotions etc (bring your own toothpaste). The tiny kitchen was cute but we didn’t use it; I am not a coffee drinker so I’m not sure if we had a coffee maker or not. Our room was cleaned daily, the cleaning staff was friendly when we pass them in halls. I went to the Spa while I was there; the costs for their services are comparable to the other hotels (believe me I checked). I hand a GREAT deep tissue massage! It was so awesome I feel asleep for most of the session! I didnt hear any noises while I was awake…at all. It was one of the best spa experiences I’ve had. The facility itself is beautiful and accommodating. There’s a Jacuzzi, sauna, steam room, lounge area, mediation room, showers and everything is so clean and neat. The staff makes sure nothing is laying around. Concierge was a life saver! They were very helpful/informative when it came to booking dinners at different restaurants and suggesting great breakfast buffets One night my husband and I went down stairs to bar where we had drinks, munched on some of bar snacks and relaxed. It was great! The location is convenience, no far from the strip at all - a 5 minute walk...if that! If you have a problem with walking 5 minutes TO the strip then you probably should be walking through the strip at all, the strip is a killer. I would definitely return to this hotel, I would recommend this hotel to friends for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place in the city of fun”
Reviews.Author: Avisurtout
Reviews.Content: I get a nice suite at the 44th floor, enough far from the elevator to be quiet. The view was insane, on the Bellagio's fountain and on Las vegas. The people inside are very cool and quiet, and are willing to help you if necessary. No casino inside the Hotel, so the staff all around is listening at you. The food was too expensive, but well, we are in Vegas :). On advise to end up : ask for a room with the view and near the 44th floor, and get the suite, it worth the price...

Reviews.Title: “Waouh ! Beautiful hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ViktorTatran
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel at 5 mns from the Strip Boulevard. Rooms are nice, a beautiful spa and a large swimmimng pool. A little bite expensive, but this is ok for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - and NO COFFEE MAKER”
Reviews.Author: lkarelee
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Vadara in Las Vegas and although the room was comfortable and tastefully decorated and had a small kitchenette - there was no coffee maker, dishes, plates, silverware, or anything else you would normally find in a kitchen. We asked for a coffeemaker but were told they didn't have any unless you booked a suite. You had to buy coffee ($6.00 a cup) downstairs in the cafe and tote it back to your room - now this was a $200 a night room!! The staff were very nice and very sympathetic to our no coffee plight. If I stay at Vadara again - I will definitely pack some instant coffee and a CUP!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Peace & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Grateful01
Reviews.Content: I agree with my fellow reviers that Vdara is a great place to stay. It's a few blocks from the strip (behind the Cosmopolitan), but close enough where everything is nearby. There's a tram/connector to the Bellagio, which helps you get access to everything else. If you don't mind walking 10 mins to Las Vegas Blvd, it's great! It's not your typical Vegas lobby..the minute you walk into the hotel, you realize that you are in a different venue. The simple, quiet lobby excudes cleanliness with a touch of urban chic. The market/deli - also located in the lobby area, offers organic food that is delicious and fresh. The staff - from the bellperson to the night doorman - is courteous, professional, and makes you feel welcome from the beginning. They truly appreciate you staying there. The room we had was a mini-suite, with a kitchen area, living room/sleeping area, and separate bathroom area. My good friend and I traveled together, and it was nice to have plently of room to spread out. We felt like we were in an apartment in Manhattan. The view was amazing, and offered different shades to allow one to enjoy Vegas skyline. The rooms each have a doorbell, and buttons to indicate whether or not you want housekeeping service. I accidentally left ours on, and did not receive service one day. Ah well! A few things that I was surprised about...my friend and I wanted separate beds, but they indicated that the entire hotel only offers a King and a pullout couch. Personally, I did not like that one of us had to sleep on a pullout couch, and that 2 beds were not an option...but my friend said it was fine to sleep on. The pool area was not open, but I was able to use Aria's pool area....about a 10 minute walk next store. It's a wonderful area with great bar service as well. We went to the spa, all excited for a Vegas spa experience. It was wonderful and relaxing, with a hottub/showers/heated lounge chairs/aveda products to use, etc. Meditaton lounges are available to use too, so one can take a nap right after a massage. It was marvelous. We both realized afterward that we could hear a lot going on in other rooms/outside our doors during our massage...not something that you shell out decent money for a "spa experience." That was disappointing. We called the spa a few hours later, and they apologized and welcomed us back the next day to use the spa area as much as we want. When I went back the next day, they knew who I was immediately and welcomed me with open arms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a gem, especially if you like to get away from the casinos and the smoking. Perfectly tucked far back enough from the strip to feel exclusively sheltered but centrally located for easy access to everything, City Center feels like an upscale upgrade from the Strip from the moment you drive up. The property is gorgeous, modern, classy and understated, everything about it is a refreshing contrast to most of the strip. No smoking, no casino = quiet & comfortable. The staff was low key and professional. At check in, the clerk asked if I had a room preference, and when I asked him to pick something great out for me, he chose a room with a great view of the Bellagio fountains...nice upgraded room. These are all suites. Mine had a kitchenette with stove, microwave, fridge and dining room table, living room with couch, chair, side table, coffee table, two large screen TV's, a soaking tub, glass shower, queen size bed and automatic shades. The decor was modern...dark wood, leather and frosted glass, everything was new and clean. You pay a resort fee, but I enjoyed the wi-fi, waters in the room and the gym. All of those would have cost more separately elsewhere. The cafe was a great breakfast alternative in the morning before my meetings. This will be my go to property in the future. It's rare that you go to a property anywhere and can't find anything to criticize. This was honestly a five out of five star stay. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, great service”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are spending our last night in the Vdara...had great service...especially appreciated Mary the concierge who helped us when my husband became sick and we had tickets to "O" that we couldn't use. We booked through Jet Luxury Resorts and when there was an issue with our reservation they upgraded us to a one bedroom overlooking Bellagio fountains. Great location and loved being connected via foot bridge to the Bellagio. Very happy with Vdara. Was wondering about how good the service would be based on some of the reviews but everyone was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeDNJ
Reviews.Content: Since we hadn't been to LasVegas in about 10 years we wanted to stay in a newer hotel and the travel agent suggested the Vdara. We thought it was a good choice in that it was clean, quiet and the staff was attentive to our needs. The biggest complaint we had is that you could not walk directly to LasVegas Blvd. And when our daughter came to pick us up with her car, there was only one way in. The concierge at the hotel was very helpful in getting us show tickets at a discount. All the people we met that were working at Vdara were pleasant and helpful. Would we go back? I don't think so - and only because of the indirect location. Other than that I would recommend it to anyone that likes a non-casino, no-smoking facility.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chiefytravels
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately for us, we were greeted by an a*hole of a valet staff. He crankily told us to move our hire car then didn't even offer to help me with my 20kg backpack despite being about 5m from the trunk of the car. I was shocked! The same guy wouldn't let my boyfriend leave the car, so without offering to help, I dragged both of our backpacks into the reception. At the reception, there was no line and I was served straight away to a lovely gentleman who checked me in quickly. I was soon on my way up to my room and was delighted with the view (I specifically asked for a high room with views of the Bellagio fountains prior to arrival. tick). The room had a small kitchen (you need to request utensils etc) and 2 fridges which I thought was good one was full of mini bar goods (which are automatically charged to your room when you remove them) and the other fridge empty which was useful as we bought drinks, salads etc from Walgreens & ABC which was much cheaper than room service/the deli downstairs. The automatic blinds/shade was automatic but I was a bit disappointed at the amount of light that shone through the gaps in the morning. I expected them to completely shut out the light, but it wasn't the case. My fault for staying out all night I guess! The bathroom had a lovely big tub which I thought was great. Nice and deep. The shower was good too. The bedroom had 2 TV's, one facing the lounge, the other in the bedroom. The internet was quick (and should be for the resort fee - $25 a day, crazy). Room service was very slow and ridiculously expensive (as expected) but we got $100 credit included in our package so we used it. My boyfriend ordered a hamburger which he thought was OK and I ordered some breakfast. I liked how the toast was made fresh in the room. The deli downstairs was lovely and fresh (and expensive) but it is convenient. As mentioned above, stock up with water/softdrinks/snacks/alcohol from Walgreens or ABC to have in your room. Check out was quick, no line. You can actually call reception and make an appointment to check out so perhaps thats a better idea if you are on a tight schedule, from other reviews the reception line can get long but over 4 nights, we never saw it too busy. The walk to the strip is accessible through the Bellagio & so too is the monorail. Overall I was happy with the room and would recommend it. It is nice and new and I really do like that it was non-smoking and didn't have a casino in the building. The cleaning staff did a great job too, I thought the room was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location. Very modern amenities.”
Reviews.Author: impulse22281
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time in Las Vegas. Last time I stood in NYNY. I thought the remote control shades, and room darkening blinds, as well as the electronic Do not Disturb, Housekeeping button, and room doorbell were all cool little gadgets. I requested a view of the Bellagio fountains and got one. Staff was friendly. Great location - only caveat is that it takes a little while to actually walk through the connecting overpass and through the Bellagio to get to the strip...maybe a 10 minute walk, but not bad at all. They did charge a $20 per night hotel fee which I guess covers waters, printing your boarding passes on your departure, etc. The $20 fee did catch me a little off guard since I had booked through a Southwest Jackpot deal. I'm still giving it 5 stars because I enjoyed my stay, and everything costs money in Vegas. Would definitely recommend Vdara to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vdara - great location, clean, comfortable, modern.”
Reviews.Author: GigiDenise
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas as a couple and the Vdara was perfect for us. Checking was quick; friendly and efficient staff at the desk. We never waited more than 20 seconds for an elevator! We loved that there was no casino/no smoking. Quick and easy to get to the elevators. We ate most breakfasts at the Market and the food and service were great. Access to restaurants at the Aria was no further than in-house dining from rooms in other hotels so was not a problem. Room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was roomy with a large shower and a soaker tub. The bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed the view of the Bellagio fountains from our 23rd floor rom. The windows the entire length of the room afforded an excellent view. Walkway to the Bellagio was convenient, and taxi service was prompt. I would definitely stay at Vdara again, and would not hesitate recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice concept, but not sure I would return”
Reviews.Author: mary10007
Reviews.Content: Love the no smoking, no casino policy, but the staff needs to get their act together. Check in was hours late (granted, they issued comps, but not enough when you are exhausted and just want a room). Many guests were complaining about the long wait. When we finally got our room we were upgraded and very pleased with the great views of the ballagio fountain and city. However, housekeeping did a poor job (food left in sink, waste baskets not emptied, etc). Lots of young people crowded in suite rooms (and @ pool). Breakfast options limited to one cafe that was crowded (not enough help). Overall, probably won't return, even though we loved the no smoking aspect.

Reviews.Title: “1st time visit to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Steve T
Reviews.Content: The Vdara was excellent , we were on 26th floor overlooking bellagio fountains. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Room very clean and everything worked. Ideal location on the strip. Would certainly go back

Reviews.Title: “great hotel without the rifraf”
Reviews.Author: luby12
Reviews.Content: first time to stay at Vdara. Was very clean and very nice rooms. We loved that it was non smoking and no casino because you can take a break from it all. Staff was excellent. The only drawback was we had several people in each room and they only have king beds with a sleeper sofa. Would be nice if two queen beds were available. The sleeper sofa was very uncomfortable and you have to ask for the bedding. The pool was under construction but they allow you to use the Aria's pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Planet5455
Reviews.Content: Very clean and stylish hotel. We booked for a week with Expedia and includibg our flights it was £600 each, which we thought was excellent value for money. We had an excellent room on 20th floor with a view of a section of The Strip and the Bellagio fountains. Ask when you check in for a room at the front. Bathrooms were beautiful and were sparklingly clean every day. We had the basic suite which was still a pretty enormous room with a kitchenette, dining area and sofa. The bed was gloriously comfy. We were told that the pool was unavailable, but we're happy to use the one at the sister hotel Aria. Vdara has a 'snack bar' which came in very handy for wraps, bagels, sandwiches, salads, fruits and breakfast items. The main dining experience is at the Aria where the buffets are sensational. This is a short walk from Vdara lobby to Aria and up an escalator. Looking at other hotels this was a shorter distance than most who had the buffets within the hotel. Vegas is big so we accepted you have to walk to get to places. Comfy shoes are essential in the day. We didn't have a problem with all the walking to different hotels as we felt we needed to after all the food we ate. The Vdara is connected by a walkway to The Bellagio and we enjoyed walking through to get to the strip. We actually felt this hotel was an excellent location. One small word if warning for us Brits. There are no tea/coffee facilities in the room and you need to ask the lobby for cups, plates, cutlery and pans etc. Upon request they delivered the items within 5 mins. They don't have kettles, so you need to boil the water in a pan on the hallogen hob. We just got on with it and just excepted it. I'd packed tea bags (sad I know) but they actually came in very handy and neither my friend nor I can function without our morning brew. Pick up carton of milk too as the hotel charged us $9 a glass! Overall an excellent hotel and we had the most amazing week in Vegas - a must for the bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but with some quirks.”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: Once I got bit by the travel bug, and then the Vegas bug, I wanted to stay at Vdara, but for various reasons I could never justify it. Well, the "march madness effect" seems to have worked in my favor this year because all the cheap Vegas hotels filled up FAST. With my MLife membership, I was able to swing a rate at Vdara that made it competitive with other upscale hotels. You can't deny that the building is amazing and flat out exquisite in various aspects. There's something about the shape that sets it apart from the rest (except for Aria, of course). Yet, I can't help but think that, someone, at some point, ruined Vdara for everyone. By this I mean that there are certain things about the guest rooms that are flat out quirky. Kitchenette? Great, until you realize that all the drawers and cabinets are empty. No silverware, no dishes, no cookware. Nothing. Clothes iron? Tethered to the ironing board. Coffee maker? None. To understand where I'm coming from, you have to compare Vdara to Palms Place. I would consider these to be equivalent properties, but the edge goes to Palms Place which has fully stocked kitchenettes, doesn't tether the clothes iron to the board, and provides a coffee maker. It's like a movie with a really impressive trailer, but when you pay $10 to see the movie in the theater, everything from the trailer happens in the first 10 minutes and the rest is fluff. That's what Vdara is to me. Big lure, followed by fluff. Yes, it looks nice, the beds are pretty good, and you're in CityCenter, but you might as well have stayed at Aria because you don't really gain anything by picking Vdara. That's it. I don't regret staying here, because there's always a first time for everything, but unless they stop treating guests like irresponsible children (I know, there are some out there), I'd rather spend my money on a regular room elsewhere. Recommend? Not really.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service, pool under construction, hiding fees and noisy!”
Reviews.Author: FrauKritisch
Reviews.Content: After reading all the good reviews we decided to stay in the Vdara Hotel. That they are smoke-free and have no casino was a plus for us too, because we wanted a quiet hotel. Unfortunately our stay was very disappointing so we will stay at another hotel next time (there are so many!). First of all. The pool is under construction so it can be very noisy. They don't tell you that when you book or check in. We thought the pool is in repair and ready for a swim the next day. But after asking we found out that the pool is under construction for the next months. So, no pool in the hotel. For what I am I paying 30USD resort fee??? Rooms: - nice new room with big windows - view of interstate (but was ok for us) - construction noise the whole day - thin walls so you hear your neighbors (our neighbors partied the whole night like crazy) - although it is a new hotel the walls in our room were run down and in the bathroom the ceiling was half ripped off but never repaired - nice bathroom, but no water pressure in shower - they have a kitchen in every room but no dishes, coffee maker or anything....you need to order it - there was a table lamp at the bed side but you had to turn on/off the light from the living room, not when lying in bed which is very inconvenient (and yes we've asked because we thought it can't be true, but it was in our room) - window shades have a gap between them so light is still coming in - check out time is already at 11AM (no late check outs) Location: - very annoying, you need to take the air train or walk quiet a while (THROUGH the casinos) until you get to the strip (and it's not a pleasant walk and you get confused where to go because there are almost no signs) Service: We travel a lot all over the US (for business but also for pleasure) and stayed in many different hotels from 3 stars to 5 stars luxury. Even Motel 6 has nicer, more helpful and better service than this hotel. The font desk is very uninformed. The hotel was not fully booked on a weekend. Now we know why. What we didn't like about the front desk: - you wait in the check-in line forever (same with the concierge, maybe one person is not enough?) - asked for a a quiet room far away from the elevator or ice machine and the front desk gave us the room right next to the ice machine (which was located at the wall to our bed). - asked for an explanation of our room rate and fees and got 3 different answers from front desk - front desk seemed like robots. Their answers came right out of a hotel handbook. Their answers are standard and sometimes they don't give an answer to the question at all. - front desk was very rude when we asked for a late check-out. When I politely said that other hotels have no problem with late check outs (especially when they are not fully booked) she just snapped: "Well, that's your bad luck then, we don't do it." - no apology for the noise from construction of the pool when we asked about it. Very rude. - no self-parking, only valet Value: - When you see the hotel prices you think 179USD is quiet cheap, but in fact it's not. You end up paying 250USD with the taxes, fees and the resort fee. You have to pay for every little thing. We will not stay in this hotel again. Customer service is very important to us and this hotel treated us not very friendly and helpful. Never experienced such a rude and uninformed front desk. They have to train their stuff much better. And this is for you, Mr PR of Vdara Hotel. I saw that you commented on most of the reviews which is a good thing. But you only write the same answers to everyone (I guess a simple standard answer a la "copy and paste") and you don't take the time to address the issues people had. I think that is even worse than not commenting on a review. It just shows that you don't care about the problems but only about to get more people in the hotel. Good customer service does not use standard answers, they apologize and care about their guests. Even if you tell me now that that I should come back. NO, thank you. We will not. Much better choices in las Vegas. It's always the same answer: "Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent visit to Vdara Hotel & Spa. We sincerely hope that you will reconsider Vdara and look forward to welcoming you back in the near future."

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience at the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: jlovelock
Reviews.Content: Check in was very easy with the staff being very helpful in asking what us what we were up to over the next few days and if they can help us by booking a resturant or club in the evening. The only problem we had was that we were unable to use the pool in the Vdara as it was under maintenance at the time. But this was understandable as the spring season was coming up. They did say we could use the pool in the Aria hotel next door but we couldn't be bothered with walking over there with our stuff. The room was amazing, a nice large comfortable space to fit 3 us us easily. We stayed on the 23rd floor and i must say the views are amazing! There was only one problem i found was the pullout sofabed. Unfortunatly 1 of us had to sleep on this and he was unable to sleep well as the springs were digging him in the back. Other than that everything was nice, comfortable and clean. The hotel was very easy to get to the strip, you could go 2 ways either outside and down the stairs, crossing a few roads to get there (it is signposted). Or what we found easier was to walk towards the tram which links up to the Bellagio and exit through that hotel to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to the stunning penthouse”
Reviews.Author: julie7381
Reviews.Content: What can I say? My boyfriend and I were first time visitors to the Vdara tonight and we got upgraded from a standard room to a two-bedroom, two-bathroom, split-level penthouse. We could not believe our eyes when we opened the door. I could have cried! I'm writing this review from the spa bath tub while looking out the window on the 56th floor. All this and it cost us barely $130. Many thanks to whoever checked us in. We'll definitely be back. Super modern, super stylish. And no casino or smoking. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Olivia E
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this stay but it was a big disappointment. I will start by saying I stayed first at Mandalay the day before I checked in here. The rooms at Mandalay were spacious and beautiful, and the front desk staff was exceptional. Then I came here and expected better service and a better experience and got neither. Arrived just after 1pm (check in was at 3). Wait in line was about 10 minutes and when I got to the front desk she told me I could not check in and would need to come back in an hour. I asked if I could at least pay and get the paperwork part out of the way and she said no. So came back an hour later to an insanely long line. I was literally standing in line for 30 minutes at check in on a Saturday and there were only THREE employees at the front desk doing check ins. I was amazed that there would be only 3 people on a SATURDAY of all days during peak check-in time. WHY wouldn't there be more employees? I really don't get it. I have now stayed at- The Mirage, Monte Carlo, New York New York, Mandalay Bay, Riviera, and Excalibur, (am trying to stay at almost all of them at least 1 time) and have not even ONCE experience such a long check in time. Also I was expecting the room to be bigger, which it wasn't. Very modern and cold type of decor (not beautiful, just modern). No TV in bathroom. I liked Mandalay much better. The valet and bell desk staff however were AMAZING!!! Those guys should all get raises :) Aside from the stellar bell service & valet everything else was just average. I will not be staying here again. Oh one very good plus was that it is a non-smoking hotel, and just about every cab ride we took to anywhere was only $8-$10. Easy to leave car in valet the whole time and just take cabs everywhere. Also room was VERY clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Better Staff!”
Reviews.Author: graphicnatured
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Vdara from Thursday through Monday in a two-story, two bedroom Penthouse on the top floors. Upon arriving we were greeted at the airport by Allen, our hotel-appointed limo driver who had already found and pulled our luggage off the carousel. Major points. Once at the hotel and checked in, the bell hop Kimberly took us to our room. She was very nice and personable. Our room had a couple issues. One of the shades was stuck and slightly crooked, the downstairs TV wasn't working and the upstairs bathroom door lock was loose. We called downstairs and they had us switch rooms. They gave us a better suite with a panoramic view! Along with switching us to this room they also sent Harris, the technician, to make sure everything was perfect. Harris was a great guy and so nice. He really went the extra mile, all with a smile and I loved the way he spoke with ownership and pride of the hotel. More points. A couple days in to our trip I was downstairs meeting up with a guest who was just arriving and Kimberly noticed me and asked how I was doing. She remembered my name and asked how my wife and toddler were. Extra Points. We loved the view and the location and appreciated that it was a non-smoking facility. The bathtub on the lower floor was situated right next to the huge open window of the most gorgeous view imaginable. I'm a shower guy and I took a bath every day I was there. I added a photo of it. Right across the street at Aria the casino is world class and also smells great. A short hallway takes you to the Bellagio so finding a nice place to gamble is no biggie. Want $5 blackjack? Across the street from Bellagio, Bill's Gambling Hall has it. The lobby at Vdara smells better than any other hotel I've stayed in and you can buy the scent on sticks to take home and make your house smell the same way. We bought two packs of them and will buy more in the future. If you are planning on having someone with you who will be taking the pull-out couch, they would be better off leaving the couch in it's normal functioning status. The pull-out bed felt like a sheet over bare springs so I wouldn't wish that on my worst enemy. The beds in the rooms were awesome though and very comfortable. Overall, we loved Vdara so much we were sad to leave. I smile thinking back at the memories I will have and it is easy to say that the view, the smell, and location/amenities, etc.. will be the things you remember about a place, but when Vdara has this in spades and one of your fondest memories will also be of members of their staff, that says something. We highly recommend Vdara for your next stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: internationalworld
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing weekend here with my girlfriends. We had bought a Groupon in January and used it for this trip. We stayed in the King Suite. A King bed with a pull out mattress in the couch. 2 flat screen tvs. a kitchen stove/microwave, refrigerator, jacuzzi/ separate shower. We stayed on the 45th floor of the hotel which had the most beautiful view of the Vegas! We could see the Rio hotel as well as the Bellagio and the beautiful fountain show from our room. The staff here was so welcoming and helpful. Whenever we needed anything they were very attentive. The security was great at night. They made sure that you had a hotel key before going up. The hotel is right across from the Aria and next to the Cosmo hotel. Great place to stay for a weekend. loved the location, would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “New and annoying.”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara March 8 through March 12. I got an email offer from them for around $125 a night. When deciding on this hotel I chose it because of the no smoking feature because after a night of smoky casinos and restaurants it is nice to come back to smoke-free sleeping. Vdara does pull this off quite well. The smell and coziness of this hotel are very good. The rooms are nice, but nothing that special considering you are in Las Vegas. The bed was large and soft, but totally ruined by the cheap paper sheets and worthless comforter you are given. They change your sheets only if you ask. Rooms have dark colors, wood grains, and a lot of glass which makes them look sharp but they do not have enough worthwhile employees to handle keeping them clean. The only problems with my room were the paper sheets, large amount of dust, and the decision this hotel made to charge you mega bucks for coffee at their mediocre deli rather than supply it in your room. No coffee in a four star resort is a travesty. With those minor issues alone I would have given it a rating of four, but it gets a poor rating for its staff and the managements lack of caring when something goes, in my case, very wrong. First, you wait in line forever when you get there. Second, I asked for a view and got a breathtaking view of Interstate 15. After waiting in line forever, I mean forever, and for me it was 10:00 pm and it took an hour to get my taxi paid to inside my room. I don't use credit cards, I hate them, I brought cash and a debit Mastercard to Las Vegas. After the deposit I initially paid, they charged me a $250 hold on my debit card simply for not having a credit card. I asked her to run it as a credit and she said she could not. They can when I order a pizza in Las Vegas, but not at this new super snazzy hotel. I was fine with the hold since I was going to pay for the hotel anyway, but after I left the desk, she ran another $812 hold on my card. I got a fraud notification from my bank asking me if I was in Las Vegas and just spent $1000 dollars plus at the Vdara, and I said, uh, no I just checked in but it was only $250 but he informed me they just received another transaction for the $812. After I blew a gasket and cleared all the smoke that came out of my ears, since it is smoke free afterall, I called down and was treated like a child. They told me it was an "accident" and they could not take care of it now since their bank was closed. I asked for a manager to meet me at the front desk and they said for me to ask for Austin. When I got down to the long lines of check-in, I had to wait in line again, being told when I went to the front to see the manager that "they would be right out, please remain in line." When I got to the front of the line I spoke with a lady (Anleese maybe) and I told her I was to speak with Austin about an issue and she told me Austin went home and she would take care of me. I said, okay, and she arrogantly cut me off and asked me if that would be okay if she handled the issue. I said yes and explained the entire problem to her and she told me that it was an unfortuante mistake and she would try to take care of it but it would take some time. I went back upstairs to my furious wife, who was embarassed and upset with me over all this happening, all that was going on. The manager called up and said her bank and my bank were closed and she would have the next manager coming on in the moring take it off my account. She ended with, it may take up to five business days for it to be completely off. I needed a drink and hit the strip. Friday came, it never came of my account. Saturday, still there and Sunday too. I called my bank that Friday afternoon and they said no one marked in the notes that anyone from Vdara called and that transaction would be on my account until they, Vdara, took it off. They told me they should have been able to void the transaction immediately after they did it, but of course they did not. Vdara never called my bank the next morning, as I was assured, and never after it was brought to managements attention or for the four remaining days I was at their hotel. They never checked with me to see if the matter was resolved. Luckily, my fun money was cash, and Vdara could never take that from me. When I checked out, the same employee who made the mistake would be taking care of me again. I don't fault her, she was always sympathetic to me and there is a reason they are called accidents, they are accidental after all. She asked me how my stay was and I said not very good considering all these holds on my account. She apologized again and read me a note on my account that someone wrote that it would be taken care of on Friday. I pulled my phone out and showed her on Monday morning that it was never taken care of. She asked for my card to pay the remaining balance on my room and I laughed. I asked her "What would you do if you were me?" She knew. I did pay for my hotel, turned around and left, knowing I will never, ever, be back to that place again. Other things you should not forget: *Resort fees and the taxes on those fees charged me an extra $110 on my hotel. *You are carded every time you go to and from your room by some guy that works there. Nothing more annoying than stopping, getting out your room key when you are just walking through a lobby. Security I guess. *No direct access to Las Vegas Blvd

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ubergirlcanada
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and was extremely pleased to have 5 nights at the Vdara in the City center. Over the top amenities in my room. The king suite was fantastic, the nicest hotel I have stayed in sometime. Having full in room dining, a luxury kitchen, 2- 42" flat screens and great work station was ideal. The bath was beyond luxury and the automatic room shades were a nice touch. The in room dining was great, cuisine, price and service were a 10. Only thing negative, my view was of the parking lot. Not a big item, as I was not paying for the city scape view. No smoking and no casino in my building was a blessing. The City center and interior access to Belagio and others offered these items.

Reviews.Title: “Casino and smoke free hotel”
Reviews.Author: Footsie67
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on 1st March for 4 nights. We chose this hotel as there were no casinos and it was a non-smoking hotel. After staying at the hotel although we loved the room I personally would prefer to stay in busier hotel but I'm sure people would book this purely to be away from the hustle and bustle of the gaming rooms. Check in was easy and had no problems with anything on the bill, there is a resort fee but we paid this before we left the UK. The hotel is new and has a lovely smell when you walk in, you can buy the scent sticks there. The rooms are decorated well and the bed is very comfortable, so much so after our flight from the UK and jet lag we crashed out for 12 hours and missed most of Saturday night. We would have gone out if we had not had to be ready for pick up for a helicopter ride at 5.00am - well worth it with Maverick helicopters. There is a kitchen area but you have to ask for the basics of cutlery, plates and glasses so we never bothered eating in. they try to sell it that they can arrange in room dining. We had a room on the 50th floor looking over the Luxor and down towards Mandalay Bay/The Hotel but since found out you can get rooms overlooking the Bellagio which we wished we had requested. Unfortunately the Pool area was not in use as the beginning of the season so could not use but were told we could use the pool in the Aria next door but never got the chance. Again due to time we never got to use the Spa so cannot give a review on this. My only complaint was on 2 occassions we had knocks on the door from maintenance of which we had not requested, I put this down to there being so many floors and they got the wrong floor. In all this is a quite, contemporary hotel, away from the main strip. It is a little difficult to locate and we found it easier to go through the walkway to the Bellagio. My advice to anyone new to Las Vegas, good walking shoes, plan ahead with shows (if not use Tix4tongiht kiosks for cheaper) and where you are going to eat. There is a good app on iphone called Viva Vegas with great tips and ideas. Enjoy your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke free alternative - great!”
Reviews.Author: copleycop
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through Travelbag in UK. We've stayed many times in Las Vegas across the strip in the theme hotels. This hotel was straight forward, gorgeous rooms with great viewa without having to walk through the smoke filled casinos to get to your room. The hotel is connected to Bellagio so it's simply a 10 min walk to the strip through a great hotel. Best of both worlds! When we visited the pool area was closed and had to use the Aria pool instead which was great. Would stay again at the right price in Vegas for the room views alone. The good thing about this hotel it keeps all the beer swilling, smoking gambling addicts at bay.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Las Vegas - What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RickLJJ
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Vdara for 5 nights in March 2012 and REALLY enjoyed the quiet atmosphere in a very active city. With its central location,outstanding views of the Vegas skyline and the Bellagio fountains, non-smoking facility, and clean quiet rooms, it is in our view the best place to stay. Easy access to lots of restaurants, shops, and points of interest. Staff was very courteous and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Scotsman72
Reviews.Content: Booked through lowcostusa and got a great deal which included the resort fees, worked out at £424 for 6 nights which we thought was pretty good! We ended up on the 29th floor overlooking the Ballagio fountains. Room was fantastic, good size and added bonus of having small kitchen if you felt inclined to eat in, we didn't! The only minor gripe I had about the room was that the water pressure wasn't great in the shower but we could live with that. The hotel was a little oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, nice to get away from the smoke filled casinos at the end of the day. All in all, we would heartily recommend the Vdara and look forward to staying there again when we eventually return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Recharge in Sin City”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: Vdara, part of City Center in Vegas, provided a peaceful, completely smoke-free environment in which to rest and recharge in between the mayhem. All suites, very similar to a studio apartment, comfortable bed, huge soaking tub for two, and a kitchenette for snacks in the room. If you are looking for quiet and smoke-free, this is definitely the place to be. The cafe is slighty over-priced, per usual in Vegas, but the food is decent. The spa takes up an entire floor in the hotel and was amazing minus the construction directly outside. No casino here, but 50 feet from Aria and The Cosmo which are both chic and entertaining. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Mrskish
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Vegas for his first time and choseVdara for it's location and because it was a smoke free hotel connected to two casino resorts. The calmer environment was nice. We had a city corner suite overlooking to Bellagio fountains. The appliances were a nice plus. Full size fridge so you can keep leftovers. They leave two mini waters and two coffee pods (Keurig) each day. We booked a package and the welcome amenity we received was a dozen cookies. We rented a car and it was an easy pick-up from Aria. The location is perfect and the market cafe had some really good food as well as groceries to take back to your room. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and confortable”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugBR
