Reviews.Content: The city center complex where Vdara is located is THE place to stay in Vegas. Connected to Bellagio, Aria and Crystal shopping. Many top tier restaurants around. Should have more eating options at the building (only a small coffee shop, which is obiuosly crowded each morning).

Reviews.Title: “A different place”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer666
Reviews.Content: Vdara is not like most of the hotels on the strip. It does not have a casino or smoking. It's more like a regular hotel. We got a good deal on a studio room that had a king bed, sofabed, kitchenette, and large bathroom. The cafeteria in the lobby gets very crowded in the morning. Better to go out to Walmart and buy some breakfast stuff. But then you still have to find a way to get coffee. No real restaurant in the hotel, so be prepared. But it's easy to walk over the Aria, where there is a so-so buffet. Housekeeping was a bit erratic. Also, when we were there, the pool was out of commission, which was a big bummer. I might consider staying here again, but I would definitely check out other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maryios
Reviews.Content: After much dilberation, we chose the Vdara for our first stay in LV - it was definately the right decision. Booked the basic suite via lowcostusa so price included the resort fees. Got comp. upgrade to a fountain view room which was amazing at night (room 31010). Room was very large with kitchen area (no kettle but I took a travel kettle) and fridge for snacks etc. Bathroom was also large with great shower and big bath tub. As noted in other reviews you need to call down for cups/robes etc but we did this and it only took about 20 minutes. Super comfy bed meant a great night's sleep. Only used house keeping twice in the 7 day stay as I am happy to make my own bed and there were ample towels etc. All the staff were super friendly and the location was great for us - hop over to the Aria or walk through the Bellagio. Bar was pricey but we used it to enjoy a beer before checking out and sat in the outdoor part with swings and interesting furniture. Finally, loved the scent in the building - wished I'd known you could buy it before I left though - I'll have to go back now!!

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic Suite at Vdara......Amazing Views!”
Reviews.Author: mwj1268
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Vdara for one night in a Panoramic Suite (#50.001). Incredibly quiet and clean hotel that is smoke free and what a great option this is to avoid the loud and stinky casinos that line the Vegas strip. Very short walk to Aria, Cosmo, and Bellagio and the tram that goes to Aria and Monte Carlo is very close as well. Outrageous views from this room from 3 different sides! Could see all the way to the Trump and Stratosphere on one side, The Cosmo, Planet Hollywood, Ph Towers, and Mandarin Oriental on another side, and The Aria, Monte Carlo, New York New York, and Mandalay Bay on the other side. This hotel feels so far away from the strip because it is so quiet and relaxing but the strip can be reached quite easily either through the Bellagio, Cosmo, or Crystals. The only true negative I found is that the mandatory $25 resort fee is very excessive and you get very little in return. But, I knew this before booking here and just wanted to stay somewhere new that offered non-smoking facilities. But honestly, the Cosmo has similarly priced rooms with balconies and NO resort fees and is closer to the strip. So I will be staying at the Cosmo from now on instead of Vdara. But I do recommend the Vdara if the resort fee does not bother you because this is most definitely a very nice place to stay for a change from the normal strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations and then some”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaTraveller17
Reviews.Content: Based on the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor, my husband and I stayed at the Vdara for 5 nights in March 2012. We stayed in the deluxe suite and it certainly met and exceeded our expectations! The king sized bed was so comfortable and the room itself is a very decent size for the two of us. The kitchenette came in very handy. We were able to take leftovers from our supper and heat them up for breakfast, which saved us a few dollars. As others have mentioned, you do have to call housekeeping for cutlery and plates. Usually they were delivered within minutes, and someone from housekeeping always gives a follow up call to ensure they were delivered. Our room had a view of the Bellagio fountains, which was such a nice added perk! Bathroom is very large with a 2-person soaker tub and a large glass-enclosed shower. The housekeepers (who did a very thorough job) refreshed the toiletries every day, including the 2 small water bottles in the fridge. We tipped about $5 per night, so I'm certain that helped. Customer service was awesome. Every person we encountered, from the front desk to the bell hops to the concierge was polite and courteous and helpful. I also appreciated the fact that every evening, they have a security personnel at the elevators, checking for room cards. The Vdara is a bit of a walk from the main strip (about 15 minutes) but we did not find this to be an issue. The hotel is significantly quieter as a result - perfect for relaxing after a long day in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ldhill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara for 3 nights and loved it! My husband and I was there with some friends and we all agreed this was the best hotel we have stayed at in Vegas. The rooms were lovely, the bed was comfortable and for the money we paid, it was just luxary all the way around. We order room service; they were fast and the food was good. I really enjoyed my stay in Vegas and did not want the leave. The staff was very helpful and made you feel right at home. I also like this is a smoke & casino free hotel. If you want to gamble, there is easy access to get to other casinos. The free tram is also helpful and provide easy access to other hotels. I will always stay at the Vdara when I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: colstaNM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a weekend getaway to Vegas. We have been many, many times, but this time was different. We chose to stay at a non-casino hotel named Vdara in the City Center. We were pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere in the hotel. It is non-smoking and quiet. It seems like an escape from the madness that the casino hotels offer. We love to gamble, but it is nice to go to sleep in a quieter place. The staff is over-the-top helpful and courteous. I would definitely visit Vdara again in the future. The bedding is extremely comfortable and the views of the Bellagio fountains is exceptional. I have nothing but positive things to say about our experience at Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent couldn't fault it"”
Reviews.Author: scots c
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vdara for 5 nights end of Feb into March, couldn't fault it rooms super, very clean with room service spot on. Yes it's slightly off the strip but from hotel to strip it's only 10mins walk or you can go through the Bellagio or Aria which are only a few minutes walk away, hey Vegas is all about walking anyway. Having no casino was great as you get away with all the hustle and bustle and noise that comes with them. The cafe inside is good for picking up small snacks didn't experience long queues that some people have been stating was slightly expensive for what you get but i'd say on a par with all the other hotels. Don't believe what people are saying about a strong sweetly sickly smell in the main entrance area that's nonsense no smell what so ever only the smell of newness. We had a view overlooking the Bellagio fountains and Eiffel tower at Paris at night it was stunning. The only negative comment that i can say is the $100 deposit per night for the room to cover for any breakages extremely steep and we were not expecting it but apart from that don't hesitate in staying there you won't be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely gateaway in the heart of Las Vegas..”
Reviews.Author: Anna Leah M
Reviews.Content: The hotel smells amazing, fresh and crisp and very clean...the only hotel lobby in Las Vegas that is quiet and not crowded at all...the suites are very good size..the bed, linens and pillows are very comfortable...the bathroom a good size for two people...the hotel have 1 restaurant and a bar and the market place which i think is the downside because i love to have nice and good selections of places to eat. A perfect hotel in the heart of las vegas if you want peace after a nite out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, New, No Casino”
Reviews.Author: Richard D
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean, modern, beautiful, comfortable, new hotel on the LV strip without the casino element the Vdara Hotel & Spa is an excellent choice. Our suite had 3 rooms 1.5 baths and more closely resembled a small posh apartment. Beautiful view, nicely furnished, two large flat screen TVs. The kitchenette was more than functional with a small stove, fridge and microwave. When reserving one of these rooms, you get the choice of viewing the strip or overlooking a different part of the city. The all valet parking and other service personnel are top tier. The Vdara is not a true "value" as pay for what you get. I will be staying at the Vdara again and hope to try out some of their spa amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Vdara!”
Reviews.Author: CancunCanadian
Reviews.Content: Wow! That is the only word to describe the Vdara experience. It is an amazing complex, close to all the action and chaos of Las Vegas, but once you walk into the lobby of the Vdara you instantly feel relaxed and calm. Because it does not have a casino, the atmosphere is soothing. The "basic" rooms are fantastic -- king size bed, two flatscreen TV's, wonderful bathroom with soaker tub, and incredible views of the strip. I can only imagine what the bigger suites look like! The rooms are so comfortable it is almost hard to leave them! The staff treat you so well, welcoming us back as it was our 200th stay not our second. The fitness facility is one of the best I've seen in a hotel with all the necessities for a great workout. A wonderful deli/cafe can be found in the lobby. The pool area is amazing. Perfect temperature of the water, great service, and plenty of shade from that hot desert sun.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your checkbook!”
Reviews.Author: Jerilyn W
Reviews.Content: Just checked in to the Vdara, expecting the $20.00 per night resort fee, not expecting the $100 per night deposit.The industry standard is the room fee for one night. (I was able to negotiate it down slightly) Not the way I want to start off my long awaited vacation.I booked through Southwest Airlines.When I called them I was informed that they had no control over the individual hotels charges and some of the rooms were in fact condominiums that are rented as hotel rooms. The room is nice, showing its age with chipped furniture and waste paper baskets. I brought coffee knowing that the motel 6 has a coffee maker and the Vdara doesn't. It's not a nice enough place to justify these silly idiosyncrasies. Other hotels are eliminating their resort fees. At the moment I'm regretting my choice of hotel. I'll see if there is some way in which this hotel can be redeem itself over the next five days. I'll update the review as things progress.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views”
Reviews.Author: 991Mike
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a nice get-away from all the other hotels as it has no casino, so it's more relaxed, less frenzied. Another big benefit to no casino is the fact the hotel doesn't smell like an ashtray as most of Vegas does. The rooms on the east side of the hotel all have an awesome view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. Pretty cool! The rooms are all suites - two flat screens, great bathroom, etc. Another benefit is a kitchen with a fridge, sink, microwave and I think even an oven. You can request plates, glasses, etc. as we did to host some friends for margaritas and tequila tasting!

Reviews.Title: “The "new" Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 908traveler
Reviews.Content: A lovely facility. The room was terrific and view even better. The staff friendly. The resort fee was a joke. They said it was to cover a newspaper, water and turndown service. True BUT we had to go to the lobby for the newspaper, the valet for water and call each day to request turndown service (only responded 1 night out of 3 requested). This property needs to provide better services. It appears that this is not quite up to hotel status.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean and comfortable place.”
Reviews.Author: MegPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful, clean and comfortable hotel i have ever visited. Located in Las vegas strip but non gaming, non smoking and all suite hotel. It is a place to stay and have your peace from noise and have a beautiful view of the strip and center city. It has all you need for a relaxing vacation, a gym, a spa, and a place to eat if so wish and you don't mind the cost. However, the beautiful thing about this place is that, it is at the center of the city so you can easily go to nearby places for affordable meals.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service!”
Reviews.Author: Arghhhhhhhhh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the recommendation of friends. The rooms are amazing, the staff are sincere and the hotel is very quiet. It is a nice break from the business of the strip. There are only 2 minor problems with Vdara. It is a far walk to get onto the strip as the hotel is set back quite far. Also there is little value in the $20 per night resort fee. All you get is two bottles of water and free Internet for the fee. I would probably look for a hotel that doesn't charge the resort fee next time. Otherwise everything at this hotel was super!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Don't Waste Your Money!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: taboo29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was Awful! First Let me start out saying I booked this vacation package through orbitz And was fully aware of the resort fees But never was informed of the $100plus incidental fee per night(So much 4 thinking I got a good deal right) Anyway the nxt morning the hubby & i decided to make our pan breakfast once again i knsa we had 2 call 4 dishes. But the dumbess thing was when we ordered coffee which they brought with NO coffee maker!!! So how the hell were we 2 make gourmet coffee. Then we asked 4 tea, what do u know, theres an additional charge 4 that. By this time Im pissed. Wtf did i pay $400 plus additional 4?? Then i call ask 4 salt & pepper, Yup u got it $5!!! For salt & pepper yr sh........ Me right? Anyway when it was time 2 check out they didnt want 2 give me my deposit back said the maid couldnt go in the room because it smelled strongly of smoke! I dont even smoke!!!!! Anyway i had to wait 30 minutes for them 2 check the room b4 i was refunded my deposit. What a waste this hotel. 5 stars my a..! This was at best 2 & half! Its hard to get to the strip And nothin in the room was that spectacular 2 rate this hotel any higher than 2. The service sucks, the maids are slow, And overall i would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice alternative to big resort casinos”
Reviews.Author: okjunga
Reviews.Content: Vdara is very clean and modern. Rooms are suites with comfortable sitting area, kitchenette, and roomy bathroom. Smoke-free environment, but close enough to Aria, Cosmopolitan, and Bellagio that you can easily walk to restaurants and gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice if travel with young children”
Reviews.Author: LostAngeles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend trip with our 4 yo boy and all of us were happy with the choice. We, because the hotel is close and convenient to most locations on the strip and he, because was in walking distance to the monorail and could satisfy his wish for taking countless rides with the monorail! Will chose the same place for upcoming trips to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great no gambling/smoking place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Joemammadotca
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you need when dealing with hustle and bustle of Vegas. It provides a little escape frome the craziness when you want to get away from the lights and noise of the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time back and keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: SuperD102
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time back to Vdara, and it was honestly better this time around! We stayed 2 years ago when it first opened and since then, the little cafe downstairs has opened and the room lay out has improved greatly! I have not added pics, because the ones already on here are very accurate. The cafe downstairs is a wonderful little place to eat, kind of expensive, but I've noticed that most places on the strip now are getting very expensive to eat at. We did not have any trouble with customer service. We found everything efficient, and everyone friendly. The rooms were spotless, and the beds so amazingly comfortable (I think one of the most comfy beds I have ever been in). I loved the weight room. It had just the right amount of equipment (treadmills, ellipticals, free weights, weight machines, skip ropes, you name it) and it was never busy. The Vdara pool was shut down for maintenance when we were there, so we had access to Aria's pool which was superb as well. Overall, we love the Vdara because it is a nonsmoking facility (so you have no rooms that smell like smoke even though they are suppose to be nonsmoking), and there is no casino, which makes it into a nice little get away. Aria is a 2 minute walk away, or there is a walkway that connects you to the Bellagio (also only a 2 minute walk). Personally, we love not being on the strip, but if you are going to Vegas to soley party, this may not be the hotel for you. If you like vegas and the strip, but also like a little bit of seclusion while you are there, this hotel is perfect! This time around we had a fantastic view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. We will be back to Vegas and will not bother staying at another hotel, because the Vdara is so consistently fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing get away!”
Reviews.Author: Jill B
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Vdara last week! It was so close to the Bellagio and a beautiful break from the smokey casinos. We had a corner suite and the views were incredible and the room was extremely spacious. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Guaranteed view...after looking at four rooms and lots of complaining”
Reviews.Author: kmac26
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara while in LV for a conference. We booked 4 months in advance, choosing a Panoramic Suite. As experienced travellers we knew the right questions to ask. We made sure our "unobstructed" view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip was guaranteed. Well...upon a late arrival, after 10 pm due to a 6 hour flight delay, we were tired and ready to crash. Not so fast...our room had an awesome view...of the back of the hotel, the parking lot, and the freeway. We called down to the front desk and got very little sympathy. At one point we asked if we could cancel the reservation in the morning. We were told "do what ever you want." So...went to front desk to talk to a manager. Actually got some sort of assistant who was helpful. She changed us to a "view" room. An obstructed view that really required some imagination to see anything but the back of the Cosmo. Back to the desk. This time she actually took me to two more rooms with partial views. I said the reason I booked four months ago was so I would not have these kinds of issues. She then said she could show me a Penthouse suite...as an upgrade. OK. Of course the Penthouse was awesome. On the 56th floor with a commanding view of fountains/strip. "Only $50 more per night." Since we were staying 5 nights we wanted the better room but thought they should be more accommodating considering it was almost midnight by now. We settled on $25 more per night with waiving of 3 nights "resort fees." (Don't get me started on THAT subject,) They also gave us a $50 resort credit and a few drink coupons. So we got settled in and were pretty happy for the duration of our stay. The hotel didn't tell us we had some additional benefits that go with the Penthouse suite...airport limo ride and private check out desk to name two. Housekeeping was good. We also called ahead of time to request a coffee maker, dishes, and pans be put in the room. So we had to get all that stuff delivered to the new room. Not sure we would stay at the Vdara again. No casino...which is good and bad. Also they pump in a sickly sweet perfume into the lobby air. But good location and the room was very nice and clean. Bed was great and main bath was well appointed. Water pressure in the shower was a little weak. Also the blackout shades have a gap where two sections meet...which lets in light. WiFi worked fine...three TVs...large living room area with the spectaculat view of course. Oh and we got to meet some nice members of the security staff at 3:30 am one morning when the couple next store got into a knock down drag out brawl...in Italian. Security responded quickly and seemed to handle the problem. We go to LV 3 or 4 times a year, and with so many new properties to try, nothing about Vdara really made us think it was so special that we couldn't wait to return or was even worth trying again anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sisabell
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no complaints. The rooms were clean, big and comfortable. The beds were amazing! The bathroom was modern and had a nice soaker tub as well as a separate shower. Enjoyed having the kitchen and washer dryer as we were in town for a week. We enjoyed that the property was smoke free. Aria is a short (like walking half a block) walk away and has all the casino and food amenities you need. Vdara is also connected to the Bellagio by a walkway so you can easily get there. We had an awesome rate from booking.com and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but.....”
Reviews.Author: SueROntario
Reviews.Content: Just back from four nights at the Vdara. I found it by searching the web. Excellent location to all of the Strip but customer service was lacking. It was my husbands 60th birthday (the day before arrival) , and my birthday too (I know it is very rare to have birthdays on the same day as your mate) and it was our daughter's birthday on our day of arrival. Wow! Needless to say we we're hoping for a free upgrade and possibly champagne (we had ready read on the internet that if it's your birthday the sky was the limit). Not so fast, there were no "free" upgrades available but for a fee.... 50 or 70 dollars per night we could have a corner suite - very disappointing! We took the 50 dollar offer but felt quite let down. Customer service is very lacking at this hotel and as the week wore on my husband eventually challenged management and won the battle of the free upgrade. The $20 per night resort fee was a bit much too as the pool was closed the whole time we were there. However, I must say this hotel (feels more like a condo) offered peace and quite away from the rukas. Overall a good stay. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DE5
Reviews.Content: What can I say. I got the name off the travel agent and was told it is a new hotel & the photo's on the internet looked amazing which is what was making me dubious about booking (photoshop). Far from it, the hotel is beautiful and the pictures you see on the internet are what you get. The check in staff were friendly & helpful. The suites were spacious & very clean. Nice big TV, sofa, BIG comfy bed with mattress topper & pillows that your head disappears into (I usually sleep with 2 pillows, they were that big I only needed 1). The bathroom was gorgeous, nice big bath. Walk in shower. Telephone next to the toilet. The toiletries (shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, body massage bar & facial bar) were replaced every day. The wardrobe space was amazing & the wardrobe was lit too... I'm glad I booked this hotel as we could get away from the casino's and hustle & bustle & relax. it is connected to the Bellagio & across the road from the Aria so easy access to everything. The perfect location. Our room had views of the strip & the Bellagio fountains so it was nice to sit with the lights off & watch the fountains with the view of Bills & The Venetian in the distance. The hotel has a mini supermarket with coffee shop so you can breakfast & light snacks. I don't know where the cleaner hid as we never saw her but she did an amazing job of looking after us & I WOULDN'T HESITATE TO RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheSherrys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic place to stay if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. It has great facilities and the rooms are spacious and well equipped. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to be near to all the attractions but at night can escape to the calm of the hotel. Great bar area and the cocktails are a must!

Reviews.Title: “When it rains, it pours...”
Reviews.Author: Sea_Neuron
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that this is my first review ever on Tripadvisor, but I feel compelled to share my experience with you fellow travelers who may be looking at Vdara as a lodging option. This was my 3rd stay at Vdara. The first two visits (04/2011 and 11/2011) were great; I was mesmerized by the prototypical Vegas over-the-top facility, the suites themselves and the view! And given the fact that Vdara would send me a promotional e-mail almost every week, they succeeded in enticing me to return in 02/2012. So what went wrong this time? For my first two trips I'd booked a deluxe view suite; no complaints with the room itself. This time I thought I'd splurge a little by booking a corner suite. I arrived at the hotel at 2p.m. The line at check-in wasn't too long, but when it was my turn, I was told the only clean room they had was on the 6th floor facing the garage, and the receptionist Kalli offered to upgrade me to an executive corner suite but it'd cost me $100+tax. I was incredulous that this 56-floor hotel had only one clean corner suite, to which she replied it was because all the other ones were dirty. I told her I wasn't going to pay an extra $100 because their cleaning staff had only cleaned ONE room by 2p.m., so I offered to wait. She told me come back at 4p.m. Mind you, I was also in the midst of a bad cold, but I've got my principles, so I came back at 4p.m. as told. I had to tell my story to a different receptionist, Sevy, who said the room was still dirty. He offered to give me $75 for food. I knew Vdara didn't even have a restaurant, and there was no way I was going to spend $75 on over-priced coffee (costs $5 a cup there) at their deli, so I asked if he could apply the credit towards the mandatory “resort fees,” and he did. He again offered me the executive corner suite at $100. By then I was getting fed up, so I asked him what the difference was. He said it's an extra half bathroom. I said I was traveling by myself so there's no need for me to pay $100 for a bathroom I wasn't going to use. He said there was nothing more he could do. So, with no room to go up to, he told me to come back at 5p.m. and said the room should most likely be ready by then. I came back at 5p.m., feeling chills and having a migraine from my cold, and lo and behold the room was still dirty! Sevy was nowhere to be found, so I had to deal with a 3rd receptionist, Debra, who frigidly said there was nothing she could do about housekeeping, and told me to come back at 6:30p.m.! That's FOUR AND A HALF hours after I had already checked in! But she assured me that she'd be here till 10p.m. and I wouldn't have to deal with anyone else. Alas, I said on a wooden bench right across from the receptionist desk because I really had nowhere else to go, and I saw her disappear into the back room after 6p.m. and I never saw her again. At 6:15p.m., I looked out the doors and it was already dark outside, I thought this was getting ridiculous, plus I was beginning to spike a fever and I really needed a bed, so I dragged myself back to the check-in area and talked to a 4th receptionist, Abraham. He heard my story, and I could see on his screen that the room was still listed in red (dirty), and he immediately went to the back room. He came back five minutes after and said the reason the room was perpetually “dirty” was because maintenance had to fix something in the room. He apologized and offered to upgrade me to that executive corner suite without charge. Truth be told, I was feeling so sick and tired he could've sent me to the morgue then and I would've slept there. So, at 6:45p.m., almost five hours after I checked in, I was handed a key to my hotel suite. I thought to myself, “Why did receptionist number 1, 2 or 3 not communicate with housekeeping/maintenance to find out what the 4th receptionist was able to do within 5 minutes?” Because of the above, I was forced to wander around in a limbo for 3 hours then sat on a wooden bench across from the check-in area for almost an hour and a half, and I couldn't make any plans for anything because I didn't even have a room. But the story doesn't end here. I went to the suite. There was a beautiful kitchen with a coffee maker and Bosch appliances. But no cup. I wanted to heat up some water to take my medicine, but their fancy coffee maker wouldn't just boil water without their little coffee cup, and I didn't want coffee. I just needed hot water, so I dragged myself down to the deli to ask for a cup. The cashier looked at me and said, “I can't give you a cup. I was told not to give out any cups.” I explained to her that I needed to heat up some water in the microwave and the only thing they had was glass, which would break in the microwave. By now it's a recurrent theme amongst the Vdara staff when I heard the cashier reply, “Sorry, there's nothing I can do. You can either call maintenance for cups, or I can give you a plastic cup.” Yep, that was what she said verbatim. I'm only sorry I didn't see her name tag because by then I was getting absolutely fed up. The guy who stood next to me in line shook his head. I was spiking a fever, my head was throbbing and I couldn't even get a paper cup in a hotel where I had paid to stay. I replied, “I'll just buy an empty cup from you then! I need hot drinkable water.” She still wouldn't give it to me, but instead called her manager on the phone. She eventually RELUCTANTLY handed me a paper cup. Is this vacation or have I enrolled myself in a refugee camp? After that day I tried to enjoy my vacation by staying as far away as possible from the Vdara staff. I did use the concierge once for dinner recommendations. She just basically printed out copies of restaurant menus at Aria, Vdara's sister hotel, and Crystals, their fancy City Center shopping mall. But at least she didn't say there was nothing she could do. On my last day, after I checked out at 11a.m. (the designated check-out time without paying an extra fee), I had five and a half hours to kill before my flight, so the receptionist told me the bell desk could store my bags in the meantime. I went up to Randy, who looked at me coldly and said he could only store one bag because my other bag was a shopping bag and he couldn't store any bag that was “open.” Actually, I had my small backpack and a pair of shoes in another bag within the big shopping bag, so I asked if he could store those two bags for me because they were not open. He agreed, but I asked him what I should do with my big empty shopping bag. He looked at me and the shopping bag and said, “Well, you better hold onto it then. Rules are rules.” I was distraught by his utterly unprofessional and demeaning response, didn't really know how to react and just quietly walked away. I walked around in disbelief for five minutes, decided that one could catch more flies with honey than vinegar, and walked back to the valet area and handed him $2. Suddenly, he broke into a smile (or a grimace, I really couldn't tell nor care at that point), and said, “Oh, let me store that bag with your stuff then.” So with $2 those rules suddenly didn't apply? Are you really that cheap you can be bought for $2? And without the $2 I was a secondary citizen to you even though I had just stayed four nights at your hotel? I am absolutely appalled by the professionally incompetent, morally dubious, apathetic and socially uncouth behavior that I encountered with the Vdara staff. Don't get me wrong. The facility is gorgeous. It's actually a failed luxury condo project as locals have told me, so that's why every room is a “suite” because they were meant to be sold as luxury condos before the real estate market crashed. I really would like to give a better review for Vdara because it is just one of these beautiful places you have to see for yourself, but the whole Vdara staff just systematically ruined my vacation for me. I'm also beginning to realize that the first two times my stays at Vdara were uneventful because I never had to deal with the staff. Alas, when it rains, it pours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: GVancouver
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is an excellent option to the more expensive strip hotels. Our room was a full-sized suite overlooking the Bellagio pools. It was much bigger and less expensive than the room our friends had at the Bellagio. It was equipped with a small fridge and kitchen, dining area and sitting room. It was nice to have a relaxing place to relax with a bottle of wine before dinner rather than paying the stupidly expensive prices in the Bellagio lounges. A minor annoyance is having to ask housekeeping to deliver plates and pots and pans. A worse annoyance is they won't provide a kettle or coffee pot. The deli and store in the lobby are actually reasonably priced. Sandwiches and breakfast dishes are available without breaking the bank. Veuve Cliquot was $48, $20 cheaper than many other places. It is all non-smoking, which we appreciated. There's no casino or wild bar, but it's a short walk across the causeway to Aria, or through an overpass to Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “What happens in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: MonicaK01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a trip to Las Vegas and we stayed for several nights at the Vdara. I really loved the cleanliness of the hotel, the professionalism of the staff and the luxurious feel of the place itself. It was a nice break away from the smoke filled casinos you find at every other hotel in Vegas. Sometimes those slot machines are so tempting that I am glad I didn't have any in the lobby of the hotel! The bed was turned down every night and the towels were replaced each night as well! We had a great view of the city and couldn't have asked for a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with Great View, Good Location and No Casino”
Reviews.Author: peeweebbb
Reviews.Content: Went on a last minute trip to Las Vegas. Was upgraded to 39th Floor overlooking Bellagio Fountain and the strip. Check in was fast and efficient. Room is larger than your usual hotel room. The decor was ultra modern and has a full kitchen and mini-fridge. There were 2 Philips TV, one facing the bed and one in the living room. The design is unique and we could certain stay here longer. The hotel has no restaurant except for a small bar and a coffee shop which sells sundries. There is no self park. All cars are valet parked for you (complimentary of course). If you like to park yourself, you might want to try the Cosmopolitan next door (short walk only). We had to ask for wine opener, glasses etc. and they brought them immediately. There is a walkway connected to Bellagio where we had excellent buffet at a reasonable price. The only negative was this hotel is not that pedestrian friendly. The drive from the airport to the hotel was quite a challenge. Too many confusing signs (esp. at night). I would try the Cosmo next door next time.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay,”
Reviews.Author: iamcally
Reviews.Content: This trip was business and arranged by the conference team. Not sure I'd have pick Vdara had I booked myself. What a WONDERFUL surprise. The room was very large...walk into butlers pantry style kitchen which opens to lounging area. A partition wall separated the bed area from the lounging area. Both sides are mounted with flat screen TVs. The large bath had a free standing soaking tub...yum! Too bad I had no time to enjoy. All marble bath. Extremely clean and fresh. The wall was completely lined with windows across both sleeping and lounge area and the city lights were beautiful! The bed was comfy and the remote controlled draperies and shades provided complete darkness for those who party through the night and sleep while it's light. Vdara is located in the middle of the strip and is connected to the Bellagio via a corridor lined with shops. Very lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sftraveling1
Reviews.Content: First impression was….WOW! Vdara has a beautiful exterior, all around great décor from the lobby to the rooms. This is a great example of a hotel with attention to detail. Comfortable bed, electric blinds, small kitchen and nice bathroom. The front desk was extremely polite; obviously a well trained staff. The room had a great view of the strip, large open living/bedroom and rooms that don’t connect. The hotel is right behind Bellagio and a short walk to their lobby. At first I thought, a non gambling smokeless hotel in Las Vegas would be a boring choice! I have to admit it was nice to walk out of a casino into a tranquil lobby on my way to a great night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hurtzu32
Reviews.Content: Check-in was smooth and efficient, albeit somewhat cold and impersonal. We asked for a room as high as possible, and the staff accommodated, giving us a suite on the 51st floor. There are two banks of elevators much like there are in large office buildings, so we never had to wait very long to ascend. If you don't upgrade to a larger suite, you'll enter your room into a small kitchen featuring a mini-bar beside a fridge for guest use, a sink with a garburator, induction hot-plate and convection microwave. The room was clean and all the furnishings seemed new. The bed was very comfortable. The only hang-up, so to speak, was that the phone on the desk of our room did not work. There were two other phones in the room, one in the bathroom and the other on the bedside table, so we decided not to raise the issue with the front desk. All other appliances and electronics worked well, including the electronic window shades and blinds. The bathroom was large and functional, with shampoo, conditioner and body wash replaced daily. Service was, for the most part, good. After being out late one night, the lock on our door wouldn't work. After consulting with the front desk, security was sent up and the electronic lock on our door was reset. The whole ordeal took only 20 minutes to rectify. We would have made greater use of the concierge desk, but there was always a long line, so we usually went to the bell desk. They were very helpful with directions and recommendations. When we did finally speak to the concierge, we were given incorrect information about the bus fare, but it wasn't a big deal. The hotel is connected to the Belagio via a walkway, and is serviced by a Tram which connects it to the Aria and the Monte Carlo further down the Strip. This is especially useful, as the distances between the properties in Vegas are much farther than they seem on maps. There is only a single cafe in the Vdara which closes early in the evening, but access to Aria with all its shops and services is easy. The pool was closed during our visit, but we were allowed to use the pool at the Aria, which was much nicer than the Vdara's pool looked. Overall, the Vdara is a great hotel, and I would stay here again. The staff are friendly, the in-room amenities are excellent, and it's a very quiet and confortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent non-gaming hotel just off strip”
Reviews.Author: elisevh
Reviews.Content: Sleek, spacious, not engulfed in clouds of smoke, and great location

Reviews.Title: “Quiet non-smoking hotel”
Reviews.Author: CPAAttorney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 7 nights beginning February 17, 2012. I asked for and received a complimentary upgrade to a fountain view on a high floor at check-in. I also asked for the suite with a separate bedroom, but was told that the hotel was sold out. The large 32nd floor room was very clean and nicely decorated, with a full size convertible sofa. The only problem that we had was that the dorm sized refrigerator was not cold (52 degrees), so they switched the beverage/snack items from the hotel refrigerator into the guest refrigerator and let us use the hotel one. The room was very quiet. I did not hear any noise from adjacent rooms or the hallway. The Bellagio and Aria hotels are just a short walk away. I have stayed at the Bellagio, Wynn, Encore, and Venetian hotels in the past. Not having to walk through a huge smoke filled casino to get to your room was great. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay.”
Reviews.Author: littlegypsyau
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vdara hotel two seperate times in February. First time stayed in the Vdara suite which was lovely and large with full size fridge and washer and dryer, should you need it. Bathroom was spacious, with seperate powder room. You have to request cutlery, cups and other kitchen ware. Only negative was the sofa bed..it was a spring mattress of which you could feel each and every spring. I requested a mattress to top it and it was there and set up for us when we returned the next evening. The night time I stayed we just had a lake view room, we didn't check in until 11pm and there were no rooms left so they upgraded us, again, a lovely spacious room. It's smoke and gamble free and that's what I was looking for. Had $100 food and beverage credit which was nice. The pool was not open though, which was a bit of a bummer as I wanted to take my grand daughter swimming, but you could use the pool of another hotel, but we didn't want to make the trek. The spa was relaxing too, had better massages but again, relaxing. Staff at the hotel were nice and friendly. Check in and Check out were crazy though with long lines. I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great non gaming non smoking hotel close to the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S
Reviews.Content: We checked into the vdara after a long international flight. Sevy at check in was great and upgraded our room to a room with a view of bellagio fountains when he found out it was our honeymoon! The room itself was big, clean and plush. Great shower and free standing bath. The hotel is linked with bellagio and within easy walking distance to the strip. We found it quite central on the strip too. The resort fees are a bit steep considering the spa/pool was closed when we visited. Overall we had a good stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice quiet getaway”
Reviews.Author: Meechie2cute
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend with a late night check in and was pleasantly surprised at how attentive the front desk were at such at late hour. Check in went smooth and we were given a room on the 25th floor. The view of the city was incredible and the room was well appointed and spacious. I was impressed. The customer service was awesome as well....Dominque in the business services office was impressive. The location is solid as we were in the center of everything and the hotel itself offers a short walk to the Bellagio and Aria hotel. Overall this hotel is comfortable and non-gaming which I loved, therefore...We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Great deals for locals”
Reviews.Author: Bussinessfoodi
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean and newly decorated! All rooms are large with lots of storage! The pool is lacking to say the least though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: 1gelato
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when it 1st opened & this is our third visit. The rooms are spacious with a small kitchen area. Love the style of the rooms & the hotel - dark woods, modern and understated elegance. I had to take a service animal along on this trip. I was pleased to see a tiny dog area away from the front of my building. It was locked and, imagine my surprise, when I requested the key & was told it was reserved for owners. You must be kidding! Vdara would prefer to have animals relieve themselves on the beautiful landscaping around the front entry? Would it be disgusting to talk about their irrigation for the landscaping that is a drip system that can't even begin to flush away dog urine and feces? So there I was.. Nose pressed to the fence... Lookong longingly at the doggie poop bag dispenser while the dog left behind two overly large 'deposits' that will remin in place for the next guest to discover.. If you are not encumbered by a dog this is a beautiful place to stay. It is a non-gambling property so you'll have a bit of a trek to indulge or see a show or eat. Think of the Vdara as a isolated hide-away from the bustle of The Strip. It does have problems in addition to the dog thing - no dishware is provided in the kitchen and the little cafe in the lobby does not have noteworthy food. With all the beautiful hotels in the area we won't stay here again - there are too many inconveniences and problems with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tadgl
Reviews.Content: We spent a quick four day visit to Las Vegas at the Vdara Hotel and Spa. The Vdara was recommended by our travel agent, so we had no prior experience with this hotel. After booking our stay I began to have second thoughts based on a number of very negative reviews of the Vdara. We NEVER experienced one of the problems expressed by some reviewers. Yes, the resort is not on directly on the strip. We had a five minute walk from the elevator to either the Bellagio or the Aria. No casino, see previous comment. No restaurant, ditto. The lack of these amnities or conveniences was negligable. I have stayed at large places on the strip where I had even longer walks within the same resort. WE stayed in the basic deluxe room. Incredible. The bedding. Better than even the best comments you have read. Clean and SMOKE FREE! Request for extra pillows - 20 minutes. Check In and Out - 15 minutes combined. Would I stay here every visit to Vegas, no. If you are with a partying group or working a convention I would look for a slightly more convenient location. But, if you want a very enjoyable stay with some periods of complete luxury and peace - give it a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suites but...”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasseagull
Reviews.Content: We chose this property because we were traveling with two kids and thought the suites with full kitchen and laundry would be more spacious and convenient however the kitchen is not stocked with any dishes or silverware at all so you have to keep calling down for everything you need. We got in very late so it took forever to get to bed as it took a long time for all the deliveries of bedding for the pullout and dishes to be made. Try to arrange for this prior to check in. The rooms were very clean and beautiful! The master bed SUPER comfy! LOVED the non-jetted soaking tub. ONE complaint (pet peeve of mine) which caused us to upgrade to a larger suite with additional powder room, is that the bathroom does not have enclosed toilets as many higher end hotels do. You should know that there is no Restaurant here aside from a walk up and order cafe where you can grab a quick breakfast or lunch. There is a bar, however. You can also take the monorail to other hotels with restaurants within city center . Valet Parking only.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: 59Angelo59
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in great location. Lovely rooms, spacious, clean, and well presented. Our rooms on the 36th floor had great views over the city including the Bellagio fountains. We used the concierge to book our tickets to David Copperfield (an amazing show and a real highlight of our trip!!), their help was friendly, patient and professional. We had an incident with Valet parking but it was handled so professionally, promptly, and courteously by Matthew (Front Services Manager) that we could not say a bad word about it or Matthew. Food at Market Cafe is OK (nothing great). . We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jay2vegas
Reviews.Content: Just got home from six nights at the Vdara. Overall a great experience. This is my 8th trip to Vegas, but first at Vdara. It truely is a different kind of hotel compared to the stand busy casino resorts. Overall layout is great and easy to get around. I've seen people complain about it being far off the strip, yes it is... But it's about the same distance as most other hotels to get from your room to the strip. The valet is great and super friendly as we're the bell desk who stored our bags. The only downfall was we were told at check in the pool was open and yet it was closed for maintenance the entire time. The front desk let us know we could use Arias pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Wittsy02
Reviews.Content: Loved it and everything about it! Am planning to return soon! Amazing service, lush rooms with views to die for! Beautiful poor area and great bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dwcoupe287
Reviews.Content: We spent arecent night at this facility and it was a very nice experience. I had reservations about a hotel that far away from the strip but it was no problem, just a medium walk. The room was first class, spacious, clean, large, nice bathroom and an excellent bed! The cons were a little to long to check in, wanted email info which was provided at reservation and they requested it again when I checked out to forward the bill. Seems like once should be enough. The TV's in the room were nice flat screens units, but the remotes were very, very, slow. The lugage was very slow to be delivered, had to call twice. All the staff were very nice and accomadating, in spite of a few cons, this facility is still a very nice alternative to the normal Casino room, and I highly recommend the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Stud_Puppy_2012
Reviews.Content: I travel about 25 times per year and booked this on a whim for a business conference and what a surprise I got when I checked into my 42nd floor corner room. I had windows along 3 sides of the room which had amazing views to the west, south & north. Very contemporary and cozy, clean and nice amenities. I have rarely seen a hotel with a full size refigerator, stove and kitchen table. I especially liked the electronic window shades which could shade the afternoon sun or give you a total blackout in your room for maximum privacy. It was extremely quiet, comfortable with high qualify beddings, two 42" flat screens, big shower, tub and great lighting. There was a 10 x 12 room with couch and coffee table to relax after a long day seperated by sliding doors with ghosted glass between the bedroom. This place didn't have a casino (one reason I chose it) but had a nice bar, cafe/store on the main floor. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars was because the pool and hottub were closed for servicing. Big Bummer! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great aparthotel letdown by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Ge0rdiefrank54
Reviews.Content: Start at the front desk,very classy,we arrived 2pm,room not ready,we requested fountain view so no problem they looked after our luggage and we wandered up the strip 2 hours later we were given a room that looked over the back yard,back to reception ,then given a room that looked over Monte Carlo, 3rd time lucky got what we booked!, So sadly first impressions let down badly by front desk staff We have stayed all over Vegas including Bellagio,Paris,treasure,monte carlo,new york MGM Ballys to name but a few...the room in Vdara is better than any of the others we have stayed in It has a full kitchen albeit with no utensils,we had to ask 4 times to get knives for the croissants and cups to drink the good coffee out of supplied by the cafe in the lobby Would we stay again..yes because of the smoke free environment but the service really should be better

Reviews.Title: “Expect something different”
Reviews.Author: TheOCIronMike
Reviews.Content: Vdara is striking in its architecture and, if you score a great suite, a wonderful place to stay. For us, non-smoking makes all the difference, and it makes a trip to Las Vegas much, much more enjoyable, as even on the NS floors of places like Venetian or Bellagio, we can still smell the smoke and my wife's allergies pay the price. We got a corner suite and the nightime view was fabulous. However, having been told we could check in "anytime," it was nearly 5 before the room was ready. One reason might be the clientele: the room across the way was trashed by a family with kids, resulting in a lengthy cleaning by multiple maids. There is a small cafeteria style dining area at the Vdara and nothing more, so we had breakfast next door at the Aria, dinners elsewhere. Snack prices are of course high, but not extraordinary. The CityCenter area looks like a walkable urban area on the brochures but in fact is not--the entire center of the area between the three hotels is roadway. It is relatively easy to find your way down to the Strip, but coming back we walked through the Bellagio next door. there is a skyway tram at Vdara but it only connects to the Monaco--the regular skyway train is across the street. While it was cool, we did enjoy the pool for a couple of hours. Be forewarned though, the glass of the hotel is like a magnifying glass in mid to late afternoon, focusing the sun onto parts of the pool deck with dramatic results. I can't imagine what it is like in summer. Pool deck is minimalistic, pool shallow but nice. Checkout was marred by inability to do so on the television set. We would go back, but plan to check in late.

Reviews.Title: “One of my new favorites, the Vdara!”
Reviews.Author: littlejet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay at a hotel without a casino and we ended up at the Vdara which is adjacent to the Bellagio. We loved it! My husband surprised me with a suite and it was amazing! It was huge and was really like a 1-bedroom apartment complete with a kitchen, washer/dryer, guest bathroom off the foyer area, a living area, separate bedroom and fabulously large bathroom. The hotel has a very modern and sleek design and there are lots of high-tech features such as automated shades that cover/uncover the vast picture windows with the touch of a button. We stayed in room 39-002 which was at the end of the hall (so no noise) and had a view of the Bellagio fountains from the bathroom. The views of the fountains might be better if the room was closer to the elevator but those rooms weren't suites. The cafe downstairs has great food and coffee (I had a scone that was the best I'd ever eaten, so fluffy and tasty), the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and the spa is first class (separate review written about this). I highly recommend this hotel - what a nice escape from the casino rat race!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable! Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: MaryIN
Reviews.Content: Let's just start with the fact that, having met the bellman exactly one time, and returning almost two hours later, he remembered me by name. That set the bar for the level of service I received as a guest at the beautiful Vdara hotel. The property is gorgeous - very contemporary with fine attention to design detail. Front desk staff was helpful, offering to take care of things like boarding passes for flights. Even the paper they printed them on was luxurious! The rooms were simply unbelievable. I had an expansive one-room suite with kitchen, dining table, living area, desk, huge bedroom and the best bathroom ever - including a pristine soaker tub that was calling my name after a long day on the floor at a Vegas trade show. I was in a corner suite, so two solid walls of windows and nice views of the City Center complex and Vdara pool. My colleague was in a giant 2-bedroom suite on the 42nd floor that honestly sorta took your breath away. City Center complex is right across the street, so fine dining and shopping are as convenient as can be. If you're in Vegas for business or fun, but prefer a little respite when you're done with the strip proper, Vdara is the best thing going.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Luxury Amid the Craziness”
Reviews.Author: Princesstessa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara for the first time for 5 nights over a long Valentine's weekend and we were very impressed! We upgraded our room to a City Corner Suite. The room is well worth the extra money and it is beautiful! The views were amazing and we loved the full kitchen, washer & dryer and the bed is absolutely to die for. The robes and slippers are plush and cozy - I was very tempted to spend the money and buy a couple. :) It is a short walk to either the Aria or the Bellagio and you can also reach the strip by walking through the Cosmopolitan and you end up across from Planet Hollywood and an awesome brand new Walgreens. If you need any supplies or utensils or laundry detergent, all you have to do is call Housekeeping and they bring it right up within minutes. We always had to ask for more coffee also - I couln't figure out why the maid would only leave 1 regular and 1 decaf coffee. We each drink 2 cups per morning and we definitely do not drink decaf - does anyone? Oh well - whatever. We had a great trip and would stay at Vdara again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A real Oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: britfromtexas
Reviews.Content: If you don't need a casino within steps of the guest elevator then this could be the place for you. I really liked the fact that I didn't have to walk through a smoke-filled casino floor to get to my room. This is a very classy place with a lively bar and a coffee shop (not Starbucks!) in the lobby if you need them. There was a small line when I checked in but it moved quickly. This property is well-situated if you want the southern end of the strip (places like New York, New York, MGM Grand etc. and it is part of the 'City Center' resort with high-end shopping restaurants and casinos within easy walking distance. I managed to get a corner suite (over 800 sq ft) which is a fabulous room with windows on three sides (although one was facing a parking garage). You enter into a corridor that opens into the dining area with a kitchen complete with appliances including a full-sized fridge. Then you walk past the closet containing a washing machine and tumble drier (!) to the living room. A turn to the right goes into the bedroom with the second flat-screen TV and then you can circle round to the right again for the bathroom and another doorway to the kitchen/diner. Needless to say I didn't want to leave this place!

Reviews.Title: “Gave them a second chance! Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: A B
Reviews.Content: We had a wierd experience last year when we stayed at the Vdara. We had some maintenance and noise issues. The Vdara made it right! We went back for three nights and the stay was very enjoyable. Cafe downstairs is great. Location is great. Really enjoyed the stay. When staying on the main Strip again we wll definitely be at the Vdara. Sooo nice t be able to get away from the smoke! I'm highly allergic!

Reviews.Title: “Vdara - hiding behind the Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: lmeegan
Reviews.Content: If you want a nice quiet hotel, without the cigarette smoke and high room rates, and easy access to the Bellagio, then this is the place. Got kind of a boutique feel to it. Rooms are big and new - I was in a suite with a full kitchen (minus dishware), which can come in handy if you need to stay awhile. The king size bed was very comfortable. The windows have those automatic shades you can operate from the wall to black the whole room out if you stay up all night and need to get some sleep. A short walkway from Vdara through the Bellagio convention center puts you on the Bellagio casino floor. There's a full bar on the lobby floor, along with a coffee shop to grab something quick. Fitness center is decked out with new equipment and sits inside the spa area on the second floor. It sits in the city center area, which is full of shops and other hotel properties as well. All in all, I was pleasantly surprised at how cool this little hotel is, and how convenient to Bellagio it is.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara, thumbs down!”
Reviews.Author: Diamondgirl
Reviews.Content: Let me start out first by saying that I have never, ever given a hotel a negative review until now. I have stayed at quite a few hotels in my travels and I am definitely not a nit picky kind of person and unfortunately I haven't had much time to post reviews in recent years on hotels like I used to, but I had to do it for this one. First and foremost Vdara is not a 5 star hotel. We recently stayed at the Cosmopolitan in November of last year and the hospitality, rooms, restaurants, everything was top notch. We were attracted to the Vdara because they have no casino and no smoking and all rooms were suites, right up our alley. Well upon check in, which was smooth and quick, I asked the front desk clerk if I could see an upgraded room before deciding if $30 more dollars a night was worth upgrading to their Vdara suite. Well she seemed kind of put out and told us that we had 10 mins. to view the room. I let that comment pass, but it didn't sit well with me. The Vdara suite was definitely not worth $30 more dollars a night and with her attitude, we decided not to give this hotel more money. The first impression of this hotel via the front desk clerk was not good. She was not rude at all, just very cool. No warmth none what so ever and we noticed this with a couple of the other front deskers who were checking others in. Barely cordial. The room was nice and comfortable, but what hotel that has a kitchenette, not have basic kitchen utensils? Seeing we were staying here for 9 nights, we needed these things. We had to call for spoons and forks and other kitchen items. They took forever delivering them. The iron didn't work right and we called 4 times for a new one, and never received one. We made due with the luke warm iron. What 5 star hotel does not have a DVD player for their guests? Yes, we love to watch movies from time to time in our hotel room after a long day of sight seeing, eating and slot playing. I think even the 3 star hotels have DVD players. In order to watch a DVD, you had to rent a playstation for $50 a day!! Are you kidding me? You mean to tell me that the $20+tax resort fee doesn't include this? Absolutely didn't care for the valet parking. Even though it is included in the resort fee that you pay, it still feels like a scam because the valet parkers are so kind and considerate, how do you not tip them? So you kind of felt like you had to tip them. Also, I'm not too crazy about leaving my car rental keys with anyone. So if you wanted to self park, you had to do that at the Aria, and that was a very long walk (commute) back to the Vdara. A scale in the bathroom while on vacation? Please give me a break. Who wants to know how much weight they have gained? I'd rather find that bad news out when I get back home. Now, with all these small little problems, I still would have rated this hotel maybe 4 stars until the ultimate no no happened. Everyday housekeeping cleaned our room. Great, no problem. But everyday when we returned, all of our personal items were moved!!! Did not like this and should have used my first mind and complained about it, but we decided that we just had an over eager housekeeper who wanted to keep things extra neat in the room. So instead of my toiletries being on one side of the bathroom counter and my husbands on his, she felt they all needed to be on one side only. My clothes that I had folded in a chair, well she decided to put them in plastic Vdara bags. Are you kidding me right now? This person is actually moving our stuff!! Hubby said, oh they are just trying to be helpful, so we said nothing. Thank God we put our ipods in the room safe, because my flat iron (ceramic, tourmaline, the really expensive kind) came up missing. Didn't notice this until actually getting back home. I leave my flat iron on the counter top in the bathroom at every hotel we travel to. Never thought this would be something interesting to steal. After doing a clean sweep of the bathroom and other rooms in our suite on departure morning, we determined that we had left nothing behind. Not realizing that my flat iron was not where I left it in the bathroom until after we came back home. That is when it hit me. The flat iron was missing from the counter top after the last time the housekeeper cleaned our room. Never even missed it until after returning home. Really mad at myself for not noticing the flat iron missing while still at the hotel. We actually tipped this person everyday and she had the gall to steal from us. Who steals a flat iron? I spoke with the hotel and they are checking into it, but I know nothing will come of it. It's my word against the housekeepers, but it is a very sad day when you can not leave personal items in hotel rooms (let alone a 5 star) and have to have something missing. I felt I needed to give anyone who is considering to stay at this hotel a heads up. It is a very beautiful property and the rooms are well appointed (except for the kitchen utensils), but the lack of hospitality and thievery at this hotel is a very sad situation. It is a shame that I now have to do an inventory of all items I bring to hotels and before check out, make sure every item is still accounted for. This is the first time I have EVER had ANYTHING stolen from me and even though it was only a flat iron, it still hurts as if it was something of even more value. This sad incident will definitely not stop us from our Vegas trips several times a year, be we will never ever stay at this hotel again, not just for the thievery, but also because we just didn't seem like we were valued.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's weekend”
Reviews.Author: ljctx
Reviews.Content: Part of a Southwest Airlines four day package. Chose the Vdara because it was new, totally non-smoking, no casino and in the middle of everything. Got a free upgrade to a Panorama Room - windows on three sides. Only negative - it was on the fifth floor. Room was great - large kitchen, living room and bedroom. Electric curtains and electric room blackout shades on all windows. Very quite and housekeeping was excellent. Had a small cafeteria style restaurant in the lobby. I picked up breakfast each morning and we ate in our room. Short walk to the Bellagio on a private walkway from our lobby. Also same access to the overhead tram that stops in the Aria, City Center and Monte Carlo. Two trams running - wait always less than six minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at numerous Vegas Hotels. The location was prime. Very close to the City Center. Ask for a room facing the Bellagio - the view was great. We had friends in different rooms with different views and the Bellagio view was the best. We were disappointed they did not supply a coffee maker in the suite, nor hotel robes. Ask for robes when checking in. We asked for the coffee maker but was told they did not supply them. Did not make sense since the room had a kitchenette. There was also no hair conditioner, which was not a big deal for my husband and I. I've traveled with my girlfriends and I know that would have been issue for some. The bar was very nice and had an awesome atmosphere. We had food at the market cafe and it took a long time for the food. The valet service was very fast. Beds were comfortable. All in all it was pretty good. The Trump was better though if you are looking for comfort. Although, The Trump is not ideally located. The Aria (next door) seemed very nice and we will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou Vdara!”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive corner suite, absolutely fantastic view, amazing clean tidy room. When I contacted concierge or baggage etc they were friendly caring and really tried hard to please. Been to the bellagio suite before and much prefered this. No casino and no real shops or restaurants means its only really a place to stay, which is a shame because its a lovely hotel. Partnered with the Aria, which was soo lovely and clearly new. Shame vegas has become a 'begging area'. The latest thing is to dress up as mickey and lie on the floor drunk. 'Not cool'.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for 3rd time!”
Reviews.Author: marsjanet
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at The Vdara. This time we had a one-bedroom suite on 34th floor. We loved it! Large suite with fully eqipped kitchen, washer and dryer which are very helpful if you stay longer as we did ( 6 nights). Bathroom is huge with walk-im shower and bathtub. What a pity, they don´t have the Aveda bath amenities anymore! But you still have bathrobe and slippers. Complete staff is very friendly. Valet service is very quick although I wouldn´t mind self-parking. We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Love that it is a non-smoking hotel...even in the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: tpa2az
Reviews.Content: Frequent traveler to Vegas for fun, Lake Mead and work. Happy to have stayed at Vdara on a recent business trip because once I walked through the lobby to my car, I didn't smell like smoke! Thank you Vdara! Fortunately, the newer hotels (Aria, etc) control the smoke and add wonderful smells throughout to help mask the smell. But Vdara goes a step above and does not allow. The rooms are clean and did enjoy having the small kitchen. We had room service for breakfast one more and it was fabulous!!! I will definitely stay here again. We like to gamble at The Bellagio, and this was a nice quick walk away...not the most picturesque walk...but it got us from point A to point B!

Reviews.Title: “Classy! Located in the epicenter of all things HOT in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Sandi56
Reviews.Content: Modern Class. Upgrade to get "the view" you will not be dissappointed. Had view of the dancing fountains of Bellagio, the Strip, the Rio and Palms. This is not a casino. Very well appointed leather, comfort. Kitchen was efficient and well appointed, sitting area very comfortable, bedroom nice, bathroom had full tub, plus separate shower. Just lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Very Vegas but then again not”
Reviews.Author: Arneby
Reviews.Content: Your typical over-the-top luxury Vegas hotel with a gazillion rooms. What differs Vdara from the rest is that this hotel is gaming free. Thats right, no slot machines in the lobby (or anywhere else). Quite spacious nice suites with full kitchen (even dishwasher). Roomservice is flaky at times and so is the wireless network. Fast once you're on but *very* flaky. Wirless internet is part of the $20 a day resort fee. A way of hiding the actual cost. No regular breakfast hall. Order room service or eat at the Market Café which get seriously clogged every morning until at least 10am. Vdara is part of the 'citycenter' block which means close proximity to sister hotel Aria, Cosmo and Monte Carlo. And the local automatic tram.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from strip craziness...”
Reviews.Author: SaB_012331
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to Vegas - frequently the Harrah's properties but have also stayed at Palazzo, Marriott, Wynn, Mandalay Bay, Nugget, etc.... I guess we've been there a lot. In any case, Vdara was great - non-smoking & non-gaming but close enough to Aria & Bellagio (okay, the walk was a bit long once you got inside Bellagio). Crystals is just a walk away as is Cosmopolitan. There's also a walkway that from Cosmopolitan to Planet Hollywood corner and a tram which goes to Monte Carlo... and we're gamblers so that was nice. Our room was wonderful - it overlooked the Bellagio fountains from the Bellagio view (vs. street) which was just as breathtaking. The room was clean & having a mini fridge (and a mini bar) in the room convenient for us. Kitchen utensils for the microwave & two top stove could be obtained upon request but we didn't so cannot speak to that. The bathroom was clean & modern. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because of housekeeping. The first day we only had a small facial bar of soap in the sink. The next day the cleaning team did not provide any other soap (had plenty of shampoo, conditioner & lotion). We called & were given more facial soap, body bar & shower gel (so they did exist). The 2nd day we had to call housekeeping because our room was not made up by mid-afternoon. They Immediately came to clean & did a great job. Just a mention - we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “CONTEMPORARY”
Reviews.Author: SARRECAT
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It is beautiful, modern, quiet and it's in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: gabsydney
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel , great position next to the strip , quiet rooms , very large rooms ,would stay here again ,

Reviews.Title: “For Non-Smokers and Gamblers, this is the perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Drocca
Reviews.Content: I am a non-smoker and non-gambler. If you are like me, this is the perfect hotel. Once you arrive, you are greeted with a clean fresh aroma. They pump some fragrance into the air system. We got the Deluxe Suite on the 50th floor facing Monte Carlo. We were greeting to a beautiful view and very clean suite. In the suite was a king size bed, sofa bed, desk with ethernet plug, cordless telephone, tv with audio/video plug ins for DVD/iPads, ironing board and iron, small personal safe and and hangers. In the kitchen you get a small bar fridge, two stove ranges, sink with garburator, microwave and a dining table. Upon request, you can get plates and utensils from housekeeping. Beware of the other small fridge that holds items from the hotel. Once lifted from its place, you will automatically be charged. Unless absolutely necessary, I would avoid opening the fridge in case you trigger a sensor. Bathroom is large with a soak tub, shower stall, weight scale, professional duty hair dryer, (ladies you can leave you hair dryers at home. This is very good quality. Three heat settings and speeds) lots of towels and toiletries. Some commented on the traffic noise from the highway but we did not hear anything. You may hear more helicopter noise zooming by. Nice bar in the lobby and a small cafe for a light snack. They are not open late night so either you order room service or head out the hotel. They also have a small store to purchase microwave meals, beverages (yes beer, wine and hard liquor) and personal items. Did not have a chance to visit the gym. The pool was closed for the season. The hotel is a short walk to Bellagio, Aria and the Crystals. There you can take the free tram to Monte Carlo to go to MGM. Walk through Bellagio to Caesers Palace. Even though the hotel is off strip, it is close enough to walk there. Now for some comments. 1. Those of you that visited youtube to view what a room is like at Vdara, may notice a Kreig coffee machine in the kitchen. You will not find it or a regular coffee machine as I was disappointed to find out. I didn't see I would ever use it if there was one as there are number of places that serves coffee. 2. Be careful on the selection of beverages that requires a bottle opener. 3. Vegas is very famous for charging an arm and leg for hot water. I also advise to bring your own water kettle if you like to make hot water. 4. Bed and pillows are extremely soft. If you are used to that, you will have the best sleep. If you are like me who is used to firm beds and pillow, you may experience a sore back and neck in the morning. Doubling up on the pillow doesn't help. Overall a fabulous hotel. There is not another hotel like this in Vegas. Must try to experience a different side of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “tried many 3-4 star condo hotels, there are better”
Reviews.Author: ted u
Reviews.Content: stayed at the signature, ph towers etc and this place is definitely the worst in service and amenities. Least kid friendly. secluded need to use the car a lot. Worst sofa bed with coils protruding out in a new hotel. they don't even have plates or utensils, dw soap in the suite...you have to call for them...which took over 3 attempts and I gave up. Whats the purpose of getting a condo hotel with no utensils etc. Overall its a new hotel, things are new. If I had another chance I would stay at the signature or ph towers. I at least tried staying here now to find another place for vacations at las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “this is an amazing place”
Reviews.Author: drooster1
Reviews.Content: I love going to Vegas, but hate the constant smell of smoke at night so this was a perfect fit for us. The room was upgraded for free to the belagio fountains view. the beds, shower, and set up was just amazing. They do not have a place to eat late at night though so prepare for that. Also its not actually on the strip you walk through the belagio to get to the strip which was fine for us

Reviews.Title: “Great potential”
Reviews.Author: AngPaz24
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is a great place. We had to give it a few stars off due to the oversight flaws that we experienced: - stained sheets on our bed - burnt out light bulbs - strange smell in room - scratchy towels. But, the service and staff were great! The bed and room is very comfortable. The workout gym is great and very clean. It is one of the better places to stay on the strip and we do plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing break”
Reviews.Author: Jen1330
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for 5 nights in October 2011, we picked the hotel for the location and price. The view from our 49th floor room was amazing, we overlooked the Bellagio fountains and the Strip, the room was huge and had the most beautiful bathroom. Another bonus was the non smoking throughout the hotel, was lovely not to have the smell of smoke lurking in the rooms and lobby. However you do need to call room service to bring the cutlery to your room, it would be nice if these items were already allocated to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: chefry
Reviews.Content: this was beutiful!!!! check in a breeze!!!! Suite was fantastic!! Check in clerk asked what floor we would like and what view we would like!!! Suite was very modern livingroom very comfy, bedroom again was fantastic as was the bathroom!!!! and the view of the Bellagio fountains!!! WOW

Reviews.Title: “Yeah.....Las Vegas Hotel without Smoking”
Reviews.Author: SEDoiron
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for work. There is a new choice in Las Vegas for a hotel other than the Marriott that is smoke free - Vdara.
