We stay in a suite and it had a full kitchen, dining and living room area. The service was excellent, the gym is well equiped and our view of the Bellagio fountain was great. The valets are so helpful with directions. Vdara is next to the Crystal Shopping Mall and Aria so there is plenty to do. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ecarylloh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way to LA and weren't disappointed. Our room looked over the Bellagio fountains and was huge - really good value for the money we paid (got it as a Top Secret hotel on Last Minute for £78). Only slightly odd thing was that although we had a kitchen we had to call down for any cutlery or plates.

Reviews.Title: “Free Valet and a Kitchenette!”
Reviews.Author: RMarieMpls
Reviews.Content: I'm no stranger to City Center. I've stayed at the Aria, pulled an all-nighter at The Cosmopolitan, and done more than my share of shopping at Crystal's. I knew where the hotel was located, so I figured it would be easy to drive right in, park, and check in. Not exactly. I drove around for a half an hour trying to find Vdara parking. I gave up and parked at the Bellagio, which is connected to Vdara by a skyway. Its literally a 2 minute walk. Little did I know there is no Vdara self-park because it is all free valet service. It was so convenient to drop off my car and head right up to our suite. No messing around with parking ramps and a mile walk through a casino! There is no casino so its much easier to go directly to your room. The lobby is lovely and the fragrance they use (sage maybe?) is delightful. The entire hotel smells fantastic and its not at all overpowering. I was relaxed the entire time I was staying there. The rooms are lovely, in relaxing earth-tone, and the bathroom with soaking tub was perfect. There is not much of a divider between the bedroom and the living room, which for a couple is fine. The kitchenette was sparkling clean, just make sure you know what you need before calling housekeeping for dishes, pots, utensils, etc. I was treated like a princess the entire time I was there. I'm contemplating staying there again the next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, relaxing stay, fabulous spa”
Reviews.Author: Joy K
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay last weekend at the Vdara. I don't gamble or smoke, so this was the perfect hotel. It was so nice to walk into a Vegas hotel lobby & not have to walk through the maze of a loud, smoky casino. The room was excellent. I took the advice from previous reviews & requested a high floor (I always request a room away from elevators). My room was spacious & quiet. For once, I had a relaxing time in Vegas. The housekeeping is good, but know that they are slow and take a LONG time to clean the room. The 1st day, they cleaned the room in the afternoon and were done by about 5pm. The second day, however, I was gone all afternoon and had the green "housekeeping" light on. I returned around 5pm, and the cleaning cart was parked 2 rooms away, exactly where it was when I left earlier in the day. I went out for dinner, and when I came back around 8pm she was cleaning my room! I had to get up at 4am to catch my flight, so I asked her to stop. (she was very nice, it was not her fault since she just came on the shift at 5pm). So, just know that if you are accustomed to having quick service early in the day like most hotels, that may or may not happen here. Not necessarliy a big problem, but possibly inconvenient if you want to be in your room in the early evening. The spa is fantastic, great service, all the perks & extras you could want. If you go, plan to take advantage & spend a few hours there. They have toothbrushes, razors, Aveda face products, etc., everything you need. I highly recommend you spend an afternoon here! The only downside is the food selection. The Market Cafe is convenient, but unless you hit it EXACTLY right, the lines are ridiculous. Due to the limited options, this little place gets overwhelmed & jam packed. If this is the case, take a 10 min walk into the Crystals mall & go to the little Wolfgang Puck "Pod." They have coffee, sandwiches, etc, at the same prices with no lines. (at least when I went at the prime 10am hour. The bar is nice, the wine selection great. The food menu is good but limited. I wanted to eat here a second night, but the menu just didn't motivate me so I went over to the Aria to find a bigger selection of menus. You can also walk over to the Bellagio, which is connedted via walkway. It would be so simple for them to extend the bar menu slightly (a little side salad maybe????) or to keep the Silk Road venue open. This is a very nice restaurant space but totally wasted.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us, great room, great service”
Reviews.Author: BethAustin36
Reviews.Content: We loved our Vdara suite, it was the perfect layout for us. Full kitchen plus table and chairs was very nice. We had to call housekeeping to get dishes, silverware, can opener, dish soap, sponge, napkins, etc. but was brought up promptly. If you're going to cook think about your kitchen needs list before hand. Loved the separate bedroom and guest toilet. There are two closets in the bedroom and lots of drawers. The in-room safe was smaller than expected, won't hold laptop but did hold all our winnings. ;) TV has HDMI input, it was a little tricky to get mode changed (under Watch TV option) but staff was eager to help us get it working. Had a nice view (South, not strip/premium view) from 27th floor but balcony would have been nice. All of the staff we talked to in person or on the phone very helpful and always tried their best to take care of us. We never got 'not my job' from anyone. We slept late one day and we called to get our room cleaned about 4:00 and they expedited getting it cleaned. We went for a long walk and it was done when we got back. Spa is small but they suggested we use the Aria spa for a day pass and is only $5 more. Fitness center was nice. Only one working stationary bike but lots of treadmills with iPod connections. There's only one bar and cafe/market. Market was much better stocked and wasn't horribly over priced, better than I expected. Aria is right next door (very short walk outside) and has lots of restaurants, club and casino. Also, Bellagio is directly connected by walkway (all MGM properties). Cosmopolitan is short walk behind the hotel, again outside. Not MGM property so not directly connected. It has several bars and lots of restaurant options. If you're looking for good and cheap, find Secret Pizza. Vdara is a hike to strip but we found the walk through Bellagio quick and easy. Coming home to quiet, smoke free lobby was heaven. All around, this our favorite hotel on the strip so far and we've tried bunches. For strip location, full suite and great service I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay After Our Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Kro0717
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara June 3rd and 4th after our wedding. We booked on Priceline. Our stay was unbelievable! We got to the hotel around midnight, after all of the celebrations. The front desk could not have been nicer. The manager saw we had just gotten married, and immediately upgraded us to a two bedroom penthouse suite. The room was truly amazing, well appointed, well thought out, and luxurious. The hotel itself is such a retreat without a casino and all of the noise. It was a nice break from where we had been staying all week. We ate lunch at Bar Vdara which was delicious and had great service. The location is not ideal, but close to the City Center monorail, so we didn't mind. The pool looked nice, but was a little too quiet for us, so we didnt use it. Even if we hadn't gotten upgraded, I think we still would have had a wonderful stay, but that was definitely a nice treat! They really know how to treat guests and you feel special just walking through the doors. I would definitely recommend Vdara for anyone looking for a change to the typical Vegas vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Good but with restritions”
Reviews.Author: Carmo_Brasil
Reviews.Content: We went in New Years in a part of 10 people to Las Vegas and stayed in Vdara. The front desk is mediocre, with a bad mood. The corner suite is great, with a good view, bed. The shower is really bad! The bathroom’s amenity is very simple and the smell is not good. The concierges not help in anything. Inside the hotel don’t have restaurants to take a breakfast, lunch or dinner. I not coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: everett_rainier
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Vdara and was satisfied in most ways. Having stayed at the MGM Signature a number of times, however, I was disappointed that the newer Vdara didn't raise the bar for me. The big advantage to the Vdara is location. Obviously, it's located in the City Center, but Vdara is a 50-yard covered walkway away from the Bellagio, as well. The shortcomings of Vdara are few but diminish what could be a five-star property: 1) no robes in the room (you call housekeeping to request them) 2) no tableware in the kitchen 3) wood chairs on marble kitchen floor - upstairs room made a ridiculous amount of noise just sitting in the kitchen...at 2am 4) soaking tub instead of a jacuzzi 5) no covered, climate-controlled walkways to casinos (unenclosed walkway to Bellagio is as close as they get) The only other hotel I've stayed at in Vegas is the Signature, which has the missing amenities above and doesn't have the chairs on marble issue either. The huge benefit to Vdara's location is enough to outweigh these shortcomings. I much prefer being able to walk 100-200 yards to 3 of the best casinos and high-end shopping on the Strip instead of having to take a looooong walk or cab ride from the Signature. If I am going to Vegas for something other than the Strip (business), I would probably stay at Signature over Vdara. If I am going to Vegas for fun, I'll look into another similar property (Trump or Palazzo) before heading back to Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous non-casino hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MVLULU
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas twenty-three times on business. This is my favorite hotel and I'll tell you why - no casino and no smoking! You walk in the front door, pass the beautiful reception desk in the lobby and head right to the elevator. No walking a mile through a smoky casino to get to the elevator to your room. This hotel, originally planned as luxury condos, I believe, is beautifully appointed with comfortable modern furnishings. The unit was extremely clean, the bed was wonderfully comfortable, and the bathroom was luxurious with a large glass shower and separate tub. Each suite has a small kitchen. If you ask at check-in, you may get a room with a view of the Bellagio fountain! We did! Even though Vdara is not directly on the strip, it's a short walk to the Bellagio. Not an inconvenience at all. I will definitely stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but poor processes”
Reviews.Author: FlyingMer
Reviews.Content: I loved the rooms, ammenities, spa and gym....but hotel management were inattentive and broke promises to us by not having rooms ready when promises. Also, the little restaurant has good food for a quick bite but the service and waiting times are terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for Non-Smokers”
Reviews.Author: SoloRide
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel for Non-smokers – Excellent Location Ask for a room on the highest floor possible for the best view. The rooms are basically floor to ceiling windows, so the views are awesome. Cool décor, flat screen tv’s and nice kitchenettes. No smoking in the entire building and there are no gaming tables or slot machines. There are no restaurants in this hotel. NO problem, the Cosmopolitan is right next door where you can eat at Milos, Comme Ca, Jaleo, Scarpetta. You can walk across the street to Aria, where you can eat at Sage, Serrano, Am Fish, etc. There is also a walkway that connects to the Bellagio right next door. Sensi is the first restaurant available to you. Also close to their atrium with the seasonal displays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Familyguy101
Reviews.Content: Awesome stay @ the Vdara. Beautiful hotel, but the number one thing is....NO SMOKING. There is no casino here so there is no casino smoke to wade through as you get to your room. The hotel is connected to the Bellagio and right across the street to the Aria for your gambling needs..Stayed in the Vdara suite which had washer/dryer , full kitchen , and an awesome tub and seperate stand up shower. It was like having a small apartment. Our suite had huge windows and an awesome backside view of the Bellagio fountains and the intersection of Las Vegas Blvd and Flamingo. Awesome. Automatic window shades and black out shades were an awesome touch. The hotel has this awesome smell throughout which is very addicting. Staff was nice The only real drawback is although the hotel is "on the strip" it sits back off of the street , which is about a 10 minute walk to get back to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wished the hotel had more restaurants, but loved the rooms”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while at a conference at Aria, its sister property. I loved the large rooms and the chic, modern feel of this hotel. The staff was great, and the tram took us from Aria to several other hotels on the Strip. I used the spa here and enjoyed that, too. I would stay here again, but the hotel is definitely better for business than pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Spa service execellent did not stay at hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ninabel
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to the spa for a message since the service was rated well on some other reviews. Both of us felt our massage was great. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The prices are comparable to other places on the strip and included the sauna and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ria432
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Vdara hotel in July 2011. The hotel overall was excellent. Extremely friendly staff, the rooms were impeccable and the location was convent. I would reccomernd this hotel for people who do not like to gamble .

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kimvoo
Reviews.Content: This is the second stay for me; the first was with a bunch of girlfriends and the second was with my family. Great service - everyone from front valet-front desk to housekeeping were genuinely friendly and very helpful. Both times the front desk helped us upgrade to a bigger room because of the size of our group and wanting to be closer to each other. The city corner suites are amazing! twice the size of the deluxe suites and completely worth it with all the amenities. We definately used the kitchenettes for breakfast (some fresh bread from the Paris Hotel..yum!) and the washer/dryer. This hotel is connected to the bellagio (walk way) and beside Aria. It is quite because of its location and does not have a casino or restaraunt attached (perfect for us). You can also connect to the city centre monorail that takes you down to the monte carlo. Some cons of the hotel: plates and cutlery and anything that has to do with using the in suite kitchen must be requested from the front desk (im not sure if this is standard with other hotels that offer the kitchenette), Marketplace downstairs closes early and offer a limited selection of items, like any other hotel i really dont feel the resort fee is worth it (20/night - but its vegas so what do you expect really..), the pull out sofa is extremely lumpy and uncomfortable so i wouldnt suggest sleeping on it. I hear the spa services are wonderful but we didnt have time to book for one. The pool is great in the summertime with a great layout. If you are looking for a quieter more relaxed place with great amenities and a short walk onto the strip this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: journey803
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at Vdara. We had a suite on the 54th floor which included limo transportation to and from the airport. Staying in the city center area was wonderful due to the location. Vdara is very clean, nice, good service, and much quieter than most other Las Vegas hotels. There is no casino at this property. The one downfall is there isn't anywhere to get something to eat inside Vdara except for a small market cafe which is only open from 6am to 8pm and 10pm on the weekends. The next closest places are in the Aria or in Crystals which are both a very short walk. My husband and I found ourselves spending more time at Aria than at Vdara because there really isn't anything to do at Vdara. If you are looking for some peace and quiet in Vegas than this is definitely the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Bare-bones comfort”
Reviews.Author: Simon G
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and accommodating, managed to make a large hotel never feel crowded. Rooms were large, clean and very comfortable. However the hotel has very few amenities outside of your room, with minimal on-site options for shopping, dining or entertainment; it's the Vegas Strip's answer to a Holiday Inn Express. Plan on spending your time at the other hotels and casinos, then stay here for the quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Glam!”
Reviews.Author: h20andsunlovers
Reviews.Content: Beautiful non-casino hotel in Vegas! We stayed in October 2011 for 4 nights and will stay there again. The rooms are huge - and are all suites, and are very modern and sexy. The location is perfect if you don't mind walking. If you do, you can always hop on the monorail. If you find a good deal for this hotel, snap it up! The pool is a good size, and has plenty of sun chairs - and you can't smoke! A real bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lacey_723
Reviews.Content: Stayed 02/01/12-02/04/12 and it was GREAT! The rooms were beautiful and spacious. The scent all over the hotel smelled really good! The employees were nice and welcoming. They let us know good places to eat. If you are looking for a hotel without a casino and without all of the smoking, this is it. There is a tram that transports to other hotels near. You are really in the center of it all. The wings from the rest. were very good and like the idea of the mini market being there. The hotel was beautful and service was good as well. I enjoyed my Birthday in vegas!!!!!!!!!! places you have to eat Hash House A GO GO for breakfast. FOOD WAS HUGE but Delish! Ziplining in freemont was fun esp. for 15 Bucks..lol The adventuredome is more so for children. The fashion show mall has the biggest FOREVER 21 Ive ever seen!!!!! Overall the Hotel was great and if I return to Vegas again I will def stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Felt ripped off and won't go back, but great staff here.”
Reviews.Author: Traveling53
Reviews.Content: First of all, being charged a $20 "resort fee" is a rip-off serious enough for me to take away one star. They jack up the daily room rate by this fee supposedly for internet access, local & toll-free phone calls, access to the Fitness Center, a daily newspaper, two bottles of water, and turndown service on request. A decent hotel would include internet access and turndown service on request in the regular room rate - which is not low; with cellphones, who needs free calls; the newspaper is at the front desk, not delivered to the door, and can be grabbed by anybody coming off the street. If a guest wishes to use the Fitness Center, he/she should be able to opt to pay or not. On general principles, I refuse to return to any hotel which engages in this abhorent rip-off. If more travelers would stop patronizing these places, maybe the hotels would stop doing it. However, if you don't mind being ripped off $20 per day, here are the pros and cons: Pros: Being in a completely non-smoking hotel is wonderful. Also, I liked being able to go to our room without going through a casino. The location is good; easy access to Bellagio and from there to the Strip. We had a 50th-floor room with a fantastic view. The room is divided into bed and living area. It's spacious, and the bathroom wonderful, with a huge tub and lots of space. The hotel is very clean, and the hotel staff were all helpful, friendly and courteous. Big kudos to them; they are the best feature of this hotel! Cons: There's a kitchen, but you have to beg for plates, cutlery and pots & pans because nothing is in the cupboards (which is annoying). Worse, they don't have a coffee maker -- they wouldn't even bring one up for me. No coffee maker??? Even a Holiday Inn will have a coffee maker in the room! Supposedly the pricier rooms have coffee makers, but this lack almost convinced me give the place two stars instead of three (the staff kept that third star). They'll bring you a robe, but don't bother; we saw people wearing them to/from the pool. The robes are flimsy and cheap and you'll look like an inmate in a psychiatric hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: scolona
Reviews.Content: The only reason I have given 2 stars is because we did receive an early check in with no problem and our suite was spacious and quite nice. There is only one restraint which is more like a deli than restraint but not much of q problem I was thinking it was ,ore of a boutique hotel. I stood In line for literally 20 minutes before reechoing the counter, ordered a chicken Fraser and was told I could not order there and had to go to the counter- starve g I finally made it to the counter and 25 minutes later (I know this because they gave me a timed receipt) I walked back up to find out where my lettuce wi cut up cold chicken was, another 8 minutes and I received it. Seriously, an hour for cold chicken on lettuce - it probably takes 30 seconds to make? So now I am cranky, make it back up to my room, tune on the television and a Vdara informercial is playing on half of my screen - the other half is lines. Funny enough the commercial is telling me About the extraordinary service. Lol. I gather my belongings and stop by the gym on my way to pool. One person working in spa/gym who is on the phone for the 5-10 minutes I am waiting to find out about the services they offer. I give up and go to the pool. Find my way to the pool stand and the pool attendant is sitting on the ground with her back to me texting, I ask for a towel and she tells me to "just grab what I need" without getting up and or tuning around. I grab a towel - get to a chair and it has a huge hole in it - of course. Later in the evening stopped by the bar downstairs and had a very friendly waitress that had around 35 people in her section, not her fault but she had the opportunity to refill our empty drinks every 25 minutes at best and I watched as she was running table to table. We arrived back at our room and no turn down service- never have stayed at a hotel that did not have turn down service but the bar is so low here I am not surprised. The next morning I went down to the pool at 9:15, although the sign said it opened at 9:00, the pool was locked and there was just a line of people waiting. It is now 4:00 the same day and no one has cleaned our room since we arrived yesterday afternoon?.... I called and housekeeping said the could be as late as 6pm to clean the room - seriously wtf?.. No wonder they do not have time for turn down service. Sitting here waiting for housekeeping to show up watching super bowl on the half of a screen of the television (that they said they fixed yesterday). I would call to complain but front desk does not pick up - never ever stay her. Cosmopolitan is right next door do yourself a favor.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, terrible management”
Reviews.Author: Don R
Reviews.Content: I booked a number of rooms and a penthouse suite for a business event. The hotel is a great property is an excellent location. The rooms are very nice. The staff members are outstanding. But the hotel management is incompetent. Rooms that were promised to be ready for events at specific times were not ready requiring us to contact all of our business associates to apologize that event would have to be delayed. According to management, they just couldnt get the room cleaned in time. I had to call the management throughout the day to inquire about the room status and I received different answers each time. The cafe food is great, but its another example of management out of control. Good luck getting your order. So if your planning a group or business event that involves the hotel management, I recommend you look elsewhere. However, for a quick non business get-a-way, its a fine property with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: D0nna74
Reviews.Content: I am giving this hotel a rating of 5 because it is beautiful, the staff were great and our corner suite was excellent. There was free valet parking and as we rented a car that was handy! Well worth the tip. We booked tickets for 3 shows through the concierge, which was great because not only did the guy know people at the other hotel box offices and got us very good seats, he also made sure we had and used the free M-Life card to save money. We had a kitchen and a washer/dryer in our suite and although there wasn't any soap or kitchen supplies when we arrived, a call down to house-keeping and they brought us everything we needed within minutes. ALL the staff were really friendly and not in a fake way. :) They went out of their way to make conversation and be polite. The bed and pillows were CRAZY comfortable!!! They even have Vdara at Home and you can order the same pillows/mattress and I am trying to talk my husband into splurging! Seriously though, I have a pretty screwed up neck with disc herniations and after a couple days there I noticed that my neck wasn't hurting at all. Usually hotel beds are a nightmare for me but not here. Now to the "but" in my title... We wouldn't stay there again because of the location and lack of restaurants/entertainment. I'm not going to mark the hotel down for that because it clearly states the location. It is minutes to walk to the strip, but just not very direct. There is also just one cafe and no other places to eat....again, the hotel description clearly states that so it doesn't deserve to lose points as everything else is wonderful. If you want to stay on the Strip in a less-Vegas style hotel, smoke-free, casino-free and beautiful, you would love the Vdara. If you want more of the whole-package hotel, then maybe look into the Aria, which is in the same family of City Center hotels but has way more going on.

Reviews.Title: “A very difficult one - cant decide if conned or comp'ed!”
Reviews.Author: evelyninhouston
Reviews.Content: I booked a delux Bellagio Lakeview suite as i figured that would give me great Strip views. We arrived at 3pm on Saturday - 2 clerks working check-in and about 12 groups waiting to check in - we waited in line some 20 minutes (this is especially annoying when on sunday (early) and mon whern there was no-one checking in or out there were 5 clerks on duty!) - Anyway, i got the "good news / bad news" pitch. Bad news my Lake View suite wasnt ready, but they could "upgrade" us to a (larger, apparently) corner suite with views of "the south of the strip - Monte Carlo, Luxor, Mandalay Bay etc) - having been travelling for over 10 hours we took the "upgrade" - THe view from our window were of the back of these hotels and the Freeway (I 15) but we did have the mountanin view on the horizon.. As for the rest of the stay, not as plush as I was hoping for, fitness centre very cramped and of course the inevitable "resort fee" of US$20 per day - note that the Bally Group are advertising that they have stopped charging these. Finally, the location of this Hotel makes it v difficult to walk in and out of - if you try and turn up Harmon off the Strip you hit fences and have to walk back to the strip, throught the Cosmopolitian Casino, out the back, crossing roads and up stairs to get to the Vdara entrance. Staff were all v polite and service good, but this gets 6/10 at best off me I am afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey G
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is set back from the strip, but it's still on the strip. My finacee upgraded us to a king suite, and it was so nice! There was even an all in one washer and dryer, full kitchen, dining area, living room and 1 1/2 baths. Everything is high tech and the beds are great! Room service was pretty timely too. There is no casino, resturants, or buffet...BUT there is NO SMOKING!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable suite experience”
Reviews.Author: TimBudi
Reviews.Content: Me and several friends went to LV to celebrate my birthday in January. We stayed at Vdara because we want to stay in a non gaming hotel. We arrived around 10 pm, there's only 2 front desk staff but check in was easy and we did not have to pass a long hallway full of slot machine. It was more on a quiet and calm experience. In 20 minutes we were in our room. We booked an executive room because it has a large space, a half bathroom and a full size fridge. The room was clean and the housekeeping staff did a great job. We asked them to make the sofa bed and deliver 4 dining sets, it was done by the time we were back to our room. The bed was comfortable but not the sofa bed. The bathroom was nice and clean and stocked with towels and bath amenities. 2 Flat screen TV, one in the bedroom and one in the living room. The location of the hotel was close to everything. Its within walking distance to the strip, ARIA, Mandarin, Belagio etc. The only thing that set me down was that they could not save me a room with a lake view as I requested several times prior to arrival. I understand it's not a guaranteed but with the modern computer system they should know whether they will have a specific room I requested on that day or not. I count this against customer service and the M life service. I'd rather known this in advance rather than later. No upgrade was offered too. I guess some four star hotel does not have the drive to deliver a 5 star service after all. Will I stay again? not so sure....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but won't return because of the location”
Reviews.Author: eaglesgal
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in what may seem to be a great location. This hotel is only a block off the strip but it's not that simple....to get to the strip is a HUGE hassle, numerous walkways, alot of stairs or the tram to another casino and then winding your way through that casino ( and the smoke) to get to the street. Since the Vdara doesn't have a restaurant, casino or nightclub you are forced to leave the hotel for all of these options. I was well aware of what the Vdara had to offer when I booked and was totally fine with the option of leaving the hotel for food etc...based on maps and such the strip is so close but yet so far away. Our room was fine, all of the flat surfaces where dusty and the hallway and our room smelled like sewer ( 46th floor) we ended up switching rooms/floors due to a sofabed malfunction and I am happy to report the 43rd floor did not smell like sewer. I will stay elsewhere when returning to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair accessibility”
Reviews.Author: thatsnufpiggy
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my boyfriend who is a wheelchair user level C6-C7. We were pleasantly surprised by the accessible room. It was very spacious and very clean! We were upgraded to a view of the Bellagio fountain. The sound from the fountain did not bother us. And overall hotel was very quiet. Next to the wall by the door, there are buttons for for your room to be cleaned or not disturbed. It will light up with different colors (depending on what you want) to let housekeeping know your request. Kitchen : as soon as you go in, you are in the kitchen area. There is a mini fridge (fits few bottles of water), a microwave, sink, cabinets and drawers. It comes bare so you have to ask for everything. I read few reviews that mentioned that you can ask for a coffee maker. We asked, but they said they don't provide them anymore. Bathroom : spacious sink, wheelchair can roll in under the sink. There are grab bars by the toilet. Roll in shower with grab bars and mounted shower chair. The shower area isn't that spacious, but it was okay for us. There is a bathtub which we didn't get to use. Bed : I know wheelchairs are usually customized and people have their own preference on the height of the bed when transferring.. but in our case, the bed height was good. In my opinion, it wasn't too high. There is no casino so it was very quiet. There was only carpet inside the hallway to the rooms. We went by the pool, most of the area is accessible. I didn't see a lift for the pool. We didn't go to the spa. We didn't go in to the business room but it looked kind of small. The hotel is very accessible. You can ask for bathrobes and water. Bathroom sink was a bit slow to drain. And we had a little incident with a wet area on the carpet. It turned out to be a leak from the heater/air conditioner from the room next door. It did take awhile for them to take a look at it. But the older gentleman from maintenance (I think) that came by to take a look at the problem was very nice and helpful. Overall, we would definitely come back to this hotel and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Alternative...”
Reviews.Author: Ben1500
Reviews.Content: ,,,to most of Las Vegas's hotels. We loved the modern design, no smoking and no casino. Our son commented we could get to our rooms without having to walk 20 minutes. The concierge service worked hard to answer my questions and were very gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Girls trip!”
Reviews.Author: Seematony
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Close to the strip and airport. They have a free tram available that is connected to Bellagio, Monte Carlo and the crystal shopping centre. A less busier hotel on the strip but i liked that. Nice pool and cabana area. Great rooms.... we had a room with a great view of the Bellagio fountains, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Most of the 4-5 star trappings, but not quite there”
Reviews.Author: candsnz
Reviews.Content: We chose Vdara because it's reasonably priced in comparison to other 4-5 star Vegas hotels. It's all non-smoking, does not have its own casino, and is pretty well positioned in the middle of the Strip behind the Cosmopolitan, next to Bellagio and opposite Paris. Unfortunately the line to check in and out is almost always very long. While reception staff are generally very pleasant and helpful, each transaction seems to take a very long time. The Vdara does not offer self-parking - and collecting your car can also take a while -but generally the valet team are friendly and helpful. With no restaurant on site, food is only available in-room, at the casual Market Cafe or in Bar Vdara. The menu in the bar, however, was quite impressive and the quality/presentation of the food was very good. The bar staff were knowledgeable and pleasant. The rooms are not overly large but well designed and attractively appointed. The small kitchen is not stocked with anything...at all!. Glasses, cups, spoons etc must be requested from Housekeeping. The remote-controlled black-out blinds are a nice idea but do not provide any semblance of 'black-out' as the gaps between the blinds let in a great deal of light. While the air-conditioning is efficient there is only one large fixed vent in the bedroom area. If you like a cool room for sleeping the air is blown around the bed creating an uncomfortable breeze! The main bedside lights cannot be controlled from anywhere near the bed, and the small reading lights are inadequate for comfortable reading. On the positive side, the rooms were pretty quiet considering the hotel's position in relation to the freeway. And there was certainly no noise from neighboring rooms or the hallway. Tip - call Housekeeping to request robes and slippers.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: islandcouple55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for 6 nights while visiting Las vegas. I must say this hotel was marvelous! To start with it's brand new and spa styled. When entering the hotel from any of the entry ways you are taken from the busy hustle of Las Vegas to a clean, relaxing, pleasant smelling heaven! The staff are ever so efficient and eager to please. The rooms are actually suites. They are large and very clean. The decor is soothing, modern and relaxed. Any service you ask for is tended to promptly and room service is always on time! All of the suites have door bells, house keeping lights and do not disturb lights outside each door that are set by pressing a button in the room by the door. The curtain/ window shades are all electronic and the view we had was wonderful!! The valet parking was quick, efficient and friendly. The concierge was very helpful for events and directions as well as full of good ideas for this to do. The pool is large warm and clean as well as the jacuzzi. The spa was heavenly! We had terrific massages together in the same room. The dressing room/ sauna/ steam room area is so well planned out. Every amenity is there for you in case you forget to bring something with you. The spa staff are very helpful with information as they show you around before your massage. The security in the hotel was very good and professional in their behavior. There was always someone standing near the elevators for guidance and checking to be sure you belonged there. We were there over New Years so security was a big plus! I guess I can't say enough great things about this awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be staffed a little more”
Reviews.Author: ubviswa
Reviews.Content: Though this is a very nicely maintained and very clean hotel, I personally saw waiting for every thing except maybe the swimming pool. Obviously my visit was during post Xmas season and hence maybe the wait. That apart, the resort is fabulous, probably the only non-smoking place in the whole of Vegas, unless you wanted to stay 10 miles away. All other hotels on the Strip can give a non smoking room, but cannot give a non-smoking environment - hey! it is Vegas baby...is what their eyes would say if you can read eyes. Vdara is well connected and actually it was a whole day later when I realized that the monorail is free. After that traveling from and to became such a boon, since the Strip is quite an expanse. The front desk did not tell me that on arrival, directed me to the Concierge who had an attitude and looked indifferrnt, was not friendly. I went the next day to the Concierge asking if they had a coupon for the monorail, again similar attitude and 20 minute wait. The gentleman in front of me kept calm and his dignity when the concierge staff rolled her eyes on what seemed an obvious question to me; that proved definitely it was not me or my deo. However the bell boys and the valet were very friendly and were willing to wait until we got all our stuff off the car. The valet even asked me - would i need the can of water taken to the room, and the flipflops - both I had forgotten, non essential but and it was very good he asked me. I would have realized that the next day when I needed them to go to the pool. The room itself had a Kitchenette that was a blessing. Being a vegetarian, there was not much not choice outside especially after 10 pm. Vdara itself has limited eating in options, Aria being a few foot steps away did not have any veg options either. What to watch out for is - the booking agent on the phone told me from the type of room i was booking, I could see the Bellagio fountain and the strip, so had an expectation built up. It was a glimpse of the fountain and had to look for the strip. Their website is good, but not very descriptive of what to expect. If I did not have an expectation it would not be so bad. Four pluses - kitchenette and honestly fully non-smoking hotel, Valet and bellboys excellent; almost centrally located and good enough for the price. Few minuses - more staff needed, courtesy at the concierge. Thanks for reading, and If this review is helpful please say so.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: Bajalolo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a hit from the moment I arrived. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate and all the little touches afforded in each room a delight. My roomie especially liked the doorbell and the lights signaling do not disturb and clean the room. The location to the tram made it easy to get around. Highly recommend it. I thought having no casino was a minus but definitely changed it to a plus especially regarding my wallet and a good environment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice change from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: cyberta88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here, and I absolutely loved it!!! The decor is modern, the room is a suite and it has a kitchenette equipped with pots, pans etc... We picked this particular hotel because of the kitchenette. My husband and I like making our own breakfast, so this was perfect! It's close to the Cosmopolitan, Aria, and shopping. I will definitely stay here again! Only bummer, no casino!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice....low score for Amenities”
Reviews.Author: JB3434
Reviews.Content: The rooms and staff are both nice at the Vdara. I don't think that they offered alot as far as amenities go. There is a small cafe in the lobby, no casino, gym is small with limited amount of equipment, and the pool is also small and doesn't have alot going on. The rooms are great but for the money, there are alot of choices in vegas with more to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A quite refuge next to a sea of casino chaos.”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelerMVCA
Reviews.Content: Very nice accomodations in Vegas, with out a casino. Casinos are only steps away at the Aria, Cosmo, and Bellagio if you want that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel without Vegas Drama”
Reviews.Author: Srjenkins19
Reviews.Content: Vdara was a great home base for escaping the madness of Vegas. It didn't have a casino, which was fantastic, and it had a lovely pool with very helpful staff. The only downside, our room only had one king bed (and I was traveling with a friend), but other than that, it was great. No real restaurant on site, but the hotel is connected to the Bellagio, which was quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: GEM10Barrie_Ontario
Reviews.Content: The rooms are amazing. They are so nice you never want to leave. We had a corner suite so when you opened the blinds you could see for miles. We had a nice surprise with a knock at the door and cookies and hot chocolate were delivered. I think it was part of our package. Would reccomend it to anyone, the only downfall is not having a full restaurant. The coffee shop is good but very busy. Would return in a heartbeat !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: LIL_traveler86
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, beautiful view, wonderful service! Couldn't have picked a better all-suite hotel to celebrate my 25th birthday! Almost all of the rooms have only one bed, but it's a huge bed! There is also a couch in the room which has a pull out which was pretty large as well. With that said, the bathroom is amazing and the room is very spacious! My first visit to an all-suite hotel and would come back again! Most definitely recommend this place for fun or leisure. This place doesn't have a club or casino but it is located in the new City Center so everything is walking distance to the new clubs/casinos. All in all I had a fabulous stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, modern, very affordable, and No gaming on site”
Reviews.Author: ClipperTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had s suite of 4 roomettes: bedroom, living room, kitchenette and bathroom for $550 for 3 nights. Beautifully appointed, views from three sides. I don't like hotels with gaming because they are much more crowded, harder to check in and out and parking is often a hassle. Very well, located in the center of the strip, this is a great place to stay and proximate to anything you can want.

Reviews.Title: “Condo next to the strip”
Reviews.Author: GAMACA
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a hotel. Doesn’t have the multitude of restaurants or casino or anything. One can see it was built as a condo building. However it is a nice touch to live like this so close to the strip. Don’t misunderstand this, this is high level living. The units are well appointed with Bosch appliances. If you plan long stay this could be a better alternative than the hotel. The only drawback is access. Seems to be very awkward. Pedestrian access definitely difficult. From the strip you need to walk through the maze of halls and passages either through Aria or through Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Not so secret anymore!”
Reviews.Author: WYOMAGS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another wonderful stay at Vdara in Las Vegas--our FAVORITE hotel! We always upgrade to the City Corner Suite as the views are breathtaking! I always tease our friends and tell them you can literally take a shower and watch the Bellagio fountains go off--which is the TRUTH!!! Our room was full of space with a kitchen, living room, dressing area, twin-sink bathroom against a glass wall with a gorgeous view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip and a good-sized bedroom. The washer and dryer come in handy as well. Guest services brought up laundry detergent and dryer sheets complimentary upon our request! The only drawback is Vdara used to carry really nice bathroom amenities and they did not have them during our stay. My wife was really bummed as she looks forward to the nice shampoo and conditioner they used to have in the bathroom. There is a new small restaurant/deli in the lobby that was a FANTASTIC addition. You can pick up fruit, water, pop, sandwiches, etc there. It is very affordable. The elevators? Amazing! Honestly we were on the 53rd floor and never waited more than 5 seconds for an elevator. I am NOT exaggerating. Five seconds tops. All in all Vdara is an awesome place to stay. It smells great when you walk in the door--feels like home! Casinos are close and so is the strip. Vdara used to be a best-kept secret but based on the large number of people in the lobby it is no secret anymore! Do yourself a favor: Stay at Vdara your next time in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!!!”
Reviews.Author: iLuvDetroit
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is the best hotel I've stayed at! Beautiful, modern, clean, perfect location! First time in Vegas and I'm in love! Most comfortable bed I've slept in and the most amazing cleaning service. They organized my makeup that I left all over the bathroom counter!!! Was super impressed and I loved the fact that it was a non-gaming hotel. Highly recommend and brag about it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: megb05
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in January 2012 and we had the best time! The room was the most basic room but it was amazing! We had views of the strip and the Bellagio Fountains! We used the fold out couch as a bed so both of us could spread out and we were both VERY comfortable here! The bathroom was beautifully clean and amazing! This hotel room had everything we needed and if anyone wants to let an alarm clock ruin a trip to vegas they are being ridiculous! We accidentally had a house keeper come in once while we were asleep as we forgot to press the do not disturb but this was not a big issue. Loved this place and would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting a fun trip to vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Kmw19
Reviews.Content: My husband and i decided to book a trip to vegas and after reading reviews we thought of this place. This hotel RUINED our trip - NEVER again. Now I'm not one to complain and usually don't but felt I had to let people know to please avoid this hotel. Our trip started off great - i walked into the lobby admiring the design, art work, the beautiful bar, great smells etc. We patiently waited in line where a nice gentleman checked us in and 'upgraded us'. We arrived to the room and I was happy with the view but didn't care much for the room itself and actually found the layout to be quite awkward = a lot of wasted useless space = and the rooms are quite dark. I didn't bring my blow dryer as every hotel i have stayed in has them. Well to my surprise this hotel didn't - huge disappointment as I need to blowdry my hair so I wasn't able to wash my hair and get properly ready for a night out. My fault I guess for just assuming I guess. We decided go out anyway and got home around 4 a.m. Well at 6:45 a.m. we got a nice wake-up call from the alarm clock being set from the previous guest who stayed in our room. We woke up exhausted and cranky and spent 20 minutes trying to figure out how to turn the stupid clock off - not as easy as one would expect - there were no off buttons - just snooze. Couldn't unplug it because it's plugged in behind a built-in wall unit. We finally got it off or so we thought only to get woken up again. Nothing worse after staying out late and wanting nothing more to sleep in. We played around with it some more and finally got the alarm off then headed out for the day. We returned later in the night forgetting about our disasterous morning and hit the sheets. Sure enough 6:45 a.m. AGAIN the alarm goes off. This time i was really angry. I called down to front desk and they said 'we can't explain how to turn off the alarm over the phone - maintenance will have to come up to turn it off - it is hard to explain how to turn off" (No apologies or anything) REALLY!!! You need maintenance to come turn off an alarm clock!!!!!!! RIDICULOUS!!!!! So another day and we are up, annoyed and angry. Great way to start the day. Then to top it off I go down to the lobby 'cafeteria' and order a $5 gross coffee I have to serve myself. Finally the day came to leave and I couldn't wait - we checked out - got the bill (all the resort fees, fees for overpriced room service, fees for everything you could think of really) from a rather unpleasant little man and went on our merry fricking way. I hated that hotel and will NEVER recommend it to anyone or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for non-smoking, non-gaming hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: vetism
Reviews.Content: We did extensive research into non-smoking hotels on the strip. As of today, there are really only two choices - Signature at MGM Grand, and Vdara. We picked Vdara given it's relatively new, and in our opinion, better location. We were pleased with our choice during our recent two-night stay. The good: - Free valet parking, quick on pick up - Walk in the lobby, and there's the front desk, and right around the corner is the guest elevator. That means no walking a few hundred feet through the casino floor just to get to the elevator like other hotels on the strip - Easy access to Bellagio (via connected walk-way) for dining, entertainment and gaming options - Room is spacious, well appointed, and if you request and get a room facing Bellagio (like we did), the view of the dancing fountain is spectacular Needs improvement: - No self parking (see above). If you're reluctant to hand over the keys to someone, self park at Bellagio garage and walk 10-15 minutes back to Vdara - Staff is friendly, but at times they're understaffed. Also, despite our multiple visits to the front desk, they could not get our card to work for room charge - No food on premise after 10pm (except pricey room service) All in all, we would return the next time we're in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condotel in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying in the 2bedroom Hospitality suite. We flew in and took advantage of the comp airport transportation. Limo was on time and made it a breeze to get to the hotel. Great start to the weekend... Checkin: because of our suite status, I checked in at the vip line. Everything was smooth and fast. Hotel/Room: great location and not a far walk to casino at Aria. Lobby was clean and modern. Elevators were mostly quick. Always security present at lobby elevators. Room was tastefully decorated and fresh. Kitchen was a great touch and loved the keurig with comp coffee and water. beds were comfy and appreciated the turn down service. Only complaint about the roons were: no black-out curtains, but shades instead. Room could not be made completely dark. Also water pressure was a tad weak. Service: great. Doormen remembered us and was always courteous. Never a long taxi line. Overall, everyone agreed that this was a great hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A gem not so Far from the Madding Crowd !”
Reviews.Author: Tbuzzi
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. We just completed a 4 night stay at the Vdara and had two rooms. check in was easy and quick and the lifts are located next to reception, so unlike most of the other Vegas Strip hotels you aren't dragging your bags through the lobbies and casinos to get to your room!. They also only offer valet parking which is included in your resort fee. Although there was no casino in this hotel is attached by a covered walkway to the Bellagio so within 5 minutes you can be in the casino. The hotel spa services were overpriced even for resort/luxury spa, but I had the best massage I've ever had in my life here. All rooms are suites and have fully equipped kitchen. We stayed in a Hospitality Suite and had two bedrooms , two full bathrooms and a guest bathroom with a lounge and kitchen/diner. Kitchen was fully equipped and we also had our own washer and dryer. My parents were in a one bedroom Penthouse Suite and there room was beautiful too. I have seen the comments about not for asthmatics and pumped fragrance but have to say that it did not affect either myself or my mother neither did I notice it. The only downside is that there is no proper restaurant located in the hotel. there is a small cafe/market but they do offer a fantastic 24hour in room dining menu. But if you want to eat out, the Aria hotel is located within 2 minutes of the front door and easily reached by a pedestrian walkway. The Aria has lots of restaurants and shopping . We dined at the "Julian Serrano" tapas restaurant and having lived in Spain for 4 years I can definitely say the traditional tapas was as authentic as it gets! The modern dishes were quite unique too.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke-free, modern, spacious & EXCELLENT service!”
Reviews.Author: rgershy
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was excellent - every employee was more than helpful and willing to assist with a smile. I recommend this hotel for those people who want to be near the action, but not living in it. We went as a two mother-daughter pairs and the quiet smoke free environment was much appreciated. The rooms were modern - although there was a bit of an odd smell in some of the hallways. This was not the case in the rooms. I definitely recommend this hotel as a comfortable place to stay - probably very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION,LOCATION,LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: TOMARO
Reviews.Content: We just completed a three nights stay at the Vdara. It is everything that all the reviewers have said and more. It is very comfortable and gets you away from the noise of the strip in a good way. If you like chocolate martinis then be sure to try one at BarVdara but make sure the bartender uses Stoli Vanilla. Yummmm yum. We will stay there again on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “NOT for ASTHMATICS”
Reviews.Author: Tara M
Reviews.Content: VDara is a non smoking property however they pump so much fragrance into it that walking through the lobby was obnoxious and overwhelming. The other properties we visited were not this extreme with their scent? Perhaps Vdara finds the smell of tourists offensive. I would have rated his property higher if it was not for the fragrance issue. On the plus side we did have a nice view of the mountains, the strip and the Bellagio fountains and the property is fairly central with a tram to the Aria & Monte Carlo. The mini-suite was comfortable with a kitchen and small living room area however the kitchen had no utensils or coffeemaker stocked but did have a note that you could request these items. Seems little point in having a mini kitchen if it has no coffee pot. Or maid service was efficient and friendly and the interaction we had with other staff was courteous.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: KariMetzger
Reviews.Content: Wow - stayed here on a girls' retreat weekend, and what an awesome stay it was! LOVE: -Decor - totally contemporary -non-smoking designation! -no casino downstairs (so I felt I was coming home rather than staying stimulated the entire time! -kitchens in every suite! -top notch cleaning (no yucky grout issues, everything feels completely clean) -VIEWS!! WOW WOW WOW! So romantic! -The tv - you could play music playlists to suit your mood/fancy - loved this! -Concierge was very helpful -the spa here was one of the best in the world I've been to! Wonderful service, amazing decor, and truly relaxing - a MUST DO if you stay here! -LOVE the master light switch where you can turn off the entire suite with one button - I love these in Europe and am so happy to start seeing them in North America! -LOVE that you can signal housekeeping or DND at the touch of a button without having to dress to open the door.. -love the blackout shades and privacy shades - automatic and so helpful! COULD IMPROVE: -If this is such a green hotel, why are there no recylcing containers in the suites? -the lights next to the bed only turn on/off on a switch AWAY from the bed - weird and not helpful at night. -no restaurant in the building -a bit of a walk into the main strip (not too bad, as it is connected to the Bellagio), but still a 10 min walk.. -the front desk screwed up our reservations several times while we were there (only on halfway through did they sort out who was in which room, even though we had walked them through it several times (and there were only 2 per room!) -pool/hot tub closed at sundown - VERY unfortunate, as we really wanted to relax in the hottub after our long days! -pool deck was super slippery and a bit dangerous! Would ABSOLUTELY stay again on a girls' retreat weekend, a romantic getaway - you name it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in the Heart of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: husker7028
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Vdara for 2 nights this week. Great hotel, perfectly situated on the Las Vegas strip. Everything is new and service is outstanding. Many of the rooms have incredible views of the Bellagio fountains and the rest of the strip. Highly recommend this hotel as a place to get away from the usual chaos of the the strip. But at the same time, it is very centrally located so makes walking to any of the casinos very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice suite.”
Reviews.Author: Woozster
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Vdara. Enjoyed it very much. Location is great, connected to Bellagio and the tram running to Crystals/Aria and Monte Carlo. Saves lots of steps if you're going that direction. Our room was a standard suite and had a kitchen. Drawback: no coffee pot, even by request. My husband loved the remote control shades and the room stayed really dark for sleeping. The view was unremarkable but the room was modern and well-appointed. Wi-fi was sporadic.

Reviews.Title: “Newer, Non-Smoking Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Brynny2
Reviews.Content: As non-smokers we appreciate a hotel, like the Vdara, that is designated "non-smoking". Our room was mini-suite style with the TV wall separating the sleeping area from the sitting area. The hotel is quite new, so all of the furnishings were stylish and in very good condition. There isn't a casino in the hotel, so it has a quieter atmosphere. A walkway connects the Vdara to the Airia and to the Bellagio for casino action, shows, and more dining choices. We enjoyed the Vdara and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but a bit far.”
Reviews.Author: JvtZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel had everything we wanted we even tried out the spa! There is no casino at this hotel but next door is belagio and aria and they both have casinos to enjou! The only negative thing and I mean ONLY thing, is the location, you are behind belagio and away from the strip. Every where you go is a 10 min walk farther, multiple that by your stay and it adds up. This is my second time staying here and I'd do it again since the price is so good.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis without feeling far away”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara last week while attending the crazy busy CES convention. Knowing the day would be hectic, I wanted to find a place where I could escape the mass of tourists, and the dank smell of cigarettes that usually accompanies hotel lobbies with casinos in them. Vdara is the place. You are nicely situated between the glamorous old world Bellagio, and the glamorous new world Aria in the Strip altering City Center. Literally, steps from each, and connected to Bellagio by a covered walkway. The view from my room looked out over the Bellagio fountains and the Paris Hotel's Eiffel Tower on one end, the Palms Hotel and the red and blue neon covered Rio Hotel at the other. Yep, I was in Vegas alright. The room was spacious with two flat screen tvs, and a large, comfortable bed and nice living room. There is also a table for two in the kitchenette area. The bathroom had a large glassed in shower with a built-in counter for sitting. The separate bathtub was a deep tub soaker, which came in handy at the end of day for soothing my aching feet. Reception was courteous and speedy. And the lobby was always populated, but the foot traffic was manageable. Weather wasn't conducive to using the outdoor swimming pool, but it looked adequate with lounge chairs all around the deck. Didn't use the spa, but checked out the menu which looks nice, so next time. And there will be a next time. Vdara is understated by Vegas standards, but still cool, and the closest thing to feeling like you are home. The best place to stay, in my opinion. Leave the casinos, shows and restaurants for going out. You are steps away from all the hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday!! Best Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Msbliss
Reviews.Content: Our stay was back in October 2011, but I been meaning to write a review since then. We stayed for 12 nights. The staff were very accommodating and gave us a room on the 49th floor overlooking the bellagio fountains. The view at night was simply breathtaking and you could really see how much the strip comes alive at night! The hotel room was gorgeous and the bed so comfortable!! This was definitely a once in a life time holiday for me especially as I got engaged, but it was truly a lovely hotel! The hotel was also very clean.The pool area was really relaxing and not noisy like it can be at some hotels. The walk to the strip takes about 5-10 minutes through the bellagio, but once you are there you are right in the centre, and to be honest anywhere in vegas takes ages to get to so the 5-10 min walk is nothing really.

Reviews.Title: “The standout property of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bentl1
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise. Having stayed at EVERY hotel in Vegas over the years, I can tell you this is the best hotel I've seen. This hotel jumped past the Bellagio and the Venetian. Completely non-smoking, no casino, designer rooms, great staff, quality beds ... the list goes on and on. It felt more like home than any other property we've ever stayed at. The only flaws we could find were these: #1) No coffee maker in the least expensive room ... Designer everything in the room and not a ten dollar coffee maker? Really? 2#) The hated "resort fee" ... STOP IT!! The only reason hotels do this is to cheat travel agencies out of some of their commission. This only makes the hotel look cheap. 3#) The "free" wi-fi, which is part of the "resort fee" is so bad, it's basically useless. Amazingly, the wired ethernet connection wasn't any better. 4#) Low water pressure. Although there are water issues in Vegas, this is a ridiculous idea to save water. This is why I travel with my own shower head when I go to Vegas. I'm already planning my next stay there. Just fix the aforementioned issues and it'll be fairly close to perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: sleepy38
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a couple of months ago with friends. There was three of us on the first night with a fourth person flying in from California on the second night. After considering all the usual/well-known hotels, we thought we would go with something different so we ended up booking one of the corner suites at the Vdara. The whole arrival & check-in process was very smooth (although we arrived on a weekday afternoon so not sure what this will be like at busier times). If driving, you may miss the sign that leads up the ramp to the hotel/complex entrance so be extra careful! The room itself was a pleasant surprise. Being a new hotel, the rooms are in perfect condition and the corner suite in particular was very spacious, with great views of the strip, two bathrooms, a full kitchen and dining table, even a washing machine and tumble drier! There is a sofa-bed that can sleep two although it is not very comfortable for two adults so would probably be better suited to one adult or two children. Having said that, it was perfectly adequate for one night. The bathroom in the bedroom was very spacious too, with a separate huge shower and a free-standing bath with great views - this would be great for a couple on a romantic weekend away but not of much use to us during our stay. We did not spend much time in the room and did not use any of the hotel services so cannot really comment on these, other than the housekeeping which was good (you can ask for the sofa to be made into a bed while you're out). The other great selling point of this hotel is its location. Through a system of walkways, you can walk to the Bellagio in about 5 minutes and there is also a light rail loop that connects to the Aria and some other hotels (we only used once to go to the Aria). Overall, a great, modern and comfortable hotel with a great location. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Vdara restaurant update”
Reviews.Author: dubfun
Reviews.Content: The Silk Road restaurant inside of the Vdara has been closed since my last stay there. I wondered why it was never open when I last visited; there was always a sign that said "Closed for meeting or conference or some such thing. The only place to get food at the Vdara is at the Market Cafe, which is like a deli/grocery store with a few chairs and tables. Therefore, there is no proper dine-in restaurant on the property. They said that demand was too light. You have to go to one of the restaurants in the City Center/shopping area or neighboring casinos. I will still highly recommend Vdara and will stay there again. But this is just a warning to those who would like a full service restaurant in their hotel. Of course, room service/in room dining is still offered. You will have to leave the property to find a sit down restaurant, but there are very good restaurants within the City Center complex and at neighboring Aria, Bellagio and Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet in a town that never sleeps”
Reviews.Author: 2busy18
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is 24/7. After being in the casinos and enjoying the shows it was nice to relax in a smoke free, non-gaming hotel. We had a cornor suite on a high floor. The view was spectacular. It is very easy to access the strip and all the other hotels. The Bellagio and Aria were steps away. The staff was helpful and friendly. The spa was also very relaxing and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised!”
Reviews.Author: avalon1025
Reviews.Content: My last two stays were at Aria and Palazzo, thought I would give Vdara a try, loved it. Loved that it was non gaming and non smoking. It as a quieter hotel with easy access to Aria and Bellagio. The rooms were very nice, I wouldn't hessitate to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel! Beautiful inside and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Brandonmarcus
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews and thought most were accurate except I had a great experience. I stayed on the 12th floor. There was no noise. The shades are electronic, so if you don't figure out how to use the wall control you probably don't realize that you can make the room completely dark. It's the 21st century in this hotel. I stayed in a one bedroom, so the hotel room was very spacious with a kitchen, and a clothes washing machine and dryer. There is an easy connetion to the bellagio and a tram to the crystal mall. It takes a couple minutes to walk to the center of the strip. I picked this place since it has no casino so it's safer and cleaner and less noisy. Aria is a minute away and so is the bellagio for gambling. The two best casino's I have been to in Las Vegas. The restaraunts in Aria, Bellagio and the crystal mall are amazing. Cheaper eats on the strip are convienent enough and go grocery shopping and fill the fridge to save money so you can gamble more!!!! Personally, I hope this place stays an unknown gem so that the prices don't go up, but it's actually the best place I have stayed my three times in Las Vegas ;)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Gazorninplat
Reviews.Content: The Vdara was awesome. We had a two year old with us and having the kitchenette and free crib was great. And of course being in a non-gaming and non-smoking hotel was perfect for the family in Las Vegas. I think they designed it to be chic and modern, but it turned out to be very family friendly. It's a short walk through the Bellagio to the strip, but we didn't mind being a bit isolated from the hustle and bustle. Otherwise, it is located very central relative to the strip. Rooms are beautifully modern and clean. The bathroom is definitely better than most, with a big soaker tub, although I'm surprised it only had a single sink given the space. Bed was very comfortable like in most boutique hotels. Nice to have the pool open all year, although I can imagine the pool would be way too small during the summertime. We tried Cafe Vettro and the buffet at the Aria and both were very good to excellent. The cafe in the lobby was also pretty good and reasonable. Staff were very friendly and eager to help in general. We got a great deal through Westjet Vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but no self-parking”
Reviews.Author: Nevada_Tom
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at Vdara during the first week in Jan 2012. It was a very nice, upscale, clean hotel, with great views, very nice room, and a nice pool. However, upon checking in we discovered to our surprise that the "free complimentary valet parking" was the only parking available in Vdara's parking garage. Self-parking was available at the nearby Aria Hotel's parking garage, but required either a burdensome trip on a shuttle or else a walk through the Aria's heavy smoke-filled casino area to get to Vdara. Had I known that there was no self parking available at Vdara, I would have stayed elsewhere, as I do not like valet parking. This ruined what could have been a very pleasant stay at the hotel. The in-room safe was also not very deep, which did not allow very good storage of valuables like laptop computers.

Reviews.Title: “Key Aspects Lacking”
Reviews.Author: via_the_bee
Reviews.Content: OVERALL Vdara is a beautiful, clean, non-gaming and non-smoking hotel, and the rooms (given their size and the hotel's central location) are a reasonably good value. However, the check-in experience, room amenities, and hotel facilities are all lacking. With so many options available on or near the Strip, I would not likely stay again nor would I recommend this hotel to others. - Check-in staff is inattentive - Room is beautiful and spacious but lacks some key amenities - Room service and housekeeping staff are prompt and courteous - No self-parking; pool facilities open late and close early; beautiful but open and expensive bar CHECK-IN I booked a City Corner Suite online for a special getaway with my girlfriend for her birthday. A few days before arriving, I called the hotel to request a room with a Lake/Strip view and also to request that kitchenware be delivered to the room. The phone attendant told me that she had made a note about both items, but that views are not guaranteed until check-in. We arrived around 10:30AM, before the 3:00PM check-in time. Indeed, the note about kitchenware was on file, but there was apparently no indication of my request for a view. I requested a view again in person; no Corner Lake View rooms were yet available, nor could a dirty room be assigned to us despite the fact that people were checking out that morning. We were told to come back closer to check-in time to select a room, but my we had planned to hike near Lake Mead in the afternoon, so we had no intention on cutting our trip short. I let our attendant know this, and he told us we could pre-register with our credit card and ID and return to the invited guest line and pick out a room later (to save time). He also told us that if a room with a view was cleaned before we got back that he would try to assign it to us. When we returned to City Center after our hike, we queued in the invited guest line. Although only one person was in front of us, the normal line emptied faster. In fact, I overheard one other couple receiving a Strip View Corner Suite in that line. Finally when it came to be our turn in the invited guest line, we were asked to produce ID and a credit card (almost as if we had not done this before) and told that there were no rooms with a Strip View available. Not only that, but the room that we were assigned smelled heavily of marijuana. We returned to the desk and requested to be moved; the staff were quite responsive and apologetic but again didn't listen to my needs. Rather than being moved or upgraded to a different room class with a view, we were assigned to an Executive Corner Suite on the 11th floor overlooking the Aria Tram, and my requests for kitchenware were not transferred to the new file. Moreover, despite the fact that I asked if there was a sofabed in the room, the attendant did not ask if I needed it made up, and later that night (when we were super tired), I found that there were no sheets on the sofabed nor anywhere in the room and had to call room service, delaying my sleep by at least a half hour. It seemed like at every opportunity, I was delayed and ignored by the actions of hotel staff. This is not what I would expect from a hotel reviewed so highly by others. ROOM (Executive Corner Suite - see photos) Despite the lack of a view, the room itself was very clean, spacious, and comfortable; we slept very well in both the bed and sofabed. There is a very nice TV in the bedroom and one in the living room, and there is also a connection center for iPods and other devices under the TV in the living area. The Internet was lightning fast but went out of service once during our stay. The electronically controlled shades and blackouts are great for blocking out the flashing city lights. The main bathroom is large and has two sinks and a separate shower and tub. The toiletries smell very nice, with floral and sandalwood notes. There is an extra half bath attached to the living space, which is handy if someone is sleeping on the couch. However, neither bathroom has towel racks for hand towels, so you have to leave those lying awkwardly on the counter. There is a Whole Foods south on the Strip at Town Square if you need to stock up on food and want to use the beautiful kitchen in your suite. There is a large fridge (which is refilled with water bottles daily as part of your resort fee), electric burners, and a dishwasher in the kitchen, and you can request as much kitchenware as you'd like (be sure to also request detergent if you need to do dishes). However, the Keurig coffee machine and/or the pods it uses makes very weak coffee, and there was no tea nor cocoa in the room, which is something I'd expect from a much more basic hotel. Also, if you want to wash your clothes before heading home, there's a washer and dryer in the closet near the door, and room service can bring you detergent and softener. SERVICE Room service and housekeeping were excellent and reasonably prompt about bringing us anything we needed. FACILITIES The is no self-parking at Vdara; if you don't want valet, park near the West Elevators in The Cosmopolitain, exit by foot via the hotel lobby onto Harmon, turn right, and take the outside stairs to get to Vdara. The hotel pool is open from 9AM to 4PM; for any business traveler or couple looking to squeeze in an early morning swim or late night visit to the hot tub, stay elsewhere. Also, pool hours are listed as "seasonal," so it's hard to know this information in advance. The hotel bar is integrated into the lobby; it's quite pretty but very open, and drinks are on the expensive side ($10-12 for a cocktail).

Reviews.Title: “Great off-strip location. No casino a plus!”
Reviews.Author: justm0
Reviews.Content: Was a relief to come here after all the crowded lobbies and casinos we had to walk through at other hotels. Nice, contemporary comfy rooms and bed! Pool is not huge, but off season was not overrun. Very pleasant bar and overall service.

Reviews.Title: “Consider it a boutique Condo-hotel, with very limited extras, poor reception staff, difficult way-finding from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: asianPrince-S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vdara as a part of our Grand Canyon trip, to fulfill my partner's one of the dream bucket lists. Then, we thought we would give LV a try. We are no gamblers, don't drink much, but we are interested in the whole artificial setting in a city scale, in the desert, and we are also interested in how the tourists sustain its existence, through ups and downs. The City Center was formerly the site of Boardwalk hotel and a Bellagio staff parking lot before the whole area is redeveloped in 2005, initiated by MGM with Dubai money. The development include Cosmopolitan. Aria, Vdara(Condo hotel) and Mandarin Oriental and its residence towers. The location is undoutedly the best. But, remember that, in Las Vegas, you just walk at least 20-30 min. just to get through a hotel on the strip without getting distracted. This is an ideal location for a casual tourist, like us, who doesn't spend time in Casinos and who just have 2-3 days to get around. Particularly, Aria appeared to be the better sister to Vdara, and has a nice modern casino and posh restaurants, tall ceilings in public levels, but better and more luxurious interior decoration didn't mean much, once we spotted prostitutes and female pimps arranged by the casino staff. _______________ (difficult to access from the strip) Strangely, both Aria and Vdara, sharing its arrival/valet area on the second level from the strip, the access is more easy with the car than walking pedestrians. The signs were hard to find or follow to get to Vdara from the street.
