And, the lobby and elevator hall, situated on the second level, was hard to get to, and it really takes 15 min to get back from the strip on foot. _______________ (No extra features) For Vdara, other than the hotel front desk, and the compulsory valet parking service policy, there is no real contact with the staff as they do not have any feature! Someone below mentioned, lacking Soul, and I totally agree with his perception. The canteen is the only food and drink source in the building. Operated as self-service but very slow, and they close early! In the morning, we feel forced to compromise a lot, in limited seating area, and the breakfast menu option was not great. Coffee and Snack kinds. But their pasty and coffee, smoothies are expensive, but very good. The gym, included in your extra service fee, was inside the spa and doesn't look inviting, also limited numbers of weight training sets. _______________ (extra charges) I already accepted the water bottles, gym, internet, Valet parking as the extra compulsory charge at a set price. But, the management probably knew the guests don't use much of these features. We still tip a lot to the valet parking guys each time, or they keep you in the lobby for a very long while. But, including the extra fee, it still is a good bargain compared to others with shabby rooms in a distant location. _______________ (issues with front desk) The front desk receptionists can be really nice or nasty, depending on who to talk to. We, initially ran into some really nasty Chinese staff who refused to confirm and hold our room when we called from Grand Canyon, to notify our midnight arrival in the same night. -but, the room was already paid through their website! And, other than the apologetic manager who sort out this matter, we had to give tips to other receptionists only to re-confirm the room type when we arrived for additional night check-in (facing higher floor, the Bellagio fountain facing at already set prices). Then the room was not ready still at 4pm as promised. Although tipped, she did nothing until I called the hotel at 4:15pm. After another hour and half, we were allocated to the slightly disappointing lower level location. There is a cocktail bar, in the lobby, but I have seen only one guy using it for one afternoon, otherwise, it was inactive. Another Lounge type room was closed, next to the foot bridge to The Bellagio. _______________ Closely located to the Strip is a plus, but, poor wayfinding from the ground level to return to the lobby was tough each night, and walking through the parking entrance of the Cosmopolitan, climbing on to the windy and isolated staircase next to the fire station are rather humiliating and very inconsiderate. For the rating, I would still give 4.5 out of 5, IF this was in NYC or Chicago in a boutique hotel category. But, I am giving 3.5-4, considering Other hotels' exceedingly high standard and Vdara's accomodation-only ANNEX approach to Aria, lacking the quality services. Vdara's poor reception experience and stiff-faced valet parking staff need big improvement. However, although I point out some flaws and disappointment, compared to Hilton, MGM signature, and dingy northern strip hotels, or even Planet Hollywood hotel rooms, this is far superior option for many travelers for its location and the great room fittings. You will still keep your dignity and find a tranquility for several hours each night after experiencing the double-faced Sin city with excess of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and sparkling.”
Reviews.Author: avenuealex
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Everything is brand new and sparkling. I enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Suit in a beautiful hotel at a low price”
Reviews.Author: Sagees
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara hotel from Jan 7th to the 11th, 2012. I cam to Vegas for the affiliate summit internet advertising show. I was looking forr a hotel that was close to the Caesar's Palace at a decent price. CES was starting up on the 11th so prices were up for the week i was interested in. The first two nice were very reasonableee at $190 a night for a corner suite. Then on Monday, the price went to $300 a night and they wanted $900 a night for the rest of the week. Tip, try to stay away from Vegas when CES rolls around. I really didnt have a choice since my show was adjacent. The Room was absolutely amazing. I was not expecting such a large suit. It had a full chicken with a dish washer and huge fridge. The bathroom was even bigger, with a large shower and beautiful bath tub right by the window with a full panoramic view of the mountains and strip. There was a comfortable living room with a nice 46'' LCD and and equaly large bed room with another 46'' LCD. The room feels like an apartment. The space is really well used. i was sad to leave the room. The design is simply beautiful and functional. Also, forgot to mention that there is a washer and dryer in one of the closets. The view is gorgeous. I got to see the strip as well as the surrounding mountains in the horizon. I used the gym just about every day. Its well equipt and has just about everything you need for a workout on the road. I ate at the bar downstairs the first night i came in. The pizza is not very good, dont get it. The crust was stale and the cheese tasted like it came out of a can. The bar tender was very nice. Also, watch out if you eat alone. a really scanky looking women sat next to me. I am sure she was a prostitute. I hear this happens a lot in vegas and that the hotel gets a cut. was surprised to see here in this type of hotel, as it does not have a casino and is more of a business hotel. In any case, it really uncomfortable when you have a prostitute sitting next to trying to solicit you. The hotel has a walkway to the belagio. Thus you can get from the Vdara to the Ceasers really easily walking through the belagio. This is a smoke free hotel which is a real treat for those of you who dont like the smell of cigarettes. The lobby actually smells like a spa, which is very soothing. I also ate at the Vdara market downstairs which was a great solution for a quicj breakfast or lunch. The southern sandwich was great and soups were amazing. Very fresh and the prices are decent relative to other places around. I stayed at the trump last year during the same dates. There is no comparison, this places trumps, the Trump ;). The service is better, the prices are lower, the location is more fun, and rooms are jusy beyond. I will be coming here on my next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Non smoking hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soccersam74
Reviews.Content: So nice to have the bussel of Vegas and then come back to a smoke free,clean and civilized hotel. The rooms are a good size and the beds are super comfy. If you are lazy and don't want to walk more than 100 meters don't stay here. We liked walking through Belagio or Aria to get to the strip. The cafe downstairs is a bit ordinary just use it for convenience items. Loved the in room wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern, quiet & smoke-free hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camnicsydney
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 1 night mid December and thought the hotel was excellent. Having stayed in Vegas before at the other end of the strip we really liked the location of Vdara being right next door to both Aria & Crystals. One of the main reasons we liked the hotel so much was because of its proximity to excellent restaurants in both Aria & Crystals. We loved that Vdara is smoke free and it doesnt really have a big proper lobby bar...which means its a little more low key but close to everywhere you might want to eat or party (ie cosmo). The one drawback that we didnt care for was the lack of cutlery in the apartment/hotel room. We got a salad from Aria one day and waited for over 30 mins to have some cutlery brought up to the room.....really?! Why have a full mini kitchen with a stove-top and full size fridge if I dont have any cutlery? A proactive solution to this might be to ask my on arrival if I would like cutlery etc for my stay.... The room was very spacious, clean and extremely modern. We wouldnt hesitate to stay here again. My couple of restaurant tips for you to consider are: -American Fish -Social house for exceptionally delicious japanese happy hour & out of this world coffee from Jona (the best barista in Vegas!) -Jaleo (much better than Julian Serrano-in our opinion) -Holsteins for a delicious burger -Scarpetta for delicious affordable fresh pasta Lastly...if you want to get to the other end of the strip to the Fashion Mall or to check out the gorgeous Wynn hotels you can jump on a Trump shuttle at the basement of Caesars Palace....but trust me the walk wont be quick & easy...no walk seems to be along the strip in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Spotty service but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: family5_10
Reviews.Content: The suites were impeccably clean, and the kitchenette at the entry gave us a lot of hard surfaces on which we could safely leave our luggage. Nicely designed, beautiful bathroom. The lobby was also very modern and pleasant, and it was a relief to come into a calm, smoke-free environment. In the morning, there was a long line (during the busy Christmas/New Year's week anyway) for breakfast at the little lobby coffee shop, where the food and coffee were fine. The weak spot was service. We had to wait forever to check in and when we needed to have the sofa bed made up, we waited over an hour and a half for housekeeping and finally had to go down to the front desk ourselves to get the bedding and made it up ourselves! That's for youth hostels, not would-be chic hotels that charge $200 night for suites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: ashleywyatt
Reviews.Content: We were attending the Money Show at Caesar's Palace but opted to stay at the Vdara. The corner suite was gorgeous with almost 1200 sq. feet of living space. You can walk to the Bellagio through a connecting walkway in moments or cross over to the Aria from the front of the Vdara Hotel entrance. I prefer the food at the Bellagio, especially LeCirque...magnificient with views of the musical dancing waterfall show every evening. The Vdara is a great hotel but needs restaurants to keep you going back.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars for beauty and elegance. Zero stars for soul and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: jasonmarsell
Reviews.Content: In town for CES, I stayed for three nights in a Panoramic Suite, which is a corner suite overlooking the pool. The hotel is beautiful, the room was all-class, and the beds were extremely comfortable - no complaints, there. My problem with the Vdara (and CityCenter as a whole) was likely due to my lack of comfort with properties that cater to the wealthy - a general lack of soul and comfort. The hotel has no doormen and employees (aside from security) were few and far between. The lobby felt like a museum - cold and quiet. The casino (which is actually in the Aria) was high-dollar, as was the clientele. Although nicely dressed, we weren't wearing a jacket and slacks and felt completely out of place - on a Wednesday evening. Casino staff were as snooty as their customers, and that's steered us right out the door and down to Bellagio. CityCenter's mall is named Crystals, which sounds more like a strip club in downtown Atlanta than a high-end luxury mall. This place isn't for you if you don't own (or know someone that owns) a Bentley. The main stores are Bulgari, Cartier, Fendi, Gucci, Tom Ford, Versaci. Again, beautiful, but just not for me. All-in-all, if you're a high-roller, City Center is definitely for you. If you fall more in the mid-range "not cheap, but not wealthy" travel class, stick to the Bellagio, the Wynn or the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Silverfox21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Vdara hotel Las Vegas for my 60th birthday. The hotel was lovely and clean and the bed was just something else, I have never slept in a more comfortable bed, superb. Great location, overlooking the main strip from a distance. The Vdara is smack in the middle of the main strip if not actually on it. It takes five minutes to walk from the hotel to the main strip. The room was big and airy, no smoking, so no smells. All staff were very helpful and if we went back to Las Vegas, the Vdara is where we would stay. We had breakfast in the hotel which was lovely and also in the Bellagio which was equally as nice. Plenty of hotels close by, so plenty of choice for eating out. Bus stops close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fashionable and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Ferhilt
Reviews.Content: Twin to the Aria, the Vdara Hotel & Spa is the more relaxed, grown-up version of the pair. If you want to have easy access to the new "city center" of the Vegas Strip while having the luxury to go back to at the end of the night then this is your place. The Vdara is definitely tucked away behind several other resorts closer to the actual strip, but I thought that was a good thing. It was a bit of a walk anywhere you wanted to go except across the roundabout to the Aria. Even that wasn't too bad. The Aria grants you access to the casinos, shows, conference center and shops all the way down onto the strip itself. Our only issue with the room was the door to the hall where the air flow/air pressure caused it to whistle constantly. We had to put a towel across the bottom of the front door to make it stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy P
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. I was very impressed by the modern décor of the room. The bed was very comfortable, and it had one of the best pillows I have ever had. It was a long pillow which I have been trying to find so I can buy, but I cannot seem to find it anywhere. We had a pretty nice view and great service. Overall, I was very happy we stayed at this hotel. The hotel was very spacious and had a nice kitchen and very large bathroom. I would stay here again and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Vdara!! We WILL be back!!”
Reviews.Author: BrenJay
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas quite a few times and this time decided to try something different. We stayed at the Vdara for 4 nights! WOW. So glad we did. It is well worth the extra $$ to upgrade to a corner suite.The room was perfect. Lots of space, kitchen area, sitting area, and large bathroon with a vanity counter...for me and all my cosmetics, hair stuff etc. :) Loved the double sinks. The view of the strip , Bellagio and out lining areas was terrific. The beds are one of the most comfirtable we have EVER slept in anywhere. Loved all the little etra, robes, slippers and the in room safe. Staff are equally exceptional. We used the concierge desk a few times both for tickets and restauarant recommendations. We were well looked after. In addition the staff at the Verdara loung were very friendly, and the service was excellent. Appreciated being in a hotel where there was no smoke!!! We hated to leave!! until next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Bright light city!”
Reviews.Author: Travellers396
Reviews.Content: We had a fun time in Las Vegas. 5 nights and 6 days was certainly enough for us. The staff are very helpful and willing to issist in every need. We reserved a panoramic room on the high floors but when we arrived they only had one room on the 6th floor so we upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which was on the 55th floor and with a view of the paris and the bellagio fountains. We had to use the sofa bed which wasn't at all comfortable in fact it was awful and we discovered the next day that there is supposed to be a matress cover put on when the bed was made up however the maid didn't put it on. We did have to call the house keeping a view times and we found it did take a while to have things sent up. The advantage of the hotel is it have no casino which it good if you have children, it is very new so everything is clean and not worn and all the rooms are no smoking which was a great bonus for us. We would stay here again if we were ever in VEGAS!

Reviews.Title: “hotel good - charges outrageous”
Reviews.Author: Jonathon D
Reviews.Content: Vdara was a pleasant, comfortable clean hotel. However, we were charged us for items not used. Even at check out, the hotel tried to charge us multiple times for several items on the same day from the mini-bar. We told them the items that were used, but later still received charges for items even though never used them. For this reason, I strongly would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to expectation”
Reviews.Author: redsunset
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in early January in a corner suite at Vdara. I chose this hotel because I wanted a smoke-free, casino-free environment, yet one close enough to the action when desired. Vdara delivered. (Put another way, the yahoo quotient was low.) i had a great suite overlooking the Strip and the famous fountain at Bellagio. The suite was so well maintained it looked as though it hadn't been used. A short walk across the plaza takes you to Aria with its huge casino and very good restaurants (Jean Georges and Sirio delivered also). Another short walk down a corridor takes you to Bellagio. This will probably be my hotel of choice when I visit Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris75
Reviews.Content: Vdara hotel has a city center location in front of Aria hotel. It's a non-gaming hotel, probably much more quiet than most of the hotels on the Strip. My suite room was absolutely fantastic, very pleasant with a kitchenette, a living room, a large bathroom and the room itself has a very comfy bed and top quality linens, with a city center view (not the most interesting view in Vegas). For breakfast Market Café offers a decent choice. Bar Vdara is nice and not bad for a quick meal, but it was a little bit quiet most of the time. The only drawback was the necessity to go outside in the evening for some action (restaurants, bars, casino). Aria Hotel is close and offers plenty of choice but when it's really cold in the evening (less than 40°F during my stay ), it doesn't communicate directly. Overall it's really a good hotel with great rooms, but Vdara is on the quiet side.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: Haven07
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. A breath of fresh air in Las Vegas. Our room was great, fab view over the strip and loads of space for all the shopping. No casino was a bonas and the smoke free policy an added bonas. cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious but a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: laliz5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Vdara for one night on a business trip. I loved the atmosphere at the hotel. My room was towards the top of the hotel, facing the Bellagio. It was really nice to be able to watch the Bellagio fountain show from my room! Great view. The room didn't disappoint, it was pretty big and everything was comfortable. It took me a minute to realize the blinds are remote controlled; the control is in the "hallway" which isn't that close to the windows where you'd think to look for it. The bed was very comfortable, I slept well. I have no complaints about the room. I loved the Market Cafe downstairs. I needed to grab a quick breakfast on my way out before work but there was a long line. I guess that's what happens when it's the only place to eat in the immediate area. The food I got there was actually pretty good! Not that cheap but what do you expect in Vegas. The walkway to the Bellagio is convenient. The walk to the Strip on the other hand was farther than I thought it would be. There are some stairs going down to the street intersection with Las Vegas Blvd, which I took as it looked to be the most direct route to where I wanted to go. It was kind of a strange street though, a little dark and nothing was there, just the driveway to the Cosmopolitan parking garage. As a woman alone in my 20s I was surprised to find myself on guard walking on that street at night, you'd think Vegas there are always people around but not there. The only other complaint I have is the front desk - there was ALWAYS a line!! Overall, the hotel was great. It is a little pricey after they add that annoying resort fee (just tell me the price up front!! ugh!), but if you want luxury and are ready to pay for it I wouldn't hesitate to stay at Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the comfort?”
Reviews.Author: SDWanderlust
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Not on the strip per se, but not far from it. You can walk to the Bellagio and then onto the strip. Also, there seems to be a monorail station close-by. Did not use the monorail and therefore cannot comment on it. Common Areas: There are some sitting areas close by the elevator, but no formal lobby. The pool appeared very nice and large, as we looked down at it from our suite. Did not really use it due to the cold weather. Gym is well equipped, but small for that size of hotel. There must be hundreds of rooms but the gym is quite small. In the morning, all the machines would be occupied and therefore there was a claustrophobic feel. Room: We had a corner suite. It is well laid out and functional, but very short on comfort and quality. It is around 800 square feet (?) and comes fully equipped with a fridge, washer, dryer, utensils etc. Great for a family or those who need space and want to do some light cooking. Comfort and quality left something to be desired. The sheets felt cheap and the duvet is synthetic. For a four diamonds classified hotel? Hm? The sofa bed in the living room is a torture to sleep on. You can literally feel each individual spring. We ended up sleeping on the floor instead. I would not count that space as a functional bed. There are two large flat screen TVs; one is in the living room and one in the bedroom. There are iPod and laptop hookups where you can listen to music and watch DVD, respectively. Bathroom is nice and large. Very functional and well laid out. There is only one bathroom, unlike the Four Seasons where there are two bathrooms for a similar suite. Can be a real hassle for four adults. Services: The checking in was quick and friendly. The concierge put in great efforts but was not able to secure a dinner reservation at one of the nicer restaurants. Gym attendant was friendly and helpful. She explained about the gym, where to find water, handed me a towel. There is no self parking. It is a real hassle. Bellboys were very helpful both on arrival and departure. Recommendation: It falls short of my expectations especially on comfort. The sofa bed is a real disappointment. I don’t recommend this place if comfort is a high priority.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but...”
Reviews.Author: yogagirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Jan 4 - 7, 2011. The location of the hotel was excellent. There is a walkway that connects you to the Bellagio (about a 3 min walk) and Aria is just across the hotel as you exit. It was also nice to be able to get to our room fast since you did not have to walk the entire casino floor (this is a non-gaming hotel) to get to the elevators. The bed was extremely comfortable... you may not want to get out of it. The bathroom had a sunken tub (which we unfortunately did not use). I did wish the shower had more pressure but I guess the "green-ness" of the hotel contributed to this. The room also had a kitchenette that we did not use, but was handy in keeping our water cold. There is an electronic control for the shade and blackout (?). The cafe below had a really good selection for breakfast or snacks. We used the gym every morning and their equipment were state of the art. My only complaint was that when we got inside our room, there was a half-empty bottle of hair gel in the drawer, along with the hair dryer. Its really minor but I wish it was not there since it made it seem like they did not do a thorough job of cleaning the room. In spite of that, I would stay here again on our next strip.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke free for me!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly C
Reviews.Content: Besides being smoke-free (which is a breath of fresh air) the rooms are spacious and nice. The hotel offer amenities such as free WiFi and water bottles. Service is mixed depending upon the person. Pool is great but extremely busy during weekends so it can get loud and or rowdy. I enjoyed the cabana rental tremendously. I also found it weird that they charge your credit card every day. Nonetheless, I am a big fan. Try to avoid check in times as the line is unruly...

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Room but not much else...”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: If you want off the strip, then this is your place. A long walk from the Hotel to the strip and mostly outside at that. There's no real food on site and no restaurant in the hotel. The check-in process was horrible with check-in and out's in the same line (if you could call it that). More like a mass of guests in one area waiting for the next clerk. Got to the clerk only to find out the room wasn't ready and would have to stand in line yet again after we returned. The room was very modern and super clean, it should be since it was new property. The Pool was nice but very small. We rented a cabana and not much came with that except the cabana. The pool area staff was very accommodating and super helpful but very understaffed. Seemed like one person for the entire pool area. Could have been the time of year that they were understaffed? If you want the quiet of off the strip it an OK property but even if you're a business traveler it would be nice to have a dining spot on site .

Reviews.Title: “NYE 2011-12”
Reviews.Author: mccullor739
Reviews.Content: We booked Vdara kind of last minute (early December) for NYE. I was able to use my MLife card and get a little discount on the rate but still $$$. We arrived at 4pm and had a deluxe fountain view room reserved. On arrival I was told our room would not be ready for 2 more hours. After about 15 minutes of the desk clerk trying to check on different rooms, we were given a $50 credit to have a meal and our room was ready. We had a great view of the Bellagio fountains to Rio. The room was modern and included a mini kitchen. There was a sliding door that separated the bed area and the restroom. The door would not close completely, a little annoying. The safe was left open but locked by the previous guest. I waited for a little over 2 hours for someone to reset the safe *It was NYE around 7pm. Once the tech arrived it only took 30 seconds to reset the safe. Advantages: Non smoking property, however everyone smokes right outside the front of the hotel. Disadvantages: very limited on food, you basically need to visit Aria for gaming or something to eat unless you just want a simple meal (sandwich). There was a small lounge bar. I believe there was a restaurant on property, but it was not open when we checked. We stayed here for the 31st and Jan 1st, then moved to Palazzo (favorite). We checked out at noon and wanted to buy some gifts at Aria before going to Palazzo. We had to wait outside in line for 20 minutes to check our luggage to be held for an hour while we shopped. all in all, I would be curious about a room at Aria. I'm not real sure I'd stay at Vdara again unless it was at a really good rate. We like to play the games and walking to Aria to play was a little more inconvenient then we liked. On a plus, the casino and Aria in general was excellent. Vdara is really just a hotel in Vegas close to Aria. Without Aria next door, I doubt they would get $99 a night.

Reviews.Title: “decent non-gaming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosscopcotrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Vdara for one night on business in December 2011. Vdara is a non-casino hotel situated in City Center just across from 'the back' of Aria. I stayed in a Vdara Suite on the 45th floor which was around 900 sq ft and had a good, reasonably longish distance view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip. The suite was clean with a kitchen and dining area, a lounge area, bedroom, large bathroom and separate toilet. It had more than enough room for me. The bed was a King size and was comfortable. One aspect to the suite which was slightly disconcerting was that it was in the join of the inside corner of the building which meant that I could see in to another hotel room and I assume they could see into mine too. It was possible for both rooms to close the blinds but if this was done then the great view of the fountains and the strip was no longer available - so it was either a sacrifice of privacy or a sacrifice of the great view. I tended to switch between the two. As I was only there for one night this did not bother me too much but if my stay had been longer I would have asked to move to a different room. Room service was delivered on time and the food (Ramen Noodles) was of good quality. The pool area looked decent and relaxed but I did not use it myself. There is a bar and a cafe in the hotel lobby which I also didn't use. If you want casino action you can walk to Aria in a few minutes and there is also a walkway through to Bellagio. Due to the lack of casino the hotel is quiet and I'd recommend it to non gamblers who want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip when required but still be close enough to walk across to the strip, Aria or Bellagio and get involved.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: affableajacian
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from the 27th of December to the 3rd of January. A fresh change from the neverending human traffic that plagues the main floor of most hotels. Found the valet service to be one of the quickest I have seen of any of the hotels around the strip. Valets are very helpful for directions if needed. Had a wonderful 7th floor room with all the bells and whistles. Our room came with a Keurig and two k -cups d day which was very much appreciated. Found the beds to be very very comfortable and the floor provided the quiet needed after a long day. For people looking to have a quiet relaxing stay, this is the hotel for you. With Aria, Cosmopolitan and the link to Bellagio being directly connected to Vdara via the walkway, gaming is never far away. Will definately stay here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “A nice & fresh hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitty-hello
Reviews.Content: A hotel that doesn't have 2nd hand smoke smell & casino, I like it. The room that I stayed at has a nice view- day & night which you don't get that elsewhere often. Room is comfy (but not the sofa bed! if you plan to share the room with others), clean, trendy, has a kitchen+table, where you can sit & relax, coffee, reading magazine, surf computer.... I will go back again for sure, however, due to the busy X'mas holiday (probably), customers service is below average, they do not greet you and didn't make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: ktdelosreyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort over the 2011 New Years weekend and was very happy with the service we recieved, from the time we checked in to the time we checked out, everyone was very helpful. Our room had some very cool features, from the electronic do not disturb button on at the door to the automatic room darkening blinds, the bathroom was spacious with a huge soaker tub which I enjoyed after our 1st night of walking the strip. The only complaint I had was when I reviewed the Vdara on this site, I viewed the pictures of the room and found the only 1 bedroom photo showing a bedroom, livingroom and kitchen. When we arrived to our room, I was disappointed to find that the livingroom was in our bedroom, and since there were 4 of us sharing the room we made the best of it, but it wasnt what I was expecting...I guess I should have went to ask for a new room, but becasue it was New Years weekend, I figured they would be sold out. I was also disappointed by the lack of kitchen furnishing, there was no coffee maker and when I called for one, I was told that they were out. Other than those few issues, I do have to say that this resort was beautifully decorated, the beds were very comfortable and the staff were great, expecially the Valet boys, they were quick to bring our car and very helpful, offering directions if needed...I would return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: CardKirb08
Reviews.Content: If you want an incredibly clean, modern, and quiet (by Vegas standards) hotel in the middle of the strip, go to the Vdara. Rooms: Even the most basic room is a spacious suite. Most other suites of its size and quality on the strip are easily 30-40% more expensive. Food & Shopping: A surprisingly decent cafe & convenience store in the main lobby, but the Aria is only a 2 min walk away (literally, 2 min) with all of the dining variety you want and expect from a Vegas resort. It's also owned by the same company (MGM) so you can charge everything to your room. In addition, all the CityCenter shops & restaurants are less than five min away. Casino: None in the Vdara, but the Aria is steps away (notice a theme here?). Also quite close to the (frankly obnoxious) Cosmopolitan, even closer to the Bellagio. Pool: Pretty much the only problem with this hotel. While clean and well-maintained, the pool is boring, uninspired, and has a parking lot view. It gets the job done, but pales in comparison to the pools at every other true resort I have stayed at on the strip. Service: Excellent and friendly. The whole place feels like a well-kept secret that the staff is proud to call home. If pool time is important to you, don't stay here. If you want the lobby of your own hotel to be hopping and a "scene", don't stay here. Otherwise, it's a steal and wonderful place to call home in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Quiet Oasis, but close enough to enjoy the action!”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying that Vdara is a great hotel. I had excellent service during my stay, the room accommodations were great, and the dining/meeting facilities were top-notch. I stayed in Vdara during a business retreat over a long weekend. The facilities were well equiped to handle a large group meeting and the staff that set up our business lunches/dinners were very professional. Vdara itself DOES NOT have a casino, however you are connected to the Bellagio and the Aria, so gambling is just a short walk away. The rooms are very modern, spacious, and have all the nicest amenities. The pool was very relaxing and not too crowded. Last, the concierge was very helpful both in recommending and organizing shows during my stay. Overall, Vdara is a great hotel that places you in the heart of the strip, with access to all Las Vegas has to offer, without the crowded and overwhelming feel of many of the other hotel/casions.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room”
Reviews.Author: archiescat
Reviews.Content: We found the room absolutely amazing! Two widescreen TVs either side of a bedroom/living room arrangement, remote curtains and lovely bathroom. The view was breathtaking. One of the advantages here is being able to use facilities on the same block as Bellagio and being able to charge to your room at Vdara. It links in by walkway to the Bellagio where the quality of bars and restaurants and cafes is amazing. We would certainly stay at Vdara again; it is modern and minimalist and therefore avoids the rather trashy fake look presented by some hotels in Vegas. I think you could say Vdara was genuine. Great Concierge service here also. Highly recommended. There was one tiny disappointment in our room never being made up; I am not sure why but when we mentioned this the resort fee was refunded to us. Maybe it did not show on their computer or something. This would not deter us from returning though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SDLCrownline
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, friendly staff, conveniently located. I highly recommend Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lulussister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara hotel between Christmas and new years 2011 and had a very nice experience. It is a lovely hotel with no gambling....but, no smoky casino to have to walk through to get to your room! The room was spacious with all amenities one could ask for, electric shades/blackouts, electronic "do not disturb" button, and a beautiful bathroom. It was reasonably priced and the location in City Center is just perfect. It is attached to the Aria and Monte Carlo hotels by tram and Bellaggio by walking inside a hallway. It does have a $20 resort fee per day for internet and other resorty stuff (whatever that is) but what hotel doesn't have a resort fee anymore? My only complaint is that the only place to get coffee/breakfast is in their "marketplace" which has a line so long it is undaunting in the morning. This place should be quadrupled in size and personnel to accomodate all 1,500 rooms in the hotel Better to get on the tram and go to the Monte Carlo for Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara nickel and dime you”
Reviews.Author: Holidayatvdara
Reviews.Content: I have the same or similar comment about the Vdara hotel. We stayed there from 12.28.11 through 1.1.12 and everyday there was something. We only had two small wash clothes and when we showered there was none. I asked for two additional towels and they brought them. On day number 2 and 3 they cleaned; they gave us the two again. Everything was a cost. The Internet site say no extra cost for Internet but we were charged $20.00 per day extra for that and other hotel extras we didn't even use. We couldn't get a coffee maker either. They say it wasn't available in our suite. The photos shows a nice colored comforter and body pillow. Only the body pillow was there. When we asked they say they didn't provide those anymore and they took the body pillow when they cleaned the next day. They didn't have trash bags in the trash cans which I thought was unsanitary. Our dining room light (one) was out and we asked someone to fix. No one came that night. We had to call back again to ask. I asked for a manager and the lady who answered said the manager is unavailable then i called back again and she said she was the manager. I told her i just called a few minutes ago and she said it wasn't her that i had spoken to; but it was. She lied because i knew she wasn't wanting to take the call initially. There seems to be some management issues there. No kitchen utensels were in the unit. Not even silver wares. We had to ask. No robes or slippers; only available upon request. We saw the card on the closet shelf; upon our packing up. No freezer access unless you purchased the drink bar option. The green technology used was nice. Closet lights turned on when opened. They had electronic do not disturb lighted push buttons. Everyone looked under 35. No real management from what I saw. I think the better management is at their other hotel. It was a mess. I'd spend more money somewhere else if I knew they'd nickel and dime me.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, comfortable, quiet, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: txnewlyweds411
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying in a non-gaming hotel. Plus, the Vdara is just a quick walk away from the Aria, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, and City Center. It had a fun little bar and good market for guests. Beds were comfy, and even though our room was right by the elevator, our room was very quiet - even on New Years Eve. At night, we had a gorgeous view of Paris. The gym is smaller than other properties, but definitely had enough equipment to burn off a drink or two. We would definitely go back. Prices are also more affordable than other properties and the rooms are just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Easter Long Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: HeidiPG
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I took our first ever trip as a couple since having the boy (now 18). We have traveled extensively with him, and enjoyed it all, but wanted a little getaway on our own finally. He is a teacher, so we are limited to official holidays, that coincide with my retail work schedule. This means we often travel on expensive time slots unfortunately, but that is just how it is. Yeah to traveling without the kid too! We purchased a package from Air Canada Vacations to get an almost direct flight to and from Vegas with a nice, non-smoking hotel. We had a very nice mini suite on the 34th floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains. I get the feeling this building was intended to be a condo rental place, but with the market problems has been reverted to a more traditional hotel structure. That is ok, the rooms are comfy and well appointed. Ultra modern decor and appointments, luxury bathroom, mini kitchen and wonderfully open windows. We spent a lot of time outside rambling around the city, but got down to the pool area for a plunge, which was delightful, and I took in a mani/pedi at the spa services as a treat while he went comic book shopping (his hobby, not mine). This place did not have a major dining restaurant open, however, they did have a cafe/convenience store open on the main level, with satisfactory though expensive food options to eat at tables, or take to your room. Food is expensive almost everywhere on the strip, if you don't want fast food crap. The hotel is well connected to other facilities by walkways and a tram to the Monte Carlo complex. I was so happy to have a totally non-smoking building to stay in. When we wandered around hotels with casinos, the smoke levels were horrifying and I am so glad we were able to choose a place without that atmosphere. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a Trip”
Reviews.Author: GJGPrescott
Reviews.Content: if you must, stay on the North or Northeast side of the building as the South (pool) side is concave and amplifies the sun, even in winter. Our room was 82 degrees when we checked in (even though it was December - thermastat was in the off position at check in - quite a welcome). Positives: no casino, non-smoking, full kitchen in some units, comfortable beds. Negatives: Stayed in a Vdara Suite. Dirty at check in (beds were made and room was vaccumed but there were used shampoo bottles in one of the two bathrooms, dirty window sills, dirty dishes in the dishwasher, food in the freezer, etc.). We were moved to a different suite on the North side (a positive) but they messed that up too by making me call three times for new keys and a bellman. Stayed three nights, called for our car in valet 5 or 6 times - every time a recording ("we're sorry, due to the volume of calls we are unable to process your request") - note we stayed Monday through Thursday. Primary phone broken in new suite. Called for bell service at check out (from the secondary phone) - on hold for ten minutes plus. Gave up and hauled it down myself. $20 resort fee for the gym, internet, newspaper, etc. (paper is not delivered to your room - you go get it yourself in the lobby). For this price, you deserve better service. Stay somewhere else. We loved Encore last time we were in town.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in the centre of the strip but removed from the craziness!”
Reviews.Author: slp1978
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a 4 night stay at the Vdara hotel and spa. It exceeded our expectations! The location was excellent with access to the Bellagio, the Aria, and the Cosmopolitan hotels. A big bonus is that it's a smoke free facility which is pretty much non-existent in Vegas. Because there is no casino and there aren't any restaurants, it is not as busy as the other hotels so you feel like you're coming home at the end of a busy day. The kitchenettes are also a major bonus! Overall we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more for a real 5 star resort.”
Reviews.Author: nnaattaalliiee
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel with a free buffet promotion, which was really a $40 dollar buffet credit for breakfast and lunch only. That was a let down at check in. The front desk staffer told me that Aria was the best bet for a good experience. Unfortunately, the brunch buffet was $30 per person, so the free buffet really cost $30 after tax and tip. Not so cool. The toiletries provided felt cheap. No bathrobes, no slippers. Nice tub, no fun bath products like bubble bath or bath salts. Two of the lamps in the room were broken. The TV dimmed and brightened by itself constantly. The water pressure in the shower was disappointing. The grout in the shower pan was stained. The overall light levels were so low that i could barely do my make up and see myself in the full length mirror. They have a kitchenette and there's a note that says that kitchen supplies are available on request. I called for a coffee machine and they don't provide that one freaking supply. Really? So then I had to go downstairs to the cafe for coffee in the morning. I had to wait in line for 20 minutes for an EMPTY cup for self serve coffee that cost $5! No line for just coffee. I wasn't feeling well one night so we ordered room service. The menu in the room wasn't the correct menu and the right one wasn't available. The operator told me they had chicken noodle soup. I ordered it (sounded great because I wasn't feeling well) They brought up a thai style chicken coconut soup which happened to be disgusting and not what I ordered. They apologized after i called to complain and replaced it with beef stock with like 3 noodles in it. It was even more disgusting than the first soup. We also found another guests dirty socks in the room. Pros- short walk to three great casinos. Thats it. If you are looking for a 5 star Vegas resort experience, go somewhere else. If you like staying in what feels like a glorified time share in a good location, Vdara might be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Experience”
Reviews.Author: picklelodeon00
Reviews.Content: Excellence from start to finish!! Great place to stay with kids. Located in the middle of the strip near shopping and restaurants. Calls promptly answered and needs promptly met by staff. Can't say enough positive about them! Great place, would definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful quality - great price”
Reviews.Author: Rod L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 story, 2 bedroom penthouse, for a really low price. Room was super. I've stayed in regular rooms before. They were also very nice. Clean, modern, great TV's, quiet, no smoke, no casino. Perfect for a family. It's connected to the Bellagio and a 2 minute walk from Aria - plenty of eating options.

Reviews.Title: “European style Vegas...quiet and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: cghlucky13
Reviews.Content: I am not a huge fan of the chaos of Vegas, so I love staying at the vdara when in town. No casinos, nO smoking, very friendly staff, very clean, sleek and contemporary rooms. The sister hotel, aria is right across the drive and has excellent food and gambling. I won't stay at any other hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Angela M
Reviews.Content: We (mum,dad, and two "young adult" children) have just returned from a Christmas trip to Las Vegas. Our 4 night stay at the Vdara in a 2 bedroom penthouse suite was excellent. The accommodation was just as described. We had a 54th floor corner suite and the view over the city and mountains was incredible. We could watch the fountains at the Bellagio from one side of the apartment. The beds were so comfortable and the bathrooms luxurious. Perhaps the showers could have been a little more powerful. Having the kitchen area was a bonus - cutlery and crockery arrived quickly once requested. We didn't eat in particularly but it was great to have the option, and our champagne breakfast on Christmas morning (fizz from the local store and smoked salmon bagels from the cafe downstairs), was a delight - made more fun by the watching the exploits of the pilot spelling "NOEL" with his plane vapour. The hotel is so close to the action but was like an area of of calm and tranquility away from the buzz of the casino's and the Strip. A few minutes walk took us to the Aria - the buffet on Christmas Day was well worth the queue (about 50 mins). The food was plentiful and delicious. The covered walkway to the Bellagio took us quickly to a completely different environment, packed with people and a pretty Christmas display of polarbears, penguins etc, as well as the lively casino. We would definately return to the Vdara as it met all our needs. The staff were welcoming and helpful. The housekeeping staff were keen to make sure we had everything we needed. The apartment was not cheap but we felt it was worth every dollar and, if in Vegas again, we would certainly return to the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gizmochee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiet and walking distance to Aria and Bellagio which I liked and close enough to Planet Hollywood. I stayed on Xmas night with my husband at Vdara deluxe room. We got the view of the Bellagio lake and their swimming pool. Our room looks like a studio room with king size bed, comfortable sofa against the window, bathroom, and mini kitchen. I didn't have any complaints. One night is enough to enjoy the hotel. I didn't use their market/cafe in the lobby instead went elsewhere for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: schneid21
Reviews.Content: New, top of the line property on the strip in Las Vegas, without the noise and commotion associated with a casino on premises. Room was very well appointed. We stayed in a corner room, with amazing views on three sides. Full kitchen and dining area as well, though we didn't use it. A quick walk to the Aria Hotel next door and you have restaurants and casino. Free wireless internet. If you're not attracted to the usual Vegas craziness, I highly recommend the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Neuroactive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara for 2 nights in a standard room/suite and loved our stay. We love the fact that it is a non-gaming and non-smoking hotel at the strip. The hotel is connected to Bellagio and across the street from the Aria as well as a short quick walk to the Cosmopolitan. After getting into our hotel room we noticed a hair in our bathtub and I immediately called the front desk and asked if we could switch rooms and maybe get a better view of the Bellagio fountains. The gentleman was able to switch rooms for us and give us a free upgrade to a premium view room for no charge, very nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: add200
Reviews.Content: I have been to vegas 5 times from the uk and this hotel was by far the best i have stayed in. the rooms are top quality with a kitchen area (have to request utensils but how much cooking are you really going to do) and 2 hd tvs with lots of channels. Also a large bathroom with great shower, the bed was superb and we had a view of the belagio fountains too. There is not much going on at vdara but thats perfect as you can escape the madness and still be a short walk from aria or belagio which have plenty! If you are going to vegas and have chance to stay here do it, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Kitty123_11
Reviews.Content: For someone who isn't in Vegas just to play at the casinos this is an good choise since it's more quiet and calm. Quite resonable prices, very nice and modern rooms. We got upgraded to a King Executive Suit, which made our stay in Las Vegas perfect. Even though Vdara isn't at the Strip, it's still close enough, about 5 minutes walk. The gym was the best hotel gym I've been to.

Reviews.Title: “A Refreshing Change”
Reviews.Author: KBro65
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the switch from the standard Vegas-style casino hotel. Less of that cheesy over-the-top schtick and fake "class" that still prevails in other popular strip hotels. About 3 hours after landing, we found ourselves gettin busy in the Gold Lounge over at the Aria hotel. Easy-going crowd on a Saturday night .... just relax and make fiends ..... everyone seemed willing to share 2for1 and free drink coupons that were circulating around the room, actually spent our night there, passing on the long VIP line-up downstairs at Haze nightclub (my wife and i are both 46). Easy stroll back to Vdara hotel when we were ready to pack it in (2 minute walk). Completely smoke-free at Vdara was a bonus, but I personally didn't care for the fragrant scents they were pumping into the lobby and halls. Our hallway smelled "off" for some strange reason, couldn't pinpoint it....but maybe that's just personal taste. Careful with the room safe, the ledge is recessed, so dig deep before leaving to make sure you don't leave anything small inside (left my iPod behind). All-in-all, I would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice balance”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Obturator
Reviews.Content: Pros: Peaceful environment (No casino) Smoke free environment Close walking distance to Bellagio, City Center, and Aria Reasonably priced New modern rooms Free wifi Nice intimate (small) spa Small kitchenette Comfortable beds Cons: No casino $20 resort fee per day for free use of a tiny gym Eating options in hotel are lacking We came to Vegas on a whim and booked a room here for a couple of nights because of the great room rates. If you're of the mindset that you don't really care where you stay because you'll be out most of the time, but you at least want a decent place to stay that is still relatively nice then this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly close to the strip - foldout sofa”
Reviews.Author: WhirlwindTravel
Reviews.Content: Some people complained about the location - that it's too far from the strip. Not so - there's a direct access through a walkway through Bellagio. 5 mins and you're at the Bellagio fountains. We had the corner suite. It had a fold out bed in the living room - perfect for a family or 2 couples. Full size kitchen with an oven and microwave and even a full size washer and dryer. Other than that, it's quite luxurious; on par with the other new hotels in veg

Reviews.Title: “Vdara! I'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: HirschAustralia
Reviews.Content: Worth paying the extra money for a Bellagio lake view. Great for entertaining friends before heading out to the strip. Room is large with open plan kitchen, lounge, bedroom & bathroom. Deep bath for soaking was a fantastic way to unwind at the end of the day. Electeric shutters, one for shade and the other a blackout shade worked great for long sleepins. 2 large flatscreen TV's, which you are able to check out from you room made life very easy. King bed- very comfortable. This is a new-ish hotel in Vegas, all suites. Set in city centre, which is very central to the strip, easy to walk to the strip through the Bellagio, which was even safe solo at 3AM. Modern hotel is both non-gaming and non-smoking. Nice, clean atmosphere. Friendly staff, gave a great introduction to the room and media centre; prompt room service. Unique room keys that don't demagnatise, swipe in front of door. Do not disturbe switch. Several of my friends have stayed since- we all love it. I'll be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Dave A
Reviews.Content: The Vdara was a very nice hotel, but we were a little disappointed. The room, which was advertised as a suite, was smaller than expected. It was basically a regular room with a nice little kitchen. There was no separate living area as we expected from seeing in the photos. Since the hotel seemed fairly empty this time of year (we never waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator, and we never saw anyone else on our floor), so you would think they could have upgraded us to one of the larger rooms as advertised in the photos. The hotel was very quiet, as there is no casino, and very limited food choices. Also, it is a bit difficult to get to the strip from Vdara. The choices are: through the Bellagio (via an outdoor bridge); via Aria; or via the Cosmopolitan. Overall, it was a nice, clean modern hotel, but we were just expecting more, so I guess that is why we were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea S
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel! My husband and I stayed with another couple during our visit, and we both had great experiences at the hotel. To start the hotel itself is beautiful, I loved the modern but elegant lobby and the very helpful front desk staff. I thought the two best things about the hotel were the smoke free and game free property. Another huge perk is that the hotel is connected to the Bellagio via a walkway which was very quick, easy and convenient. The room was very comfortable and large, we had an amazing bathroom with a great soaking tub that was so nice to come back to after visiting the grand canyon! I also really loved the lobby bar, great drinks, and nice small plates (the same as the room service menu). Overall the great spa-like quality of the hotel as well as the location really sold me on making this a repeat property for our vegas get-a-ways!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mukhi
Reviews.Content: New, modern; smoke free atmosphere a relief from smoke filled casinos. Our room wasn't ready, even after waiting an hour so we were upgraded to a City Corner Suite. Convenient Market Cafe, nice kitchen, attentive staff. Close walk to Bellagio and fun tram ride to City Center, Aria, which eventually goes to Monte Carlo Hotel. Convenient free valet parking. It's true when they advertise, "You may never want to leave."

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, non gambling hotel”
Reviews.Author: etohelp
Reviews.Content: we stayed in vdara for three nights early december, 2011. the hotel is very nice, well laid out, rooms are spacious and curtains are electronically controlled. each room has a small kitchen but no utensils. you have to let the front desk know what you what in terms of utensils or cooking pots. they will have housekeeping bring it up. the refrig is small, just under the counter type. there is no coffee maker in the room so bring your own coffee mix. you can heat up water in the microwave. we were fortunate enough to get a room on the 43rd floor facing bellagio. from there the view is stunning and you can watch the fountain show as many times as you want. you can access bellagio through a short outdoor pedestian bridge so even in cold weather, it's not bad. of course, bellagio has one of the best decorative lobby and common areas so it's really fun to walk through and have coffee as you wish. from bellagio, you can access the tram that services city center. you can also walk to aria by following the sidewalk from the lobby. that is also outdoor and a bit farther so in bad weather it can be a chore. one thing not well thought out is the traffic flow and the road access to the hotel, you have to go to harmon, take an exit to the right (watch carefully for signs or you will miss it), then you go through various loops and acute turns to finally reach the lobby area. all parking is valet (free). exiting the hotel to get to the main roads is again confusing so be clear on directions. i guess nothing is perfect. it is still a great hotel, just be aware it is not quite on the strip. enjoy !!!

Reviews.Title: “Every room a modern suite! 100% Non Smoking, clean, comfortable, spectacular views!”
Reviews.Author: yvrtravelguy
Reviews.Content: The basic room is a two room suite with living room with couch and chairs on one side of a divider and a king size bed on the other. Windows are not floor to ceiling in all rooms but the expansive views are breathtaking. Ask for a "lake" view overlooking Bellagio's fountains. You can't hear the music but you can hear the 'explosions' of the water. Be aware of this if you go to bed before midnight and are a light sleeper. Deep soaker tubs fit two large people facing each other. Amazing soak for one person. Seperate glass encased shower has a weak shower stream because of the LEED Environmentally friendly hotel that Vdara is. There is no self park for Vdara so you need to choose valet (which was quick and efficient), Bellagio self park or Aria self park. Aria is a tram ride away so we chose valet or Bellagio self park. Valet is always free in all Vegas hotels. Tip $2+ to the driver that brings your vehicle. Vdara is at the back of the City Center property so your best connection to the strip is via the overhead covered walkway that goes north into Bellagio. The tram takes you to Aria then Monte Carlo. Vdara's lobby is very modern but one thing we loved was the marketplace in the lobby area. Wine, drinks, milk, eggs, cheese, snacks, coffee etc. priced very reasonably for a high scale hotel. Yes you can a two burner stove and a refridgerator in EVERY room making it even more affordable if you decide to cook! Rooms feature automatic shades as well as blackout shades. Couch pulls out to a queen if you want to stuff 4 people into the room. Kitchen has a 4 person dining table as well. Dimmer lights in every room too. I rated the value a 4/5 only because the prices, even on sale, are not the cheapest in Vegas However I would stay here again! There is NO casino on site. Closest is Aria or Bellagio. The one downside is the silly resort fee that the MGM Resorts make you pay. Every resort is a different amount. Vdara was $20 per day. We got two free half water bottles each day for this plus free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TKEVancouver
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas quite a bit in the past two years and Vdara has been one of our favorite places to stay. It is in a nice central location on the strip...others have complained about the distance from the strip but it is only a few minutes to Aria or Bellagio. The rooms are a very good size and our had fabulous views of the Bellagio fountains. We had a resort credit too so a few Negronis at the lounge and room service were nice treats! I would definitely reccommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for families”
Reviews.Author: Corley
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Vdara 17-21 December, 2011. The "basic" suite is exactly as advertised, and included a very convenient kitchenette. Here's a quick list of pros: - Kitchenette (includes sink, small fridge, hot-plate, table for two) - separate seating area (good for watching TV, reading) - 2 TV's (includes plug in ports for external computer, VGA and HDMI input, with USB port for charging) - nice bathroom, tub for two, plenty of counter space for cosmetics - great location with easy access to Cosmopolitan and Bellagio - Great service, prompt help with last-minute things from housekeeping Cons: - on-premises dining : good for breakfast and lunch. Late-night dining not so much. Closes at 8 during the week and 10:30 on the weekends. Reasonably priced. Good food, though. $4 cup of coffee. - no coffee maker in the basic room Other items: - taxi ride from airport = $22, to airport = $15 - 5-minute walk to the monorail that goes between Bellagio, Aria and Monte Carlo - Smoke-free, and no casino (but the Cosmopolitan and Bellagio are about 5-10 minutes walk to the tables. - I recommend this hotel. Clean, good price, family friendly

Reviews.Title: “Disover the truth”
Reviews.Author: AmyDesi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in mid-Dec. I reviewed the comments from other guests before making reservation. I found that some of the comments are not accurate. Here is my own personal experience. 1. Location: some people commented that it is not easier to find and not close to the Strip. The truth is that it is quite close to the Strip, though without direct entrance facing the Strip. The easiest way to reach the hotel is through Bellagio (don't go through Cosmopolitan Hotel, which is NOT connect to Vdara) 2. Ambience: Modern. The best part is that it is a non-smoking hotel. We gave it a BIG plus, esp after passing through some 'smoky' looby of some hotels (including Venetian and Bellagio) 3. Check-in: some people commented that the check-in is slow. It is true. It took longer than what we expected for a 4/5-star hotel. But, the staff are freindly. 4. Food availability: some people commented that there is only limited catering services of the hotel. This is very true. The "Market Cafe" of the hotel has only very limited choices. It is difficult to get food, esp if you arrive late in the hotel (e.g. late flight arrival or after a long-day trip to Grand Canyon) 5. Room condition: some people commented that the black-out curtains do not block 100% sunlight. It is true and it can be annoying if you want to wake up late. But, since we stayed there during winter time, it did not give us too much problem. 6. Bathroom: our major concern is the water pressure of the shower. It is very very weak and so difficult to control the water temp. Overall speaking, it is a decent hotel to stay if you are not a gambler (as there is no casino and we like it). It is also value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Advisor158
Reviews.Content: Simply the greatest hotel I've ever stayed in. After all of the excitement and crowds you encounter through the day it's incredible to go back to a quiet, clean, non-smoking hotel to rest for the next day. The fitness centre is incredible, as is the pool and cafe. The room itself was amazing and I've actually ordered one of their beds for home because it was the best sleeps my girlfirend and I have ever had. Only 5 minute walk to central locations such as Bellagio. The only bad thing I can say is the rooftop pool was very windy, but it may have been the season and timing of our stay. Incredible, incredibly stay and I will be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: WeilunGrace
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a a new hotel, and if you're looking for a brand new, nice modern rooms this is the place to be. This hotel isn't as busy as any of the other hotels because there is not much going on in the hotel but rooms to stay. I gave sleep quality, cleanliness, and rooms a 5/5 because I personally think this hotel is equipped with some of the finest rooms. Some of the staff were great but I can only remember the bad ones that at times became a negative influence on my stay Overall fantastic hotel! Non-smoking ! (Y) which is perfect cause you want to get away from smoke after you go back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Carolynn M
Reviews.Content: The vdara is very new, it is very clean and the room as so comfortable. The beds were like sleeping on a cloud. Floor to ceiling windows which in our case offered up a gorgeous view of the Bellagio fountains and the Paris Eiffel tower. The view at nigh was breathtaking. It is a non smoking non gambling hotel which I loved. No need to walk through a smoky casino to get to our room. The cafe downstairs always had a line up but here are so many places to eat nearby that it did not bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great non-smoking option in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: megannpa
Reviews.Content: Easy to access the entire strip from Vdara! Virtually attached to Bellagio and Aria (you do have to go outside for 50 yards or so to get to either hotel) and from there onward to the other casinos. Cosmopolitan is directly in front of Vdara so easy access there as well. Rooms were nice. Bathtubs were not jetted but nice soaking tubs- if you really like fancy bathrooms, this hotel was only a little above average- no TV in the mirror, bathtub was good for soaking but no jets, shower was fine but you can tell it was a "water saver" shower head. Nicely decorated. Staff was pleasant although we were there for 8 days and no one ever learned our name (a little unusual in such a nice hotel, especially during slow season). Bed was very comfortable. Views were nice even in the "nonview" suites. Kitchenette was nice to have although we didn't use it too much. We never had a problem with noise during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Kristeeleigh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at almost every hotel in Las Vegas and this one is at the top of our list. We loved the modern yet peaceful feel. The rooms almost felt like "The Hotel" but with a much better view (we had room 48006). The location is great, central inside the city center complex yet away from the hussle and bussle of the people on the street. They only have valet service, which I find great, and the guys always had our car out in 5 min or less. The rooms also have kitchens which is great for eating left overs if you have any from dinner or lunch. Overall this is a great hotel with out a casino, you really never miss the casino because so many are only a short walk away or you can get on the tram which connects to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Spectacular Modern Hotel in a Unique City”
Reviews.Author: ThomasLes
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a spectacular hotel. I checked-in later in the evening. There was no line at the registration desk. The guy that checked me in was great. He had a nice personality and provided information about the hotel and my room. I stayed in a room on the twenty-seventh floor. It had a great view of Paris and the Bellagio Fountain. The Vdara is a non-smoking hotel, which worked out for me. The room I stayed in was very spacious. It was well appointed with modern furniture, a kitchen and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is the “wall-flower” of the casino hotels. There are no sit-down-restaurants or fancy nightclubs within the facility. I actually liked coming back from a night on the town to a quiet hotel. The Bellagio is connected to the hotel and is just few minute walk and the strip is a convent distance away when you exit out the front of the Bellagio. The only negative experience was when a family member tried to call me at about eight o’clock on Saturday morning. There was no answer at the switchboard and then there was a busy signals. He called several times. The family member subsequently called the reservation line. He was given another phone number, which did not work either. For a hotel of this size I would expect better facilitation of incoming calls. Thankfully it was not an emergency. All in all, you will not go wrong selecting this hotel it is in the center of everything and the staff I encountered were just super.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis In Sin City”
Reviews.Author: Tucsontiger
Reviews.Content: The Vdara has no casino and only a small bar and store that sells sandwiches and the like. As a result, it is very quiet and sedate. It is also smoke free, which is a big deal. I believe that builders initially viewed Vdara as residences and not hotel rooms. This resulted in larger suites that have all the amenities. The suite we were in had a full-sized refrigerator, microwave oven, dishwasher, and even a clothes washer and dryer. You won't find that in many regular hotel rooms. The suite featured 1.5 baths. The living/dining area and the bedroom were separate with zone heating. This is a very nice feature. The bed was extremely comfortable. In all three nights we were there, I did not hear any sounds at all, so I think they added extra sound proofing when they built the place. The elevators were very fast; I never waited even a minute for one. The Vdara has a gym on the second floor with about 5 treadmills and a couple of recumbent bikes. They have some dumb bells and a few machines. You can get in a good workout here, but not a real intense one. They supposedly have a locker room with steam and sauna, but that is another $25 per day. The wireless in the hotel was very spotty. Make sure to plug your laptop into the ethernet cable. The speed was good, but not great. I think in a brand-new building, it should be great. Don't fool around looking for self-parking. There is no good option. Just do the valet. You don't even have to tip if you do not want to. When you want to eat/shop/gamble, the Aria and Cosmopolitan are all within a very short walk. It is not the easiest route in the world to get down to the strip. You may not want to, though, since City Center has everything in it. I would also avoid the City Center monorail. It does not go very far. The stations are generally at some remove from the hotels. By the time you walk up to the platform and then into the hotel, you would have been better off to just walk in the first place. I strongly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quiet place to stay that is luxurious and fully-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: songoftheeclipse
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I had an excellent overall experience during our 4 day stay here. We stayed in the deluxe suite. The room was fairly large with a kitchen, living and bedroom divided by a partial wall, and a bathroom. We unfortunately didn't make use of the kitchen but it would be a great way to save some money on your trip. The living room area was comfortable with a couch, chair, and desk. The partial wall that divides the living and bedroom has a tv on both sides. The bed was one of the best I've ever slept on in a hotel which was great because its hard not to do a lot of walking in Vegas. A restful night really prepares you for the next day. The pillows were awkwardly large. The bathroom was spacious with a large bathtub and a separate shower. I would have liked some stronger water pressure for the shower but I do have an unruly mass of hair that is hard to wash. The frosted glass door lets light through so make sure to role over if you here your partner get up in the night to use the bathroom unless of course you like light when you sleep! The view from our room was amazing. You could see the mountains off in the distance or the fountains at the Bellagio down below. The room was clean and the cleaning service was prompt and efficient. One day when we didn't request room service we came back to the room with a message on the phone. When we called the person at the front desk asked us if we needed anything since we had the do not disturb light on when they came to clean. I thought that was a nice touch. I was impressed with how thoroughly they cleaned; I didn't expect to come back and see some of my clothes I left out folded. The only real negatives from my experience were the long time we waited in line to check in. It took almost 30 minutes. It was a Saturday afternoon and the line was long but when you're on vacation its hard to wait for it to begin! Also when we checked out even though a long line formed behind us when we walked up there were 2 people helping each person at the desk. Maybe they were training but if I had somewhere to go I wouldn't have wanted to walk up and see 4 people helping 2. The $20 resort fee seemed excessive but that is common practice at hotels. I didn't visit the spa or the gym. If you are looking for a relaxing hotel for your Vegas vacation I highly recommend this one. The location is just off the strip. The tram can take you to Aria, Crystals, and Monte Carlo or you can walk right into the Bellagio. When I go back to Vegas I very well may have to come back here!

Reviews.Title: “No fuss brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Adrian K
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice now, and if it wasn't for my wife wanting to try something different I'd have booked again for our next trip to Vegas! Rooms very modern and high class prestige fixtures and fittings. Nice staff, good room service. Good location in the middle of the strip, great valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, nice quiet hotel for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: channing14
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Vegas November 28th - December 3rd and Stayed at Vdara our entire stay. The room we booked online was a basic Deluxe Suite. We arrived at about 3:45p.m. and did not have to wait in line at the check-out desk which was very nice (though I think this was just due to the fact that we were there on a slow day). I am subtracting a star for the lack of enthiusiam and overall rudeness of the Gentleman who checked us in, he barely said hi to us and acted as if we interrupted him by wanting to check in, this did not start out our experience at Vdara very well. It was hands down the rudest I've ever been treated at the checkout desk at any hotel I've stayed at in Vegas (I don't get upset about much but he was talking down to us BIG TIME). We asked if there were any upgrades avaialable, and while we did not get an upgrade to a nicer room we did have a great view of the Bellagio fountains. I read reviews and don't know how people always talk about the Hotel upgrading them for free to a nicer room...I have been to vegas over five times now and it has not happened once to me. Our room was on the 33rd floor and it was quick access from the elevator to the room which was very nice; No large lobby to walk through or sets of elevators to take which was a relief Upon arriving in our room everything was tidy and neat until we went into the bathroom. The ceiling above the bathtub was peeling and it was a very noticable eye sore in the bathroom, we also found garbage from the previous people who stayed there, old toothpaste and tisses. I am not one to complain about small stuff so I picked them up and threw them away myself (I'm sure some people would have come unglued but I just didn't let it bother me, I didn't want to be upset the first day in Vegas). The beds and pillows here were the most comfortable I've ever slept on In Vegas (I would go back just to sleep on the beds..they were that good!). The small dining table was nice as was all the storage in the kitchen. Everything else in the room was basic; a chair & desk, sofa, coffee table, a main closet, a closet in the bathroom, two nightstands, flat screen TV, and some drawers for clothes (no coffee maker....sad). The location of the hotel was great. Vdara is part of the CityCenter so it is in the middle of the strip. It was connected by a walkway to the Bellagio, behind the Cosmopolitan, and across from the Aria. Going through the Cosmopolitan seemed to be the fastest way to the strip. I can't really review the food at the Vdara but we did get coffee one morning. It was good, but way to expensive for what it was (which I find to be the case with everything in Vegas nowadays). They have one bar which we did not try also but it was always packed (so it must have been good). The whole time we were there the room service was great, our room was so clean everytime we came back at night (maybe the cleanest I've ever stayed in, with the exception of the day we arrived). Overall I would give Vdara an average review (if I could 2 1/2 stars). It would be a great hotel for couples or families who are going to vegas for a quieter time. Would I go back? Probably not and here is why: The front desk person was unfriendly, when that is the FIRST thing I experience on my first day of hard earned vacation I just cannot return to a place like that (no matter how great the rest of the experience was). It only takes one person to leave a bitter taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: manonthebeach
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here. The had a great offer with 50 dollars a day in resort credits. This was a great deal. I loved that it was fresh and clean. The valet was quick each time, as well as the room was cleaned every day. The room was bigger than expected, the mattress was one of the best I have slept on.
