The only complaint I would have is, when I check out for some odd reason they charged a random added fee after I left. I sent an email to guest service's the next evening saying it would be reversed. Had it not been for the odd charge It would be 5 stars. I must also compliment the room service. The server was very nice and cordial, as well as fast setting up the table.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, comfy beds, no hustle-bustle”
Reviews.Author: leadthumbs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set apart from the rest on "The Strip" in that it is completely non-smoking - including the lobby, bar and cafe. As well, there is no casino. However, you can get your casino fix by walking 3 minutes to Aria or 2 minutes to Bellagio. The hotel itself was very clean, quiet and secure. A great place to stay with the kids if the hustle-bustle of typical Vegas hotels is a bother. The king-size bed was actually one of the most comfortable I've slept on - down feather pillows and thick duvet, smooth cotton sheets, etc.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! 1ST TIME TO VEGAS...”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with a stay at the Vdara for my Birthday (all booked and chosen by my boyfriend) even though I work in my mothers travel agency. I was really nervous having read some of the reviews about this hotel, however, DO NOT LISTEN TO ANY BAD REVIEWS! Some people are just too picky.. Firstly, a word of warning..when checking in you will be asked for a deposit of $500 which if you pay by credit card does not get taken from your account straight away only acts as a guarantee, whereas if you pay by debit card it does get taken but refunded when home. Along with the resort charges of $20/day. You can keep track of the charges on your room account through (one of the two plasma tvs in the room!!). We had a double deluxe on the 37th floor overlooking the bellagio and its fountains!! The view is OMG through 4 huge double windows! The beds are soo comfy..just what you need after a long day walking.. also two plasma tvs :D The rooms are pretty big even just the basic rooms! I loved the whole modern, contemporary and chic feel of the hotel and the gorgeous smell on entering. The staff are soooo friendly (especially the bar staff). The location of the Vdara is great a short walk to the Aria then you are on the Strip. I can not recommend this hotel enough..since I have arrived back home I have also been telling all my customers whom are going to be booking! Thank You Vdara for a wonderful holiday of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with great views and great escape!”
Reviews.Author: Sheree L
Reviews.Content: The Vdara was clean, beautiful and a great place to stay for all ages! Our room had amazing views, a great size suite and the bed was super comfy! I also loved our big tub for soaking in after a long day/night on the strip! The Vdara was located between the Bellagio and Monte Carlo right off the main strip. Everything was in walking distance!!! They also had a little cafe that served breakfast, lunch, yummy lattes and had a mini grocery section! Next time I am in Las Vegas- I can promise you I will only stay at Vdara! Felt almost like coming home to our very own condo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are massive! Nice new hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Go-Go-Go-With-Gazza
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and this was a conference/holiday visit. The conference organisers booked the hotel for us and we stayed 7 nights. Arriving at the hotel, we were lucky with check-in - a breeze compared to other members of our group who arrived at different times. They queued for 20 minutes or so. Prior to going, we checked out all the reviews and was totally surprised when we arrived in the room to find how big it was - some had claimed that the rooms were small!. I read somewhere that this hotel was built as an apartment building originally and turned into a hotel - hence the kitchenette and the dining area. Strangely, the kitchen stuff - plates, etc, were available only on request. The rooms looked, felt and smelt brand spanking new. Fresh and clean with modern decor and colours. Bed was ultra comfortable and huge. The shower was hot and strong. We asked for (and probably paid for) a room overlooking the Bellagio Fountains which were magnificant. Location was convenient to the Strip and also the casinos. However, in hindsight, it was a fairly lengthy walk to the strip along a deserted back road which may be very offputting to some. There was a tram that linked all the way back to the Monte Carlo, where we had other friends staying which was handy. There were chargeback facilities through several hotels in the same group (and same area) which was magic for the buffets and the pub! So plenty of pros. Top 4 cons worth mentioning: 1) the Resort Fee of $15 which appeared to be payable for a tiny bottle of water, they even managed to forget to leave water on 2 mornings. 2) The young ladies that booked the shows etc were so snobby that I felt I was intruding on their busy schedule. 3) I didn't take a laptop and they wanted to charge an obscene amount of money to use the Business Centre and 4) The cafe is very basic and it would be nice to see them re-open the restaurant on site. All in all, a nice hotel which I would recommend whilst it is relatively new. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grava83
Reviews.Content: Have not been in Vegas in 5 years, this hotel is absolutely beautiful, rooms are amazing huge large suites it looks way better in reality then in pictures, we were blown away. Very comfortable beds, super soft linens. Its close to everything. Highly recomend thi shotel its very nice to get away from al the craziness from the strip to this nice quite hotel. The only thing I did not like was their market place cafe takes forever for food to come out. Aria buffet was good and its right next door. The weather is quite chilly in Vegas this time so defiantly bring warmer fall cloths. XS club in ecore was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marik81
Reviews.Content: After not visiting Vegas for 5 years it has changed alot! Vdara is an excellent addition there!!! We traveled with a group of 9 people and all lived the hotel. It's very convenient to get around there, the only flaw is the market cafe in the lobby, we ordered one bagel with cream cheese to go and it took 20 minutes to prepare! And the didn't even put the cream cheese on the bagel it was on the side!!! All other cafes, bars, and restaurants are excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Eddie_Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: this is a real high quality hotel very well situated on the strip. Staff are very attentive and the rooms are furnished to a high standard. my only criticism is the lack of a coffee machine for such a high quality establishment this to me was unusual. The coffee shop in the lobby is ok but prices are a little on the high side even for a hotel of this standard. The lack of restaurants is not too much of an issue as there are good things to be found at the Aria and Bellagio both of which are attached to the Vdara. Bed was very comfortable and also a good selection of products in the bathroom. The seperate tub is a nice touch. The concierge staff were very good and managed to get us prime seats for the tribute to Elvis show in the Aria at a very good price similar to what we had be offered earlier in the day at one of the ticket outlet stalls but the ones they were offering were further back in the theatre. Check out even on a Sunday was very efficient and the baggage storage for later flights was very welcome. the only reason i've not given it 5 stars is the lack of in room coffee but thats being harsh on my part i just so needed a coffee on Saturday moring after a long night in the Aria casino.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Guy R
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality hotel. Dealt with issues regarding equipment failure fast and courteously. Beautiful pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit at the Vdara in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Peanut-Chopper
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed at our at the Vdara. I was attracted to the fact that every room has a kitchen and it was non-smoking. We used the kitchen just for eating cereal in the morning. You simply request kitchenware from housekeeping and you bring it up. You leave dirty dishes in the sink and they pick it up the next day (no dish washer - but that was fine because who wants to do that on vacation). The concierge was very useful as it is an MGM property so any shows at other MGM properties is very easy to access. We just ordered from our room and picked up the tickets downstairs because they can print it out at the hotel (no running around to pick up show tickets) and when we had a coupon for a lower price for a show, they called up the box office and got us the lower price! Also ask for the coupon for a free VIP coupon box to the Premium Outlets (ask for two if you visit both outlet malls). Easy to access the Belligio. We had ask for bathrobes and slippers but again, no big deal. We loved the contemporary decor and the two TVs (even though we never stayed in our rooms for long). Loved the instant hot water too. No problems connecting to WIFI. Free water bottles daily was very handy too. Loved the bus system. Just buy your tickets at the bus stop (credit card works). Going Northbound, the bus stop is in front of Planet Hollywood or Paris and going Southbound, the bus stop is right in front of the Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Our Las Vegas Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Ed F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Vdara on three separate occasions, and the Vdara has become our choice hotel for staying in Las Vegas. We can often find an excellent rate, and we've taken advantage of Vdara promotions on two occasions. We travel to Las Vegas approximately 4-5 times per year, and we've stayed at many of the hotels on the strip. Pros: - Non-smoking and non-gaming: this means that it's quiet, smaller, and easier to check into. The lobby is often very quiet, which is nice compared to the insanity of the other hotels on the strip. The best part is that the Aria is about 200 steps away, so you can be in the middle of the fun within minutes. - Rooms: We've stayed in both the basic suite and the City Corner suite, and both are stunning. Classy decor, and the beds are fantastic. Ask for a Bellagio view or an Aria view. - Service: Most staff is utterly courteous, helpful, and friendly. - Kitchens: The kitchens are great for saving some $$$ by making some meals in the suite. Plenty of room for simple food prep and a nice dining area. - Free parking at Aria: You can either valet your car at Vdara (for free, I think) or park for free at the Aria. It's a short walk to the Vdara through the Aria. We like to do this when we want to get our car out early to go hiking around Las Vegas. Cons: - Kitchen: While it's great to have a kitchen, you have to individually request every single item of cookware that you want from housekeeping and have it sent up. This suite isn't nearly as stocked with cookware as other suites on the strip like Trump and MGM Signature. It's really the main drawback for us. - The basic suites do not have coffee makers, although there is a full kitchenette. - We've had some trouble getting housekeeping in our room. We've been gone twice from about 9am-5pm hiking and returned to an unmade room. We had turned on the "housekeeping" light in both cases. Overall: Although we've experienced some fairly minor inconveniences and instances of poor service, I still think Vdara is a five star hotel. We like to stay in upscale suite-style hotels in Las Vegas, and the Vdara has become our #1 choice for several reasons when we travel there. Given the competition, that's a pretty big recommendation.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Heart in Texas but body in Central Wisconsin
Reviews.Title: “Get away gone good”
Reviews.Author: Tim K
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this hotel which was very nice and connected to Casino's nearby. No need to go outdoors, unless you smoke. We did have a housekeeping situation, however Vdara personnel were on top of it to remedy quickly. Very friendly staff which is a good reason to go back .

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rayfal
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the vdara at the end of October. Lovely rooms plenty of space, two flat screen tv's in the room. Large bathroom. Small Kitchen in room, you had to ask on arrival for kitchenware but it arrived very fast, could do with a kettle in the room. Safe in the room Our room had a great maid service, we did not ask for a turn down service but we got it. Could not say enough about how well our room was cleaned. However my sister room was on the same floor but about 10 rooms down from us and their maid service was awful, one night at 10pm the room was still not cleaned, even though she had went out at 9am and had put on the service my room button, and all week she got very bad service, she must of had a different cleaner than us because as i said we got 5 star service. If you ring down you can also get lovely bathrobes delivered The hotel is a non smoking, non Casino, but you just walk up a walkway to the Bellagio Hotel and you have the casino. The daily resort fee is a bit much, it is to pay for wifi( not always great) and daily Newspaper( which you have to order on arrival - we did not know this) and bottled water not worth the charge but you have to pay it even if you do not use any of the item you are paying for. I would stay at the Vdara again. But from my sister experience with housekeeping, i think if you complain the first time it happens, you might get better service, she complained on checkout and got her resort fees taken off her bill. So if you stay and get bad service complain on checkout Great hotel and i would recommend to anybody, it is modern got a lovely bar in rececption, it has a little shop/cafe also in reception

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, luxurious”
Reviews.Author: vashya
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is quiet oasis in the heart of the Strip. There is no casino, so you can recapture a sense of sanity after a day (or night) of blackjack and poker. The rooms all seem to be suites, with a dining area, separate living room and bedroom, 2 flat screen tvs, and a very large bathroom with separate shower and tub. And the rooms are quiet; the people that stay here seem to actually respect "do not disturb" signs. We also tried the room service (quick, tasty, and friendly).

Reviews.Title: “meh...”
Reviews.Author: metropolistraveler
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a lovely, well-maintained hotel but its inconveniences outweigh its design. Its location so far away from the strip was much more annoying than expected. It's more than just a long walk--it's a trek down a steep flight of stairs, across a busy street, through the lengthy driveway of an abandoned/unfinished building and then back up more stairs just to get to the walkways. Check-in time was also a drag. With only 10 people ahead of us in line and 4 attendants at the desk, we expected a breezy check-in. Instead the process to 40 minutes because each attendant was doing a hard upsell to each guest on activities, spa services, and registering for an m-life card. So not the appropriate time or place and hardly a fluke as the check-in line was always incredibly long and at a standstill no matter what time of day we passed through the lobby. Maid service was also hit or miss with housekeeping coming at 9am and then when asked to come back later, wouldn't return until 5pm. Again, it's a perfectly fine hotel, but totally misses the mark in terms of service, convenience, and the excitement you usually feel in a vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location....”
Reviews.Author: Athena76
Reviews.Content: 4 friends and I were in Vegas to run the Rock and Rock Vegas Half Marathon. We stayed at the Vdara for 5 nights starting on December 1st. We had picked the Vdara due to its non-smoking and casino-less status and we could not have been happier. We booked 2 corner suites and had 3 ladies in one and the 2 guys in the other. They accommodated our request to be on the same floor and although we did not have a view of the foundations we instead faced off the strip to the mountains. Nothing wrong with taking a shower or having a bath with that view. With 3 of us in the same room, the corner suite provided us with enough space that we were not on top of each other and having the fridge and microwave was very useful for breakfast and also re-heating leftovers from some of the fabulous restaurants. The pull out bed was alright and we asked for turn-down service nightly so that housekeeping could come and make up that bed. This worked great except for one night where something must have gotten lost and they delivered new linens instead of turning down the bed. The bathrobes are amazing and I highly recommend using them, I would have bought one had they been available. One of the best features of the Vdara it is closeness to the Bellagio. It takes less than 5 minutes to walk to the Bellagio lobby and then on to the strip. The Aria is also right there and has some fantastic restaurants as well. We found everyone at the Vdara very friendly and helpful with housekeeping stopping by to ask to everything was meeting our satisfaction. The Market Cafe is convenient and the room service is fantastic. We ordered in breakfast our last day before heading to the airport and the found both the service and quality of food impressive. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Vadara and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for a more sedate stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but very inconvenient and poor services”
Reviews.Author: Eblong
Reviews.Content: While the room we had was very nice, there is little to offer the guest. The only eatery in the hotel closes at 8PM on weeknights, and it has the only shop in the hotel in it too. If you want coffee after then, then you have to order from room service or go to mother hotel, since there is no coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Exceeds Most Reviews”
Reviews.Author: drcreamer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 5 days and 4 nights in a corner suite at the Vdara in Las Vegas and were VERY impressed!!!! Like many of you, we spent a great deal of time reading the various reviews and became confused at the seemingly contradictory findings. We found it to be EXCELLENT. Please allow me to elaborate from a baby boomer point of view. We do NOT generally stay in fancy five star hotels and we do not expect to be pampered or waited upon in any luxurious way, BUT we do INSIST upon a clean, well appointed room and we require a hotel that is well kept and has a reasonably friendly staff. Our first stay in Las Vegas 3 years ago was in a standard room at Treasure Island with a strip view. We found it to be a very good value and we enjoyed the north end of the strip. Our second stay was with other family groups and we all stayed at New York New York on the south end of the strip, again a standard room with a Park Avenue upgrade. It was quite good but in our opinion not up to the standards of T.I. This November 21-25, 2011 we decided to explore a fancier room at the newly built Vdara. Initially we were booked in a Vdara suite with one free daily buffet each (breakfast or lunch only) at one of 7 MGM buffets. As the trip came closer to fruition, Vdara introduced a new package for an upgraded corner suite with a $50 DAILY resort credit for in suite dining or use at the Vdara Market. This is the option we went with for $129 per night .... the credit brought that down to an effective rate of $79!!!! Yes we did use the credit each day (more on that below) The room in our our middle class opinion was SPECTACULAR!!!! It was an 811 sq. ft. one bedroom condo. Elsewhere the various reviews describe the room quite well and the Vdara web site has an excellent 360 degree view of it and a floor plan, so we will let those reviews speak for themselves. For clarification it seems from some reviews that the Corner suite and the Vdara suite are identical except for the view BUT not quite. The Vdara suite has a main bathroom and a powder room but the view is not as good as the corner suite which has one very large bathroom but a stunning 270 degree view. We would have preferred the powder room too but all in all it was a great great room. Many reviewers complained about the electronic shades and the difficulty in using them but we found it to be no problem at all. I guess there was some mild sun shining around the edges and between the blinds in the morning but it did not bother us. We do not need cave like darkness to sleep and in fact generally kept most of the blinds up at night. It was stated by some reviewers that the housekeeping was poor and service was substandard or poor. We SAW NONE OF THAT, although one day our room was missed for cleaning all together. The front desk offered to send someone up when we returned that night but we did not to be bothered at that time and so they volunteered to remove the daily resort fee for that day. Fair enough we thought!!! There have been many questions concerning the various offers that the Vdara makes available from time to time such as what is included in the Vdara resort credit and how does one use it. It was a mystery to us as well but I think that our experience may help shed some light on the topic. First of all the Vdara Resort Credit actually means slightly different things depending on the amount assigned and the details of each offer. For example SOMETIMES the resort credit can be used for the Spa, and the Aria restaurants as well, BUT in our case the $50 daily credit could only be used for in suite dining and for ordering food from the Market Cafe just off the main lobby. Although the cafe also carries soft drinks, snacks, souvenirs etc. the credit was only usable to offset purchases made from the Market Cafe menu. (A detailed menu is available on the Vdara site) To use the credit simply order the items from the menu and charge it to your room. It can be eaten in the cafe or taken back to your room as you wish. Service was quite prompt and even a special order was ready within 15 minutes. Juice, Tea, Coffee are able to purchased via the credit. As mentioned elsewhere, the only trick is that you may need to personally check at the front desk or call down to ensure that the credit has been adjusted on your bill. This was a fairly simple task and while it would be nice to have it happen automatically all of the time it was a very small diversion for what amounted to $50 off each day. We just checked on our second day and on our last night after we had made our last purchase. As noted elsewhere, there is no Casino and no real restaurants to speak of, but both are readily available just across the driveway at the Aria. The walk to the tram which will take you south to the Monte Carlo is just two flights of stairs (or escalators) off the main lobby. Or instead of turning in to the tram station just walk a few more yards and you enter the Bellagio complex. From that first entry point though it is a good 10 - 12 minute walk to work your way through the Bellagio and emerge at the overpasses to either Caesar's Palce on the west side of the strip or Bally's on the east side. There are many other hotels that almost immediately let you out to the strip in a minute or so and they are "hopping" day and night with the sounds of the casino, entertainment and restaurants, BUT we were much more pleased with the more quiet and laid back atmosphere of the Vdara. We do not regret a single minute!!!!! It was a dream trip.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Ksigns
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband last month during the week. It's a very nice hotel. I liked that it's non-smoking and everything still looks very clean. I like the location. It's very close to most things on the strip. Now, the things that bothered me... We ate out and brought left overs to keep in our room since we have a refrigerator and microwave. The rooms have kitchens but no silverware. No problem, there is a note asking you to call room service and they will bring silverware up to your room. Well, I called down to have someone bring up some silverware, after 45 minutes of waiting I figured they forgot and I called again. They couldn't give a reason as to why it was taking so long and in 5 minutes I had my silverware. I expect to wait 45 minutes to have freshly prepared food delivered to my room but not for silverware, and it's not like this was a Saturday night when the hotel is super busy. It was a Thursday. The next thing that I didn't like was that there is no gift shop/sundries shop at the hotel. So if you forget to bring something like a toothbrush/asprin or anything else, you have to go to one of the neighboring hotels to get your things- I went to Aria to get bandaids, it would have been nice to get them at our hotel. Of the 3 hotels in City Center I liked the Cosmopolitan the best, cool bars, friendly staff everywhere. The buffet at Cosmopolitan is awesome! The Aria is very pretentious- why have a bouncer outside of a lonely sports bar? I don't think that I would return to Vdara because there are better options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Smart”
Reviews.Author: acoralsea
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, lovely room, gorgeous bathroom, and no smokey casino... yea!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Alan T
Reviews.Content: Pros: The best hotel in a city that I have ever been. Very beautiful landscape, partial view of bellagio fountains, amazing smell in the hotel, very spacious room, very new and modern hotel, long windows with automatic curtains. Very good price compared to what the hotel offers. Con: difficult to find a con, but the blackout curtains do not work well, there is a gap between the two curtains, which allows light to penetrate in to the room and wakes you up in sun rise, like me.

Reviews.Title: “Alright stay, but a little dissapointed.”
Reviews.Author: Lori J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vdar for the American Thanksgiving long weekend. We had both been to vegas seperately before and this was our first trip together. First thing, Friday night about midnight, we were woken up to water running from our bathroom. Upon inspection, it was leaking through the roof and the light fixture. A handy man attended right away, inspected it, ensured we would get upgraded and indicated he would get back to us asap to let us know if we should move the same evening or wait until the am. We waited for about an hour, nobody called and so, we went back to sleep. A side note about the rooms. We stayed at the Vdar because of the kitchenette however, we had to request utensils and plate which, they took everyday and we had to request again. And, the rooms had no coffee pot or kettle which, I'm sure, is so you buy their coffee in the lobby. We used a pot to boil water. We were up early the next morning for golf and because we were wondering the status of our room as nobody had gotten back to us, I stood in the always long front desk line (remember, this is 645 am) to ask about the status of our room but, left because we would have been late for golf. This brings me to my second dissapointment. We requested our car from the valet and were in a bit of a rush to get going....when he arrived with our car and my husband did not tip him, he actually said "oh, okay" and turned around and left with obvious attitude. So, overall, the hotel itself was beautiful with friendly and helpful staff or the most part. And, the rooms were beautiful. However, we were not upgraded despite our inconvenience and felt some pressure and hostility from the valet staff when, god forbit, you did not tip them. We were eventually moved to another room but, it was not an upgrade. And, I'm not sure if I'd go back just because of the valet experience. Let me park my own car for god sake....they had a HUGE parking garge right there! I've worked in the service and hotel industry for years and worked at a 5 star hotel in Whistler so, I know a thing or two about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Love the non-smoking!”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissChrissy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights near the end of August for a belated honeymoon, and if we come back to Vegas, we will definitely stay here again! This was his first time to Vegas and my second. We LOVED the non-smoking atmosphere, and stayed in a fabulous room overlooking the Bellagio fountains. We actually enjoyed the fact that there was no casino in this property, as it gave us a chance to get out and move a bit. Each morning I went down to the pool and lounged/swam/enjoyed a book, while my husband joined a poker game at the Aria (sister hotel) across the road/circle driveway. The pool at the Vdara was great, and service there was fairly good, though one day I did have to wait because only one waitress was working. All of the other days there were two or three servers walking around. I did enjoy an egg scrambler dish from the pool menu, and sat at the tables nearby; this meal was excellent, and I would have eaten from this menu more often if I didn't have a free brunch each day. I found that it was easy to find a lounger in a good spot, and there was plenty of sun to soak up. I did find that the rays would reflect off the hotel windows, and at one point I had to move because it got too hot! The pool deck also burned my feet when I walked to the steps to cool off in the water, but I guess that's what you get in the desert during the hottest week of the year! We then had a late brunch each day at the Aria buffet, which was included with our room at the Vdara, and was EXCELLENT food. I do wish there was a buffet in the Vdara, but the Aria is also lovely and just a very short walk away, so it was a minor inconvenience. We didn't use the bar in our hotel as we had plans each evening and it just didn't work out for us to drink there, but I did access the room service menu late one evening for a delicious pasta dish. We also loved the tram (accessible from the back of the property) as we had friends staying at NY NY, and the tram got us much closer to them for the few times we met up. TIP: If you want to learn how to play craps, go across the road to the Aria and ask for Nic; she is amazing and walked me through the game step by step...I even won a little over $300 my first time playing!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Caredog8
Reviews.Content: Everything you expect from Vegas and more It's the centre of the universe for Vegas right now. Reasonable rates and rooms are great Wish it includes Breakfast but I can overlook...

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bet On It”
Reviews.Author: leialab
Reviews.Content: Recent hotel stay, the evening of November 25 th: My wife, son, daughter in law, and myself had driven from Los Angeles to celebrate my birthday. I had requested that the sofa bed be made up; we returned very late, did find that the bed appeared to be ready for sleeping, and my son and daughter in law used it. When they woke up the following morning, they realized they had been sleeping on coil springs that were covered and were very sore. At checkout, I advised the desk of this matter and the response was that there were mattress pads available from housekeeping, had I requested it. I replied that housekeeping did make up the bed.. i completed a follow up survey, and given the nature of the problem, the hotels response was unacceptable, saying they wer sorry the bed was not " to my liking". Insincere and disingenuous. Tthis experience has left us with "sore feelings" with regards to future stays or recommending the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mboyerm
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vegas and we really enjoyed our hotel. The pool was amazing (but drinks can be very expensive around the pool area - but you have to expect that - you're in Vegas!) We were really happy with the fact the hotel doesn't have a casino (it gives you a break from the craziness of the city). The room was outstanding - we couldn't ask for anything more. We did the Maverick helicopter tour, saw O from Cirque du Soleil and the Celine Dion show - we had a blast. If we ever return to Vegas... we'll definitely consider returning to this hotel if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, view, central location, comfy beds, but behind in service”
Reviews.Author: Gisellabell
Reviews.Content: Vdara offers a great value, chic and modern with well-appointed suites, central location and easy access to Bellagio casino, plus the added bonus of the sky tram. As much chic as it is, is still not quite 5 stars, so if you're looking for a more luxurious, pampering experience, you may want to look further. The bed was uber comfortable, and it was great having a living room, kitchen and full vanity in the room. Very spacious corner suite. The view from our room 52006 on the 52nd floor was spectacular and offered a 180 degrees of neighboring hotels up the strip, mountains to the west, and directly above the Bellagio fountain which lit up at night - just spectacular. For exploring, this is a great location being central on the strip. The only issue we had at all was with the service. My dad dropped us off in his car, and while 5 bell hops stood talking to each other 20 feet away in front of the hotel - NOT ONE OF THEM even looked up to see if we needed any help unloading or transporting our luggage. This was a major faux pas. The front desk staff were equally lacking in welcoming warmth and under-attentiveness, and they neither informed us about our room amenities, the application of our $50 daily credit, early pool closure, etc..., nor welcomed us to the Vdara. The were short, curt and bored. Upon check out, they were in the same form, and when I asked for a print out of the credit we were given of $50/day, I had to ask several time for proof. Her response was that "I made the charges, so shouldn't I be able to recognize that the credit was applied?" Shocking really. We called for several things to be fixed in the room (blinds wouldn't close, broken TV remote) but no one ever came. When I called to locate a price list for the mini bar, I was told to look in the wrong place. Basically, the feeling that this is a new hotel with not-so-well-informed staff was apparent. [Due to poor customer service I received, I may think twice about staying here again.] But, if you are looking for a good value, clean hotel without the crowds, smoke and loud noises of night clubs keeping you up until early morning hours, the Vdara will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Travel_Fiend
Reviews.Content: The Good: It is located in City Center. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. Great views. Staff was really attentive and nice at first..There is someone at the elevators greeting you and there is also a very pleasant employee that just stands in hallway by the elevators just to assist you. It is very quiet inside the rooms. The Bad: If you walk after a late night there is someone at the elevators asking to see your roomkey. The hotel is hard to get to. It's set up like an airport. There was no iPod dock that I could find & figuring out how to set up the playstation was frustrating. Its hidden in a cabinet & you need to navigate with the remote. There should be a manual. The website says that each suite comes with full size Aveda hair products. The small tiny bottles of bodywash and shampoo were cheap and the bodywash gave my son a rash. The Ugly: I booked two rooms & asked for them to be connected. I had gotten a special online that included $25 credit for one room $50 for the second room including an in room gift. I verified 2 times before our stay & was told it was not gonna be an issue. When my boyfriend checked in he was told that I needed to be there with my card ( even though when I booked the rooms I was told it was not going to be an issue). I had to give my debit card over the phone for both rooms and was charged a $400 deposit. He got upgraded to a slightly nicer room so our rooms were not even close to each other. Once I checked in I was assured our rooms had in room credits. We were billed for our in room gift, was told it would be removed. Ordered pizza the second night, it was truly the worst pizza. The kids asked for sandwiches! We are not snobby by any means. Cheap frozen pizza would have tasted better. $40 for 2 - wow! We tipped the attendants but when I checked out I was billed again for tips and the $75 credits were not applied. When I complained the girl at the front desk waived the resort fee but she insisted the credits were given when I could clearly see I was only being BILLED for room service. I left and found that they had my deposits refunds still on hold and an extra $60 on hold for 5 days. I called in & I was told someone would call me back. I called a few days later and was told the they were STILL trying to get in touch with the front desk, two weeks later still NO response! Once u check out they couldn't care less. The ugly

Reviews.Title: “Vdara - Almost the Perfect Visit!”
Reviews.Author: kevtee74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Vdara Hotel at the beginning of November and we had a fantastic stay in this hotel. It all started from acknowledgement of an email we sent prior to our visit requesting that we would like where possible a nice room with a view of the lake. On arrival, it was obvious from the girl on reception that VDARA were fully aware of our email, the girl was exceptionally pleasant and the hotel provided us with a great room with a view of of the Bellagio lake. The room itself was excellent, very spacious and had all the amenities that we required and an excellent view. In terms of the hotel, we had no real fault and the fact that it was non-smoking was a huge bonus and we actually liked the fact that there was no casino. I would have to say that the bar on the ground hotel is disappointing for a hotel this size, I don't know whether they have the space, but an exclusive bar on a high floor with a view, would be a great idea imo! There was one shop in the lobby area which we used frequently so that was definitely a plus. The only very small comment I have is that we found the girl on reception when we left rather cold. We had requested a late check out, but this appeared to be flatly turned down with no real recognition of the request and our circumstances. I found that a bit disappointing considering we had spent 7/8 nights at this hotel and she did not ask whether we had a pleasant stay. However, this was a small issue, the bottom line is that VDARA had provided us with a fantastic stay in Las Vegas and we will definitely return to the VDARA in the future (NON-SMOKING HOTEL IS THE WAY TO GO!) Thanks to all at VDARA for a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect non-gaming hotel”
Reviews.Author: TigrMama
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of days for work but caught dinner and a show next door at Aria. Rooms are chic and modern with nice kitchen amenities, except no coffee maker (minus 1/2 star). It's a bit odd that there is a cooktop, microwave and mini fridge but no dishes or pots and pans in the room. I had to request a corkscrew to open a bottle of wine which incidentally, they stock in the mini-bar (minus another 1/2 star). Complimentary bottled water is a nice amenity that is always appreciated. There is plenty of space and I enjoyed the comfy bed and linens. Love that it's a non-smoking and a non-gaming property too. Valet parking was pretty quick and the location is convenient if you don't have a car. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So Nice- I've Stayed 5+ times”
Reviews.Author: LaryS6143
Reviews.Content: I go to vegas 6 or 7 times a year and since the city center has been built I have only stayed at the hotels there. Vdara offers nice rooms, friendly staff and great bartenders at the pool and keeps you close to the action if that where you want to be but also give you the calm of a resort hotel if you don't want the hustle of a casino hotel. The rooms are nice size and the bathrooms are great if you are with a significant other...the jacuzzi is a plus. The noise proofing is not quite at the caliber of some of the places I've stayed but you are far enough away the lights and the noise don't really bother you in the morning. It is a good value for the money and comparable to other hotels...its Vegas..things are expensive so 14 dollars for a mixed drink by the pool is to be expected but served with a smile and good humor. I'm sure I'll stay here again and I booked it a couple of times for my parents and they had no complaints either.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Smokefree”
Reviews.Author: hatster31
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at Aria recently, I must say that Vdara is the better choice. While it does not have all of the electronic gadgets that Aria has, which by the way, is confusing and not efficient, the rooms are nicer at Vdara. All parking was valet, which is nice because you don't have to hike a long way to pick up your car. It is also a quick walk to Aria if you want the casino. Inside, the Vdara is smokefree, and even the standard room has living area, sofa, and kitchen. It's also very quiet. However, I do have two complaints. One, the sofa bed is not comfortable at all. It was of a very cheap quality, so if someone has to sleep in the sofa bed, it's not too good. Second, the curtains are not blackout. So, if you are someone who needs to sleep in complete darkness, when the sun comes out, your room gets extremely bright. All and in, I would recommend Vdara over Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in vegas”
Reviews.Author: misterevs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, new, clean hotel. Amazing views and amazing room, no 31009. Wonderful pool, gym satisfactory. Right next to strip, between Cosmopolitan and Aria but so much more relaxed with no passing traffic or casino. And if you want the casino the aria is their sister hotel and thus less than a 50m walk across the forecourt. When my girlfriend booked this because of the spa I was a little dubious as I was thinking more about the grand themed hotels. Having visited these hotels and having them so close I would choose Vdara every time. It has everything you need with no stress. And when you want the bustle, well it's right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Different things to different people.”
Reviews.Author: yng_cpl_30s
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews of the hotel, we realised Vdara is a different kettle of fish compared to other Vegas resorts so we opted to stay for only five nights of a ten night trip to Vegas in November. The are advantages and disadvantages depending on what you are looking for but, first of all, let me describe and review the hotel as it is before giving my view on this new way of staying in Vegas. We booked a Panoramic View room but when we arrived the highest floor available was the 8th floor, which defeats the purpose of having 270o views of Vegas! We asked for alternatives and the check in person was more than happy to assist. She disappeared for 5 mins to check blueprints for the hotels to figure out what rooms would be best for us. She returned with a list of floors and room types. We opted for a City View room on the 39th floor, with views of the strip and Bellagio Fountains. The room itself was very impressive and different to any other room we've had in Vegas. The kitchen / dining area is quite unique and contained a very large fridge/freezer with ice making facilities, sink, microwave and hob. The dining table, with four seats sits neatly within the kitchen and the washing machine and dryer sit in a nearby cupboard. With our trip being nearly 2 weeks, we made use of the washing machine, to freshen clothes. The living room contains a large tv with two seater sofa and coffee tables. It has a separate air conditioning unit from the bedroom, which again we found useful if one of us was sleeping while the other watched tv in the living room. The bedroom itself was large enough and separated from the living room by fogged sliding doors. It has another large tv with bedside cabinets, desk and several lamps. The bathroom can be reached via a sliding door from the kitchen or door from the bedroom (the whole suite is a square that can be walked round). The bathroom is very large and has twin sinks, which large lit mirror. On the other side of this mirror there is a makeup area with the same sized mirror. There's a wardrobe with safe. The bath tub is deep but not very large. The separate shower is large but the water pressure in our suite wasn't very high. The signature part of the suite was the window running along the two external walls of the suite. The electric blinds (shade and blackout) could be controlled in living room, bedroom and bathroom. It let lots of light in and, of course, gave magnificent views of the Bellagio Fountains, Eiffel Tower, The Cosmopolitan and Strip as well as sprawling Vegas. Having read many reviews there are split opinions on this hotel. Firstly it's only a hotel and not casino. We're not gamblers but did enjoy being amongst the slots now and again when we stayed at The Mirage. However, Vdara is connected to Aria, Bellagio and Monte Carlo. It takes a 5 min walk to Aria and Bellagio or 10 min tram ride to Monte Carlo. These are all part of MGM Resorts too so the MLife card will work in all three and allow you to collect points. This was fine for us. Vdara is part of the City Center complex and, as such, is set quite far back from The Strip. To get to the strip you do need to walk for 10-15mins, through any of the three casinos mentioned previously or there is a road leading out from the front door. At first this was no hassle for us as it normally takes the same amount of time to walk from your room to the front door of any casino resort! However, after the second day this did become a little tiring, constantly walking the same routes simply to get out of the hotel and see the sights. The hotel is also completely non-smoking. This is not a problem for us and was actually quite refreshing having come from the more smokey Mirage. We ordered room service once and the food was delicious but the guy who delivered it stood around for a tip for what seemed like forever. Even though I gave $10 tip when I signed, I felt pressured into another $5 to get him to leave the room! Tis put us off ordering again. All in all, we loved the room at Vdara. The staff were friendly. However, it lacks the facilities of other resorts and the walk to and from the strip through other casinos became tiring. I'd definitely recommend it if you have stayed in other casinos and are looking for something new but if it's your first time, stay in a casino resort for the real Vegas effect.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KPYG
Reviews.Content: We stayed he in November 2011 and booked as part of a hotel and flight package. We have stayed at other locations in Las Vegas and was a bit apprehensive about the Vdara having read some of the reviews on here. We shouldn't have worried at all, this place is fantastic. Although this hotel is not directly on the strip you can easily get there in a 10 minute walk. The hotel has a link to the Bellagio which gives you easy access if youre going north up the strip. If you want to go south then cross over the road to the Aria and either walk down along the foot path or go through Crystals shopping centre. You can also get the free tram at Bellagio or Vdara. Our room was fantastic. Having seen the Vdara advertise on Facebook about their room views, we emailed ahead of our arrival and requested one. On our arrival we were greeted by very helpful member of staff. She noted that we had requested a view room and gave it to us at no extra charge. What a view we had, looking north up the strip with views of the Bellagio fountains. Magnificent. Our room was spacious and clean. We had a dining area, lounge, bedroom and large bathroom with bath and shower. The room had two tvs, hair drier, a separate fridge in addition to the mini fridge. As stated in other reviews there is no cutlery, robes or slippers in the room but we had all of these within 10mins of requesting them. We sampled the in room dining and were pleased but Vegas has so much more to offer food wise. $20 a night resort fee gets you in room Internet, bottled water, use of the pool and newspapers. Is it worth it? I don't think so but there are other hotels who don't charge this. You can get free wifi being just within the proximity of the hotel and you don't need to be a guest. It's clearly a fee they charge and are using these things to justify charging you for it and you can't opt out. In summary, great hotel, great staff, great location being part of the city centre complex but unjust in charging the resort fee and what you get for it.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara - An upscale hotel without the flash of the casino”
Reviews.Author: Masci_AZ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a lot of the nicer hotels in Vegas and the Vdara in the new city center is definitely unique. First it has all of the amentities of the finest hotels but it is just that only a hotel, so you don't get inundated with the lights and sounds of the casino when entering and leaving. Aria and the Cosmopolitan are the neighboring hotels and offer the show, shops, restaurants and crowds. The city center is definitely the new upscale trendy Vegas area. Pluses - a great little cafe in the front, a very nice bar area, stunning rooms, what Vdara doesn't have Aria and the Cosmo do have, and it is in a great location on the strip Minuses - a smaller pool area, no restaurant on-site, the city center tram is not convienent, incovenient to walk to the strip There is a daily resort fee that may not show up if you booked through a travel website. I heard other guests complaining when they were told they had a balance due. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples, business or friends, but definitely not for families. If I could have given this a 4.5 out of 5.0 that is where this would have rated.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in Service”
Reviews.Author: John V
Reviews.Content: Stayed 11-24 to 11/27 and we were disappointed. Checking was a mother and the second day we day tripped up to Zion (left room at 6 am and came back at 7 pm) and our room was not made up. We were looking forward to a nice shower and had to wait on clean towels. Also hot water in the shower both mornings took 10 minutes to get above luke warm. Just way better choices in Vegas for the kind of money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the bedlam”
Reviews.Author: PortlandOldGold
Reviews.Content: The Vdara Hotel (& Spa) in Las Vegas provides a wonderful, quiet, and refreshing hotel experience in the midst of all the excitement, noise, action, and confusion of the Las Vegas scene. Because there is no casino in the building, there's not much noise and no smoke odor. The ordinary rooms are attractive, large, and comfortable with a small kitchenette area and a big bathroom with separate shower stall and soaking tub. Beds are comfortable, the view from upper floor rooms is great day and night, and the rooms have electric windowshades for both "shade" and nighttime "Blackout". The hotel has a big pool area, a spa, a handsome small bar, and a combination shop and cafe area which works well if you're not really hungry at breakfast or lunch. The hotel is very reasonably priced, and is very well located, easy walking distance from three of the glitzier big resorts (Aria, Bellagio, and the Cosmopolitan, all with lots of nice restaurants and huge casinos) and excellent shopping at the Crystals complex. This attractive new property is really a quiet winner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Condo Like Features but feels a little half done.”
Reviews.Author: PRM2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for a 3 day weekend. Here are my thoughts. Pros: -No Casino so the hotel is relatively quiet. -Kitchen and sitting area, although my friend's room had the kitchen, they did not have the table and chairs (get to that later). -Easy layout and small hotel feel. -Free and efficient Valet Service. Cons: -Rooms did not black out well. -While the roooms look to be a good deal online the $20 Resort Fee quickly pushes the rooms into Aria/Cosmo/Wynn price range. -Rooms seem half done in areas like the lack of true black out, and lighting scheme. - No basic/expected amenities like bath robes, etc. (although you can call to get it done). -Uncomfortable furniture (beds are pretty good). Final thoughts: The hotel feels only 1/2 done. My buddies room lacking the table/chairs, the uncomfortable (but pretty) furniture, and the lack of a good lightning scheme and good black out curtains make the hotel feel that things are a bit rushed. Given that the price of the hotel is in the same range of some better options, unless you're dead set on staying in city center in a hotel without a casino there are better options. You can get same or better pricing most weekends at Aria, Palazzo, Cosmo, etc. Several of the hotels have much larger and more comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great for non-gamblers”
Reviews.Author: kbinsb
Reviews.Content: This property is actually made up of privately owned condos. It has no casino and little in the way of food (other than room service). It also has only valet parking, although it's not too much of a hassle to park next door in the Cosmopolitan lot and walk over. That's the down side. The upside is that the rooms are fabulous. Clean, spacious, pretty, convenient. Every room has a small, but full kitchen. The views are great from every room. If you are concerned that there isn't much choice of restaurants on the property, don't worry. Aria across the way and Cosmopolitan next door offer plenty of great restaurants. We love this hotel and come back to it every time we visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: GretchenHarms
Reviews.Content: Our room looked just like the photo on the website. Check-in was a breeze, even though we arrived early. Staff was friendly. We LOVED the non-smoking aspect and we had no trouble getting a reservation for a couples massage at the spa on short notice. The view of the mountains from our room was spectacular. And best of all, in was so QUIET!!! I'm attending a conference in Vegas next Spring. You better believe I'll be staying here...not at the conference venue.

Reviews.Title: “We will be staying here from now on!”
Reviews.Author: Daynaplease
Reviews.Content: Love that this hotel is completely non-smoking! It's very clean and cool and modern. There's no casino but we didn't miss it, just walked to the other hotels like Aria and The Cosmopolitan. There's even a free shuttle. There is a little kithen with a microwave and stove top. The view was great and there's cool motorized blinds. The bathroom is very nice with a big soaking tub. The king size bed was awesome and there's 2 flat screen tv's. Love that there's no smoking in the entire hotel! Also the pool is very chic and nice fitness center. Bought through Travelocity as a secret hotel and very happy and will definitly book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: Pay74
Reviews.Content: This is now our 3rd trip to Las Vegas and this time like last year was for 11 nights, having been through the Aria and Vdara resorts on our last visit we decided we would stay here to try it. On booking between Aria and Vdara we opted for Vdara as we felt the room was nicer for the money, we fully understood on booking that Vdara did not have it's own casino, had one bar and a cafe but knew it was a 3 minute walk into Aria that had all the amenties required for a trip to Las Vegas. Check In: seen a few others have had a bit of an issue on this one I think it depends on when you check in and it ss luck as to how busy it may be, we walked right in and checked in no problem, we were asked if we wanted a room on a high floor and from reading up on Vdara I knew some rooms had a view of the Bellagio fountains so we asked for one of them and we got it. On other days we did see more queues at reception so I could see how it might get busy but as I said no problems for us. Room: Room was very impressive 3 big windows that go the whole length of room, a separate sitting area divided by tv/clothes unit with 2 large screen tvs, 1 for bedroom side and 1 for sitting area, there is also a kitchen area that has a table with 2 chairs a 2 ring cooker,microwave and fridge. Bathroom has a shower, sink and nice soaking tub, a hairdryer is provided. There is a nice sized built in wardrobe that also houses iron and the safe. If you require cutlery you have to phone down to get it which I understand as to have cutlery in all rooms would create more work for housekeeping to keep clean and we would not have used it anyway. The other on request item are bathrobes, I believe as it is 5 star those should be in room without request. The lights and curtain controls are in middle of room I think they should be beside so you can operate lights and curtains from bed. Bar,Cafe and foyer: As there is only 1 bar in Vdara I think it has to be spot on and it just lacked the service levels I would expect, we found it slow to get drinks when it was quiet and that was on 2 seperate occasions, cannot fault the quality of drinks or the bar itself just not 5/5 I am sure it is fine most of time but just slow on our 2 visits. The cafe is a little small for the amount of rooms in hotel so it was busy, the menu was good though and food was also nice. Foyer area is nice with security at lift entrance which is common in all Las Vegas hotels. In summary we would stay here again it is a lovely hotel with lovely rooms, it is well located next to Aria and its casino and restaurants and Bellagio is close too. We recommend this hotel highly but what gives it the 4 stars rather than 5 is that service level and the MGM Mlife card. We found the Mlife card took a lot longer to get points/comps than our last vist at Wynn resorts.

Reviews.Title: “I like VDARA”
Reviews.Author: Alexredrock
Reviews.Content: pos: comfortable room,view on the Bellagio fountain,no casino, no smoke aria,quiet neg: very, very small cafe

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Fair_Minded_Dude
Reviews.Content: Where to start.... Its awesome, just awesome. All of it

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service and View, What else can you ask for.”
Reviews.Author: SpoiledVacationers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Vdara Suite (800sq ft) with kitchen at 1.5 bathrooms during Thanksgiving week. Pros: * Great location, at the center of the strip, right next to Bellagio. * Service was outstanding, since we had visitors spend a night, housekeeping brought in extra bedding and repaired broken hairdryer within 5 mins. Some of best response and polite service. * New and clean hotel (opened for business in 2 years). * Large spacious room: the Vdara Suite had enough space for our visitors, over 800 sq ft. * Great view: Room 40-010 overlooked the Bellagio fountains: * Most importantly, NO CASINOS. Cons: * the only complaint is there is not a quick way to cross the Vegas strip, even taking the Tram (Aria Express) is a long walk. Given the gigantic sizes of these new mega hotels, be prepared to walk 15 mins to cross the street.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!!”
Reviews.Author: Rolanda N
Reviews.Content: I consider Vegas my 2nd home and for my stay at the VDARA, I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED! As soon as you walk through the doors the wonderful spa-like aroma relaxes you,Immediately!Front desk was so friendly and courteous, Especially Jason.Very professional. The rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. Everything was spotless,the linens were fresh and privacy was of utmost importance. They really give you the option to participate in the crazy rush that is vegas or simply stay inside and Veg out if you so desire. I will certainly be staying there again! Thank You VDARA :)

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay anywhere else in Vegas again!”
Reviews.Author: EMPER0R_ZURG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara recently and absolutely loved it. The service was exceptional. The hotel was quiet. The non-smoking casino-free building certainly keeps a lot of the Vegas riff-raff away. Sure, if you want to gamble, drink your face off, chain smoke, and stumble to your room at 4 am go for it. I'm happy for that to be somewhere other than the hotel I'm trying to sleep in. Walking into this hotel and not being confronted by the stale smell of years of cigarette smoke caked on the walls is wonderful. The rooms are very nicely appointed. The valet car service is very quick. The cafe in the lobby is nice but busy at times. The french press room service coffee is a special treat. A bit expensive but some of the best coffee I've been served. People on here complain about the $20 per day resort fee. This includes the WiFi access and valet parking as well. If you think it's too expensive, stay somewhere else. It's clear at the time of booking this is charged in addition to the base rate. Quite frankly, this place was worth every penny. We will never stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel for location, luxury and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kev5
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great first visit to Las Vegas. It was a very busy holiday and the Vdara provided the much needed respite and relaxation away from the Las Vegas experience that includes noise and bustle. That said the hotel did still have a warm atmosphere that made it enjoyable to have a few refreshments in their bars whether to plan or review the day. The bar staff were friendly and mixed some great cocktails! The rooms were spacious, comfortable and with many extras and the housekeeping was excellent. When we first checked in there was not a room available on a high floor, however the next day a change of room was offered unpromted and this gave us a great view. Although away from the biz, walking to the bellagio, Aria or strip was easy and nearby. Staying at the Vdara really added to our great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, if you want to escape the madness.”
Reviews.Author: Chelly1972
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! Check-in was very smooth and quick. If you don't like queuing stay at the Vdara. Room was beautiful and very spacious - we stayed in the standard room. My Aunt upgraded to a one-bedroom corner suite - well worth the $50 per night, much cheaper than what Virgin Holidays quoted. The fridge is very small and you have to ask house keeping for crockery and cutlery. Resort fee is included in your package price if you go with Virgin Holidays. Loved the bar, very relaxed and the service was excellent. We used the cafe quite a bit for breakfast etc........lovely coffees and pastries. I loved the location and the walk-way over to the Bellagio is great. I liked the close proximity to the Aria. I'm not a big gambler but I like a flutter - Aria casino was fairly quiet compared to the other hotels and the clientele seemed to be less crazy than the other casinos. Take a comfortable pair of shoes - It's easier walking to places during the day. However, in the evenings we tended to get taxis to avoid the men who thrust the girly flyers in your faces!! Not appropriate when you have child. We ate at a few of the buffets. The Wynn was good but not sure if it was worth the money or the 90 minute wait - we visited Sunday lunchtime. We liked P.U.B - great food and they allowed children in too! We visited the West rim of the Canyon - only took approx 90 minutes to get there - this was the highlight of my stay - utterly breath taking! Overall, we had a fantastic holiday. If I was to visit LV again I would without a shadow of a doubt stay at the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Day 1, cleaning staff didn't bother to clean the toilet. Day 2 returned to the room at 4:00 pm and it still hadn't been cleaned up. Called and they said I must have had the do not disturb light on, which it was not. The rooms are nice but it was a disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, subtle, quiet hotel just a minutes walk from all the madness!”
Reviews.Author: Bully1981
Reviews.Content: The vdara is honestly the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. On my honeymoon it was exactly what we wanted, the condo style units are stylish and sizable and the lack of a casino in the hotel makes for a welcome oasis to escape back to when you've had enough of all the fun. And when you're recharged and ready to return to it all it's a 2 minute walk to the Bellagio, 2 mins to the aria and then to the rest of Vegas! Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: caflygrl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as my family had stayed here earlier in the year and really enjoyed the experience. This was my 1st time here and while it was enjoyable, there were a couple hiccups along the way. First the pros - Vdara is entirely non-smoking and when you walk in the lobby you can actually breathe and get a fragrant floral aroma. For me the fragrance was turned up a bit too high but still, I loved the non-smoking aspect. Our suites were well appointed with a small stove, microwave, and fridge. They provide you 2 small bottles of water a day but our room attendant was very kind and let us have some extra if we were going out etc. The seating area and bed area are divided by a wall with 2 flat screens on both sides. The bathroom is huge with soaking tub and glass shower (water pressure was so-so). For a $20 "resort" fee (this is per room, per day) you get free wi-fi and I guess those bottles of water every day. I didn't get a chance to visit the pools or gym but perhaps those amenities help make up the fee as well. The hotel has a tram to City Centre which is a bunch of upscale shops but also some more affordable restaurants. It is close to Bellagio which was nice as we went to their buffet. It is more towards one end of the strip so yes, you will have to walk a little if you want to see Venetian, Treasure Island, etc. The cons - We pulled up in our taxi and no one was there to greet us, help with luggage or guide us to the door. We ended up having to unload the luggage ourselves and wander around to find the proper door to enter. Up in the room we requested kitchenware, a coffee maker, and sheets for the sofa bed. When we came back later in the day we had the kitchenware and sheets but no coffee maker. They did not make up the sofa beds for us - we had to do that ourselves and it turned out so uncomfortable that we decided to forego it. When we called to inquire about the coffee maker (which was there the last time my family visited), housekeeping told us they were not allowed to deliver it but if we called customer service and got an ok, they would bring it up. When we called customer service we were told our "deluxe suite" did not include a coffee maker and this was only for the more expensive rooms. Um, what?? What hotel room does not come with a coffee maker? When asked to speak to a manager, they said the same thing. Wow Vdara, I cannot believe you can't afford to put a coffee maker in a DELUXE suite and yet still charge a $20 "resort fee" per day. Even Holiday Inn Express has a coffee maker in the room. We were told if we wanted coffee to go to the market downstairs to purchase one. !!!! Finally after much hassle customer service allowed us to have a coffee maker. Housekeeping would not always remember to leave more k-cups (we had to write a note) and while they were great in taking the dirty mugs from the sink, they did not replace them so we had to use paper cups we brought with us. I did grab b-fast at the market downstairs once but the line was extremely long and when I got up there they had just about run out of every b-fast food item. I can't imagine having to come downstairs for a cup of coffee every day. Overall I had a great trip.... the big bonus for me is the non-smoking but I will seriously reconsider the next time I look for a hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great introduction to Las Vega”
Reviews.Author: NoaandOmar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Vdara all suite hotel in LV. The hotel was lovely - new and stylish it lived up to the pictures they have on their website. The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful. The room was excellent - we had a studio which had the bedroom separated from the living room by a desk/console that had TVs on eithe side. One for the living area and the other for the bedroom. Housekeeping was prompt as was room service. All the associated MGM properties at City Center were within arms reach, leaving the options for dining and entertainment plentiful. We enjoyed breakfast and lunch at restaurants in Aria, drinks at Cosmopolitan and shopping at Crystals. I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind not having a casino in the hotel ( short walk to the sister hotel Aria for the casino). It's modern, fresh and positioned in a place that will keep you busy with the options.

Reviews.Title: “Service needs work”
Reviews.Author: KLB01
Reviews.Content: This is a drop dead gorgeous hotel!!! With that said, they should pay more attention to their daily room housekeeping. This was very slow, we would leave our room at 9 return at 6, our room was never touched. They every have buttons to tell the housekeeping crew that your room is ready to be serviced. Another bad point is there is no strip access, but you can walk through belligio just as fast. Loved that it was no smoking, a little weird it didn't have a casino. All in all, good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - but beware of the pool area”
Reviews.Author: NickRen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara in September for 2 nights. It was through a special deal on Expedia, and was worth the money we paid. Our room was great with views of the Bellagio fountains next door. The two main disappointments were the lack of eating options in the hotel (a canteen-type restaurant that closed early) and the swimming pool. The shape of the hotel reflected the sun's rays and focused them right on the pool area, so you couldn't stay there for very long. Bit of a design flaw.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Not the Most Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: andycrna
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas at least five times per year. This is our first stay at City Center and first at Vdara. The first thing I noticed it did not seem like a Las Vegas hotel which can be a good or bad thing. I personally like the feeling of being in a large casino hotel. The lobby was modern and open with two banks of elevators. There is a bar and a restaurant / cafeteria / mini-mart in the lobby. Our room had a unstocked kitchen, didn't care not cooking, sitting area and a bed area. The sitting area was separated by a partition with large flat screens on each side. Awesome bathroom and shower with a large deep garden tub. The view and the windows were over the top and I guess my favorite part of the room. The bed was large and very comfortable. House keeping staff did a great job each day and were very polite and welcoming. I used the spa and gym daily both were nice, clean but a bit on the small side as compared to Caesars or the Venetian. My biggest complaint was the HIKE you had to make to get anywhere. Would stay again for the right price but would prefer a casino hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Attractive”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful and very clean. I liked that the hotel is non-smoking. The service in the hotel was not overly friendly, but they did bring us robes when we asked. The resort fee is a deceptive add on and I don't appreciate that type of hidden fee. You are supposed to get one bottle of water per day included with that fee and since they did not replenish ours when they serviced the room we did get half of our resort fee refunded. The location was great and the room was great. It did serve our needs well. Also they did check us in early without problems which was nice, but when asked if we could have a later check out time, they said yes, but they would charge us $30 if we stayed until 2 and 1/2 a day if we stay later than that. That wasn't worth it so we just checked out at the normal time even though our flight wasn't until 5:30pm. I would consider staying there again because i like that the entire hotel is non-smoking, but I will look at other options as I was not wowed for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A1bs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara for 2 nights. The check-in was very smooth and quick with an option for low or high floor. The lobby is small compared to other vegas hotels and there is no casino, so getting from room to the hotel lobby is very quick. The room itself was very modern with a high quality finish. It was large with kitchen and dining area and nicely appointed bathroom. The bed was very comfy, I stayed at the Venetian for 3 nights before and I must say that the bed at the Vdara was considerably more comfortable. The only drawback was lack of bathrobes. The city centre and other hotel/casinos in my opinion are only a short walk away. Overall I would stay at the Vdara again, if I wanted somewhere peaceful and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet. Does not feel like Vegas”
Reviews.Author: docnakona
Reviews.Content: Quite a different experience. Stayed here on a business trip and the conference was in the building. Elegant, very contemporary vibe. Was strange (but nice) not hearing the typical casino clang clang. Gorgeous views from panaromic rooms. I do not think that they have any "bad views". Pool was small side since they seem to emphasize cabanas. Hard to navigate to from the strip the first time.

Reviews.Title: “amazing retreat”
Reviews.Author: drinkgruner
Reviews.Content: Wonderful escape from the Casino scene, non-smoking, modern clean building, terrific cafe that makes great bistro sandwiches, market has good selection of goodies for the room and mini kitchen, heated pool and whirl pool is almost empty making a great retreat. Helpful staff....just ask. Monorail just down the hall that takes you to Crystal shopping centre and walkway to Bellagio Hotel to see the fountains and "O" and the casino. Pillow top kingsize bed,very comfy, shower and soaker tub with powerful hairdryer, full sized couch, wifi, big screen tv. Mini Kitchen very handy...no kettle, but used the pot to boil water, no coffee maker...they sell coffee downstairs so...we made eggs for breakfast everyday and had healthy snacks daily from a small fridge. I would come back to this hotel in a second....felt comfortable like home.

Reviews.Title: “Truly four star”
Reviews.Author: scrapmetal
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for weekend and must say it's everything advertised, non smoking,no gambling,quiet ( minus then highway traffic on northwest side facing bellagio that also offers the best views of the strip lit up),and beatiful rooms.For 130 per night,our suite (only ten dollar upgrade at check in) feature two wide flat screens,huge bathtub,full kitchenettef,fridge,range,micro,etched plus decent eating and living areas.The electric shades were the bomb (only suggestion would be controls closer to bed) and the bed was comfortable with a capital c.

Reviews.Title: “Breath In”
Reviews.Author: Eric A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the only Non-Smoking hotel in Las Vegas. Which was so refreshing. It is so noticeable as you walk from hotel to hotel in the strip. Love it! It was clean, comfortable, and had a great modern tub. I normally don't take baths, but I was compelled to do it and enjoyed it. I was attending a conference at the Caesar's Palace and the room had the best price I could get at the time. It was worth it. The only negative is that the spa was below standards. It was beautiful to look and the amenities was AWESOME!!! Warm shaving cream?! How can you top that. On the other hand, it was uncomfortable. small jacuzzi, not inviting seating to relax, and the steam and jacuzzi were scorchingly hot.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here! Terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: Kimfadi
Reviews.Content: We travel quite a bit, so we know what good service is... Not at Vdara. When we checked in it was very slow, and there was a customer complaining about so Rome walking into his room. After checking into our room, we realized there was no heat. It took three hours and being pushy to be moved into a room, we missed dinner. We only stayed three nights, and someone walked into our room ( staff) three times!!! I was sitting on the couch in my pajamas! We complained to management, who could care less. The entire staff was rude and uninviting. If you want to enjoy your trip, go to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch how you book !!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers22
Reviews.Content: Booked three nights via a reputable third party website. No problems booking in but when we enquired as to why we weren't getting any housekeeping we were told it would be an extra $45 per day !!! No mention of this in any of the booking terms. Apparently some of the rooms are privately owned 'condos' which are then rented out and they don't come with daily housekeeping, which you have to pay extra for. Never heard of this before in a five star hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul11Manchester
Reviews.Content: We were quite disappointed in the Kitchen area fasilities. you had to phone up for mugs plates and cutlery, anything you needed.There is no kettle of coffee maker, as we like a drink in the morning, we needed these items, we were waking up all hours with the time difference. you have to ask for robes and slippers, we were there for a week so needed these items, Its is a nice hotel, as every body says, however we stayed at the Sygnature at MGM last year and was spoiled, with the facilites in the kitchen, you didnt have to request anything. You do have to do a lot of walking, even though there is the Express train. Also beware of the Taxi fares, they say it is $7 to strip, we were charged $30 as they went the long way round, check on the pay list when you arrive, theres a Airport Bus that charges $6each to the strip,also a price list of other forms of travel, worth checking it out

Reviews.Title: “Quiet stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very much has the feel of staying in a high-rise condo bldg. If you want to stay at a quieter, low-key hotel, this is the place for you. The Aria (across the driveway entrance) has the casino, restaurants, buffet, bars, shows, etc. Also, right next door is The Cosmopolitan and Bellagio, VERY good central location on the Strip. No self-park, you have to use valet (which was fine with us), especially when you call down ahead of time and the car is waiting for you. A few cons: very low shower pressure, the 3 black out shades don't overlap (there are gaps) letting the sun in, a few minor maint issues (burned out bulbs, torn strap in window shades, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip gone wrong”
Reviews.Author: KCDSeattle
Reviews.Content: Anniversary Weekend-- Long wait to check in - 3 people working 2 just talking.
