Overpowering Scent in the Lobby and elevator that gave me a headache for 1 1/2 days , so strong that my husband and I could taste it. I felt like I had to plan how many times i could go through that lobby in a day. When we talked to one of the ladies that stands by the front desk about it- she told us that she was going to get security to see if they could do something- Its call facilities - i asked if they could do anything about the strong scent and she was so rude and told me that if I was not happy with it to cancel my reservation and go somewhere else. I would by they had several events there that weekend -Toyota Convention was really big. I called the concierge and I explained what was happening with the scent and they told me that they couldn't do anything about it they didnt control it. not really an I'm sorry . Horrible customer service. Then the blackout blinds have a gap that wakes you up 5:30 -6 am - bright room. so we called the front desk -asked if they could do something and facilities showed up with blue painters tape to cover the gap- it didn't work, the guy went and brought back black tape & didnt have enough for both gaps. so we had deal with it but we had to put it up and remove it in the am. everyday we were there (Sat-Tue). The room was modern and bathroom was nice - and clean. The $20 resort fee per night should be credited if you dont want a paper whatever else- the WiFi was slow and we had very little to no cell connection. We liked the room but they need to fix a few things. They need to go through hospitality training again -they need it. Not a very good anniversary trip.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis on the strip”
Reviews.Author: wreath
Reviews.Content: Liked City Center and Vdara very much. No casino to march through. Sophistication in design - trendy in an asian constrained style. Could walk to Bellagio and tram connection took you to Crystals shopping center, Aria and on to Monte Carlo. Room - nice kitchen area,living room with center console work set up that separated bedroom. Sheets, towels, robes all great. View was back side of Bellagio - their pool area and out towards Rio Suites and mountains. We liked the bar downstairs, the pool upstairs. Wished could have gotten a "bit" more personalized breakfast - but off to Bellagio for that. Will return to Vdara !!

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet, dignified oasis in the new CityCenter complex”
Reviews.Author: JTworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is our 6th stay here. It is flat out our favorite in Las Vegas. Think almost "Park Hyatt" or "W" just a few steps away from the middle of the strip. I say this based mostly on the smallish indoors/outdoors lobby bar, small lobby but airy, and guest rooms. The fitness room is very nice but we haven't tried the spa, pool, or dining. You have to like to walk. There is a covered walkway (300 ft walk ?) from the Vdara lobby to the tram station in Bellagio. The tram runs from the north end of CityCenter (Bellagio) to the south end (Monte Carlo. By tram/foot you are 30 minutes from the showroom in MGM, and 35 minutes (using also the Mandalay Bay tram) from Mandalay. It's not so convenient going up the strip. Our late night cab ride from the airport was $20 including T&T. Going to the airport, some cabbies take the freeways which probably is a good idea but adds $10. Every one of the rooms we have stayed in have had an excellent view looking N/NE toward the upper strip. You look down on the dancing waters of the Bellagio fountains. No accompanying audio -- but incredible visually... especially at night. During this trip (mid 11/2011) -- admittedly low season -- the nice, large breakfast and lunch restaurant adjacent to the lobby has had a sign "Closed for a Private Party" but appeared deserted. (It must be really, really private!) However the new (since our last visit) lobby market place has an incredible selection of sandwiches, salads, wine, etc. to eat there or to take out. There aren't enough tables so plan on taking it up to your room... The staff is nice enough. In each of our visits, I've snapped cell phone pictures of the room layout, fixtures, and especially the desk/audio/video center, which has a nice design so when I have my home office redesigned, I'll have some visual cues. As for the amenities others have commented on, I thought we had robes and slippers on the last visit. (Can't swear to it). This time they just have a pair of slippers for each of us. The room amenities (shampoo, soap, etc.) are just fine. Also, was a Keurig coffee maker and coffee in the room last time, but not this visit. Hint: we always book through US Airways Vacations. Excellent pricing. But as with any of this stuff, discounts abound so check room and flights in a number of combinations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet and calm base camp”
Reviews.Author: GWVan
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent, housekeeping very responsive, price was reasonable in this "non smoking non gaming" hotel. I was in town for three days on a primarily business trip and found this place to be a calming oasis in the midst of the cacophony that is Las Vegas. I would use this place as my base camp for any trip to Vegas, easy access to the strip, but set back. You do not have to run the gauntlet of distributors of hooker trading cards to get to this place. No harsh lighting and sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location,”
Reviews.Author: lauren_thevet
Reviews.Content: Very nice new hotel, rooms are like mini suites although you have to request kitchenware - but just call housekeeping. We requested a nice view and got a 30th floor good view of the Bellagio fountains. (no bribe was needed for this). The cocktail bar helped us arrange a get together for our friends after our wedding, and it was easy to get a tab for our drinks. The cafe was nice, but we just got take out as it was always really busy. The vdara could do with a functioning restaurant. We recommend the wicked spoon at the cosmopolitan next door - around $23 pp buffet breakfast - truly amazing, and around $49 pp evening buffet - literally couldnt think of any food type not available! There is a walkway through to Bellagio which we found the easiest access to the strip. As its a non gambling and non smoking hotel the lobby is clean and you don't have loads of tourists and hangers on just milling around so it feels peaceful and like a rest from the loudness of the strip. Its quite hard to drive to Vdara as its not well signposted. we drove around the block 3x before finding the entrance. Heads up on the housekeeping - you need to change your doorbell colour to request your room to be cleaned - its not done automatically! also if the room light is blue your doorbell wont work its do not disturb. Our taxi to the airport was around $21.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing city view”
Reviews.Author: sdgt625
Reviews.Content: Two things I really enjoyed about my recent stay at the Vdara - no casinos in this property (I hate having to walk through casinos in most other vegas hotels just to check in), and the view from the 50th floor. I got a corner suite on the 50th floor, and the view was most amazing. From the Bellagio fountain show down below to the mountains in the distance. I could see it all. It was especially great looking at the city lights down below while enjoying a hot shower. The suite was very nice - everything felt very new and clean and modern. The only main issue I had with the room was the sofa bed which was broken the night we checked in. I had difficulty pulling the bed frame out, and it took a long time for housekeeping to come to make an attempt at it. (I had to call three times, and it was easily 60 minutes before anyone from the hotel came to help). The housekeeping staff had no luck either, and could not tell me when they would be able to find someone from the engineering department to try to fix it. Since it was 2:30 am already, I decided not to bother with the sofa bed that night. They eventually fixed it the following day. Also, housekeeping service was a little disappointing for a five star property. The trash cans were not emptied after the room was cleaned one day, and clean wine glasses were not replaced after used ones were taken away by the cleaning crew. Overall, I did enjoy my stay at Vdara very much. The amazing view from my suite made up for any of the little issues I had with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, and good location”
Reviews.Author: Capaneus
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on a business trip and was wowed by the overall experience. The rooms that I saw were all immaculate with over the top appointments (considering the price) like Gaggenau cooktops, stainless steel split fridges, fantastic furniture, multiple high end TVs, audio video system with plenty of inputs etc. I thought the company must have gotten a killer deal but when I checked the regular Vdara reservations the price was very modest. I personally like the location. Its right next to the Bellagio but offset from the strip. This means its a bit of sanctuary from the Las Vegas craziness but minutes away from it when you want it. The downside was the restaurant/food options. There is a convenience deli sort of place and something called the Silk Road which my company had rented out for the trip. In Vegas you expect a selection of good restaurant options in the hotel/casino itself to select from. This leads to the other aspect which might not be to some peoples liking, this Hotel doesn't have a casino in it. If you are looking for a place where you can roll out of bed and gamble, this is not it. Again I think this lends to the sanctuary from the madness aspect I appreciate. Obviously there is no dearth of gambling within a minutes walk. This place would also be great for a family visiting that just need a base of operations for shows, rides, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Joe
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days. The room was very trendy and comfortable with a great view. I liked that it was a non casino non smoking Hotel. No Riff Raff. What was missing is a good restaurant. If there was one, It was not open for the guests. The pool area was very nice with a full service bar. The staff were OK nothing special but no problems. It realy needs a good restaurant. Location was close to the Aria where restaurants are a plenty. Prices for food and drink quite high, but this is Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, with so so customer service”
Reviews.Author: prdtpc
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the vdara hotel in late september for our yearly excursion to Las Vegas. Nomally we stay at one of the properties owed by harrahs but we wanted to try one of the new hotels in the city center complex and chose the vdara because of its smoke free policy. Let me start off by saying the hotel is extremly nice and mordern. The suites are well equipped with great amenities comfortable bedding and black out shades "a huge plus after partying the night away in vegas". The pool at the vdara altough rather small compared to other hotels was nice and relaxing. If you are planning on staying at the vdara one important thing to keep into consideration is that the hotel is not on the strip directly. There is a passage that connects the vdara to the Bellagio hotel however you will be walking at least ten minutes through a maze of lefts and rights before you make it outside to take on the night. Also there is no restaraunts in the property just a cafe "which did not bother us since there are so many great food options in Vegas". The biggest downfall of the hotel is the customer service they are terrible, They double charged both myself and my girlfriends credit cards the full rate "we were splitting the room price". Spoke to the manager on the phone after check out about the situation and she was extremly rude it took over a week for the problem to be fixed. Also one evening we smelled gas outside our room we called the front desk muliple times so they can send someone upstairs to investigate waited two and half hours and no one came upstairs. Its a shame because overall the property is extremly nice and I would have given it a four star rating however the poor customer service just left a bad taste in my mouth and is the sole reason i will not be returning to the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but that's it. Rude staff, cheap amenities, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: whoopsjenny
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Vdara now. We have spent one night here and while the hotel suite looks nice, that is the extent of it. The bathroom amenities (shampoo, conditioner etc...) are EXTREMELY CHEAP. They are awful. Everything looks nice and modern but functionality of the room is poor. The iron is bolted to the iron board which makes ironing clothes quite a task. Robes and kitchenware is available 'on request' When we woke up in the morning my husband and I needed to do some work before heading out for the day but the wireless internet (part of what we pay $20 a day for) was not working. Blackout shades are a joke. They have the wow factor of being operated by a switch but they let sunlight in! Very, very poor design. For the fancy suite, double flat screen tv's there is no coffee maker, dvd player or double sinks. The refrigerator is tiny and not at all cold. I need to call down to have it looked at so the food I bought does not spoil. The valet was very, very rude. They began talking about me after I left my car. They must have thought I had gone already.. nope. Extremely unprofessional and rude. The location is good and looks nice on the surface but that is it.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing, but...”
Reviews.Author: XLTdryvr
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to check out the new city center, Vdara being smoke free was a plus! The room and kitchen amenities came in handy. This is an ideal place to be during extended stays. It was nice and quiet with no crowds so we took advantage of touring the hotel and hanging out in the lobby for cocktails (virgin drinks for me). The large windows in the room made for great views. I’m not a fan of modern furniture but their set up was rather nice. It’s a very spacious all-suite hotel with a non-Vegas feel. Small things excite me… it was fun riding the tram back and forth to the surrounding area. Bellagio is still my fav so we began there and hopped until Monte Carlo. I enjoyed the stay, but wasn’t impressed with the food selections at Vdara. Breakfast, lunch and night life we found ourselves headed over to hang out at Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Breath-taking views!”
Reviews.Author: Spuds92
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at Vdara. It was astounding!!! We arrived early (aroun 11 am) and knew we probably would not be able to check into our room yet, but thought it would be worth checking. The front desk informed us our room as not yet cleaned, but they would hold a room for us. If we came back in a couple of hours we could check in at the "Invited" check in area and not wait in the line. It took two more tries, but the wait was well worth it! Our room had the most breath-taking views of the Bellagio fountains and the Strip. Wow!!! From the 52nd floor it felt like we could see the entire city and the mountains. The City suites are so spacious! We asked for extra hangers, place settings for the kitchen and detergent because I already had clothes to wash. All of these items were brought to our room within minutes of arriving. Great servcie!! Our room was spotless the entire time we were there. It was wonderful having a full sized fridge and microwave. Eating leftover lobster pasta for breakfast was yummy! It seemed every time housekeeping cleaned our room they took our soap. Whatever was sitting out in the shower they threw out and repaced with a new bar. I've never seen a hotel do that! Unfortunately by the end of our stay we were a bar or two short and had to move our one remaining bar from the sink to the shower to the tub. I'm sure with a quick call to housekeeping we could have requested another bar or two, but we ended up just moving around our lone remaining bar and chuckling about it. Everything about Vdara was relaxing and peaceful. It is completely non-smoking--a rare gem in Las Veags. Every time we walked back into the lobby I took a deep breath and said, "I love it here!" The air was fresh and wonderful. The walk from the lobby to the room elevators was short and sweet. A nice change from most Vegas mega-resorts. Aria and Belligio are within EASY walking distance so it feels like everything is right where you are. I loved it! It was unseasonably chilly (certainly NOT Vdara's fault LOL) and we did not use the pool areas, but did walk around them. While the pool area is small, it was very appealing. And with cabanna's renting for only $125 on a week day, we will probably rent one the next time we are in town. We loved it so much we will return in May. I'm already counting the days!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel without casino but in the heart of action”
Reviews.Author: ObviousMan
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a part of MGM Resorts, a huge group of casinos in Vegas and Gulf Coast. Overall rooms are very good, on par or better with 4 or 5 star properties. We could not check out the restaurant as during the 4 days we were there it was constantly closed for private event. A couple of small things I find inconsistent with otherwise great place to stay: 1. The showers only have the "old style" single handle water volume/temperature control. I find it strange that they decided to save on faucets while making this high end property. 2. Lack of good way to print boarding passes. One more gripe - $20/day "resort fee", which covers internet access, access to fitness room, and 2 12 oz bottles of purified water. Unfortunately many hotels are going this way, and the issue is that it is mandatory, even if you do not want any of the services the fee covers. The good part is that the hotel is literally steps away from Aria and Bellagio (from the same MGM group), and also from Cosmopolitan (different group), which offer a vast variety of restaurants, etc. Overall quite enjoyable stay at Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms in a low key resort”
Reviews.Author: LikeItIs-Reviewer
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is definitely the place to stay if you value a great hotel room over resort facilities and amenities. The rooms are awesome - its an all suite resort so as standard the rooms have a kitchen/dining area, lounge with fold out sofa bed, two big flat screen TVs and a big bathroom with separate soaker tub and walk in shower. The decor is very modern, with cool lighting and colour schemes and electric shades and blackout blinds. The bed was unbelievably comfortable and on the whole it's really the kind of room you'll be happy to spend a lot of time in. Even better if you can get a north facing room with partial views of the Bellagio fountains. The rest of the hotel is very pared back and unlike other Vegas resorts. If having a huge dining selection, casino and shopping in your hotel is important to you, then the Vdara may not be ideal. Dining options in the hotel are very limited, but given the location right between the Aria, Bellagio and Cosmopolitan you are only steps away from other resorts who have all that in spades. The pool area was fitting for the hotel - simple and stylish. In high season when everyone wants to be down there, it may get a little crowded, but I can't see it ever having the type of pool scene for those who want to party all afternoon. A few minor annoyances: - the blackout shades have a one inch gap between panels which limits their effectiveness  - the hot water takes a l-o-n-g time to come through in the shower - why give all the suites a kitchen if you then have to call to get kitchenware stocked in the suite? I really enjoyed my stay at the Vdara, it's a welcome oasis in the bedlam of the strip, but close enough to all the action whenever you want it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average service”
Reviews.Author: meirgold
Reviews.Content: M wife and I stayed at the vdara for 3 nights during mid October. The hotel is new and is in a good location with direct access to the Bellagio and the strip. This hotel doesn't have it's own casino which makes it cheaper in price, faster to access the room and clean from cigarette smoke. For the gamblers, the Bellagio casino is within a 7 minute walk and there is also access to the casino of the Aria hotel which we did not visit. We very much liked the location if the hotel as all the major attractions and shops were in walking or short drive distance. Upon arrival, we discovered that the hotel only has a valet parking and no close self parking option. This was quite disappointing for us as we like to have direct access to our vehicle, didn't plan on tipping the valet for each time we needed the car and watching the valet drivers running around trying to get the guests cars out in time, made us feel pretty bad for them. I hope they get paid well for this tough job. As we entered the hotel, there was a rather short queue at the front desk for check-in and 3 receptionists dealing with the guests. Shortly after, one receptionist stopped working on check-in, another disappeared into a room in the back leaving only one receptionist to handle the check-in. We waited over 20 minutes, while there were only 7 people in front of us. As we asked for a room on a high floor with a good view to the Bellagio fountains, we were given a room on the 30th floor which had an amazing view to the fountains. The room was large, clean and comfortable. We liked it very much. The only downside we found was that there is a small space between the sets of blinds which allows enough light to shine in during the early morning hours and wake us up. Our most disappointing experience was on our second night, when we were woken up at 5 in the morning by what sounded like a helicopter. We called the reception to ask them what the source of the noise was but they did not know. It was only after the second call that the receptionist was willing to check with security who told her that these were the backup generators of the Bellagio which were being tested. This lasted for 45 minutes. Following this experience and also some service problems we got from the lost&found department, the hotel had the decency to deduct the resort fee from our bill without us asking them to do so. In general, several hotels in Vegas have now stopped charging a resort fee and I personally think this hotel should follow. To summarize: the location is great, the room was nice, but I think they definitely need some improvements on the customer service side.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing 5-Star Sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: scottanderson1978
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 6 nights at the Vdara Hotel & Spa and absolutely loved it. We were told by our Expedia concierge that we would feel spoiled after staying there and he was absolutely right! The location was excellent - the Vdara is located in the City Centre complex right in the heart of the Strip next to the Bellagio. There was a free 24-hour tram service which ran from the Vdara to the Aria and then onto the Monte Carlo which came in very handy, and otherwise we were able to walk almost anywhere else we needed to. One of many aspects of the Vdara we liked was the fact that there was no casino located in the hotel - this equated to no noise, no smoking and a much more relaxed, refined atmosphere as a result. Our room was on the 48th floor and it was absolutely our sanctuary from the hussle and bussle of Sin City - the quietest hotel room we have ever stayed in with the comfiest King bed we have ever slept in. We had a great view of the south side of the Strip, and the room in general was immaculate in terms of cleanliness and design. The kitchenette was cool (although we really didn't use it other than the fridge) and the bathroom was very spa-like. There are resort fees at the Vdara amounting to $20/day, but we felt this was fair (even though we admittedly didn't take full advantage of the associated amenities) as having free unlimited high speed Internet access was a huge plus for us. The maid service was always thorough, the concierge was very accessible and the front desk was always helpful - excellent customer service all around. As for dining, we visited various places on the Strip for dinner each night, however when it came to breakfast/lunch/brunch we had a special deal as part of our booking which covered up to $40/day in buffet meals at any MGM resort (with a couple exceptions). Although the Vdara did not have a buffet we walked over to the Aria most mornings (only 3 minutes away) and took advantage of their excellent buffet - fair price and very fair offerings. With respect to airport transportation there are no scheduled shuttle pick-ups to/from the Vadara, but we simply phoned one of the shuttle services and they had no problems picking us up on request. $7 one-way versus the same trip costing $25-$30 via taxi. All in all, we have nothing bad to say about the Vdara. This hotel is truly a 5-star experience and well worth the money. If/when we return to Vegas I don't see how we'll be able to stay anywhere else now!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thianda
Reviews.Content: I spent my honeymoon here and loved every second. Vdara is at city center between the Aria and the Cosmopolitan. It's elegant and modern but mostly spacious. Everyone was so nice, specially the concierge who go out of their way to help you. Vdara's prices are usually cheaper than other hotels their size because it has no casino. So you'll have to cross the street to the Aria for gambling. The rooms are amazing. Huge, delicious bed, shower and tub, lots of space and a kitchenet. if you can, ask for a room high above. The night view of Las Vegas is unbelievable. Just fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jlau327
Reviews.Content: You will love this if you're not looking for a noisy, smoke-filled casino atmosphere but still want to be right on the Strip. Aside from the nearby Mandarin Oriental (which is much more expensive), this is the best non-casino luxury property I have been to in Vegas. The whole hotel is (relatively) quiet and peaceful, and everyone is very friendly and attentive. The rooms are goregous and huge - even the standard room is a suite with three large rooms. On the high floors, you have great views of the Strip and the whole surrounding metropolitan area. Wi-fi is strong and easy to access. While dining options are basically non-existent in this hotel, Aria and the rest of CityCenter is right outside. As far as in-suite dining goes, both the food and service were excellent. My only real complaint is that the rooms are missing some of the high-end "luxury" touches you get at the Mandarin or the Four Seasons - extra toiletries and amenities, over-the-top mini-bars, etc. However, for the price, it is sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo style Hotel in a Busy City”
Reviews.Author: murphymj
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here. No casino in the lobby and a non-smoking policy is great. Nice rooms and every convenient to have a small kitchen to make a little something for breakfast. Close to everything but away from all the noise. I love everything that Vegas is about but it was great to go back to our nice quiet room which was on a higher floor with a view of the Belaggio fountain and Effiel Tower all lite up at night. I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jo_hearts_holidays
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas several times & Vdara is by far my favourite hotel. Before we stayed here I was a little concerned reading the reviews about long waits for housekeeping, rooms not being serviced, big queues at the market bar and a long hike to the strip. I have to say that our stay was fantastic from start to finish and all of the staff were great. Our room was amazing, a panoramic corner suite. The view was great and it was nice to wake early & take a bath watching the sunrise over the desert mountains. Our room was always serviced and we were very well looked after by housekeeping. The hotel is literally 50 meters from the Bellagio, maybe 5 minutes to the strip. We have stayed in Venetian & Signature before and both had a much longer trek to the strip. I am not a smoker so it was abolute bliss having clean air through the hotel. There were queues at the Market Bar but the staff were efficient and we were never waiting more than 5 minutes. We found the selection of food to be good & it was all very tasty. I would stay here again on my next trip. If you can try the Red Dragon at the bar - delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and on the strip”
Reviews.Author: 33454Rjs
Reviews.Content: Pick the Vdarra because of the location. Didn't know much about the new City Center but had a conference at the Tropicana. Don't get me wrong I love the action of Vegas but this is a perfect retreat. You're within minutes of the Aria or the Belaggio for gambling and everything else but this gives you piece and quiet as soon as your enter the lobby. The room are great but the best is walking into the hotel lobby and it not smelling like a cigarette butt. My wife did the spa which she said was excellent. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no gaming or smoking in hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoysiaplug
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and beautiful and very quiet. We had a large party next door for at least an hour or two and once our door was closed, we didn't hear them. Well insulated. Really liked the absence of smoking and gaming in the hotel. Had breakfast at the poolside restaurant - the service was lovely. People don't seem to realize it exists as they stood in line 20 deep to have breakfast downstairs while upstairs by the pool, they could have had a sit-down meal for the same price. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “6 nights at the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Emma84Albufeira
Reviews.Content: Got back from 6 nights in vegas staying at the vdara hotel from sunday - saturday. I cannot fault the place. On arrival we checked in fine ( 2 peole in front of us so I wouldn't call it a queue!) we asked for a room high with view of fountains if possible and we got it, just smile! there are 6 lifts so not a wait and they do not stop at all floors. On arrival to room it was spotless, spacious and fabulous. Sofa area with tv, bedroom with tv, large bathroom ( amazing tub bath). Daily maid service, 2 bottles of water put into fridge a day. There is shampoo,conditioner, shower gel, flannels and hairdryer there to use. We didnt require any kitchenette bits but all you need to do is call and they bring it up for you. The hotel views are spectacular, blinds are elctronic so can be up / down / half / black out or nomal!! To leave the hotel the best way is to follow easy signs to the belligio and its a 10 min walk out there onto strip...great walk as you go past wedding chapel, shops, bakery and belligio main reception which is an experience in itself. To return it was just the same walk through the belligio into the vdara. You can get to the strip from the main entrance but the road doesn't have a kerb all the way and with 6 lanes of cars its quite tricky. The beds are to die for and our bed seems boring now were back, towels changed daily. We got a great deal off last minute, direct flights. The tax is $20 a day but that gets you free wifi, local calls and water stocked up. There is a bar and cafe in the hotel itself We were very pleased with our entire stay

Reviews.Title: “Peace in downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lluviaxlluvia
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to walk out of Vegas, but with all the amenities of the city. It was perfect as the hotel is separated from the casinos. It has no cigarette smoke. And it's very quiet. . We chose a panoramic suite. It was an excellent size, with well equipped kitchen, including washing machine and clothes dryer and very good bed. The bathroom was large with lovely views, as well as the entire suite. . Room service was a little slow, sometimes very slow, but the other qualities of the hotel made us forget this detail. . It has a small market, very convenient, right next to exit the elevators. And several great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. At the reception were all very friendly and professional. Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Calm amongst the Casion Storm”
Reviews.Author: Hannah C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Vdara recently for my 30th birthday celebrations and would highly recommend it. The whole hotel is full of suites (and also has residential suites) and these are new, luxurious and large! We stayed in an executive city suite which had great facilities and felt like a small apartment. The hotel itself doesn't have a casino which is actually quite a breath of fresh air in Vegas, as you walk into a hushed lobby which is chilled out, with a nice little cafe (a bit overpriced but what do you expect for Vegas!) and a couple of bars and restaurants. As the hotel is asscociated with the whole city centre complex and the Bellagio, this means that you can visit any restaurants and bars in the other connected hotels and charge back to your room which is handy. The Aria next door, has a lovely new casino in it as well which is well worth a visit. Nice pool and complimentary valet are great additional benefits, but beware of the resort fees (as with most hotels in Vegas) as these can be a costly surprise and are not quoted on room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nnb
Reviews.Content: Non smoking which was great. Rooms were so spacious with separate kitchen and lounge area. Panoramic views from the room overlooking the Belagio fountains. The bed is the comfiest bed I have ever had in a hotel. The market cafe was a bit pricey for what you were getting. The pool wasn't deep enough and felt like a hot bath but some people like that. The hotel was like a haven away from all the hustle and bustle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, difficult to access it via the strip”
Reviews.Author: Horte P
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel, our suite view was awsome, but when we were walking back to our hotel, it felt that it took forever to access it via the strip...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic All Suite Property on centre of Strip - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Anglo1Belge
Reviews.Content: After a couple of days staying at the busy Bellagio, we moved to the all suite Aria resort where we booked a double bed penthouse which was cheaper then 2 rooms at Bellagio (for 1-bed suites that is). Before arriving, we got a mail from concierge to inform us about complimentary limo service to and from airport.....nice. When entering the property, we were taken by the quietness, definitely different then other properties with casinos. It felt a more adult place, more of a hotel you would find in Chicago, NY, London. This makes it just attractive, you can enjoy Vegas but take a back step by staying in this beautiful property. The suites have all mod coms you would expect, including kitchenette, washer, dryer, fridge,full equipped bathrooms etc... A local told us this property was intended to be used as apartments, but due to downturn was converted to all suite hotel.... only thing missing would be some basics such as glasses, fork, knifes, dishwashing products, etc... It was a bit weird to find all cupboards in kitchen empty, only a few glasses (no knifes, corkscrew, to be found). The views however are just amazing, you can enjoy Vegas and beyond, just amazing! The shop in the lobby offers a good choice of basics but would recommend trying the shops at the nearby Aria as choice is bigger. The pool, despite smaller than nearby resorts, was an adult-only very relaxing space which we frequented every day to get away from it all. If in Vegas, and you are with 3 or more, def go for a 2-bed penthouse, just awesome. Next trip to Vegas, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: munchiesLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Great place - ask for a room on a high floor overlooking the Bellagio. Views are fantastic. Only down side is that there is no restaurant but there are lots of good ones close by.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mau151
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Kendall and the really nice Asian woman in the Lobby. I can't remember all their names, but I do remember their kind service, from the check in to the bar. I was looking to spend a night with my wife in a suite in Vegas and after visiting almost all the hotels in there, I chose the best one. Good Bellagio lake and Eiffel tower view in the 34th floor. And the room, outstanding! Before going to Vdara, I was staying in Tropicana for a week and it was a good room, all remodeled. Nice pools they have.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: fivestarfriday
Reviews.Content: I've seen many hotels, Vdara was definitely one of the nicest in terms of the room itself. Sitting area, kitchen w/ table, large bath, wall of windows, more like a nice city condo than a hotel room. Las Vegas can be sensory overload, so it really helped to be close to the action, yet be able to retreat into a comfortable, clean environment.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricky C
Reviews.Content: Hotels in las vegas always get extremely different comments, fortunately mine is a good one! Vdara have good location and convenient access to other hotels, we tried different buffet and different casinos nearby.... however, the pool is still too severe sunshine to swim, the same as Trump......

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional and amateur service. Worst stay in Vegas in 12 years!”
Reviews.Author: shanddallar
Reviews.Content: Joined trip advisor to write this review. I'm sure many people felt that their stay at Vdara was fine. However, it's when you run into problems and seeing how the hotel staff deals with problems that you really appreciate whether a hotel is good or not. Here is my terrible experience: I spent months planning for a family trip to Las Vegas to celebrate my husband's big 30th birthday. We saw that Vdara had good reviews and is new so ended up booking 3 rooms there. I even splurged and got the Vdara suite for my husband and I to make it extra special. Along with hotel arrangements, I also made reservations at Cut steakhouse one month ahead of time just to make sure that our party of 7 would get the reservation at the time we want. Then after dinner we would have enough time to get into our costumes and go to the Club that we want. It was Halloween weekend so I knew that it would be very crowded. The problem started almost immediately as we checked in to the hotel. First, we drove around looking for the self parking garage, and couldn't find it (or signs that say there's no self parking at Vdara). We circled around several times which is painful because Las Vegas blvd is busy. Finally I called and the hotel said that Vdara only does valet...which is unusual for Las Vegas. Anyway, so we dropped off our car and checked in. Our suite was pretty nice but as soon as I sat down on the couch in the living room, I felt my socks getting wet. There was a large wet spot on the carpet right in front of the couch. I'm sure many people will agree when I say how much I hate wet socks. Not sure what that puddle was (and praying it wasn't puke from previous guests), we called the hotel asking someone to take a look at it. Mind you that this was immediately as we got into the room on Friday afternoon. A guy came, looked at it, didn't offer anything useful and just gave us some towels to put on top. We decided against changing rooms at this time (bad mistake) because I had already unpacked and thought this spot should dry up soon. Moving on to Saturday, the big day. We got back to the hotel at 3pm and the room was still not made up. The wet spot was still just as wet as yesterday. We called the hotel asking someone to take a look at it again and to make up the room. By 4pm, still no one came. So we called again and then left for the pool for a quick bit of sun. Came back at 4:30 to get ready for the big night. Our dinner reservation is at 6pm. We were planning on being ready by 5:30 and have the family up in our suite for a quick round of drinks before heading out. As we walk up to our room, our door was open, there was a huge cart outside and 6 people in the room. We asked what is going on and apparently that wet spot was from a leak from the AC and they had moved all the furniture in order to strip the carpet!! Who does this during a guest's stay without asking them first whether if it's okay with them? To have 6 strangers go into your room with all your belongings tearing apart the living room is NOT what I expect to deal with at a 5 start hotel. Additionally, the maid is cleaning the bedroom and bathroom at the same time! Bear in mind that NO one had apologized to us at this time for this craziness. We asked if they could come back to do this after we check out tomorrow since we are now running late in getting ready for dinner. They hesitated...which in my opinion shouldn't even be an option for them...and finally agreed. But it took a long time for them to move back the furniture and clear out the room. Meanwhile the maid is still taking his time cleaning the bathroom so we still could not get ready. Imagine my husband and I just standing in the middle of the suite with all these strangers there and a mess everywhere while time is ticking away. By now, I decided that we need to switch rooms because there just isn't enough time waiting for these people to get out. Again no one was around to help us. We called the front desk explaining this and asking to switch us to the nearest room so we can get ready. One woman came over saying she is the manager then said she will ask the manager to see if we can get another room (....i thought she was the manager??). After several more phone calls by us to the front desk (because no one came back or called us), they said finally they found another room and someone will come to take us to the other room. Meanwhile I had to frantically clear out everything in the room and dump them in the luggages (which irritated me so much because all of our nice dressy clothes/costumes has to be shoved in the luggage). Still after an hour (now it's 5:30) no one has come to get us to a new room!!!! The restaurant couldn't move back our reservation because surprise surprise, it's full! So now we are looking at possibly missing our dinner reservation and having to scramble for some random restaurant that can accommodate 7 people at the last minute....after all the time I spent researching on restaurants. So I hauled my stuff down to my mother in law's room to use her shower. My husband still had to wait at the mess of a room for "someone" to come to take him to our new room. Any woman knows that 15 minutes is not enough time to shower and get ready for a fancy night that you had planned for months! I was so frustrated and overwhelmed at this time that I broke down in tears (which I NEVER do in public). We rushed out of the hotel (my hair wet) without being able to do our little pre dinner get together and luckily reached the restaurant without losing our reservation. On to the following day, sunday. I called the hotel front desk to speak to customer service to give them feedback on this terrible experience. The woman on the phone was apologetic and sounded sincere. She asked for my phone number and said that she will call me after talking to her manager and credit us some money back in an attempt to remedy the situation. I had calmed down by then and hearing someone apologizing finally made me feel better. I would have been okay without any credit back at this point but since she offered, I figured why not. Many days has passed since that day and no one from Vdara has called me. We saw a credit of $44.80 on our card.....what the heck does this mean? This is so insulting. Do they think that this horrible ordeal has a price of $44.80? Additionally, because we were rushed out of our suite in such a hectic manner, we forgot my husband favorite tiger's eye bracelet and our family halloween photo (that we paid for at the foundation room) in the suite. A reasonable person would see this and easily be able to figure out who this belongs to. Especially after this ordeal. They have our contact info, phone number, email, etc. They could have and should have contacted us immediately to notify us. Nope, no one did. We had to call the hotel's lost and found (after being on hold for a long time, then hung up on, then redialed) to find out that they do have our things but wasn't planning on letting us know! Sorry for the long rant. I feel so strongly about this and wanted everyone to know how unprofessional Vdara is. I feel like we were dealing with amateurs. We have stayed at almost every hotel in Las Vegas from 3-5 stars. No place was this terrible and unprofessional. I feel so insulted by this hotel. I will NEVER stay here again. I will tell all of our friends and family to not stay there. Oh last thing, the valet only situation at this hotel is very inefficient. Especially during check out time, there were crowds of people waiting outside for like 2 valets to run back and forth like crazy to get everyone's cars. Again, just another example of amateurs who set up this hotel. Save your preciously earned money and stay anywhere else instead. I recommend the Wynn which is our normal go to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: iamindy22
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and we would love to stay at Vdara again. The service was impeccable, the room was beautiful, the pool was smallish but very nice and the Wicked Spoon Buffet next door was well worth the walk. I would recommend Vdara to all and when we come back my wife and I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home in Vegas for a week!”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl82
Reviews.Content: Loved the Vdara. Room was very spacious, very,very comfy bed, we had a view of the pool. We stayed for a week from March 28th-April 4th while my little brother got married. We never had any problems with ordering anything to the room, true dishes weren't always there, but we asked for them at the beginning of the week and they always washed and restocked. Nice walk out to the strip, didn't take us too long. It was nice being attached to the Bellagio, and also so close to the Cosmopolitan, it was a great location, and it was nice coming "home" to a nice, quiet, non-smoky, no casino environment. Room was always cleaned, front desk was great, location was awesome, loved the room, and we got a great price. Spending a week in Vegas was definitely worth the suite with a kitchen. Would recommend the Vdara to anyone. This was my 3rd time to Vegas, and I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A great venue--ideal location and serene atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Westmount
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the Vdara. We were just in Vegas in July and stayed at the Wynn in a corner view deluxe, so we know our hotels. We wanted to try something different. Actually I think for a younger couple the Vdara is even better. Big bonuses for airy, non-smoky and serene lobby--very nice to come back to after the noise of slot machines/smoky casinos and 'see and be seen' venues like at the Cosmopolitan. But the biggest bonus is the location. You get a great-sized room with very modern decor, a super comfortable bed, a soaking tub with a separate shower, and if you opt for the second elevator bank, a great view of the Bellagio fountains. It's sort of a kiddie-corner view, so you don't get to see them all front and center as if you were staying at the Bellagio, but it's a great view of the fountains and the strip. Bonus points for: -cleaning our room first thing as we left around 9 am every morning. I absolutely DETEST big hotels where you are waiting around all day for someone to clean your room and you have to call down to housekeeping frequently -short check-in line (very much in contrast to the Wynn, where it took 1/2 an hour to initial checkin) -clean, neat, and smoke-free lobby with a great little cafe with great cappuccinos/espressos and snacks -indoor walkway to the Bellagio and all the amenities/shopping in the Bellagio -short tram to CityCenter/Crystals and Hermes (of course, gentlemen, that may NOT be good for you if your wife finds this out) -around the corner from restaurants at Aria and Cosmopolitan. We could walk to restaurants even in my 5 inch heels every night...so nice not to have to cab everywhere. -best location on the strip--proximate to everything. -Very helpful staff--extra kudos to the doormen/taxi stand staff. Really nice guys. All in all, I actually think we liked Vdara MORE than the Wynn! Negatives: -Vdara does not have gambling, shopping, and restaurant venues inside itself proper, so you have to walk to a restaurant. For us this wasn't a negative, but gamblers and diners who don't want to leave the property via a short walk or tram might not like it. For us it was well worth the short walk to have a QUIET place to come back to at night. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent!”
Reviews.Author: JacobOslo
Reviews.Content: There is only one word to describe this hotel: Excellent! The rooms are very nice and spacious offering a spectacular view of Las Vegas. The hotel in one of the few hotels in Vegas not having a casino located inside it. Great pool area with excellent drinks. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for quality”
Reviews.Author: MA L
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in an amazing hotel aside from the noise of all casino, this is the place. People were great, room was more than amazing, we had a free upgrade. they didn't have to do that! Only down side, no restaurant and one small restaurant/convenience store for breakfast but nothing to shadow the great experience.

Reviews.Title: “different, in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: Arif X
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Vegas practically every year since Elvis used to headline so i have stayed pretty much all over the place.This is the first time I have stayed at a no smoking, no gaming hotel and I have to say it was actually quite a pleasant surprise.The hotel smells fresh and is not as manic as all the others and yet it is linked to the Bellagio on one side and the Aria to the other so all the shopping/gaming/restaurant facities of those two hotels are at hand.the pool is not very large and can get quite crowded, people actually go down early to put their towels on sun loungers to reserve them, unbelievable! We saw Cirque Du Soleil's Elvis which despite bad reviews was excellent, not quite as good as Love but up there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Non-Gamblers”
Reviews.Author: StarleneS
Reviews.Content: Not everyone goes to Vegas to gamble and party. We went for the shows, the food, the shopping, the lake and the fun and the Vdara was the perfect place to stay. The room was a suite that was more like a small condo or apartment, complete with a washer and dryer, microwave and fridge. I loved it! I could live there... IF there were more closet space! But seriously, the hotel is super nice. My only complaint is that the restaurant/ store in the lobby closes so early. Still, that's not a huge problem because there's tons of other great places to go in walking distance. The Vdara puts you close enough to the excitement and at the same time, far enough away. I've stayed at the Bellagio and the Venetian before, but the Vdara is where I will stay from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazy_about_newyork
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is the best place on earth. This hotel is in a good location. Our hotel room view was over looking the belagio fountains, this was a fabulous way to wake up on a morning. I loved everything about this hotel the staff were friendly and and helpful which is always a plus. The pool area was relaxing yet had an upbeat vibe. Im hoping to return to vegas very soon and I would defs stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Walking Shoes”
Reviews.Author: jctejada
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is not quite on the strip so get ready to do a little walking. Your best bet is to take the skywalk to the Bellagio and venture out to the strip from there. If you walk out through the front door then you have to go through the side of the Metropolitan but the sidewalk ends before you can get to the strip so you are forced to cross the street and a little zig zagging here and a little zig zagging there and you are finally on the strip. So with all that said the Vdara offers a little something different then most of the Hotels on the strip since the Vdara is not exactly on the strip. It's quiet... the service was great and the rooms were awesome for the price we paid. Partying in Vegas can be draining so my friends and I slept like babies at the end of the night so yes the beds are very comfortable. One word of advice... don't take ANYTHING out of the minibar inside the fridge unless you intend to use it. I moved some stuff around to make room for some juices that we bought and little did I know that we were getting charged for them the moment we took it out the fridge. It looks like the fridge has a sensor so keep your hands off the merchandise unless you intend to use it. At the end of my stay I explain what happened and insured them that I just moved this stuff around and I didn't actually use any of that stuff and they refunded the cost to those items to my account. They didn't give me a hard time at all.

Reviews.Title: “One of the few hotels with no casino in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PippiVenice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the City Center, very well located to walk in Vegas. No casino, so it is much quieter than other hotels. All opened spacious suites, with kitchenette even if it is completely empty! This means the kitchenette is 100% useless (however, who would eat in the room in Vegas???). Curtains don't cover completely the windows, so in the early morning the sun come into the room... if you sleep in the dark (as I do) take a night mask with you. Check-out is at 11.00am, very early for Las Vegas. No turndown treatment except in the panoramic suites; cleanliness is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloBarrister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in August, was able to upgrade to a corner room which had a fantastic view of the fountains. Was very nice to come back to a quiet hotel after long nights out on the strip. Would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Panoramic Suite”
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel since it's Smoke free smaller than the mega resorts and very close to several great gaming hotels. The Panoramic suite is a very comfortable size with great views. These are located at the end of the hallways so they don't really share walls with any one so they are extremely quiet. The bedroom is completely separate from the living area really making it feel more like a condo than a hotel room. The bathroom was fantastic and the tub and separate shower faced a wall of windows and had such a great view. After a long night on the town I came back to a room that had been given the turndown treatment. WOW! This was totally unexpected. Although it's nothing more than preparing the bed for sleeping and laying out slippers in front of the bed. It made me feel special though. The rooms are very clean and housekeeping is top notch.If you like pillowy top beds these are awesome! Great quality sheets as well. Plenty of clean towels in all sizes. My only issue is that the check in checkout line is all mixed and if it's busy things can seem a bit unorganized. However the front desk staff is not only beautiful but quite polite and efficient. There really are no food options other than the glorified walk up counter called Vdara Market Cafe. This is not really a problem since Vdara and Bellagio are insanely close. One can walk to the Aria cafe in less than 5 min. The beauty of Vdara is in it's location behind the Cosmopolitan. You get the serenity of being off strip but in 5-10 min from the front door you can access Bellagio, Cosmo, PH, Aria, Monte Carlo, Mandarin Oriental (check out mandarin bar).

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RickCA
Reviews.Content: If you are sick of the sensory overload that is Las Vegas, but find that you have to be in town anyway for a conference or other business, Vdara is hard to beat. First thing that you'll notice as you walk into the lobby is that it is a smoke-free hotel. That, alone, is worth the visit in my book. The second thing that will strike you is.....the quiet. No casino noise because there is no casino! The check-in was painless, fast and in 10 minutes we were in our fantastic corner suite 25 floors up. Views were amazing and the comforts of the suite were first rate at twice the price. Very good value. I'm staying here any time I visit Las Vegas from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingThruEurope
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my birthday weekend and was given a complimentary upgrade to a fountain view room on the 38th floor! One word to describe the room- AMAZING! The view overlooking the strip and Bellagio fountains was just spectacular. The room itself was spacious, comfortable, and well-appointed. The bed had to be the most delicious and decadent thing I have ever slept in! We loved the fact that the hotel is non-smoking, non-gaming, but is just a short walk to Bellagio and City Center. The pool was okay, not great; but really appreciated the complimentary water served. We definitely found our new favorite hotel in LV!

Reviews.Title: “great time at quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: saundra14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Vdara in August of 2011 to attend the Magic show. Well, because I sometimes snore my boyfriend aND I wanted to stay at a nice place and get a bang for our buck. We stayed at Aria in Februay and although we like ARIA immensley, we always try to stay someplace different on each trip ,so this time we chose Vdara. Let me tell you, we were not at all disappointed. We were able to get a one bedroom suite for a very reasonable price. the room was kept clean ,very cool, as it was 112 degrees outside and sleeping was great. the bed was comfortable and so was the sleeper sofa. the kitchen was modern with all updated appliances including a garbage disposal, dishwasher and washer and dryer. the only complaint that I had was that we had to request silver ware and plates, but not a big deal. I am a gambler and he is not so i had no problems at night coming out of Vdara and walking right across to Aria. it was not convenient that there was no buffet or tons of restaurants but its Vegas, who stays in a room. . Overall it was a nice stay and we will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: adamjadam
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 weeks in the fantastic Vdara Las Vegas. This hotel is just amazing, offering 5 star delux luxury in the heart of Vegas. The all suite hotel is perfect for couples looking for a haven away from the noise; smoking; gambling of Vegas. Staying here is like staying in an exclusive private aprartment with everything you need for a great holiday. We stayed in 2 rooms; one at the back of the hotel looking over the desert; one at the front looking over the Vegas strip. Both rooms were amazing, you should go for the corner suites or even the penthouse suites if you have the cash !! The penthouse rooms and huge and decor is lovely! The rooms are the back of the hotel are quiter so take your pick - the rooms at the front can be noisy but you do get views over the strip and over the mountains. You do get aircon noise but will get used to that pretty quickly. Service is exceptional - discrete and attentive - nothing is too much trouble. Staff are friendly and efficient. Rooms are changed frequently, in some cases twice a day. Pool area and spa are lovely - small but not too busy. The pool area is trendy with music playing, waitresses and bar. The private beds and cabanas seem expensive, there were lots sunbeds, these are close together but ok. The Vdara market was very handy - good for breakfast snacks and emergency supplies if not a little expensive. The Vdara bar is cool and trendy but a little expensive. Good to sit and chill after wlaking around Vegas. Tip - just stay here. Stop looking around - book here !! You will have a great time. This hotel is like an oasis in the middle of Vegas frenzy. You will look forward to getting back to your hotel and will enjoy staying in. Tip2 - you can get onto the strip through the Belagio or Cosmopolitan hotel. its very close, takes a few minutes walking, no need for cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on a large room”
Reviews.Author: ajheili
Reviews.Content: I had found a great deal on a Corner City View suite online, but was having difficulty booking for that price online. The first time I called, I spoke to a slightly rude lady who didn't help me. I tried calling back later and had a very helpful lady help me out, and get the price I found online. My boyfriend and I spent two nights here, and enjoyed our room very much. The only complaint about the room was that the carpet was slightly damp in the bedroom. I'm not sure if they just had the carpet cleaned prior to our check-in, but it wasn't a big deal. The staff were fairly nice, and the room was very modern and sleek. The gym was small, but had what I wanted. They had extra towels and free bottled water down there. It is a step off the strip, and can be inconvenient to get back to las vegas blvd, but it was worth the short walk. I would stay here again if I found a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, service is less than expected”
Reviews.Author: Rafael C
Reviews.Content: I came to Vegas last minute for a weekend. I booked a room with vdara and upgraded for a fee to an 'executive' suite. The room is fantastic, the view is gorgeous. They give you a full kitchen and sitting area (like a small apt). The service is not good. They provide a full size kitchen. No plates, forks, knives, etc. only 2 cups and 2 small bottles of water. Since the air is very dry, we Ran out of water quickly. When asking for salt and pepper shakers,room service wanted to charge $5. Lemons for salad were $8. These little add-ons really frustrate me to the point that when leavings hotel, I'm really not interested in coming back here. On the checkout day, I requested to check my bags for the day and sit by the pool for the afternoon until my flight. If I want to use the spa for a shower before my flight, they want to charge me $25 per person. Forget the fact that's spent $3k to comets Vegas for the weekend, but that was the straw that broke the camels back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the Strip”
Reviews.Author: hmspcl
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's quiet & non-smoking, which is why we stayed in this hotel in the first place. The next best thing are the rooms, very clean, contemporary and functional (I just wished they'd do something about the table lamp's archaic switch. It took me a while to figure it out!). The next best best thing is the tram that connects the hotel from Bellagio all the way to Monte Carlo. The negatives are there's very few places to eat in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelly b
Reviews.Content: Good points - hotel is non smoking, about a two minute walk to the main strip and very clean. The staff were always friendly and although on arrival we were booked into a ground floor room without a view, this was soon sorted so we could see the whole strip from a higher floor. Bad points - this hotel doesnt have the bar space or restuarant you can expect in other hotels so if you dont want to go out in the evenings this can be quite a souless place. However who wants to come to Vegas and not explore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vegas Hotel minus one snafu”
Reviews.Author: nbk5276
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for my sister in-laws 40th birthday celebration. Check in was prompt and painless. We were in a corner executive suite on the 24th floor. One of the primary reasons we chose this hotel, is that it does not have a casino in it. The room was quite spacious and flowed very nicely. The decor was modern minimalist which I really appreciated. My two main criteria in which I judge a hotel room are the bed which was quite nice I slept very comfortably. The second criteria is the water pressure in the shower. I have to admit the water pressure was lacking. Our room had many windows and it was nice that these were all easily controlled electronically and the room did include blackout curtains. My review title mentions a snafu. As this trip was to celebrate a milestone birthday. I had arranged some special treats for the birthday girl prior to our arrival with the concierge. Her room was supposed to have some birthday balloons and a plate of choclates and fruit waiting in her room. Well this didn't happen! I immediately called down to the concierge to see what had happened. Alleriese told me she had seen the balloons go up, and I must be mistaken. I told her that I was in her room and they were not there. She basically called me a liar which was unacceptable. She did not offer to investigate or look into what had happened. We were pressed for time as we had tickets to a cirque show and had to leave. I did stop by the front desk on the way out and mentioned what had happened. I wanted to talk to the concierge but over our 4 day trip there was always line for the concierge. Luckily upon our return the snafu had been corrected. But I still had a sour taste in my mouth from my dealings with Allerise. So the next morning I went down early to discuss this situation with the hotel manager. He was not available however Hakan the chief concierge was. I relayed the situation from the previous night, and indicated my lack of faith for there execution on the birthday cake that was supposed to be delivered the following day. Hakan went to great lengths to assure me this would be executed as I wanted, and followed up with me several times to reassure me that things would go as planned. Overall it was Hakan's attentiveness making things right that allows this review to be a 4 versus a 1 or 2. Would I stay here again, Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian m
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vdara in mid-September 2011. The hotel is even better than described on the official website. On arriving we were dealt with very quickly, reception staff being both very helpful and friendly. We requested a high room in advance and got the 43rd floor with a magnificent view over Vegas. As already mentioned there was no crockery or silverware to use in the kitchen BUT there was a note to request these which we did and almost immediately everything needed for two people arrived which would have allowed us to make a 3 course meal if we had wanted. I kept all the dishes etc in the cupboards and they were never removed by the cleaning staff. The shop and cafe was excellent and very reasonable so we used it to buy salads and desserts. Many people went there to collect breakfast in the morning. The pool was quite busy but we could always get loungers. There was a bit of glare on the building but we just put up our umbrella until the sun moved a little, it was not a problem. This was one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in and would recommend it to anyone staying in Vegas. The downside to some, but not us, was there is no casino and no smoking but that made it so peaceful to return to. The only real downside was the $20 +tax a day”Resort Fee” which is just a hidden unavoidable way of raising the rate.I am surprised that such an excellent hotel employs this rip-off tactic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view nice room”
Reviews.Author: athena2vctory
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my birthday trip. we check in from 26th -28th, we got a room at 47th fl with fantastic fountain view. The view was awesome the room itself is ok. Other than that nothing really Wows me, I love the fact that the hotel is in walking distant to Aria and Bellagio, however; the hotel is quite distant to the strip and the other hotels. Having know that the crystal, Aria, Vdara and Bellagio are one Giantic complex but the direction from those places to Vdara is lack. We got lost a few times trying to get back the hotel. I love their bed, just thinking to bring one home, I was really soft and gives you the support feel so refresh everyday. But whoever is cleaning my room need some improvement, I found an orange m&m next to my bed on the second day but clearly I didn't purchase any m&m I have no idea where the m&m comes from ?! in additon, the towel looks old and feel tough. I love the staffs in Vdara they are amazing, we request shuttle service to the airport, the concierge and the bell man was very friendly and helpful but I have to say the front desk makes me feel like annoying and stupid. I mean the girls look great but they need to know how to treat their guest right at least be polite, there was a girl standing in the lobby and asking people whether they are checking out when I told her I did the TV thing and her simple reply where is your key and turn her back while I was trying to ask her where to store my luggage. Other than that staying at Vdara was quite awesome I might go back just for their bed and view

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MsNick
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Vdara from 10/21-10/23. It's a nice, modern hotel. No casino, no smoking, no problem! Sometimes it's refreshing to not have to deal with the noise of a casino. No worries, if you feel like gambling, Bellagio and Aria are a few steps away. The first night, we went to Haze at Aria. The walk was very easy, right over the bridge. The second night, we saw O at the Bellagio. Another very easy walk. We also ate at the Bellagio buffet (not one of my favorites). The room is a nice size, beds are comfortable, very nice layout. Face towels in the bathroom seem to be scarce....but all in all, great trip, will return in February for my birthday. Only other complaint, the "tram" in the City Center can be confusing at times. Only use it if you need to go to Crystal's or Monte Carlo. Otherwise, it really serves no purpose to the other hotels. You're better off walking to Aria or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Resort fee, mattress disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jpatter1
Reviews.Content: Cool, modern hotel. no casino, which I like. Reasonably priced, until they tack on the "resort fee". Considering they don't even deliver a paper in the morning, and there's no coffee maker in the room, a $20/night fee is offensive. The mattress is cheap and sags in the middle, which is surprising for such a beautiful hotel. The Market cafe downstairs took 30 minutes to fix a bagel sandwich. I probably wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but”
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: I wish I could rate this hotel a 5. I am not a demanding person and this is the first time that I have to rate a hotel. The property itself can be a 5 but the front desk staff is a 2. They sound energetic and professional but nothing can be accomplished unless you call them to follow-up on your request several times. I've never stayed at a 4 star hotel with so many deficiencies: 1. There is no safe in some suites (took us 5 phone calls to confirm) 2. The sofa bed in our suite cannot be opened because there isn't enough room. The front desk staff said that this problem could be easily fixed by calling housekeeping. She made me sound stupid. It's rather mean to say because it's terrible to find out that you cannot use a sofa bed at 2 am. 3. The alarm clock does not work. 4. The telephone in the bathroom does not work. So, good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for 10 nights, had a great room on the 21st floor with a view of the Bellagio fountains. There are no negative comments to give, just positive. The staff are great and the location is too. We stayed at the Venitian last year (where the rooms are a little tired) but so glad that we chose this one this year. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fernuch01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vdara for 6 nights, we had a deluxe suite with a view of the Bellagio fountains on the 24th floor. Room was very nice and really clean, the housekeeper staff do a great job everyday. The hotel is non smoking which we really enjoyed even myself being a non smoker. Staff were very friendly and also said hello when passing by. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good...”
Reviews.Author: TravelFever
Reviews.Content: Had a deluxe suite with a view of the Bellagio fountains, which was great. The bed was very comfortable. The room was nicely appointed and arranged. The building is smoke-free! Free valet, and they get your car in less than five mins every single time. Only one block from all the action on Las Vegas Blvd., so very convenient location. The lobby, lounge and bar (indoor and outdoor) area were very nice. I had to take one star away because the bathroom was not perfectly clean (and a hotel bathroom must be perfectly clean) and the soundproofing could be better. We were very lucky the people next door were just talking... there was a room at the other end of our floor that we heard partying from the hallway.... if we were next to them, I would have had to move. Overall, I would definitely stay there again... it was so nice be to in a smoke-free environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip, Hotel is OK”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict082
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Vegas and we booked a bit last minute so decided Vdara looked interesting. We stayed at Encore last time and I like to try different places but I wished we stayed there again. That being said, we didn't really "get" the Vdara until you go there. Apparently it was supposed to be timeshares or condos that why the kitchenettes. The first night I was kept up because of the disco at the Cosmopolitan. I asked to move and they let us however, the second room was a little smaller. I didn't really care since I would sleep better. The pool was open and it's okay. It's a really short walk to Aria and City Centre and although it's sort of on the strip it still takes a while before you get there. We ate at Beso it was really good and I enjoyed the atmosphere. My husband used the Concierge for booking his golf at two courses and they were very helpful. He really liked them both and played 2 for cheaper than a round at the Wynn course ($500). We saw ELVIS at the Aria and it was good. The next night we ate at Caesars and then saw Celine. That was really amazing. It was sold out and I went back three times. The ladies were so nice that when more seats were released they kept 2. After my husband came back from golf we tried again, they held them up and winked to me that I had forgot my credit card - they were awesome seats!!! I really loved Vegas this time. I think because you know the set up of everything. I do however think I'll break my golden rule and stay at the same place twice - ENCORE - it was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: PatrickCA15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my best friend for 5 nights early October and enjoyed it immensely! The staff were very helpful & courteous! This is a fairly new hotel (< 2 years old) and everything was immaculate! My only concern was the fact that it only has one king size bed and a pull-out sofa. The only rooms with 2 beds are the penthouse suites. There was a resort fee of $20 per day per room ---which includes free wi-fi and use of the pool faciliities. The spa is an additional $25 per day per person which allows unlimited access for the day. However, the spa itself is quite small. The spa at the Aria Hotel is much larger with more facilities at the same cost. But overall, had a great experience at the Vdara! Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jo c
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe suite which was really nice. The room was very spacious, it was self contained which was a bonus. The hotel does not have a casino however this appealed to us as we are not big into the casino scene. The hotel does not have any dinner restaurants so the closest was ARIA however this is just across the road very convenient. The staff we ok... the pool bar waiters were so rude! no tip given! the rest of the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Corner Suite was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: CFSilver
Reviews.Content: Corner Suite was great - clean, modern, spacious, quiet, comfortable bed & pillows, luxury linens, excellent maid service, fantastic workout facililty, professional & friendly staff. We were extremely pleased. Very good value. Loved it being smoke-free and casino-free! A bit away from the heart of the Vegas strip but perfect for us; we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Splash out for the 5 star treatment”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHall95
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget, always stay Sun-Thurs in Vegas. Hotel rooms are much cheaper then. That made staying in the Vdara affordable. Usually it would be way out of our league. It's brand new and stunning. The rooms are all suites. We had the smallest and it was still huge. Like something off the movies. The staff were really helpful and they cleaned the room whatever time of day was necessary, so you didn't feel rushed to vacate ths room. The pool area is really cool and not as noisy as most Vegas party pools. There is music though, so it's certainly not boring. It's location is great, right in the heart of the strip. But I recommend spending plenty of time within the City Center development, which the Vdara is part of. A great shopping, dining and entertainment complex that's really high class and can feel like a totally different side of Vegas. All in all, a breathtaking hotel. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Low key!”
Reviews.Author: Milla3131
Reviews.Content: Vdara is the perfect place if you're looking for something close to all the action but want a nice, quiet place to stay. Smoke and casino free, Vdara was clean and comfortable yet within steps of casinos, shopping, and restaurants. I forgot some clothing in the closet of the hotel and Vdara offered to ship it to me for free! The only negatives: Vdara only has one restaurant, which has a limited menu. Also, the gym was very small and always packed when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new, Fairly Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColonelAudubon
Reviews.Content: Just stayed three nights at the Vdara in Las Vegas. The hotel room was nice with contemporay decor. We took a Grey Line shuttle from the airport to the hotel, which we would later regret. Had a little wait to check in but the front desk employee apologized for our wait and was very courteous.
