After check in, we went to our room. Entered through a small kitchenette. Had an honor bar that was well stocked. Large bedroom with table and chairs, sleeper sofa, desk and chair. Spacious bathroom. Bed was comfortable. I only have a few negative comments regarding my stay: I was charged a spa fee that I am not sure what it really covered. I was supposed to receive two bottles of water and a paper each day. Never received the paper and two original water bottles were never replenished. I did not get much sleep on the third night stay. The room next store was partying hard until 2:00 am and I had to be up by 3:30 am to catch a 4:00 am shuttle to the airport for a 9:00 am flight. I complained about the noise next door. It was quiet for a while then started up again, so a little unhappy about that night, but overall liked the Vdara very well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Vdara with my boyfriend as part of a multistop trip. We have both been to Las Vegas a few times before and this hotel is a real find. The rooms are large, very well designed and extremely comfortable. There are windows the full length of the room making the rooms beautifully bright and the night time strip view fabulous. The bed is large and comfortable as is the seating area. The bathrooms are large and bright, scrupulously clean with a fantastic shower unit along with bath and double sinks etc. We ordered room service one night, the menu was varied and the food very reasonably priced. It was delivered promptly and set out in our dining area so it looked like we were in a restaurant! The food was restaurant quality as well. The staff throughout were smart, polite and exceptionally helpful although anticipate a wait if you wish to deal with the theatre ticket booking desk! All in all a great hotel if you don't want a casino in your hotel. It's location means this isn't a problem but it may but some people off. Lovely bars and cafe/restaurants downstairs and a large spa made it perfect for us as a young couple.

Reviews.Title: “dissapontiment”
Reviews.Author: Yulia G
Reviews.Content: We were promised the top floor with the view on Belagio hotel 24 hrs prior to arrival. The room was not ready by the time of check in. We had to wait about 1.5 hrs.. The bathroom does not have a hair dryer (it is a standard even in a low rate hotels anywhere). The view from the 48th floor window is amazing! The $10/ person per day resort fee is a rip off. We did not use any of those things. We were never told by anyone that it will be a resort fee. The valet parking people do a great job to run the operation, but i am not sure it is efficient and convenient for the travelers to call and wait for the car to be delivered. Also, I am very sensitive to smells - the hotel over uses scented cleaning chemicals, IMO. The pool is amazing. The people are friendly and helpful. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara or Aria? The answer is quite simple ...”
Reviews.Author: omans
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 10 days, staying at the Vdara. We were lured by the no smoking and no casino aspect of this hotel, more on that later .... I had emailed the hotel one month before to let them know it was my husbands 50th birthday and was there any chance of a complimentary upgrade to a fountain view. I received a reply saying no problem - great! We checked in on a Tuesday afternoon - no queue but there definately is on Friday through Sunday, as weeekends are busier. We were given a room on the 16th floor, with no view! I rang and spoke to the front desk and reminded them of my original email and their reply. The best they could do was offer a possible move to a view room the next day. We have never done this in our lives but decided to agree and the next day we moved to a room (43032) on the 43rd floor with a full fountain view - fantastic! The room service was good, cleaned everyday but the last and we rang and requested, cups, pan (for boiling water, no kettles provided and robes and slippers) all with us within one hour. The hotel is modern and clean,. The Market Cafe is very small for the size of the hotel and is the only place you will find for food. Silk Road was not open once in our 10 day stay. Always a sign saying private party. It was sometimes used for conference dinners etc. I dont think we would have used it anyway as its a strange space age kind of bar, not very welcoming. Bar Vdara is weird, an afterthought. The outdoor seating and (swing?) looks out onto the car parl - nice! We all know that part of the Vegas holiday is the weather (which was great) which in turn means a great pool is essential. There is where the hotel fails, big time. For the size of the hotel, the pool is completely inadequate. It doesnt get sun until 10am (opens at 8am) and then to stay in the sun you would have to chase the sun around the pool, moving from bed to bed. The beds are crammed in each one touching the next, Im really not exaggerating. The space that is taken up for cabanas is wasted, I didnt see one used! There is a small jacquzzi too. We used the pool two mornings and tried one afternoon. I have never seen so many people crammed into one space, there wasnt a single bed unoccupied. This is not my idea of fun! There is music, which is a bit loud but bearable. At the weekends the music is turned up to give a `party atmosphere'. Several people complained, as in such a small space it was just too loud, they were taken no notice of. I dont mind music but want to be able to relax by the pool, which just wasnt possible. We decided to take matters into our own hands and went to see the concierge. If you want hours stolen from your holiday, this is the place. Sometimes only manned by one person and some staff more helpful than others, not good at all. We had already had a look around the Aria and Bellagio pools. We asked could we have some kind of pass to other hotel pools in the group (Aria/Bellagio). After much discussion the Manager at the Aria pool agreed we could have a pass for the next day. We went to the Aria the next day, amazing!!!! Three big pools, all bigger than the one at Vdara (not including the liquid party pool). Three big jaquzzis. Lots of trees, space and beds. It was heaven. Some music playing but not intrusive. We had a chat with the Aria pool Manager and he agreed that we could come to the Aria pool again. We went every day!!!! This saved our holiday, it sounds extreme but it made such a difference, it was wonderful. We spent so much time at the Aria. The smoking and casino element was just not an issue. We like a bit of a gamble and didnt really notice the smoking. There are so many choices for food. We ate at Blossom (Chinese) pricey but gorgeous. Sweet Chill, basic pastries/breakfast, never too busy. We also ate at Beso (Eva Longorias steak house in Crystals, not too pricey and great) and Wolfgang Puck in Crystals, pizza/pasta good value. We also had dinner at the Eiffel Tower restaurant in Paris for my husbands birthday, gorgeous (book ahead for a great table). Apologies for the long review but wanted to get in as much as we could. I have no problem paying a resort fee (there is no choice!) but felt we should have paid ours to Aria as that was the hotel, hands down, that provided us with a great holiday. Next time we go to Vegas, we would happily stay at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Superb quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel - non-smoking, no casino, fabulous pool - a true oasis. And for those who do want Las Vegas and all its offerings you are right on the Strip. We were greeted warmly at check-in, the valet parking was efficient and courteous, all of the hotel, including corridors and pool area, was absolutely immaculately clean. I would recommend it for families in particular and couples who want the spa and the luxury of a well kept hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Martyexpert
Reviews.Content: We just ended a 3 night stay at the VDARA hotel in Vegas. This hotel room was amazing. The bathroom is bigger then any regular hotel room in Europe!!! We had a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains! We were staying in room 43010. The suite is fully equipped with a kitchen, Bosh Washer and dryer and all the amenities you need from a 5 star hotel. The only bad thing about it is the kitchen as nothing included in it. Not even a spoon. You have to call and ask for everything. They'll bring it up to your room but it is still a phone call away... The swimming pool is awesome. The reception area is small and very cozy. The staff is very friendly and the girls working the reception are beautiful and classy. You don't feel like your in Vegas as there are no casino in this hotel. This is a big plus. You can get away from all that noise by going back to your hotel. The concierge booked for us at Circo next door at the Bellagio and we asked for a good table as it was our friends wedding and we got the best table of the restaurant. Both my wife and I loved it. We stayed in a suite on the 62nd floor of the Encore last year but the VDARA is better for all the reasons above plus the location is perfect being in the center of the strip. We would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL OF YOUR VALUBLES!, THEY WILL GET SWIPED!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheMusikMan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty decent overall, until I noticed things going missing. I filed a report for a missing item and so far little to nothing has been done. This hotel is a very expensive stay! Housekeeping must assume that things are easy to replace for the people that stay there. I will NEVER stay there again. I expect things like that from little seedy motel 6's.

Reviews.Title: “Overall bad experience”
Reviews.Author: m124124
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the property is indeed very nice. Just like other people mentioned, I especially appreciated the smoke-free atmosphere. I also appreciate being off the Strip, but at the same time within easy walking distance. Check-in was slow -- but so is at any other Vegas hotel I suppose. Express check-out on the TV did not work, and there was a big line at check-out (even bigger than check-in), so a hotel employee was collecting room keys and writing things down on a notepad and that was checkout. She said I would be receiving the hotel bill via email, but never did. I did, however, receive a spam message thanking me for staying there. We got our rooms off the price line website for $80/night each and felt we did not receive the price line treatment that some people sometimes report, which was a pleasant surprise. I am giving it a bad rating because of the following: we had two rooms. In one room we took a drink from the minibar to see how many ounces it had and put it back. We were charged $9 despite the fact we called and was told they would take it off the bill. The second room, my dad who was on his first visit to the US accessed a paid movie on the TV and backed out as soon as he realized it was paid. I explained this to the check-out lady with the notebook and she said would take the charge off, but that did not happen either. In conclusion I was charged on my credit card for things we did not purchase and they said they would fix it, but did not.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with some minor gripes”
Reviews.Author: NineEighteen
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here this week and generally we were impressed. We booked a 'Vdara suite' which was very comfortable and big. The bathroom was enormous and well equipped and views from the lounge and bedroom quite nice (36th) floor...although ours faced east whereas a Bellagio view would surely have been better. The room was quite dusty when we arrived which gave the impression it had been empty for a while but that was cleaned by the next day. You need to get out of bed to switch off the bedroom lights which seems odd. The resort fee seems a bit cheeky, I'm not sure why it's not simply rolled into the rate. $20 + tax a day seems a bit steep for a couple of bottles of water and Internet access but this seems to be par for the course in Vegas nowadays. Market Cafe does the most amazing cinnamon rolls and the coffee is good. Queue can be long but service seemed brisk.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and party in vegas”
Reviews.Author: LbVictoria
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 night stay at Vdara which was wonderful. The trip was to meet my sister from the uk (we live in Canada) We spilt our time sightseeing, relaxing by the Vdara pool and partying. This hotel was the perfect base, near the casinos but without the hustle and bustle The hotel staff were supper helpful, when we booked in we were allocated two rooms on the 8th floor with no view but after returning to reception we were quickly swapped to the 35th floor with a view of the fountains We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in LAS”
Reviews.Author: nizora
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the hotel, or should I say apartment as the room was fully equipped with everything you need in an apartment. Our room was upgraded to corner hospitality suite,which was far too big for what we needed. It has 2 bedrooms, big lounge, kitchen , laundry and third toilet for guest and beautiful view to the Belagio fountain. We picked this hotel due to the non smoking rule which is very rare in LAS, and location,location. We will not hesitate to recommend this hotel ,and will definitely stay here again if ever we come back to LAS.

Reviews.Title: “Away from it all, but still in it!”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Close enough to aria but so quiet and tasteful. Rooms biggest ive had in vegas. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service and bogus $20 resort fee charge”
Reviews.Author: savvasavva7
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves one star.... I'm still staying here as a guest, so my review may be updated by the time I leave later in the week. Here's the problem: 1) the hotel room toilet seat was never cleaned. Housekeeping never bothered to clean the seat. I went to walgreens, bought my own bleach and wiped it down myself. 2) I paid a $20.00 "resort fee" fit each night I stay at the hotel. This amount is in addition to the room rate and taxes that I pay. Supposedly, the $20.00 is used to cover costs relating to free daily newspaper, Internet access. Well we never got our paper. What makes this whole situation worse is how customer service was handled by the hotel staff. So after I didn't notice a paper in my room I called the front desk and inquired. The representative who answered the phone at 10:05pm on 10/19/2011 said that there were plenty of newspapers available at the front desk for me to pick up. She told me to go downstairs and get my selection. I went downstairs and didn't see anything. Plus, there was a long line at the front desk so logically I went over to the desk just off tk thr side and asked the Asian woman on duty there for help. She frowned, and wasn't helpful at all. She told mr there weren't any papers either and that if I wanted one I needed to walk over to the aria hotel to get it myself. Frustrated, I went back to my room, complained to the front desk about this and asked them to remove the $20.00 resort fee charge. Word of advice to all travelers: you should not have to pay $20.00 for a daily newspaper that was promised and never delivered. Also, you should not have to physically walk downstairs to get something that wasn't ever available in the first place.you should also never expect to get good customer service at vdara. I'm still at the hotel right now. Hopefully they'll work out their mistakes before I leave their premises. And I hope they will remove the $20 charge that they agreed to do.  I told the blond security lady working the night shift on 10/19/11 and she promised to find a paper for me, which she did and had personally delivered it to my room. Thank you. She worked hard to find it for me. Regardless, I am still not paying the $20 bogus charge for the night. I will be writing to other travel websites about this bogus $20 resort fee and terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, but might not go back”
Reviews.Author: missmattie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe Suite on the 27th floor. We had a partial view of the fountains at Bellagio (we could pretty much see the whole thing - see photos). The room was nice - it was clean. There looked like a stain on the floor that they tried to get rid of, but it wasn't that noticeable. I liked how spacious the room felt. We had the one with a single TV instead of the one that has a separate living room from the bedroom. The bed was comfy and the pillows were very fluffy. The elevators are quick and the walk from the elevator to your room is really short. We intended to use the kitchen but didn't bother. You have to request kitchen utensils if you want to use the stove. There is no coffee maker in the room - first time I've ever seen this. There is a small fridge - VERY small. If you have left overs from dinner, it might not fit. To smaller than average sized bottles of water fit and that's about it. The Marketcafe on the main floor sells 6-packs of eggs, bacon, etc which was handy. Housekeeping did a good job each day. They always arranged our toiletries & stuff in the washroom very nicely. They would forget things from time to time - one day they forgot to give us face cloths, another day they forgot to leave a bath mat, another day they didn't replenish the shampoo (which I loved by the way. It was their own brand and for whatever reason, it left my hair very shiny). The shower has a rain showerhead so the pressure isn't strong, which I kinda missed. In terms of location, it's in between Aria and Bellagio. Valet is complimentary, but if you want to self-park you have to do it at Aria and either walk through Aria to Vdara or take the tram from Monte Carlo (which is right by the self-parking lot, maybe a 2 min walk) to Bellagio. If you take the tram, take the elevator down because it's closer to the doors to Vdara. You can also park at Bellagio but the walk from the self-parking lot to Vdara is a bit longer because you have to make your way through the casino & hotel. I think it was still about a 10 min walk even though the parking lot is actually right next to Vdara. I didn't check out the pool because it was cold while we were there. I didn't think i would, but I missed having a casino in the hotel. If we wanted to do anything we had to walk all the way to Aria, Bellagio or drive somewhere. When you're really tired after walking around all day, the trek back to Vdara was kind of annoying. I have stayed in Aria before and think I would prefer to stay there. I had very little interaction with customer service - they left me a message once because housekeeping said they weren't able to clean my room because of the Do Not Disturb light when in fact they did clean our room. The person I spoke to was very nice and apologetic. I lost & found on the last day because my husband lost a hat somewhere between the tram at Bellagio and the self-parking lot at Aria and I was asked to hold and nobody came back after 20 min. When I called again I got someone totally different and they helped me. We prepaid for this trip using expedia. When we checked in, they had to pre-authorize $100/night + the resort fee/night on our credit card. Make sure you have enough room to cover this or else you might not get your room! We have never had to do this in any other hotel we stayed at in Vegas before, so it was quite the surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome No Smoking with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: WileyMartinez
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. This is one of the nicest hotels. The first thing you will notice when you walk in is the amazing smell of no smoke, it just smells clean like a spa. The lobby is small, but quiet. There is a small bar and market place, which by the way was great for breakfast. We were on the 45th floor and had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain show (free upgrade when we asked about it). The hotel staff was so nice at check in and answered all of our questions. There is a quick walkway to the Bellagio and Aria is a two minute walk across the street. We even walked to Planet Hollywood in heels by going through the Cosmopolitan, and it took maybe 10-15 minutes. We spent two days at the pool, which had great food and great service. Our room had everything thing you could need and it was huge. We booked all of our shows through the concierge service and they were so nice and accommodating. We had to check out at noon but our flight was not until six that night, so the hotel held onto our suitcases until we went to the airport for no charge. The resort fee of $20 is a bummer but we knew about that before we got there so it was no surprise. As we left the hotel we both decided we will definitely stay there again and that we must bring more friends since our room was so huge (supposedly we had the smallest kid of room available) and it was still huge! Oh and I loved the Ipod hook up in the room. Looking forward to my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Dvanle
Reviews.Content: We had four nights in the basic room but what a wonderful four night. Room was spacious, clean and new! Bed was comfortable and very quiet in the evening. Easy access to Aria, City Centre and the walk to New York New York is pleasant if you stick to all indoor accesses (Via Aria and City Centre). Great to walk into lobby that smells fresh and clean. No smoking anywhere! We had a wonderful view of the Bellagio Fountain and I enjoyed the display every night! One downside, more staffing for the Market cafe to reduce the queue just for a coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Vdara - Quiet, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1000IslandsGuy
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Vdara. One of the nicest Hotels I have stayed at and great value. Get higher floor as view from 12th sucked. Nothing going on at all in lobby. Really tough to get to strip and Bellagio is a hike. Arria is right across street. Nice no noise and no smoking. Pool is very nice. Resort fee of $20 a day is ridiculous. It isn't a resort. Just be aware that this Hotel is a place to sleep, very comfortably, and you need to taxi or walk to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: jcrb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in October 2011. We had booked a city corner suite but were upgraded (at no extra cost) to an executive corner suite on the 38th floor. I have rated it as 5/5 and even after spending the following 3 nights in the Mandarin Oriental I would say it's more like 4.5/5 - taking into account the difference in price. The suite was huge and had a great view of the Bellagio fountains and North up the strip. The suite was lovely and had all the amenities you would expect. The large fridge (including iced water dispenser) was welcome. We were sent a bottle of sparkling wine after we checked in which was a nice touch. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful including the housekeeping staff who did a great job. The hotel is in a good location although it is not directly on the strip - it really is an oasis of calm! The hotel is connected via a (mostly) indoor walkway to the Bellagio which is really the centre of the action in Vegas. The Aria is literally a 1 minute walk in the other direction and there's always plenty of taxis outside. There are a few bad points though: i) the room had a few cosmetic blemishes (chips to woodwork etc); ii) the air conditioning unit was located (I think) next to the bed and was a little noisy at night; iii) if you want a truly 5 star experience the Vdara is a league below the Mandarin Oriental. For the price we paid though I can't really fault the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Non-Casino Hotel”
Reviews.Author: monw30
Reviews.Content: I love this place!!! I will definitely stay here again! The rooms are huge and have a nice view of the back side of the strip. The bed was comfortable. I loved the bathroom and the size. The kitchenette was nice and having a small table to eat at was great. I did find it a little odd that there was no dishes or cooking utensils in the rooms but I don't go to Vegas to cook so it was fine for me. Room service was great and the food was good. I loved that there was no casino and no smoke smell. the lobby and lounge are pretty, quiet and relaxing. The spa is amazing!!! I had the best massage ever!!!!! Staff was friendly and easy to deal with. Valet only was a little bit of an inconvenience during busy times but was still nice. Overall a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Mrs8a_86
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay at the Vdara after reading reviews and knowing it is one of the newest hotels in Vegas but my excitement quickly ended as soon as we arrived. We arrived at 5:30pm and were told our room was not ready yet and we would have to wait an hour for one to become available. After a while waiting at the front desk for them to try and find us something sooner they told us they found a room and it was an "upgrade". When we reached our room we realized it was not an upgrade but a smaller room than what we had originally booked! I booked a room with 2 bathrooms and this one only had 1. There was also dirty dishes in the dishwasher that smelled. We called front desk to tell them that this room was not working for us and we needed a room with 2 bathrooms and all of a sudden there was one available. We then moved rooms to the one we had originally booked and we walk in and 3 lights in the room have burned out light bulbs so it was pretty dark. We ended up calling front desk again to let them know because we didn't want to spend our vacation in dark and they waived the resort fee. Jeez thanks but that's the least they could do for all the inconvenience. We also missed dinner reservations because it took so long to get everything straightened out. All in all the rooms we nicely decorated and the beds were super comfy. The bell guy was very nice as was the maid but we come to Las Vegas at least 3 times a year and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: pontiac_grandam
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is very nice and still has that “new” feeling. The location of Vdara is kind of poor (it’s in City Center but the one way in the back and farthest from the strip). They provide a tram to Aria, Crystals and Monte Carlo which we ended up using a lot to save us from walking to and from the hotel/strip. There’s also a hallway that connects Vdara to Bellagio which was handy. This hotel doesn’t have a casino and lacks restaurants (does have a café) so they almost force you to leave if you want to do anything. Vdara could use some more people working at the front desk; at any given time it seems like only 2 were working and there always seemed to be a line. Our room was clean and large; we were on the backside of the hotel so we didn’t have a good view of the strip. The bed is my biggest complaint; it was super hard and uncomfortable. If you can’t stand hard beds then maybe this hotel isn’t for you. We ended up walking through Aria and The Cosmopolitan and both seemed to have more going on and more glamorous/chic than Vdara. I think they’re both a little more expensive but it’s probably worth it. Next time in Vegas I’ll be staying at one of those instead of Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: olive24
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Vdara. Stayed in the City Corner Suite. Great location - close to casino and restaurants at Aria and Bellagio. Enjoyed the spa and salon at Vdara but also recommend the Aria spa.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR COUPLES”
Reviews.Author: PAMCD
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is situated midway down the strip set in behind the Bellagio with about A 7 Minute walk to Las Vegas Blvd.. It is a non smoking, non gambling property. The rooms are large with great views and modern decor and comfortable beds. The staff is friendy, and helpful, but the front desk can get busy with usually only 2-3 staff on. Only 1 cafe and bar, so plan to eat elswhere. The pool is on the small size, get down by 10am to have a choice of where to sit. Cabana's can be purchesed for $50.00 for the day which is recommended if you plan on spending more than an hour at the pool. Lots of pool umbrella's if you choose not to book a cabana. Its quite, fresh and a break from the hussle and bussle of the strip. We would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The New Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Kurlandf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutley beautiful. The staff was friendly,helpful and made you felt welcome. This hotel is no gaming,but thats ok as it is tucked away in the city center. There are other gorgeous hotels just steps away to gamble. We were here for four days and didn't set foot on the strip! The city center has everything you need with shopping, restaurants and casinos. We go to Vegas a couple of times a year and were getting tired of the same old crowds. This stay has make Vegas our new favorite vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but watch out for extras”
Reviews.Author: kirsty007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really beautiful and nice without casino (honestly!). The pool is lovely. The extra's will kill you though... cocktails by the pool, even coffee from the cafe are all ridiculous. That's how they keep the room prices down so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Gavleng
Reviews.Content: This is my new favourite Vegas hotel. Just returned from five nights at this wonderful hotel and can't recommend it enough. Check in was very fast and we got a free room upgrade simply by asking nicely. The room was amazing and spotlessly clean. Bed was fantastic along with the very high quality bedding and pillows. We were very impressed with the hotel and the fact that it was a smoke free, casino free property that just oozed sophistication.I have never been in a hotel that smelled so clean and fresh, it is quite simply amazing. The hotel is situated just off the strip in the city centre complex, but it is very easy to reach the strip via the Bellagio, Aria hotel or Crystals shopping centre. It took us about 5 minutes to reach the strip at a leisurely pace, but if you don't like walking then maybe you would be better paying a bit more to stay at the Cosmopolitan as the rooms in both hotels are pretty similar but the Cosmo is on the strip. I will definitely stay at this hotel on my next visit to Vegas and strongly recommend it to anyone who wants a good quality hotel without the Vegas gimmicks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, no Vegas frills”
Reviews.Author: erewards
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a nice contemporary hotel. It is comfortable, but may not be for everyone. There is no self parking, but the valet parking is quick and free (unless you tip like I do). One great thing about the hotel is that once you get out of the car, the elevators are just feet away from the door. You don't have to walk forever to get to your room. The bed was comfy! This is also the first hotel I've stayed in that not only had a large flat screen TV, but it also had digital cable with perfect reception and lots of channels. You wouldn't think this would be hard to find, but it is. The internet is also great. I clocked it at 3 up and 3 down. Better than any other hotel I've found. The pool area was small compared to other hotels in Vegas, but adequate nonetheless. There are a couple of things that you may want to watch out for if you are used to large Vegas resorts. There is no real restaurant in the hotel, at least not one that was open while I was there. They have a small snack shop with sandwiches and drinks, but it isn't open very late. Room service is offered. They do have a bar on site. Also, this hotel does not have a casino. Vdara has quick access to Bellagio (walking distance) and a tram that goes to Aria, the Crystals Mall, and Monte Carlo. It is a little complicated to get to the other nearby hotels, but that's how Vegas is. Here's a tip: If you want to avoid the strip, you can enter and exit off of Harmon Avenue from the west side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: toothfairyklw
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights after a dreadfully disappointing nights stay at NY-NY. The Vdara is non gaming ,so the atmosphere was lovely and smoke free. The check in experience was very good, all members of the staff were pleasant and helpful. The room we had was a deluxe suite ,with amazing panoramic windows .Very spacious and clean.The pool on the 3rd floor is very nice with frequent waitress service ,the only annoyance being the loud poolside music . On the whole this is a stunning hotel, especially if you want somewhere to take a break from the casino for a while. I would definitely stay again and was very impressed with the whole Vdara experience

Reviews.Title: “Mother's Day in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rincon54
Reviews.Content: I recently took my mother to Las Vegas. We decided on the Vdara because we wanted enough room for each of us to have some privacy and a nice suite seemed ideal. The price was right and the suite was beautiful, but some very basic items weren't included. The suite had a kitchen area, but no coffee maker. We could have upgraded to a larger suite with a coffeemaker for an additional $20 dollars a night. Frankly that's a lot for a small coffee maker. Also, I thought it was quite telling that the small coffee shop/cafe in the lobby sold small coffee makers and ground coffee. Also, the kitchen area didn't have basic items such as any flatware or plates. Since my mother is older we tended to have dinner early and would liked to have had a late night snack without always having to order room service, but without utensils it was very difficult. In spite of these problems I might have stayed here again, but frankly the walk over the walkway and through the Bellagio just to get to The Strip was really long. Anyone who has mobility issues or who is elderly will find the walk challenging. I know my Mom did! We are now planning another trip to Vegas to see everything she missed because it was too far to walk, this time we'll be staying somewhere a little more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and we loved the hotel. make sure on check in that you ask for a high floor. We stayed on the 51st so we looked out over the strip and the airport. The standard of the room was really high and when we had a problem with the safe the security team came straight away. A must.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Dina808
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Las Vegas and we booked this hotel because it was non smoking and it had no casino. Hotel lobby was beautiful and smelled nice. Staff were very friendly and suites were clean and roomy. We had no problem with housekeeping. The only problem we had was that a horrible odor emitted upon entering our room, but seemed to dissipate once you were in the room awhile. Because we were there only a short time we didn't complain. We believe that the odor stemmed from the garbage disposal in the sink in the kitchenette. Other than that and the slow service to check in and check out, everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “So AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Teejer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas in October 2011 for our 10 year Anniversary. We stayed in the Panoramic Suite at Vdara and it could not have been any nicer. The nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. Front desk people were nice, room was amazing, and the entire building was smoke free. There were windows every inch of our room with beautiful views of the mountains, strip, and we even got to have our own private Ballagio Fountain shows. Waking up all we could see were the tips of mountains and sky. It rained both days we were there, but we didn't even mind. The hotel provided the most snugly slippers and robes and there was a tram that connected to the Ballagio, Aria, and Monte Carlo. I would stay here every time I visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “a Hotel that feels like Home, a Home of the Future”
Reviews.Author: FlemBrimstone
Reviews.Content: World Class Facility. (BTW, Thank you for clicking “Review Helpful” button!) Maybe the best in Vegas. Here’s why: You stay on the Strip without the pushing and crowding of a casino-lobby. All the Casino you need is just steps away at the Aria and Belligio. All Suites. Free Aroma Therapy every time U walk in the place. Best bed you will ever sleep on. Front Desk staffed by Super Models. Ultra modern luxury appointed rooms. Eager helpful staff. I go to Vegas 2 or 3 times a year and stayed in the best of ‘em but always go back to the Vdara since I discovered how good it is. There is just a home feel to it. A home in a bright future where everything works and everybody is nice! ROOM: Stayed in the Executive Corner Suite this time. Wow! Really strongly recommend this design. Add washer and dryer & another flat screen TV, lots of extra room to spread out & more views to the super nice regular suite, a True home away from home. If you want to use the full kitchen very much pack some paper plates, forks or plan ahead & call housekeeping in advance to have them bring you what you want. The only possible bad outcome is if you do not ask for the extras you will need, they will cheerfully bring you anything. BATH: Bathroom larger some rooms at Holiday Inn! Really nice large shower and nice to gaze at skyline while in the soaking tub. Robe and slippers nice touches. MORNING COFFEE if Critical for you, and it is for me! The in room coffee makers are back but only in the bigger suites. So - splurge on better room - splurge on the in room coffee service ordering it the night before and awaken to butler bringing coffee! - lobby store opens real early - stop by the Starbucks at the Fashion Show Mall & get Avia instant and a souvenir mug heat using in room microwave. All good options. A bad morning coffee experience only happens if unaware of the choices. SPAS: The spa here is full service and intimate. The one next door at the Aria is bigger and also really good, maybe better but not by much. The high balcony infinity pool built into the side of the Aria is a rare co-ed spa experience, very romantic. DINING: The Union in the Aria has the best sliders made of prime steak and a wicked good chocolate cake. Skip the Aria’s buffet, it has all the charm & service of a high school cafeteria, try the Bellagio Buffet instead. Kitchen in room, lobby store to pick up something to put in it, room service fast (but maybe not 24 hr) and you eat at the real dining room table in your room. SHOPPING: Skip shopping at the Crystals mall. It is has down escalators with no corresponding up escalators, a “you can’t get there from here” maze-like nightmare walking design that traps you into long unwanted extra long walking past empty or ultra super uber high end stores. Very pretty though, architectural eye candy. But if you can afford these prices? Have your personal shopper go for you, they will be late. The mall at Cesar’s, the Fashion Show Mall and the 2 outlet malls are much more fun. NEGATIVES: The high end Aveda shampoos and stuff disappeared after the first day though, not sure if they are dropping this brand or just trying to save money. One day after sleeping really late with the do not disturb button pushed I called to alert housekeeping around noon that I was leaving and they could now clean, when I returned at 4 it still was not done. In a one week stay these were the only 2 negatives so not too bad, and it took years and 4 or 5 stays here to have even these very minor complaints.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Molly B
Reviews.Content: Vdara hotel, what a joke! I travel to Vegas often. This past week I stayed at the Vdara for the first time and believe me, I WILL NOT GO BACK. The staff is not friendly and the people that are supposed to take care of you, steal from you. My cell phone was stolen from my room. The hotel did absolutly nothing about it. The worst part about it was they made me wait 4 hours for security, in my room, on my vacation before they would tell me they would not do anything about it. I talked to someone else staying in the hotel and funny enough they had things stolen out of their room as well! The food is over priced and not good. I wasn't impressed with the cleanliness either. STAY AT THE WYNN! THEY WILL TAKE CARE OF YOU! Hope this helps :)

Reviews.Title: “not recommended for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: eTurboNews
Reviews.Content: My room was spacious, the beds were fantastic, the room spacious and well equipped, except for a missing coffee maker. Coffee and breakfast was only available at a fast food restaurant in the lobby. Expect long lines and waits. No place to sit down or relax. None of the restaurants are open for dinner, except for a small lobby bar. You have no choice, but go to the casino hotels and through casinos to get food or enjoy a sit down breakfast. I was in Las Vegas to attend a trade show. I selected this hotel because of the non-gambling feature, and gym/ pool facilities. None was available to me due to short operation hours. The pool is only opened from 8am - 6pm, the gym closes at 8pm, and so does the sauna. It costs $25.00 to use the sauna, plus the hotel charges a mandatory "resort fee" for using gym facilities, internet and for turn down service. I needed none of this - but had to pay this fee anyway. I attended the IMEX Meeting and incentive trade show and was surprised to find Vdara as an exhibitor. Who would want to stay at such a place without being able to use their facilities. Perhaps for someone on vacation and read to gamble it's an ok place, but not for someone traveling on business with a tied schedule looking forward for a relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The cost of fresh air in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: elyette
Reviews.Content: 'Went to LV on business. I selected Vdarra because it is a non-smoking hotel without a casino. To get to my conference each day I plowed through smoke-filled flashing neon casinos, laced with gyrating semi-nudes and five different rock songs simulatenously blaring at full-blast. Each evening, my frayed senses welcomed soft colors, quiet and fresh air. The immaculate rooms are tastefully decorated with state of the art features and wonderful toiletries. You can also check out from the television in your room as long as it is not the night before a morning departure. I had an early morning departure but the front desk checked me out the night before which saved me time and stress. Here's the downside: When I checked in I was first notified of additional $20.00 per day "resort fee" for the use of a land line (no joke) in my room and newspapers in the lobby. I told the front desk that I didn't need to use such things and I wanted to "opt out." I was told that I had to pay the extra fee anyway. Since I pre-paid the hotel stay, I was trapped. Apparently, many LV hotels do this. Therefore, it makes sense to ask about this before you book. Despite this fee, although I had a kitchenette, there were no plates or utensils. The hotel requires that you ask for them to be brought to your room. After I requested them, I still didn't get them. I had to request them again. The hotel waived one night's resort fee however. Inexplicably, the hotel give does not include coffee mugs in the set of utensils and plates delivered to your room. When I stumbled upon a conference room and borrowed a mug,the conference staff told me that their attendee-Vdarra guests complained about this. It follows that the hotel does not supply coffee makers in the room or offer coffee or tea in the lobby either. You are allowed two bottles of free water a day in one of the room refrigerators. If you open the stocked refrigerator and touch an item 30+ seconds, you will be charged for it, even if you put it back. Yes, I had to ask about this rule. It costs $10.00 to use the business center for either 10 or 15 minutes. They will allow you to get a boarding pass however. The concierge is free but there are long lines in the morning. By afternoon the lines disappear. To paraphrase JP Morgan, if you have to ask Vdarra how much their basic services cost, you probably can't afford to stay there. However, if you don't share Morgan's philosophy and there are certain services you need, I recommend that you call ahead of time to find out how much they cost and then decide whether you want to book a pre-paid room. Factor in an extra $110.00 for a five night stay. Each cubic foot of fresh air on the Vegas strip can be rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough”
Reviews.Author: larmac6666
Reviews.Content: This was second year we have stayed at the Vdara. It is becoming my wives birthday hotel. Check in was brisk and efficient.Last year we had a room with the partition wall between the bed and the sitting room, this year one large open area.I liked this years room better.We had a lower floor level this year ,a lot less ear popping in the elevator. Hotel seemed much busier this year the lounge was always crowded when ever passed by.The new snack bar/ store served its purpose [mix] There was some dust bunnies on the wall near the A/C duct but other than that the room was clean. The beds and bedding are spectacular, there was a brochure left on the desk with offers to purchase same. WI FI was easy to set up and convenient. This was our 15 th trip to Vegas and we have never seen any shows ,always an excuse not to go . This year we bought tickets online 4 weeks earlier to "O", next door at the Bellagio and it was excellent.Found a great tapas bar 2 years ago on Paradise Road called FIREFLY.This year we found its twin down on WEST SAHARA. Both Firefly restaurants have been very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas, Baby!”
Reviews.Author: kalyblue
Reviews.Content: Long weekend in Las Vegas for special concert. Found a quiet hotel - Vdara. Rooms are spacious, surrounded by windows looking over Las Vegas CityCenter area - my favorite is the night view of twinkling lights. Some rooms overlook Bellagio fountains at higher rate. NO CASINO! I know some may hate that in Las Vegas, but I loved it - walk right out of elevators, nicely guarded by staff, and quickly out front door to waiting taxis. Did I mention we were on 41st floor & NEVER waited for an elevator more than 30 seconds. Higher floors have separate elevators so we are wisked up to our rooms in a snap. Quick, no smoke, and polished feel of great hotel & professional staff. Full service hotel including in-room dining, pool, awesome spa. Connects with Bellagio & tram. Across taxi loop from Aria and CityCenter. "Extras" : blackout shades that automatic rolldown, 2 flatscreen TVs, roomy bathroom with relaxing tub separate from glass shower, reading lights, dimmers on many lights, robes available, plenty of comfortable modern seating for party of 6+. Don't forget the party cheese trays/wine that the downstairs market offers, just in case! Doorbell also signals "do not disturb & housekeeping call. We never heard any neighbors. Someone REALLY thought this layout through. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Linseyduo
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful and relaxing place to stay while in Vegas. The rooms are clean, new, and beautiful. It is a quiet place to come back to after a long day/night out. The rooms are definitely sound proof...did not hear anyone else our whole stay. The bathroom is gorgeous, and I loved new and modern feel. I gave it four stars for just a few reasons. First, there is only one tiny cafe in the lobby, that always has a huge line. There are no vending machines to even grab a soda. Also, while check in was easy and pleasant...during our stay, we asked a few of the lobby staff (not desk staff) for advise on transportation to places, and they were really no help at all. We did not wait in line at the concierge, but certainly thought someone living and working in Vegas could answer our questions. I know some people might complain about having to walk through the Bellagio to get to the strip, but my husband and I actually enjoyed it each time we left...what a beautiful place to experience each day. That is actually where we gambled. Using the tram was also super easy and convenient as well, if you were headed down to that end of the strip. We also visited the spa and had a lovely time. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Las Vegas to attend a friend's wedding. We specifically wanted a non-smoking, non-casino hotel to avoid the hustle and bustle but still wanted easy access to the main spots on the strip. The Vdara met all our expectations and covered all our requirements. The first thing you'll notice as you walk into the hotel is the amazing smell. It smells like a spa - a combination of various essential oils. Absolutely beautiful. There was a small queue at check-in when we arrived but the desk was fully staffed and we waited approx 5 minutes, maybe less. The girl on the desk was extremely friendly. We had booked a Lake View Suite and I asked if she would be able to put us on a high floor so that we could get an even better view. This was no trouble at all for her and she put us on the 34th floor, room 028. When we walked into the room, we were astounded by the view. We pretty much directly overlooked the Bellagio lake and fountain show. We also had views of Paris and the Flamingo on the strip and the Rio off to the left. By far the most spectacular aspect was the views of the surrounding mountain ranges. They were just beautiful. We loved watching them change colour in the morning and evening as the sun rose and set. We couldn't have asked for any better - top marks. The room itself was gorgeous - a little kitchenette (that we didn't have cause to use), a dining area, seating area, bedroom and bathroom. The bed was fantastic. We're used to a firm bed at home but this bed was like sleeping on a marshmallow. Maybe not what I'd choose for a permanant basis but a lovely treat for a week's holiday. It was also massive. I found it hard to get out of each morning. The bathroom was great. Large walk-in shower with adjustable shower head to change pressure. Lovely big bath with overhead shower and large vanity unit with sink and mirror. Housekeeping came every day and made our bed and tidied everything. They even neatly arranged cosmetics and toiletries. We didn't have any cause to deal with any staff during our stay but, on the occassions we saw them they were always very friendly and polite. The hotel is just off the strip but you can get there very, very quickly. There is a covered walkway that leads from Vdara directly into the Bellagio. This is a very pleasant walk as you're taken right through the Bellagio conservatory and lobby. The walk seems very quick because there's so much to look at but it probably takes about 10 minutes maximum. Vdara lobby is directly opposite the Aria lobby so you can get to a casino and bar in less than 2 minutes if you wanted. Aria leads onto the Crystals shopping centre which, in turn, leads onto the strip so, again, another 10 minute walk to the strip in a different direction. We had a $20 buffet allowance each, every day. Vdara does not have a buffet but the allowance could be used in the Aria, MGM Grand, Luxor, Mandalay Bay (and others that I can't remember). We went to the Aria most mornings because it was so close. The buffet there was amazing and the hotel is really nice and new too. We tried MGM Grand one day. The variety was even better than the Aria but the place itself wasn't so nice. You just had to give your Vdara room number and show ID and they'd charge to your room. Vdara then remove the charge from your bill. Only spent one day at the pool. It was lovely. Towels are provided there and there were loads of loungers. Pool was a little smaller than usual but was amply sized. All in all, I would definitely recommend Vdara. I can't think of any faults that would affect anyone's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - lousy service”
Reviews.Author: worldwidemark
Reviews.Content: I should have known this wasnt going to be a great stay when we had to wait 40 minutes in line to be able to check-in. This was an average wait and heard of colleagues who stood in line for over an hour. Having only 2 people on front desk was not a good idea... The one or two times i had queries for the front desk after that they were useless and i relied on a friend staying in the Bellagio to arrange things instead! The room on the other hand was one of the best I've ever had. Lovely big suite - 2 TVs, huge bathroom and great aircon. On day 2 i arranged a trip to the Grand Canyon and heard the bell boy saying he was going to have a $700 day- I know its Vegas but im not tipping someone for doing their basic job - and especially if they are boasting about it blatantly in front of customers. I would consider staying here again but only if the staff are improved radically

Reviews.Title: “Nice property-no restaurants-below par room service”
Reviews.Author: PeterA_L-M
Reviews.Content: Love the Asian themed and high quality rooms, in fact all suites, but don't like the fact that there is only a self service cafe in the lobby which at breakfast always has a long line, and was very disappointed after a long day at a convention to come back to my room which had not been serviced. Service generally was OK and I will stay here again as there are no gaming machines in the hotel which is a huge plus for the business traveler. It is also a non smoking property however a colleague checked in to his room to find that the previous occupants had smoked heavily in it. He was challenged by the staff when he complained who said that they did not smell anything, which to a non smoker is a huge no-no. Not good guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeAngela H
Reviews.Content: I loved the Vdara hotel in Las Vegas. I have stayed a several luxurious hotels throughout the country & abroad, but this hotel is one of my top five. The cleanliness, service, & environmental standards were superb. If I ever go back to Vegas, I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay here again, no problem”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTommy11
Reviews.Content: If your use to 4 star hotels this is a great place to stay. There no casino but there's one just across the street about 100 yards away. The hot tip is the Spa. You can buy a day pass for $25 buck, that entitles you to the locker room, the hot tub the steam room and sauna and meditation room.. all freaking day. Its a beautiful 4 star spa too. Also the Aria a 5 star hotel is just across the circle. Incredible restaurants, coffee shops and casino. There is a nice coffee shop and store in Vdaras lobby for coffee breakfast and sandwiches bring your own drinks and snacks for.your room refrigerator. Pool is small but good food and good service, great for sunning and people watching. You wont be disapointed in this 4 star downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: coconutfan2010
Reviews.Content: Check-in process: A bit of a line up. The girl had a bit of an attitude, but it did not bother me too much. She set us up on the 28th floor, which is the top floor that one of the elevators will take you to. I had booked Vdara through their online promotion for $20 food credit per person per day. I had to tell the girl that I made the booking under this promotion so that she could give me the voucher. Otherwise, she would have forgotten! I read the fine print on this promotion before I made the booking. It said that you could only use it for breakfast and lunch. Unfortunately, the girl noted that the credit could not be used on the day you check-out. Obviously, you could not use it on the day you check-in because of the timing. I was disappointed because this meant I could only use it for one day! Fortunately, the girl told us that you could use it for dinner but you would be responsible for the extra cost. We end up using the credit for dinner on the first day and lunch on the second day. The credit could be used at certain hotels only including Aria, Mirage, MGM, Luxor, Monte Carlo. The credit could not be applied towards taxes and gratuities. Room: We had the deluxe suite. It was nice and spacious. A clean room. We had a view of City Center. A kitchenette and microwave was available but you would need to ask for kitchenware. There was a nice tub, separate shower, and lots of towels. The bed was very comfortable. Internet: Free for guests, okay speed Parking: Valet only, no self-parking. Free for guests but we tipped the valet. Check-out process: I checked out and reviewed my charges through the tv. I was e-mailed a copy of the charges instantly. I left the keys in the room. Other: Resort fee of $20 + tax per day which includes Wi-fi, water, and valet. We tried out their gym facility. The threadmill and bikes had individual screens. There were iPhone connectors on the machines so that you could charge your phone/listen to your music while you work out. Towels and water were available. Weights were also available. The gym closes at 8 pm. This is a non-smoking and non-gaming hotel which is one of the reasons why I booked it. Overall: A pleasant stay. I may return depending on what promotion they have.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this hotel is impressive!”
Reviews.Author: bstorm
Reviews.Content: We loved the Vdara for many reasons. Since we had never been to this hotel, we did not know what to expect, but we were quickly impressed. The check in was fast and friendly, and our room, though not large, was absolutely gorgeous. We were on the 40th floor and had a fantastic view of the city lights from the glass windows along one wall of our room. The filter shades and blockout window shades lower with the press of a button. Everything is thoughtfully and beautifully designed. The furnishings are subdued modern, with shades of gray, black, white and bright spots of color in the art on the walls. Each room has a king sized bed with flexible reading lights above the pillows, a desk with free internet connection, a sofa, a flat screen TV, and soft lighting. There is a slick mini kitchen near the entry with a small table and chairs should you decide to eat in your room. The bathroom has a huge soaking tub with a separate shower, and lovely amenities. It felt like you were staying at a private designer residence. The bed, linens, and pillows were comfy and luxurious. You won't be disappointed if you stay here. It will spoil you!

Reviews.Title: “Vdara-A stylish 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMadeEasy
Reviews.Content: Fairly clean, seems smoke free, no loud casinos on-site, small variety of food options at hotel and unfortunately a small pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with customer service”
Reviews.Author: mugsymalone73
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice and housekeeping service. Did not care for front of the house service. As a hotel manager in California, customer service is very important to me. When people don't acknowledge u and say hello in your lobby or even a smile I have a problem with that. Front office staff have no care attitudes and feel like they r too good for their job. Snobby attitude does not get u far in the hospitality business. Next time I m in Vegas I will pay 250 dollars. A nite to stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster - stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel466
Reviews.Content: I've never written a Trip Advisor review, but the Vdara was *such* a disaster I was actually motivated to say a few words. My wife and I stayed at the Vdara for 4 days. The basic problem is that they lack all amenities, and employ far too few employees. If you're expecting a top-shelf stay...look elsewhere. The entire hotel has 1 small store/shop, and it closes at 8pm. They have 1 bar, which holds about 20 people max. No restaurant, no place for water/soda...zilch. Every morning the line for coffee is *out the door* (20-25 minutes minimum) and angry customers are cursing and muttering about how awful it is. There's one line with two registers and whether you want coffee, food or toiletries, get ready to wait. Forget about getting through to the concierge - calls go to a recording where and the line in the lobby was consistently 20 minutes. I used my iPhone a lot. One day I stopped at the front desk and waited the 30 minutes in line, so I could speak with the manager. I explained how frustrating it was to wait 20-25 minutes each morning for a cup of coffee. She (Anar Shah) suggested I get coffee at the Bellagio or Aria! (You can't make this stuff up). I said that I didn't want to have to go to a different hotel for coffee. The woman next to me at the desk was complaining about her stay, and asked for incidentals to be comp'd on her bill. They weren't offering anything, except suggestions to go elsewhere. I went from annoyed to heated and walked off. They built this place 2 years ago and simply didn't include enough amenities. Now they're hurting for money and I guess they cut way back on staff to control costs. The net result is a place you want to avoid, unless you don't mind wearing a path to the Bellagio for anything you need - food, coffee, casino, reservations, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Perfect Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Caroline K
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a great (non-smoking) hotel in Las Vegas in the Middle of the Strip. We stayed for one night only during the week and found it was a real bargain ($129.-/night)! We got a standard room but it looked more like a Suite with a stupendous view on the strip and a fabulous bathroom. Service is excellent (check-in and -out, parking etc.) and the hotel's conntected to the Bellagio. The Vdara is a great hotel and offers fantastic deals during the week (prices double at the weekend!!).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for 7 nights. The hotel room was fantastic. We were on the 34th floor and asked for a view of the Bellagio fountains at check in which we were given complimentary. The room was immaculate and clean. The bed was the comfiest we have ever slept in. A couple of times the water or shower gel werent replaced but all we had to do was ask and this was rectified with an apology. The pool is a little small but we got a sun bed every day as they remove towels from beds if not used. On a weekend the pool is packed with young people sunbathing and drinking. The hotel reception smelt lovely and we had no problem with check in or check out. It is a quick walk approx 2 minutes to Aria hotel which has a casino and plenty of fantastic restaurants. There is also an undercover walkway to Bellagio. There is a free tram from Bellagio to City Centre hotels (Vdara and Aria) Crystals shopping centre and Monte Carlo hotel. I would definitely stay here again as it is only 5-10 mins walk to get onto the strip yet it is also smoke and gaming free - the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaCaramel-Onne
Reviews.Content: Overall outter appearance was nice. The room seemed kinda small with the way it is set up. n Our room smelled like smoke. But the experience wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “engaged at Vdara!”
Reviews.Author: Nathan E
Reviews.Content: So pleasantly surprised with the outstanding ambiance, style, and service here. non-smoking, non-casino were 2 major pros to this hotel, but upon arrival I quickly realized these were not the end to the benefits! A young gentleman whose name will ring in my head any instance I recall the greatest getaway in Vegas I and my fiancee have ever experienced kicked off the vacay during check-in at the front counter. throughout our experience at Vdara, this young man had made things unthinkable, a reality! We had stayed 4 days in an corner deluxe sweet and felt like we could live there for the rest of our lives we were so comfortable! the cafe at Vdara had amazingly quick and delicious tastes, the bar at Vdara had service reminiscent of a short stay at a 5 star hotel in Manhattan, and the pool was beyond relaxing. I would return here any possible instance I receive!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: summer154943
Reviews.Content: FIrst time in Las Vegas, the Vdara will be hard to top. Great as we are non smokers, even though there is no casino, there are casinos just steps away so not a big deal. Feel very pampered. You can buy organic food if you wish to make a meal in your room. The only drawback was the lack of dishes being in the room, there was a delay in getting them. Would stay again. Quiet, comfy and beautiful

Reviews.Title: “bright lights city”
Reviews.Author: fmjjb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a girls trip for my sisters 40th birthday. Spacious, modern suites with lounge and small kitchen area. Unfortunately we were misinformed by Harvey World Travel North Perth and when we arrived the bedding configuration was not as requested. The hotel does not do any twin bedding (only king size and sofa bed) so three adults had to share one bed and a very uncomfortable sofa bed. Aside from this inconvenience, the staff were attentive and the hotel was generally very good. It did lack atmosphere and a decent restaurant but the adjoining hotel, The Aria had a great casino and several restaurants of high quality. Possibly a little too far away from the action of the strip for those wanting adventure but great for a quieter holiday for those who don't mind walking the 15 or so mins to the action.

Reviews.Title: “A different hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Nim P
Reviews.Content: Not your standard hotel, so in a nutshell i liked this place and it is definitely a nice hotel. I didnt like the check in process every day i looked at the queue for checking in and day or night it was long (we waited 30 mins). The rooms are fantastic we were asked if we wanted to be upgraded to have a view of the Belagio fountains but we declined at $30 extra per night, and to be honest it was no biggie to us. 2 flatscreen tv's but pretty pointless unless you watch one at a time as the sound of one drowns out the other. Clean rooms Fantastic comfy beds!!! Read some reviews that said the water bottles were not replaced and we found that happened to us but we just asked the maid as we were walking to the elevator and she happily handed us a bottle. They are also pretty through with the cleaning and organised our books and magazines into a nice order when we got back to the room as well as moving the coffee tables and sofa's back. The market cafe in the building is great even if it is pricey. Location is awesome as its in the middle of the strip we don't mind walking and parked at the aria car park and caught the monorail to Vdara. We booked this though the Expedia secret 4 star hotel deal and i would consider staying here again if i were to come to Vegas again. I also loved that it was no smoking as everywhere else in vegas all you can smell is smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Just Off the Strip -”
Reviews.Author: CBeam
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is part of the MGM City Center Development, but is off the strip. It is a non gambling, non-smoking property. I was traveling on business, so both of these were attractive. It is only a short walk to the Aria or the Cosmopoliton, which both have casinos if you want to gamble. I stayed for several days, so having a kitchenette in the room was a plus. Bathrooms are generous and the rooms have lots of windows. They have service issues that they need to work on - nothing major, but annoying. I returned to my room one day at 5:00 and it had not been cleaned. One of the phones in the room wasn't working and I had to call to have the coffee supplies replenished. There were also items left in the room by the previous guest. Also, there is no self parking - only valet. (In spite of sign directing to self parking.) It is at no charge, but is understaffed. I was going in and out to meetings and always got voice mail when I called to have my car brought around. One morning it took thirty minutes for my car to be retrieved - and was late to a meeting. The pool area is pretty modest by Las Vegas standards. My last night at the hotel, the City was resurfacing the street in front of the hotel from midnight to 6:00 am, so constant jackhammer, truck, asphalt grinding noise - not the hotel's fault, but was ending of stay that makes me think I might not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best luxury value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vaibella
Reviews.Content: Second time at this property and definitely still deserving of their Four Diamond ranking. Upgraded by front desk gratis this time to corner suite. Gorgeous view. Clean quiet cozy room. Bed amazing. Best night's rest before convention. Bathroom very functional modern and clean! I will tell you what stands out- as before, best room service ever!! Beats any place I have ever stayed. Also nice to have a quiet hotel and then a short one minute walk to action of casinos and restaurants. And.. What a value! Finally, the hotel has a soothing spa smell when you enter. Definitely notice the non smoking environ.

Reviews.Title: “Not the TV!”
Reviews.Author: latrell1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara for one night, checking in late in the evening, so I basically just slept and showered here. That experience was, well, a mix of highs and lows. Vdara is designed to be an quiet, calm oasis away from the other casinos on the Strip. It doesn't contain a casino, which means that it doesn't make a lot of money in 2011, so MGM (the owners of the property and the enormous CityCenter complex) really aren't huge fans of you finding your way here. You can get to Vdara through either the Bellagio or Aria casinos. I walked through the Aria to find my way to Vdara, and after a couple of signs pointing me in the right direction, the trail went cold. Encouraging me to stick around and gamble, perhaps? Fortunately, I was not ashamed enough to ask a security guard, who directed me to Vdara and didn't once beg me to stay and gamble. How quaint! Vdara itself smells ... spa-like. There are air fresheners in the elevators and plenty of green features to the building's interior design. It's like someone gave an interior decorator $500 million and sent them to a mall that just had Bed, Bath, and Beyond, The Body Shop, and Whole Foods. That's not to say that it isn't a pleasant experience, just ... odd. Check-in was quick and painless. There is a small cafe in the lobby of the hotel, but it was closed at 10 PM, even as the bars were open. There didn't appear to be anywhere else within the hotel to buy essentials, so if you woke up at 3 AM with a headache or in need of a drink, unless I'm missing something, you would have to trek outside in your PJ's and head across the way to the gift shop in Aria. The rooms themselves are reasonably spacious. My room had a kitchenette, but no silverware was included within the room; I had to call downstairs if I wanted to have silverware sent up. This screams "People were stealing our silverware." The room had electric drapes and a big, comfortable, clean bed. A small dinner table had seats for four; while there was a futon with a small coffee table that would comfortably sleep another person, there is no way you were sticking four people in this room. The room also had a large flat-screen TV on the wa... Well, let me clarify. The room did have a large flat-screen TV on the wall. The only problem is that when I turned the TV on, it spewed a mix of random colors that wobbled back and forth on the screen. There was also a weird spider web image that came to a point on the side of the screen. This happens when - yes - someone punches, drops, or otherwise breaks a television set. And this useless broken set had naturally gone unreported, so it was up to me to tell the hotel that the room I'd been in for an hour had a busted TV and that I had nothing to do with it. Fortunately, MGM appears to have taken my (honest) word that I didn't break the television. When I called the front desk to report the problem, the hotel sent a technician up to take a look at it. The technician agreed with my observation about the brokenness of the television, but noted, "We don't have any of those TVs left!" He then suggested that the front desk might try and offer me a new room that had a working television, but I pointed out that it was nearly 1 AM, had unpacked everything I had, and really just wanted to go to sleep without moving my things to another room. He noted that he would call the front desk for me and ask if they could take care of something for me. (Nothing ended up happening, but this was a complimentary stay, so there really wasn't much that they could do beyond send me up some free air fresheners.) Of course, this surely doesn't happen in everyone's room. But it was quite disappointing. After that, I went to sleep and then woke up, showered, and left. The bathroom is quite nice thanks to the large soaking tub, but only an average shower. The wi-fi was extremely effective. In all, this is a new hotel that serves as some sort of sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip, and there's certainly a place for that. But it can be awful boring when someone's decided to break your TV. I recommend that when you check-in, ask for a room with a working television. It's for the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, 100% smoke free, no gambling”
Reviews.Author: jestra
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during a convention Oct. 2o11. After they solved the difficulties with my reservation (they had 2 reservation and both were cancelled - strange) I got a nice room on 33rd floor with a lovely view towards the Rio Resort. I coud see the glass elevator to Vodoo lounge going up and down. I stayed there already one year ago so it was the secound time I chose ths place. I like the 100% smoke free enviornment - which you find very rare around Vegas. Anyway, the rooms are great, contemporary style - very european. The only pitty was the breakfast bistro in the lobby. It wasn´t open last year so its pretty new but the couldn´t handle all the people going there to get coffees etc and the minimarket was quite expensive. I always went out to breakfast -at Flamingo road I found a nice diner - Blueberry Hills. What annoyed me a little was the availability of the front desk. I had to go there sevreal time and espeacially in the morning there always was a long queue. But in general it was a nice stay at a very convinent place. The pool is a little small for the size of the resort and I missed a coffee maker in the room. Free WiFi is available all over the place - but at the pool it was difficult to get a connection.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Andsar99
Reviews.Content: first off, this is a nice new place to stay, it is close to Belaggio and Aria. There is a train that goes from Vdara to Monte Carlo. Easy to get to the strip, We had a car and valet was very good. Take Harmon Ave out the rear to get to other hotels very quickly. As for the room it is very nice, big windows, comfy bed. Call to ask for kitchen supplies. Beware there is no maid service for some rooms, depends on what you booked, and from the sounds of it maid service is non existent anyways. Well we would just leave out towels in the hallway and grab new ones from the cart, or call for new towels. We were barely in the room anyway. If you can get a good price <$100 this is a nice place to stay. The pool is smaller, but fine for a swim, if you want a nice pool you can walk into Caesar's pool no one asks you any questions. All in all I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, smoke free, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: MaddyHatter
Reviews.Content: We picked the Vdara because it was non-smoking and non-gambling. It meant we had a quiet retreat to go back to at night. It doesn't have the attractions of some of the other hotels (shopping malls etc) but It is a 10 minute walk through the Bellagio to the Strip - so not really an issue. Our room had a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip. It was large, clean and quiet. Minor gripes: you have to ask for cookware to be sent to the room and it isn't replaced once you have used it. Concierge desk could get very busy. A word of warning: if you take a taxi from the airport, cost can vary a lot. It is about $20-$25 if they don't use the freeway and $35-$40 they do.

Reviews.Title: “Modern style meets strip”
Reviews.Author: Juno1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year , the Vedra is much more quiet than surrounding properties. It is next door to the Bellagio so in a great location. There is no casino in this hotel but seconds walk to Bellagio casino. The rooms were huge with an awesome view of the stip. We had a kitchnette in our room, a king size bed and a lounge wich turned into a sofa bed The only inconvenience was acsess to buy meals the resturant in the lobby was vbery expensive and it was a long walk to get breakfast, lunch ect.

Reviews.Title: “Vacous Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huskyrides
Reviews.Content: We picked the Vdara due to it's not smoking and non gambling status. We did appreciate this, however the hotel was worse for it. Compared to any of the other hotels in Vegas it doesn't measure up at all. Due to the proximity of the Cosmopolitan, Bellagio and Aria they have very little facilities within the hotel itself. One small bar, with over priced drinks. One small take away and that was it. First time in Vegas so I am not sure if this is the norm, but it just felt very impersonal and they only seemed to care about the volume of people coming and going through the hotel. Check in desks were always busy as they were never fully staffed. 30mins to check in after a 10hr flight is not ideal. The room we had was really nice. However, our toilet broke 3 times in 6nts and most days it wasn't cleaned until 3/4pm. We just felt that they didn't care. We also had a room on the 5th floor facing the delivery area, so we were woken up daily with trucks coming and going. I think this was due to the fact we got a really good deal, so they allocated us a 'cheaper' room. Pool was very small with loud music pumping out all day. Also the other guests were drinking alcohol in the pool, which isn't good. This isn't an episode of MTVs Cribs! We still haven't worked out how to get from the hotel to the strip with the instructions other reviewers gave. You can walk through the Bellagio, which takes about 10-15mins (due to volume of people in there) or through the Aria, then through Crystals Mall, which again takes 10-15mins. You can take a much quicker route, but you need to walk along the side of the Cosmo. You'll see the smoking area outside the hotel, take the stairs at the side, then walk along beside the Cosmo, cross the road, and you're now outside the Crystals on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: princessfefe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara for one week in October 10. What a beautiful place. The rooms were big with windows filling one wall - with fantastic views.
