The hotel was an oasis of calm in a crazy place. As soon as you walked into the hotel you felt peaceful. There is a lovely aromatherapy scent in the lobby which immediately relaxes you. Only criticism would be the pool - which was beautiful but as it is on a room and surrounded by glass buildings it is like an oven - you literally feel yourself cooking as you sit there - there is not nearly enough shade and you have to pay to use daybeds. The hotel is a Condo - with a kitchen area in each room - but you have to ask for literally everything from spoons to cups if you want them - we didnt bother as there is so much choice outside the hotel. The hotel is very close to the strip - there is an adjoining covered walkway to the Bellagio - fantastic. We had meals in the Bellagio at various times of day and night - had a fab meal there at 3am! you never know what time it is when you are in the casinos!! The other way to the strip is out the front of Vdara and walk to the left into the Aria - another amazing hotel - huge casino and lots of bars etc. Another nice touch in Vdara is that it is a no smoking hotel - which is a nice change in Vegas. We loved our first trip and were very pleased with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 start Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: yanka7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, and was asking myself - why would anybody choose to stay here? If you are in Vegas for business, maybe it's an OK place to spend a few nights. Vdara is a typical average-class business hotel (like Marriott, Radisson, etc.) that could be located anywhere in the world. In general, the whole City Center architecture looks like an airport complex somewhere in Munich, or Amsterdam: nothing glamorous, nothing exciting. Vdara hotel is clearly an afterthought, since they were not able to sell those units as condos, and converted them to a hotel. If you are planning to go to Vegas for pleasure, and looking for a 5 star experience, I would recommend Bellagio and Wynn/Encore options, not City Center. Here are some of the key points of our experience with Vdara (deluxe room): - Check it was actually easy and quick, no issues there. - Room is not that as spacious as it looks on the pictures, divider in the middle makes it look like a suite, but it’s actually just an average size room with a nice decor. - A lot of space is wasted by the kitchenette (and if you are not staying for extended period of time, simply wasted space) - Bathroom is rather small, probably the smallest I've seen in 5 star hotels in Vegas, with just one sink. - There is no issue with Vdara location, as far as its proximity to the casinos and strip. We easily walked everywhere. Aria is literally 2 minutes’ walk, Bellagio is about 3 minutes. No problem at all. - We had a horrible experience with housekeeping. We left our room at 8 AM, turned on the switch for the housekeeping service, and came back at 2 PM just to find out that our room wasn't serviced. When we called to complain, we were told that they don't start working until 10 AM,???!! Who cares? It's 2 PM now! It seems that the hotel is consistently understaffed and don't have enough people to clean rooms (and don't care about complains). - Checking out. We got down to the front desk and saw a huge line. Probably 30+ minutes for check out, so we went back to our room and used TV service for self-check out. - Market café looks like an airport fast food place and serves airport-like food. Also, the fact that Vdara is a non-smoking hotel is not such a big deal after all. There are always non-smoking rooms in other casinos, and in general, I've noticed that there are only a few smokers on the casino floor in Bellagio and Venetian (not how it used to be just a few years ago). Overall - will not recommend. Our friend who recently stayed at TI (Treasure Island) said that their renovated rooms are very similar to Vdara. It doesn't carry 5 stars, but at least you get the whole "Vegas" experience.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks! Thank you for not smoking.....forever.....”
Reviews.Author: Mymauidog
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a thursday late afternoon- only one person in front of us - very quick check-in. Very great service. Staff are groomed perfectly and uniforms were striking. Room was fantastic- Bed was amazing- firm but fluffy. I looked to see what kind of mattress but there was no label. Loved the bed. There was 2 x 40"flat screen tv's (we just had a basic room). The room was clean (carpet showing some stains but its a very light coloured carpet) High speed internet included in your resort fee - all plugs available to connect to tv - Ipod, USB (2) cables for wire in connection We were in a room on the 36th floor with a North View (Bellagio pools) View amazing, the blinds awesome. -Remote controlled and 2 sets of blinds. No elevator line ups, pool was awesome - (death-ray is accurate) Lots of options for shade with the umbrellas though. Bring your own sunscreen. Sunscreen is expensive here. $20 per bottle. Poolside menu was very reasonable- loved the ahi tuna salad. Only $10 Wasnt expecting housekeeping based on previous comments but we checked in on Thursday evening and had housekeeping on Friday but none on Saturday and checked out on Sunday. No housecoats in the rooms but nice towels. Property needs a starbucks on site. The coffee place is too busy. Can't wait to go back- booking right now!

Reviews.Title: “Only a 5* if you are used to staying at 3* hotels!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler10020
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Vdara for 3 nights and the adjacent Aria for an additional 3 nights. The Vdara was not worth even the dscounted rate we paid. Before I get into the negatives, some of the positives were - - Nice large room with beautiful bathroom and soaking tub - Convenient to Bellagio and other City Center propertie (Aria, Cosmopolitan & Mandarin) - Comfortable bed - Pleasant Staff However, the negatives far outweighted these positives. They were: - check-in took an hour and a half. First desk clerk telling me to come back in a half hour and to put our bags with the bell clerk, the bell clerk told us to go outside to the bell stand, outside no one would help us, and at that point we gave up and held our bags. We were told after the half hour to go to the "invited guests" line which was longer than the regular check in line and took an additional 45 minutes waiting there just to see if our room was ready yet. All in all we got on the first line at 2:45 and did not put the key in our room door until 4:10pm. - Our room was never cleaned for our entire stay! When we inquired on the 2nd day having not received housekeeping, they told us that because we booked through discount travel website, we were not entitied to housekeeping services. WHAT? How is that 5* service? But more importantly - I don't want to stay in a hotel room that may not have been cleaned regularly - especially A) in vegas where partying in your room is common, B) god only knows what the people before us did in there and if the room was cleaned everyday then either, or B) when the turnover for rooms for check-in has to happen so quickly, how thoughouly could they possibly clean the rooms if it hasn't been touched in days?? - The pool is a joke. Its one small pool surrounded by concrete slab with the chairs backed in so tight you cant even get in or have any personal space. There is no greenery or anything even luxurious about it and it faces a parking garage. - The fitness center is about as big as my bedroom at home. - The "Spa" was closed for rennovation...isn't this a hotel "& SPA"?? and why wuld it need rennovation if it has only been open for about a year? - There is no restarurant in the hotel...isn't one of those stars in the 5* system supposed to be for FOOD? If you are hungry or want a quick bite, you can pay through the nose for a snack at the little cafe in the lobby or walk over to the Aria or Bellagio. - No robes in the room, we had to ask for them. - Why would you have a kitchen in each room without putting anything in it - no even a corkscrew or a few forks or knives?? - I couldn't use their wireless internet to access my work with my laptop. I work remotely and use a laptop when I travel to remotely connect to my work PC. Their wireless internet blocked my ability to connect to my work PC and I couldn't work while I was there (unless I went to starbucks outside the citiycenter where it worked fine). This is a hotel where conventions are held constantly, assuming most of them are there to work as well, I can't be the only one who has had this problem. In other hotels I have never had any issues with connecting like I have had here. By the third night, we were laughing about everything that was going wrong and it became a joke. All in all, I would not stay here again and I would not reccommend this hotel to anyone. P.S to future travelers - we stayed in room 19003 and it wasn't cleaned for 4 days - enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Helen K
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at Vdara again. The service is seriously lacking in this facility...left for the day with housekeeping call light on...when we came back at around 2am, nothing was done! When we called the front desk they replied "I'm not sure why it wasn't done because all the housekeeping staff went home but if we send someone up now then you won't receive housekeeping service for the rest of the day". Unreal how horrible the service was for paying 200/night. Valet is required and when we went to pick up our car, the valet brought the car around then went back in his booth instead of letting us know the car was ready. We stood around for awhile and when I noticed that the car was there, I went up to the valet and he said "we called the name several times and there was no reply". I saw the valet walk right into the booth without calling our name. I will never stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis from the insanity of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCombs
Reviews.Content: Vdara Trip report: Check-in: We arrived a 0700 in the morning after a nice redeye flight from Honolulu. After a very prompt and courteous limo pick up from Presidential Limo we were delivered to the hotel at about 0800. There was no one in line and even though I wasn’t hopeful that we would get a room that early I gave it a try anyway. Much to my delight our room was ready and we were promptly and pleasantly checked in. I wish I had written down the name of the lady that took care of us. Her customer service skills were spot on. She was pleasant and very helpful and offered suggestions for things for us to do while we were there. I will add that when we came back from walking around there was a considerable line of people checking in but I didn’t stick around long enough to see how long it took. The Room: We had a 51st floor Panoramic Corner Suite. The view was wonderful with a partial view of the Bellagio fountain, only obscured by the Cosmo. The room while at the end of the hall was not that far from the elevator. I’m really not sure why so many people complain about the hike from elevator from the room. - The room was clean but could have used some attention to the dusting. Attention to detail with the dusting could be improved. My husband is pretty tall so he could see dust in places that I couldn’t … such as on top of the refrigerator, the TV, etc. That’s really the only negative I could give you about the room. - We had room service several times and the food was good and delivered quickly and hot. Server’s were always pleasant and helpful. They tell you to call when you are done and they will pick up the dirty dishes but after waiting for an hour, I set them outside and turned on the Privacy light. - As many have noted, there were no dishes in the kitchen but when I called they sent some up within 30 minutes and called back to ensure that I got what I needed. While they brought up a full compliment, I had to specify that I wanted more than just plates and silverware. I got a couple pots, cooking utensils’, etc. There is a K-Cup machine in the room and they give you a couple cups to start with but they don’t leave you a coffee cup to make it in. That’s like leaving an ice bucket but no glasses to put the ice in. That’s something that just doesn’t make sense. Vdara, PLEASE put some cups in the room! I ended up getting a coffee cup but then the maid service took it away when they did daily service. I left a note the next day (with a tip) asking them to have another sent up…that NEVER happened. Thankfully I had my own travel cup that I made work with some effort (it was a bit tall for the small machine.) If you don’t want to pay for the additional cups and one cup a day isn’t enough I would suggest bringing your own. I have a machine at home so I just brought some of my own supply. Having a stove and a full size fridge was nice. We made our breakfast each day so we didn’t have to rush out and find a place to eat and we had the ability to reheat any leftovers we had from the previous days. - Noise. The room was so peaceful. Never heard a peep of noise from any other room or even in the hall. The only noise came from the Cosmo night club on Friday and Saturday night BUT it was so faint the fan and my earplugs took care of that. - The bathroom. I loved the set up and the tub was nice BUT, the design of the tub left a little to be desired. The drain cover which has a raised knob is right in the middle of the bath tub. If you try to slide down to rinse your hair or get deeper in the water you end up with the plug in less than convenient locations. Also, if you fill the tub too far, and you slide up too fast, you end up flooding the floor. Thankfully there are lots of towels to help deal with that. - Having a washer and dryer in the room was a huge bonus as well. Note, they do not provide soap or fabric softener so you will need to buy some. Also, there’s a flood sensor that you need to make sure is reset or the water will not fill in the washer. Be very stingy on laundry soap as these are front load washers and if you don’t have sufficient clothes in the washer you will have a soap bubble flood (like I did, although it was minor!) - Location, Location, Location: Well much as been said about this already BUT we really didn’t find it that bad. We walked across the sky bridge to the Bellagio and then out to the strip. Quick and easy. Always lots to see along the way. We really liked that the Vdara didn’t have the huge crowds and smoke that come with the full service casinos and hotels. - Dining options: Other than room service and the Café down stairs there aren’t many in the hotel BUT that wasn’t an issue for us. We never used the Café but ran into a very upset man in the elevator that waited 45 min for a cup of coffee because he didn’t have a coffee maker in his room. He was not a happy camper! - Security: Some have mentioned that there was someone stationed at the elevators to check keys before allowing anyone up. We only noticed that during the weekend. No one checked our card during the week at all. - TV Check-out: Used the TV to do the check out and had no issues with it at all. Got an itemized list in my email later that day. No unexpected charges, no issues and no waiting at the counter to check out in person. Overall we really enjoyed this property and all that it offered the location and lack of “Vegas” craziness. We would most certainly recommend it to anyone who wants a place to relax away from the insanity and be able to cook for yourself now and then and do laundry (for longer stays). Please feel free to PM me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: InnkeeperAllAround
Reviews.Content: We wanted a quiet respite from the Strip and were very satisfied with Vdara. The room was modern and spacious and extremely comfortable, and we enjoyed having the kitchenette to use. We also enjoyed being across from the Aria and next to the Bellagio when we wanted to people watch and join the craziness. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel But Hard to Find”
Reviews.Author: Ghassanan
Reviews.Content: we came to Las Vegas with Car, and it was very hard to find the interance, there is no Casino in the Hotel and the food shop close early. the room were great ,clean and new ,the Valet guys were exelant ! but my expectations from a new hotel like this were more

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Dennis B
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews before arriving, I was expecting a few things to be missing however coffee pot was there, and cutlery and crockery,was offered immediately and instantly provided. We had a vdara suite on the 21st floor which met our expectations to the full. My only minor problem was the light switches which need some practice with on off sequences before understanding what switched what on and off. The bathroom was a good size however the bath could have done with a wall handle to help one get out of it due to the depth. Service was excellent when required and the concierge had organised my requested itinerary, to perfection. Easy access to the the Bellegio, although a covered walkway to the Aria would have been nice, whilst only a short distance the reflected heat during the afternoon, made the walk uncomfortable, almost worth grabbing a taxi to drive you the 100 yds plus. The pool area although small was only spoilt really by the heavy bass music, which drummed out which really appeared to be more for the benefit of the pool bar and reception staff than for the clients. Yet while mentioning the down side of things overall we had a great stay and would certainly go there again, and being a non smoker certainly is a big plus. The Spa was excellent and staff through out the entire stay were friendly and most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury adjacent to "The Strip"”
Reviews.Author: Christine B
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at the Vdara Hotel on our first trip to Vegas. We had a large, tastefully decorated executive suite (living room, dining room, kitchen, powder room, gorgeous big bathroom with large soaker tub, king bed.) This is a NON SMOKING hotel (a priority for us) with no casino or stores making it an oasis of quiet amidst the clamour of The Strip. Tucked between The Bellagio, Crystal, and The Cosmopolitan, it is just a short walk out to the strip. The one cafe at lobby level provides light fare for eat-in or take out. We would definitely return to this hotel on a future visit! C.& M. Bell, Toronto, ON Canada

Reviews.Title: “Thought I'd Died and Gone to Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: ravinon
Reviews.Content: Yep, that was my reaction the first night in The Vdara as I lay down on their wonderful King sized bed.. Infact i took the details of the bed as one day i intend to have one!! This hotel is not a Casino hotel and it's smoke free! Thats why we chose to stay there. It was also much better value than The Bellargio where our friends stayed even though it is connected to the Bellargio (literally by a covered walkway). We upgraded to a courner suite and it's well worth it if you can do it. (book early and dont stay the weekend for the very best deals). You have full kitchen facilites and we found the shop on the ground floor to offer very resonable prices for grocery items so we had breakfast and nibbles in the suite (there wine was also cheaper than elsewhere). The suite itself was extremly roomy. A couple could live there with no problems. The bathroom was huge with seperate dressing room and wardrobe. The only possible negative I could come up with is the shower didnt offer the best pressure and could fluctuate in temperature but seriously the room/suite was so wonderful that this is just nit-picking. The night view was lovely and the suite itself was extremly quiet. We are both light sleepers and didnt hear one door slam or loud talking in the hallways. We slept so well in The Vdara that we were sad to leave. Honestly don't hesitate to book this place. We are experianced travellers and rate The Vdara as one of the best. We are not great fan's of Las Vegas but this hotel made the 3 night experiance an absolute pleasure! Oh, and the staff were fantastic too from check in to house keeping (the room was immaculate..I even forgot to check for bed bugs as it was so spotless!!) 10 out of 10!!.............just book it, you wont regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel”
Reviews.Author: TF1960
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Vdara Hotel for the first two nights of our holiday and initially were very impressed with the look and ambience of the place. Check in was fine and I asked for a room overlooking the Bellagio fountains if that was possible and was told "well I am not too sure what your view will be but if you are not happy come back and we will see what we can do". Needless to say the room overlooked the Freeway! We asked to be moved and were told that another room on the opposite side of the hotel was being cleaned, to wait 30 mins and we would be called. 40 mins later we were told by reception that that room had now been taken and that we had been given another room on another floor that was also being cleaned and they would call us. An hour later, and after going down to reception, we were given a room that had a partial view of the Bellagio fountains and the Freeway. When I queried with reception about the view they informed me that the "rooms with a good view are more expensive". Now I am not too sure if we were being fobbed off but we were not impressed. Anyway, we saw two different types of rooms both of which were lovely but as someone else mentioned, there was no cutlery, tableware or cookware of any description. This didn't bother us for the two nights we were there but we were glad we had booked the Signature for our last four nights as this hotel did have all the facilities you would need if you wanted to use them. We were also surprised at the road noise in the room especially given that we were on such a high floor. It was a straight forward walk through Bellagio to get onto the Strip and from there you are very central to everything. I don't know if I would visit this hotel again and would probably go back to the Signature if and when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to return to after noise of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Criketfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in September 2011.Lovely suite on 9th floor overlooking pool area. Very clean & spacious. However don't expect full kitchen facilites, we had to request cutlery and crockery, but maybe many don't go to vegas to dine in for breakfast! Nice bar area and snack bar in lobby stocking essentials. Staff were very helpful.Good connections to Bellagio and the Strip. Would recommend this Hotel as it is nice to return to a non-smoking and non-gaming haven after the noise of Vegas. It is cheaper to go to Walgreens or CVS to get provisions if needed.(near the Monte Carlo)

Reviews.Title: “made a horrible mistake and ruined my first vegas trip.”
Reviews.Author: LAS V
Reviews.Content: Once you get in to the hotel you have to stand in like for 45 mins just to check in after a long long long flight. They will take your credit card information and hold $300!! Got the room, didn't like the view of desert ask them to change. They said nothing was available for a sunday!!! Asked for a upgrade tried selling me quite a few. Decided to go with $20/day upgrade. But they gave it at "DISCOUNTED PRICE" $10/DAY. It takes a long time to figure out the lights as there are no instructions. Hotel is boring there is nothing to do. They have a small cafe and a bar. Haven't tried the bar but cafe is overpriced for the kind of food they are serving. On the day of check out out of $300 i gave them earlier they owe me just 100$. They charged me stupid resort fees. When i first bought the room i already paid for the resort fees and the taxes. Why would they charge me again.. still waiting in line to ask them its been 45 mins already! I am never ever coming back to this hotel. I am not even sure if i ever come back to vegas again. Every restrurant you go once you give your credit card they will hold 3 times the actual bill. Went to a club they took $200 for a $20 cover, went to sapphire they rip us off for $700 we were there for not even 30 mins! I had lots of expectation but i feel ripped off!

Reviews.Title: “Love it.”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_CanadaJeff
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Vdara for 4 nights. I toured around most well known hotel in Vegas and like this one the best. i think* Vdara is the only Non-smoking, No-gaming , All-suite hotel in Vegas. It's well connected to other landmarks like Bellagio, Caesar Palace, City Center etc. The suite was modern, clean and BIG. The only thing i could not give a 5-star is the pool. It's on the small side, and really hot because of the reflection from other buildings. I would definitive stay again though!!

Reviews.Title: “Professional and courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: danalxndr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from two nights at the Vdara Hotel in Las Vegas. It is a non smoking, non gaming hotel which makes it a nice place to return to after being in smoky casinos all night. It is a newer hotel, located within the CityCenter complex and within walking distance of the Aria Hotel/Casino and the Cosmopolitan Hotel Casino, as well as being adjacent to the Ballagio Hotel/Casino. The rooms are large, beautiful suites, with a flat screen television on the wall, drapes that open and close by remote, and a kitchenette that includes a refrigerator to use as well as a stocked refrigerator that you can purchase items from. There were some problems. I told the valet that I would be going out for dinner after checking in, so he moved my car out of the way, but the car lights were left on. Check in took quite a bit of time, so by the time I went back out to my car, the car battery was dead. Fortunately, the staff does prepare for such a situation, and they brought out a device that was able to immediately recharge my battery. This hotel is very modern and uses newer technology. On the second night after spending a day out, we returned to our room at 11:00 PM. To get into your room at the Vdara, you wave your room key (instead of putting your room key in a slot) in front of the door which causes the door to unlock automatically. When doing this, the door would not open. I went downstairs to the lobby and was quickly reissued keys in the lobby. When I went back to my room with my wife, the door again would not unlock. By this time my wife and I were getting frustrated. I spoke to security near the elevators (This person was great) who was apologetic and called immediately for assistance. A manager at the Vdra again reissued keys, and had a hotel representative go up to our room to make sure they key would work, but again (the third time), the key did not unlock the door. The hotel representative then called for maintenance, who immediately came and was able to let us in our room and eventually fix the door. This led us to the next problem. Housekeeping never cleaned the room (My guess is housekeeping could not get into the room due to the key problem). My wife eventually spoke to a manager who apologized and gave us a resort credit for our trouble. It is an impressive, beautiful hotel in a great location. We had to deal with multiple staff members at the hotel due to the problems we had, but they were all professional and dealt with our problems in a courteous and timely manner. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and will definitely consider staying there the next time I am in Las Vegas. I would also recommend this hotel to others because it is a great hotel (even with the problems), with professional and courteous staff who take care of their customers. It is a newer hotel with newer technology, so their might be some bugs that need to be worked out, but overall, the Vdara is a great place to stay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Toms River, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “TO ALL THE COMPLAINERS”
Reviews.Author: 27DomP
Reviews.Content: Just came home from our 5 night stay at Vdara Hotel and Spa. Some of the reviews that i have read about the place almost turned me away. Glad we came here. The no smoking rule is big for me being that i am a recent quitter. Hats off to this policy. Staff very pleasant and friendly. Service was excelent from the pool breakfast staff to the host that handled our cabana. Great job Vdara. Guess everyone's experience is different. Would come back to this property anytime. Highly recomend for the laid back persons. Short walks to all the gaming facilities. Keep up the good Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Bolted iron to the ironing board!”
Reviews.Author: travel5
Reviews.Content: I should have known that I was not getting into a 4 diamond hotel when the check in took 35 minutes. But this wasn't the only reason for my grading on this hotel: - In room safe was locked by the previous guest and had to wait in the room 30 minutes to have security open it. - Iron was bolted to the ironing board (just like a cheap motel) - had to call housekeeping to request a robe, since they don't place them in the closet - Weight scale was broken, had to request a new one. - Internet signal was extremly slow. Could only conduct business e-mails at the Mandalay Convention Center - No coffee maker in the room, inspite of having a beattiful kitchen I just can't beleive that this hotel misses on so many AAA basics and still acheives a 4 diamond status. Do yourself a favor and stay at another hotel. Las Vegas offers too many options for you to committ the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “Marble floors does not equal good service”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: I have never felt more missled or over charged for a hotel stay before Vdara. The rooms are nice clean and new but the service is non existent. 15 minute line to check in, no restaurant, coffee shop has 20-30 minute line in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this one...”
Reviews.Author: smmcisaa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Vdara. We did not choose this hotel as my husband's company booked it for him so for that I can't complain to much however if I returned, it would not be to this hotel with all of the other choices. The hotel itself is very shiny and new and on the surface seems ok. That is until you go explore the other options and see how many amenities you are missing out on. To be clear, if you want a smaller hotel with no smoking, casino, places to eat and away from the chaos of the strip then maybe its for you. I found it nice the first day then quickly started missing a few things. The front desk: Not overly friendly. Made us call back 5 times before telling us they could not give us a late checkout on the Sunday, not even if we paid which I find very hard to believe. The room: Actually quite nice. I was told I was upgraded to full view room...full view of the Aria and valets...not a view at all. Bed was super comfy, bath looked nice but small. Shower was also small. Kitchenette was useless but fridge was nice. The pool: Probably the worst. I had such pool envy when we went to other hotels. Its small and crowded and not very refreshing. Drinks at pool were way overpriced, $5 pop and $14 cocktails. I heard the food was decent though. Food: No restaurants but the Aria is very close however it was always very busy at the buffet. I would recommend Julian Serrano at the Aria...food was amazing! The market store at the Vdara is crazy expensive. Water $3, crackers $8...I didn't buy much there. Tip: Its only a short walk to the tram where the hotel connects to the Bellagio. Use it! It will cut a bunch of walking time if you are going near Monte Carlo and onwards (New York, MGM, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: glennharrold
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, in a corner suite which was excellent, the room had a number of views - city view, and of the Aria, Mandalay Bay, Luxor etc and the MGM out of the bathroom window! The beds were very comfy and the kitchen, living room and bedroom all immaculate. The deep bath tub and huge glass shower, 2 TVs, american size fridge, coffee maker and ice machine (ideal for those drinks or to chill some bubbles) were added extras. Crockery etc can be ordered from houskeeping - but its Vegas who wants to stay in and cook!? The Vdara market cafe was great for a quick snack or breakfast in the mornings, quite, peaceful and not too crowded. The myriad of local buffets and restaurants were excellent. Staff were friendly and professional and helpful. The Vdara is close to the Bellagio, Aria, Cosmopolitan, Planet Hollywood, shopping centres and the frenzy of the strip but the Vdara itself is tranquil and relaxing. We would definitely stay again - the only downside is the MGM resort fees - they are excessive and really only get you a small bottle of water!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: alexanderSIMPLE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vdara hotel for a bachelor party, in their huge 2-bedroom Hospitality Suite. Overall, it was a good experience, definitely the way to go if you want to live like a king in Vegas but still be able to get a good rest away from all the craziness. The room was amazing, and we had a view of the Bellagio fountains and The Strip. It's about a ten minute walk to Las Vegas Blvd from the hotel, so the location is great... the best of both worlds, with no casino on site. People have been saying that the hotel no longer stocks Aveda products... and that's false. You get what you pay for. Obviously, if you book on Priceline and get a great deal, don't expect to get pampered with a high-floor room and the latest organic toiletries. If you book directly through them, you may get better service. We had plenty of towels, silverware, and Aveda products throughout our stay. The thing that a lot of reviewers must not realize is that his "hotel" was originally designed as a condo building, before the real estate bubble burst. Therefore, all rooms have kitchenettes, washer/dryer combos, and great views. Also, it is why there is no casino onsite. The downstairs market was never intended for large crowds, but I give them credit for dealing with the huge flow of people. Because of this, also, the pool is on the small side... but the drinks are reasonably priced. The Silk Road restaurant closed earlier this year, and that's old news. There's no "private party" in there as the sign says, but also no need to be offended. Aria is right nearby, with plenty of sinful activities to indulge in. I'd give them five stars if it wasn't for the service. We don't complain much but we had some troubles with check-in taking a long time and just some more minor issues. I asked the concierge for a restaurant lunch recommendation and he pointed me to a restaurant in Aria, which is only open for dinner... he should have known better, you know? As far as the building goes, it's a "best bet"!! Also, we were there on a very busy weekend, and Vdara and Aria is where a lot of very beautiful people stay. We even saw a few celebrities, so it was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Quiet & Smoke Free”
Reviews.Author: TheProette
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at Vdara and it is a lovely hotel. It was nice to come back from the strip and the casinos and have a quiet place to relax and enjoy the pool and amenities. The fact that it was non-smoking was a big plus for us. The only down side in my opinion was that it is set back from the strip a little ways and you end up walking quite a bit. Next door at Aria the dining was amazing however and that is only 30 seconds away. Everything you need is at City Center so it is not too big a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room for 4!”
Reviews.Author: IwanBanens
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 2 adults and 2 kids of 8 and 10 years old. Beforehand we mailed to make sure that was possible. No problem they confirmed. Upon arrival the second bed for the kids appeared to be a sleeping couch that was not suitable for sleeping on because of metal poles and a very thin matras. We had to complain for more that 5 hours before it was fixed. They had to get a bed from another hotel! Very poor service for this so-called 5 star hotel. According to staff this problem was already known for some time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aaron L
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel in September 2011 with my girlfriend. The rooms were excellent. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. My girlfriend is the pickiest person I have ever known in terms of cleanliness and even she was impressed. The pool is a bit small but this is easily made up for by the fantastic cocktails and wonderful food available fom the bar. In fact the cocktails were so good, I had a few too many and dandered into the pool with my wallet still in my pocket and ruined my money! After taking time to visit all the hotels on the strip, the Vdara appeared to us to be the best and when we return to Vegas we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A top choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jandc2
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is in the new City Center next to the Aria, Billagio and Cosmopolitan...a very good location. We very much enjoyed this no-smoking, no-gambling hotel - although neither is very far away. Our room was a suite--phenomenal with a superb view of Vegas...it was quiet, relaxing, and VERY comfy. We highly recommend this hotel in Vegas. We rated it 4 stars instead of 5 because the fitness center and pool area are both under-sized for the size of the hotel. Enjoyed the spa too!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property for an off-strip stay”
Reviews.Author: Rivered
Reviews.Content: Summary: Immaculate property, great service and excellent rooms Check-in: Easy and quick process. Even with a small line, things went very rapidly. In addition, the valet service was great. Very attentive and very rapid delivery of your vehicle. Location: Perfect!! It sits almost right between the Aria and the Bellagio. Three minute walk from the front door to the Aria casino and maybe a 5 minute walk over to the Bellagio. And if a 5 min. walk is too much, you can always take the tram. Food: Did not have room service but there is a small shop downstairs for coffee etc. Not a ton of shops in the hotel which really lends to the character of the hotel. Nice and quiet which is a nice change of atmosphere from the casino hotels. Casino: No casino at the Vdara (which is great!). And, frankly, it is nice that there isn't one. Rooms: Large, clean and well equipped. No complaints and the views are great.

Reviews.Title: “nickel and dimed to death”
Reviews.Author: bothearlyretirement
Reviews.Content: First of all we thought that the Hotel building/rooms were very comfortable and the staff, although overworked, were very helpfull and courteous. However we thought that the Hotel policies took away any desires to return. Firstly there is a $10 per person per night "resort tax" which reallyonly covered a daily 12 oz bottle of water. Pretty expensive bottle of water... There was a $5 charge on every room service item which makes a jug of morning coffee about $30 plus a very small tip to the staff. We have stayed at a number of 4 diamond hotels and as we say the Hotel is very comfortable, spotless and very good staff, however there a many Hotels to choose from in Vegas and that is exactly what we will do next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room & view, but rather inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: CgyGirl
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a corner suite from the standard room (they call it a deluxe suite). No free upgrades were offered to us, though she did credit us for 2 nights resort fees ($40 total - hooray). From the 49th floor, we had a spectacular view of the Belagio fountains which we really enjoyed. The windows in the bathroom were nice too - kinda cool to take a shower and look out at the city/strip at the same time. One of the reasons I go to Vegas is to enjoy the nightlife and the incredible dining options the city has to offer. This hotel doesn't offer either. There's a very small lobby lounge and a small cafeteria-style market - otherwise the next closest option is to walk over to the Aria. To get to the strip, it's a bit confusing and there's not really any helpful signage to point you in the right direction. It ends up being about a 10 min walk to the strip once you figure out where you're going. For ladies who wear heels, it's not a pleasant walk so I suggest taking a cab. I have no complaints about the service, staff, or the room - it's just what I go to Vegas for isn't conveniently accessed from here. I've also read how several other travellers have been able to get complimentary upgrades - we were not so lucky so that kinda bugs me too. If I was spending all my time in my room, I'd consider going back. But seriously... it's Vegas... that'l never happen, so I likely won't go back to the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis on the strip”
Reviews.Author: lynn0101
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. The rooms were nice, comfortable - great beds. It was so nice to be able to get away from the chaos of the strip. No casino, no smoking.... definitely the only place I will stay going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in a crazy town”
Reviews.Author: Adrian C
Reviews.Content: For us our Vdara experience did not begin well when we were given a suite on the 50th floor that had not been cleaned and we had to take another suite for one night on a much lower floor which did not have the views expected. My wife insisted we were relocated to the suite we should have been given which we were the following night. Having said that our new suite had a jaw dropping view over the Belagio fountains and the city. Our suite was classy with a king sized bed and two 42 LCD screens. The hotel did not have gambling which suited us but was linked to the Bealgio which had more than enough for most people. When our helicopter trip to the canyon was cancelled at the last moment the hotel set about trying to re book us with two people phoning around different companies even though I had made my own reservations, when this was not possible and they saw how disappointed we were they provided us with a complimentary hotel limo to take us to our show thank you so much Mathew. My advise here would be book your flight through the hotel as I am sure that had we done so we would not have been cancelled at the last moment. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful everything!!”
Reviews.Author: mariu40
Reviews.Content: I loved it!! this hotel has a great location, great service, brand new modern style. We were received very cordially and even with a 95% occupancy, we were kindly upgraded to a suite :) excellent beds, great bathroom, kitchen, guest bathroom, etc with a great view of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vegas”
Reviews.Author: aknoble
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for people that want to escape the insanity of Vegas, but still have access to the casinos and nightlife. The rooms are pretty large, but my suite had kind of a choppy set up with the furniture. My co-worker's suite was much more open. The view of the fountains and pools at Bellagio was awesome. The bed was really comfortable and the bathtub was amazing. As soon as I went into the gym facilities I didn't mind the resort fee. Even though it wasn't huge, the gym was really nice. The equipment was all in great shape and they had towels and water set up at all of the machines. It closes kind of early, but I prefer to workout in the morning anyway. I thought the service throughout the hotel was amazing, everyone we encountered was very friendly and asked how we were doing. I agree with some of the criticism about the cafe, it's not set up very well and the food isn't worth it. For being the only food option in the hotel it was kind of a disappointment, but Aria is right there with plenty to pick from. In my room I forgot I was in the middle of the strip in Vegas...then I went to wait for the elevator and it all came back to me. That will always be a long process in that town, so I can't fault the hotel...I just wish the fancy lights didn't emit so much heat in that tiny metal box! Overall though a great hotel for business travelers or those who want to have a break from the casinos and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great for everyone”
Reviews.Author: 6thjdub
Reviews.Content: The location rocked, room service was great, love the valet, best bar ive ever been to. There's no casino so it's kid friendly. Rooms are huge and soooo nice. I only didn't like that the curtains split and let the rising sun in way to early for Vegas (:

Reviews.Title: “Hurry up and enjoy it before MGM destroys it”
Reviews.Author: MaineMan2Maine
Reviews.Content: We had 2suites for 8 nights, arrived check in was a breeze , upgraded to better suite with views of Bellagio fountains. Rooms are very nice, well set up and Sevy had pots and pans sent up immediately. Sevy was tremendous. Housekeeping was some of the best we have ever had in any hotel. 2 flat screens in the room, k cup, full kitchen and 1.5 bathrooms. Some rooms do not get kitchen upgrades such as pots and pans and k cup. This is the beginning of the destruction that MGM does. They have started taking away Aveda products and now give vdara products, in time it will be a run down hotel...this is the MGM M.O. The beds are very,very comfortable but the couches are terribly uncomfortable. Many reviews state that the pool area is not a party place, for the most part I agree except weekends. They will in time reduce rates and it will be like any other place. The pool in my opinion in a travesty for LV. Poorly designed, very small and wasted space. The cabanas for the price compared to other hotels is a good deal. My wife actually slipped on a ramp in the pool area, I know it sounds obvious but the areas surrounding the pool is very slippery, it has to do with what then product they used. Waiter said they nearly kill themselves daily. Another girl fell in the same spot on the same day....she was drunk but they still gave her another drink. My wife made a report, they asked her how much she had to drink.......she doesn't drink...never has. Manager was very defensive about the incident and my wife did hurt herself but they did not seem concerned. We have started talking to our attorney, because this is not an isolated incident, even employees say they nearly kill themselves. You can access the Aria and Bellagio and you can walk to the Cosmopolitan as well. Its a bit of a walk but it's a bit of a walk anywhere In Vegas. The only cafe In the hotel is a debacle, poorly designed, non functional. The food is good a bit pricey but your on vacation. The cafe also closes very early.They have a function room that states private party the whole time we were there...it was so private we never saw anyone....this is where the cafe should be. You must valet every time it is MGM continuation of nickel and diming customers. The resort fe also a joke...includes very good wifi and water but why make people pay for it if they don't use it. Overall the rooms were nice,quiet and good to have washer and dryer but we will not be back. You better get there quick before MGM ruins it...it's only a matter of time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for non gamblers”
Reviews.Author: Tienschneider
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are non smokers and he doesn't like to gamble so we often stayed at the Trump Hotel. This time, we decided to give this hotel a try since it location is perfect for the two of us (I like to gamble so I just go over to the Aria or the Bellagio). The room is very modern and the bed was very comfortable, and it makes you feel at home. The only thing missing in this hotel is the coffee service, my husband and I enjoy having our coffee in the room in the morning. The front desk staff was very nice and courteous. This hotel is definitely on my list to come back.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: melissajhill
Reviews.Content: Incompetence is the first word that comes to mind. Dishonest is the second. Don't leave anything behind because it will not be returned. This hotel was a disaster! One thing that I am sure of is that we will never return to Vdara. Ever!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: redkerr15
Reviews.Content: Definately my new fave hotel in Vegas. The hotel is smallish, elegant and very classy. Having read reviews here I was prepared for bad service from house keeping, but could not fault them. My mum and mum in law shared a suite with a pull out bed, and this was made up as requested on arrival. Crockery and pans for cooking arrived shortly after. The Vdara as an aparthotel is a great way of doing Vegas on a longer stay. Eating out is expensive on the strip and I find I don't want to eat out every day anyway. Loved the bar downstairs, Try the "Kiss of persuasion". You can sit outside and it is surprisingly quiet! I liked the Market cafe downstairs, yes it is not cheap but the food is good quality and the sandwiches and salads huge and good for sharing. The pool was very nice too, not as plush as some but the bar area is a very nice spot for a bite to eat. The location is fab, the Aria is across the road, Crystals are through the Aria and Bellagio easily reached through linking corridors. It is so nice to return to the Vdara after being out on the strip, it really is a little oasis of peace. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good; but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ColoTravDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the Vdara are modern and comfortable. The property sits back from the strip, but really no further than the Bellagio. So, if you are used to walking the strip this is really a non-issue. It is also connected to Aria and Monte Carlo via a Tram. Further, if you are concerned about not having a casino in the hotel, don’t be, it is a short 5 minute walk to Aria. The pool is laid back and quite small, but adequate. Vdara does have some problems though including (1) poor housekeeping and (2) customer service/billing. During our recent 3 day stay, we had our room cleaned once. I even called to ask for our room to be made up on the second day and no one showed (and we didn’t have our “do not disturb” up). In addition, there was a significant amount of dust on the lamp shades that remained there throughout our stay. Lastly, they were running a promotion were you received a free breakfast or lunch buffet for two each day. We took advantage of this and the charge was supposed to “automatically” come off a checkout. It didn’t. It took two weeks of phone calls and e-mails to finally get these credited back. Frustrating. I would stay here again; but I recommend that you check your bill thoroughly (you can pull it up in real-time on the in-room TV).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: DORDubai
Reviews.Content: It is perfect property for a quite stay in las Vegas, especially since there is no casino within the property... we have been upgraded to suite and it was a very nice and spacious. Unfortunately turn-down was not made properly (The cleaner forgot the cleaning staff in the bathroom,, the cleaning was not finished but they left...) In the morning there was one serving of coffee for a double occupancy suite... Leave for a suite for a regular room the hosekeeping was not acceptable.... we called for getting some coffee and it took us 22 minutes to get anyone pick up the phone.... stay thetre if you do not expect gret deal of service. We checked out and went happily to Wynn....

Reviews.Title: “We will be back - Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Vivian V
Reviews.Content: We booked Vdara Hotel through hotwire, not knowing hotel's name until completely booked. Reading the earlier reviews, we were a little bit disappointed but for the good price in the busy week (summer break), and no chance to return, we took a chance. Arriving around 1:00pm, 2 hours before check-in time but Hotel let us check in with a great welcome. I asked for room with Bellagio's fountain show view and got it. As some other reviewers mentioned, this is not a hotel, it's more likely a high-end apartment. Our room has stunning view at night. Contemporary interior decoration with very comfortable beds. No "Casino" smell, quiet and easy access to Bellagio & Aria. Swimming pool and Spa are on 3rd floor, small and quickly occupied after 10:00am. Not much impressive since we came here not for the pool, but for a 5-star hotel standard, it's not yet qualified. We had stayed at Bellagio's Spa Tower before, loved it, but liked Vdara more due to its nearly built and contemporary interior. Didn't enjoy Bellagio much since there was and is always lots of people in front of the hotel for fountain show time and inside the casino. We paid for the price (was really expensive last time) but mostly for the brand, not much the enjoy. This time, with Vdara, yes, we did enjoy both the price and the service. Will be back and refer friends or who like contemporary techniques to check this hotel out once having chance to come to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Miguel9128
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! The biggest advantage was its central location on the strip, and the fact that is has no casino in it with cigarette smoke. When we checked in we requested a room with view of the Bellagio Fountains, and ended up getting a beautiful suite with washer/dryer/living room/dining room included - WOW!!! Best room ever. Great value for its prize =). There is a marketplace in the Vdara but is very pricey. Tips: - When you check in, request a room with the Bellagio fountains - For cheap food/dining that is good quality go to the nearby Miracle Mile Shops. The restaurants in the City Center complex (which Vdara belongs to) are VERY expensive - There is a food court at the Monte Carlo; this can be accessed by a free tram from the Vdara - In the strip and on casino/mall entrances you will be continously harassed by people trying to get you to buy time shares....this was really annoying. They will always try to ask you the same "screening questions" - just tell them you are leaving Vegas tonight and they will go away.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most comfortable rooms in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Virga017
Reviews.Content: The Vdara Hotel and Spa has one of the most comfortable rooms in Las Vegas. It is comfortable to the body (bed, chairs, desk, bath) and to the eye (with its design and layout). Additionally, the workout room is excellent, as is the store in the lobby. With no restaurant on site for dinner, its proximity to Avia, the Bellagio, and other casinos along this section of the strip is essential. It is a young crowd that stays at this hotel, many from overseas. It's location in the middle of some of the worst traffic on the strip does not make it an easy place to commute from.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, convenient!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJane03
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried after reading some of the earlier reviews, but we got a good price on priceline for a busy ( so expensive ) time in Las Vegas, so we took a chance. We loved it! My favorite hotel in Vegas is the Bellgio, and because of it's location, the Vdara was ideal. I had stayed in Bellagio's Spa Tower before, and this was the same location, with a nicer and roomier suite. We had the deluxe suites- actually 2 of them. This is the bottom of their line, so no coffee maker. But one had 2 big flat screens, the other because of it's layout had one, but was a more open space. The view over the pool was pleasant, and the room was quiet. We had no problem checking in, even though it was quite busy. We were in and out of there in 15 minutes, including the time the clerk spent searching for two suites next door to each other. We really appreciated her attention to that! Besides the market cafe, there is a fabulous pastry, coffee and crepes place just inside the Belliago very close to Vdara. They will pack up your breakfast so it is easy to take back to your pretty suite to enjoy! Despite previous comments to the contrary, our rooms were spotless, and made-up in a timely manner everyday. We loved Vdara, and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Vdara for four days in September.”
Reviews.Author: TimCar
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nice, a solid Three Star, no higher. To me, a Hotel needs to have, at minimum, on-site restaurants and a private lounge area to rate more than 3 Stars. The Good: Large Flat Panel TV's in the Rooms Nice Views from the Bellagio side (can watch the Bellagio Fountain shows) Very comfortable beds No "Casino" smell or traffic The Bad: Very expensive room service (like $48.00 for one person generic eggs, toast, coffee and juice) Very limited beer selection at the little lobby open area bar. ...and most of all, location. It's about a 1/4 mile walk to the Casino area of the Bellagio, a little closer to the Aria Casino, but if you want the Bellagio, get ready for a hike. The walk wouldn't be so bad if they had auto doors instead of expecting you to push your way though all those doors. I know that sounds a little lame to complain about the doors, but hey, this is Las Vegas and it is supposed to be a link between two high class hotels. The other thing that bothered us and a lot of others is the Vdara is right next door to the Cosmopolitan Casino and Las Vegas Blvd., yet it's like "You Can't Get There From Here". I think whoever owns the VDara also owns the Crystal Shopping Center as they force you to walk across the street, through Crystals, up the escalator, back across the street on the overpass, then back down the escalator to get to Cosmo's and the Blvd. -or- You have to J-Walk maybe 20 feet across a driveway to cut 90% of the trip and just walk next door. Also, I think when this Hotel was built it was going to be Condos, not a Hotel. They probably built it just before/during the housing crash in Vegas. This would explain the lack of amenities you normally find in a Hotel (like Restaurants, Shops and a better Elevator layout) and also why the rooms have stoves and ovens in them. The rooms look like an updated "Extended Stay" hotel. . . One last thing I have to say: The Nevada Gaming Control Board (NGCB) is out of their minds and out of touch with customers. This is the second major gambling location I have been to in Nevada since the NGCB removed coin money from the Casinos, and it will be last time I go to any of them. It just isn't any fun to be in a Casino without the sounds of a Casino. We only found one $1.00 machine (at New York, New York Casino) that paid out in coins and there was a long line to play it. Just like the last Casino we went to in Reno, we brought over $2,500 to play with, yet only spent maybe $100.00 before getting bored of the dull atmosphere and leaving the Casinos. They need to bring back the "Clunk-Clunk-Clunk" of coins falling into the hoppers!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Halo27
Reviews.Content: It was a breathe taking and beautiful hotel! Room service and customer service was excellent. Its not on the strip but there is a short walk connected to the Bellagio to the strip. Also there is a tram connecting it to the Aria and the Monte Carlo. Overall it was quiet with lovely views the rooms were spacious, and definately clean! I would definately stay here again and recommend it to other people. We rented a Cabana for a day which was lovely with a private pool area, fridge, flat screen tv, water, misters, and our own private server (whom was friendly and efficient) my best trip to Vegas by far.

Reviews.Title: “peace & tranquility & just a short walk from Bellagio & Aria”
Reviews.Author: jellycat_plantcity
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights, in deluxe suite. Room had a city view, of Bellagio & fountains & Cosmopolitan. Beds were super comfy. Room service was excellent with portions large enough for 2. The cafe by the pool was a delight in the mornings, quite, peaceful & not too crowded. Thanks so much to Chance & WIlliam for their menu suggestions , the corn flake encrusted french toast was a melt in your mouth taste sensation. We found check in & out to be quick & easy and the valet was attentive even when we lost our claim ticket the morning we were leaving. What is so amazing about the Vdara is its proximity to Bellagio, Aria, Cosmopolitan, Planet H, & the frenzy of the strip but the Vdara itself is tranquil & relaxing. We would definitely stay again. PS the reception area has a lovely fresh aroma (but the rooms themselves have not scent at all...just clean)...as we headed "home" each day as we got near we would say "it smells like Vdara.....ahhhhh"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: Was on a visit to see my daughter and stayed here. Hotel was perfect for us as it had no casinos and no smoking. Rooms were nicely furnished and view was very beautiful. Vdara is located in a perfect spot to get to all the other hotels on the strip. They have a tram located nearby to get to other properties which is very convenient. I would have given the hotel 5 stars if it wasn't for the folio problems we had. We were never able to see our bill and/or checkout on line. All in all though this was a minor distraction and strongly recommend Vdara for any future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: sammi_jj
Reviews.Content: Loved the Vdara, we stayed for 4 nights at the begining of Sept. Modern, clean, and quiet. Gives you a nice break from the strip but is still so close to everything and very handy with the passage to the Bellagio and the tram too. The only reason it gets a 4 not a 5 is because of the pool area, it was very small given the size of the hotel and its 5* rating.

Reviews.Title: “CENTRAL, COMFORTABLE AND QUIET”
Reviews.Author: RICHSHAR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after considering that fact I have been to Vegas a few times and like nice quiet places among the travel. Based on some review we tried three different rooms over 6 days. We had a conference to attend and wanted to be near the action. We tried a corner suite and thought this was great, however we did not have a view of the Belgio fountain and these are facing the pool side. Would recommend a higher floor over looking he Fountain. We then got a one bedroom suite on the 56th floor overlooking the fountain, this was fantastic and most enjoyable as we could see much of the total fountain and were above all the noise. The Panoramic suite was great and better than the corner suite, but really of them all try to stay on the upper floors overlooking the fountain. We found the service to be swift and helpful. I was a little nervouse after reading the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Angelairene22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family during our most recent Vegas trip to celebrate my son's 30th birthday and this hotel is by far one of my favorite so far without a casino. The hotel is behind Cosmopolitan and connected to the Bellagio by a tram and next door to the Aria. It takes roughly 3 minutes to walk from the lobby over to the Cosmo which wasn't bad at all. The lobby is clean, bright, and modern with a cute little cafe/marketplace downstairs for your convenience. From the complimentary valet, check in, the whole course of the stay and check out the service was seamless.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern, nonsmoking hotel for a strip stay”
Reviews.Author: fluff_astrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the 4th of July weekend and found it comfortable, stylish and quiet. I shared the room with several other folks, so the sleeping area seemed smaller than expected for the price paid. It did have a large bathroom with double sinks, marble, bath and walk-in shower. The kitchen had a dining room table, flatware/plates, a microwave and more, so we saved a lot of money on breakfast and lunch by buying groceries at a nearby Walgreens and preparing food in the room. The double flatscreen TVs are large and new. However, the way the bedroom and living room are set up--with a central partition but open space on the left and right side--meant the TVs were back-to-back, making it hard to watch two different things at the same time without the sound bleeding over. Being a non-gambler and nonsmoker, I appreciated the lack of a casino at this hotel. The absence creates a clean, smoke-free environment and ensures there isn't a horrible cover-up perfume scent in the hallways. For this reason alone, I rank this hotel much higher than THEHotel at Mandalay Bay, because despite touting itself as casino-free, THEHotel still connects to the Mandalay Bay casino and its smoke permeates. In addition to the room amenities, the property has, among other things, a nice gym, a rooftop pool, and a deli/cafe. There's also a large pool area on the roof. Do be forewarned that this is the much-storied "Death Ray" pool, meaning that the surrounding City Center towers reflect sunlight directly down and increase the odds you'll walk away with a sunburn. Given that it was 114 degrees outside during my stay, I didn't really venture out for more than 5 minutes, but it appeared they had plenty of umbrella chairs set up. Part of the peace and quiet that goes with this hotel comes from the fact that it is a bit set back from the City Center hub-bub. So, while I would personally return to this hotel for a leisure/luxury visit, if you're someone who wants more of a nightlife atmosphere and an easier place to stumble back to after a night of clubbing, the nearby Aria/Cosmopolitan hotels may be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “A little break from the Vegas craziness”
Reviews.Author: jennjn
Reviews.Content: The Vdara was a wonderful place to stay away from the craziness of the Strip but close enough to take it all in. The Vdara required a bit of walking to get to the Strip, but there was a nice walkway through the Bellagio. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. The salon was nice, but nothing too special. No casino and no smoking makes this hotel a relaxing stay. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: jogar1
Reviews.Content: Vdara is non smoking and has no casino, so it's nice to get away from the noise. At the time we were there, there was no restaurant open to speak of, the one that was there always said "private party" There is a deli with 3 or 4 tables and you can pick up coffee, pop, a sandwhich, essentials and a few light groceries. Nice hotel over all.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as last year.”
Reviews.Author: Poodle_Mommy
Reviews.Content: I still like the Vdara, but things are not as good as they were last year when we stayed. We stayed September 4th to the 10th, 2011. When we walked in to the room, the feeling was cold, I finally realized it was because the bed was all white. They use to have a gold coverlet and bolster on the bed, that was gone. Then when we went to take a shower, expecting the Aveda products they had the previous year, they were replaced with something, "formulated especially for the Vdara," not nearly as good as the Aveda products they referenced on their website they had advertized. The bathtub had a red washcloth hanging...which I have no idea where it came from. Even the housekeeping wasn't up to par. They didn't remove a dirty glass and sometimes they emptied the ice bucket, sometimes not. Last year, we had a fabulous experience and couldn't wait to return. This year, that was not the case. It still is a beautiful hotel, with awesome views if you can get on the higher floors facing north. But the walks to the Strip can wear on you over time. The only place to eat is the Market Cafe, and although I liked what we had there, it closes at 8PM. Since this hotel only offers nice rooms and Spa, the least that they could do is have some small eatery open later than 8pm in a 24 hour city. I might stay again, but at this point it is unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: 3hapitravelers
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! We had a room on the 30th floor with an amazing view of the fountains in front of the Bellagio. The room was very spacious and modern. The bed and pillows were ultra comfortable. The bath was large and had a nice deep soaking tub, which is rare in a hotel. The spa is wonderful and worth every penny spent. I had a massage and facial package and it was 3 hours of heaven. We will definitely return to the Vdara if we are in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Perefect Hotel for Non Smokers and Smokers who Hates Excessvie Smoke”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel318
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely a nice surprise. I initially had second thoughts about staying at this hotel because of reading other posters remarks about their stay at this hotel. I must say, I enjoyed my weekend stay at this hotel. Pros: There is 24-hour security. No one is allowed to get on the elevator unless you have a room key. Our housekeeper was exceptional. She replenished our towels and personal hygiene products twice daily. The housekeeper even provided us with turn-down service each night. The hotel is smoke free. The Bellagio is less than a five-minute walk away (across the skywalk--which is connected to the Vdara). In addition, if you leave out the front door, you can walk to Aria, which is also less than a five-minute walk. A cab ride to the airport is cheaper than being in the center of the strip. Less than a 15 minute walk to the city of the strip. We were provided a room at a reasonable rate with an excellent view. Cons: Some of the guest service representatives can be a bit condescending and rude. The store inside the hotel closes early. Overall, my stay at the Vdara was refreshing and relaxing. Lastly, the blackout shades did not bother me. The shades allowed just a small amount of light in--not enough to lose any sleep. I will definitely stay at the Vdara again. Places to eat at that is near the hotel: The Sugar Factory - Across the street in Paris Hotel Buffet - Bellagio Hotel (connected to Vdara) Gilley's BBQ - In Front of Treasure Island - 15 minute walk Fatburger – Located in the strip mall across the street from CityCenter.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Neys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on September 5th for 4 nights. This is our third time at this property. This is a new modern hotel with kitchen facilities. What was missing from the room this time was the coffee maker which they no longer supply. Also you have to request slippers and robes if you want them. We like this hotel very much. It is clean, the staff are friendly and very accommodating especially Mike the porter at the front door and Delores (Whoopi) internal security. They were both very helpful and friendly giving us info on Las Vegas. We had a special package that included a free buffet for two each day to be used at several different hotels. We used our voucher to have breakfast each day at the Aria Buffet. We found the buffet to be great, and in our opinion better than the one at the Bellagio. We travelled with my brother and his wife. They usually stay at the Venetian. They did like the hotel very much, but did not like that it was not on the strip. They found it was too much walking to get to the strip. You have to go down a side street to reach the strip, or there is a walkway between the Vdara and the Bellagio that you can also use. This walkway is at the back of the Bellagio so you still have to walk through the Bellagio to get to the strip. So people with mobility problems may want to choose another hotel. Also if you want a hotel with a casino, many restaurants and shops you may want to choose another hotel. We like this hotel very much and would stay here again on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rutger L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only, wanting to try out some other hotels in Las Vegas as well. This is a truly design hotel, with a nice lounge atmosphere ( which you like or not). Rooms are very spacious and beautifully styled. Overall this is a great hotel, but you can find other hotels that offer the same luxury (or even more) for a much better price.

Reviews.Title: “Great View.... of the naked people next door! :(”
Reviews.Author: nikkisha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during labor day weekend and was very disappointed. The check-in process went smooth and that was about it. It was downhill for there. The lady at the front desk at check-in asked if I had any requests and I asked her for a room on a higher floor with a view. There are 56 floors in Vdara, I was put on floor 31. I get to my room and the curtains were down so i pulled them up to see the view, instead what i saw was a view of the naked couple next door! I was so disgusted. So I immediately pulled the curtain back down. So much for a room with a view! It was already 5:00pm when I checked in and I was too tired to go back downstairs and ask them to switch me to another room. I wish i had! Because once it got dark out side I realized that the curtains were see through and I could still see them and they were still naked! Later I tried to use the wifi on my ipad and it wasn't working. So i called the front desk to have someone come look at it. A "technician" came to reset the wifi and it still wasn't working his response was "oh well, sometimes it just doesn't work." I was furious, wireless internet is part of a ridiculous $20 a night resort fee and I couldn't even use it. I called the front desk to ask them what else was included in this so-called "resort fee" because clearly the internet was not working and they said that it included bottled water (which wasn't even in the room), wireless internet (which wasn't working) and a local newspaper (which i didn't need) When I asked them if I could have the resort fee removed since i didn't need any of those they refused and said its part of the hotel service. So basically I had to pay no matter what. 30 minutes later they sent up two tiny bottles of water, so thats what i had to pay $20 a day for! I was stuck in a room with no view except for the naked couple next door and no internet. I went down at 6:00am to check out on a Tuesday and it took at least 30 minutes and there was only one person ahead of me! It was the slowest check-out I've ever experienced! I will not being staying at this hotel again!! I expected so much more considering this was supposed to be a 5 star hotel. It's 3.5 stars at best.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and so quiet”
Reviews.Author: SablePoudreuse
Reviews.Content: Facing the New Aria hotel, the Vdara is a beautiful place to stay and enjoy a top quality moment. In the center of a new area recently developed, with luxurious boutiques and restaurant, the Vdara (or its twin brother the Aria) offers an excellent quality to stay in Vegas. Price wise, it is always useful to look for the best package before going to Vegas. Summer 2011 was so quiet that we could find a room available a day before the 4th of July, just passing by the front desk. Both Hotels were built a couple of years ago and are in a top top condition "not to say" brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, but!”
Reviews.Author: denis_mason
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara for a week from 25-Aug-11. It was a lovely hotel, and we enjoyed our stay tremendously, especially the size and facilities of the room (Deluxe Suite). However, the Silk Road restaurant had a sign posted at the entrance all week stating "Private Party", when no such event ever took place during our stay. I suspect that the restaurant had been closed for some reason. There was a coffee shop/snack bar on site, name the Market Cafe, which provided a reasonable range of food for breakfast and lunch, but was grossly inadequate for dinner. The consequence of not being able to use the Silk Road was that we had to walk to the Bellagio, via the link walkway, or take a tram to Aria, every evening. Whilst this criticism may appear to be petty, it became a chore when it had to be undertaken every day. If we had been advised of this situation before we left the UK, we probably would have stayed at the Bellagio and saved the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara---Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: hobbymandoc
Reviews.Content: My sister and I treated our Mom to a Vegas trip for her 82nd birthday. We chose to stay at the Vdara because it is non smoking and we really got a good deal on a spacious City View Suite. Our room was on the 41st floor and our view was AMAZING! The staff was very helpful and housekeeping had our room fresh and clean by the time we returned from breakfast every morning. The only negative was the uncomfortable sofa bed that my sister had to sleep on in the living area. We loved the location and we will certainly stay at the Vdara in the future!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: Check9
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Vdara for three nights, Sept.6th - 9th. We spent two nights in a excutive corner suite and one night in the two bedroom two story penthouse on the 56th floor. When we arrived I asked about getting a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains. The gal that was helping us said there was none available. This was at ten in the morning so it was understandable. I then noticed she saw that I was holding a $20.00 bill in my hand and all of the sudden there became a room facing the fountains available. We had a great view and the excutive suite was very nice. I will mention that the lobby is very nice and the cafe looked great but we had free buffets for two days so did not eat there. I have to say the smell in the lobby is over whelming. Some may like it but I thought it was a little over the top. Kind of smells like they want it to have a spa like smell. The smell did not carry into the rooms. We had asked for a feather topper for the pull out couch as I had read another review stating they had gotten one and it was great. Well, I was pretty surprised when we came back from being out and there sat what I would call a comforter. They did not have any toppers. My daughter decided to just roll up inside of that and sleep on the top of the couch. As another reviewer mention the products are not Aveda in the smaller suites but we did received them in the penthouse suite. There was a Keurig in both suites with the little cups in the refrigerator but only one regular and one decaf. You also received two bottles of water. Did not see a paper until we ordered room service for breakfast in the penthouse suite and the guy that delivered the food also brought the paper for us. We left the light on for housekeeping and they came in and cleaned and left clean towels and etc. No problems there. I must mention the furniture in both rooms are very nice and the first suite still looked pretty new. But, the penthouse suite was another story. Apparently either families or parties have had a pretty good time. The couch had so many stains I didn't even want to sit on it. The purple velvet chair was also bad on the arms and head rest area. Not what you would expect for $600.00 a night. The chair up in the upper story bedroom was of the same kind and it was fine. The room itself was fabulous with super cool views. The hotel seemed to have quite a few people always in the lobby but we never ran into anyone on either of our floors. It was nice and quite for sleeping.
