For those who use white noise machines they have a fan in the bedroom that you can turn on with the air conditioner/heat so that takes care of not having to bring a machine or earplugs. The beds were good and the pillows were great. The tvs were big and HD so very clear. They also have tvs in the bathroom. The bathrooms are super. We did not use the pool but stopped to look at it and was surprised that it isn't a very big area. Lot of people were crowded into a small space around the pool. The valet parking is very fast. We never waited more than 5 minutes. The walk to Bellagio or Aria is no more than 5 minutes or less. Cosmopolitan is also very close but you only have sidewalk part of the way and then you have to walk on the edge of the drive way. Very weird that they didn't figure a way for people to get over there in a more safe way. I suppose if you want to walk a long way you can do that through the hotels but most people are looking for the shortest way to get over there. In recent years we have stayed at Aria, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, Encore, Palazzo, Venitian, Paris and Trump. We would choose to stay here again as the rooms are large for the price. We do like the Cosmo because of the balconies and nice large showers and decor. We like Encore too but the rooms are not as big for the prices they charge. The excutive corner suites we reserved for $129.00 a night and you just can't do better than that at other hotels for what you get. My son and his wife stayed last month in a city corner suite at a good price and said it was really nice. I say give Vdara a chance I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “nice new hotel - annoying housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: San2rini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vdara for 4 nights during the first week in August 2011. We had a beautiful, modern and clean room with a King bed, massive bathroom with tub and shower, kitchen and lounge room. The only thing that spoiled our stay at the Vdara was the housekeeping!!!! We were not told that you need to call the Front Desk whenever you want your room to be cleaned, we simply thought that you press the housekeeping button/light outside your room and the Housekeeper would come by to make up your room that day! We only requested housekeeping on the 3rd day of our stay. Upon returning to our room and finding this out, we were informed by Front desk staff that they will arrange for someone to come by at 5pm when we were scheduled to leave our room again. We left at 5pm and returned to our room at 1am the next day from the Grand Canyon, very tired, hot and sticky, to find that our room had not been cleaned which meant that we did not have any clean towels or bathroom products!! Housekeeping were not answering the line, I tried calling twice and was on hold for 30mins in total. I then called Front Desk to only be told that due to the weekend they have many guests checking in, so they advised I simply try calling housekeeping again. I called Front desk a 2nd time and they said they would advise housekeeping of our situation. To make a very long story short...we were provided with soap and towels at 3am so we could finally have a shower and go to bed. Our room was cleaned the next day. Vdara staff only seem to care about you for the few minutes when you are checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, worth the $$ and cant wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelerHouston
Reviews.Content: How nice to walk into a hotel on the strip that does not smell of smoke. We had such a pleasant stay at this hotel which is nicely situated between the Bellagio and Aria. Both of which are very easy to get to by tram, connecting hallway, or walking. Cons: they do not offer double bed rooms, but they can put a sleeper sofa in the room for you. There is a café in the lobby, but very expensive and closes early. The suite we stayed in was huge and had a kitchenette with a small fridge and stove. The bathroom is very modern with lots of space and had both a tub and walk-in shower. Exceptional customer service from the bellhops and staff would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Read this for the best vegas vacation.”
Reviews.Author: hmiecz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sep 2011 and here's my take. Stayed w/ my wife for 3 full days and the planning paid off. Vdara and the Aria are the best 2 hotels in Las Vegas for a few very important reasons. 1) Vdara has no casino. Why is this good well because there are no huge caravans of people constantly walking through your hotel and the people can number in the thousands per weekend. To get to the Vdara from the strip we walked through the Bellagio which is a nightmare on the weekends walking through the hordes of people. Once we got to Vdara property it was instantly peaceful. Only the people that stay on the property are there. 2) No smoking --no explanation needed. 3) Great value. The hotel is a true 5 star and is a bargain. 4) Great views. Our room was on the 48th floor and we watched the Bellagio water show every night. 5) Free valet parking. It's good to tip a few bucks a day though. 6) very clean. The hotel is mostly spotless for the reasons of no smoking and no casino. 7)location. Not directly on the strip to keep out the indigent but close enough to walk there in 5 minutes. About a city block away. 8) staff friendly. They don't have to deal with idiots walking through their casino constantly so they are much more laid back. Our experience wasn't perfect. Cleaning staff forgot to clean out room one day and the safe was acting up but overall a fantastic experience. Some tips. 1)rent a car from the airport. Airport car rental are the cheapest in the city and it prevents you from being trapped and locked to the strip or paying for very expensive cabs or shuttles. 2) avoid the Bellagio. This hotel is nothing buy hype and a money pit. The best thing about it is the water show which is great but that is it. $358 for 2 tickets to see "O", not in my lifetime! And definitely avoid the buffet at all costs. A total ripoff. Go to the Rio for buffet. 3) Go see Absinthe at Ceasars Palace if you can, it's the best show in Vegas right now if you are not easily offended. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for my buck”
Reviews.Author: Flakfizer
Reviews.Content: The room was just fantastic for the price. The service was great too. Great everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but seems to be aging”
Reviews.Author: GregRI
Reviews.Content: I love Vdara, the smoke free aspect, the non gaming aspect. It serves as a great retreat from the rest of Vegas. This is my third visit to Vdara in the past year and a half, not to say hotels should show any love for being loyal to them, but it would be nice to get a comlimentary upgrade. Just to bring me back down to earth, I do book the least expensive room, so I can't hold it against the hotel. The 20$ a day hotel charge is borderline annoying, wish they would include this in the price of the room. Our room seemed to have been aging, just little things but you can sense it. The new Vdara Market has some great options for a quick lunch, I loved Silk Road for breakfast on my last trip but it has closed since. I considered myself to be a super loyal Vdara fan, but my wife and I discussed this last visit and thin we may be looking elsewhere for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of its 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: 03rcode
Reviews.Content: Our first time there and it's worth it. From the start to the end, we couldn't ask for better service. They didn't offer any excuses for anything, just exceeded our expectations. It is very clean and the decor is fantastic...wow! We love this place and it's easily the best place we had ever stayed. The rooms have a mini fridge, a glass stop stove, sink and microwave! It's convenient to the strip. Coming out of the lobby area continue making a left inside the building and it'll lead you to a covered walkway to the Bellagio and to a Tram system too that will get you to Aria...wow, another nice place in the City Center. I got this place on Priceline for $81! Its worth every penny. What I didn't like was the "Resort Fee"....please. Bally's don't charge this, so stop nickle and diming your customers. That is my only gripe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but needs some improving. Would stay here again though.”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Non-smoking!!!! You don't have to walk by or through a smokey casino to get to anything in the hotel Suites were very spacious Bathrooms - nice soaking tub, large size No weird smells throughout hotel Panoramic views were awesome!!!! We requested a view of the Bellagio fountains. Televisions in both the living and bedrooms were great! Front desk was very accomodating and friendly. Valet was quick when we called to pick up our car. Very, very quiet rooms Did not see any crazy drunks scurrying around the lobby, hallways or hotel The location....very close to most everything but far enough away from all the drunks and smoking buzzards. Parking is free but all the valet people who approach your car expect a tip.....we had several approach our car each time we needed to take it out of our hotel. That was annoying. Very helpful reservation agents. Con's: Toilettries were not Aveda as previous posters wrote about, instead they were Vdara soaps, shampoos, etc. and they smelled very much like a yucky cotton candy that had been baking in the sun for too long. Room service was very slow You have to request kitchen items (dishware, utensils) There is no coffee maker in the room There is no blow dryer in the room Strangely there is no bathroom fan for air circulation. The free bottled water is purified water, not spring water. We did not get our free newspaper. Mattresses felt skimpy and were uncomfortable compared to other hotels we've stayed at (pillows were very comfortable though). Crowded elevators. There were 6 but only 1 would open each time someone would press the button. The lighting is bad in the living area and bedroom. It is more designer lighting that you could not easily read with. The marketplace at the Vdara (next to the lobby area) had horrible cafe frape's. Wasted $6 bucks on one and it tasted like an overly bitter water down frape with no flavor. Prices at the marketplace were not very good either. For example, the baguette's were $6 each! There was mold in between the floor tiles in the shower and a dirty shower nozzle. Everywhere we turned there was someone to tip....the guy who opened my passengers side door, the guy who opened my drivers side door, the guy who took my luggage, and another guy who appeared to take my car (no it wasn't either of the two guys who we had tipped who had opened our doors). Then there was another guy who delivered our bags to our hotel room so that was someone else to tip. We had to call down for kitchen utensils so that was another person to tip. Tipping was never ending! Somewhat intimidating entrance feels like you are in the roundabout of an airport and pulling up to catch a flight. Overall, this hotel definitely does not have the same attentiveness that a Ritz Carlton or St. Regis hotel has but it is a great hotel for Vegas. The best part is that it is non-smoking. If we return to Vegas, we'll stay here again. But we will bring our own bath products and eat elsewhere other than the marketplace. We'll also expect our room not to be cleaned for the day until close to dinner time as it was when we stayed here (the time most hotels have their turn down service). And we'll bring a huge wade of dollar bills for the endless tipping that this hotel seems to thrive on.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Tram Made the Difference!”
Reviews.Author: K2A2
Reviews.Content: We rolled into Las Vegas knowing Vdara is an opulent, newer 57-story glass tower tucked in somewhere in City Center. You’d think the hotel would be easy to decipher from the ground; however, if you are ‘right there’ underneath, it is nearly impossible to see the name way up high. Just look for the gigantic, colorful “Canoe Crash” sculpture out front –that’s how you know you’re in the right place, and you can proceed with Vdara’s complimentary valet parking. If you view the whole valet process as a pain in the neck, exit back onto the main drag and make your first right onto the next little street, which is the other side of Aria. There is ample, free self-parking in a clean, beautiful Aria garage [heck, it’s all City Center]. Take the garage elevator to the Casino level 2 and follow arrows to the complimentary tram, which will pleasantly glide you right to Vdara. It was surprisingly easy and hassle-free with very little walking. An electronic sign is always displayed, specifying how many minutes until the next tram, never to exceed 6 minutes. Coffee… If it’s a critical part of your day, map out your coffee strategy before your leave home. Vdara has only one little grab & go-type café in the lobby, large coffee is $3.95 plus tax (or there’s room service). Here’s how we did things our way, and loved it: From the Lobby level of Vdara, head to the awesome, smooth-sailing tram; zip over to the Monte Carlo, where you can eat in a traditional coffee shop restaurant, or use Monte Carlo’s Food Court with McDonald’s, Starbuck’s, Subway, etc. My husband brought the four of us large McDonald’s juices and coffees back to the room in a cup-holder for under $10. In the other direction is Bellagio, but you won’t find much that appeals to a family. On a side note, there’s a 24-hour sundries shop near the entrance of Aria, which is pretty easy to get to on foot. As far as shopping, the Crystal’s shopping center is next door, but it’s more the Rodeo Drive variety of shops. If you need more ‘down to earth,’ everyday shopping, cross the street and use the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. It’s a great outing, and you will find wonderful casual dining there as well. If you don’t want ultra-fine dining of City Center and aren’t into lavish buffets either, AND you want a decent-seeming Casino for real gambling, then stay in grand style at Vdara, but utilize your feet and the super-tram for your conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxtion”
Reviews.Author: yattat
Reviews.Content: Loved it!! Room was great. We tried the $20 trick and received a 41st floor room with view of B fountains. We booked room through Priceline. Very clean. Bed and pillows were great!

Reviews.Title: “Vdara”
Reviews.Author: d s
Reviews.Content: My inital impression was WOW! There is no casino on the property so don't have to walk through smoke to get from one point to another. If you do want a casino Bellagio and Aria are extremely close...don't even have to walk outside to get to the Bellagio. Room was spacious, with fridge, washer and dryer, and coffee maker (that we could never get to work). Cleanliness much to be desired. One of the cabinets had an open box of crackers and an empty bottle of Mountain Dew (see picture). Housekeeping also missed garbage under one of the nightstands and along the base of the bed. Unfortunately, had a blackout while staying there so those people coming back from a night out had to sleep in the lobby as couldn't walk up the stairs due to magnetic locks and elevators obviously not working. Friend had to walk down 30+ floors with his bags and golf bag, using only the light off his cell phone to catch a cab to the airport for a 2am flight out. So the negative of not having a casino, no back up generators incase of a blackout!

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't look anywhere else on future trips”
Reviews.Author: Kevin257
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at Vdara in July 2011. Vdara was very clean and staff were friendly and quick to assist. We had a late flight on the day we checked out and the hotel sent a bell-hop to our room to pick up our bags and store them in a secure area for the day so we could enjoy our last day in Vegas wihtout worrying about our luggage (without a fee). Staff were also helpful in securing a taxi for the ride back to the airport (take a taxi, it's worth the extra money! It's easy and quick). There is no casino in Vdara and also no smoking (huge positives for us). Vdara is in right off the middle of the strip in an area called City Center, it's easy to get to and very easy to get to teh other casinos and hotels. There is a covered outside passage way that leads into the Bellagio as well as a tram that runs to Monte Carlo, Aria (also worth checking out, more expensive than Vdara but worth walking through) and Crystals. The quality of the room was excellent, it was very clean, comfortable and we loved the modern decor. While rooms have kitchens if you plan on cooking bring your own supplies (maybe the hotel would supply them if you asked? we never inquired). There were no dishes or pots/pans, however there are so many great options for eating out in Vegas, who really wants to eat in? After walking through almost every hotel in Vegas, we couldn't have been more pleased with our decision to stay at Vdara. We loved the location in the middle of the strip, easy (almost all indoor) access to the Bellagio (which has an amazing pastry shop), and clean, secure feeling. The only thing we were disappointed in was the pool- it isn't as grand as other pools in Vegas and isn't very deep however this wasn't a big deal to us as there are so many other things to do in Vegas. We would definitely stay here again on a future trip and highly recommend Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Oasis From Hustle And Bustle”
Reviews.Author: BrownJB
Reviews.Content: I chose Vdara based on the reviews I read on several websites. My decision was partly based on the fact that the hotel didn’t have a casino and had a more laid back atmosphere. Vdara is a very nice hotel that smells great. I don’t know what they are pumping into the ventilation but it is a nice touch I didn’t notice in other hotel/casinos. My girlfriend and I did stand in line 10 minutes to check in although there weren’t many guests in front of us. This was due in part to the person managing the line who didn’t do a good job of getting guests into one of the three lines she wanted the guests to form. This came as a surprise to me as I have noticed the other hotels have many people at the front desk for check in. Every time we were in the lobby I noticed a long line. You would think this would be something that could be remedied. We upgraded to a larger suite on the 36th floor with a 270 degree view of the Strip and the Bellagio fountains. The view was great! The suite itself was spacious but did already show signs of wear. We noticed some wallpaper peeling and the desk had several scratches and one gouge in it. I would also advise against getting water from the water dispenser in the refrigerator. The taste left something to be desired. We chose to access the Strip through the Bellagio. It is a little bit of a walk but most of it is inside so that was a non-issue to us. We also used the tram which will take you to Aria and Monte Carlo. Overall I was satisfied with Vdara but I was disappointed with the check in process and the issues I mentioned in the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara a nice quiet get-away but....”
Reviews.Author: Cgyguy
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at the Vdara recently and enjoyed the hotel. Of course sicne it's new the rooms are very modern, clean and niceley decorated. As the hotel does not have a casino on the premises it was a bit quieter and gave one a sense of stepping away froom the hustle and bustle of the strip. The only thing that we didn't like was the "additional Spa fee" that is tacked onto the bill. Apparently this is for use of the pool facilities although considering that we didn't use the pool it's just an add on to get some more money. A little misleading....just add it to the nightly price of the room like other hotels and don't try to make it into something else.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service. Never again!”
Reviews.Author: lucyethel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and regretted each night. We were so looking forward to the stay after looking at the website and loved that each room had a kitchen and that the resort had no casino.  In the past we've stayed at other nice resort/hotels in Vegas that had similar set up without the casino and check-in was always so much faster and easier. Vdara disappointed us from the get go. First the entrance to the hotel is difficult to find even on the strip. The signs are tiny, the road takes you in loops and is overall a BIG headache. Most hotels on the strip have a back entrance, not this one. The only way in is from the Strip. Considering the traffic on the strip is horrible, it can take you 15 minutes to go one block! Upon finally getting to the hotel, the only way to park is w/valet. No self parking? Come on! Sometimes I don't feel like tipping everybody 10 times a day! But Vdara says that's what the resort fee is for. Yeah, right. So the check-in counter was a pain too. 3 long lines.  Why don't they get smart and make one line for all of us to stand in. That way we can go to the first available person? On to the room. The furnishings are nice and modern. But there were some major issues with the room. 1) No pots, pans, cups, utensils, etc. in the kitchen. Completely bare when you open the cupboards. You have to call housekeeping to bring each and every thing you want and that takes them at least 30-45 minutes. Such an inconvenience, when I wanted a cup of tea like an hour ago! They don't even give you a coffee maker. Also, the refrigerator is the size of a medicine cabinet. I kid you not. Go ahead and try to fit a few things, and you will see how ridiculously small this is. 2) Bathroom door was one of those sliding doors. Ours was already broken and the lock didn't even work b/c it wouldn't slide all the way closed. 3) The blackout shades are broken into 3 sections and each section has a 2 inch gap in between that lets in all the bright sun in the morning. Forget about sleeping in past 6am, unless you put a pillow over your head. 4) No robes in the room. You have to call housekeeping to bring it up and that takes 40 minutes. Again, a pain when you wanted to use it a 40 min ago and are now waiting to take a shower b/c the robes haven't arrived. We had a bad customer service experience with their coffee shop and front desk one day. They told us to write a comment card and to this day, no response from the manager. Sad. They don't care about their customers at all. Basically get in, then get out mentality. We will never stay here again. I get better customer service from a Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bigmoumout
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas quite a few times and stay at different hotels. Luxor, Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, the Venetian, Motel6, Main Street Station, Golden Nuggets. Vdara has no fancy theme and just looks like a huge tower but it was one of our favorite. It's modern but sober, the rooms have a nice eating area, a small kitchen, 2 TVs. The bed was one of the best I've slept on in hotels and I have back issues so I'm picky. The view was gorgeous, hubby didn't want me to close the blinds so he could watch over the Strip from the bed. They offer water in the fridge, you can check out from your room, on the TV. There are some fees but I think it's $15/day and it includes the internet. We LOVED that it's smoke free, there's no casino, you can go directly to the Bellagio and it's super quiet. The pool was nice, the staff very friendly and helpful. There's no self parking but valet is free, just tip the guys.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good. Not flawless but a close thing.”
Reviews.Author: v4nnm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Vdara three times in the last year - Sept 2010, Nov 2010 and May 2011. Overall it is a great hotel if you are in Vegas on business or if you don't want the usual woken-up-at-4am-by-the-frat-boys scene I have experienced in many other Vegas hotels such as MGM, Luxor, Excalibur, Ceasers, Mandalay etc where I have stayed previously. Vdara is very quiet and serene in comparison to most other hotels. Do not be put off by the walk to the strip. If you are staying in the MGM for example, the walk to the strip from Vdara through Bellagio is no further in comparison and it's quite pleasant. I see reviews from other travellers complaning about how far it is to walk to Aria .... er, hello? It is like a 90 second walk across the ground between the two hotels. There are always plenty of cabs available at Vdara or Aria if you need to get somewhere fast, there's no real strip traffic to trouble you because of it's location (assuming you get a decent taxi driver) and you can be there about 8 minutes after leaving McCarran. There's not much food on offer at Vdara but in under five minutes you can be in one of several restaurants in Aria or Bellagio where there is plenty of choice. in my experience there is only one tiny drawback with Vdara; it's the drapes. I've stayed in single rooms and I've stayed in corner suites and without exception the drapes do not meet. In the corner room I used on this trip, there was a 1 to 1.5 inch gap between the corners of the blinds and I find this mildly unsettling because I like total blackout. If it doesn't bother you its not worth worrying about. Oh, and despite the iPod connectivity claims, I could not get my iPhone 4 to play music through the entertainment centre, not with a speaker cable or an iPhone cable - just couldn't figure it out. Maybe I was just being dumb. I've always had prompt efficient check-in and -out, never had problems with noise or the housekeeping staff and if you take a corner suite you get a huge fridge, four bottles of water a day, washer/dryer, table for four, big bed plus sofa bed and a divider between the two beds for privacy. Plus, the wifi is free and isn't limited to one device per room unlike some other places. I am back in Vegas again this November but have chosen Mandarin Oriental for that trip; we will have to see how that works out. Had that not been available, I would have still gone back to Vdara just for the tranquility of the place.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true. Consider Vdara but also other resorts.”
Reviews.Author: gnasty71
Reviews.Content: It was hard to rate Vdara as you'll see. The ideal rating would be a 3.5 overall compared to other resorts. Overall, it was a nice hotel but the negative comments for the most part are true so definitely read them. Yelp also rates Vdara at 3.5 based on user reviews. We chose Vdara because of 3 main reasons. 1) It had suites 2) there was a good package deal 3) its new so we decide to try it. The hotel was supposed to be apartments or condos and was converted into a hotel. So what does that mean? All the rooms are suites. However, there are no double beds, only single beds. If you are traveling as a couple or family, this is fine. If you are with friends, you have no choice but to sleep in the same bed. We had a Vdara suite which as a fold out couch and can sleep 3 comfortably. Also, the hotel has no casino and not much of a bar scene. It has a spa which we didn't use. The hotel. The hotel is new and I'd consider it luxurious. The hotel has a very modern feel to it which goes with the CityCenter theme. The suites were very well furnished and comfortable. The Vdara suite has a full refrigerator, kitchenette, living room area, spacious bedroom and bath. There is also a half bath in the kitchenette area. 2 flat screen tvs; one in the living area and one in the bedroom. Wifi access is free. The lobby has a bar and a convenience store/food & coffee store. They offer breakfast, lunch and snack foods, has a seating area and a pretty decent section of refrigerated food you'd find in a 7-Eleven,Wawa,Circle-K type places. They have a pool. I thought it was a bit small so it could get crowded. But there is a lot of seating and a bar so that is something. Nothing impressive. We didn't hear any noise from the other rooms or the hallway and our room was the closest to the elevators. One thing that was pretty cool. The suite had a washer/dryer and room service will provide detergent and fabric softener. So what isn't great. Nothing really bad but just the little things. One, its not on the strip. The Aria and Bellagio are in walking distance. There is a tram that takes you through the CityCenter area casinos (Bellagio/Vdara, Aria, Monte Carlo). Its a quick walk from the hotel but the waiting area and stairs to it are out in the open. So when its 108 degrees, its a little annoying. You can walk through various casinos and get to Las Vegas Blvd in about 15 mins. Not the end of the world but it can get tiring to do all that walking. And remember, no casino, no shows, no buffets or special restaurants here so all the guests are going somewhere else. There are plenty of cabs that stop in front and it has valet service if you rented a car. Second, the water pressure is kind of low. Many Yelp reviews complained about that. Its tolerable but if that annoys you, be warned. Third, it didn't bother us but after reading some of the little issues about the valet, it did dawn on me that it was true. You can't seem to call down to have your car ready, if its busy you wait outside for the car, the car gets dropped off on the other side of the road so you have to walk about 25 feet. We didn't mind it but again, if that stuff annoys you, be warned. We didn't see any obvious signs of auto-checkout (the TV offers an option, your bill is dropped off under your door, etc). We checked out in person and there was no line at the time. However, lines can form as we saw so if they do not provide auto checkout, that would be frustrating. So it is a nice hotel with modern suites. We found the staff to be nice and helpful. They printed out my boarding pass because the business center was closed. (It was 8pm which was a bit early to closed in my opinion). The hotel was clean and no problems with any of the room amenities. Its just a bit far from the main areas and you have to go somewhere else to do anything fun. I'd recommend other hotels if you really want to get into the action. If you get a good deal or find yourself at the Vdara, just be aware of the downsides. In the end, its still pretty close to the Strip and you can get there without a lot of hassle. Just time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, new hotel. Very luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: I was surprised about this hotel. I had no idea it would be this nice. It is very new, and the rooms are huge. The bed is very comfortable, and the temperature control is strong (a must in Vegas). There is no gaming here, so it is much more mellow here. The bathrooms are quite luxurious, the curtains are power-controlled. The TV is a little slow to change channels, though. I paid around $150/night, and it was well worth it. Overall, an excellent place.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE - Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Writer_at_Large
Reviews.Content: I can't stress enough - worst place I've ever stayed!! Don't waste your money on this hotel. The staff doesn't give a crap about any service issues you may have. Housekeeping iis a joke - we checked into a room with a vodka bottle still on the floor by the couch, door latch kicked and cracked - must have been a wild party. Spoke with head of housekeeping more than once and still no care to make things right. Attitude of every staff member is "don't care to help patrons." Just passing time to make their paycheck. Beware the business center closes at 5 sharp, Concierge closes at 8. No dishes available to use the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place...Some Customer Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: NJS0485
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Vdara with three friends to celebrate one of their birthdays. We arrived at the hotel and were impressed with how nice everything looked from the valet area to the front lobby. Everything looked first class. Front desk staff was pleasant and check in was pretty quick and there were no lines at all. The room was very nice and had a living area that was somewhat seperated from the bedroom area. It was clean and our room had a small kitchen with dining area that was very clean. The first issue with the service cam when we wanted to have our car pulled up to the valet stand before going downstairs so we wouldnt have to wait when we got down there. We thought this was possible after staying at the Wynn last summer where we could call the valet desk and our car would be waiting out front when we got down stairs. It was not posible at Vdara because nobody ever answered at the valt desk, not once in out 5 days there. The second problem witht the valet was that we would hand the valet person our ticket and stand where they would pull the cars and wait. After about 15 minutes the smae person we handed the ticket to would drive the car out and drive right past us and continue on for about 30 feet. We would end up having to walk to the car when the guy obviously saw us standing there. It wasnt a hassle to walk to the car but just annoying. The second problem came when my friend was told that she had a gift waiting at the front desk. We went down to get it about 1 hour later and it was no where to be found. The front desk employee told us to go to the conciege desk and there was nobody there. We stood there for about 10 minutes and finally asked an employee that walked by if anyone was working there and they said no and continued walking. We went backto the front desk and finally after 20 minutes of searching they found the gift that was a gift card from a family member. The hotel is nice, peaceful, and very luxurious but service could use a little work.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but bad customer service.”
Reviews.Author: rjose
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1. Beautiful hotel rooms. The amenities in the room were gorgeous and modern. There is a fully equipped kitchen, dining table, a sitting area, TWO plasma TV's, comfy bed, and the bathroom is absolutely gorgeous with granite/marble finishes and a standing shower AND tub. 2. The lobby is also sleek and modern. 3. The location of the hotel is excellent – right on the strip. 4. We got there hours before check in and they were very attentive and said that there is a room available ASAP, which I think was a big plus. Negatives: 1. So, when we got into our first room there were small insects crawling in our shower drain and the sink in the bathroom was spitting out the water in a weird manner so we called the front desk. They were very nice and said that they were going to send up someone to take a look. One of the supervisors FINALLY arrived to our room - I mean, seriously don't say that they're going to be up there in 5 minutes but really take 25 minutes. The supervisor finally came, took a look at the insects and the sink and was very nice and offered to give us a room on a higher level and with a better view of the strip. We said OK and she said someone from the front desk will call us and let us know the new room number and that we do not have to go down to the lobby for a new set of keys, they will just reactivate the keys we already had. After the supervisor left, we waited over 30 minutes and did not hear from anyone. So, I called the front desk and wondered if they had forgotten about us. They said no, and didn't even apologize and gave us the number of our new room. Well, when we got to our new room the cleaning lady was still there frantically cleaning the room. I felt bad for her because she had to rush and I didn't want her to rush. In other words, I don't want a half-assed clean room. When the cleaning lady was finally done our room keys didn't even work, even though the supervisor said they would switch it automatically so that we didn't have to go back downstairs. Luckily for us the cleaning lady was still in sight and opened the door for us. Talk about POOR and SLOW service. 2. What peeved me the most about the Vdara was their check-out routine and valet set-up. Most hotels give you the option of leaving your room keys in your room so that you do not have to go downstairs and wait in a line. Well, around 11:30am we were on our way to go downstairs but all the elevators were completely packed – they were full of everyone else checking out around the same time. We were on the 33rd floor so the thought of tugging my entire luggage down 33 flights of stairs was definitely not an option. So, we went back to our rooms and waiting for about 30 minutes for foot traffic to die down. On top of that, waiting for your car at the valet was like waiting in line at the DMV. There were so many other people checking out that the line for them to bring out your car (self-parking is not an option at this hotel, it's valet only) took FOREVER. We waited a good 30 minutes just for them to retrieve our car. Now, it wasn't the valet peoples’ fault because they were working fast and hard, but rather it was the poor choice of not having self-parking be available. Therefore, this mistake is solely on management's part - they seriously need to fix this because if their Sundays' always look like this they will undoubtedly get an abundant amount of complaints. It was ridiculous, especially since you're waiting outside in Vegas' hot weather waiting for your damn car. Again, I do want to stress that the hotel amenities are gorgeous, updated and modern, but for a hotel to function correctly and for customers to keep coming back your management has to be equally inviting. Quick example: I stayed at a Ritz Carlton and yes, their rooms are nice, but not as modern as Vdara but their customer service is excellent. They are attentive and really care that you enjoy your stay with them and personally I think excellent customer service is more important than modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Get a deal”
Reviews.Author: JHW81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a summer deal package and it was really worth it. I had a deluxe room with lakeview 52010. The view was amazing and so romantic to bad I was staying alone this trip. Pool is small but wasn't crowded. If u don't like small hotels u won't like this one but if you are looking to escape the smokers of Vegas than this is your hotel. It has easy access to bellagio and aria.

Reviews.Title: “VDARA IS AMAZING HOTEL 10/10”
Reviews.Author: holsandme
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at quite a few hotels in vegas but the Vdara beats them all hands down!! I looked at reviews and always use them as a good hotel is important to me. Was looking at the cosmopolitan but so glad I went for the vdara, it was perfect! We were greeted by a friendly receptionist and didn’t have to wait in line (it seems waiting to check in is a given at all other hotels). Check in was fast and at the lifts they check your room card so security is great. We has a room on 41st floor and the views were amazing. You walk through door into a small kitchen which was great as we had room service the one night so was nice having a table to sit at! Also there is a double fridge one is empty which is great so you can keep drinks in there. You pay a $20 daily resort fee but get 2 bottles of water use of gym etc. resort fees seem to now be at all hotels. The room was spacious with sofa and small armchair, a large bed tv, an entertainment center and reception supplied us with a lead so I could use my ipod! I gave the lead back at end of stay so wasn’t charged. The bed was huge and comfortable and the bathroom was amazing!! The bath tbe is the best ive ever been in. I want one for my home bathroom now. My sister and I had a bath every night as it was so relaxing. The lighting can be adjusted and there is a walk in shower. They provide aveda products, there are also scales, which for me was great as I have a habit of weighing myself everyday. We had one small problem when the bathroom door which slides wouldn’t shut. I asked for it to be fixed but it was actually made worse. I went down to reception and explained and she gave us a $60 credit for the inconvenience and got it fixed straight away! Housekeeping – in several hotels I have found housekeeping too noisy and not great in this hotel the service was 10/10. You never really saw or heard them and they cleaned the room so well and quickly. The market café - in reception this café is convenient and great value. We had breakfast there every morning which were always good, you can also get coffee, sandwiches and some amazing cakes which we said we’d try but didn’t! The pool – this was one area which I think could be improved slightly. Felt the décor of pool area was lacking and the waitress’s outfits were unflattering and could be much better. We always managed to get a bed but it was very crowded esp on weekends and beds were very crammed in. think they should maybe put bamboo around the pool area as the white fencing isn’t great and doesn’t fit in with the rest of the hotel décor. The gym – im now a runner so a gym with good treadmill is important to me and the vdara gym was great. Stocked with water bottles and towels its small but a great gym with treadmills, weights cross trainers etc. Location – it is set back from the strip but there is a walk way to the Bellagio, which also led to the tram or Cesar’s palace. The vdara has no casino so its very relaxing and calm hotel compared to the other hotels which is refreshing when you come back from all the excitement, hustle and bustle of vegas. if you want to gamble it’s a short walk to the Aria and through the casino to get to the strip. So if you want a gorgeous hotel that’s modern, calm relaxing, great service and staff this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Several Better Options Out There”
Reviews.Author: Latitudes_Dancer
Reviews.Content: I travel a LOT to Las Vegas. I have stayed at most of the strip hotels in many different types of rooms. Of the five or six all-suite, non-gaming hotels I have stayed at this property fell squarely in the low/middle depiste it being one of the newest. And I say this while setting aside entirely the fact that my room was not fully recovered from the obvious bachelorette party that had just checked out and the lack of concern expressed by hotel management when advised of the problem. Service is not the problem; staff was generally very nice. The property is simply not amazing, just pretty nice...mostly because it is still new. If you are coming for pool time, go elsewhere as the pool is much too small with chairs all mashed together (you do not get the use of Aria pool facilites) and the reflecting sun is hot and blinding. If you read all of the reviews and still think that Trump (luxurius), MGM Signature (well-appointed and you get all of MGM amenities), Palms Place (never need to leave the Palms property) or HRH (young crowd and great pool scene) are not for you and Vdara is, then at least consider Cosmopolitan which is right next door to Vdara and far surpasses anything this property has to offer for about the same price and room style (suites). It can all be summed up like this: Vdara is the tract housing verion of the custom-built Cosmopolitan. I mean who would choose tract housing over prime real estate??!!?? No reason you should either. Consider your options.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara, no casino and no restaurants”
Reviews.Author: ptbrk
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, Vdara makes it easy to avoid the casino scene but leaves you right on the strip. Although the Aria's rooms are much better appointed, Vdara is no ugly duckling by any means. My biggest complain during my last stay was the lack of places to eat without having to schlep to the Aria. During the 3 days of my stay, the only sit down restaurant had a "private party" sign which felt more of an insult to the guests than a cute sign thought out by an inexperienced manager. Thus, the guests were left with the quasi coffee shop attended by overwhelmed youngsters that kept arguing with the guests that what they got was exactly what they ordered even though it wasn't. At any rate, the rooms are great, the proximity to the strip is great just go eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaime C
Reviews.Content: We were really upset after booking Vdara and reading the reviews on TripAdvisor! However, all of the lousy reviews are WRONG!! This hotel is a gem compared to the rest of the strip! Our family stayed in a suite at Bellagio, and boy were they disappointed when they saw what we got, for a lot less $$. Our room was spacious, had a dining area, kitchenette and everything we could have asked for! The hotel smelled divine, and there was NO SMOKING (huge +) unlike every other hotel in Vegas! If you want a casino it's a quick hop, skip and jump to Aria or Bellagio! The only disappointment was when it is windy in Vegas they have to close the Vdara pool. It looked like a mini hurricane up in the pool area! All in all, we LOVED, LOVED, LOVED Vdara and will only stay there if we go back to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Smoke Free upgrades this hotel from a 3 to 4 star”
Reviews.Author: cbpi
Reviews.Content: The Good -smoke Free -large modern rooms -Aveda Products -kitchenettes -food Quality from Room Service was excellent The Bad -kitchenette empty-no plates or utensils -no coffee maker -no restaurant The Ugly -despite a sign that instructs you to call if you would like plates, the front desk told me that they don't provide this for deluxe rooms

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: LWM1146
Reviews.Content: I realize that many of you are reading Vdara reviews and thinking there is some spotty service and apparently some inconsistency at this property, as I did. Trust me, DO NOT STAY HERE!! I travel extensively and am happy to say that I have NEVER had an experience like this. Granted, the rooms here are gorgeous and the no smoking, non-gaming idea is interesting; however, the horrible service makes this is a big NO. I can understand the service issues once I met Anar Shah, the assistant GM. I have never met someone so devoid of a service mindset. I'd be happy to go on about the specific issues I had - there are many - and Anar did nothing but make things worse instead of better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet place to stay if you're not looking for a lot”
Reviews.Author: slee82
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided on Vdara b/c it was new and we wanted to experience what it was like to stay in one of Citycenter's hotels. We already knew this hotel had no casino, clubs, restaurants or a huge fabulous swimming pool so we knew not to expect too much. That's why I called it 'comfy quiet place to stay'. I tend to like happening atmospheres but when you need to crash after partying, Vdara def. provides that kind of comfort. The lobby area is quite spacious & has a lounge that's both inside & outside. There's also a small grocery store which we didn't get to visit. The elevators are straight forward, 2 main areas with the floor levels listed. Now onto the rooms, all the rooms are suites which was pretty cool. Ours was the most basic (deluxe suite) but it had more than we expected. Small kitchen area w/a microwave, refrigerator & stove. You get 2 complimentary water bottles every day in that fridge :) The bed was a king and has a 2 seater couch on the side. That was nice to have in case you want to invite ppl over. The bathroom had a shower & tub, I had a problem w/the tub though. The plug didn't close properly so the water would just keep draining. Quite disappointing for a new hotel. The bed would probably be the best part, I have never slept in a more comfy bed. Must have been the memory foam mattress and the pillows they used. Everything conforms to you nicely & it was hard to wake in the morning. The blinds on the windows are controlled by a switch near the kitchen was cool too. Unlike those annoying ones that you have to pull shut by hand. Housekeeping was great, they refilled the towels/toiletries but also took the extra step to pick up after us which we'd never expect. Now the pool, I'd read reviews that it was small but I felt it was big enough. Its got no slides or waterfalls but good enough. There's a hot tub too and more than enough lounge chairs. There's also a fitness center and spa but we nvr got to check it out. So, not too bad overall until you look at it location wise. Citycenter itself is a huge place and its tricky to get around w/all the overpasses & winding paths. Whole place seemed more vehicle than ppl friendly. There is a main road between it (Vdara) and the Cosmopolitan & things would've been way more convenient if they had built a proper sidewalk that leads to the strip. My friend & I pushed past the shrubs that grew beside the Cosmopolitan everyday to avoid taking the proper/super long route. Dining, gambling & clubbing wise is fine w/Aria right across the front lot. On our last day, we had some trouble getting a hold of our shuttle but the folks at the front desk & bell hop were friendly & helpful about it which was nice. I didn't notice any sort of rudeness or 'I hate my job' types of attitudes that most of these folks display. One more thing, there's a resort fee of $20 per day which was kinda dumb for a place that doesn't have everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay of my life!”
Reviews.Author: dkelly45
Reviews.Content: I upgraded my room to the Vdara suite, whih i recommend if you plan on spending any down time in your room. It has a washer and dryer, full size refrigerator with freezer, cooktop, dishwasher, microwave/convection oven and dining table. The bedroombis separate from the living room and there is a master bath as well as a 1/2 bath! The master bath has a separate tub and shower. They leave bath salt everyday. Nice sized bathroom. The living room and the bedroom both have large flat screen TVs and automatic blinds. Nice and dark in the am. I had a view of the Bellagio fountains. I was very specific and asked for pots, pans, cups, plates, silverware and storage bowls when i checked in. It seemed like they didnt want to give out much but after they made about 4 trips to my room i finally got everything i needed. I also asked for robes, but they were standard in my room (dont know about the deluxe suite). I used the kitchen and cooked meals in my room. It saved me a lot of money versus eating out. Well worth the upgrade. I did not encounter any rude staff members, in fact everyone was quite plesant. It sounds strange, but I had a very relaxing time in Vegas! I will stay here if i come back to vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the brochure!”
Reviews.Author: MovinOnAlong
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a corner suite overlooking the Bellagio fountain. What a great veiw of the strip and city with two walls of windows! The room was spacious with new furnishings. Sofa bed in living area with TV separated from king bedroom with sliding doors, full kitchen with dining table (bring own dishes - only 4 coffee cups provided), K cup cofffee and bottled water in the frige. Small washer dryer but bring you own detergent. Large shower and bath area with soft towels, robes and slippers. Great bedroom with king bed and large soft pillows and work table. Friendly turndown service on both the sofa bed and king bed. Smoke free. Have nothing bad to say about the stay; this is luxurous, quiet lodging conveniently located to the Aria and Bellagio with only a 10 minute mostly air conditioned walk to Caesar's. Free valet parking, Nice pool area but closely spaced lounges. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absoulutley Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Cimy
Reviews.Content: Fab staff,very friendly,very effcient and best of all no smoke anywhere. We were given a room on the 51st floor with excellent views of the city. Really nice place to come back and chill.

Reviews.Title: “I'd probably stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Superguy1221
Reviews.Content: In a simple pros and cons format I'll tell you about this place PROS: Large rooms with very basic kitchenettes (mini fridge, tiny stove, small table). Only a few years old (one of the most modern places in Vegas) Non-smoking (one of the only hotels in Vegas that doesn't smell bad). Tall building with nice views Very easy to get a taxi. Very quiet (less drunk people in the elevator than there are at most Vegas resorts) Paid the same here as I would at Mandalay Bay or Aria and got a better room CONS: You have to walk 10 minutes through Aria or Bellagio or 5 minutes down stairs and a street with no sidewalk to reach the strip. Feels like an empty shell (lobby is quiet, half the rooms on my floor were empty, the pool wasn't busy). Kitchens don't have plates or utensils in them.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - except in-room theft, mold and no restaurants”
Reviews.Author: MXTravel1
Reviews.Content: A pretty good hotel for the price. Service was so-so (long lines at check-in, concierge was very unknowledgeable). But the room was spacious and luxurious for the price, though mold in the shower was a problem. Great location, easy walk to Bellagio, Cosmopolitan and Vdara. The two biggest complaints were: No good food options in the hotel. One small cafe (packaged food mostly). In the morning it was a line of 30-40 people with a half hour wait for a cup of coffee. The hotel staff said they were "aware of the issue". Also, our room was robbed when housekeeping came to make it up. I can't say for sure they did it, but cash and travelers checks were taken from the room. While I imagine this happens from time-to-time at all hotels, the staff was fairly defensive about it, saying that they were not liable under Nevada law, and would not under any circumstances do anything about it). They weren't even particularly nice about it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis with a central location”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl905
Reviews.Content: The Vdara opened at the beginning of the year, and in my opinion is the perfect place to stay while in Vegas. The rooms are spacious, with a fridge and stove and cooking utensils if you like, although we were much too busy to cook. Our room had a beautiful view of the Bellagio gardens and dancing water fountains. Because the two buildings are attached, it's only a short walk to the Bellagio Casino. Five minutes longer takes you out to a central intersection of the strip where other casinos and restaruants are found including Paris and Caesar's Palace. Or, you can travel in the other direction by taking the free shuttle that leaves every 5 minutes to the City Centre Mall, with great shopping and more restaurants and the attached Rio. From there around the corner is MGM Grand and New York. We visited in March, so the sunny temperatures were comfortable for walking from one venue to another. Next visit we'll be sure to leave time to check out the rooftop bar and the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience but a different Vegas Vibe”
Reviews.Author: Scottsdale1
Reviews.Content: This was a first time in a Non-casino hotel. There was a lot to enjoy and you want to go with your eyes wide open. It was a pleasure to pull up to the hotel valet and walk just a view steps to the front desk and then just a few more to the elevator bank. Not having to trudge a quarter mile with bags through the casino was a welcome change. The rooms are large, lovely and modern. A nice feature is an added refrigerator along with the mini bar if you want to stock up for your stay. The pool is enjoyable and while not large is probably the right size for the hotel. Vdara is a pleasant walk to the Aria so a casino is handy if you want one. Accessing Las Vegas Boulevard is a lot of hiking. You either have to go a long way through the Bellagio or Aria. While right next door the Cosmopolitan there is no easy way to get that hotel which is really a shame. All in all, decent value for the money, new, comfortable but different. The one bad thing was the rooms have motorized blinds--very cool but not fully effective at keep the room dark in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Edsmum984
Reviews.Content: A welcome respite from the madness of the Strip, the Vdara has no casino so is quieter than many of the other hotels we walked through on our trip. The Marketplace cafe has great food all day. Rooms are all suites with kitchen area and sofabed. Contemporary styling, free wifi, well situated just behind the Bellagio (and there's a walkway to the Bellagio so you can get through to the Strip). One weak spot is front desk, long queues to check in and out and housekeeping requests were met with a charming smile but no action. But overall, pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “To be in the thick of things, without being in the thick of things, the Vdara is a great, luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: bahstar1
Reviews.Content: The smoke & casino free Las Vegas Hotel, the Vdara, is the ideal place to stay for a clean, sleek, luxury hotel stay in Vegas, without all the crowds, smoke, and messiness of many other Vegas hotspots. In the City Center, and a very short walk to both the Aria and Bellagio casinos, the Vdara is a great way to relax a little in a town that's hard to relax in. Beautiful suites, ammenities and bathrooms, the Vdara is an excellent venue for the crowd & casino weary traveler. (who still wants to be a part of things.) Get a room that faces the strip - the views are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: PMTK_11
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent steered us from the Bellagio to the Vdara. Good choice. This is a hotel and has no casino. We stayed in a deluxe suite on the 43rd floor of this skyscraper hotel which is pretty much right next door to the Bellagio (we could see the fountains from our room). The view over the city was SPECTACULAR at night. The room was comfortable and clean, although on the small side once the sofabed was in use - our son was on the sofabed which left little room for cases when it was pulled out. There is a kitchenette which we didn't need - maybe it would have been better to have that space available. Luxurious bathroom. Staff very professional and efficient. Cafe was great to grab breakfast - really friendly staff who remembered me from day to day. We checked out early and they held our room for us until we were ready to leave - which was great and a wise choice - by the time we'd picked up our rental car and returned to pick up our cases from the hotel it was a nightmare. Sunday and everyone is leaving Vegas. We had to wait nearly an hour to retrieve the car from the valet parking which was really unacceptable - particularly as we'd asked them not to take it into the garage as we were only going to be five minutes collecting our bags. Valet parking on the way in was excellent and on the way out was horrible. The valet was rude and that gave a black mark to an otherwise great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway but still close to everything”
Reviews.Author: elanabean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a 3 day getaway in part due to a special upgrade promotion online from their website. This hotel is non-gaming and non-smoking and we we decided after staying at the Signature that we enjoyed this type of hotel. Our first impression was how nice and open the lobby was but found getting to the front desk confusing (hint. It's to the left of the entrance). After reading some of the reviews I expected a wait at the front desk, and yes there was a line about 4 people long and the wait was around 10 minutes. However, the front desk apologized for the delay and were courteous. Our room, a corner suite, ended up being rig next to the elevator, but once inside we never once experienced any outside noise from the hallway- so it didn't matter. The room: beautiful. It was huge with sliding doors separating the living room from the bedroom. There was a small dining room and kitchen with a washer/dryer unit. None of which we used this time, but I could see this as being very useful if we were staying longer. There was also a sliding door from the kitchen into the bathroom, kinda odd, and the door stuck a lot. We just kept it closed and used the entrance from the bedroom instead to access the bathroom. The bathroom was also huge with a giant soaking tub and separate shower. The toilet area however was semi exposed (no door closing it off). The bed was super soft and you can purchase the bed and pillows online (I'm possibly considering the pillows-so comfy). Overall I'd definitely consider staying here again. It's close to Aria(for gambling) and City Center. A large part of the time we barely ventured beyond there (we regularly take short trips to Vegas so we've spent time all over but wanted to spend time specifically in this area because we had yet to).

Reviews.Title: “New, elegant decor, and very clean! No casino--so no smoke smells!”
Reviews.Author: wordz99Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. The room was beautifully decorated in a current, sort of minimalist style. We had two large TVs in our room--one on each side of a room divider--the large comfy bed was on one side, and a comfy couch was on the other. There was also a little kitchen/dining area, which we didn't make use of, but we could have cooked our meals there. The bathroom was perfect--complete with a large soaking tub, in addition to the luxurious tiled shower. Large fluffy towels topped it off. The hotel is quite upscale and has quick access to nearby casinos. It was nice, though, that there is NOT a casino within this hotel, as it never seems possible to erradicate/encapsulate the cigarette smoke that is so prevalent in the casinos. The hallways are well kept, as are the elevators and all common spaces. We were impressed with the cleanliness. The only downside was the service. We had to call room service several times to get an extra blanket, but when they finally did bring it, it was a fresh and new fluffy down-filled coverlet--so nice! (Matched the quality of the bedding!) Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! My favorite Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonoma
Reviews.Content: First of all, Vdara, is an all non-smoking, non-gambling hotel, but is adjacent to the Aria and Bellagio. If you are looking for a quit place to retire after you've had your fun, this is the place. The suites are gorgeous and immaculate, the beds are comfortable. The pool and spa are penomenal. You walk in the front door across a small lobby to the room elevators. You do not have to be funneled through a casino to get to your room. My only criticism is that the market cafe is poorly organized. It is a combination of a deli, coffee shop and conveninece store, but everyone ha to cehck out through one cashier line. They need separate lines for ready to puchase items and cafe items. Overall, I love the Vdara and wills tay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to typical loud and smoke filled Vegas hotels”
Reviews.Author: SCSTripping
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Vdara was a memorable experience. This is a beautiful hotel located in the City Center that was originally build for Condo living I believe, therefore the room didn't feel like a hotel room. The decor is contemporary, the rooms are large and even the bathrooms were lovely with the master having a large inviting soaking tub. There are flat screen TVs mounted in both the living room and bedroom and there is a full kitchen and separate dinning room off the living room area. We stayed in a corner suite that provided 240 degree views of the strip as well as the Bellagio fountain. I would go back to this hotel in a heart beat and highly recommend it. One drawback is that the hotel does not have a casino. But I'm not a gambler so this wasn't an issue for me. Plus, there are walkways connecting this hotel to other hotels in the area if gambling, drunkenness, and the thick smell of smoke is your thing. Check out the website, the rooms are as nice as they appear online.

Reviews.Title: “many a common theme with Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Damo4212
Reviews.Content: Appears to me that management really need to address some of these very obvious issues; 1. Staff behaviour/attitude is clearly not at a level where it needs to be. There seems to be no escalation or complaint process. 2. Include cutlery/plates etc in the rooms. This is a no brainer! 3. Improve the pricing and selection of the cafe downstairs, particularly paying attention to the quality of the coffee and time it takes to get served. 4. Improve check in and check out during peak times. 5. There appears to be some concerns about the security levels within housekeeping department. Sounds to me like if you get this right, the rest will fall into place and you'll improve your current rating. This is a beautiful hotel and with these things rectified it has the potential to be wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Vegas August 2011”
Reviews.Author: Blondes6
Reviews.Content: Vdara was a nice hotel, but I wouldn't consider it a 5-star hotel. I would rate it a 4-star hotel. When we first arrived to our room there were dirty dishes in the cabinets. While housekeeping did come and clean it up right away. The main bathroom was littered with papertowels on the floor. Otherwise, everything else was clean. I didn't think the service was excellent as I have stayed at other 5-star resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jbg79
Reviews.Content: Non gaming hotel right in the middle of all the action. Our convention was at Ceasars so we walked through bellagio every day and over the walkway to the convention. Perfect place to relax but close to everything on foot. I highly recommend the atmosphere and wonderful staff at vdara.

Reviews.Title: “No Casino!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paolo015
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotel in Las Vegas without a Casino inside. It is rail connected with Aria and really close to Bellagio (the real city center!!!). It is not on the strip and minmal in the services but rooms are nice, clean and large. We asked for a room lake view, in order to see the Bellagio fountain show, it is nice, evem if you can see just a slice of the show. Rooms are well equiped with also a little kitchen were you can heat some food. There room is splited with a living room with sofa and Plasma TV. This is not a top rated hotel, but is a good way to save some money to spend elsewhere. If you already had some time in other structure and you go there knowing what to do, it can be the right solution.

Reviews.Title: “Quantity Not Quality”
Reviews.Author: TravelsLA85
Reviews.Content: My partner and I came here for a couples weekend in Vegas and took advantage of their buffet + hotel package at around $200 per night. Seems almost too good to be true, because well, it is in some respects. If you are budget minded and don't mind the occasional rude service staff then this place is for you, but don't expect to feel "important" at this hotel. Upon check in we were greeted by a friendly staff and an intoxicating smell. Our room had an excellent view of the mountains and partial strip. We ended up on the 32nd floor which was awesome. The first thing that shocks you is just how HUGE the rooms are. I'm pretty sure my first studio apartment was much smaller than this room. The bed was to die for and made me sleepy within seconds. Fabulous amenities and an all suite hotel sans casino make this place feel like somewhere overflowing with high class. Here's the catch though, the service is hit or miss. We had two instances of a rude service staff. 1.) I asked a elevator attendant how my friend's valet would be charged to my room if they didn't take a ticket and he condescendingly replied, "SIR valet is FREE." And "pfft'd" under his breath. 2.) Check out is at 11am and we were scrambling to get out, but by 11:17am there was pounding on our door and the very rude housekeeping professional asked us if we were staying late and we said very politely, "no". Well that was all she needed to reply to us in a stern and demanding tone "SIR check out is at 11am! You need to check out now." Well given the lines downstairs and the impossible to operate check out on the TV we were obviously running late. Our bad, but come on be a little more polite. 3.) After all of this I filled out a survey to which I received an automatically generated apology email. I requested in the survey that someone contact me and of course nobody ever did. I called the hotel again and got the run around from a rude front desk attendant. So this hotel is about quantity over quality and I don't think they care much about retention. There were some other great service staff at this hotel, but overall they were fairly rude and unimpressive. Lastly, avoid the pool. It's very small, lacking of waitstaff and if you can sneak into the Aria pool just do that. It's way better.

Reviews.Title: “Written from vdara room right now.... Great so far”
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from the bed in 50016 I can't see any of the problems that others have put on this site , yet I will post again if I do Uk holidaymakers be aware that lastminute do this hotel cheaper than expedia

Reviews.Title: “One major lack in service colors this review”
Reviews.Author: kgreview
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a glowing review. The property is the most comfortable, peaceful and lovely that we walked into in Vegas--even the scent in the hotel is thoughtfully aromatherapeutic. The deluxe room is gracious in size, comfort and amenties--it's quiet an dark for a good night sleep when you are ready. The lobby bar serves a tasty appetizer menu with very good service and the Marketplace has very healthful takeout and/or pantry items to take back to your room and prepare in your kitchenette which is supplied in the rooms. We would definitely choose to stay here again for all these good reasons. I should also mention that I think the location of the property is ideal for being close to the big Strip destinations without having to sleep in them. However....we needed 2 beds and the property is all kings with queen pullouts and were sold the rooms from the reservation desk as the pullouts being very comfy once they place a featherbed on them--which is true (however of course not as comfortable as the King). The problem is that we placed the request in our reservation, we checked in at 8:30am and made sure they had the request. We called housekeeping about 3P to remind them and were assured that the bed would be made b/w 6-8P but returned at 8:30P to find no featherbed, no bed linens etc. Was told from housekeeping that they could not locate any for us. Tried to call the hotel manager twice in the next 30 minutes, who we were told was too busy to talk with us. In the meantime a housekeeping supervisor promised when we returned from our late night dinner, the bed would be ready and we left for our first evening very frustrated. The bed was ready when we returned at 12:30a, but honestly we should not have had to follow-up so many times, been told they weren't sure they could come through with the initial promise, and have a manager refuse to talk with us. The service has been generally friendly here but not reliable. One last quirk, the Marketplace cash registers were not taking charges one morning but none of the 10 people working thought to warn people before they waited in the 10-15 minute line for placing orders.

Reviews.Title: “I was wrong, it's amazing.”
Reviews.Author: IrishPrincess57
Reviews.Content: When the city center complex was being built I was adamantly opposed to the blight on the strip. But consented to stay at Vdara (a nonsmoking hotel sans casino) just to prove my point. I could not have been more wrong. Not only was it a joy not to hear bells & whistles from a casino, it was clean & even had it's own distinctive scent (when I questioned management they said it took them 6months to find the right scent to relax their guests &make them feel revitalized). Every time I walked into the place I found myself breathing deeply & feeling better...it was wonderful. Before we left for the Vdara, I did my homework on the entire city center complex & found it won the world's most environmentally conscious award, the 1st given to a hotel complex. Even the artwork in the complex is made from recycled products. My fav was the huge "chrysanthemum" sculpture made of kayaks. There are tours (both self guided & other) of the 50 works of art in the complex that should not be missed. My adult son & I spent a day of culture checking out the pieces as well as visiting the art galleries in the complex. The buildings themselves are works of art as well as their decor. It's a photographer's dream! They even have an covered walkway to Bellagio from the Vdara. The hotel service was stellar & shortly after we arrived we had a medical emergency back home with our dog that required emergency surgery, etc. If it hadn't been for the front desk's Dennis' help getting faxes sent (the consents back & forth & credit card info) & his running from the front desk to our room at least 4 times, it would have been even more traumatic..especially since it was Christmas evening. When we checked out a few days later everyone at the front desk asked how our pup was doing. It's that kind of place. Gorgeous facility, friendly staff, comfortable high end rooms & gorgeous views (we had a view of the Bellagio fountains) makes Vdara the special place to spend your hard earned cash.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean, contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honeysa
Reviews.Content: Had good one night stay. We treated ourselves to a good one night stay in Vdarra. Hotel is clean and no "smoke" smell. Although, hotel practically has nothing a night of entertainment to offer, everything else are easily accessible ie Bellagio, Monte Carlo, Cosmopolitan a d the rest of City Center. They could do better on their check-in lines during check-in rush hour. Be prepared to stay in line for 45 minutes if you get there around 3:00 pm. Advise: get their around 5:00 pm and u won't have to deal with d lines. Still, I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our visist very much”
Reviews.Author: DenJeff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are English and live in Spain. We went to the Vdara for my birthday and our anniversary in July/August for two weeks, which I understand is a long time for someone to stay in Las vegas. Check in was quick and efficient and the staff were very helpful to us throughout our stay. We were upgraded to a Bellagio view room, which was great. We were on the 34th floor. Therefore we had fabulous views of the Bellagio and Rio. The room and bathroom were clean and the bed was wonderful. Toiletries and towels were replaced every day. We asked for crockery which was brought and when they took the mugs away we rang for them to be returned. That was the only time we had to ring housekeeping. We checked out over the phone which was excellent so we did not queue at all. We enjoyed going to the pool and had plenty of room as it was not packed. The cabanas were mainly all vacant and we saw people going to look at them but I expect the price put them off. As we stayed for a long time, it got very tedious walking through the Bellagio or the Aria every time we went out so in the end we got taxis to wherever we wanted to go. That was the only downside. We used the business centre to print out our boarding cards and the gentleman there was also very helpful. It was very nice to be in a non smoking all suite hotel with modern facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: edwardkupa
Reviews.Content: While the facility was great and the room was fantastic, it lack the quality service for this kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: heidicamp
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the VDARA and we pleasantly pleased. The room was nice and comfortable. We had to get our room changed around midnight as we returned to a really foul odor in our room. They gave us a room 2 doors down and we moved ourselves. Was a pain as we had already unpacked and we forgot a couple items in the room and had to have a housekeeper let us in. Each room had things that didn't work, like the curtains and mini bar and the scale in the bathroom. (why have it in there if it doesn't work?) The parking was valet and we didn't mind as we paid more for a taxi to go a couple blocks than to tip a valet guy every time to get our car. Pool was just average and had an employee checking room keys before letting you in. I would stay there again if the price doesn't go up. Be prepared to pay a "resort fee" of $20 too.

Reviews.Title: “We did not want to leave the room”
Reviews.Author: redrock-canyon
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing room with the best views. We had a one bedroom suite with view of the city from everywhere even the shower. Service was great very clean and easy valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel deal in the world if you book on Priceline.com and upgrade to a strip and fountain view room”
Reviews.Author: tangointahiti
Reviews.Content: The huge suites have 30 feet of glass windows and incredible bathrooms. if you're on a lower floor the hotel is nice. if you're on the top half of the hotel it's world class. The view across the Bellagio fountains towards the Paris is the best we've ever seen. A comparable view suite in any other major city would be at least $1,000 a night. If you use Priceline.com you can sometimes snipe the Vdara for $80-90 a night. Often you can then upgrade your room to one of the top floors for an extra $15-20.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL IF YOU CAN!”
Reviews.Author: mightyoyo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the good reviews and I knew it was a fairly new hotel. But after staying in this hotel for one night, I suspected all the good reviews were from this hotel's friends/family members! I had a such bad experience with them. First I asked for 2 rooms together with a door connected in between. They said ok. But when we went up there, the rooms were together, but there's no door in between which we can open. We asked several times, and they couldn't accommodate our request. Then I found an old fast food box (with food) left in the fridge that didn't get to be taken out by the house keepers. They came pretty fast and cleaned out the mess but left a weird sour smell in the fridge. Then we asked for some slippers. They never brought them. We called them at least 5 times and they always said it's on the way. i also find there's no lotion in the bathroom and of course I called them to bring 1. Nope never brought the lotion. Finally we asked them to bring some sheets and blanket for the sofabed. It took many phone calls and a VERY LONG time for them to bring them and they left them in the wrong room (my friends room). The front desk staffs were not friendly and the house keeping service was TERRIBLE. We ended up stayed 1 night and cancelled the 2nd night. I will never stay in that hotel. I wonder how they got 5 star hotel rating. After staying in that hotel I got a survey email from them. And in the survey, I asked one of their management people to call me to discuss the detail, but never heard from them. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL IF YOU CAN! BAD MANAGEMENT!! BAD SERVICE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but wont stay again”
Reviews.Author: gaborko
Reviews.Content: Everything was nice but wont stay again. Hated walking to strip. I expected it but gave it a try cause no casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service needs to be improved”
Reviews.Author: globalnomad12
