Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara from 4 nights, Sunday thru Thursday. The service was pretty bad on Sunday night. The kitchenettes do not have any cookware, as these have to be ordered. The sofa bed does not come with sheets, and these have to be ordered too ( I wouldn't recommend sleeping on the sofa bed, the mattress is not comfortable). We must have called at least 3-4 times and waited several hours before anything showed up. I'm guessing they were were severely understaffed on Sunday night as the service improved tremendously on Monday. I still don't understand why they can't provide these basics in the room, particularly as it is supposed to be a 5 star hotel. On the flipside, the rooms are clean, very nicely decorated, and the location is hard to beat, particularly for access to the Bellagio, Aria and Cosmopolitan. The convenience store in the lobby closes early, but there is one at Aria which is open 24 hrs and is a short walk from there.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Find”
Reviews.Author: Elvin_10
Reviews.Content: It is very difficult to locate the turn to actually go to Aria or Vdara. If you are driving, be forewarned. Love the nonsmoking and no casino oasis it provided. But no "wow" factor to the lobby. Service only fair. Restaurant was never open. Is Silk Road still in business? Standard room was very comfy. Very nice "suite," and great bathroom. Pool was very nice. I heard the stories of the Vdara Death Ray, but had no problems. Very easy to get to Bellagio, and tram to south strip. More challenging to actually walk out to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, I always recommend it to my Blog Readers!”
Reviews.Author: nishnish2000
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Las Vegas. I love that it is a suite and it's tastefully done. The service at the Vdara was awesome. We were upgraded to a room with a mountain view and partial view of the Bellagio Fountains. I loved the modern look and feel. The hotel attracted young professionals, not teenagers or youngsters in their 20s looking to just get drunk. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Special in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jim1231
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find such a gem in the middle of the strip (or slightly off the strip). This non-gambling hotel is centrally located next to Aria and connected to many nearby hotels. It is far quieter and more relaxed than other hotels with casinos you have to walk through to get to your room. The room was beautiful- virtually a 1 bedroom apartment! The full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, very comfortable bed etc were perfect to get away from the street. We can wait to stay again...... Staff was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service ~~ Worst in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ItsIttoday
Reviews.Content: Pros- Clean, Excellent View city corner suite. Cons- Absolutely worst customer service in Vegas I've experienced. At check-in long, long lines with only 3 agents at front counter. Baggage assistance only 1 person outside.. With so many choices in Vegas this new modern hotel is at the bottom of my return list.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: natly90
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good overall as the room was large, bed was comfy, had a kitchen, a nice large bathroom with a large tub and our view of the strip was amazing because we could see the Bellagio fountains from our room. The only downside was that it was not right on the strip and some walking was required to get to it. Also, for anything you need in your hotel like soap/shampoo (wasn't even in our room when we checked in), extra bed sheets for the pull out bed, kitchen supplies and bath robes you have to call housekeeping. When we called I asked how long it would take for them to deliver it to us and they said an hour. So if you need anything...best to call right when you get in so that you have everything you need. Also, you have to pay a $20 resort fee on top of your hotel rate (internet is included in this fee).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel/Customer Service-Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: JimMaura
Reviews.Content: I booked Vdara because it was the cheapest Five Star Hotel available in Las Vegas and my wife and I stayed there from August 1-5. The hotel/room itself were very nice and the staff, at all levels, were fantastic. The pool area was small and so hot due to a lack of shade that it was uncomfortable after 10 a.m. The location, about a 15 minute walk to the Strip, was the most annoying aspect of staying at the hotel. The $20 per day resort fee was unreasonable. We stayed at the Palazzo on a previous trip and would stay there again before returning to Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: JJones458
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a Suite booked thru Priceline. Biggest surprise was the $20 per night additional mandatory "Resort Fee" they add on at check in. If you book there count on it. Location was fine, you can walk easily to the Bellagio and go out to the Strip there or take a tram to the Monte Carlo. Hotel was very quiet and clean and the staff was very responsive to any requests. The Bed was very comfortable and rooms were well appointed as you would expect for a 5 star hotel although not as plush and luxurious as some.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: funlovingcouple157
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during my birthday weekend and loved everything about it. Used the kitchen area for a little preparty action before hitting the strip. Plenty of room to entertain friends without feeling cramped. We also loved the huge bathroom that had both a stand-up shower as well as a regular tub. The location us great being located right in the middle of everything.....right next and connected to the Bellagio. We loved the fact that this hotel is smoke free and didn't have a casino. When walking through the doors, it literally smelled clean. We loved this hotel so much that we plan on staying here again in January for another birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Not "Off" strip but not exactly "On" the strip.”
Reviews.Author: ExoticDave
Reviews.Content: This property is located in the enormous City Center development. Of the several hotels in the complex, this property may be rated 5 stars, but really doesn't provide that 5th star that I am accustomed too receiving at genuinely 5 star properties. It is located behind the Aria, which is behind the Mandarin Oriental, which is next to the Cosmopolitan. That being said, my room was outstanding! There were 2 enormous flat screen TV's, a large shower, a beautiful tub, plenty of towels, and (my favorite) AVEDA, products. The bed was comfortable, and room quiet, and the lighting tasteful. There was even a little kitchen featuring a sink, microwave, and glass-top cooking surface. I would stay here again as it is a non-gaming and non-smoking property. The pool area isn't huge, but is was nice. Prior to visiting the pool, I looked at my feet and noticed that I needed a pedicure. The spa got me in immediately and provided me a pleasant, non-rushed, top-quality experience. The hotel charges a $20 per night stay for "free" hight speed internet as well as other things that we all know should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, great view.”
Reviews.Author: Runnergirl45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a Southwest vacation package and chose Vdara because it's a non-smoking suite hotel. We checked in hours early but rooms were available and we had our choice of views and elevations so we chose a high floor with a view of the Bellagio water show. It was spectacular and we really appreciated that we had a choice, especially since most hotels charge to upgrade for that kid of view! The room was super chic and nice...but unlike Signature, the kitchen isn't stocked with anything...no plates, silverware, coffee maker, etc. We called housekeeping for all of those...but they don't provide coffee makers so you have to go downstairs to the cafe for coffee. I'd rather have an in-room coffee maker. The cafe is fine for breakfast, lunch and smoothies but the service was really slow and uneven. There's a small store attached that sells wine at reasonable prices, beer, cheese, and even frozen foods that you could heat in your room. The pool is okay...the chaises are so tightly packed that you'd better like the people next to you because you have to crawl over them to get on your chair. The wind was crazy out at the pool so stuff was blowing everywhere and no one walks around and cleans up leftover drinks. We did book a cabana one day...nice to get have a small semi-private pool to float in and a room to escape the heat ('though the misters and fan didn't do much). We worked out at the fitness center, which is pretty complete with cardio machines and weights. It never got too crowded to use the machines we wanted. To gamble and eat dinners, we walked next door to Aria or to the Cosmopolitan nearby. Had one late night cocktail at Vdara's bar and sat outside. Pretty relaxing, not a scene. Overall, we had a good stay. If you want to get away from it all but be close to City Center, etc, I'd recommend Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiheather
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at the vdara in august. The best part of staying here is the location. An air-conditioned 15 minute walk and you are through the Bellagio and on las Vegas blvd, conveniently, right at the deuce stop., It is much quieter than a hotel casino and no smoking, even by the pool area, outside. There are some rooms 40th and up, which have great views of the strip, Bellagio fountains and pool. Then cons would be, no coffee pots in the rooms, so you have to go to lobby and buy overpriced coffee after waiting in line behind people ordering full breakfasts. and the cafe shut down early (by Vegas standards) at 8 pm. Beautiful lobby and professional staff but always a small wait for the front desk. Cabs are easy to get, never waited at all. Has a free monorail attached that takes you through the aria and cosmopolitan and upscale mall called crystals. We got a great deal considering the amenities and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Quality/Price ratio”
Reviews.Author: Ljungskog
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a Deluxe Suite (option 1 with room devider) on the 42nd floor overviewing the Bellagio Fountains. We ended up in this hotel by chance and absolutely loved it. The room was great, very large, tastefully decorated and the view fantastic. Valet parking, check-in and check-out was fast and flawless. Gym and Pool area was ok and the absence of a crowded and smokefilled casino at groundlevel, was a relief - We were not in Vegas for the gambling ! Several reviewers complain about lack of service and on two occasions we got the impression the this facility is running a little low on staff. It took 40 minutes to get our luggage delivered to our room and it took 3 phonecalls and more than1 hour to get Maidservice to unfold and make the extra bed. Nothing I consider real troublesome, but off course it opens up for the discussion wether Vdara is a real 5 Star Hotel. This hotel was however without any doubt the best quality/price deal we got during our 2 weeks in the US.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: claudz00
Reviews.Content: My friends were staying at the Belagio so I wanted to stay close to them. The Vdara is only 2 min walk along the internal walkway The room was very large and the view of the Belagio fountains was an added bonus. Fabulous view! This is a gem of a hotel. Non-smoking, with no casino yet the casinos are seconds away. the service is touch and go. It has a great kitchen yet no utensils or crockery. You have to ask for everything and when I called housekeeping I was ttold to call later as they were very busy! I called twice and then went to the cafe downstairs and got some plastic cutlery. Supplies in the bathroom, whilst good, are vey scarce. Again, you have to call to get the basics. Free wi-fi is great The cafe dowstairs serves good food and overall I would stay at the Vdara again :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: pointandshoot
Reviews.Content: Pros: - New and modern suites with state of the art kitchen + opulent bathroom + 2 gigantic TVs + super comfortable king sized bed + couches, etc - location: right opposite the Bellagio, which is pretty much the centerpiece of Vegas and also the center of the strip. In fact they are linked by a walkway; hooray to hiding from the 100F weather! - Free wifi - Gym had sufficient machines and was clean & bright, but don't expect a college gym. Cons: - No casinos or buffets, but that might be a plus for guests who prefer a quiet retreat from the casino activity - bell service was almost non-existent; we had to carry our bags off our car, open the doors and bring it up to our rooms all by ourselves - some of the lights in the room were not working, and the weighing scale, though state of the art, had no battery in it. but none of the above had a great negative impact on our stay. - pool was okay. unimpressive. Overall: This is a spanking new all-suite hotel so you can expect the best facilities. however, this also means they need some time to iron out some of the aforementioned problems. Tip: we got this hotel off hotwire and managed to get the suite for US$99! with some luck and intelligent guess-work, it's not hard to deduce which hotels will be assigned to you, especially in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: statguy3
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for 5 nights at Vdara. Overall, it was a very good stay. The basic suite was nicely configured, space was efficiently used, and it was very comfortable for 2 people. The service was generally good, but not elegant. The staff was friendly, but not polished as you might find at upscale properties. It was really good to have a mini-refrigerator in the room, as it is hot in Vegas in August! Although the Vdara only has a snack bar, the Bellagio's restaurants are available through a walkway and the Aria is a short walk around the traffic circle. In addition, the Cosmopolitan has an excellent, gourmet buffet just a short block away.

Reviews.Title: “Everything they advertise is true”
Reviews.Author: KI6871
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in a City Corner Suite. The room was exactly as anticipated - modern, sedate and spacious. The curtains aren't true blockout but certainly do a great job and I love their automation. The bed was extremely comfortable with great linens and the aircon was reliable. Check in and check out was swift although we saw the Sunday morning check out queue and note-to-self, don't check out on a Sunday anywhere in Vegas. Concierge, Louis Mas in particular, were superb in the lead up to and during our stay. Big hugs and kisses to him. I realise it is the job of concierge to provide advice and assistance but I believe Louis went well above and beyond to make my birthday stay well organised and fun. The pool area is superb. We hired a cabana one day and were treated by employee Kristen to a great day. Vdara's cabana area is much more sedate, no 'rehab' sillyness but still loads of fun for our group of six. My friends were unsure what the cabana day was going to be about and thought we might just hang out by the pool for an hour or two - Five hours later we were still sunning, swimming and laughing. Late late (or is that early early) room service ticked the boxes. I can say only one small critiscm and it is to support others views of housekeeping, veeeeery slow, actually, non-existant but hey, if that's the only complaint I'm a happy camper. I recommend Vdara to anyone looking for a non-smoking, non-gaming spacious-room property. You'll love this place, it's seriously chilled but just a hop skip and jump to the best nightlife of Vegas, namely the Cosmopolitan complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Simon H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Vdara many times since it opened. Even though it does not have a Casino, The location is great in City Center middle of the strip and next to Bellagio, Aria and Cosmopolitan for any gambling urges. Decor and general feel are Uber Chic. The rooms are all suites, even the basic room has a living room, very large bathroom with seperate bath and shower, as well as a kitchen. The beds are one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Pool and Spa again are top end, very nice, not rowdy like some in Vegas The Staff are always great, freindly and helpful. If you wish to stay centrally located on the strip have great value for money and stay in a top end hotel, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was awesome,but.....”
Reviews.Author: miamimomma72
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is an excellent hotel slightly off the strip in Las Vegas,there is no casino and it is an all suites hotel which is the main reason we booked it. the hotel is across the street from the Aria which is also a beautiful property and offers a casino for those who are interested in gambling, the Vdara was beautiful and very clean, the staff was professional and accomodating. Our stay was nearly perfect, i say nearly because we experienced a few inconveinient issues during our stay that annoyed me slightly; 1. we stayed for 5 nights, initially placed in a room on 9th floor, with a great layout inside and a not so great view of the bellagio tram stop,the bathroom door had handprints on it which annoyed me(it was a sliding frosted glass door) we were very tired when we arrived (6 hrs of travel) so we took a nap before calling housekeeping to ask them to clean it, when we woke up three hours later we realized that the air conditioning unit was making a loud rattling sound so we called down to have them check it while we went over to check out the strip and grab a bite. when we returned the ac had not been addressed and the glass was still dirty?!! (annoying) we called down to speak with someone at the front desk and they offered to move us to another room immediately. we loved the new room(35th floor with a panoramic view of las vegas all the way to the mountains.!!!) needless to say we were very happy. 2. our new room was great but not as open as initial room, it had a wall that seperated the sitting area from the bedroom with a pull out sofa and chair, glass coffee tables, two flat screens, large bathroom with seperate glass shower and large soaking tub (the ish!!!!) kitchenette with table for two, small fridge, sink,two burner stovetop,...etc. the housekeeping in this suite was immaculate...a few issues turned me off slightly....the toilet stopped up as soon as we got there (had to call front desk for repair), handle on bathroom door fell off and nearly smashed my toes! (had to call for repair) handle on kitchen sink came off! (another repair call)....annoying???!!!! yes!! (these are things you don't want to deal with on vacation, and epecially in a 4-5 star hotel) needless to say there were a few things that cheapened the feel of the hotel. but otherwise we felt like we were at home and very safe and secure. (great security) we did receive a full refund of our resort fee for our trouble (100 dollars-we had to ask for it, it was not offerered?!!) so we felt better about the few issues that we experienced. pool was great, it felt like we were at someones private pool party versus the big party palooza like some of the other hotels, (be careful at pool!!! there is a severe hot spot in the early afternoon that will literally fry you and your hair!!! google "vdara death ray") you will have to leave the property if you're looking for a fancy meal, there is a small marketplace/grocery store in the lobby that is very conveinient if you need something quick to eat but it does close early (8pm?) so be aware. this hotel is flanked by the Aria, the cosmopolitan, and the bellagio which are all awesome and easy to walk to...they have casinos,shows and great places to eat (wicked spoon buffet is a must do at the cospmopolitan) we literally could have stayed in this area for our entire vacation and felt like we've seen and done it all. I highly recommend the Vdara...just be sure to check your fixtures and do a once over when you arrive...lol.. otherwise you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Corner suite was worth the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: myoshi
Reviews.Content: No casino in the hotel was a good thing. Quieter and made the room a refuge from the Vegas craziness. It certainly didn't suck seeing the waves of bachelorette groups and college sorority sisters as they headed out to the nightclubs at the Cosmo and Caesars in their "looking to hook-up" attire. The 2 for 1 drink tickets from the front desk on check-in are definite money savers...Would defintely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the service and level of responsiveness”
Reviews.Author: BigAlChitown
Reviews.Content: I have several comments, but overall was most disappointed with the level of service. Our room was not made up either day of our stay before dinner and was never made up the second day of our stay. (To the hotel's credit, the resort fee was refunded to all of us for all three nights because of our complaints.) Reaching the desk and auto valet by phone was a crap shoot as avout half the time the calls weren't answered or bounced from the valet to the front desk despite it being a slow time. As others have said, the pool is nice, but nothing special by LV standards. The room was rather small and not well laid out. It is a stretch to call the room a suite and there was not a lot of room to navigate in the "deluxe" room with the sofa bed in use. It was a long walk to the Strip,so the location was not ideal. I will say, the walk to the Aria casino was not as bad as some walks I have had when staying on site (e.g. the walk from Encore to the Wynn poker room.) Overall, I would not recommend staying here, especially if you are in LV to party and/or gamble!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive room but...”
Reviews.Author: Voyagevegas
Reviews.Content: Our first contact with the Vdara was at our arrival with a cocky valet who was almost offended because we want to carry our luggages ourself. Then, we finally got our room but be patient, we had to wait 45 minutes in line to check in. They were about four employees at the front desk when they would have need to be the double number to serve everybody in a ''descent'' period of time. We finally enter the room which was just impressive i.e modern, confortable, nice view etc (a real suite). The only bad point was the so call kitchenette that comes without any plates & stencils (not even a coffee maker) plus their is no grocery store near the hotel!?! Finally, the 20$ per day resort fee on our bill when we checked out was frustrating especially because it is not clearly mentioned when you book your room unless you have a magnifier with you...Everything is made for you to spend always more money.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: ykculgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked the room last minute for a family vacation, pay $30 extra per night to upgrade to an executive corner suite which is about 840 sqft. My family loved the room decor and hotel staffs were great. Hotel is quiet since there's no casino in the hotel but it's within walking distance to Aria and Bellagio. Highly recommend this hotel and definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, gorgeous, luxurious”
Reviews.Author: XMRadioStar
Reviews.Content: From top to bottom, this place is breathtaking! It might not have an actual restaurant, but the cafe food is delicious! I recommend one of the sandwiches. And the smell that's in the air... so much better than smelling stale cigarettes and cigars... Hands down I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “New, fresh, location, this had it all”
Reviews.Author: Olle B
Reviews.Content: Well, Las Vegas, what a city,, we been there before and stayed at the strip. Worn out hotel and the all around allowed smooking went all the way into the elevators and nearly into the rooms. What a different Vdara is. New, clean and beautiful rooms. Never had any problem to find a fast elevator even if the hotel is 54 floors in high. The breakfast at Aria was itself worth the trip to Vegas. The walkway to Belaggio was so smooth and easy. The poolarea was clean and free, unfortunately we hadent the time join. The reception, check in and out was smooth,, Im sure there are other hotels at this level, but I havent visit them yet, so so far is Vdara our number one recommendation for your Las Vegas vacation. Best R Olle & Jeanette B

Reviews.Title: “OK....But”
Reviews.Author: Robin H
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely suite divided into kitchen dining, lounge, bedroom and bathroom. The bed was fantastically comfortable. Not sure why they bothered about a kichen/dining area - there is absolutely no cooking or eating utensils, and worse - no tea or coffee making facilities. Not even a cup or a teaspoon. The hotel has no restaurants, althoug there are some very good ones at the Aria, a short walk away. There is a rubbish (and overpriced) cafe in the lobby - cardboard cups of coffee and plastic cutlery. There is a $20/day (plus tax) 'resort fee'. Other than two tiny bottles of water each day, we were uncertain what exactly the 'resort fee' was for. But we weren't surprised - the money grubbing never stops.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - would love to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: wheljenn
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous room - very spacious. Love the separation wall between bedroom and sitting area. Great big bathroom with a huge soaking tub. It was nice to have the kitchen area, and although it was easy to call and request silverware and dishes, it would have been nicer to have them already stocked - with a coffeepot please! We had a great view of the Bellagio fountains. Great rate, and $30 late check-out was worth it as we had a late night flight; we got to visit the amazing fitness center, nice quiet pool, then refresh before our flight. Loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We plan to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Mimizhusband
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Thursday/Friday night - it was quite dead on Thursday. 1. Even our smallest of the Vdara's rooms was very large. An upgrade can make it a huge suite for not a ton of extra $$$. 2. The lone cafe in the Vdara was not up the quality of the rest of the hotel. Much better to just eat at one of the many restaurants in the Bellagio (down one walkway, close) or the Aria with its 16 restaurants (just a walk across the parking circle). 3. The pool is rightfully famous for a very concentrated sun reflection off of the Aria. I am rather tan and even late in the day and being out for just 45 minutes I noticed I had taken much more sun than normal for the time of day and the duration. Plus the reflection is hard on the eyes. The room electronics can charge any USB device if you have the cord, no transformer needed. The TV's have a very nice panel of video inputs: HDMI all the way back in time to s-video and many major ones in between.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at Vdara; not as good as first visit but we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: kdwall
Reviews.Content: Our first stay was shortly after the hotel opened. We loved that it was non-gaming, non-smoking as we don't smoke or gamble. I was there for a trade show and the shuttle picked up at the front door. Loved having a coffee pot and well-equipped kitchen! After arrival this year, however, I discovered the shuttle pickup was in the basement on the other side of the Aria because the buses had problems navigating the circular drive. I had appointments that required I take my portfolio & computer. I was NOT happy. A cab ride to World Market Center is nearly $30. When we got to our room it smelled like a dead rodent and immediately called the front desk. They were very nice and were able to remotely reprogram our keys for another room two floors down which was fine. Then we discovered the coffee pot and all the kitchen essentials are no longer provided. No robes either (even 4-star hotels provide them). The rooms are still very nice and clean. The small fridge and microwave are very handy to have. The bar is fantastic (you can actually have real conversation without yelling), you can now order some light fare (you couldn't last year) and the same wonderful bar waitress is there from last year. The $20 per day is a little out of line for internet and two small bottles of water. We didn't mind it when it included all of the items provided last year. Overall, we still think the Vdara is a great place to stay and we'll likely go back. The good far outweighs the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm... Luxury at it's finest, but...”
Reviews.Author: GTW76
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a great hotel "IF" you are looking for a traditionally non-Vegas type stay while still being in reasonable proximity to the Strip. Here's the deal, last time we stayed at the Mirage - loved everything about it! This time around I wanted a strip hotel (according to Priceline the Vdara is a Strip hotel), unfortuantely, most of the things that I loved about the Mirage were not available at the Vdara - I blame myself for that, as I opted to go the Priceline route (as you may know, with Priceline, you do not have control of the actual hotel you will be staying in, just it's amenities and star level). With the Vdara, I missed having a casino on site... the closest casino is either the Bellagio, or a tram ride to the Aria, or a 10 minute walk directly to the Strip. I also missed having a selection of restaurants on site (the Vdara has one - I think, that is more a high-end grocery store & very small cafe), I also missed shops - to buy either hotel wear or souviniers (the Vdara has none), and then there's the pool - where the Mirage pool (and seemingly every other pool area we visited was attractive, vibrant, and full of life the Vdara pool is... well, a pool - and that's about it. Very small & very boring. We are by no means party people, but when in Vegas we expect to imerse ourlselves in the culture of the town, and the Vdara just didn't do it for us, mostly because of it's lack of amenities and proximity to "the action". I found it very odd that upon checking-in, I had to sign a document acknowledging the fact the Vdara was a non-gaming facility. Okay, so why the high rating... what the Vdara does offer is beautiful rooms with great views (of places you wish weren't a tram ride away - LOL), the linens are amazing, the bathrooms are spotlessly clean, and the room set-up is very smart (afterall these are suites, not really hotel rooms). ...but that pool area - ugh! We came away from this trip realizing we are Mirage, NY NY, MGM Grand, Bellagio type people, the Vdara is more for foks that want to go to Vegas but not be part of the Vegas scene. ...next time I will know better.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel! Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: LyGod
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Las Vegas and stayed at the Vdara! Wow! The room was amazing! Very clean and spacious. We were fortunate to be upgraded to the corner suite! The service at the desk was fast and friendly! Would stay there again without a doubt! The hotel is right in the middle of the strip and close to everything you want to see! Very happy with our first trip to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Vegas Property minus the Casino”
Reviews.Author: stevestr
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel when you can get it on special. Small pool. No self parking at all. Use the parking one block west and walk through the adjoining hotel to get back to this one. Some freeway noise at night. There is a buffet over at the other property if you don't like the rather smallish offering in this hotel's lobby. One of the most comfortable pull out sofa beds I have ever used. Our unit was an end unit 1 bed suite and contained a refrigerator, stove, washer and dryer, walk in shower, and a separate bath tub along with an in unit safe. Other that the lack of immediate self-parking and the small walk to the strip, this was a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Carolinelomeli
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a great place to stay and I highly recommend it. First, I was surprised at how easy it was to check in. Being part of the City Center worried me, but it was not even an issue as valet was a breeze. The lobby was beautifully done and the staff friendly. Also, the fragrance that hits you as you approach the front doors is heavenly...so fresh! The room was nicely decorated and very clean. The king bed was very comfortable and housekeeping was pleasant. The sofa sleeper is not very comfortable though as reported by my kids so I probably would not recommend sleeping on it. We ordered room service once for lunch and once for dinner...food was okay. It could have been better, but being in Vegas there are plenty of other great places to eat so I'd recommend skipping the dine in service. The gym was very nice and spacious. Everything you could need was there. The swimming pool is kind of small and the rays at noon reflect off the building so it could get plenty HOT! Nice pool area, but I would definitely not be out there in the afternoon otherwise something is bound to melt or get scorched! Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “clean,modern,easy access to airport and strip, but complicated within citycenter”
Reviews.Author: wescbr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Deluxe room with one king bed, very comfortable bed and pillows. We had very nice sleep throughout five nights stay there. The room has a dining table and actual kitchen (kitchenware can be provided). Clean washroom, one bathtub and standing shower so two can take shower at the same time. Very nice decor in the room, the blinds and shades are controls by switches on the wall panel. In fact the room is a bachelor suite with kitchen, so you can buy some food from Townsquare if you rent a car. overall very nice and clean, another bonus is that during the night there is a security personnel in front of elevator area asking for room key, which made us feel safe and secure from drunk people. It was very quiet during the night. If you ask for room number 2,4.6 you will see the Bellagio fountain throughout day and night. other rooms probably will get you a view blocked by Cosmopolitan or ARIA. It take less than 10 minutes from airport, so you can either take $7.00 shuttle or taxi for about $17. When returning to airport you can wait outside every 30 of the clock or call 24hrs prior.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but noisy on Friday night”
Reviews.Author: Ranger99
Reviews.Content: Had a 5-night stay at the Vdara in July. Started off good - first time I never had to wait in line to check in. Luck of the draw. Stayed on the 41st floor in one of the smaller deluxe rooms. View of the pool and freeway. No noise from the pool but a lot of traffic noise at night. You get used to it. Got a good deal with a Southwest Air package. Figure the room cost about $80/night plus the $20 resort fee. Don’t look for the switch that controls the curtains by the bed or the windows. It is on the wall in the little area between the kitchen and main room. Also there is a main light switch by the front door that housekeeping always turns off. Couldn’t figure out why none of the lights would work until I flipped that main switch. Bathroom has a big soaking tub with a separate shower. There is kind of a funky odor that I think is coming from the bathroom vent. You might want to bring a can of Lysol. Turned on the Housekeeping light when I left the room about 9AM and it was always cleaned when I got back about noon. They always left two bottles of water in the refrigerator. You can pick up a free paper in the lobby including USA Today and WSJ. Wireless internet worked fine. Interesting that the Vdara was the only wireless connection available. Pool is nice with plenty of chairs and umbrellas for shade. FYI – It is not a salt water pool. There is a big Jacuzzi that actually has hot water. No noise from the neighbors (if I had any) until the 5th night which was a Friday. That is when all the party people checked in. The walls are not that sound proof when there are people on both sides of the room yelling at 3AM. Had a little glitch trying to use the TV check-out. It said it was unable to process. Had to go down to the lobby and wait in line. Then they said I was already checked out so the TV check-out must have worked even though it said there was a problem. Would stay at the Vdara again if I could get a good deal. But I wouldn’t stay on a week-end night. Tips: The tram to the Aria and Monte Carlo runs from 8AM until 4AM and comes every 3 or 4 minutes. The Monte Carlo has a food court with a Starbucks, a 24-hour McDonalds, etc. I would not recommend walking to the Hard Rock Hotel. The map shows it is right down Harmon but it is a long walk.

Reviews.Title: “depends on what you want in Las vegas”
Reviews.Author: kath1954
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Vdara are lovely, and equally important, quiet. Seems like that should be all one would /should ask for. However, I felt there was something missing. The lobby and check-in feels convoluted. The one "deli style" food offering is limited for travellers. The "suites" have a well set up kitchenette if that is the way you want to go , but, no utensils, pots, pans, etc. - not even a coffee maker. Equally irritating was the $20.00 a day resort fee - added on top of your rate - for the use of the pool, gym, internet and not to forget - 2 bottles of water......... I do like the option of leaving a casino and going to a quiet hotel, but, if you go - depending on what your expectations of Las Vegas are - you might be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: freemaee
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Vdara and we love it! From the moment you walk into the lobby it smells fresh, it is quiet and relaxed. The staff is very efficient. Love the fact that there is no casino in it and that is a non smoking. The rooms are decorated beautifuly and there is plenty of space (even for our 3yr old to run around). I prefer the "Lake View", which is the view of the Bellagio's fountains, upper floors. The pool was fine early on, gets crowded later in the day and the music becomes too loud (I can understand why). The restaurant was not open when we were there, however there is a small place in the lobby with some great (not so inexpensive) choices. The best part is that withing a walking distance is Aria and that has a few very good choices for restaurants. My favorite Barmasa.

Reviews.Title: “Bad attitude at front desk”
Reviews.Author: kevinli
Reviews.Content: We are very happy when we arrived the hotel. It seems a very upscale hotel & the front desk is very nice & polite. But we immediately disappointed with the room we have as we found that they didn't clean up the bathroom properly before they let us check in. Toilet was not flushed & used towel was on the floor! We spoke to one of the front desk person & see if we can exchange the room. Unfortunately, the hotel room is full. They are gladly to gave us some in house credit to be use at the hotel's restaurant while we are staying with them. We noticed that they have missed charge our account. I called them up & explain to them. At first, the person I spoke to claims herself as the manager. She is not willing to make full refund to us. So, I was trying to explain to her again.... She stops me without letting me finish my word .... eventhou at last she has agree to make the full refund to us, I really think she is rude. AS A FRONT DESK/ CUSTOMER SERVICE, her attitude is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: SkiCOLLINS
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have been to Vegas Many times, I have family in Vegas so we have the ins and outs on what not to do. Anyhow, We loved the Vdara hotel and Spa. For me it was like the The Hotel because of the non gaming property. We had a Corner suite and it was very spacious! One thing I would like to see is a light switch near the bed, not just tiny lights to read by. All of the staff was super helpful and very nice. We ate at the buffet at Aria because Vdara does not have one that is fine but, the cafe should stay open til Midnight. The Spa and exercise area was A#1! We got a great rate and would stay again but, would not stay for regular price.

Reviews.Title: “VDARA IS AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: 1tunyaj
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Las Vegas to attend a cheerleading competition. I just wanted to see if my decision to stay at a hotel minus the casino was worth the missed atrraction. Oh my goodness, it was worth it. Although we had a ilttle hike to the nearest casino which was the Bellagio, and a short tram ride to the others, it was worth the effort. Our rooms were spacious, real spacious, equipped with a mini kitchen, a bar, and refrigerator just for your own personal goodies, an excellent view, especialy at night. The best part about it, and most might say what is she talking about, is the fact that the room key function is not goverened by this magnetic strip, which can disallow access to your room if it is near a phone or other credit cards. This key is just a plastic key with some kind of chip in it that you wave in front of the door and it opens. You have three buttons on your wall instead of the hang tags used in most hotels, and you can select housekeeping, do not disturb, and the third one was just a general light that i assume allows housekeeping to know they if they are at your door, they can knock and ask you if you want your room cleaned or need any more towels and stuff, in case you didn't realize that option is available. You have two flat screen tvs so if you are like me, one who likes to watch her own shows, then this option is ideal for you and your companion or crumb snatchers. The bar is ideal as it is open until late at night and has plenty of comfortable seating inside and outside. There is a Market Place spot with a quick mini grocery sections, it is high as the sky though, but, you pay for convenience. They have a little club that I never saw opened, but, we stayed mostly during the week, so maybe it only opens on the weekend unless it is rented out. Withing walking distance to other high end hotels would be the Cosmopolitan and the Aria, both have their own scene and plenty to do and eat. The best deal as far as the food though is the Bellagio's buffet. I enjoyed that way better than the Aria. If you just want the experience, go to the Aria, if you want to eat your heart out with many more options and less the cost, go to the Bellagio. If you check ou the reviews, you will notice the Bellagio is rated "1" for price you pay for food and the upscaleness. Plus you can do the casino stuff at the same. And, you can do some upscale shopping too.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best rooms I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: tk72
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel. It is a little off the strip, but a 5 minute walk through a corridor to the Bellagio and the City Centre monorail which connects between Bellagio & Monte Carlo. Is the only hotel on the strip without a Casino and that could be a welcome relief as you avoid having to go through the Casino to the elevator lobby. The staff were professional and fairly quick in attending to your requirements, though a little impersonal. The check in process was quick and the check out was even quicker though there were long queues at the front desk. This is becuase they had assigned someone to collect the keys and your details and emailed you within a couple of hours with your invoice. The best part of the hotel was the room. Roomy, spacious and well fitted out. The bed was comfortable. I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good rooms, low on extras (for Vegas)”
Reviews.Author: evlk
Reviews.Content: Overall, i really liked my stay at the Vdara. The room was massive - and all very new and clean and crisp. It had a nice classy atmosphere, and was definitely quieter than most hotels on the strip because it doesn't have a casino. The location was great - really close to the Bellagio and right next to the Aria. The Wynn and Encore were just a short walk away - so it was easy to get to the fancy casinos for gambling etc. There was a pool, but it was very windy when we were there and couldn't enjoy it. They had a spa too, but we didn't take advantage of that either. My only reservation was the lack of a restaurant and good bar on the ground floor. You pretty much had to go out of the hotel for breakfast (unless you grabbed a snack at the cafe/shop), and when coming back in the evening - if you wanted a drink before going to bed, the bar lacked an atmosphere that made you want to stay there. The bar had a real "waiting room" or "airport lounge" feel. If you are after a smart hotel without the fuss of a casino, but pretty much nothing else that you get form all those resort casinos on the strip then i'd recommend the Vdara. As a place to rest - it was great, but it lacked the frills that I think you need to stand out in a place like Vegas. I liked the lack of casino, but that seemed to mean that other things had been left out too.

Reviews.Title: “very swish; lovely hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: penhar
Reviews.Content: Situated behind the Bellagio and without a casino this is an all suite hotel with lovely rooms - very clean and light. Few issues - valet parking only - if you forget something in your car you have to get a ticket, and a valet brings the car back for you to get it out and takes car away - my other half really wasnt impressed. Also full kitchentte and no coffee maker in the room. Small cafe - very expensive - as was everywhere in Vegas. Next door to Aria which has a smallish but nice casino and overall it was a good choice of hotel for the couple of nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: austtexgirl
Reviews.Content: My best friend and booked this through Hotwire and got a $99 room rate. The rooms are beautiful, and the service was fabulous! Only had to call twice - once to replace the soap, and another time to get hand towels. They were prompt and friendly. Much to our surprise, their room service food was amazing. Some of the best chicken wings we've ever eaten! We'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Pool is clean, but not as glitzy as other resorts. Loved that it was all non-smoking, and it was an easy walk to Bellagio and Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay there again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: raindoggy_99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two boys stayed at the Vdara for three nights at the end of july. First off, when the bellhop put our luggage on a rack upon arriving, they left our stuff sitting outside without taking it to the back. I sat there and watched it for 5 full minutes before a person finally took it to the back where it could safely sit. That was after watching several empty handed bellhops pass by it. I even walked up to the rack and took something off of it and no one said a thing. What if it hadn't been my stuff? Our bathtub had hair in it when we got up to the room. Not just a hair, but several hairs. Made me wonder how well they clean the tubs!! Shower leaked all over the floor anytime it was used. The rest of our stay was pretty uneventful until we left. We had realized we had left a couple of my sons items behind when we checked out. We were sure they were left in the room and that he hid them somewhere. He is two and puts stuff anywhere. 2 hours after checking out we realized it and called to have them check the room. We were told they would get back to us and didn't. We decided to go back to retrieve the items and talked to a manger by the name of zach who was at the front desk. He assured us the room had been cleaned and the items were not found but that a manager would check the room. 20 minutes later he said they were not found in the room and at this point there was nothing they could do. He acted like we had not really left them behind even though we were positive we did. I had started to cry because I was so upset about them not finding his stuff that had sentimental value to us. He assured me several times that he would call us that night and let us know if he had heard anything or if they had been found. NEVER CALLED!!!!! Between me and my husband we talked to probably around 20 different people between lost and found and housekeeping and management. They way they run things there is a nightmare. They made it so difficult to locate our stuff. We left vegas two days later very upset that they didn't find our stuff. We called everyday, several times a day for a week. They told us that they could have been lost in the laundry and that could take weeks to locate! ERRRG! Finally after a week of them telling us they were not there, a nice young lady in lost and found called the room and had the current guest check the room for them. GUESS WHAT????? They were in there the WHOLE TIME!!!!! So frustrating!!! A cleaning lady and a housekeeping manager couldn't find them in the room but a guest can?????? All that hassle and the last two days of our trip ruined because they don't clean properly!!!! Will NEVER stay there again!!!!! TERRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “New - Beautiful - Smokeless”
Reviews.Author: melwood7
Reviews.Content: This was my ninth trip to Vegas and first stay at the Vdara. We got a great rate that included a daily buffet at any MGM Mirage casino hotel which was very nice. I hate, hate, hate the cigarette cloud that you find in most all the properties in Las Vegas. I understand it, but it's still frustrating for non-smokers who have allergies. The Vdara was a refreshing getaway from all of this. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a view room overlooking the fountains at Bellagio. If you don't reserve this kind of room - you should ask if you can upgrade at check-in. The view was spectacular! The room was very clean and well appointed. The bathroom was large and had a big soaking tub (not jetted) with a separate glass enclosed shower. We did use the small empty fridge for beverages but did not use the actual kithcenette (microwave, cooktop). Very handy though if you need it! The bed was very comfy. My biggest complaint about the room overall is the blackout shades. I like to sleep-in on vacation and the shades don't hug the window at all, so about 6:00 in the morning, sunlight fills the room. Very annoying. They should have thought that out better when designing the room. The only issue we incurred was with housekeeping the first day. We left our room early and pushed the button for housekeeping and were gone for about 8 hours only to return and not have our room serviced. We left for dinner and told the front desk and by the time we returned it was clean. Problem solved. We used our buffet passes 3 times. We started at the Aria buffet and then tried the Monte Carlo and went back to Aria. I have been to many buffets in Vegas and the Aria is by far my favorite. Not only was the selection amazing, but the quality of food was exceptional. Vdara has a bar, but no restaurants which is fine. It's about a 2 mintue walk to Aria which has plenty to go around. I would return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but has some issues”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Homer
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Vdara as I had a conference next door at the Bellagio. The price was right at $85 per night but then you have to add on the $20 per night resort fee. They also place a hold on my credit card of $110 per night as a security deposit. I am not sure why the deposit is per night, its not like if there is damage it grows with the length of time I stay. Check-in was a breeze at around 930pm on Wednesday. Only two people manning the desk an only two people in line. We never noticed a bad smell in the lobby or the public places like others did. You will have to show your room key to the security person near the elevator each time you want to go up, so don't forget the key. The elevator was quick to the 41st floor, we eneded up with a room with a view over CityCentre, Monte Carlo and the Mandalay Bay. It took us a bit to get the lights going, appartently the master switch is by the door and if you don't turn it on, the lights won't come on. When we walked in, we were in the "kitchen" with a large table and two chair, we had a fridge, microwave, 2 burner stove and a garberator. As mentioned before, there was no cutlery or tableware. Walking through the kitchen put us in the main room, the queen bed was off to the right, the sofa was in front of us and the desk ahead on the left. The tv was mounted on the wall opposite the bed above a chest of drawers. The bathroom has a large shower, a big tub and dimmer lights. The bathroom does have a slider door with a frosted glass insert so you can "shadow" dance if you like. The staff was friendly and the cleaning staff did a nice job. We never ate at the cafe but it seemed busy. The crowd was mainly 20-30 year olds which surprised us. We did like the no-smoking policy. The cons which we weren't happy with. 1. the self-parking is a 15 minutes walk/ride away. The only parking at the Vdara is valet which does not work with rental cars as the valet would not be a listed driver. We had to park at the Aria self-parking, take the overpass to the Aria, walk through a variety of doors to the tram station. To get to the station, you have to ride the escalator up. Once you get the tram, you take it to the Vdara/Bellagio stop. Again, you go down the escalator and through some doorways til you get to the walkway to the Vdara. It was a pain to drag luggage through. It also meant no spur of the moment decisions to go out since it was a pain to get to the car. The location of the garage meant that you would come out in the middle of the strip and be subjected to the traffic. 2. the lights by the bed are controlled by a switch in the kitchen so it is not the best for laying in bed and then turning out the lights. There are two little spot lights in the bed for reading I guess but generally useless. 3. We had three phones in the room, only one worked. The one by the bed was not even plugged in and there was not cord. The one in the bathroom didn't work either. 4. My wife noticed that there was no hairdryer in the room which has been pretty standard everywhere we have travelled before. 5. the blackout blinds are useless due to the large gaps between them. 6. neither one of us found the bed comfortable and we had terrible sleeps. Overall, I am not sure we would stay here again. I would have given the property 3.5 stars if we were permitted to use the half star.

Reviews.Title: “Cornerstone values of service and respect have gone by the wayside at the VDARA!”
Reviews.Author: Ramalamadingdong
Reviews.Content: 7 ladies from across Western Canada came together for a long anticipated Girls Weekend to celebrate some milestone birthdays. After much research, we decided on the Vdara because of its touted great service and amenities. It was a great disappointment. For starters, the pool area is inadequate, very small and disappoininting. Secondly, one group of women upgraded to the Vdara Suite in the hopes that we could host our own happy hours and get some visiting in. While the suite was acceptable in size and decor, we discovered late at night that in this particular room phones didn't work and the tvs didn't work. Without a working phone in the room that certainly does present a safety issue for its residents in case of medical emergencies, fire etc. Because of the late hour, we took our chances and opted to sleep on it and report the probem in the morning. Much to our dismay we dealt with the day time manager who was extremely condescending and not willing to listen to reason. Long story short, we ended up being assigned a new room in a different tower of the building, we moved our own bedding and belongings ourselves and we were very disappointed that no one was ever sent to help us move rooms. What kind of hotel lets ladies move their own belongings (after waiting over an hour for someone to show up)? It was not like this move was down the hall, it took over 10 minutes of schlepping our suitcases up and down elevators and down long hallways. We later stated our displeasure to the same manager and she, with her plastic face, told us we could have a resort credit of $75.00. That credit bought 3 ladies lunch at the Vdara. Finally, at checkout, we weren't asked how our stay was but we volunteered the information anyways. After retelling our story we were offered a discount on our next stay at the Vdara or their sister hotel - we responded "not on your life would we come here again." Cornerstone values of service and respect seems to have gone by the wayside at the Vdara. Save your money and try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Vegas Worthy”
Reviews.Author: archu01
Reviews.Content: Because the hotel is new, it's really nice. But there is not casino so it doesn't feel like a true Vegas hotel. The service was terrible!!! Room service NEVER had anything listed on their menu and they just assume substituting items without asking us was okay. (i.e. we ordered giner ale and they gave us sprite...as if it's the same thing). Staying at Vdara doesn't give a true Vegas experience. This hotel is excellent for people who are just there for business and no fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet & clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrMacGyver
Reviews.Content: After our last trip (Fort Lauderdale), this was much nicer. We stayed at a 5 star hotel on the beach in Ft Lauderdale and the rooms were small and did not even have a frig. The Vdara has a nice kitchenette (frig, microwave, stovetop, kitchen sink w/ disposal). The room overlooked the pool. They have power blackout shades, but light still gets in because it is 3 separate shades. The bathroom was roomy, had a soaking tub & shower. King size bed was comfortable. **NOTE: the other bed in the room is a sleeper sofa - which worked out ok for our son (10 yrs old), but I'm sure not anywhere near as comfortable as the bed. Luckily the room is decent sized so even with having the sofa bed out the whole time there was room to walk around, etc. There is a desk and a dinette table with 2 chairs. They did miss cleaning our room one of the days, we called and were credited the resort fee for that day. The next day they did a great job cleaning. It is a nice & quiet hotel -- they did a good job with the sound proofing. We were glad it is a nonsmoking hotel. Casinos, restaurants, etc. are all within easy walking distance. The pool was clean, staff was friendly, but the pool does close early (7pm). There is a small cafe in the lobby, but a lot of the food is premade (like the sandwiches - so if you don't like the sauce, you are out of luck because they don't have any other options). **My biggest complaint would be the strong perfume air freshener they have constantly pumping out in the lobby - it's enough to give you an instant headache. If the rooms and rest of the place had been like this, I could not have stayed there. There is also sometimes a long wait at the front desk - often only one or 2 persons working. Beware if you are in a hurry to check out/catch a plane, etc. The first night when we checked in, it took almost a half our for them to bring up our bags... if we had known, we would've just brought them up ourselves as we were waiting for them so we could change clothes and go out to dinner. Overall a good experience & would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Sin City”
Reviews.Author: meow7
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Vegas, but it definitely won't be my last! My sister and I went to Vegas for 5 days to celebrate my b-day, and decided on Vdara because it's a brand-new hotel. It's a non-gaming and non-smoking hotel that's located in the new city center. Vdara is just off the strip, but is next to the Bellagio, and has a connection to it, so most days we just walked through the Bellagio to get to the strip. The check-in & check-out process was fast and efficient. Just be warned that Vdara has a $20 resort fee per day that you must pay at the end of your trip. Unfortunately, we were not aware of this when we booked our trip, so it was a bit of a surprise. We requested a room on a high floor, which we were given. Our room was on the 43rd floor, and overlooked the Bellagio pools and fountain, we could also see Paris, and The Palms resort on the other side. The view was spectacular! The Bellagio fountains are a bit loud, and at night with the tv off you could hear them going off, but this wasn't an impediment for me to fall asleep. Perhaps if you need absolute quiet to fall asleep, you should request a room on the other side... The rooms were great, very clean, modern furniture, and a kitchenette. The beds and pillows were super soft and I always had a great nights sleep :) The hotel provides you with 2 free small bottles of water per day, but make sure you don't take the bottled water from the mini-bar because you will be charged for it. The free bottles are labeled with the hotel name and they're in a separate fridge. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel, so I can't comment on that. We checked out the pool, but it was small, and besides it was too cold to swim. Overall, I liked the hotel, and would definitely stay there again. I'm going back to Vegas in September for a friends wedding, but booked a different hotel because I like to try new places :)

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Peasan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of June 2011. Hotel was spotless. Rooms were great and we got upgraded to a Premium View giving us a view over the fountains at the Bellagio. Pool was very clean and there were plenty of sunbeds so no having to get there early. Location is ideal (centre strip) so most of the other big hotels are within easy walking distance. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, needs fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonTravel_001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days. The rooms, visually, was very inviting and modern. The pool area is very nice. The staff, equally nice. The sister, adjoining property Aria, was equally nice. The casino at Aria was particularly nice... We had a great rate for 3 days. But, there were problems. Perhaps first and foremost, there was an overwhelming sewage smell in the bathroom. I am not exagerating. Wow. Overwhelming a few times. It is likely a venting problem, but ti really does not matter, does it ? I mentioned it to the front desk staff, but do things like that ever get addressed ? Second, I was here on business. I would like to be able to report on the business center. But for some inane reason, it closes at 8. Really ? The holiday inn business center is open all night. Having said that, the staff did agree to print what I needed to print. But why ? These are little things. The hotel is really great. But would I stay here again ? Sewer smelling bathroom ? No business center ? Probably not. Oh, before I forget, the fitness center is adequate. 5 treadmills, 4 bikes, a small assortment of machines and free weights. I guess it is typical. Luckily, there were not many people there or there are not that many machines to go around.

Reviews.Title: “Always a first class hotel...in the middle of the strip yet secluded enough for some peace”
Reviews.Author: rxtraveler_branson
Reviews.Content: Love the location between the Aria & Cesars. The rooms are always clean & show nice upgrades. The kitchenette is a nice touch. They will bring silverware & dishes when requested however it would be nice if some were left on location even if they were plastic and disposable. Have always found the staff at the front desk to be responsive to any request. The pool is small. Maybe they should share with their bigger associate partners next door.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Beautiful Hotel, NO SMOKE!”
Reviews.Author: davidmad1
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms are beautiful and it smells great. It is smoke free, so definitely a plus This is our 2nd visit here and once again the hotel provided nothing short of world class room and service. All of the room appointments are top quality, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The were a few "cons" although minor. At the time that we visited (07/2011) the main restaurant was under renovation, which left a somewhat to be desired 'cafe'. Not quite what we are used to for 4 or 5 star hotels. Also, unlike many of the other huge resorts, there is no option of self-park, to occasionally avoid the valet tip.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RickInPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in pretty much every hotel on the Las Vegas Strip since I go there often to visit family. Vdara is a brand new hotel in MGM's City Center that, in my opinion, offers the best of everything. It's non-smoking. It has no casino, but there are multiple gambling options within a short walk. The rooms feel more like the modern apartment you wish you could afford than hotel rooms. And it's a welcome, peaceful retreat from the craziness of the Strip. Most important, rooms are extremely well-appointed, comfortable and modern. Views from high floors are incredible. Splurge for the Corner City Suite - for not much more money, you'll really treat yourself to some finer living. The room even has a front load washer and dryer! Add to that 2 flat screens, an incredible bathroom, a very comfortable bed, a full kitchen (yes, FULL SIZED appliances and dining room table), and windows galore. If that weren't enough, this hotel couldn't be more perfectly located. If you're driving, you can get to it without ever driving on the Las Vegas Strip (enter from Harmon Street to the West). A short walk across the quiet traffic circle is the Aria hotel for very upscale restaurants and plenty of high roller gambling. In the other direction, through a quiet hallway just off the Vdara lobby, you have direct access to the Bellagio hotel and all that it has to offer. Walk out the front of the hotel and down a quiet sidewalk, and you're in Cosmopolitan - the newest and hippest casino/hotel in Vegas. You can do all of this without getting close to the somewhat grimy, crowded Strip. This hotel can offer surprisingly good rates. I think some people don't want to stay there because it's not in the absolute middle of the action, and it lacks a casino. But ALL of that is so close by, it doesn't even matter. I love this hotel and have already booked my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprize”
Reviews.Author: Mondolulu
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had to go to LV for a conference for 5 days. So I was left alone most of the time while he went to seminars. We were upgraded to an executive corner room and we loved it because it felt like an apartment rather than a hotel room. The view was not much since the hotel is behind the Cosmopolitan and set back from the strip. But it had a full kitchen, small dining area, windows on two sides with electric solar shades, a huge bathroom, a small living room with flat panel TV, and a bedroom with flat panel TV. The hotel is more residential with no casino...but the Aria and Bellagio casinos are within short access. We love to gamble and it was no problem. There is a cafe, bar, pool, salon and spa. I used the salon and found a fabulous stylist there named Kelsey who cut and colored my hair. She was great and I'll use her again. Lots of people arrive at the Vdara with groceries to stock their kitchens and we will do the same next time. It was nice there because I usually get burned out on LV after a weekend but in this apartment, I could have stayed a lot longer. There was free internet access in our room...well, actually they charge the customary $20/day resort fee like all the other strip hotels do so it wasn't exactly free. The bed was heavenly and we slep like logs. Everything there is chic, new and clean. My only criticism was we ran into one very grouchy person working in the cafe one day.

Reviews.Title: “need to improve service”
Reviews.Author: Petre
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a flat. They have kitchens but...no appliances. You need to ask the concierge and then they wil bring you a pan, 2 plates and some other things. I needed to go shopping for have a decent pot, a toaster and several other kitchen appliances. The housekeeping has ups and dows. Some times, if you leave the room after noom they dont came. But, after all, this is Vegas, where you dont need to get up earlier. The room is nice, but they need serious improve in service and, of course, have better and more kitchen stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....but the resort fee sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Debb1
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel the resort fee sucks though. For over $20.00 day you get 2 small bottles of water.

Reviews.Title: “Quietly Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: lyanbourque
Reviews.Content: Compared to other 5 star hotels in Las Vegas, Vdara's lobby area was not very spectacular but the one thing that really jumps out is how quiet it is. Especially after walking through all the noise and bustle of the strip and casinos it was surprisingly relaxing. The room was very spacious with a kitchenette, TV area that was somewhat seperated from the bedroom. We were able to get a complimentary upgrade on our room to one that had a view of the Bellagio fountain so that was a nice perk. We found that Vdara's location was great, it is attached to the Bellagio via an outdoor bridge and just a quick stroll to Aria. Although there was no casino or really restaurants in the hotel it wasn't a far hike to get to those type of amneities. We found that the pool area was nice but because it is flanked by Aria, the area got really warm when the sun was out due to the reflection from all the glass surrounding it. We were there in April when it wasn't terribly hot, I can't even imagine what it would be like in the summer. Regardless we really enjoyed our stay and would have no issues staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time EVER”
Reviews.Author: jeanneann
Reviews.Content: We staryed at the Vdara from July 16-20 in a corner suite. The walls are windows from the bottom up and the view is fantastic. We actually saw planes that were on their way to land, and also the Bellagio fountains. The rooms were immaculate, and when you were in the spacious bathtub you could actually see out the windows while you were bathing. That was awesome late at night with all the lights of Las Vegas.There was a complete kitchen and a washer and dryer - need soap and fabric softener - just ask housekeeping, and they bring it up. We had a most excellent time and even tho there is not a casino, it was wonderful and quiet and the Aria which has a casino is right next door. On a scale of 1-10 I would give it a 10+

Reviews.Title: “5 stars in 2010 -- 4 stars in 2011”
Reviews.Author: cetatx79
Reviews.Content: I would give the Vdara 5 stars if I hadn't stayed here previously and expected more. We stayed at Vdara in Feb. 2010 shortly after they first opened. The rooms were pristine and the service was fabulous. We loved everything about our stay the first time. There were very few people in the hotel and we felt like it was private and somewhat exclusive. We stayed for the second time in July 2011. The hotel is still beautiful and wonderfully maintained. The beds weren't quite as comfy and the maids left something to be desired. Every day we would be missing one of the bathroom toiletries that should have been replaced. Overall, I would recommend the Vdara to friends and family. I personally will try a different hotel the next time we go to Vegas because I have stayed at Vdara the past two trips. I have been in the rooms at the Bellagio, Mandarin, and Aria. I would say the Vdara is much nicer than any of those – hands down. Pros: Vdara has convenient access to the Bellagio that we really enjoyed. The Aria, which is also very close, has the nicest of all the casinos in my opinion. We enjoyed the pool area at Vdara. If you are looking for a large pool with a party atmosphere – this is not the place. The Vdara pool area is smaller than others but nice and very relaxing. My very favorite thing about the Vdara is that if you stay on the side near the Bellagio fountains, you can watch them go off from your room all night. The view is wonderful and much better than you can expect from the top of the Eifel Tower at the Paris Casino. Cons: Service is not as great as when it was new. It is also more crowded than before but still better than most casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LeighMark
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Vegas yesterday and we stayed at the Vdara for 8 nights. We were in a Deluxe suite which is the lowest priced so we weren't expecting what we actually got. Our suite was absolutely stunning, huge bathroom, bed and 2 flat screen TVs, one in our living area and one for the bedroom. Our view was looking onto the Bellagio and down the strip. This was a hotel without a casino and it was also a non smoking complex which suited us both down to a tee. Cleaned every day with fresh towels. One of the best hotels we have stayed at and I would recommend to anyone to go here. Small pool but does the job! Awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like it”
Reviews.Author: Gbowren
Reviews.Content: By far the best choice I've ever made picking a hotel. Nothing compares to this. My husband had a business trip and I decided to go along. I don't smoke or gamble so there was no way I was staying where his classes were (Flamingo) I wish I could bottle up the smell of the Vdara and take it with me. I could live there the way the suite was laid out. The view was amazing. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Bec
Reviews.Content: The stay at the vdara marked the halfway point in my wife and my trip through the west coast, and this property was the standout of the trip. The suite was outstanding - plenty of room to move, kitchen was functional (but you have to contact housekeeping for crockery, cutlery and utensils)m and the living room very comfortable. Our suite was on the 53rd floor, so to get to the strip through the Bellagio took about 15 minutes, but it was worth it. Coming back to the hotel, you noticed a massive difference after coming from the smokey, smelly Bellagio, to the pleasent pot purri of the vdarra - NO SMOKING hotel. Loved that it was no smoking. The rooms didn't carry that rancid stale tobacco smell. The beds at the vdara have to be slept on to be believed. I haven't had as good a sleep anywhere in my life. It was like sleeping on a cloud. The only negative about the place was that one of our reading lights fell off it's mounting on the second day we were there, we contacted housekeeping to report the problem, but it was never fixed. Upon checking out, we mentioned this and were told that we should have contacted security. That's not our job to do, it's the properties. If this problem had have been sorted for us, it would have been a 5 star stay

Reviews.Title: “VEGAS AWAY FROM VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: sydney8888
Reviews.Content: This is our third time we stayed at the Vdara. The corner suite was perfect. The suite had all the amenities - full kitchen, large bathroom, washing machine, separate bedroom, living room, robes, slippers, coffee machine with k-cups, etc. I really like the Aveda products. The room was very clean and quiet. The staff was friendly, efficient and so nice. The room did not have any dishes and utensils, so I called and it came within 10 minutes. I liked that the Vdara does not have a casino. It was relaxing to be away from the noise, smoke, etc. However, the excitement was only two minute walk to the Bellagio, Aria, and Cosmopolitan. In addition, walking thru the City Center complex was like visiting another city.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Plush and No Smoking!!”
Reviews.Author: PhelpsRoad
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Vegas. They have nice rooms with views of either City Center or the Strip. We had a fantastic view of the Pool, City Center and the mountains in the distance. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms are modern and spacious. The whole hotel is non-smoking and there is no casino in the building, so you don't have to travel through crowds and plumes of smoke on your way to your room. For those that do want to gamble, there is a pathway to the Aria Hotel and Casino which is quite nice. The pool is great, but there aren't very many sun umbrellas on hot crowded days, so get there early.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: audaciousred
Reviews.Content: I was here in Feb for a day trip with my mom to see Cirque du Soleil at the Aria. The hotel is great! Huge rooms with nice amenities. The kitchenette and dining area were perfect for a longer stay. Sparse on the utensils though, so you'd have to order those up or bring some. The bathroom was huge - soaking tub, shower. And the divided living area was really comfortable and spacious for a run of the mill room. I think it would be a great place to throw a small party for 6 - perhaps an Oscar Party:-) Inside the hotel, the bar area dowstairs was inviting and the bar tenders were very friendly. Food options were a little minimal, but you're literally 1 minute away from Aria and maybe 5 from Bellagio. Easy walks. We viewed the pool area, small but nice. Since it was Feb, not crowded. But I'm sure the summer is a bit more cozy. Loved the Spa. Totally worth a day pass. Great service, friendly, relaxing. It's definitely on my standard Vegas list!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to spend a weekend in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lumiUsa
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel. We loved it first time (February 2011) and it was a no-brainier to make a decision about our stay now. This place is simply amazing especially when you look at the rates they offer. We liked the location, interior design and the fact that this is not a huge place - meaning that you don't have to walk for 5-10 minutes just to get to the guest elevators - you park your car with a valet (free) and get to your room in no time. In addition (as a non-smokers) we enjoyed the fact that this place is a smoke free environment. The pool is a little on a small side, but we didn't have a problem finding a spot there. The market cafe downstairs is also pretty good and useful since rooms have kitchens - perfect solution for in-room breakfast. We will definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JHawkNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the 2BR penthouses at the Vdara for a bachelor party weekend. It was a great hotel for what we wanted - non-smoking, big space, not as much $. Everyone from the free limo ride (included in the penthouse), front desk, pool attendants, etc. were very helpful and accommodating. And, the housecleaning did a spectacular job. All-in-all a great place to stay if you don't mind it not having a casino - but with a 5min walk to the Bellagio and Aria, really isn't much of an issue. Would definitely recommend and go back if I'm ever in Vegas again.... Only thing - they could provide something to dock an iPod to.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ShawnMcGraw
