Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing hotel! Very modernized and excellent service. Only downfalls were that there was always a line for the front desk and the valet parking. The hotel should really beef up there staffing in those areas!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: joetraveler34
Reviews.Content: I was very intrigued by reading the numerous reviews before starting my trip. First let me say that this is my 4th time in Vegas. We have always stayed at the MGM because of the pool area. This time I decided to make a switch to City Center. I was a little hesitant about staying in a hotel without a casino because the wild night life is why I go to Vegas in the first place. After a four night stay, I don't regret it one bit and didn't miss the MGM at all. The entire staff at the Vdara was outstanding. I arrived in Vegas at 11:30a.m. and went right to the hotel. I asked if it was possible for an early check in and it was! They checked me in right away and I was in my deluxe suite by 12p.m. A bellman brought up my luggage about 10 minutes later. I then asked him for a couple of kitchen place settings. They also arrived in minutes. The room was awesome. I had the entry level suite and it had a nice kitchen area, dining table, and a separate living room area and bedroom area. The bathroom was great, clean. The water pressure was fine and the soaking tub was incredible and filled quickly. The Market Vdara was a great place to get coffee and breakfast. I thought it was very reasonably priced. The service around the pool was excellent. Aria is about a 3 minute walk. Bellagio is about a 5 minute walk though a covered walk way...and if you don't mind walking on the road (illegally I might add like I did) you can walk from Vdara to the strip in about 5 minutes. This hotel was a great stay and I would definitely stay there again. Staying in City Center really gives you a different view of Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good 2nd stay”
Reviews.Author: GreatTraveltime
Reviews.Content: You can not beat this quality and strip location for under $100 per night (and that includes the resort fee). The kitchenette also provides the added convenience of preparing your own meal or quick breakfast. If you are going to use the sleeper sofa, let the front desk know, so you do not have to wait for sheets. Vdara was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite There Yet”
Reviews.Author: TheHolymans
Reviews.Content: I spend around a 80 nights a year in hotels, so I think I am a reasonable judge of what is value for money when it comes to hotels. On this occasion, the Vdara was not quite there yet. Yes it is a mecca of non-gambling and non-smoking (shouldn't they all be non-smoking?) which is a rare find in Las Vegas, but the service left a lot to be desired. Like other reviewers here, we booked the suite for three people (my wife and son along with me) and yet there was no bedding on the sofa bed and not sufficient towels in the bathroom. Also like other reviewers have found, there is no funnelling at check-in/check-out so we waited over 30 minutes to check-in and around the same to check-out. This was no fluke of timing as you could see similarly lengthy queues every day we were there. MGM, who own the propery, should know and do better. Having said that, there are lots of positives about the Vdara. As said, it is non-gambling and non-smoking and a great, central location just off The Strip, and is thus perfectly suited to families. It is an all-suite hotel, so the rooms are generous and you get a kitchenette (with no cutlery or crockery?) so you can bring food back to the room and re-heat/cook it, which is great for families trying to cut some costs. The beds are superb and it you can arrange it, you get great views from your room of the fountain show at the Bellagio next door. The pool and the pool area is adequate, although it was too warm given the weather in July and it was also quite dirty in the afternoons (but great in the morning). If they could just get the service right, I would ramp up the rating. Still, if you can get a decent deal on the rooms, then I would still recommend this for families.

Reviews.Title: “A great 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: luxorgoods
Reviews.Content: I give the Vdara one star because it calls itself a five star hotel. it is not. it would be a very nice four star by veags standards, ive stayed at the Wynn and the bellagio which are truly five star hotels, its the flawless service, highest quality towels and all the little things that make a five star hotel a five star hotel, ive had better bath towels at Marriott's inns, the facial tissue was like sam's club , either do the things that make a five star a five star or rate yourself correctly for the same price or a little more i wish i would have booked the Encore

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Redroses8991
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoy the Vdara but it is a little walk to the strip main fun area. This was our firt trip to Vegas and the Vdara was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: robinrock
Reviews.Content: Loved my recent stay at the Vdara. If you want a hotel that is away from all of the chaos of Las Vegas' other casino/hotels than this is the place to stay. Our room (52nd floor) was spacious and had an amazing view. Very comfortable bed. I found the service to be excllent. I liked that there was a representative of the hotel checking to see that everyone who used the elevator was actually a guest in the hotel. It made me feel safer. The room was lovely, despite the fact that the kitchen wasn't equipped with utensils. (who goes to Vegas to cook their own meals anyway?) Most of all I loved that the hotel was non smoking and had no casino. If you want to get to the casinos it's just a very short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is new, quite, and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ypwalter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the newest hotels as for 2010/2011. It doesn't have casino down there. So it is really quite, and the smell is good there. Even if you want to go to casino, you can go to the next door Aria or all other casinos just 1~few blocks. It's clean, quite, and new in design. Really good when my gf stayed with me there. She is totally satisfied about the hotel. I got it by price line for 80USD with tax included. It worth it! Even with this low price, the staff asked if I want high floor or low floor. There are two minor drawbacks for me. One is no free parking, but you can park in next door Aria. The other is no breakfast, but most of the hotel in Vegas won't offer free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful, relaxing and an amazing view!!!”
Reviews.Author: peachblacktea
Reviews.Content: Vdara was very relaxing and calm .. I purposely booked this casino free hotel to avoid all the smoke, people and rush to get some relaxing atmosphere. The view from our room was AMAZZZZZZZING.... We initially paid extra $100+ when we reserved with our travel agent for a room with "view" .. Then we opt out of it just getting the most basic room figuring we'd just upgrade when we get there. I am glad we didn't pay the extra money because when we got there (just when check-in starts) the front desk gave us a room on the 40th floor facing the fountain just as we wanted. The concierge was worth mentioning giving us very helpful suggestions. If you are into clubbing, they put us on the guest list which allowed us to skip the line all together and also gave us free tickets to the club at Aria and Bellagio. We did encounter problem with housekeeping during the second day of our 4 night stay. You really have to chase after the management team to get some response but then their offer to waive the resort fee for us did compensate for the inconvinience. Good note is to go visit the pool early in the morning right when it opens, about half or an hr after the pool opens it then becomes very busy. Their pricing for their beds and cabanas are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable service on many levels. NOT 5-star quality.”
Reviews.Author: LolaWantsandGets
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas and a weekend stay at the Vdara. We had 2 rooms. First the positives: - Check-in agent (Jordan) was very nice, helpful and accommodating - Had a great poolside massage from lovely massage therapist Ivy - The room (31st floor) was spacious, seemed clean. Had a nice dining area, large bathroom with tub and shower. - We booked the "Summer Package" which initially was a great deal (2 nights in a deluxe suite, view upgrade, daybed rental at the pool, $50 food/beverage credit at pool, amenities basket from pool, 2-for-1 drinks at the bar) - Bellman James was quick, helpful, extremely careful with our bags, pleasant, sweet. - The hotel is non-smoking and there's no gaming (casino) which is great if you don't smoke or gamble, which we do not. - Room service (for a very basic breakfast) was fast and the server was very nice. - The hotel is an eco-hotel, which we appreciated. Now for the negatives. There are so many, it's hard to know where to start. - Our rooms never got cleaned, even though we had the service light on when we left for the day. Also, when we arrived, there was trash and old room service trays in the hallway outside our doors. - We were really looking forward to relaxing poolside for this weekend getaway. However, the way the pool is run is a joke, and service there was terrible. Even after speaking with a manager, it didn't get any better. Resort pool operation is not rocket science, and we have visited many 5-star resort hotel pools that are run like well-oiled machines. Vdara's pool was the opposite: non-functioning computers (so the main attendant had to do everything by hand; then she had no idea about the package specials we were supposed to get), wait staff who didn't attend to their sections correctly, so service was spotty or non-existent at the daybeds we rented; when we did get poolside service, the waitresses just didn't care and were slow; the selection of food and beverages on the menu was limited but I never got to order any of it anyway because in the 3 hours we were there the server showed up twice. We never got the daybed amenities that we were supposed to get as part of the Summer Specials package. We had daybed reservations for 2 days and didn't bother coming back the 2nd day because we just didn't want to have a bad and upsetting experience all over again. - There is a serious lack of dining options in the Vdara, and the options aren't great. There is one low-brow restaurant, room service, and bar food at the bar and pool. - Because we got fed up at the pool and couldn't get food, we decided to go downstairs to the Market restaurant and have lunch. BIG mistake. The cashiers and "servers" there were slow, apathetic and clueless -- all qualities you do not want in people handling your food. I ordered a turkey burger and the cashier asked, "how do you want that cooked?" Seriously?? How about I'd like my poultry *cooked*? So of course it came out over-done, dry and tasteless, and didn't have the things I asked for on it. Other things that are Restaurant 101 but they couldn't figure out: tables were dirty and took a long time to be cleared. Then when they cleared them, I still had to wipe them down because they didn't do it properly; servers didn't bring out enough utensils and took over 10 minutes after food was served to bring out more... In the end I got utensils from a manager who was apologetic and blamed the poor service on the fact that the kitchen was making food for the entire hotel. - When we checked out and the receptionist asked us how our stay was, we were honest and told her about all of these shortcomings. She did not seem surprised. Although she was apologetic, the most she could do was remove the daily resort fees from our charges. That's a whopping $20/day. "But I can't refund the tips though" was her caveat. We never asked her to refund the tips we paid. We asked her if the hotel was busy with a convention or had some other huge spike in bookings, which would *maybe* explain the bad and strange lack of service for a 5-star resort hotel. Nope, it wasn't busier than any other summer weekend in Vegas. Were they perhaps understaffed? Nope, they had plenty of staff, she said. So basically there was no excuse for their poor service, from her point of view. We think that there is perhaps a major lack of training for the Vdara staff, because seriously, this is not how service at a 2-year-old 5-star resort should be. And they are probably a bit understaffed as well. There are PLENTY of other fine accommodation and resort choices in Las Vegas, and it's just not worth it to stay at the Vdara. Stay at the Cosmopolitan instead -- they are only a few months old but are way better run and they actually have enough properly trained staff who care about high-quality service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but lacking services”
Reviews.Author: MSPtravelerguy
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a very nice non-smoking, non-gambling oasis in Las Vegas. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Check-in line not funneled - waited nearly 30 minutes for clerk. TV wasn't working - took 2 calls and over 8 hours to get it fixed. Reservation for 3 but no bedding for sleeper sofa or towels for 3rd person. Good appliances in kitchenette but no crockery, cutlery, etc. - had to call twice to get basics which were not replaced or cleaned with daily room service. Additional $20 per person 'resort fee' rip-off when you check-in. $14 for a drink in plastic cup at the pool. King bed isn't - it's smaller than a regular king size. Long walk to the strip - be prepared to use taxis at $12-15 a pop for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: SohanTanna
Reviews.Content: Hotel was bright and very clean. Rooms are a good size, with a unique layout and a lot of light. Had minibar (not much variety) and a fridge as well as a mini kitchen. Shower was a bit weak, but overall the rooms are amazing. Room service was brilliant, on time and with good food. Maids did a wonderful job daily, and front desk left us extra waters upon request!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: onlythemostawesome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara one night out of the two nights in Vegas, the other night being at the Venetian. Such a refreshing change from the hustle bustle and the dark casinos of Vegas. Vdara does not have a casino and so does not have a lot of people walking in and out of the hotel. The decor is contemporary and the hotel's squeaky clean. When we checked in we were a little disappointed because it seemed quite far from the Strip but there is a connecting corridor to the Bellagio which is a comfortable five-minute walk between Bellagio's lobbies, cafes and shops. Vdara has a very boutique-hotel feel to it, and it's nice. The rooms are nice and spacious with a little sitting area and a small kitchenette. It has a microwave (which is usually not provided in the basic room), mini-bar, ironing board etc and a dining table for 4. The bathrooms are very clean with good amenities. The concierge was very helpful. The lady helped us with booking tickets for the Cirque du Soleil shows on a very busy Friday evening. The check-out is a little painful because it's a busy hotel and the waiting time can be about 20 minutes. We mentioned this to the lady checking us out and she promptly waived our $20 resort fee (all Vegas hotels charge this)! An absolutely delightful stay, and great if you're not a casino buff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - no smoke, no casino - cab to anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Craiginsydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here in June for a week. We had a city corner suite which was great. Overall we loved not having a casino on site, loved the no smoke atmosphere and had great mountain view from our room. Small downsides were the block out blinds don't really block the light, especially the corners in the bedroom and the valet /porter service is a bit 'luck of the draw' at times. The pool area is nothing special - if you want a great hotel where you can live by a luxurious pool - this isn't the place. Overall though we loved staying here, we made use of the spa, found the ground floor cafe great and and loved staying 'off the strip' although through to Bellagio is a matter of minutes and easy anyway. We had read some average reviews after we had booked, but our personal experience was way better than expected - we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “An island of calm in a turbulent sea.”
Reviews.Author: draggindave
Reviews.Content: We won a stay at Vdara on priceline, then afterwards checked the online reviews. I saw some people were disappointed though our experience was very positive. From the reviews we learned we should valet-park the car and not self park, and that was good advice for Vegas in general, not only this hotel. The room was super, very high standard, spotlessly clean and very well equipped. It was definitely the best hotel we ever stayed in from the perspective of room quality and facilities. I was a little surprised that the coffee bar closed at 9pm (?) because after going to a show it would have been nice to sit and unwind with coffee and a snack, I guess they'll get around to fixing that eventually. What most stood out was the calm, the classiness and the absence of cigarette smoke. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for 30's to 40's crowd”
Reviews.Author: gmansmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May for our anniversary. Very nice big suites. Pool was small- we splurged one day and reserved a daybed which was worth it, though they could use a little more pool wait staff. Food at poolside was amazing. Location was a little bit of a pain but once you figure out how to navigate through the other nearby buildings it's easier to get out to the strip. Crowd was laid back which was nice. Overall had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem of the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: magyarnyul
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights last week. Arrived via airport shuttle (wasn't going to worry about cabs and taking wrong way there!). We were very early (1100am) to check in/put baggage with the bell men. I am so glad i am one that prints every kind of confirmation out!! The clerk looks at my name and confirmation number and said "oh, we have that you no-show'd your reservation last month." Confused, i told her why would i book a package (through bookit) that would have a different hotel time than my flight. She took my confirmation page and said she'd be right back; had to check with a manager. Meanwhile, i'm internally freaking out!! I had heard the next woman over say they were fully booked.... About 20 minutes later, the girl comes back, Aylin i think her name was, said okay you can't check in yet, but we have your room. I asked her if i were getting double charged for this, and she gave me the "are you kidding me?" look. Heck, it was their mistake not mine that i was listed as not showing up. I asked her if we would be getting any kind of compensation for the hassle. Same look: "why? we have a room for you?" I was two seconds away from giving her my shirt to go get dry cleaned as i sweated it away! You travel all this way for hours to find out that you might not have a room??!?! I would have offered to at least take off the resort fee (to which we used none of it). So we put our stuff in bell man, returned at 300pm (she didn't offer to take our number down for a call if the room was ready early, nor did she take off the resort fee for our troubles). The room was very nice. 41st floor...back view. Saw the back of Mandalay/Monte Carlo/Luxor etc... Looking down you saw the pool. Kitty-corner to the left was a view of the airport and tropicana. Straight ahead was the Aria. I was content with it as i knew i wasn't staying in my room the whole trip. Only minor complaints about the room: there are no hooks to hang up wet towels. We had to use the edge of the bathtub. The waste basket was beside the toilet and not under the sink area. Took us a bit to find that one. The shower door needs a rubber stopper cuz when you let go of it, it slams hard!! We thought we were going to break it! The room beside us was smoking and we could smell it through to our unit. The hallway on our first night there was really messy. Lots of dishes, paper bits and the air purifier. Positive notes: beds and linens were awesome!! What a comfy sleep! The hotel being non smoking had a true resort feel, i commented multiple times to hubby that i felt like i was in mexico again with everything smelling so fresh. The walk to the bellagio literally took 2 minutes from the hotel lobby. The tram that takes you to Aria/City Center or to Monte Carlo was handy especially if you were in heels for dinner! We were in bellagio so many times we felt like we were staying in there but without paying bellagio prices. I would stay at the vdara again. I would step out of line at check in if i got the same girl though...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Paradise in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mikenchris
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here July 19-22 in room 26002 corner suite...All I can tell you is if you are looking for a beautiful clean hotel , that is a quiet place but only 5 minute walk to the glitz and craziness of the Las Vegas strip then this is the place..I've read many of the reviews here and I'm not sure why there are any complaints.. 1- Valet Service- Always smiled and greeted us when dropping car off and when we needed to get the car we never waited more than 5 minutes, always opened the door for my wife and asked if we needed directions..Very Courteous!! 2- Front Desk- We got there around 12 and asked for early check in..Zach at front desk got us a room even got us an upgrade corner executive suite with a view of the Bellagio Fountains for a reasonable upsell and even made sure utensils and laundry detergent ( yes this place even has washer\dryers in some rooms) were sent up to our room. 3- We had one small maintenace problem and one phone call to the front desk was all it took and problem solved. 4- Pool was smaller than many of the bigger Vegas hotels, but it was more than adequate and not overly crowded.. All I can say is enjoy the craziness and nightlife of Vegas but come home to a beautiful ,modern and clean condo style hotel..You won't be sorry..

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: usatips
Reviews.Content: I tend to look at things with a "big picture" viewpoint and I could not have been happier. Sure, there were little things here and there, but overall, what a great hotel! I stayed in a panoramic suite and was very pleased. The hotel was quiet, smoke-free and felt luxurious. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative for Conference at Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: venustar82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara while attending a conference at the neighboring Bellagio. I originally chose the hotel because the Bellagio was fully booked, but in the end, was very happy with the decision. It is a 100% non-smoking property with no casino, making it quick and easy to get to the rooms (and in fact it was quicker for me to arrive at the conference than for guests staying in far towers of the Bellagio). The rooms themselves are modern and comfortable with a great bathroom. My biggest complaint is the massive queue for checking in and out, but unfortunately this seems to be the norm throughout Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Five Star, But Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy0054
Reviews.Content: If the Bellagio and The Wynn are five star, then I this is not. Based on Hot Wire it is. However it is clean, the rooms are spacious and comfortable but feel a little stark. Overall, it's very industrial, especially if you look out the windows. If you can get a good deal it's worth it. The pool kind of sucks. I would stay at the Bellagio over this any time. The staff is nice. Bonus, it is a no smoking and casino hotel, so it's nice to get away from that. It's easy to cut through the Bellagio and connect to Vdara, Aria etc.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended but No Smoking and No Casino”
Reviews.Author: loun80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was originally intended to be a condo building so all the rooms are fairly large with a kitchen or kitchenette. No complaints about the room. We stayed in a junior suite. Comfortable bed, nice views, large bathroom with large tub and separate shower. All very clean It is located in City Center and is conveniently connected to the Bellagio. It is a smoke free building so you don't get hit with the cigarette smell when you arrive at the lobby. Also, there is no casino for the travelers who want more of a quiet hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A must for the Bucket List.”
Reviews.Author: zaneen
Reviews.Content: We took our Goddaughters to Las Vegas. We were recommended this Hotel and found it excellent. No slot machines no shopping mall, a true hotel. Our rooms were suites 0n the 32nd & 36th floors, NO NOISE. All the services were what we have come to expect of The United States. Access to the main areas of Las Vegas were easy either by underground walkways to the Belagio or free overhead railways.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara a hidden gem from the strip”
Reviews.Author: yonsei93
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews from TA we decided to go with the Vdara. The moment we arrived on-site the bell, valet were quick and did not make us wait. Check in was a breeze. Got the Deluxe Suite and asked for dishes, silverware and coffee maker, bathrobe and slippers. Its a big place and the service was awesome. The walk to Aria was short and to the point. Less than 5 minutes. Bellagio is quick to with an awning. The Monorail was up the stairs. From the Lobby to the Strip was about 10 minutes through Bellagio. Going to Cosmopolitan we had to walk outside and down the steps. We partied hard on the strip but came back to an oasis with no smoking, and loud casinos. Coming back here again. Tip: when you check out don't do it at 11am but do it instead in the morning around 8am. Ask to be facing the Bellagio in the middle and not in the back. 32420-32438 should do.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dianearmstrong
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vdara for two nights in July 2011. Arrived late evening; pulled up at door and complimentary valet swung into immediate action - a huge bonus in las vegas where parking is impossible. When you wanted car you just rang done when leaving the room and it was waiting at the front door when you got down. The hotel is new and clean and modern and very impressive inside. It also looks fabulous from the outside. A concave mirrored monster! It is light and bright and airy and contemporary with the sound of moving water in the background, There is a lovely little outdoor sitting area to the front of the hotel, with lots of interesting chairs including ones hanging from the ceilings like beds - the kids' favourites. Our room was on the 29th floor. Fastest lift i have ever been in! Security checked you had a key before entering the lift. The room was spacious with automatic drapes and blackouts and a fabulous view which was everchanging. There was a small separate kitchen area with basic crockery. Additional items could be requested from reception. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The bathroom was also huge with an enormous shower and bath. Ideal. The hotel was connected to the Bellagio, the Aria and the Monte Carlo by free monorail. It was a bit of a convuluted trek out onto 'The Strip' which is busy all the time! Apart from a small cafe there was no restaurant in the hotel, that i saw! Also no casino. Pool area was lovely and never really got over busy; fancy beds and cabanas were available to rent daily for not a lot of extra money. Waitresses sashyed by all day taking orders. We had lunch by the pool and it really was excellent. All in all a great stay. I wouldn't stay again just because i would want to try somewhere different the next time. Well done Vdara!

Reviews.Title: “180 Degree View.. amazing”
Reviews.Author: SimplyGirlie
Reviews.Content: We booked the standard room but decided for an extra 50 dollars to get the suit. Amazing.. private kitchen, has laundry facilities, lounge area, private bathroom and huge bedroom. Bed was super comfy, staff were extremely like and helpful, very nw hotel. Connects to the Bellagio which is a bonus for those who like to gamble as Hotel does not have casino.If you want to be centrally located but also away from the noise Vdara is the way

Reviews.Title: “luxurious hotel suites at the centre of las vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: johnfromwollongong
Reviews.Content: new hotel suites. we had a panoramic view rooom- so we could see the ballagio fountains (not the same without music). Connects to bellagio, aria . does not have a casino so it was much quieter but within walking distance to both these casinos if one wanted to. the rooms were immaculate -it would be great for a romantic weekend, though we were there with our family. the only downside is the pool, which gets crowded and has limited opening hours

Reviews.Title: “First Time to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jamie R
Reviews.Content: My "new" husband and I went to Vegas for our honeymoon and we stayed at the Vdara for 5 nights. We loved the open space and the comfort the hotel offered! It felt like we were staying in an upscale apartment, not a hotel. The staff was excellent too! We liked the kitchen and used it to cook breakfast before heading out for the day. The only thing we didn't like was the valet. You have to give your car to a valet every time you leave and come back to the hotel. The tipping got a little expensive. I understand why it was done and I admit, at first I loved it, but towards the end of the trip it was annoying remembering the valet slip and then waiting for our car. We even called ahead once, but the car wasn't ready yet. That was the only problem we had with the hotel. This should not stop you from staying here, we loved this hotel! For the amount we spent (around $150 a night) it was an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Vdara Hotel and will be back.”
Reviews.Author: mikegulfwar1vet
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed at the Vdara from July 11 to July 15. We got in around 1 in the morning. First impression was that they were very friendly for that time of the morning. We stayed in a corner suite. It was fabulas. The view was spectacular overlooking the Belligio fountains and the Strip. My wife who is very particular when it comes to hotel room loved the room. She especially liked the full fridge and a washer and dryer. The next day we went down to see Las Vegas and I was pleasantly surprised as to how friendly everybody was at the Vdara from the cleaning personal to the concierge. I was really impressed with this hotel. When we go to Vegas again, I will definitely stay at the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “New and quiet modern hotel with small kitchens and large deep tubs!”
Reviews.Author: rawills5339
Reviews.Content: It is a unique hotel for the Las Vegas strip in that it has a quiet lobby to return to (no casino) after your adventures in the surrounding strip casinos. It also is very easy to get to and has valet parking for no charge. The staff is superb and will go out of their way to make sure that your stay is excellent. Although there is a learning curve in figuring out what is really available to you. The City Center Tram station (free) is very close by at the Bellagio, this will take you to the Crystals shopping center, Aria casino area and the Mone Carlo casino if you need to go south. The pool area is adequate, in a south facing, hot location, but has lot's of shade umbrellas to use for free, bar and food service. I would deffinately stay there again. I would deffinately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "5 star" on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Mahonosferatu
Reviews.Content: We were so underwhelmed by the Vdara. We stayed here for three days and we were disappointed with all of them. They give you condo type rooms but don't stock them with anything but two water glasses and two towels. They say you can call housekeeping and request anything you need but why not just have them in the room? I could understand if it was a three star hotel trying to save money but this is supposed to be a five star resort. The room was nice looking and trendy but it was entirely surface. They give you two flat screens (mediocre Philips brand) which isn't really necessary but don't have a robe or coffee maker. You can request the robes but housekeeping is rude and will decided not to give them to you if they don't feel like it. We called twice to get a robe and some wash cloths and it took them over a day to get it to us. We didn't call them the night before we called them at 1 in the afternoon and then again at 10 am the next morning. We called the front desk and they claimed that we told housekeeping that we didn't want to be disturbed even though we had the housekeeping light on, and yes we double checked that it was the housekeeping button and not the do not disturb button. Overall there are so many hotels in Vegas that are nicer and care about their guests more that no one should waste their money here.

Reviews.Title: “You can't base 5 stars on the just the room...”
Reviews.Author: Plaidbunny
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice but you can't base 5 stars on the room set-up. Our room layout was really nice and spacious BUT we had to keep the shades drawn most of the time because the room next to ours could see directly into our room. From our bed into our BATHROOM! If we could have just closed that one shade then we could have still watched the Bellagio water shows, but having a guy stare into your room the whole time was a little uncomfortable so we had to keep them closed. The cleaning staff is VERY slow or they just don't care - our decorative blanket was in the hallway outside our door when we checked in. We realized after we went to the pool and came back that the blanket must belong to us but we didn't want a dirty blanket on the bed, so we called housekeeping to pick it up. 4 hours later it was still there. We gave up and just kept it in the corner of our room the whole time. There was the same bottlecap in our hallway for over 24 hours. We had the housekeeping call button pressed on our room, were gone for 5 hours, came back and our room hadn't been touched. The service at the pool was slow and unprofessional. Our "organic" chicken fingers were undercooked and she forgot our drink order twice. Plus the reflection from the building onto the pool area makes it impossible to walk on the blazing hot cement and will make you sunburn even faster. The valet guys were the best part. They were quick, nice, professional, and gracious. Plus valet parking was free so we ended up tipping at least $3 every time we got in or out of our car. The location of the hotel is pretty central so we didn't really need our car that often. The bed was crazy comfortable! The sheets were high quality and the mattress was the perfect combination of firm and plush. The towels were also very nice, shower was great pressure, toiletries were high quality. The bathtub was nice but can really only hold one person. Front desk was ALWAYS swamped so we couldn't even check out without wasting 40 minutes waiting for our bill. 5 Stars means they put your bill under the door the night before you check out... Also, the bellman used the same elevators as the guests which is another ding against 5 stars. And there was no restaurant open when we were looking but room service is 24 hours. Overall, nice visit. We would stay here again for the discounted rate we got but nothing higher. The pool was too disappointing and we would rather be able to swim and enjoy the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay full price!”
Reviews.Author: DBatten121
Reviews.Content: We went on an excellent deal on a corner suite. These suites are very large, huge fridge freezer, with built in chilled water dispenser, so no problem with water! Check in was a little slow. We requested a high room with a mountain view and had to wait 3 hours for it to be ready, we turned up at 3pm and didn't get into our room until 6.30pm. Not so good after a very long flight! We are used to staying in a casino hotel. Being smoke free was a nice touch, but think about if you want the atmosphere of a casino on your doorstep or not. We actually found we missed the buzz. The cafe is overpriced, but the bar is relaxing. We went to a Tweetup in the bar and found ourselves in a free wine tasting. Definitely follow the hotel on twitter and Facebook in the weeks leading up to your vacation. We will definitely return to Vegas, but would rather send the money in Encore for true 5 star luxury, not this 4 star in need of a little TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: wrensaver
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights on the 49th floor with a view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip. The bed was one of the more comfortable beds in a hotel I have stayed at. The usual first-night stiffness in my back was not there at Vdara. The front desk and concierge were both very helpful and answered all of our requests. Housekeeping was thorough and quick. Our room had a kitchen and fridge and dining table, a divider separating the couch/tv area from the bedroom area, and a large bathroom with a huge tub and shower. Some reviewers have complained that this hotel is out of the way. Frankly, that's precisely why we liked it. There is a covered walkway to the Bellagio and a short circular walkway to Aria and then to City Center shopping. We could gamble and shop all we wanted, and be in mental overload from all the lights and the people, and walk back into Vdara and revel in the quiet elegance of this non-gaming, NON SMOKING hotel. I think we ate three or four meals at the Cafe Vdara downstairs, which had a nice selection of food at lower-than-vegas pricing. I also utilized the spa for a haricut and mani-pedi. The haircut and style by Lisa was fantastic - probably the best I've had in a long time. The mani-pedi was a bit overpriced and did not last as long as my local strip-mall nail place. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinky1966
Reviews.Content: brilliant hotel. great view from room. five minute walk to strip. Lovely pool. very stylish and modern.

Reviews.Title: “We had such a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: MaxineInVA
Reviews.Content: We loved the Vdara. The entire hotel is non-gaming and non-smoking but that is not a problem – the Aria is across the way and the Bellagio is connected to the property. This gives you the best of everything – a nice oasis to retreat to with all of the fun and crowds of Vegas at close hand. I cannot believe this hotel is owned by the same group that owns the MGM Grand – what a night and day difference! The MGM is loud and crowded; the Vdara is intimate (for a high rise) and peaceful. The staff at the MGM is rude; the staff at the Vdara anticipated our every need. The rooms at the MGM are run-down and/or smelly depending on the room; the Vdara was clean and luxurious. We almost did not stay here because we were worried about a repeat of our MGM experience and are so glad we tried it – we will be back! The rooms were huge, clean, and full of sunlight during the day and covered by automatic black-out shades at night. Our room overlooked the fountains at the Bellagio but we never really got a chance to enjoy the show. The pool is not your typical Vegas party pool but rather a place to relax and re-charge for the evening ahead. They have responsive waitstaff ready to bring your libation of choice and they also offer poolside dining. Room service was responsive, the coffee shop in the lobby makes a decent latte or afternoon snack, and the spa is one you definitely want to check out. Be sure to show up an hour before your appointment to enjoy the whirlpool, eucalyptus steam bath, and out of this world relaxation chambers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: Frequent Vegas visitor. Have stayed just about everywhere. Spent 3 nights at Vdara. All around very solid. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return. The rooms are very comfortable and hard to fault. The most significant downsides are that the resort is a bit remote, you have to walk through Aria or Bellagio to get just about anywhere, which is less than convenient if you are a walker. Also, the pool is nowhere near as nice as the Aria - unfortunately the Aria will not let you access their pool as a Vdara guest. Here's the summary: Positives: Spacious, modern suites. Competent staff Competitive rates Efficient valet Good room service Negatives: A bit remote from other resorts (have to walk through Bellagio or Aria to get anywhere) "Blackout shades" let a lot of light in the room No ipod docking station Nice but quiet pool $20 resort fee

Reviews.Title: “I love this place. And will return whenever I'm in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Mizzdang
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a non-smoking hotel with all the comforts of home. They are centrally located in City Center next to Aria. They don't have a casino but Aria is right next door so everything is within walking distance. I haven't been there in over a year but I hope they still have supreme service. I love everything about this place with only one exception. The pool area is rather small and I heard that it gets really hot there because of the reflection of the building. Besides that, everything else was five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Littlelobo
Reviews.Content: Recently celebrated our honeymoon at the Vdara, July 10-12, 2011. Got a great rate during this time and stayed in a City Corner Suite. The suite was very big and roomy and the sleek european design was a nice touch in the suite. Check in was a breeze, housekeeping was fantastic, and everyone there was very polite and accommodating. The great advantage to staying here is the access available using the Tram that takes you from the Montel Carlo, through City Center, all the way over to Bellagio, it was a lifesaver and so convenient. We will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and wonderful treatment.”
Reviews.Author: LuckyMB1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 3rd of July to the 10th of July in a City Corner Suite overlooking the Bellagio fountains and one of the Cosmo pools. Everything was top notch during our stay from a 4 minute check in, to nightly turndown service in which they brought us fresh ice and water on the nightstands. Housekeeping was present everyday and only seen once. Room was spacious with 2 42inch flatscreens that we never watched save for the nightly slideshow put on the turndown service. it was nice to come back to the room to soothing music and pictures from the strip or surrounding scenes, and hit that bed....oh the bed is sooooo comfortable, we didn't want to leave. We used the pool area only twice, but both times we found loungers easily and we not harmed by the infamous death ray. We saw plenty of drink service and the second day they came around with free samples of their pink lemonage and magarita slushies. There was security at the elevators at all times of days waiting to ensure everyone who went up had a room key, very comforting. We never utilitzed the small cafe in the lobby, instead we headed over to Cosmo, down the step and into the parking garage, to hit the Wicked Spoon buffet to get our day started. It is also a very short walk to Aria or through to the Bellagio. Valet service was quick and efficient, we never waited more than 5 minutes for our car. Overall, Vdara exceeded our expectations on every level, and we will definately return for another stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic relaxing stay at Vdara”
Reviews.Author: jasmyne
Reviews.Content: The hubs and I just came back from a relaxing and enjoyable stay at Vdara. We booked our rooms through priceline.com and got an excellent deal ($125/night inclusive of taxes). Upon arrival, check in was quick and they were able to put us in a room at 10:00am. This was fantastic as it gave us the opportunity to go straight to the pool. The pool was just the right size with umbrellas and plenty of lounge chairs. It was 105 degrees that weekend so taking a dip in the pool was a welcome treat. There's also a jacuzzi on the side. The rooms are mini suites with modern and elegant decor. Walking in the room is a little dining table followed by a seating area with a tv and flat screen tv. On the other side is another flat screen right in front of the bed. The bathroom had a separate shower and a deep tub-perfect for taking a bath (which was great). Vdara is connected to bellagio through an outdoor walkway (about a 3 minute walk) and also has a freem tram that takes you to Monte Carlo/City Center. The tram is convenient arriving every 3 minutes or so. We really enjoyed the fact that it was a non gaming non smoking casino. After gambling all day it was fun to come back to a retreat that was nice and quiet. They do charge a $20 resort fee (internet, gym use is included in this fee)/per day Overall, I really enjoyed our trip here. The only minor thing was that they don't have shower caps and when I called housekeeping for one it took over 1/2 an hour to get it to our room. But that is a very minor issue for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosiegay
Reviews.Content: Wow - couldn't have asked for more - room size unbelievable - new hotel , wonderful decor, spotlessly clean, no smoking throughout (bonus), no casino (bonus), fantastic staff, very central. We have travelled extensively for many years and found this to be one of the very best places to stay - highly recommended. Well done Vdara!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: shawnmontreal
Reviews.Content: We had never traveled to Vegas before and had originally booked at the Mirage Hotel. I then looked on Hotwire for a 5-Star, and got a great booking at the Vdara. I was initially concerned as the location was not directly on the Strip, however I was quite pleased that it did not actually have a Casino on the premises as I hoped the focus of the hotel would be more on being "a hotel" as their primary offering. I was so right! The location is amazing, close to everything but just removed sufficiently not to be amidst the hustle and bustle. It is a few steps away from the Aria Hotel and Casino as well as the Bellagio. What a bonus that was! Upon our arrival, I was inconvienced by the signatuer scent they pipe through the ventilation systems but the staff quickly stepped up to take care of the problem. Austin was on duty that night and although he seemed a little young to be holding such a vast responsibility, he got AJ to show us a beautiful suite in order to assess whether I would continue to be inconvenienced by the smell. The rooms were great and there was not the same issue with the ventilation system in the rooms. Once we gave our OK, Sean quickly brought up our bags to the room and made sure that we got settled in nicely. Everything went up hill from there! The level of service was consistent and flawless. We were greeted all day long as we exited elevators and security requested a show of room key prior to admitting anyone into the elevator area. I found this to be a nice touch in order to make guests feel safe. The gym is well equipped and the pool fabulous! There is a great lounge pool side with a fantastic and reasonably priced menu. Erin was prompt and great at making suggestions off the menu. The person in charge of the business centre was beyond helpful and provided guidance and support as required. The concierges were always helpful and eager to assist with any request. I have to give a special mention to the beds and bedding. I have not had a good night's sleep since my return, I have been thouroughly spoilt now! All in all, this hotel made our first experience in Vegas perfect and memorable. Thanks Vdara for making us feel special!

Reviews.Title: “dont think i would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: usatrip2011june
Reviews.Content: rooms were nice...view...hmmm...compare to cosmopolitan...bellow average, no balconies. room stunk. thank god we stayed just one night...i think they clean rooms with vinegar. horrible. hotel has no casino...why would u go to vegas without casino and night life. wouldnt you rather go to ...paris? anyway...not recomended at all

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and New....will return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wolfwatcher2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here June 11th and thought it was very nice. It was spacious and clean. We are both non-smokers, so it was nice to find a place in Vegas that was strictly non-smoking. The bed slept great and the AC worked great with the heat of Las Vegas. If you want to gamble, you will have to visit another hotel. It's only a short walk on a walkway to the Bellagio or to the Aria. We don't gamble so it was fine with us not to have to walk into a lobby of stale smoky carpet and walls. I believe this aspect will help the hotel keep a lasting great appearence and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: booger6174
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights, July 4th-8th. We stay at a different hotel every trip (our 6th trip) and we booked the vdara about 4 months ago. Like always after we booked i went to trip advisor to read the reviews and as usual the bad reviews got me worried. I guess it comes down to what you expect in a hotel. Most of the complaints were about bad service, no utensils, too far away from the strip,etc... Please ignore all the bad reviews. When we first arrived it took approx 10 minutes to check in. We asked if we could have a view of the Bellagio fountains and they gave us a room on the 41st floor, with a view of Rio, Bellagio, Caesars, etc.... Upon entering our room we both were smiling when we saw how beautiful it was. Nice kitchen (although we never used it), the room was amazing with wall to wall windows, 2 large tv's, kingsize bed, which was the most comfortable that I've slept in for a long time.The bathroom had a large soaker tub and shower. The style of the room is very modern, so if you're expecting old english roses, this is not the hotel for you. The service was amazing. We put our "do not disturb" button on and came back that night to a message from the front desk asking if our room was up to par. It took us a day to figure out the short cuts to the Bellagio, Monte Carlo, etc... but once you figure out the tram system and short cuts through the casinos, you will save a ton of walking, if that's what you want. Check out was a breeze, just click the appropriate area on the TV. The pool was smaller than we expected, but still very nice, with amazing service. Free drink samples too. As a side note, we decided to cab it from the airport to the hotel, as opposed to taking the shuttle, and we saved about $30. All in all, this was the best hotel we have ever stayed in in Las Vegas. ONLY ONE NEGATIVE... and that is the $18/night hotel fee that they charge you, something that should be advised of when you book. We did not know about it, so where somewhat surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: RanRan0459
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful three nights at the Vdara. It is new, well appointed and blessedly quiet without being spooky. It is also, and has always been, a no smoking facility. It is difficult to drive in and out, however. It took our entire time learning how to enter and exit the property. The parking staff was wonderful, but it took their help, a good map and the GPS to navigate. The rooms have 2 burner stoves, a large kitchen sink, a small fridge, a microwave and a dining area, but no pots and pans, coffee makers, cutlery etc. One can request items from housekeeping, but we found them reluctant to do so. I don't want to see even the room service people before I've had a cup of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “90% Luxury and 10% What Were They Thinking?”
Reviews.Author: cb4444
Reviews.Content: Given the 4 diamond rating they are so happy to tout, this first stay at Vdara was filled with minor disappointments. Part of the famed City Center development, Vdara is positioned back from the strip and is a non-gaming property. It is connected by short outdoor walkways to either Bellagio (and the MGM tram station) or Aria and the rest of City Center. First impressions were great: short line upon my early afternoon arrival, friendly staff, accommodation of my high floor booking request, and a cool and comfortable lobby when the outside temperature was pushing 105. Unfortunately, the front desk clerk made an error that cost me significant time later to correct, only the lobby air conditioning could handle the heat, and my room had a bizarre array of problems. Vdara was designed to be a condo-only building and when MGM redirected plans for the property to make it a hotel, the budget for completion must have been slashed. At every turn, there were signs of cut corners. For example, every guest room including my standard room has a basic kitchen including at least a refrigerator, microwave, and two-burner cook top, but there's no kitchenware--you must request and wait for it each day and no kitchen cleaning supplies or even paper towels. The room didn't even include a coffeemaker. The poor finishing construction was obvious in my room: the sliding door to the bathroom was installed incorrectly and so even when fully extended would remain open by about 5 inches. Worse, the sill to the shower was positioned incorrectly so when the shower was in use, water would flood the bathroom. Once I noticed it was possible to prevent the flooding with a few towels, but that first use caused a real mess. Additionally, the room climate control simply couldn't handle the summer heat. The AC ran 24/7 and never brought the room temperature below 75. Other than those problems and a broken window shade, the room was modern with comfortable furniture and two large HDTVs (one on each side of the room divider). I had one great interaction with a helpful concierge who worked with me to fix the front desk clerk's error and another positive experience with a helpful valet, but in general, staff seemed to be lacking in training. The in-hotel cafe staff in particular acted like everyday was their first in the job. Maybe Vdara will fix their issues with another six months in operation (since the first 18 don't seem to have been enough), but given the high price, I'd look elsewhere in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: udo_schuklenk
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, it's close to the strip but thankfully does not feature a casino, hence no smell of nicotine permeates this property. It's a cool, beautifully designed hotel, connected to the Aria (another stunning, new property) and the Bellagio. The suites are spacious (our's featured two flat screen tv's, separate lounge and sleeping areas as well as a kitchenette) and not lacking in comfort. The vdara features a very decent gym, but a truly tiny pool considering its size. Other reviews mention the lack of coffee and tea making facilities in the rooms. They are right, this is unacceptable. The vdara's valet parking is 'free' (your resort fee pays for it, of course) and very efficient. Internet is also included in the resort fee and works flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Gmert
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Vdara for the last 2 years with my family. Its a bit pricey but by far its the best hotel in Vegas. Just off the strip but easy to access the best part is no smoking and the next best part is no Casino. Rooms are well appointed, clean and modern. The sofa fold out bed (our daughter used) is pretty basic but it does the job. Car parking is a highlight. This will continue to be a destination for me if the smoking ban is strictly enforced. Additionally, if Vdara staff keep the loud obnoxious types away it will ensure this place remains "the" place to stay in Vegas. Lastly, wi-fi internet is first class and a highlight also.

Reviews.Title: “Not without its faults”
Reviews.Author: VivaRobVegas
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry if I appear to be indecisive, but I still can't decide if I enjoyed Vdara or not. Other reviews have pointed out that it feels more like a condo building than a hotel, and I would have to agree. The room was comfortable enough, with plenty of natual light streaming through the abundant windows, but the lack of attention to detail gives me the impression this was rushed to get finished and corners were cut in the wake of the GFC. I did get a very good deal for a corner suite, and the separate living/dining area with kitchen and laundry could be useful had I intended on using them, but the bedroom was tiny. The limited wardrobe space was difficult to access as the doors would not open fully, and the 3 coathangers provided weren't nearly enough. The biggest design flaw however was the large intake vent for the HVAC system right beside the wardrobe and only a few feet from the bed, meaning sleep was difficult if the AC system continued to run during the night with the constant drone of the air being sucked into the system. There are small reading lights above the bed, one of which didn't even have a globe in it, and they lacked effective lighting to be able to read properly. The larger fixed bedside lamps could not be operated from beside the bed - they had to be operated by the main switch at the bedroom entrance. Frustrating. The bathroom was a highlight though. Much larger than the Vegas standard with double vanities, separate shower and deep soaking tub, and the great feeling of naturally lit spaciousness made it a haven for luxury bathing, although the non-provision of face cloths was a glaring omission. The room overall was quite modern with dark timber accents and neutral colours, but lacked soul and warmth. The property itself is casino free which will appeal to non-gamers, but a short walk to Aria will provide punters with some relief. There is a small cafe & bar in the lobby, but that is all in the way of eateries. Again, it takes a walk to find other places to dine and there is a useful walkway to Bellagio. Being tucked behind the colossal glass structure of Aria, most of the strip views to the east are blocked, but if you're lucky and get a high floor, there are glimpses south towards Mandalay Bay & Luxor. The staff were attentive without being overly welcome, and for me, I would sum up by saying I'm glad I experienced staying here but would probably not choose to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyound what I expected”
Reviews.Author: wrigh1p
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, this was a great stay. Even the lobby smelled great. The employees were very fast and helpful. the room was very clean and comfortable. Speaking of comfortable, the bed was unbelievable. I couldn't lay down without falling to sleep almost instantly. The only problems were the door bell would sometime go off randomly in the middle of the night. Also along with the Aaria, and Cosmopolitan Hotel forming a giant hotel cul-de-sac. the hot air would just circulate outside of the building. Other than that, I enjoyed the three hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Suited us perfectly”
Reviews.Author: bristolstu
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel with a degree of trepidation having read a number of negative reviews but were really pleased with the hotel and found it suited us perfectly. First the bad: Resort fee - a general gripe about hotels in Vegas which do this, not optional and not good value but they all seem to do it so won't dwell on this. Lack of dining options. The food shop had few options and closed early. Also the restaurant in the lobby was closed for the duration Pool was fairly small The Good: Room size was excellent, a few minutes walk via covered walkway and you were in the Bellagio Our room was on floor 47 and had a great view over the fountains at the Bellagio The room had a kitchen area with Washing machine and dryer which was handy. Also the fridge was empty for you to put your own stuff in (there was an option to have this filled for you) The checkout lines were pretty long but we used the in room checkout option which worked fine Overall the room was really comfortable, had free wifi and maid service was good the other point worth mentioning was the lack of a casino in the hotel. I wasn't sure whether this would be a plus or not but found it to be a real positive as the hotel was much quieter than some of the others we visited, especially coming home in the evening and not having to walk for ages to get to your room. overall I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Is this the final product or testing? Seems incomplete”
Reviews.Author: RooseveltL
Reviews.Content: This review covers an Independence weekend stay at the Vdara in room 33003. Just to be fair and not appear to be bias – I have also stayed at the Wynn, Venetian & The Hotel @ Manalay Bay – all which I rank favorably. The brand new hotel flaunts freshly polished furniture and facilities with minimum or no wear tear. The elevator system is quick and resulted in no waits. The hallway/walkway is dimly lit with a boutique feel which could be good or bad depending on your taste. I prefer well lit hallways especially if it can be done with natural paint colors and reflective lights but I’m not the designer. And now we begin the “Are you kidding me” part of this review – Driving to the resort is not clean cut – a circling ramp and hope you are not arriving West from Harmon Blvd. as it requires you to slant into oncoming traffic with your vision partially blocked by the taxi queue. Brilliant design folks just brilliant. It is important to note – this hotel doesn’t have Self-Parking so don’t be deceived by the Self-Parking sign which directs you back to Las Vegas Blvd as you can’t park on Las Vegas Blvd. Valet parking at the Vdara appeared to be efficient without incidence or complaint. I can’t make the same statement for the sister hotel (Aria) but will hold off until later in the review. Check-In was disappointing. 15:00 on Saturday with only 3 customer service attendants. I was first in line but waited over 10 minutes – I believe 4 persons on line after I was checked in. There was a young staff woman of Asian heritage walking around with a notebook but couldn’t figure out her value or purpose as I would anticipate if I were in a similar role I would either call/page someone in the back to assist guess waiting in queue over 10 minutes (like myself) or comfort the waiting patrons by apologizing for the wait/inconvenience. I might suggest the hotel eliminate her role and spend the funding by adding another person behind the desk or even better invest in organizing the waiting queue (ie. Reference a bank, airport security screening, US Immigration,etc. etc. etc.) by purchasing simple rope and signs. My check in took 4 minute when I finally did speak to someone. No purchase/upgrade offered! Room – while mostly new quite a few unfavorable observations. Pricelist for minibar available but room wasn’t stocked with supply – I was ready to purchase the orange juice but there was none? Perhaps, this is a child friendly room or candy-free line? Not my expectation for a high-end hotel. No coffee/tea maker added to no minibar leaves no beverage options without calling room service or heading downstairs? No utensils in the kitchen whatsoever. Light switches don’t make sense or logical so a label might help The room offers three telephones (bathroom, living area and bedside) but only the bedside unit was functional.Can't optimize that $20 resort fee without a phone. Bathroom offered only a single hanging towel holder. Not sure if a design flaw, engineer didn’t have screws for 2nd hook or they anticipate only solo travelers will occupy the 003 rooms. Other miscellaneous – iron was slightly broken still functional but cracked, blinds which shield sunlight was defective on the right side (perhaps a previous guest or just defective mechanism/motor), and pen supplied in the room was extremely cheap in quality (minor but representative of things). The most annoying part of the room was the noise/sounds from neighbors. I felt it was more an inner city apartment building vs. a high-end hotel. I’ll elaborate on this topic as I felt uncomfortable overhearing the bell hop advising adjacent room guest of options as they entered. More concerning is what can they hear from my room (key point I was in the bathroom overhearing this conversation). I wish to introduce to the architect a simple concept called Sound-proofing of walls/doors, etc. Next, due to the limited dining options at this hotel it is require to visit the adjoining CityCentre/Aria for sit-down. However, my experience due to heavy rain outside the tram connector was suspended. No one working in the Vdara has been prep on alternatives to the tram when increment weather. One valet worker even stated, ‘The tram service is halted because the electrical system may short out due to the weather?’ Are you an idiot? I couldn’t help but to chuckle at the comment considering all the trams worldwide (including Las Vegas Airport) which could encounter a short during rainfall and wind. I digress – without tram service the ONLY methods to get to the Aria is walk exposed via the overpass (which has no protection from rain/wind) or obtain your car from Vdara valet and drive about 50 yards and give it back to Aria valet. Maybe a covered walkway would offer guest an efficient path in all weather conditions. BTW – If a hotel requires all guest to use valet it is imperative to have PERFECT operations as the Aria lost my vehicle. I mention to the clerk upon check-in I’m leaving within 60 minutes but required to wait about 13 minutes to retrieve my vehicle. The clerk was honest enough to mention it was misplaced when questioned on the delay. This hotel should seriously consider Self-Parking for guests as it doesn’t appear they are staffed for peaks periods of transactions (ie. Dinner time holiday weekend). Finally, check-out process met the low barometer of the check-in process. At 9am on July 4th – only two clerks (one stepped into the back) and a queue for 5 persons waiting service. I would suggest anyone checking out on a weekend to hand in their valet tag prior to queuing on line. This is simply unacceptable for a high-end hotel. My overall recommendations – I felt customer service, knowledge of staff, missing amenities and basic details were ignored in crafting of this hotel. I can’t speak to the service/lodging at Aria or Cosmopolitan but if anything equivalent to Vdara – I will gladly bypass all three in choosing lodging during my next stay in Vegas. The folks impressed by this place should really consider staying at any hotel I mentioned earlier as the improved experience might explode your skull.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, non-gaming hotel- just read reviews 1st and you'll be happy!”
Reviews.Author: browna1234
Reviews.Content: We recently did a quick mid-week trip to Vegas and pricelined Vdara for a great deal. I read all of the reviews in advance so knew what to expect. No property is perfect, but with knowing it's little idiosyncracies, we were VERY happy with our stay! Here's a few pros/cons/quirks: - Pros: ROOMS. Even our most basic suite (deluxe), with only a partial view of the Bellagio fountains on the 24th floor, was beautiful. Clean, modern and comfortable with a kitchenette and a beautiful furniture and bathroom. LOCATION. We loved the non-gaming, non-smoking, just off the strip features. We easily walked between our property, Aria, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, and Planet Hollywood, and were SO pleased to return to our non-smoking lobby. GYM/SPA. We used the very modern and well-supported gym every day. Even though it's small, staff was always there cleaning machines and replenishing waters and towels. Spa was very nice as well; I only had a quickie mani/pedi but lovely space and staff. - Cons. (These weren't at all dealbreakers for us as we easily accomodated them into our plans). No restaurant in the hotel other than the market downstairs. However, unlike other reviewers, I was very pleased with the Market food and prices (for Vegas, mind you). For example, one day we left the pool and were heading to a big buffet later so just wanted a light snack for lunch. We bought a premade turkey sandwich to share (huge and yummy!) for $9 and a nice half bottle wine for $12...where else are you sharing lunch and wine for $21 in Vegas? At the pool- SKIP the food there. Drinks were fine. We ordered the fish tacos one day and they were inedible. Just plan to eat elsewhere. HOUSEKEEPING- just know that you have to call and ASK for your room to be cleaned. Which is fine, but since they don't tell you this, I bet many guests just sit there thinking that housekeeping has skipped them... - Quirks- As many other posters shared, it's odd to have a beatiful kitchenette with literally NO piece of kitchen equipment or utensil! But, I knew this, and actually packed a couple of tupperwares for our microwaveable oatmeal in the morning :) But, when I called down a literally requested for EACH item I wanted: 2 sets of silverware; 2 coffee mugs; 2 wine glasses; a sponge and dish soap...they were all brought up very quickly and served us just fine. I DO think they would have also brought up a coffeemaker had we asked, but our camping experience has taught us to travel with Starbucks Vias and powdered creamer...coffee anywhere you have hot water! :) The last quirk is in regard to the "Death Ray" at the pool...the pool is not huge by Vegas standards and is packed a bit tightly with chairs, but it was very clean and we got a spot each day. The first day, we were making fun of the Death Ray comments as we didn't experience it at all. Day 2, we actaully became the Death Ray's little ants burning underneath the magnifying glass! But again, we overcame by taking a dip in the pool and a restroom break, and in 15 minutes, the Death Ray had moved over to other victims... All in all, I would ABSOLUTELY recommend Vdara to Vegas travelers. Unless your Top 2 reasons for going to Vegas include smoking and gambling...if so, Vdara is not for you. :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms, best I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: cksweet1
Reviews.Content: Hotel beautiful, and very modern, rooms amazing, big tv, massive window, but also a great black out curtain which is electric, lots of lights in rooms, big bathroom, lots of wardrobe space, free coffee in rooms, air con in rooms, Hotel is so modern it's like staying in a art gallery, bars and restaurants in hotel are as great as the rest of hotel Free wi fi in all hotel 3 min walk through corridor and ur in the bellagio hotel, were u can see the daily water fountain show, Hotel lifts are big and fast Pool area amazing, the hotel is like a mirror so it's extra hot around the pool, lots of sun beds and booths with beds to use. Main strip, 3 min walk, Hotel is quiet, Vegas is not so it's a nice break getting bk to this hotel. I will return one day

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: zumbo37
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with some friends at the beginning of June, the hotel was great, the food in the cafeteria was great, we had breakfast there almost every morning, the security service was really nice, we lost our wallet and they found it and keep safe until we claimed, but the front desk wasn't that helpful. The rooms were really nice and comfortable. The valet parking group and service was really nice and helpful every time we asked for help, we definitely stay there in another opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: jdrain
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend anyone travelling to Las Vegas to stay at the Vdara hotel. It is a beautiful, brand new, hotel situated beside the Bellagio. You can easily walk to the City Centre from the Vdara. It is a very quiet, non-smoking hotel and there are no casinos or malls which is what made us decide to stay there. The staff and service were top notch and the rooms were very, very clean! Our suite, on the 41st floor, gave us a wonderful view of both the mountains and part of the strip. We had a kitchen and a small living room. The king size bed was very comfortable and we slept very well. We had a large bathroom with a shower and separate bath tub. We will definitely be staying at the Vdara the next time we go to LV!

Reviews.Title: “terrible, never return.....going back to the signature”
Reviews.Author: chad1980
Reviews.Content: what an uncomfortable 6 days in the room!! the lock on the bathroom door falls off (siliconed together), the beauty mirror lights are burned out, the ceiling above the bed is cracked, bathroom scale does not work, casings and mouldings are very poor finish and are comming apart, a repair man knocks on the door and wakes us at 10 am to inspect the room because there is water dripping into the spa right below us. Not to mention the blareing music at 9am every single morningfrom the pool!!! Not 1 appology, and of coarse, not 1 break on the bill!! we did not look forward to returning to the room after every evening.....will never....ever go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: MasonsDad
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is a nice hotel that is supposedly 5 stars but it feels pretty trashy in the lobby and the check out process is terrible. Their were more than 200 people waiting in the lobby for their cars (the don't offer self-park). It was pure chaos. Without a doubt, once inside the room, it's beautiful and the fact that there is not a casino there does make a positive difference. I got the hotel, by the way, on priceline for $80 per night plus resort fee. They are obviously hurting from the economy.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed and can't recommend”
Reviews.Author: TheEffect
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in September 2010. Of course, a wonderful and new high standard, futuristic hotel and I'm not "a fan" of complaining but I have found some negative things I have to mention here: 1. Our room was large enough, clean, but I was very disappointed of design and colors of the furniture, makes you feel (a bit) depressive if you stay longer in this room. Not really positive colors, not well choosed. 2. Also a negative point of this 5 star hotel is the light switcher - seriously, almost impossible to find if you come back to your room while its dark outside! 3. Badroom is large in this hotel but with possible mold in the shower. 4. Bathtub is a little catastrophe. First of all bathtub was not clean - then the metalic plug is in the middle(!) of the bathtub so if you taking a bad you can seriously hurt your back if you are going under the water because this metalic bath plug is over the bottom of the bathtub. I took a bath there, so know what Im talking about. 5. Pool is open from 9am only, not very flexible, especially if you have to check out at this time. Why not to open from 6am? I'm sure guests won't be disappointed. 6. Also no coffee machine in the room... bad bad bad. Probably won't stay again in the future and not sure why I should recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awesome rooms”
Reviews.Author: Robr20
Reviews.Content: Good, Location, with city center, aria, etc..the rooms are fantastic, absolutely beautiful. Extremely quiet, smoke free. Mini fridge, sink, kitchen table, couch, 2 tv's. Seperate Shower and tub. The digital do not disturb and door bell are different Bad, Black out shades definitely are not black out. Extremely sunny early. Bar vdara is extremely over priced, tiny and poor service. Room service over priced. To check out I called the desk, they informed me to do it on the tv. I tried and it gave me and error. Called back and they did it over the phone. Slightly annoying. What I extremely disliked was not knowing until check in about a $100 deposit.

Reviews.Title: “The only Vegas hotel we will ever return to.”
Reviews.Author: ZitaKD
Reviews.Content: We like to walk so this hotel was in a great location. Walked almost every where. Our room had a great view - mountains on the left, Bellagio fountains on the right. Loved the automated black out blinds. Clean, quiet, non-smoking, beautiful room, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not a five star”
Reviews.Author: PeteVirginia
Reviews.Content: We booked the Vdara through Hotwire and got a very good rate. Hotwire rated the Hotel Vdara as a 5 star but I think that is too high compared to other 5 stars I have stayed at in the last year. The hotel is located in the new area on the strip called City Center and is a beautiful but very modernist property. The hotel Vdara was very nice but the management needs to do a little work with the housekeeping staff. The garbage was not dumped in our room when we arrived, the house cleaning staff forgot to put wash cloths in our room and the sink drain in the bathroom did not drain properly. Also the hotel advertises their suites as having a kitchenette but when you arrive there are no dishes, coffee pot or silverware so how is one suppose to use the kitchen. On the positive side the hotel is no smoking and does not have a casino so it is really a nice place to get away from all of the smoke filled noisy casinos. It is also very centrally located on the strip. All in all I would stay at the Vdara again but I would not bother to bring coffee or any thing to fix for breakfast in the room again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the second time!”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Vegas in January for a friend's birthday. They had a block of rooms at a different hotel, and because it was cheaper we chose to stay there. We checked in and went to the room and knew right away we would not be staying there. Having stayed at Vdara once before we decided we wanted to go back. We called to get a room and they were almost completely full and they only thing they had was a Corner Suite. We decided to take it, and we loved it! The room was huge, with a small kitchenette, a powder room, living room, bedroom, and a beautiful bathroom with separate soaking tub. The rooms at Vdara have all the latest technology, automatic shades and blackout blinds, big HDTV's, and everything else a hotel room should have. The service is excellent, with full service valet and bell service, as you would expect from a Vegas hotel. The best part though is the scent they pump in to the lobby and the super fast elevators. The lobby is the most refreshing and clean smell. After walking around Vegas and smelling smoke in all of the casinos there is nothing as refreshing as walking through the lobby back to your room. Then you get in the elevator and it can take you all the way to the top of Vdaras 50+ stories in about 30 seconds. It is amazing. We love Vdara and we will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “The small things let it down...”
Reviews.Author: QueenKat_9
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good parts; Rooms are great Price (via priceline) was great Pool is great Hotel overall is very nice You would think that is enough to recommend this hotel, all the main parts are great but the problem is the little things they just do very badly.
