Valet only - the lines and the wait are ridiculous, it's not the guys working their fault, they are running around trying to help but there isn't enough of them. 15 mins wait for car is just crazy. Check-in is hugely under-staffed too. Had to wait ages there as well. And finally....the so-called "black out" blinds are an absolute joke. Awoken at 5.30am with the sun streaming through the gaps in time. So annoying and for this reason alone we couldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: arrjay
Reviews.Content: Vdara was very nice for the money spent. Everything was new and well maintained. It is in the city center, with easy access to Aria, Cosmopolitan etc..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with a few minor issues!”
Reviews.Author: jblanchet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary a week ago and overall, we were very pleased with this property. It was immaculate, modern, and the experience was enjoyable. But other reviewers were right, beware! Positives: - Check-in was a breeze (We arrived on Thursday though). We asked for a room with a view and we got it. 43rd floor with a partial view of the Bellagio fountains. Mostly quiet, the view went on forever and was spectacular at night. Clean and new, spacious bathroom, seating area and bedroom. For the price we paid, it was a steal for such a large, modern space! Bed was super comfy! We got some great sleeps. Didn't use the kitchen, no need for cutlery (can you imagine if they provided cutlery for every single room on every single floor? Yikes!). Non-gaming, smoke-free -----> excellent! - Staff were so courteous and pleasant, the scent they pipe through the lobby is enjoyable (but not altogether necessary). Everyone we encountered was friendly and warm. The housekeeping ladies were so sweet :) - Proximity to the strip was ideal. We read the review from someone who timed the walk via the pedway through the Bellagio, it was only about 5-6 minutes depending on how fast you walk. It was so quick, don't know what other reviewers were complaining about? We thought it was perfect. There's also the city center tram, great to get to the Monte Carlo without walking in the sun! - There is no self-parking, only valet. Why is that sign even there? Despite that, renting a car and getting back was no problem at all. Signs were easy enough to follow. Negatives: - Funniest thing heard on the tram, "What's the Vdara?" "That's the place where they roast people by the pool." Overheard talk of the Death Ray on several occasions. I can't be sure as the weather in Vegas was sweltering as it was, but even under the umbrellas and in the shade, it was sizzling at the pool. I don't know if the location is to blame or not but honestly, it WAS a small space as many reviewers mentioned. For the size of hotel, the pool area was tiny and always packed with people. We had a view of the Bellagio pools from our room....envy :P The music wasn't too loud at the pool at all. - BEWARE. This has been mentioned several times. We didn't ask when we booked the room what the security deposit would be and they DON'T TELL YOU when you check in (like other hotels). They just charge your credit card over $1000 and when you go to use it, another place says you're declined. The woman my husband talked to at the front desk didn't put up a fight, she said they would need to put a deposit of $100 a day ($400 for us) on the card in lieu of the ridiculous security fee which is what they should do in the first place? If you need to cover your assets, at least notify guests of the charge. Yeah we should have asked, but they shouldn't be shady either. Every other hotel I've been to has asked upon check in if $(insert security deposit amount) is alright to be charged to the card. It wasn't really the amount that bothered us, we had money for the trip, it was the fact that they never said anything. Surprise! - We discovered we didn't have soap when we first checked into the room. Quick call downstairs and the situation was remedied. I kid you not, it was midnight and my husband and I had come back to the room to use the shower/tub after a long day...some guy from the hotel opens the door to the room and tries to bring us more soap!! AT MIDNIGHT! Who does that? That's weird. - Blackout shades have gaps, woke us up every morning but our shade at home does that too so....you can't win em all, though at economical hotels, they have black out curtains which may have been better but altogether not as classy... Best part about staying at the Vdara? Clean, classy and new with excellent accessibility to the Strip. Minor issues did not stop us from having a great time here!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Tranquil Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HertsLaracroft
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel if you like geting away from the buzz of the strip and smoky casinos. This hotel was very plush and very clean. I stayed on the 34th floor overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. The room was very big and one of the best hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. Make sure if you do need any kitchen ware/utensils ask immediately... They are not in your room as a matter of course. There were no problems with staff or room bills... Ask for a free upgrade... You may be in luck. The small restaurant seemed quite expensive compared to the buffets you can get on the strip. It is a non-smoking hotel and there is no casino which I thought was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Jeaniebean13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights, and really enjoyed our 1 bedroom suite on the 33rd floor. The staff was friendly and willing to go that extra mile if needed. The only negative for us was........you had to request things that should have already been in your room. We had a kitchenette, but no dishes or tableware. We had a coffee maker and coffee, but no cups. We had a washer and dryer, but no laundry soap. We even had to ask for shampoo. We have no problem tipping staff for certain requests, but it seemed like this was all set up, just so the staff would get more tips. They are a fairly new hotel, maybe they haven't worked all the kinks out yet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, one or two glitches with service”
Reviews.Author: AmuroGM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks and I must say, the hotel was a very pleasant place to stay. The location of the hotel was not bad. While not directly on the Strip it is far easier to get to than it seems from some of the other reviews, and takes far less time to get to the centre of the action than certain on-Strip locations. By this I mean that there is a 5-10 minute walk through Aria, Bellagio or Cosmopolitan, while to get to the same place from other on-Strip hotels can take up to an hour easily (Circus Circus used as reference). The hotel is non-smoking and non-gaming, which is a good thing when arriving late at night as we did, as there was a very short walk to the check-in desk. We were informed on checking-in of the resort fee, which we knew about before booking. Another brief walk to the rooms which were also very nice. For gaming, Aria lay across the traffic circle, Bellagio along a covered walkway, The Cosmopolitan lay down the stairs, so there is a wealth of choice of ambience while having peace in your room. The rooms we booked were the basic 'Deluxe Suites', specifically two of these suites. We were given adjoining rooms, which was the only requirement we made, other than asking to have the sofa bed made up in one of them. The rooms were big enough, with a small kitchen space to one side of the entryway and a 2-seat dining table to the other. The main area was divided into two by the media centre, which had large widescreen TV's on both sides, with the TV on the lounge facing side connected to the media hub. The lounge became very cramped when the sofa bed was made up. The bathroom was very spacious. The bathtub is very large and deep, other than that I cannot comment as I am not a tub person. The shower was large enough, with decent pressure and a seat to the side (used this for a shelf). The sink (only one in the bathroom) was large and square, with the wall behind covered by the mirror, and a vanity mirror is mounted to the side. The only complaint I had with the bathroom was with the door, which is on a sliding mechanism, and tended to leave a crack open even when fully closed. The kitchen has a two hob ceramic stove, a microwave oven, a fridge identical to the adjacent mini-bar, storage space, and a sink. There was no cooking equipment nor dishes or cutlery. We had to call down for these. Now, I mentioned that we asked for the sofa bed to be made up. That was at 9:25pm. I had to call down an hour later to chase this request, at which point I asked for full dish sets for both rooms. Around half an hour later, these arrived along with the bedding for the sofa bed. Faultless service on the dishes, but could have been better for the bedding. I cannot comment on the king-size bed, as I drew the short straw (being the youngest sibling) so I had the sofa bed. For most of the stay this was fine, as I've experienced far worse normal beds. However on the last night, the mattress shifted, resulting in a painful dip where my head was. The view from the rooms would be considered 'Mountain view' as the view was off to the Rio and Palms with the mountains in the distance, though this was spoiled somewhat by the interstate. The pool deck was not too bad, though the shades were fixed in place for much of the day, due to the Vdara 'death ray' which warped one of our keys to the point it wouldn't work. This was amazing considering that the locks are contact-less pads rather than slots. We booked cabanas for two days and these were rather nice. comp soft drinks in the fridge with some snacks and a 50" widescreen with media hub for entertainment. There was a ceiling fan and misters to cool the place down, and four sun loungers reserved in front of each cabana for sunning. A splash pool lay just in front of these loungers. The poorest element of service occurred during our second day at the cabana, where our lunch order was 'lost'. This meant we were having lunch 2 hours later than planned. The peace offering was a choice of snacks and two drinks comped, our ordered drinks being enlarged comped, and an attempt to have the entire meal comped. I wasn't present when the check was settled so I can't comment on whether the meal was comped or not. In the lobby there is a bar and a market/cafe. However we never made use of either of these due to the limited choices in both. The cafe also closes at 8PM which may be an issue for some, but given the proximity to Aria et al. there is a massive choice of restaurants close to your room, often closer than if staying in any of the other hotels(not even close to an exaggeration!). From my experiences I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, and I'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One Word... Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jdspartan117
Reviews.Content: The staff are well-trained, accommodating and efficient. They let you know they are there to help and are wonderful at it. This was a true customer service experience. The hotel is spotless, modern, and smoke-free. The room was very comfortable and large. I opted for the upgraded corner suite and it was worth it. Beautiful room, comfortable bed, excellent views. This will be my preferred hotel in Las Vegas from now on. I truly enjoyed the non-gaming, smoke-free Vdara. A hotel in Las Vegas that is on The Strip and still close to the action with great value for the price. The valet was quick and courteous. Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Vdara and City Center are both a little weird.”
Reviews.Author: denvernet
Reviews.Content: The Vdara Hotel seems like the City Center architect's after thought. "What do we do with this land three blocks off the strip next to the highway?" If you stay at this hotel then you have a LONG hike to the strip. And you can't park your own car -- it's all valet parking, which is strange considering the main view from our room was the empty seven story parking garage next to the pool! Lastly, we booked online and thought we had paid all charges for the room. WRONG! At check-in they informed me of a 'mandatory' eighteen dollar per night "service charge"! I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whwc
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. Nice room. Two wonderful galleries nearby. Hotel is a no smoking and no casino hotel, which is a plus to us. Hotel charges $18 resort fees per day. Hotel also does not have a regular restaurant, which is an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JMWatson16
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay if you don't want the "strip" experience... Quiet, beautiful, with impeccable staff. Just a few blocks away from all the action but allows you to come "home" to relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of online booking site”
Reviews.Author: CA_reviewer_11
Reviews.Content: First, I have stayed at the Vdara on three prior occasions: it is an excellent hotel, with a great staff, and clean and quality furnishings. No beef whatsoever. But, my wife and I just completed making a reservation for two rooms for 4 nights, using the Vdara online reservation system. It was a terrible experience, which began late last night-- the worse part being that the first price quoted was for around $2200, then it jumped to $2313 by the time we reached the end of the reservation process, which then jumped AGAIN to over $2500 when we had to go back to page 1 of the system to edit the ages of our kids (the age change had nothing to do with the increase in price). This all happened in less than 20 minutes. We gave up and did not book. Today, I checked the site, and the price I was able to get was $2313. I just spoke with a manager at their reservation system that admitted that these mid-reservation stream price increases do happen (no explanation on how the price went down), and that the price is never guaranteed until you book it, even if you are in the middle of trying to book it. She "appreciated" my feedback on how the site is horribly designed and confusing, sorry that we were paying more for the trip, but that there was nothing she could do. That last statement annoys me the most. I rarely write reviews, but in this case, I felt it important to forewarn anyone thinking of using their website. Great Hotel. Terrible, terrible Reservation System.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but it had its moments”
Reviews.Author: Bigfam6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara for our 1st time to Vegas. We arrived late with another couple and checked in without a problem. However, our friend's room was not ready and they had to wait 2 hours for their room to be cleaned. Vdara treated them right and upgraded their room for having to wait. When we got to our room, there was poop toilet paper on the floor, broken plugs in the sinks, smelly disposal, and poor water pressure. It was too late to complain, so we complained the next morning and they immediately moved us to an executive suite, which was an upgrade from our city suite view. There were no problems with the room itself but we were disappointed with the consistency in housekeeping. Our friends had turn down service each night with music playing, low lights, & slippers by the bed. We had none of that. We had the housekeeping light on one afternoon with the housekeeper right across the hall only to find she/he never cleaned the room. Aggravating, yes but not a big deal. Room for improvement: check your washer/dryer to make sure they work; consistency in training & expectations of housekeeping; courtesy laundry detergent, dish detergent & coffee makers with kitchen supplies. Positives: concierge was wonderful; check-in & out was a breeze; friendly staff; quiet place to go back to after a busy day on the strip. We woul stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Kitchen Without One Dish”
Reviews.Author: Continental American
Reviews.Content: The property is stunning. The suites, bathrooms are gorgeous. The downfall of this property is the tacky stinginess with things that should be basic at a hotel of this caliber. On checking in, I searched everywhere for a coffee maker which is generally standard issue in a hotel of this quality. It wasn't to be found. The room menu made it obvious why. Room service coffee was as expensive as dinner at a nice restaurant. I ended up buying some cans of Starbuck's iced coffee and keeping them in the fridge. Reading of the previous reviewer's experience in the take out shop waiting in two lines to get a cup of coffee made it clear that I'm not the only one who found the lack of a coffee maker unacceptable. Also, why have a nice kitchen with shiny new appliances and not provide one piece of cookware, not one dish, not one piece of cutlery or one dish towel? Oh, I'm sure they would have been brought on request but probably at a cost that exceeded the room rate. I found the pool area nice enough. The water was a perfect temperature. The pool is not large with a lot of gimmicks like many of the more hyped pools in Vegas, but it does the job. The pavement around the pool was very slippery, and it was easy to fall there, so do be careful. Oh, and don't get me started with the "resort fee". This covered two bottles of water, a USA Today newspaper that they don't even deliver under your door - you have to pick it up at the front desk if there are any left, local phone calls that most won't need and very slow internet using your own computer. This property has a lot of potential. Once they get the details right like adding coffee makers in the rooms, eliminating the resort fee and equipping the kitchens, they'll no longer need to give their rooms away on Priceline for $70 a night like I paid for mine.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed a month for world series of poker”
Reviews.Author: sarasota69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here longer then other reviews so the good really out weighed the bad. Everyone is right about the kitchens. No nothing! They said "oh housekeeping will bring it up to you" however they forget to tell you it might take a few days! Then they bring up one little frying pan. They are weird or I should say STINGY about kitchen stuff. Not sure how many pots and pan thiefs that are out there but, must be many because they are really worried about it. Lol. I think the employees are nice but, no one knows anything about anything here. I wish I had a dollar for every time I heard "I don't know.". Rooms are nice and our air and showers were great! Room service is horrible in every way. Food is terrible in the cafe and I noticed they wear gloves but handle the food and money and everything with them so I don't see the point really. Cabs are good also and aria and belligio are right there. Spa is nice and people are nice. Great massages and they don't charge you 20 bucks every time you go to the gym like belligio and aria.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JJR07
Reviews.Content: Positive + Modern + Clean + spacious Negative - I had called twice to get a soap bar...still without success. Small thing, but frustrating... - although it appears to be centrally located, it's really not on the strip (<5 min walk)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in my June 2011 stay at Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Jacksonvillejerry
Reviews.Content: My suite felt tight compared to MGM Signature and Trump and, too many service lapses for Vdara to warrant 5/4 star rating in a city where $200 per night can buy you a lot of luxury. Didn't remove our room service dishes as promised. No turn down service and fresh towels at night. NO hot water this morning for bath or shower before check out... granted it was 5AM, but this is Vegas! Also, they charge that annoying $20 per day resort fee which includes such things as the morning paper... if you care to go down the to lobby and pick it up. On the positive side, Jessica was excellent massage therapist and the gym was good, not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RogerAberdeen
Reviews.Content: My 5 friends and I stayed here 9th - 16th June. We had a girls shopping/ shows/ and sunbathing holiday, it was fantastic. The hotel is new and modern just set back from the Strip behind the Bellagio. It is one of only a few hotels that does not have a casino, we found this a big plus point, as the casinos are quite smoky and a little bit tacky. No smoking anywhere in the hotel, so it aways smelt fresh. Market cafe on the ground floor sells all kinds of great breakfast stuff, pancakes, bagels, fresh fruit etc. you can eat in or take it up to your room. There is small kitchens in each of the rooms so you can make tea / coffee etc. The pool area is small, but it is nice and clean with loads of sunbeds. Pool restaurant has good selection of breakfasts too, really nice place to sit and relax. Great cocktails etc. Our only moan was that we had booked 3 rooms with 2 double beds in each, but when we arrived we all got 1 king size bed and a sofa bed, they do not have any rooms with 2 beds. All in all we would definately go back to Vegas and stay at the Vdara. Brilliant Holiday !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: bohnkaggie
Reviews.Content: We were at the Vdara for our honeymoon (June 12th-15th). We had a great stay. They gave us a great view of the Bellagio Fountains. The only issue we had is one day they did not have hand towls when they cleaned our room. They later provided them for us...not a big deal. I really did not like paying the "resort fee", but that is becoming the norm for Vegas. I will need take that into consideration next time booking a stay. Overall, it was a great stay and and the people working there were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: mom-of-aj
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? We made two trips to Vdara. My husband and I travel on business trips with his company and on leisure trips with our two grown daughters. We travel to Las Vegas 2-3 times a year and have been visiting for over 15 years now. We stay at several different hotels on the strip and we decided to try Vdara because it was new and centrally located and we always look for a suite with a kitchen in it when we travel. Our first stay at Vdara was at the end of May on a vacation with our daughters on a return trip from Hawaii. We were only staying for 2 nights so we decided to try out Vdara knowing that we would be coming back (my husband and I) in two weeks for a return visit for a convention my husband had at Aria. We arrived late (after midnight) after a long flight and were checked in very pleasantly and quickly by Tabatha. However, there was no bellman when we arrived so my daughter went searching for someone only to find a luggage cart. When she grabbed one, a bellman came out from nowhere suddenly willing to help. We waited a while for the luggage to come up. We also waited for the sofa bed linens to be brought up to our room and the bed made. Why weren't linens provided in the room-I don't know. We just wanted to go to bed but we had to wait for everything! When the maid came to do the sofa bed a Chapstick rolled out of it! Great!! She didn't seemed surprised or apologetic. We received no instructions on how to work the light/blind switches from the bellman so we got frustrated trying to figure that one out. Note- Planet Hollywood gives you instructions upon your arrival!! We went to bed and when I got up I found NO utensils, dishes, paper towels, mugs, NOTHING in the kitchen to make my coffee with- which is a Keurig pod! What is the reason for this? At Planet Hollywood and MGM Signature there is a fully stocked kitchen when you arrive. When I asked about it, I was told that you have to ask Housekeeping to bring it up to you. Well the bellman already got a tip, the maid for the sofa bed got a tip and I guess I have to tip the person bringing the utensils up too? We just let it go because we were only going to be there one more night. There were other issues we found in our room that I will briefly mention. The chair had an odd gross spot on it that we could guess what it might be!! There was clear scotch tape on the dining room ceiling like someone had hung something. There was a clear cell phone cover stuck to the glass end table- I thought it was my daughter's but it wasn't! There was no remote for the den television. We had to share with the bedroom tv remote. There was no full length mirror in the bathroom or bedroom-it was in the kitchen? The decor was very modern but there was very little counter space in the bathroom. The maid would move all of our toiletries on the sink onto a towel in the bathroom. I don't like people handling or moving my things! Some positives are: the views are nice and the master bed was comfortable (sofa bed was not according to my daughters) and the corner rooms are very quiet. When we came back to our room after a day out walking (around 5:00 pm), I asked the Concierge for a comment card and she said that they didn't have any but I could address my concerns with the front desk. I told her there was a line there so she gave me paper and an envelope to write them down and she would see that they would get to the manager. Well when we got to our room, the hallway was filled with laundry bags and there were two room service carts blocking our doorway. I wrote down my issues and gave the note to the lady Concierge. I asked that I get a response via e-mail because I was reluctantly returning in two weeks. When I got home I received no response. I did get an on-line survey however. I repeated everything in the survey that was sent to me and again I got no response. When our second trip was approaching I called Vdara to request a high floor room and to request that my kitchen be stocked for 6 nights when I arrived. I also inquired about getting a response to my TWO lengthy reports. I was told that I could address my concerns to Nicholas (the assistant manager) whose e-mail I was given. For the THIRD time I voiced my concerns through Nicholas to Vdara but was only given a short response to a few of my concerns and a promise that my upcoming stay would be better. Well, it wasn't. We did have better service with the bellman and we did get upgraded to a nicer but same kind of room as last time (probably Nicholas' doing). That was the end of the improvements. My kitchen was not stocked at all (remember I called ahead) and we didn't get robes or slippers in this same room this time. There were a few light bulbs out in our room. I called for the utensils, etc. to be brought up to my room and I got 2 plates, 2 mugs and 2 sets of utensils. No paper towels, no dish detergent, no dish towels (no tip either)! There was also a washer and dryer in the room (which is why we like it) but no laundry detergent either. Luckily I brought my own. After the first day ALL of my dishes and utensils were taken out of the room by the maid. Are you kidding me? I called again and complained, they sent up more dishes, etc. and the person bringing it up said I should probably leave a note for the Housekeeping staff not to take them. I did leave a note and spoke to the maid (best I could) for her to leave everything in the kitchen until I leave and to leave dishwasher detergent so I could do the dishes myself. I did not receive dish detergent or laundry detergent until the 5th day I was there! I also asked for a toaster but they said that they don't have them. Again, other hotels on the strip do! When we were checking out, the line was so long at check-out that my husband had to go back up to the room in disgust to check out over the television and he said that the receipt couldn't be sent to us because it wasn't working on the television! All I have to say about Vdara is that customer service is terrible. No one gets back to you on anything and your comments really don't matter much. Having to call and tip for everything is just crazy!! I don't understand this type of service. I am a very detailed person so I notice a lot. Vdara clearly doesn't focus on the details or customer satisfaction. It is evident in other reviews here about this hotel. I won't be staying here again and wouldn't have a second time if I knew it wasn't going to improve. Vdara had there second chance with me and that's enough. There are much better places to stay in Las Vegas than this. Planet Hollywood Towers had much better service and MGM Signature was also nice. I would try PH first because they are not owned by MGM ( like Vdara) as I had some trouble with check-in at MGM Signature in the past. I guess MGM has to work on their customer service department!

Reviews.Title: “Wicked View!!”
Reviews.Author: peacockranch
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Las Vegas for business usually isn't that "fun" so I tried to pick a hotel that I had never stayed in before, and I sure made the right choice. Vdara is one of the most luxurious hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. I checked in pretty late due to airline difficulties and I was pretty tired. The front desk attendant made the checkin easy and quick. The lobby was buzzing with guests still, but this hotel does not have a casino inside it so it was a little more slow paced which I like. This hotel has not been around long and is gorgeous. With the breathtaking view from my room, the Aveda shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom, and the supurb housekeeping staff, it was well worth every penny. I booked my travel through an ecommerce website, and it was a true bargain! This hotel is located minutes from the strip, connected to the Bilagio, and a $15 cab ride from the airport. A must stay if ever in Las Vegas. PS. The flower arrangements were so pretty in the hotel!! Orchids EVERYWHERE!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, amazing views”
Reviews.Author: HappyCouple38
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 39024 on the 39th floor. I would recommend that room to everyone. It was an executive suite with a 270 degree view. We could watch the Bellagio fountains from the bathtub or any room in the suite. It was so beautiful, especially at night. The room was huge and included a full size refrigerator, kitchen area, dining table, living room, king bed, huge bathroom and more. It was fantastic. It didn't have the horrible Las Vegas hotel room smell, probably because it's a newer non-smoking, non-gaming facility. The bed was super comfy. Some of the furniture had been nicked up already, which was surprising for a newer facility, but I guess people are hard on Vegas rooms. The staff were friendly. It's a smaller hotel, so you don't get lost trying to find the elevators to the room. The cafe is a little spendy, but the food is good. The pool area was simple, attractive and comfortable. It's not a party pool, so it was comfortable for adults, families, old and young. It was a quick and easy walk to Aria or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: whoopi1017
Reviews.Content: The Vdara hotel was very nice, very clean. It didn't have a casino which worked just fine for us. There was a tram that connected this hotel with the Bellagio and the Aria hotel. The one downfall I found with this hotel was how long it took to get to the strip. The first night we were there we walked down the road (the sidewalk stopped halfway to the strip), but that walk took about 7 mins, but if you take the tram to either the Bellagio or Aria like you're suppose to to get to the strip then it takes you about 20 mins. But overall very nice hotel, not a huge pool like other resorts, but there was internet in the room. We got in a little tiff with the front desk, they had put more that a 1000 dollar hold on my card, once we talked to them they remedied that. I don't think we'd stay here again, not because of the hotel, but because there are many more hotels with better locations to the strip that I would try to first.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Overpriced, No Casino”
Reviews.Author: ccacn10ijv
Reviews.Content: Vdara states it is a "resort." They are understaffed at the forced valet and bell hop services. Took an hour to get through the valet and to get baggage checked in. Took 30 minutes to get bags up to room. Rooms not ready until 330pm; and even then Vdara already filled the room type I paid for and offered no comparable upgrade. Staff will ask for tips, even though there is this reesort fee you pay for. Staff is courteous. Room is modern, but bloody dental floss found in bathroom. Would not recommend, will not stay at again. Remember no casino on grounds; have to walk across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room but Poor Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: Choosy_Traveler15
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in had a nice panoramic view but the housekeeping service was below average compared to other hotels we stay at in Las Vegas. The weekend we stayed at this hotel, there was a huge fire by the City Center that caused power outage. Our friends were not able to meet us and we were stuck in our room for two hours. When we called the front desk to find out what was going on, they did not seem to care. When we filled out the survey to voice our concerns, we asked to be contacted by guest services. To this day we still have not heard back from Vdara. I will not recommend this hotel to my friends unless its hotel management changes.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: Susan_Powers_2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Vdara 6/9/11-6/13/11. I visited Las Vegas myself to attend the Sir Paul McCartney concert and to get away for a quiet retreat for myself. Upon arriving, I was greeted with a smile from the door staff, as well as the front desk staff. When I entered my room, it was exactly as I saw it on the Vdara website virtual tour. My room offered excellent panoramic views and a great view of the Bellagio fountain. The room was very clean and the bed, pillows and sheets were the most comfortable of any hotel I have ever stayed at. The room had a safe with very user-friendly electronic programming. The kitchen did not have utensils, but when called for a cup and some silverware, it was brought to my room promptly. The first morning, I ordered room service. It was brought up to my room promptly and the server even brought a toaster and toasted my bread for me. What a treat! Excellent breakfast - egg white and mushroom omelette! During my stay, I was given a voucher for one complimentary buffet for either breakfast or lunch. Had lunch at Aria two days - the crab legs and cold shrimp were delicious. This hotel is definitely an oasis in the desert - a retreat from the craziness of the Strip, non-smoking/non-gaming - but close enough to the Strip via walking, tram, etc. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. Upon check out, I reviewed my bill and was charged for two extra buffets. It was quickly removed with no problem. It pays to not get in a hurry and look over your bill and ask any questions, just like you would at any other hotel. I would definitely recommend the Vdara and will stay here on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Would Return”
Reviews.Author: petest50
Reviews.Content: The things I liked about this hotel were the fast check in, non smoking, no casino, fairly quiet. Short walk to Bellagio, Nice large rooms with kitchen, couch, large bathroom. Things I didn't like: Valet only parking, lack of complimentary upgrades, very expensive cafe/market, bad view from the non Bellagio side of the hotel. there is a "resort fee" which I dislike at any hotel. The hotel can be expensive or there can be excellent deals. A person just has to watch the rate calendar. All in all compared to other Las Vegas hotels, this is a nice one. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Icarus922
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I hate the typical Vegas hotel; smoke-filled, cavernous casinos, and over the top tacky design. The Vdara really was the opposite of these- smaller scale and more intimate, smoke-free, and no casino. Even though it's a part of CityCenter, it feels tucked away and relaxing, and the rooms and views are absolutely amazing. The level of finish in the guestrooms is very high, with terrific glass showers and a beautiful tub that I never used but admired. One oddity- while there were LED reading lights at the bed that you could easily switch on and off, the large bedside sconces could only be controlled by a switch across the room. Image having to get up and out of bed at night to turn off your nightstand light and you get why this is frustrating. Otherwise a great value and beautiful space.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, modern, relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasKitty3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Vdara for the past 4 nights. The hotel is modern with a small market place (serves breakfast, lunch, dinner until 8:00 pm) along with a small grocery/ liquor store and a bar across the way. It was refreshing to come into the Vdara from the Bellagio walkway and not hear the ringing casino bells and no cigarette smell either. Check in was quick and easy. I upgraded to a deluxe suite with a full kitchen, dining area, 1 1/2 bathrooms, living area and bedroom with views of the Bellagio fountains. We received two bottles of water and coffee every day. The upgrade was worth it. The cost was only $30 extra a night.:) The pool area was very clean. All shapes, sizes and ages were there. Everyone seemed extremely friendly and the waitstaff and hotel employees were exceptionally helpful. This is a great hotel and any problems that previous visitors have encountered seem to have been worked out. I have stayed at Cesar's Palace, The Bellagio, Wynn, and Encore and I truly enjoyed the Vdara and hope to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: Ibetalot
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night with the wife for our 25th anniversary. We are locals so I have plenty of experience in Vegas hotels. Booked a panoramic suite. When we checked in they gave us a complimentary upgrade to a single room penthouse on the 56th floor. That is not an upgrade. Worse view, less square footage and the upgrade is a robe. The lights have a master switch (1 of the 3 switches on a wall plate) at the entry door but there were no instructions indicating this so it takes a while to figure that out. The first lamp in the living room was broken in half and put back together as to hide it. The curtains were broken in the living area. The room AC struggled to keep the room at temperature on a 95 degree day. (That shouldn't be a problem). One of the robes appeared to have blood on it. Brought dessert back to the room only to find out the full kitchen has no utensils, napkins..nothing. Call concierge to ask a question, first call I was hung up on, second call was an automated hold message for first available held for 3 minutes. You would think a Penthouse suite might get some respect. Called room service to get utensils and a couple of extra pillows after waiting 10 minutes I called back only to have them say that thought it was for the next room over, which is a lousy excuse since your name and room number show up on their end. Canceled the request. The room was quite beat up in appearance considering its not that old. MGM needs to fire the hotel manager and start over. This could be a nice property but someone has made some bad decisions on how to run this place. Three positives, extremely fast elevators, valet and the sculptures are nice. I've stayed at almost every hotel on the strip under the MGM name, the rest make this one look amateurish. Maybe because it doesn't have gaming it doesn't get Mr. Baldwin's attention??

Reviews.Title: “Made our honeymoon awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: daisybug501
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. We were on our honeymoon and loved how it didn't have a casino in it. We were right off the strip. Our room had an great view of the mountains and the fountains! We were there for 6 nights and every day the room was cleaned and like new every day. The bed was comfy and a joy to get into after a long day. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Be in Vegas without the casinos and smoke”
Reviews.Author: UtahPooch
Reviews.Content: An new, elegant, smoke/casino free alternative that is right on the Strip. Very spacious rooms with fabulous views. Ours had a entryway bar and cooking area with two fridges (one a stocked bar fridge) that help to separate the hallway from the sleeping area. I think that it might be the average room for this hotel. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “great location if you want to be in middle of things, but...”
Reviews.Author: tvlbuddy
Reviews.Content: maybe too busy. Our first room was to be a "mini-suite" but really was a large room with two opposite mounted flat T Vs with a bed on one side and sitting area on the other. We couldn't darken the bed area without darkening the whole room. The place is very "modern." But if you want a "private" toilet (it's all glass), go somewhere else. We paid extra the next two nights for a seperate bedroom & living area. But the kitchen had bare conviences--call room service if you need a spoon to stir the single shot coffee cup dispenser. For a sexy excursion, it would be great. Parking is all valet, but only tip required and very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service until Jin at the front desk saved the trip”
Reviews.Author: usc85
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to Las Vegas for Mothers Day in May and decided to stay at Vdara as it was a new resort. I thought I checked everything online about the hotel and any hidden costs. We arrived in Las Vegas and made it to the hotel to check in. I was informed by the check-in agent that there was a $100 a night fee included of which I was not prepared to pay. After much discussion with the agent and whomever she spoke to on the phone, this fee was eliminated. I overheard another agent telling her customer about the amenities at Vdara and when the customer asked for a room with a view of the Belagio fountain, she was able to accommodate his request. I booked the corner suite room for me and my mother and I also asked for a view of the Belagio fountain and was informed that was the last room. When I asked again, someone my agent spoke to on the phone told the agent to inform me that this was the last room taken and if I wanted a view of the fountain I would have to upgrade....yes, more money! I was ready to cry and move to another hotel. I was assigned to a corner suite room of which there was no view. I immediately phoned the front desk to check out and an agent named "Jin" answered the phone and told me that there were a handful of rooms with views of the fountain that would be available in a few hours. My mom and I decided to give Vdara a chance and have lunch and come back to the room. When we arrived and contacted the front desk our new room with the view of the Belagio fountain was available and we quickly moved. Jin saved the trip......Out of nowhere, there was a room available! Why did the agent and her manager lie to me about the room and availabilities? I was not impressed with the customer service. Vdara should not lie to their customers or favor one over another. All fees should be disclosed. I'm not sure if I will ever go back to Vdara. I wrote a review on the hotel webstie but have not received a call back from Vdara yet??????

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room”
Reviews.Author: diamondmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a corner suite at the Vdara. The room was spectacular. The view was the best I have ever had in Las Vegas. Pool was closed to high winds so was allowed to use the Aria pool and it was very nice. I will stay at the Vdara again. Spend the extra money ane get a corner suite. The view is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara, home away from home”
Reviews.Author: cokosmomma
Reviews.Content: My husband & I wanted to plan a little getaway for the Memorial Day weekend and decided that a visit to Vegas was long overdue. Our last trip was in '02 and the places we stayed before were wonderful but I wanted to try one of the new City Center properties. We're not big gamblers but thought the only way to enjoy our stay is if we stayed at a gaming hotel with 100+ restaurants and eateries...boy were we mistaken. We loved Vdara!! We selected it over the other City Center hotels because the price was so much more reasonable than the others. Also, they were running a promotion which offered a daily $25 credit valid at both Vdara and Aria...bonus! We arrived pretty late (~11pm). I asked if there were any rooms available with a view of the fountains and the gentleman at the front desk was very accommodating. (Full disclosure, in hindsight having the view didn't matter for us but since everyone on TA makes a big deal about it, I wanted to make sure we didn't miss out on anything.) Our room was on the 41st floor near the elevators and to me it was the best room ever! I'm not sure of the type of room we were assigned but it featured a "wall" that separates the bedroom from the living room, with attached storage space/drawers and a desk. This is also where the flat screen TVs are mounted (one on each side of the wall) which was a great amenity for us. I could watch reruns of "Real Housewives..." while relaxing in bed while hubby watched CNN while reading the paper from the living room sofa. We used the fitness center each day we were there...plenty of cardio equipment, dumbbells and nautilus machines to satisfy most people. Towels and bottled water are provided. I was surprised fresh fruit isn't also complimentary (like most hotels of this caliber) but there is a bar just steps away to purchase drinks and fruit. We managed to spend a little time by the pool as well. It's located on the 3rd floor and reminds me of pools at other hotels in a financial/business district. If you are going to Vegas to be seen hanging by the pool then you should consider a different property. It's not that type of party atmosphere, although the music played on the speakers was a nice touch. We spent every evening in the Vdara Bar and just outside is a cute little sitting area that we didn't discover until the 2nd night. Not many people there since everyone is out partying I suppose. Features outdoor sofas and swings. As far as convenience to the Strip, I see people can find a way to complain about ANY and EVERYTHING. Yes, it's a few extra steps but isn't everything in Vegas? Because Vdara is so close the Cosmopolitan, Aria and the Bellagio, it felt as if we were simply in another tower of those hotels. We dined out for every meal so we did not require anything for the kitchen, but we requested the robes and they were delivered in no time. Overall, our experience at Vdara was fantastic and it was perfect for us. Comfortable and quiet, yet when we wanted to get a little crazy we could take a short stroll and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: We picked the Vdara as have been to Vegas before and stayed in Bellagio and Venetian which are HUGE and so so busy, we wanted to stay somewhere not so full on this time. This place is great for that as it has no casino so it is not bedlam in reception! Decor was lovely, room was nice, bed v v comfy and the hotel was quiet and in a great location. It is next to the Bellagio, linked by a walkway and is set slightly back from the strip. The staff were all nice, but have to say service around the pool was pretty non existant. Pool area was nice. We got coffee in the morning from downstairs, v good and had stopped at Trader Joes to pick up stuff for brekkie. Used the gym which was pretty good also. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value trumps small issues”
Reviews.Author: DeansDesk
Reviews.Content: This is a non-casino hotel in Center City. It is part of a circular drive that gives you easy access to Aria, The Cosmopolitan and adjoining hotels like the Bellagio. Swanky, hip and cool. My room was spectacular and cheap at $230. It had views on three sides, a long hallway, big bathroom and all the treats you would expect at $500+ rooms in Vegas. Electronically controlled shades and blinds, flat screens, kitchen etc... Service was pleasant and accommodating without being intrusive or over-the-top. Pool was rather ordinary by comparison and didn't have full service bar or food until later in March. There is one bar in the hotel and service there was a little bit slow. There is one cafe-like eatery that has the basics and grocery's in case you want to cook in your room. (Room-service is an extension of this cafe ONLY.) The treats and small prepared snack foods were OK, nothing special. I disliked the lack of a full-service restaurant and a more functional bar setting but that's not what this hotel strives to be. I'd stay again if I was traveling with my kids or if I was in the market for a great room value but I found the limited food and bar choices to be more of a deal than I would have expected. Spotless and cool looking place.

Reviews.Title: “a little bit of quiet in a noisy town”
Reviews.Author: TNConstanttraveler
Reviews.Content: I organized an annual conference at this hotel recently and will definitely try to hold it at this location again next year. This is a small intimate hotel WITHOUT A CASINO but within an easy walk to plenty of shopping and dining as it is right next door to Bellagio and Aria. This is an all suite (of various sizes) hotel and they were amazing!!!! Fantastic views, premium bath products, robes, slippers and a complete kitchen. This was the first time in so many trips to Vegas that i actually didn't want to leave my suite! I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: trucker64
Reviews.Content: Good stay at the Vdara. Very nice room with a partial view of the Bellagio fountains. Loved the bathroom and the wall to wall window. Great price. Front desk staff were pleasant. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very special stay”
Reviews.Author: ale_esteves
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for 5 nights and the room is amazing. Very big, bright room, with 2 LCD screens, kitchen, etc. Our view was sideview to the Bellagio fountains and Palms Hotel. Simply amazing. Acess was easy thru Bellagio or Aria, and location was very good. The hairdresser at the spa was phenomenal. Service was a bit slow, as they have so many rooms. And you have to ask for kitchen tableware, as this is not in the room. Anyway was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites and super quiet”
Reviews.Author: RalTar
Reviews.Content: The V'dara Suite was very comfortable and we had great views of the mountains. After coming in at 4am and closing the door to the suite, nothing could be heard in or outside of our room until we awoke at Noon to hit the pool. Bad thing was the pool area - most of the unbrellas were broken and it was kind of sparten. We were lucky enough to have frieds staying across the way at Aria which had 3 pool areas with trees and was much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Calm hotel with easy access to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: TheJoeOsborne
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at this hotel in early June with a group of friends. One thing I really enjoyed about this hotel is how quickly you can get from the lobby to your room. Going back and forth to your room in the larger Vegas hotels with casino's can take a very long time, but at Vdara in literally only took us three or four minutes. We had a corner suite with a full kitchen and the living area was separated from the bedroom. The room offered great views and was about a 10 minute walk to the strip, or about a minute to Aria which is a very lively hotel/casino. The room service at the hotel wasn't great. It took them a very long time to deliver towels on a Tuesday morning. They also gave us the impression that they'd be able to give us a later check-out than the standard 12:00pm, but were unable to do so when we called in the morning. The room was very nice and modern, but not very open, so it wasn't a great room to party in. I was also disappointed when I arrived back from a night of partying in the early AM to sleep on the pull-out couch, and the bed wasn't made up. It didn't make for a great sleep. This hotel would be great for a couple, or for someone who's not in Vegas to party. With the exception of the view, you don't really feel like you're in Vegas when you're at this hotel. I'd stay here again if I got a great deal, but would be more inclined to stay at a more lively hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jerry6004
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, very clean and just far enough away from the Strip. There is no gambling and no smoking which makes it great. The Vdara is within walking distance to other motel if you want to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Vdara”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara from 8th to 15th may, we found this hotel to be every thing we wanted for our 1st visit to Vegas, the suite we were allocated was excellent on the 20th floor as requested, with a view of the pool. We requested plates and cutlery which were delivered to our room Some of the negative points raised earlier by other T A reviewers i.e. location and the pool are not worth mentioning, you are going to do a lot of walking in Vegas so get over it, as to the pool it was suitable for our purpose , which was to chillax for about an hour each day, wind permitting. The room was cleaned daily to a very high standard, and my wife’s toiletries (body wash etc) neatly arranged by the maid. We did leave a note requesting they leave some toiletries but on our return there was an extra six toilet rolls, obviously an Anglo-American communication breakdown The only problem we experienced was during the power cut, none of the staff seemed to know what was going on, all of the power including the emergency lighting was off, luckily my laptop was charged so I could use it to illuminate our way to the stairwell (which was also in total darkness) and down to the ground floor, to there credit the hotel immediately refunded my resort fee $115 about £85, and when I explained that I wasn’t paying for a night spent on the front terrace covered by a duvet, they informed me that they could only refund this through my booking agent (Expedia) on my return I contacted Expedia and the hotel have now refunded me a further £79.(back of the net) Thank you Vdara & Expedia. While there we went to see Donny and Marie (my wives heart throb) phantom of the opera Vegas style and Matt Goss at Caesars all the shows were really good but we had an excellent time watching Matt Goss and his band, accompanied by the dirty virgins, I might add that this was a bargain for under £30 each, after the show the dance floor and disco opens and Matt returns signing photos and the like. While there I took the early morning helicopter to the Grand Canyon for a champagne picnic, I booked it with Papillion on line two days earlier for a remarkable price of $285 approx £180, I was picked up at 5.45am by a 10 seater bus driven to Boulder city airport, half an hour away had 1 hour return flight in the helicopter half an hour at the foot of the canyon with picnic and was back in my hotel for 10.30am , my wife hadn’t noticed I was missing We had a great time in Vegas and when we return we will certainly stay at the Vdara

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Definitely Would Recommend To Others!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cgarn
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the Vdara and absolutely loved the hotel. Very modern, upscale and clean. The hotel is only steps away from the Blvd. (seriously it is not that far away) and gambling (Cosmo, Bellagio and Aria). Those hotels are a little steep for my minimums so I always grab a cab out to the MGM. Front desk and Valet service is super quick. I asked for bedding and kitchen utensils after I checked in and they were sent up right away. Housekeeping was excellent and very tidy. Pool area was pleasant and beautiful. Not sure where this death ray thing came from. What attracted me the most was the no casino (hence much less noise) and non smoking. Perfect hotel to come back to after gambling for the night. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfort in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: airforcefinn
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Vdara was a nice hotel. It was off the strip so it was quiet but it wasn't so far that you couldn't walk. We especially enjoyed walking through the Bellagio to get to the strip. Check-in was smooth and they gave us an upgraded corner suite for an additional $10 per night. The room was very clean and modern with great views of the major hotels to the South. Water pressure was not great but is what you would expect at a new "green" hotel. We enjoyed the no-smoking aspect of the hotel. The downside of the hotel is that there was no full service restaurant available. Also, the pool was below average compared to other major hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest rooms (or suites or apartments!) we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: travj1234
Reviews.Content: Wow… we booked into one of their Panorama suites and it was just amazing. Views from three sides of the apartment - yes, you couldn’t just call it a ‘room’ as it had an entry area, washer/dryer in a cupboard, full kitchen, dining table, couch area, large bedroom and massive bathroom with double basic, bath and shower. Everything was new, shiny and clean and the powered blinds were easy to operate and blocked out most of the light. The bed was one of the best we’ve ever slept in. Internet was fast and included in your ‘resort fee’ and worked in the room, from the pool and in the lobby. For us, not having a Casino and being off the strip was very welcome – and it’s non-smoking so at least each night we could breathe some fresh(-er) air compared to all the casinos and other hotels we walked, and choked, through. In regard to location, you can easily get to the Strip either through the Bellagio or by walking outside maybe 200m – it really isn’t that onerous, even in the heat. And if you want to catch the free tram to the Aria or Monte Carlo it’s only about 150m from reception to the tram stop inside the Bellagio. The fitness centre was amazing – the latest equipment all featuring TVs with cable, and probably 15 cardio machines plus weight machines and free weights. It was really impressive and included free bottled water… you could become so distracted with the TV and beautiful people around you that you forgot you’ve been running for an hour! The pool is nice but not party atmosphere if that’s what you’re looking for and there are daybeds for rent or else we were able to get a lounge chair anytime we wanted one. The only drawback, check-in and out was painful and took a while but I think that’s a Vegas thing… however the Vdara was less than the 50+ metre lines of people we saw queuing at other hotels so perhaps we should think ourselves lucky. We loved, loved, loved it. It’s one of the best hotel rooms, and hotels, we’ve stayed in (out of hundreds). Yes, we would have loved to move in there permanently, it was just great.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated without being stuffy”
Reviews.Author: morgusona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at Vdara for our wedding and mini-honeymoon because of its location, non-gaming facility, and sophisticated vibe. We weren't disappointed with the real thing. Check-in was quick and easy; the room was spacious and well-equipped (the bathroom was fabulous); our room requests were answered almost immediately and professionally. Poolside was comfortable and enjoyable. We certainly will return to Vdara -- sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for a girl's weekend!”
Reviews.Author: LaNonnaSF
Reviews.Content: We were off to a good start with early check-in. Our request for a view of the Bellagio fountains was accomodated. From the ultra-modern lobby to the room, the place was spotless and smelled nice. The room was well-appointed with high quality linens and always promptly made up so that one can relax before dinner after spending time in the spa or pool. This was a return trip for me. They have certainly upped their game and worked some of the "opening" rough spots. The valet parking was efficient also. " Generally the cafe and pool food was good except for the fresh summer rolls. They looked good, but really bland.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, convenient”
Reviews.Author: so3008
Reviews.Content: We chose the Vdara b/c it is a rare NON-Smoking hotel. (No casino) The hotel has a very modern decor. The rooms are large, very comfortable and generally quiet. (I did have one drunk lady scream in the hallway at 5am, but that's not the hotel's fault) The cleaning staff is a little overwhelmed and my room wasn't cleaned until late in the day everyday, but it was cleaned well. The desk staff is pleasant. The lobster tacos served poolside are excellent! There were only a few problems: The "feel" in the lobby was a bit "college" for our tastes. We saw a lot of 20-somethings in bathing suits carrying big, plastic drink cups with booze. It was a bit low-class. But the security is good at making sure only guests get upstairs. Also, the pool (nick named the "Death Ray") is hotter than the desert. The glass windows of the hotel reflect the sun directly onto the pool area and it is almost unbearable. We had to rent a cabana just to sit near the pool. In all, the hotel is reasonably priced and the rooms are great. I have two kids, but I was traveling without them. This is not a hotel for kids. It's right next to the trendy Cosmopolitan hotel and only a block from the strip. If you're not a big gambler, this is the perfect non-smoking hotel. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrated our 20th!!”
Reviews.Author: ManitobaNic
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel! Quiet! standard rooms are amazing. View is incredible! No coffee makers but just go over to the Miracle Miles side of the street and get some coffee from McDonalds or bring your own instant starbucks coffee. Rooms have fridge and microwaves. Ask for robes and slippers! Get the long robes, short ones are too short. included with your stay there is a charge of 20 per day called a resort fee. It kinda sucks but many hotels have it there. I think it should just be added to your cost when you book. It feels like a rip off to pay extra after you already paid. Pool was nice, so spend time there from 2-6pm at least. BYOB discretely and in safe non glass containers. We really enjoyed this hotel and would reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: This property is a smoke free studio hotel without a casino located next to Aria, its sister property on the strip, We stayed in a one bedroom with stove, fridge,microwave, washer/dryer and dishwasher. There were a few things that could be corrected. We were given no dishes or bedding for pull out and had to call twice to get them brought up. We saw a very long line for a taxi and we waited about 20 minutes for check in and our in room phones did not work one day. The bedding was nice and room was large and best of all it was super quiet! It is a short walk to 3 casinos and food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a place”
Reviews.Author: marsh_aus
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Vdara quite early in the morning, so therefore a long time before check in. We were greeted at our taxi by a lovely man who took all our bags and told us how to get them when we can check in. A very smooth process and so easy. We went to reception just to check is we could have our room, but on luck. (9am) The young girl was very helpful and told us we should have a room by midday, which sure enough, we did. We proceeded to the elevator to go to our room, which was in itself a pleasure. Not once did we wait for an elevator and they moved very quickly from floor to floor. As we stepped into the room it was just great, We walked into a decent sized kitchenette/dining area with a microwave, refrigerator and hotplate. The room was great size, with a beautiful window spanning the entire width of the room and a decent view outside. The beds were very comfy as were the pillows. The bathroom was big and very clean with separate large bath and shower. There were 2 large LCD televisions in the room which worked out great for us. Housekeeping staff were great and friendly and service was always efficient. A 2 minute walk to Aria casino and not much more than that to the strip. A great hotel for families, couples, friends, really anything.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: kkkkevin6678
Reviews.Content: This is a decent property, but there are a few problems: 1. There are large gaps between the 3 sets of curtains which allow a large amount of early-morning light to enter the room which woke me up each morning at 6:30am. After staying out each night until 3-4 gambling, this is totally unacceptable. 100% light blocking curtains are a necessity in a LV hotel room! 2. Parking signage is very confusing. Upon arriving in town, I entered main City Center entrance in my rental car looking for signs to Vdara. Only signs were for Aria. Vdara is part of City Center right??? After searching and searching, I had to ask and was told that the Vdara entrance is off of Harmon Ave. So I drive over there searching for the self-parking. I see a sign which says "Self Parking & LV Blvd" so I take it. No self parking anywhere and this dumps you right back onto LV Blvd. 10 minutes later and back again. This time I asked the valet where the self parking is and he said there is none, valet only. So why is there a sign that says "Self Park" that takes you back to LV Blvd??? Hello management, is anyone paying attention? 3. As many others have noted, the location of this hotel is bad. It's a very far walk to go just about anywhere. Even to get to the Bellagio which is right next door, it is quite a walk! 4. Pool area is just OK- small and nothing exciting and not much energy. 5. Bed is not comfortable- too soft and caves in the center. Didn't have one good night's sleep (for the few hours before woken up by the sun). 6. $18 daily resort fee is really annoying, but I guess they all do it. :-(

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: ADW44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful vacation here in May so I'll share our experiences... First, we stayed in a Deluxe Suite on the 40th floor facing Henderson and the south end of the strip, every night the views were spectacular! I know this is no big deal, but staying on the 40th floor you’d think that it may take a while to catch an elevator to the lobby….not so at all. We jokingly counted the seconds every time we went to take the elevator and we never made it to the count of 5. Anyway, our room was very clean, well appointed, spacious and extremely comfortable. There was plenty of space to spread out considering there was a desk, a small dining table, a decent sized galley kitchen and a large sofa. The bathroom was also large and very contemporary; there was a linen closet, shower stall, and separate bathtub. We really felt like we had rented an efficiency apartment rather than a hotel room and as we later found out the property was originally built as a condominium building. We are both light sleepers but during our stay we were not disturbed by any noise from our neighbors next to us or above us. The silence could have been because we were there on a Sunday through Thursday and maybe the hotel was not filled to capacity. However, there is not a casino, restaurant, or a large bar in the hotel so you’re less likely to see the same level of rowdiness that you would at a large casino. Needless to say it was relaxing... Now to the service… We really didn’t have a lot of need to interact with the staff but when we did it was a positive experience. We came and went a lot and the valet service was very quick and personalized – we never waited more than a couple minutes for our car. One day we called to have a robe and an extra luggage stand delivered and both requests were fulfilled quickly and the front desk followed up to make sure that we were satisfied. We had also pre-ordered tickets for shows at the Mirage, Aria, and Monte Carlo and to my surprise the concierge was able to print them so we didn’t have to pick them up. We visited the pool only once and although it may not be as large as some of the more popular resorts it was an adequate space. The area was separated into sections for umbrellas, non-umbrellas/sunbathers, dinning and an entirely separate area for cabana rentals. I really liked the division because we wanted to relax and avoid the sun and the fact that all the umbrellas were kept together meant that the person next to us had to use an umbrella too so we didn’t get any involuntary sun. The location of the hotel is towards the rear of City Center but it’s easily accessible to all of the surrounding buildings in particular The Bellagio, Aria and the Crystals shopping center. The location was perfect for us but make sure that you’re okay with staying a little off the strip. The only complaints that I have were with regards to the small store/eatery downstairs which was overpriced and overcrowded whenever we went there. Also, the blackout shades were not really blackout shades but I’m really knit picking here because we really liked the hotel and we even considered staying an extra night. We didn't want to leave! In closing, I will definitely stay here again so I highly recommend it....

Reviews.Title: “Some good some bad some ugly.”
Reviews.Author: Mscgordo
Reviews.Content: Pros: No casino but several in a short walking distance. No smoking. Pleasant employees. Small kitchenette, good for making tea, coffee, breakfast. Quiet Cons: Pool is very small, crowed and has a very slow wait staff. Blackout curtains not blacked out at all. The Ugly: Dusty room, behind tub had remnants of previous guests hair, soap scum. The rooms appear to be cleaned quickly and sloppy. This is definitely not a 4 star hotel but in a pinch, i.e. a short spontaneous trip from CA that won't break the bank it works.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: Naomi82
Reviews.Content: We spent our wedding night here. Our room was fantastic, a mini suite. We were given a proper high end quality cot for our daughter to sleep in and the champagne in the mini bar went down a treat whilst we waited for our babysitter to arrive. Breakfast in the room the following morning was laid out by a waiter and the english muffiins toasted in the room, meaning they weren't soggy or cold by the time we came to eat them. The only problem we had was checking in. When we first tried to check in aat 3pm we were told the room wasn't clean yet and to come back in an hour and a half, at which time we were again told it still wasn't ready. With our driver due to collect us at 6pm time was running out and after raising this with the desk cle rk he unlocked the emergency hold room and checked us into it with a $50 room allowance. In the morning one of the managers was in the lobby and asked my husband about his stay. After mentioning what had happened they gave us the room on the house meaning we only paid for the breakfast as the champange was refunded due to a faulty bottle from the case another guest had complained about. Can't fault the staff on their helpfulness and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Yes " 5 star"”
Reviews.Author: JamLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I have read a number of the other reviews and I must say I dont agree with the negative ratings. First , this is a quite hotel hence the no gaming , smoking , casino , etc. If this is not your style then this is not the hotel for you. This does not make it less of a rating. Second. Resort fees are common throughout the strip, dont like it find a hotel without them. Last, take a cab if you dont like to walk. Our use your car if you want to hit the strip. Walking from hotel to hotel is so 80's. Ok, on to my stay. First time at Vdara. Check in was fast. Less then 10 min , I was in my room relaxing. The corner suite was nice and was over 800 sq ft. Nice size with two flat screens, soaking tub, kitchen and a nice coffee maker. Pillow top mattress is to die for, I will say the bed was little low for my liking but i got use to it. Had no intentions of cooking so the lack of cooking supplies did not bother me but it was strange. Automatic shades were nice and views from the 39th floor were nice. Could have used a 24 hour Cafe as 8 pm is just not late enough. All of my encounters with staff members were pleasent. I even called to ask for a late check out , the answer was sure will 1 pm work? Great. Went to lunch and came back and asked again for a later check out, was told again , no problem 6 pm check out was granted for 30 bucks. Valet was slow at times, solved the problem on day two by calling down, to have the car ready. Vdara is not for people looking for the club scene. It is a hotel to relax and be in Vegas without having Vegas touch you! You can go out and deal with the smoke and loudness then come back to Vdara and have it be quite and calm. What a feeling. Oh, that smell in the lobby is crazy until you get use to it. What is that smell . . . . . Smell like a bad air freshener.

Reviews.Title: “3 June 2011 - Nice property, hidden charges and staff need more training”
Reviews.Author: KazandAndy_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned to the UK after a week's stay at Vdara - we love Las Vegas and this was our 5th visit. This was the first time staying at this hotel and it is impressive as is the whole CityCentre area. We were greeted by well-dressed, pretty, smiling staff - however beware of the hidden charges at Vdara. On check-in we were advised that we needed to pay an extra 700 dollars (100 dollars per day) security charge which would be refunded 5-7 days after we checked out!! What did they think we were going to do - trash the place? We had carefully taken a set amout of cash with us and the remainder of our money was on a pre-loaded currency card therefore we were not carrying an 'extra' 700 dollars with us. I work in finance and we had deliberately left our credit cards at home to avoid the risk of card cloning and fraud abroad. We explained this to the check-in staff, who after discussing this with 2 other staff members decided that a deposit of 200 dollars cash would be OK instead????? How can this vary so much, seems to me that it's just a ploy to gain some interest in their pockets from holding your cash in their bank account for a week. Just imagine how much interest they will get if they do this with every guest's money? So we now had 200 dollars less for the week than we'd planned, but had we handed over a credit card we'd have been 700 dollars down. THIS IS A DISGRACE, SHAME ON YOU VDARA. The rooms were large, well equipped and clean with amazing views. Housekeeping was adequate but amusingly - we were left 8 new bars of soap, but no shampoo??? As our room had a fridge and Cafe Vdara closed at 8pm, we bought some tea, coffee & milk to use in our room. We asked for some cups and cutlery which we got however we didn't have anything to wash up with so once the cups, spoons etc had been used housekeeping removed the items from the room and they weren't replaced again. Not much good if you wanted a late night coffee in your room.. The hotel is in a good location, you can either get onto the Strip via the walkway through Belagio or walking down the side if the Cosmopolitan Hotel. We found it a bit pricey for drinks, fruit and snacks but this was on a par with other large hotels on the Strip. The pool area was busy but we still managed to find sunbeds without any problems although it felt a bit crowded at times due to the large area reserved for cabanas and daybeds. These were mostly unused (probably due to the high cost of renting one daily) so maybe they should consider removing some and creating more space? The music was quite loud round the pool, mostly R & B or dance tracks which we quite liked but this obviously wouldn't suit everyone, especially older guests. Overall the hotel would be great if some key areas were addressed - e.g. scrap the ridiculous cover charges, provide crockery and cutlery (& some washing-up equip) and the staff had more training, at times they seemed clueless! Would we go back? - yes if these areas were addressed, but not until.

Reviews.Title: “Time to leave the Oasis”
Reviews.Author: jcallcutt
Reviews.Content: In my last review I recommended the Vdara as an oasis of calm notwithstanding its shortcomings which I attributed to its newness. Sadly on my second visit many of the shortcomings haven't been attended to and there is an air of management failure. When we arrived the reception had no idea we had visited recently before. "Have you? Welcome back", said the friendly but uninformed check in clerk". The Silk Road Cafe, which was dreadful, has now closed and now stands empty and abandoned in the reception area. This simply shouldn't be allowed to happen in the middle of a prestigious hotel. The adjacent replacement cafe seems much more switched on and is actually open when needed, so that's an improvement. Rooms are still showing evidence of neglect, spotty and stained carpets, bathroom scales that don't work and in our case a wobbly bathroom tap, about to drop off. Room cleaning has improved, at least for our stay. The hotel charges a resort fee of $18 a day which includes water and papers, my brother in the room next door has had to ask for his water, we have both yet to see a paper. Will we stay here again? No, in spite of it being an oasis of calm, I think it's time for our camel train to move on.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but not quite top tier”
Reviews.Author: theavidtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vdara during May / June 2011. A lot of the hotel points are covered in previous reviews so I'll just leave you with a few top tips: 1) Taking taxis to / from the Aria casino side (walking to the side facing the strip) can save money and time if you are travelling to a destination on the strip 2) if you are going somewhere off strip taxi from the vadra and consider taking the freeway if traffic on the strip is bad ie weekends 3) double check your bill when you check out. I was charged double resort fees or 15 dollars, 18 dollars and 20 dollars. The correct charge for me was 15 dollars plus tax. 4) free bottled water is available in the gym - open 6am to 8pm only 5) if you want kitchen wear I would suggest leaving a note for housekeeping and I gets delivered by the time you're back Few other points / concerns aside from the resort fee issue 1) I wasn't feeling well so was napping mid day with the do no disturb sign on. However housekeeping insisted on banging on the door and refusing to go away. I finally got up and was presented with two pillows which I did not request 2) the pool can sometimes pump out loud party music. Not the most relaxing of environments 3) not sure if it's prevalent in other hotels but some people seem to reserve poolside chairs with towels. I would prefer a system whereby the staff did not allow you to stick a towel down and disappear 4) it takes 7 mins (I timed it) to get to the belligio front lobby Conclusion Overall fairly good value. Hotel is slightly away from the action but that could be a good thing.
