Rooms fairly sized and new Would recommend to someone on their second or third visit to Vegas and thus doesn't need to be right on the action but within walking distance. Not recommended for those who want to gamble or have lots of restaurants. Only one coffee shop. Belligio is just 7 mins away though Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax. Central to everything”
Reviews.Author: Mo4less
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel rooms, convenience, and how easy it was to get from the lobby to your room. Parking is tricky as you pretty much have to valet and gargage is shared with 2 other hotels. I didn't have a car so no big deal. I stayed at the Luxor and walked miles to my room. The cabanas and pool are lovely. It was perfectly nice weather for swimming and hot tub in march. I wish they would have kept them open longer than 10am to 5pm at that time of year. The sun was still up. I could unlock or lock the minibar with a simple phone call to the front desk, which was nice when family stopped by. Nonsmoking hotel and everything still looks new. The restaurant was closed the entire time of my stay and the "to go" market overpriced so this made choices limited. The concierge was snooty and the hotel does not offer coupons if you are a bargain shopper. I enjoyed the aria's buffet across the driveway.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel a little off the strip”
Reviews.Author: steve1850203
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning Hotel amazing decor. If your in Vegas during the week the prices are considerably lower. The delux suit is tasteful and modern. There is a kitchen and they will supply pots and pans at your request. Bath room is beutiful. there is a small sitting area with a separate TV from the one in the bed room. View of the mountains was exceptional cansidering what I payed for rooms in older hotels this was an exceptional deal. Swimming area is excellant and gets full sun from noon until about 5 pm. As in other reviews the hotel is a bit difficult to get to there are NO sidewalks from the strip if you try to get there threw the Cosmopolitan (Well you cant). You have to use the mono rail to get to Aria or risk being hit by a taxi dodging traffic. Sadly pedestrian un friendly!! You can walk threw Bellagio but is a bit of a journy. Also self parking is a night mare so your forced to use the Valet parking dispite there being a monsterously hugh parking garage beside the hotel! At any rate I really enjoyed my stay its a new hotel and there still working out the smaller issues staff are trying the server at the pool was a bit oblivious i was not approched in two days. As for getting a 5 star rating i think you sould have to prove your self over time to get this other wise its meaningless. Last point the elevators are stunning!

Reviews.Title: “A REAL TREAT”
Reviews.Author: tspeiris
Reviews.Content: This is a real treat. In the middle of the strip, easy access to all the best attractions on the strip. Very good location. In the city centre hotels, easy access to with the city centre trams and the internal walkway to Aria or Bellagio. Great views of the strip from the suites. Suites are mint clean and sparky sparky. Great customer services overall. Real good value for money. Well recommended for anyone who want to stay in luxury for best value for money. And for anyone who want to stay in the strip at a smoke free 5star property this is the place to be..

Reviews.Title: “No way this is worth the money”
Reviews.Author: punkyrose
Reviews.Content: Vdara isn't a bad hotel, it's nice and clean and large- but its far from the strip and one who has been to Vegas would know, closer is better after walking SO much! Walking through the Bellagio to get to the main strip I began wishing we'd stayed there. Housekeeping is slow, as is customer service. Rang and asked for a shaving kit for my partner and had to ring again as we waited almost an hour. Then when it arrived, it was tiny and almost un-useable. I expected to be wowed by the room, as it says its 5 star, but our room at Treasure Island seemed bigger and fancier than this one, especially for what we paid. I was very impressed with room service- my spaghetti was delicious and I craved it again for our whole stay! But no kitchenware in the kitchen, why have a kitchen at all!? Doesnt make sense... Yes, theres no casino, which we thought would be great, but somehow that makes the hotel seem to lack character. We booked it as we wanted a smoke free place and a casino free place but it turned out the casino downstairs created atmosphere and cheap/free drinks at other places.And its so overpriced! I ordered a cup of tea late one night at the bar and it was $6.50! Its hot water and a teabag! Speaking of eating and drinking, be aware the cafe downstairs closes at something like 8pm. They sell drinks and simple things you might need like asprin or tissues etc, and for it to close so early in a place like Las Vegas just doesn't make any sense. I didn't love the Vdara. I didn't dislike it, but I agree with other reviews you might find staying at the Venetian or Bellagio a little nicer, they seem to be very luxurious and if 5 star is what you're looking for it might be a better idea. It is quiet and away from the strip so if thats what you're looking for, then great, but you'll have to leave the hotel to do anything ( eat, drink etc. I dont think the restaurant was open the whole time we were there) Also- there is no self parking, valet only! And blinds are not blockout, because they don't match up properly sunlight streamed in between the blinds every morning, very frustrating after late nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but by no means a 5 star property”
Reviews.Author: CL5309
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1st time in May and got a good deal on room via priceline. Hotel was new and staff very friendly and professional. As others have noted, there is no casino on site and that gives the property a more laid back feel. Decor is a matter of personal preference though the quality of the furnishings in the rooms and bathrooms was closer to 3.5 star than 5 star (eg Grohe knock-off bathroom fixtures, faux marble floors in bathroom, etc). Feels like this hotel is trying to cater to 20-somethings who haven't stayed at true 5 star properties elsewhere in LV (Bellagio, Venetian, Palazzo, Four Seasons) or Shangri-La/JW Marriott internationally. My wife and I agreed that property was ok for price we paid, but if you're spending >$200/nt and expecting 5* accomodations, you're better off checking out the aforementioned LV properties.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the outside, ugly within”
Reviews.Author: mattyboy08
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at Vdara again!! For reserving a penthouse suite I would expect customer service that is at the very least up to par. The room was ok, maybe not as big as I would have like but still ok. Every single member of the staff with the exception of one valet attendant and one bellman were extremely rude. I left the room at night and although somebody was still in the room, the security member told me i couldnt go up without a key. She made me feel as if I was in the wrong because i forgot my key in the room. The front desk agent at night, (both nights) was also very rude and unaccomodating. I love las vegas and go as much as possible, but i will absolutely never stay here again!! And i will make sure to let everybody know how horrible the service is as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Oasis in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: huskeranna
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a three-night long weekend here for my 40th birthday. We found the hotel to be lovely, well-appointed, and relaxing in the middle of the hubbub that is Las Vegas. Check-in was swift and the young man behind the counter was very friendly. Our room was sleek, modern, and clean. The kitchenette is nice, but definitely annoying to have to request supplies. I echo another reviewer's request to have a fridge large enough for a take-away container. We ate at Craftsteak one night and brought back desserts and extra steak, but had to get creative with storage due to the tiny fridge. Resort fee did include two tiny waters per day. If you need more (you're in Vegas, you definitely need to hydrate), pop down to floor 2 and grab waters from the beautiful spa/workout facility. Wi-fi was fine, but my husband did have a few issues connecting. Once we got through to the front desk, the issues were fixed immediately. Housekeeping was definitely slow, but one we pressed the button they did service the room. Only had washcloths one day, which was odd. Could use improvement there. Aveda products, gorgeous bath with two sinks and a deep soaking tub. The pool was closed one day due to high winds, so I made do with the tub. Fabulous!! Would be nice if they provided a bath bomb or other tub goodies. The pool is the only issue. First day it was beautiful. We didn't need a large pool, and had no issue getting a seat. But the next two days the wind made it impossible to use. In fact, they had to close the pool. It is situated such that any wind causes safety issues with umbrellas and chairs flying into the water. This is the only thing that would keep me from staying here again. We found the pumped in smell to be lovely, and the noise level in the hotel and rooms perfect. No noise at all. Easy walk to tram, Aria, Cosmopolitan, and Bellagio. We are not gamblers, so being away from casinos worked well for us. Coffee and food at the little lobby cafe was tasty, but expensive like most of Vegas. Drinks at the pool were spendy but tasty.

Reviews.Title: “First Timers Beware”
Reviews.Author: teacher34Bowie
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just finished our first trip to Vegas. If you’re planning your first trip to Vegas, don’t STAY AT THE VDARA. The rooms are small, there is one king and a sofa sleeper in a DELUXE DOUBLE, a small pool (often dirty), very few amenities, and late night dining isn’t available. If you don’t gamble, which we don’t, you will enjoy the tranquility, but may not enjoy seeking out other forms of entertainment at other nearby hotels. Shows and other attractions aren’t available here. THE DEATH RAY IS REAL! Do your research.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Has Potential”
Reviews.Author: TravelTea
Reviews.Content: Vdara suites are nice & comfy (Aveda toiletry items, thick towels, great sheets, comforter, roomy, large windows). The kitchenette is totally bare and a big hassle to request for every little thing. No coffee maker & mugs (don't forget to ask for coffee, creamer, sugar, Equal/Splenda, stir sticks, teabags, etc.) Housekeeping is very late (came back @ 4pm to get ready for dinner&show; room still not serviced). Had to wait around for them to clean. Logistically, this place is confusing to get to/from the strip (via car, by walking, or by tram). There is either lack of or confusing signage to tell you where you are. Would I stay here again? Only in a pinch. Even though this is in a central location for the strip; I'd prefer to spend my money at the Bellagio or the north end cluster of hotels Wynn/Venetian/Palazzo. These places have more Wow factor (restaurants, shows, casinos, shopping) & overall the flow & layout for the customer experience is well in place. BTW, there is no free wifi. You pay for it via the $18 daily Resort Fee which includes newspaper, 2 small bottled water, valet, gym & local calls (cell phones, anyone?) Has potential to be great; needs to work out customer experience issues. Crystals mall (& Vdara) has no great restaurants & shopping is dead.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: HenryBrentwood_TN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending the Memorial Day weekend at the Vdara and found the property to be very nice. Rooms are perfect. My 49th floor, north facing room overlooked the Bellagio and the fountains and the view was great. Sat on the couch and just admired the panaromic view. There were a lot of young people in the hotel but only heard people talking a couple times for short periods of time. Expected long lines at the cafe in the lobby, but did not once incur any time delays. The lobby bar is perfect for socializing and drinks. Similar to a casino floor lounge. For dinner, the Aria is 200 yards away and the Bellagio is a short walk through an overpass. If you can walk around a casino, you will have no problems with these short walks. From the taxi to the front desk is 20 yards, and the elevator to your room is another 20 yards. Try duplicating that in a big casino hotels. Service at the pool was great. The waitress' are very attentive. The only thing I would recommend, but I did not see this in any of the lobby's I walked through, would be check in and check out organized lines with roping. Everyone just seems to get in a line and hope for the best. Will be back to the Vdara on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Site - Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MLM_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Since check in yesterday, have had numerous run ins with customer service. Very snobbish check in attendants - had a "carpet cleaner" walk into my room at 11:15 pm last night, have a valet that wont answer the phone, cant get housekeeping to answer... for a 5 star resort.. they need to fire the staff and start over... The building and facility is AMAZING... beautiful.. too bad the customer service doesnt match... will not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-few issues”
Reviews.Author: danton2691
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and find these reviews very helpful. My wife and I (40ish) and our 20-year-old daughter and her boyfriend stayed in two basic rooms at the Vdara from Saturday through Tuesday. We were all very pleased. The rooms were modern and well appointed. The beds were comfortable and the staff was very accommodating. The pool area is small and unadorned but it suited our needs to spend some time in the sun. I hope to return soon. However, let me reveal some issues that may aid the future guest. There is no direct way to access the hotel from the street if you are on foot unless you walk in a lane of vehicle traffic. On foot, you can only access the hotel via a tunnel running from the Bellagio or through the Aria and walk around a traffic circle. The rooms have kitchenettes but as a practical matter don’t expect to cook a meal there. The frig provided in each room is smaller then a college dorm frig and you must make a special request for cookware, dishes, glasses and mugs. If you use the aforementioned items, they are taken the next day and not replaced. Let me reemphasize that we all enjoyed the hotel but it does have its quirks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: elwood_lynch
Reviews.Content: We largely decided to stay at the Vdara due to the excellent package deal we got (4 nights return airfares from LAX for $620) but would have no hesitation about staying here again thanks to experience we had. When we first arrived check in was very quick and we were upgraded to the 51st floor overlooking the Belagio fountains. The room and the view were fantastic everything was very clean and tidy and the small bar fridge in the room made life a little cheaper as we could store drinks and mixers. The biggest win about this room apart from the amazing view was the bed. With out a doubt this is the best bed I have EVER slept in, I have traveled the world many times for leisure and work (I am a Pilot) and this bed wins hands down. As you will know if you are doing your homework the Vdara is a non smoking, non gambling hotel just off the strip. Plenty of reviews have complaints about the fact you have to walk to the strip and it's too far. Firstly the direct walk down the road takes all of 5 minutes and if you choose to go through the Aria or Cosmopolitan it takes about 10 minutes but you are much further down the strip (side note it may take longer than 10 minutes because you are likely to throw some money in the slots and have a drink). So the location is very good as long as you don't mind a small walk. The gym has coped a little flack in some reviews but it was a very good gym with new Cybrex weight training gear and cardio equipment. Another critique which shows up alot was the security of the hotel. What I noticed was a rather above average standard of security with Guards on the elevators from about 11pm and also a good in room safe. I even witnessed (at 4:30am) a girl having a go at the check in staff for not letting her in with out her card so to say security is poor is off the mark. Only downsides to the Vdara which could be easily fixed by management are that resort fee ($18 + tax per day) which is nothing short of robbery for what comes standard with most rooms around the world. Also the fact you have to order cutlery and plates ect when you first get into your room. These two complaints aside I would highly recommend the Vdara to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value non smoking new hotel”
Reviews.Author: 271blah
Reviews.Content: We met people on a trip who were staying on the 53 floor and could see the Bellagio fountain show (you can't fully appreciate them without the music). It seems to be the only place that has a no smoking casino. It is in a good location for acess to the strip and better value than some of the bigger names directly on the strip whose rep is not all its cracked up to be for the cost

Reviews.Title: “THE VDARA IS LEGIT... EXCEPT FOR THE POOL”
Reviews.Author: mlenio11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Vdara in Las Vegas with my wife for our anniversary. The hotel is pretty new and very modern... our room was amazing and well-deserving of a 5-star hotel label. The hotel is located about a block and a half from the strip... Maybe a 5 minute walk is all. The only complaint aside from not being right on the strip (which I knew booking the trip), is the size of the hotel pool. It's pretty small and pool chairs are very limited. In order for us to get a spot at the pool, we had to be out there around 9:30am. If you're looking for a hotel with a great pool, keep on looking... It's not at Vdara. A few other things to note prior to booking a stay: There is no casino in the hotel; There is no night club in the hotel; There are no shows in the hotel; It's a very quiet and calm hotel... Especially for its size.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: S1traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara in early May and have nothing but good things to say about it! The room was gorgeous, the view fantastic, the food excellent and the service was gracious and very, very helpful! We arrived late on our first evening and still were able to get a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains. We ordered room service and the food was great! The bed was extremely comfortable and the decor was contemporary and stylish. On our second day we took advantage of the spa services - a definite must! Gorgeous spa, really nice staff & the massage therapists are top notch! Every amenity you can think of available in the spa too! We asked for help from the concierge for arranging our last minute plans, and she could not have been more helpful! Las Vegas is a really expensive town for food, entertainment and taxi service, so it wasn't surprising that the cafe in the lobby was pricey for breakfast food. A better idea during the week is to take the 2 minute walk over to the Aria for their breakfast buffet - same approximate cost for so much more choice. If given the choice I would always stay at the Vdara when in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, don't listen to all the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: jenny5000
Reviews.Content: We are actually just wrapping up our trip as I type, we're checking out tomorrow morning :(. When we checked in, I asked how much it would be to upgrade to a fountain view room and the gentleman said $20 per night. He then offered to give me a handicapped accessible room on the 48th floor with a view of the fountain, at no additional charge. He said that he wanted us to have a nice room since we were staying 7 nights. We did have a couple of problems with the room, a clogged bathroom sink and a phone that didn't have a dial tone. With a quick call to the front desk, the issues were taken care of within a half hour. We didn't have any problems with any of the staff being rude at all, everyone has been super friendly. The room is beautiful, with three huge windows with automatic blinds. I just wish that the black out shades were a little wider so that all light would be blocked out and that the mini fridge was bigger to put a styrofoam container in, flat. I think that the larger rooms have a larger fridge. The room has a convection/microwave too, a very nice touch. It is very nice to have two tvs, one in the bedroom area and one in the living room. We did have room service the first night, as the cafe isn't open past 8pm. The food was very good. I had a steak and mushroom salad and my son had the mac and cheese. Do not waste your money at the brunch at Aria on the weekend, it is a waste of money at $25pp. The crab legs were so salty, pretty much unedible, the rest of the food was just mediocre at best. The best part were the desserts, by far. I don't mind paying for good food, but this wasn't good. If you have a chance, go to the Renaissance Hotel, not on the strip, to Envy Steakhouse, this place is phenominal! You can go to Restaurants.com and get a certificate for $50 off a $100 purchase, so worth it! As far as being far from the excitement, that is not true at all. Aria is right across the street, all you have to do is follow the walkway around in a half crescent and you're there. You can also walk through the walkway to get to Bellagio, or go straight to Las Vegas Blvd, via a walkway as well, this will take you to the Cosmopolitan. The tram at Bellagio will take you to Monte Carlo as well. We walked to MGM Grand, Bally's and Paris. As non smokers, it is very nice to not have to deal with the cigarette smell after a long day. There is piped in scent in Vdara, but it is not overpowering at all, since there is no smoke to cover up. My husband was super skeptical about staying here before we arrived due to there not being a casino or restaurants, but has changed his mind and can't wait to come back here next year...he LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Potential”
Reviews.Author: Auburntravels
Reviews.Content: We arrived and requested a room overlooking the Bellagio fountains as most reviewers suggest. The deluxe (basic) room was not available yet but they offered us an upgrade to a one bedroom suite overlooking the fountains for $30 a night. We opted for that. The room was not going to be ready until two hours after the 3 PM check in. We got our keys and promised to wait until 5 to go to the room. We read that dishes are not included and asked for them at check in. Be very specific on what you want. They will only bring you what you request. You want to wash the dishes you asked for? Make sure to ask for a sponge and soap. Got to the room and the requested items were there. The room was very nice. The view was incredible especially at night. A full size refrigerator, microwave and stove. All the comforts of home. The coffee make was broken but they replaced it. An annoying clicking noise in the air conditioner was reported but no one ever came. The first day and our last day our bedroom did not get serviced. We had to call housekeeping to send someone up. I even had the green housekeeping request light on all day! The garbage under the sink was missed the first three days so I moved it out nto the floor so they would surely see it. Housekeeping needs a little more attention. The first morning we went to the well equipped fitness center. Just after returning to our room I hear the front door open. In walk the Carr party much to both of our surprise. They were just assigned the room at check in. After sending them away I contacted the front desk. They said they will call me back in 5 minutes. After 30 minutes there was no call. Checked the key card on the door and it no longer worked. I went downstairs and found the person I spoke with. He apologized and did not have an idea how this happened. He gave us a $100 food and beverage credit for our troubles. Decent. We used the credit while at the pool and in the market. When I went to check out they informed me that there was no credit on my account. I explained the circumstances and they then put the credit on. Then I was told that the credit is only good for items that are served to you from behind the counter or host. Chips, sodas from refrigerator and candy in the market are not included. Deducted from credit. How bizarre! Overall the service was chaotic. The place has god potential but needs a little attention to details. As everyone mentions, the walk is lengthy to get to the strip. However, there are many shortcuts you can discover to make the walk faster. Would I stay here again? Maybe. Once the customer service gets ironed out I would consider it but there are many there higher rated hotels nearby with better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Suite spot or a mishit?”
Reviews.Author: CompressedChi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara a few weeks ago for four night in a hospitality suite. My wife and I were travelling with our two young children, ages 3 and 1, and our au pair so we needed a two bedroom suite. The room itself was impressive--about 1600 square feet with a large open living/dining/kitchen area, two bedrooms with two en-suite bathrooms (each with two sinks, a soaking tub, and separate rain forest shower), a half bath off the entry foyer, and a laundry closet with stacking washer and dryer. The furnishing are modern, yet warm and tastefully done. Bath products by Aveda. Linens and towels are of good quality. The view are to die for, and all the windows feature screens and roman shades that operate by remote control. WiFi included in the resort fee. The whole hotel is non-smoking and non-gaming, which made it a good choice for our family. The lobby of the hotel is open and inviting, and check in was expeditious, but I suspect that was because we arrived on the later side. I saw long lines in the morning for check out and again in the afternoon for check in. The pool is stylish, but cramped, daybeds and cabanas can be rented on a daily basis. By report, there are "hot spots" from the reflection of the sun off the Aria hotel onto the Vdara pool that has caused problems in the past, but we did not encounter them. There is a good sized market with food and drink, but it's hours of operation were somewhat limited. By reserving a hospitality suite, we were offered complementary limo pick up and drop off to and from the airport. The reservations person took our flight info and all our requests (car seats, cribs, kitchenware and cooking utensils, etc) and entered them into the computer, which when I called the reservations line to reconfirm all our requests were entered accurately. Then the problems started. When we arrived at baggage claim, I didn't immediately see the person with the sign with our name waiting for us so I focused on getting our bags off the carousel. After the bags were on a trolley, I called the hotel to find out why no one was there. I was dispatched to the concierge, who never picked up. After at least 7 or 8 calls, it became apparent that the reservations line operates off site and we should have asked to be connected to the front desk of the hotel, which we finally were. At that point, the front desk person contacted the limo driver (who operates out of the adjoining Aria hotel) to come get us. All told, an hour delay from the time we got our bags to the time we arrived at the hotel. Also, the car seats weren't in the limo as promised so we had to wait for another limo to come. When we finally arrived, I was crazed because our children (who were still on east coast time) were crazed, and the front desk manager apologized for the confusion with the limo and offered to buy us dinner (which we later changed to breakfast). When we made the reservations, one the website I noticed that there are three floorplans; we wanted the hospitality suite with the bedrooms together on one wing of the room and the largest dining and living room area. This was not the room we were first brought to, despite my request, and we had to be moved to the room we wanted (which took another 30 minutes). By the time we were settled in, it was well after 11 PM local time (or 2 AM for us New Yorkers). It wasn't clear to me why we weren't given the original room we requested. Also, the isn't clear why each kitchen does not come fully equipped with all the necessary things one needs in a kitchen--plates, cutlery, corkscrew, etc. The next day I had a long chat with the concierge about the limo issue and she was very apologetic about what had happened and kindly offered us complementary use of the pool cabanas during our stay ($200/day if you rent one). Apparently they are very short staffed in the concierge department, which is why it was difficult getting someone to pick up the phone when we were at the airport. They also close the desk after 8 PM which seems ridiculously early for Sin City. During our stay, we saw ferociously long lines for the concierge and were glad we did not need them (the manager gave me her direct line). She was made sure the return to the airport went as scheduled, and it was flawless. Overall the hotel is lovely, but it is a large hotel that need more staff. The concierge desk should be staffed with more people (which they are working on) as should the front desk. If you want to print your boarding passes, they give you access to the business center, but they close it at 5 PM. I'm guessing the housekeeping staff are expected to clean a lot of rooms (which they do a nice job of), but most days the room was not made up until after 3 PM. It took a long time to get your car out of valet parking, but that is par for the course for Vegas. Room service breakfast was outstanding and came in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Marchgal318
Reviews.Content: We went to vegas to get married and althought I've been many times it was my husband's first time...he liked that it wasn't a casino hotel...it was less hectic when we when had to get our car...I love the location, it's just a short walk to the Aria and the Bellagio...we rented a cabana to spend a day by the poo land the staff was very attentive...the room was spacious and clean...we were on the 42nd fl. and had a great view of the fountains at Bellagio...we would definitely saty here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Room Layout - just ok.”
Reviews.Author: steph8632
Reviews.Content: Note: Location of this hotel is not directly on the strip. We hadn't been to Vegas since City Ctr was built so wasn't familiar with how it's situated. It takes about 5 minutes to walk from the Vdara to the strip. Hotel itself is quiet and nice (no casino). We checked in in the middle of the nite due to flight delay and very nice man upgraded us to a full Bellagio view room. The room itself was just ok - weird layout. There's a kitchenette but then the bedroom part is cut off by the sitting area which was not enjoyable. It made the room feel tiny. I appreciated the upgrade but you don't really get the strip view if that's what you're interested in and I don't know if you can from anywhere in the hotel since you're pretty much blocked by other hotels. We left the room the first day around 12:30pm and put on the housekeeping light but the room was unmade when we came in. There was a problem with the sink (water wasn't going down) and it took till day #3 to get that fixed. Booked thru hotels.com and I know that they disclose that there's a resort fee of approx $20 per day added to the rate (that isn't included in the rate itself that you pay) - just a reminder. The wifi that's included in this fee is very, very slow. All in all, the hotel lobby is nice aestically and if you're looking for quiet - no casino - but I wouldn't stay again because of the location and room layout (unfortunately it was too cold to swim so I can't review the pool). The concierge and the valet guys (as at all the hotels that we went to) were really, really nice and helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful experience. Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: lovinglife12345
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night of our wedding. The place was extremely inconveniently located. The rooms were nicely decorated with modern contemporary furnishings. I was not happy with the cleanliness of the room, the sink had noodles in there left by the prior guests. We ordered room service, the moment the room service lady knocked on the door, the lights went out. There was a power outage from approximately 1:30am to around 6am. We were unable to close our blinds, and we had to walk around the hotel room in total darkness, using our cell phones as a light source. This is not something you would expect from a hotel that costs over $200 per night. We had to eat our "room-service" meal in the pitch black darkness. I am utterly disgusted by how things were handled at this hotel, I can understand things can happen, but for a power outage to last 5.5 hours to 6 hours is a disgrace and not safe. When we complained at the front desk the next morning, we were compensated with our room service being waived (approx $24 value) and the resort fee ($18 value) being waived. There was no apology, and quite frankly I think that we and other guests should have been compensated more highly. I have never been so disgusted with a hotel stay in my whole life. Another thing is the hotel is valet-only, meaning you have to wait for your vehicle. We waited 20-25 minutes in the cold & windy outdoors for a vehicle. I would have preferred to have walked to it than to be waiting that long. I received a survey via email to fill out on my Vdara experience, one of the options asked if I wanted to be contacted by a manager. I selected the "yes" option, and still have yet to be contacted. Management does not care. Overall, an extremely poor experience, I will NEVER, ever recommend Vdara to anyone, and will never return.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Onatopp
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? Pros: By far best view, I've ever had on the strip. Stayed on the 48th floor, with the view of the Bellagio fountains. I requested the view at check in and due to the system failure at check in, the clerk was checking me in manually, so as an apology I received the upgrade to the room with a view for no upcharge (normally, 20 dollars per night additional). Pool was very nice, great contemporary view. Music not too loud and not a lot of party crowd which was great for me. And... that's it for the pros.... Cons: Room, definitely NOT 5 star quality, cheap and already damaged furniture. One remote control didn't work. Black out shades weren't exactly black out shades. Bed, was nothing special. Every other 5 star hotel on the strip had better bedding and mattress. Also, lighting was poorly designed, and not easily adaptable. Also NO outlets near the desk or the bed (??), no ipod dock as promised. Room service menu was EXTREMELY limited and the downstairs food shop was simply too overpriced (7 dollars for a coffee??) and had limited seating. Bar scene downstairs was simple and nothing special. From 10 pm to 5 am you can only order three things to eat to the room, and none were vegetarian, or even customizable. Left a sign out the clean my room, and room was never addressed by the housekeeping staff... When I was dining at the next door Cosmopolitan, my credit card got declined. I called my credit card company to find out whats going on, and was informed the VDARA charged 1,700 dollars in charges to my room in a day. When speaking with the front desk, they told me it's simply security deposit on the room and that the charges will get reversed in 3-5 business days. REALLY? 1,700 who did they think was going to stay there? Charlie Sheen and his Goddesses? I received a 50 dollar credit to use upon my stay, (gee, thanks!) and upon check out the clerk finally fessed up saying this was a system error and they didn't understand why my card got charged repeatedly and then was lied about by Vdara's own accounting department. Upon check out, I inquired if I can have a late check out as my flight was later in the day, I was told I can stay until 1pm. At 12:10 security knocked on the doors to my room and asked why I didn't check out, after I already explained I'm staying til 1. At exactly 12:30 another batch of security/bellhop team WALKED into my room, while I was getting dressed, again asking if I'm checking out. No apologies! I wanted to try City Center, and was sadly disappointed. In fact, enraged. If you want to stay at City Center, stay at the Cosmopolitan. Or better yet, the classics like Encore, Palazzo, Bellagio and Mandalay Bay. This is not a 5 star resort. It's a huge disappointment. I was looking forward to a non smoking, non gaming hotel, but in the end wished I stayed at the connecting Bellagio, as I ended up walking there for basically anything from shops to food.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Vdara - Despite power outage!”
Reviews.Author: consuelabanana
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a great stay at the Vdara hotel. This was our fifth trip to Vegas so we do not mind a non-gaming hotel, we have already had the full experience and now enjoy a good value and beautiful room. We stayed Thurs-Sun, on the Saturday night there was a power outage due to a fire behind the Monte Carlo and I will comment on that but first the good! Cab ride from the airport was $15 taking the street not the freeway. Our last stay was at Aria which is the same distance as Vdara but our cab driver took the freeway and the fare was $21. We arrived quite early at 8:45 so we were not expecting a room to be ready. Front desk was very pleasant we asked out what upgrades were available. We went for a Vdara corner suite which was $40 per night. Room was ready at noon. The room was beautiful! Very modern condo decor, lots of browns and grey. I felt it could use better lighting in the evening but lots of natural light in the day. Full size kitchen, nice to have a big fridge for wine! One washroom that had an entrance off the kitchen and the bedroom. Loved the closet and vanity in the bathroom. The tub is not the jet kind but it is very deep and relaxing. I prefer the toilet to have a separate door, my only complaint for the washroom. The bed was very comfortable, I feel that it was a bit lower than a standard hotel bed so that could be a plus or a negative for some. The curtains did allow some light in but I like that it makes sure I don't sleep the day away. We were in room 51006 which had a view of the north strip and Bellagio fountains, also a view to the east of Cosmo, and PH. I could hear a faint sound of bass coming from the club at the Cosmo. Overall it has been the best room I have had in Vegas, including the corner suite at Aria which was still very nice! The accessibility of Vdara to the rest of the strip seems to be a big complaint but I didn't find it to be to bothersome. It is a one minute walk into Aria, and a couple minutes over the walkway to the Bellagio. There are also stairs and an elevator you can take down to Harmon and you can walk along the side walk to the Cosmo. In the morning we would alway take a cab where we wanted to go and would walk back in the afternoon. Now the blackout! We realized the power was out as we were walking back to the hotel, at that time it was all out at CityCenter and the street lights as well. When we got to the hotel we could see no one was going anywhere so we went and hung out at Aria for a while. We came back and were told we could get robes, flashlights and water over at an Aria convention room so we thought why not! We put on our robes and had some fun with it. Once they got an elevator up we were thankfully up in our room relatively quickly. The room had no power still so our flashlights came I handy! When we woke in the morning we called down and asked for a late check out which was not a problem and they also removed our resort fee and any charges we had made to the room which was very generous. I do feel there needed to be some better organization and for the emergency lights to be out as well is not acceptable. I understand things happen and it didn't ruin my time or my review but it is peoples safety on the line. I would absolutely stay at Vdara again.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: THETRAVELER524
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 3 other couples stayed at the Vdara Hotel 5/15/11 thru 5/17/11. We had a lovely room and overall, we were very happy. It was a room with living room, bedroom, small kitchen and very nice bathroom. The room was very nice. By the way, I was told to ask for a room with a divider, which we did. The bed was very plush, and the pillows were heavenly. As a matter of fact, we are going to buy the pillows. It had 2 TV's - one on each side of divider (living room and bedroom). We were very happy and would give it a 10. There were a few things that we were not as happy with. The furniture is not well made, and some of it fell off its hinges. Our maid forgot wash cloths one day, or ice bucket liner, or replaced used glasses. When we first checked in - it was early, they told us to come back in 3 hours. We checked our luggage with bell captain and left - when we returned, we had to wait in line all over again. The staff was no help at all - this is where they could improve. They need to get things worked out on this end. This location of hotel was not one that I would prefer. It seemed we were always either on the Tram, or walking through the hallways to get to the Bellagio, and then to further locations ! But we did enjoy the stay, so overall, I would give this place a "9".

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful oasis from hustle and bustle of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is non gambling, non smoking sits perfectly behind the Cosmopolitan on the "strip".There is easy access to entertainment either in or through Bellagio or Aria onto the strip. The rooms are decadent, we only had the basic, we were on the 51st floor with a view of the Bellagio fountains. Check in was quick and efficient , the concierge were also very efficient. All in all I was very impressed. One word of warning, if you check out using one of the two 42 inch T V's in room do so at the last minute, not only does it turn off the TV's but it also locks the bar fridge, very clever

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Suite - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jojo255368
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vdara a few weeks ago . I was a litte apprehensive about this hotel as I didn't know too much about it but I liked the fact that it was non smoking and non gaming - peace and quiet from the bustle of the strip. I booked a Vdara Suite . Not cheap , but when we opened the door into the room we went - wow - love it - heaps of space , great view and super comfy bed! We were on the 35th floor - it was quiet. Blackout curtains not as good as other hotels we stayed in though. Had washing machine dryer , fridge and all the gear we needed ( not that we ate in room but had option if you want) The cafe in lobby was awesome for breakfast - once again not cheap but you get what you pay for sometimes. Very handy to the new funky Cosmopolitan and the Aria - both beautiful hotels. Check in and out was superb. Great friendly staff - safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a lot worse but Vdara took care of me.”
Reviews.Author: LilPiggyQT
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel from May 13th through May 15th and so was also one of the people caught in the power outage that happened at about 1:30am on Sunday morning. First off though, in reviewing the hotel: This is more of a hotel catered to business folks. There is no casino so the lobby is a lot smaller than you normally would see in Vegas. It also is a smoke-free hotel which was a blessing to me. If you did want to gamble though, there is a short walkway from the Vdara to the Bellagio and the free tram that takes you from the Vdara to the Crystals shopping area, Monte Carlo, and The Cosmopolitan. There is an $18 resort fee (as there are resort fees for every hotel in Vegas) and it pays for the 2 water bottles a day in your room, gym access, and wireless internet access. I thought the fee was priced fairly as I have paid resort fees at other hotels and it did not internet service or water. The room I had booked was the Deluxe Suite and it was very large and big enough for me and my friend. It included a king-sized bed and a pull-out queen sofa bed (you just have to call housekeeping for the sheets for the sofa bed). The sofa bed wasn't the best but the king size bed was pretty confortable. The bathroom had a nice sized tub and the shower is also very large. All of the lights seem to be energy saving bulbs (a good thing in my eyes) as they would be dim when you first turn them on. The room included a teeny fridge (we had brought home leftovers and the containers where too large to all fit in there), a stove, and a microwave. There was no coffeemaker in the Deluxe Suite and you can only order coffee through room service for that room. We checked out the pool also and the “death-ray” thing is no joke. It is a fairly small pool area – make sure you wear lots of sunscreen. I did go to the spa at Vdara and it was smaller than I expected it to be. There was only one whirlpool/jacuzzi, two "heated" stone chairs, a sauna room, and a steam room. The showers were large and they did stock Aveda products at the counters. The robes were extremely comfy and the staff was very nice. Tea, water, some fruit, and some trail mixes were provided also. I did use the concierge of the hotel and they were extremely helpful in getting my name on the guest list for the Marquee Nightclub over at The Cosmopolitan. I was able to get in for free along with a few of my friends because we were all girls. Use them if you are planning to go to a club! The Market Cafe at the Vdara also has a large selection of food and drinks also. There are many to-go lunches and breakfast is served all day. The service can be a little slow as they get hectic and there aren't enough tables and chairs. The food we had was good but the coffee wasn't great. I hope it will be better next time. And on that note, I do plan on coming back to this hotel so there is a next time. I was stuck in the power outage also but I felt that the hotel apologized and compensated me fairly. It was terribly scary to be in the hotel with no emergency lighting on and not being able to see where anything is but I felt they will now be able to handle a situation like that in the future. The staff did make me feel like I would be wanted again at check-out and if it wasn't for the outage; it would have been a nice, normal stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: anna186605
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel good size rooms, we were on 48 floor fantastic view of the strip and bellagio fountains.ate in sister hotel the aria, great value in buffet restaurant something to suit everyone.

Reviews.Title: “power outage not handled well”
Reviews.Author: dfwlink
Reviews.Content: They had a power outage around 1:30 am Sunday morning and it was pitch black. it looked like a disaster area, everyone sleeping where they could find a spot in the lobby. They finally restored some power to two elevators around 5AM to get us to our rooms 10 people at a time, full power was not restored until approx 6AM. One of the employees were in peoples faces telling them to calm down and not to stir panic when they asked what was going on, unapologetic and just told them to basically sit down and shut up. I've never seen this type of treatment to any customers. This person is definitely not the man for the job. The next morning they comped my resort fees for the power outage mishap. They definitely need a contingency plan in the case this happens again, they were not prepared for this. Nice hotel, staff is great with the exception of the one but I'll stay at a different one on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel-Upgrade to the VDARA SUITE”
Reviews.Author: Dave_wiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, the Room was huge,clean and offered everything we could ever want. The house keeping was completed every day and the luxury shampoos/soaps were replaced. The Room was so quiet and of excellent standard. The room even had a Ice maker in the fridge. The 2x 42 inch TV's were ideal and did not spoil the decor of the room. The decor throughout was excellent and even my wife wants the same style in our house. We upgraded to the VDARA Suite and so glad we did as it was a massive room. The Staff were very helpful and went above and beyond to please. I would definitely come back to this hotel. Book without hesitation, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: krazykane
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Vdara on a AAA travel package. Nice place to stay although it's a little out of the way from the rest of City Center and the Strip. Pros: - Good sized suite - Two 32" HDTVs - Quiet - Non-smoking Cons: - Bit of walking necessary to get anywhere else - No casino, one restaurant - Low shower pressure - For some strange reason there was only one wastebasket in the bathroom Vdara even has its own smell you will notice when you walk into the lobby area. I would recommend this hotel for its value as long as you don't mind some walking. It's a short walk to Aria and Bellagio. The tram will take you to Crystals (a high-end mall) and as far as the Monte Carlo. The new Cosmopolitan is across the street. There is a $18/day room charge for Internet access and use of the fitness center. I was not put off by this charge - it's reasonable. There are also Internet terminals available for a charge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: UniversalGC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara for three nights starting May 12th and couldn't have had a better experience. We were in a two-bedroom penthouse on the 54th floor and the view was the best I've ever had in Vegas. Our room overlooked the Bellagio fountains, which provided us a great show each night. The room itself was also excellent. Great beds, big bathroom with tub and shower, great kitchen, etc... Every staff member we encountered was on top of their game and a did a great job of making us feel welcomed and appreciated. We had room service every morning for breakfast and once for dinner, and the quality of the food and presentation was excellent. The French toast, in particular, was awesome. There is absolutely nothing I can complain about or would have changed about our stay . It's an excellent property and value. Don't hesitate if you're considering booking a room at Vdara!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Excellent Service Just Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JIG101
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation here only because all of the corporate rate rooms at The Bellagio were taken by the time i reserved and my Bellagio suggested I call Vdara. I was a bit concerned after reading reviews here and having stayed at the MGM Signature once when the MGM was full and not liking the Signature (too quiet, too far, I could have been in Cleveland). Happy to report happily surprised. Vdara is an easy 2 minute walk to Bellagio and my room was actually closer to the conference center than many of the people staying at Bellagio. Partied late at Bellegio once or twice and stumbling back to Vdara was no issues at all. Also discovered that Vdara is an equal two minutes to Aria. And from there Cosmopolitan was a stones-throw and from there whole strip is in your face. Actually liked returning to smoke free less hectic place to bed down. Vdara is so close to happening hotels/casinos/restaurants that you don't miss them in the lobby. Room itself was good too. Comfortable bed, clean, new amentities, large. I had no problem with service. I also had the view of the Bellagio fountains which is cool (and many in the Bellagio don't have it). You can tell this is a failed condo deal as the rooms have full kitchens but no plates, silverware, etc (whic is available on request). I didn't request. Negitives: Being picky, the food service is the lobby is very slow. After a typical Vegas late night, getting a cup of coffeee is a bit of a challlenge. The pool is not up to Vegas pool standards and the heat reflection off the building on the pool is very real. If you're going for the pool scene, I might look elswhere. All in all, the place was excellent and the price is right relative to all of the surrounding properties. My room was half the price or less of an equal or lesser room at Bellagio or Aria and, if I didn't know better, I would have believed the Vdara is the new addition to either.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Suite-only Hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: v3ryb0r3dguy
Reviews.Content: The actually rating is more like 4.5 out of 5. (I just rounded up) Vdara was very nice. I've stayed at the Trump in Las Vegas and this is very comparable to it. Although it does not have a casino, it's connected to ARIA, which has a very nice casino. The room was very modern and comfortable. I especially loved the plush pillow-top mattress. Since it was still very new, the room is very clean and tidy. Our suite also had an electric stove top, microwave, and kitchen sink. Also those amenities made it that much better. I'm used to staying in 5-star locations (Wynn, Aria, Palazzo, etc.) and Vdara was no exception. The only downside I could recall was that the included shampoo and soap didn't have the best scent. It smelled kinda like citrus, but it was kinda gross compared to other hotels' shampoo and soaps I've used in the past. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in a new hotel/resort and enjoys not having a casino direct below you.

Reviews.Title: “Average, modern hotel. ATROCIOUS guest service despite comps.”
Reviews.Author: ScoNo
Reviews.Content: If you're the average Vegas type who wants to have a nice suite but you're not really an upmarket traveler, Vdara will impress. If you typically travel well, you'll hate this place. I was there for a friend whose mother just passed so we had a week to get it all sorted out as efficiently as possible without any hiccups. We needed this trip to be seamless. Being an admitted anal retentive freakshow I figured I'd write the property an email stating the cleanliness issue I have with every room (I know this is nitpicking, I'm aware, but one stays at luxury properties an expected level of service), my travel mate's mother's death and could they please make a quick effort to check our room before we get there. That mail went unanswered and we were given a room with room service trays and shoes boxes still there, not to mention the laundry left in the hall in Vdara-branded bags. The next room had a wet puddle in the bathroom and a band-aid we later found next to the bed and closet. How does this happen? Skip my ODC anal retentive issues, rooms like that should never be released back into inventory. When we called to complain all we heard we was "I'm sorry." At premium properties all employees are empowered to make their guests' stay as enjoyable as possible. At Vdara, it seems the Vegas money extraction strategy is in play. Get the cash but stiff em when they need something. The rest of the trip was a comedy of miscues. Housekeeping never cleaned our suite the next day, insisting the DND light was on despite the actual cleaning lady looking at it with with me while they told me their system said it was on. And then the next day they called to apologize for not cleaning the room that day despite the fact the room was cleaned. Other reviews have mentioned the issue with bowls and plates and silverware and they had no signage in our room telling us to call. They did, however, leave two dirty coffee mugs. We must have had the bad mojo cleaning gods angry with us on this trip because it was just FAIL AFTER CUSTOMER SERVICE FAIL. Now, with all this complaining comes many great things and i wanted to leave the end of the review with a good taste because despite our massive screw ups from them, the hotel is not a dump. Let me tell you why: Spa was amazing. We did two days of spas and both of us had zero complaints. I think Lonnie was the massage therapist and she's amazing. Perfect pressure. Despite my travel mate's cheesy, bad tourist faux pas of asking for more freebee lotions and conditioners, housekeeping was gracious (I know I'd be cursing us under my breath) Valets were efficient and not valet-y jerks Super central location Killer showers and tubs The en-suite laundry is always a nice bonus Pretty People-friendly (if you're a braided hair, NASCAR type, this is the wrong place for you) In conclusion, Vdara was just an OK stay with a slew of freaky errors. They were extremely generous in their comps and we're very appreciative of them. However, if comps never fix a problem, that's a problem. Go into Vdara with a slightly tilted eye towards guest service and you'll have a great time. "We have 1500 rooms" as an excuse is unacceptable when there are room service items, bandaids and roaches (see snaps) left in rooms. Nice try Vdara but you barely get a C on this review.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel that is clean and smoke-free”
Reviews.Author: Big_Dave75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our stay at The Vdara Hotel & Spa. We loved the fact that the hotel was smoke-free. The entire property smelled fresh and this was refreshing compared to the other hotels and casinos we visited. The hotel was in close proximity to Bellagio and Aria for when we wanted to gamble. A short walk away, you can access the tram at Bellagio and ride from there to CityCenter/Aria and on to the Monte Carlo. This was also nice because of all the walking you have to do in Vegas and any steps saved is a plus. The front desk was very friendly and accomodating to our requests. Zach especially deserves recognition for his polite and courteous help. We were there for our anniversary, and when Zach learned of this, he complimentary upgraded us to a larger suite with a view of the Bellagio fountain show. Nice!!! The rooms are large and have a refrigerator, microwave, and stove in the kitchen area. Beds are very comfortable and we had great nights sleep after all the long walking we did. Only downside is hotel is not right on the strip. In order to get out to the strip, you have to go through Bellagio and then out to strip. We would definately stay here again though because of all the helpful staff and relaxing atmospere.

Reviews.Title: “Caught a stranger in my room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jyl246
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I went to Vegas last week for a convention. Got done around 6pm and went to my room to change. I unlocked the door and was SHOCKED to find a non-staff person IN MY ROOM! The guy was half way in my room. Apparently, he was just as shocked as I was. He had his suitcase in hand and said the front desk must have issued him the wrong room!!!!! Can you believe that?! I had my laptop out, valuables all around the counter and my girlfriend had JUST left the room after showering/changing. The fiasco doesn't stop there. I called the front desk and spoke with a manager. He was just as stunned and apologized saying 'it's no excuse for a hotel of this caliber'. He issued me a $100 credit (drop in the bucket compared to what I spent on the room) and asked if he could put me on hold. I told him we were in a rush to catch a show. The fiasco doesn't stop there. So the next day, I go to the front desk to check out. I asked them about the credit. He knew nothing about the credit until I told him about it. He then took off the resort fee ($40 total) and told me that it was a "resort credit" and I had until the end of my stay to use it. I went nuts. I was LEAVING that day! He got a manager and she was absolutely terrible. She placed blame on ME. Maybe the room door wasn't closed all the way, blah blah. Wow. So I go to the only cafe on site and purchased $60 of stuff I didn't want. The fiasco doesn't stop there. Today (a week later) I found a bill for $60 on my credit card. Email and paper trail has begun.......fiasco continues Hotel review: Aside from this fiasco, the rooms are very nice and clean. I wouldn't stay there again (aside from the incident above) because it's a far hike from the strip. You have to walk through a the side hallway of Vdara that connects to the back end (convention end) of Bellagio. At the end of nights, we all know how much walking there is in Vegas. After a tired night of walking, you get to the strip entrance of Bellagio thinking you can't wait to get in the room. Keep in mind that once you get to the entrance of the Bellagio, you have another 10-15 minutes of walking to Vdara. The end.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and quiet for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SaigonGrill
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a great suite-only hotel that's part of the city center area. There are connecting walk-ways to Aria and Bellagio. The hotel does NOT have a casino and is smoke free. They are very clear on this in their information. We picked this hotel for that very reason, we wanted a quiet place to go back to and have a good sleep. The rooms were very nice and comfortable, modern decor and spacious kitchen-area and bathroom. The main place for eating at the Vdara was the market café that was open between 6 am and 8 pm. They served breakfast and lighter dishes for lunch. The Aria, however, is just a short walk away where they have plenty of dining options available. The Vdara got an extensive fitness and SPA area as well as a pool-area hovering over the Harmon circle. The pool-area was medium sized but nicely arranged. By the pool one could also find a poolbar that served breakfast and lighter dishes while the pool was open. The Vdara pool was unfortunately closed part of our stay due to heavy winds while other hotels could have their pools open as they were on ground level and surrounded by hotel buildings, but that was also the only downside of it. Overall great hotel, very nice and good value. It's still pretty new so it's not worn down like some other strip properties. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Pool Music Outrageously Loud”
Reviews.Author: dakine94110
Reviews.Content: The pool deck music was so loud I couldn't hear my friends in conversation, let alone my own ipod. Then, the cleaning crew at night played the pool radio so loud you'd think there was a special event at the pool - all the way from 6pm to 6am.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nikliss
Reviews.Content: Just off the strip;recommended by a friend;luxurious suite:we would have paid double what we did for a similar property in Australia;great little emporium in lobby ,even if slightly pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: richards157
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel to stay at. Stayed on the 19th floor Huge deluxe suite Cal king bed 2 flat screens Close to city center and Aria casino. Right next store to Belligao. Only con is getting into the Cosmopolitan as all the hotels are not connected

Reviews.Title: “Overall great but a few changes would make a big difference.”
Reviews.Author: RoxyRigby
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Vdara and had a really great stay. The room was beautiful and beyond comfortable. The scented lobby smells great. The location is fantastic if you aren't traveling with a car. The fitness center has plenty of good quality equipment. All in all it's a great place and I would happily stay again. There were however a few areas that could use improvement. First, each room has a kitchenette which is an option that I love. Also, I had read that robes were an amenity that was included, another thing I love about nice hotels ( I can't find any information about this now, so perhaps that is changing). But when we arrived we found that while we had a kitchenette we had no plates, bowls, pans, silverware, etc. There was no information to be found about this in the room. No robes either. We learned that those things are available by request which we found out when we called housekeeping and they were delivered to our room in a timely manner. (By the way, the robe was perhaps the softest robe I've ever worn.) The thing that could be done better? That phone call, the one where you're trying to find out if you're supposed to have pans, robes, whatever...it can be such an awkward call to make. It always makes me feel so tacky and like I'm a huge bother to the staff. I don't think I'm alone on this. This is my suggestion for Vdara: It would be nice if there was either printed information in the room letting you know to make the call or if you were asked at check in about your need/desire for these things. Guests would be able to avoid the uncomfortable phone call and feel that their needs had been anticipated ahead of time. Second, is a matter that absolutely needs to be addressed. It was not uncommon for piles of laundry to remain in the hall for hours at a time, with no sign of housekeeping in the vicinity. One day in particular, we could see three piles from our door, which isn't that long a section of hallway as the hallways curve. The piles remained the majority of the day, well into evening. On another day, a similar thing happened with a room service cart. The room across the hall from us had set their room service cart in the hall (a lot of uneaten food on it) sometime before I went to the fitness center at 8:00am. It remained in the hall until sometime after we went out at 9:00pm. For a minimum of 13 hours, partially eaten pizza sat outside our door. That is really gross. Even at your absolute laziest, you don't do that at home. Perhaps there were communication problems during our stay and maybe it's not the norm, but at least for us the hallway situation was very disappointing, unprofessional and just plain nasty. That shouldn't be allowed to happen in this quality of an establishment. As I mentioned at the beginning, it is a really great place, there are just a few things that need a little tweaking and I'm confident that management will work to rectify them. So in spite of the inconveniences, I would happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A chilled, classy, smoke free Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudyChalmersWannabe
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, smooth check in. Very calm, quiet affair. I asked for a high room if possible and we certainly got our wish!!- 55th floor ! It was a treat opening the electronic blinds to reveal a cracking vista. It was jawdropping, especially as on other visits to las vegas we havent been so lucky with the views. We were looking out over towards luxor, mandalay bay etc and could see incoming flights in the distance. Accomodation was v nice. lovely kitchen and bathroom with Tv next to sink. v good cleanliness, lots of towels and flannels. I travelled with my sister and she slept in the double bed and I had the double sofa bed which although was ok, I would have preferred option of an actual bed, as not as comfortable, a thin mattress. Two negatives. On the first night, as we went straight to bed, having arrived late at night,there was a loud whooshing noise which ruined our first nights sleep. We could not block it out even with a pillow over our heads. It sounded like an aircraft engine. it turned out to be coming from a vent in kitchen, as open plan we could not shut door on kitchen. In the morning I went to reception quite stressed and tired expecting a battle to sort it. Luckily, they said fine we ll get a technician to come up. Not long after a guy appeared and explained that because its an eco friendly hotel and we were so near the top floor it was literally fast flowing air shooting up to the roof. So he promptly applied a criss cross of gaffer tape and the sound was blocked off, which was blissful silence when done. so problem sorted only one night affected. Second gripe, being Brits I wanted a kettle. I asked at reception for mugs, plates, cutlery etc also as none supplied, as I heard you had to ask. Everything was available but no kettles left. She put me on a list to get a kettle but never got one in the week we were there. Bit annoyed as I quite liked that idea when booking and dont drink coffee. I ended up with a pan, boiling water in the morning for a brew. Not the end of the world but a bit of a pain as the kitchen was a nice addition with Bosch microwave/Gaggenau hob and felt a bit naff putting pan on in such a slick suite . Pool nice but a bit posey and music too loud to hear my own Ipod or concentrate on book so gave up with it. Im not a huge pool fan though and hey its Vegas. It was a contrast to such a chilled vibe everywhere else. Even though 5 * hotel it wasn't stuck up at all. I think a few families came for the weekend as nonsmoking/gaming resort with notably very polite, quiet children. Also I smiled to myself when in lift with some American teens who had just collected huge takeaway pizzas and no one batted an eyelid. All in all the Vdara was great. I read other reviews about visitors complaining about walking etc. Yes Vdara is a bit out of the way but just cut through the Bellagio or use the fabulous free monorail to City Center. It was quite nice to feel as if in a retreat. To be honest Vegas isn't the place to go if you dont like walking as its a necessity, as even each hotel is vast. I like walking and its good to burn off some calories from the really nice but not so healthy food we indulged in. Also worth a mention is the wifi (although not free, covered in resort fee) It worked perfectly, and was very handy indeed, even checking into flights home etc.

Reviews.Title: “It lived up to all my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ShyOneVancouver
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas, and I had gotten two rooms here at Vdara. I don't usually stay in hotels, and so I don't have much experience with hotels and service they provide. But seeing as how every employee greeted me with a smile, I'm definitely satisfied with the service of this place. Check-in and check-out were fast (although there was a wait for check out). House-keeping came every day, and when we requested for things, they came within half an hour. One problem I had, which I think was due to them trying to satisfy the request we put in, was the cleanliness of the one of the rooms we had. They had left a cup of juice on the dining table, a pair of underwear on the desk, and did not change the soap in the bathroom. But they cleaned this all up, and the two people in the room were satisfied with that. We did a lot of walking here, and my entire group was very happy with the distances to get to these places. We tried to find the walkway from Bellagio to Vdara, and it wasn't easy (granted that we had a problem with signs in all the hotels). Plus, it is super close to Aria. Sleep was good, and didn't hear anything, but our rooms weren't facing the strip. The King sized bed was comfortable, but the sofa bed wasn't as much. You could feel the springs. But when I actually fell asleep, I didn't even feel them, and slept all the way through. No back problems when I woke up. I am happy with our stay, and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: HonoluluVisitor
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Vdara in a 2 bedroom Penthouse suite for 2 nights. Easy check in (still a bit unfriendly) and very clean rooms compared to a year ago when still had the construction dirt and dust. Everything working this year. Cheaper by about $200.00 night so figure not is all well in Las Vegas these days for the higher priced hotels. Asked for a late check out to 2:00 p.m. (Noon is check out) and was told I could have for an extra $100.00. Decided against it. The Vdara appeared to be almost deserted and it would have been nice to have the extra 2 hrs. especially in light of having a disabled person with us. Oh well!!!! This is Las Vegas. Due to convenience and having the large suite, will stay again at the Vdara. Oh, nice to have a coffee shop in the Vdara this year. Simple, but convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Valet smoked in my car, service is poor - go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: 1933avalanche
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel after four nights at the Trump because we wanted to stay at different ends of the strip in non-smoking hotels. While Trump had everything you needed (Le Creuset kettle, Cuisinart? blender, coffeemaker, bathrobes, dishes etc) we had to specifically ask for each item when we checked in. There is a kitchen in the room, but nothing is provided. Seriously "I'd like 2 forks, 2 spoons, 2...." It took 3 calls and about 6 hours to get bathrobes. I don't drink coffee, but my spouse does and they try to trap you in to getting room service coffee or heading to the shop in the lobby. Speaking of the lobby, it had an overpowering smell of a Grandmother's cheap cleavage powder, which they might want to reconsider because a lot of people staying there are doing it for the non-smoking feature and are probably sensitive to strong scents. The valet smoking in my car was the final straw, it was the only thing I bothered to complain about at the front desk and I was met with an "Oh, sorry." The kicker: this place cost more than the Trump!

Reviews.Title: “"No problems coming back here"”
Reviews.Author: sclarkdundee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for a week recently and although we had read mixed reviews on Tripadvisor, we can't find much wrong with this hotel. Pretty good location, whenever we needed the staff they were available and generally pretty helpful. Only once did I feel the need to tell some one off but the girl on reception was so nice ... I couldn't bring myself to do it!! lol The cafe was a bit pricey but to be honest we did find all of Vegas extremely pricey this time. Having said that, I would go back tomorrow. Would I stay at the Vdara again? Why not though the last time we stayed at the Bellagio and that was much nicer. If you are in Vegas, you could do a lot worse than the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “My preferred hotel for all my Vegas travels”
Reviews.Author: beakr
Reviews.Content: This is now my preferred hotel for when I go to Vegas, I am there about once every two months. Staying in a location that does not have a casino located on the property helps make it a easy check in and check out as well as makes for a quiet stay. This last stay was the 5th time I have stayed here and as always it was great and the staff is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous luxury and rock bottom price”
Reviews.Author: NTHurrrzz
Reviews.Content: Arrived very early at check-in - 11am (normally 4pm) so didn't expect a room ready. Check-in staff confirmed this but offered un upgrade for $20 or come back at 4. Because we wanted to get stuck in to Vegas - $20 was nothing. We were whisked up to 43rd floor - expecting perhaps a bit more room and walked into the most amazing apartment room with full kitchen, dining, living room, bedroom and bathroom. It had full 270 degree panoramic views across Vegas. We couldn't believe. Truly stunning. Hotel is non-smoking ( a welcome break from the smokey casinos) and although set back from the strip only a 10 min walk to the heart of the strip. Like all Vegas hotels - it has a compulsory resort fee to cover newspaper and internet access - I don't know why they just don't incorporate it into the room rate - just factor it in when you are considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: promisesfound
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed at the Aria in a city view corner suite & loved it! This year we decided to try the Vdara. We got a great rate on one if the 270 degree panoramic suites that also included $50 a dining credit & free tickets to Viva Elvis! This hotel is fabulous. All non-smoking & no gaming so it has a much quieter atmosphere-less of the party scene. These large suites are like little apartments. Kitchens even a washer & dryer! And the robes are simply heaven. I'm seriously considering shelling out $95 to get one! There are no restaurants on property (they do have in-room dining) but with so much within walking distance & the Tram to Bellagio & Monte Carlo it's not a big deal at all. We will definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jaci01
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked when reading some of the other reviews. Check-in was easy, and the front desk was friendly. We were upgraded to the 1 Bedroom Penthouse which was absolutely amazing. The room was beautiful, the staff was friendly and the location was perfect! It was so nice being away from the crazy casino hotels. We are a young couple and enjoyed relaxing in a quiet hotel after a long day of being on the strip. We have absolutely no complaints and will only be staying at the Vdara when we visit Las Vegas! Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with terrible management”
Reviews.Author: cortney
Reviews.Content: The designers did a spectacular job designing this hotel. It is absolutely gorgeous, with the pinnacle being the spa facilities. My friend and I had the best massages here that we had ever had (I had the 80 minute “jet lag massage”, and she had an 80 minute deep tissue). But the downside: this hotel is terribly managed. The staff in every department (except the spa) was shoddy. Starting with checking in, the front desk staff was unable to tell us what services/features were included in our package. Then they told us our room was near the tram, and they'd move us to a quieter room far from the tram. The room they sent us to was immediately above the tram. ??? We were so confused that they put us here after specifically offering to move us further away. Then, it took 30 minutes for someone to arrive with our new room keys. The pool area is very chic, but the cabanas are being used as storage closets. Room service trays are left in the hall for 24 hours, even after room service specifically asked us to have our tray available for pick-up an hour after our order. Someone spent a lot of money designing this place, only to have management ruin it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Non-Smoking”
Reviews.Author: fernandf
Reviews.Content: Being a non-smoker and also someone that rarely gambles I would say that this hotel fit the glove perfectly! The rooms are plush and mine had a kitchenette, central system window shutter, huge room with a couch and magazines (not that I stay in the room a lot but when I was there I enjoyed myself). The bathroom was also super modern with a podium bathtub. The service was great and also had a tram that connects a bunch of hotels and attractions together. Another plus side was that when it comes to go out you ask for the concierge to put you on the guest list and since you stay at this beautiful hotel they put you on any list!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet place with some minor issues, no restaurant or casino, not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: MIJZ
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice room, fast elevators (never waited more than about 10 seconds--much appreciated when on vacation), no casino and not too crowded, room was quiet, slept well, free valet parking.
