Cons: No utensils or coffee maker in the kitchenette, had to ask for utensils and would not provide a coffee maker, poor water pressure in the room, music at the pool too loud, not on the strip (5-10 minute walk through Bellagio or Aria), no restaurant, slight smell of sewage outside (I guess it's common in most Vegas properties), sometimes takes more than one request to get something. Comments: This is a nice hotel especially if you like a more modern feel but you have to go elsewhere for a restaurant or casino. The Bellagio is connected by a covered walkway and the Aria is next door. The pool is nothing to write home about and the music is so loud at the pool I couldn't even hear my iPod with headphones on. I asked them to turn down the music and after the fourth time they finally did. They pump some kind of scent into the lobby, possibly to cover up the occasional slight smell of sewage from outside which you can also smell at the pool and probably other hotels nearby. If you are sensitive to smells this might bother you. Much less crowded than other properties that have casinos and therefore more quiet. There is a snack bar for breakfast and lunch, the food is decent. The workout facility is average. There is a daily resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - some tips to make it better”
Reviews.Author: runnergirl1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and we had great experience with housekeeping. I researched this hotel before we stayed and still was unprepared for a few things, so I hope this helps if you are going to stay at Vdara. Ask for double of what you think you will need for plates, silverware, etc., then you won't be calling down constantly for replacements. We had a Keuring coffeemaker so when we picked up breakfast food for the room, we just picked these up and we had coffee each morning. If you go to the market like I did the first morning - $8.50 for 2 cups of coffee. Food and/or drink (even in plastic) is discouraged at the pool. I had to offer to let the pool attendant look in my bag to prove I did not have any glass or beer. We just had apples, Gatorade and chips and I was given a very disgusted look. I guess that is why you can't find a garbage can anywhere in the pool area. Also as far as the pool, this hotel has real problem that was not realized until it was built. The sun reflects off the building onto the pool area. It is like being under a magnifying glass. They do not allow the umbrellas on the far side of the pool to be closed until 2pm for this reason. There is a fire department at the base of this hotel. My husband is a firefighter and stopped in. They said they came to the hotel with a heat measuring gun and the temperature in the pool area measured 165 degrees!! We resolved this issue but not going until later but then it is hard to find a chair. This hotel is next door to Cosmopolitan. That is a huge attraction for clubgoers and even though I was on the 29th floor, I could hear the music at night. It did not keep me up but I did not realize that was going to be an issue. Overall if I ever went to Vegas again, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Alwaystraveling78
Reviews.Content: I normally check reviews before making reservations, but my husband did this one by himself. I was a little nervous about the hotel after reading some of the negative reviews on this site, but I have to say we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a little set back from the strip, but that never bothered us. The walk really over to the Aria or Bellagio is very easy and frankly not having to navigate my way through a casino to get to my room was a nice benefit. The rooms are very well appointed and spacious. When we first arrived we asked for more hangers and a robe, both were brought to the room very promptly. The staff were fine, but I do think the girls at the front desk could do with a little more trainning. They did seem a little green and overworked. The Market Cafe located in the lobby is a great place for breakfast. The food was good and on the whole the price is right. The pool area is nice and we found the service to be good. On the whole I would stay at Vdara again. We had a really niec trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cauchemars
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week over the Easter weekend. It was a nice retreat to come back to after a long day. We were in the Vdara Suite, with a full kitchen and washer and dryer. Unfortunately it was difficult to obtain dishes or cutlery, and once they were used and taken away, we weren't brought replacements. It took us two days to get detergent for the washer, and this was only good for one wash. At the end of the week, I requested another package of detergent, and told that they were all out, and should go to a convenience store. The room was immaculate, and always cleaned promplty. All in all it was a very nice stay. The easiest way to the strip is through the main hotel doors, and down the side of the Cosmopolitan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...”
Reviews.Author: CThom7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid-week, so our price was probably not representative of what one might pay for a weekend visit, but we paid 3 star prices for a 5 star room. It is an incredibly stylish and well-designed hotel, with rooms to match. Our "basic" suite was about 600 square feet of well-furnished luxury, with two TVs, and a fantastic view. We also liked the fact that the Vdara is not a gaming hotel, meaning the lobby was nice and low key, rather than infested with traffic. Links up with the Bellagio through a walkway and is a two minute walk to the Aria. No complaints about our service. Friendly concierge, front desk and housekeeping service.

Reviews.Title: “No Smoking - No Casino= Sanctuary from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JK_Goldfish
Reviews.Content: I came to Las Vegas for my Brother's birthday and with my boyfriend who was there on business with a convention at the Cosmo. I visit Las Vegas frequently to visit with my family, however this was only the second time I have stayed in a hotel while at home. The funny part of this visit was that I was dead set on staying at the Cosmo after seeing all of their ads on TV and on the internet - but I can tell you I made the right choice in booking with Vadara. From what I was told, Vadara was going to be a luxury condo suite in the heart to f the new City Center and was not intended to be a hotel, but the market fell out and now it is what it is, which is a a very clean, affordable, quite, and luxurious place to stay when visiting the infamous "Sin City". Here were my likes: The very, very clean rooms were big and spacious, had a kitchenette with a microwave/ convection oven, small two burner stove, huge bathroom with beautiful over sized tub, stunning views, excellent breakfast from room service (even if it was 30, I was hungry, it was delicious and I ate in my underwear watching the sun rise in the desert. Worth every penny - trust me) in fact, I ate here a lot, the snacky bar menu was well executed and reasonably priced. Just as we were leaving, they opened a little posh-high end grocery store and were closing their in house restaurant. It was the answer to "why do I have a kitchen in my room?" The city center is a bit off the main strip, but easily accessible. My bottom line on this hotel - if you love the fun of Las Vegas but want a quiet and luxurious place to stumble in and out of, and a good nights sleep, this is the place! Clean, quiet, and beautiful. I believe the place was still working out the kinks in their service, but overall, all the staff tried to provide us with excellent service - a big shout out to Britney who let us use office services after hours so I could complete my payroll while on the road. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend this place highly!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more...”
Reviews.Author: kkwokl
Reviews.Content: With all the good reviews in tripadvisor... I chose this hotel and It was a regret.... I booked the hotel for one week and they put me in a very low floor. I asked for a higher floor and the front desk agent told me that that was the only one available. Never contacted me for a room change. The room is really nice but it was dirty. The housekeeping did a really bad job in cleaning the room for my whole stay. The wine glass had oil stain, which I found it really disgusting. The bathtub had a black stain, which I did not use at all because I find it dirty. The computer desk, coffee table, night table and dinning table was dusty for my whole stayed. In my whole week stayed, they only refill the complementary water 3 times. The bed was comfortable but the pillows was terrible! Got a neck pain on the next day. I would not recommend Vdara if you are going for the first time. You are not going to experience the real Vegas. It takes you around 8 minutes to get to the strip and 12 minutes to get to the bus stop. On my last day I asked for a late check out (just 1 extra hour) and they told me that I need to pay a fee. I stayed for one whole week and they are going to charge me for one hour extra? Vdara has a really terrible service for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, poorly run”
Reviews.Author: John7654
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara over Easter weekend with our kids, ages 11 and 15. This is a beautifully designed and comfortable hotel, but it is poorly run. There are many examples, but I'll just mention three: (1) Housekeeping & Maintenance. When we opened the sofa bed, we found dozens of M & M's and Skiddles there. Gross. The reading lamp was broken next to the bed. Maintenance told us that they could not replace the bulb. The wall shades we broken when we arrived. (2) Kitchen. The hotel advertises its beautiful kitchens. They are top-of-the-line, but contain nothing you'd need to use them. We had to make three calls just to get pots & pans, plates, and utensils. When they finally arrived (only to be taken away again the next day), we realized that none of the kitchen basics were provided -- no dish cloths, dish soap, not even a trash can in the kitchen. (3) Hours. It was blazing hot while we were there, and the pool was packed. But they closed it down and kicked us all out at 6:00 p.m. Bizarre. There is something very "off" about the way this hotel is run. We would not stay there again unless new management took over.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyingLife23
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Vdara with another couple & we couldn't have been happier with just about everything .... check-in was quick & easy, we had a beautiful room on the 30th floor overlooking the mountains, & we had plenty of towels & supplies for ourselves & our friends. We absolutely loved the bathroom as it was easy for two girls to share the same vanity area while getting ready to go out & the kitchen was wonderful for storing snacks & drinks that we brought ourselves. We loved our bed, even though we didn't sleep much as we are in our 20s, & our friends had no complaints about the sofa bed. We visited the spa one day for massages & it was the most amazing spa experience!!! We will be going back to the spa this year for my birthday! The only complaint we had was that we had to walk to & through the Bellagio every day to get out to the strip. The walk is only about 10 minutes or so, but being a younger group, we would've enjoyed not having to walk so far late at night/early in the morning to return to our rooms after an evening out. However, we loved how close the Vdara was to the Aria & we enjoyed going there for some good food, gambling, & drinks! Overall, we had a GREAT stay & the Vdara & would highly recommend it to anyone .... especially those who like to be away from the hustle & bustle that is Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay at Vdara.”
Reviews.Author: LVTravel99
Reviews.Content: Just finished another trip to Vegas. This was my second stay at Vdara. The room I got was smaller than my last visit. However, over all it was still top notch vs other standara five stars hotels in town. It had a mini kitchen, microwave, and a sitting area for eating. Plates and utensils were delivered promptly upon request. I had a minor problem with the drain in the bathroom sink, the problem was fixed within hours. The room had a good view, and at night, it was totally silent. I enjoyed the pool although it was a bit crowded. I loved the close proximity to Aria - by far the best casino with fantastic decor and architecture. I also had some luck with the slots there. My only the complaint is the entrance and exit to the hotel -somewhat confusing and the signs are too small. If you want a quiet santuary with a room to stretch out, I highly recommend Vdara!

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: lovetennis99
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. Our initial "suite" was 1 room w/ sleep sofa, and kitchenette hallway. Way too small for a family of 4. Hotel was very accomodating and upgraded us to a 1 bedroom corner room with a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountains. The room had a nice sized master bedroom, 2 bathrooms, a huge living room and kitchen for an additional $75/ night. Well worth the extra money. This hotel is located within walking distance to almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice for Us.”
Reviews.Author: sugarmag13
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I did my homework before booking the Vdara. I read reviews, asked questions and made sure I knew what I was getting. Check-in was less than 5 min. I had booked a fountain view room and the girl said "oh, you wanted a pool view, ummmm noooo I requested fountain view." She quickly found us another room. Room was beautiful, bathroom perfect with that awesome tub. 2 flat screens, bed was soooo comfy. The only complaint and one of the little reasons I gave a 4 not a 5 was the AC. We like it extremely cool and could not get it to drop below 69. We set it at 50 and still wouldnt get cooler. We asked the desk to send someone, and I dont know of they actually showed up or not, but it still didnt get any cooler. The hallways were also VERY warm. They must be cutting corners on AC. It was uncomfortable and it was only 80 degrees outside, I'd hate to be there in warmer weather. I also spoke to the desk about that, but who knows if they did anything about it. The pool was small but fine for us. We both had massages at the spa and they were average. The spa itself it beautiful. Yes, the hotel is a tiny bit away from the craziness, but that is why I chose it. Honestly anyone complaining about how far away it is must be really lazy or in really bad shape. I have a disc problem in my back and it was fine. A 5 min. walk to Bellagio or Aria. 10 min. over the bridge to Paris and Ballys. We loved coming back at night and having complete peace and quite. No smoking was also a plus. Everytime we walked through the Bellagio I was thankful we chose Vdara, it was always craziness in the lobby there. I agree they need to re-open the restaraunt, I do not understand why they closed it. Coffee shop was ok, but the lines were always long. Was it pricey...yes...but so were all the other shops! All the staff we encountered were very nice and polite. I would absolutely recommend the Vdara and would definitely stay there again. We also saw Cirque's Love while there and would definitely recommend that everyone go see it. Carlos Santana was also fabulous. I will add some restraunt reviews here if anyone is interested. Rare 120 at the Hard Rock was nice, the Sea Bass was wonderful as was the filet. Service was good and our waiter was very attentive. Onda at the Mirage was a huge disappointment. The food was excellent, but the service was so bad that it ruined the meal for us. We spend a lot of time in fine dinning places and I have had better service at the local diner. It was a shame because the place was beautiful and the food was great. We never were asked how out meals were, had to wave down waiter for drinks every time, and my empty plate sat there 20 min. before I had to ask him to take it away. We also let him know when we arrived that we had a 9:30 show (we arrived at 7:30) and we had to rush out because service was so slow. I do not recommend this place due to the service. The Foundation Room at Mandalay Bay was our favorite. We loved the atmosphere and the service was top-notch. Everything we ordered was perfectly cooked, seasoned, and of high quality. We had 3-4 people waiting on us at all times. The 2 main waiters were extremely personable and knew their jobs. I would recommend this place to most people. We had a great trip, the weather was perfect, loved the hotel, had great food and saw some wonderful shows.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara is top-notch”
Reviews.Author: dubfun
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a new, five star hotel in Las Vegas, you should give Vdara a look. It is a new hotel, so everything is still very clean and in excellent condition. Housekeeping does a wonderful job and leaves plenty of bottled water in the room and the small refrigerator. The basic suites (no need for a larger room, it holds two very comfortably, and possibly one or two more close friends in the sofa bed) come with a small kitchenette (table, chairs, microwave, small fridge, a small smooth glass cooktop, sink and even a garbage disposal). This feature is great for saving money on breakfast, lunch and snacks. There was no coffeemaker, but I suppose you could request one (I don't drink coffee). There are two layouts for the basic suite; one is a large, open room; the other has a media center that seperates the bedroom from the living room area. There is a large, wide screen TV on either side of the media center. This is nice because one person can watch TV in the living area without disturbing another in the bedroom. You can request which layout that you prefer. The bathroom offers modern styling with a seperate soaking tub and glass walled shower. The bathroom has a nice, heavy, sliding glass privacy door instead of a regular door. A very nice touch that saves room! The bathroom was always very clean with plenty of towels and a nice towel cart by the tub. There was no hair dryer, but again, you could probably request one for no charge. I don't use a hairdryer. The bedroom and bed is very comfortable, and the bed has two small adjustable reading lights above the headboard for reading or atmosphere lighting.. The living area has a nice sleeper sofa and chair, so you could potentially sleep four people in the basic suite. The light switches in the kitchenette and bathroom have a dimmer to simulate candlelight for those romantic nights! The windows go wall to wall and offer nice views if you know what to ask for. Ask for as high a room as possible that faces north. If you are lucky, you will get a room that has a partial strip and mountain view, and a view of the Bellagio fountains. I stayed in room 38 on the 41st floor (41038, very nice!) The windows have nice shades and blackout shades, both of which are controlled by a wall switch off of the kitchenette area (too bad that they don't have switches for the shades near the bed). Floors are either nicely tiled or carpeted. The style here is clean, slick and modern, but it is always comfortable and relaxing. It may be considered spartan by someone who prefers a room at the Paris casino, but I like the style of the Vdara. It suits my style and the style of the City Center where Vdara is located. There are a few things that come with the room that you must request. Robes, slippers and utensils for the kitchenette are available for free, and they had them up to my room within thirty minutes. I also had to have security up to the room to unlock my room safe, and they were there within an hour. All associates were pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable. The spa and exercise facilities are very nice and very clean. The pool area is small, but very nice. This is a quiet, non-gaming, no smoking resort that is populated by business travelers during the week, and vacationing groups, couples and families on the weekends. There is a nice bar and two restaurants immediately adjacent to the lobby. I only ate at the Market Cafe' (pricey, but what isn't on the Vegas strip!). The Silk Road restaurant was closed for the week while I was there because they were hosting business conferences and private parties. This was not a problem because there are many top-notch restaurants and world class shopping areas throughout the City Center complex and at the nearby (very short walk), new Cosmopolitan resort (you gotta see that place!). Overall, an excellent experience, especially if you can get a room discount through a travel service such as Priceline. This is not a cheap hotel, and you will pay for the excellent service, but in my opinion it is worth it. That is why I gave it a 4 out of 5 for value; it is not inexpensive. I also gave it a 4 of 5 for the location, only because some people feel that the City Center is not as convenient a location as some resorts; but this was not a problem for me as the Strip is not that long of a walk from the entrance to Vdara and Aria. You could actually stay within City Center (and nearby Cosmopolitan) for your whole stay and have everything you want. But who would want to do that? Don't forget, Vdara is non-gaming and non-smoking. So, if you want lots of action, you'll have to go to nearby Aria or Cosmopolitan or stay at a gaming resort. Personally, I like returning to the pampered feel of Vdara after leaving behind the smoke, noise, and drunks at the other gaming resorts. All other categories receive 5 stars at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great new Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grouch_P
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Vdara and were very impressed. The hotel, compared to other Las Vegas hotels is quite small and does not have its own casino or restaurants but has great contemporary style and is brilliant value for money. It is part of a new development of hotels, restaurants and shops called city centre. The existing restaurant, Silk Road, was closed while we were there but there is a cafe/bistro style restaurant which is great for salads, sandwiches and breakfast. The lobby is open and modern with a bar area. The rooms are contemporary and spacious with kitchenette, dining and office area. We had a view over the Bellagio fountains and Paris which was very impressive. It was comfortable and considering its size and location a great night sleep was had every night. The pool area is quite small and although was empty while we were there I would imagine could get very crowded during peak times. The hotel is connected to the Bellagio hotel which gives access to the strip or you can go through crystals shopping centre. It is also within easy reach of the Aria and Cosmopolitan hotels which have many restaurants, bars and of course casino. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you like a contemporary style without the hustle and bustle and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Spring break, give me a break!”
Reviews.Author: Kaytemisslady
Reviews.Content: Hotel restaurant closed, nobody informed us. Small market/ cafe available bur overcrowded, over priced and no where to sit. Small lounge across hall had very little seating and bar tender seemed annoyed to have us there. Received an 80.00 bill at checkout for the "complimentary" bottled water that we did not drink, "complimentary" Internet and the "complimentary" newspaper that we did not see the entire stay. We requested kitchen ware, and a pot once we noticed there was none in the kitchen. They lost our request. We requested again and we were brought plates and silverware only. When we requested a pot and a corkscrew, we were brout only a corkscrew. Each time we were certain to tip the man. We were awaken at 1:00 am by another service employee delivering a rollaway bed that we did not request. When I explained this he asked me if I was sure and then just kept walking. Not even a small apology. We drove so the only way to park was valet which we were not informed of at any point. Of course this means that a tip is "appreciated" each time you need to drive. This was not a problem. It was strange however that we were told to call ahead for our car to save time yet when we did we were asked what color our ticket was and then told that they could not do this for us. Hotel staff sadly is not friendly or helpful and the pool? Again, disappointed. The beds were a dream! And the rooms quiet. Very nice. :-) however, you can find this for much less hassle. This hotel sister was a disappointing flop, However the Aria, the more beautiful and pulled together sister is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again but there were a few service kinks.”
Reviews.Author: KitKatVA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and another couple stayed here 14-17 April and had a fabulous time. On the plus side, rooms are beautiful and everything is very clean; I love the AVEDA products in the bathroom, the amazing soaking tub, the extremely comfy bed, and the refrigerator (which is rare for Vegas hotels). The housekeeping staff also does an outstanding job!! The pool and bar have great drink menus. The salon staff are fun, professional, and very talented! We did experience some negatives too, however. Perhaps they are still working out some kinks. The concierge service was extremely slow. Twice I used the concierge (for something fairly simple) and twice I waited in line for 30+ minutes; I walked past on several occassions and also saw long lines. The service at the pool was a disaster. On day 1 (a Wednesday), it took 15 minutes until anyone brought us a menu and from that point, another 30 until we finally tracked down the server to order. Then, she brought only 1 of our drinks and said she was going back for the other... it never came. So, when I tracked her down again and ordered 2 more drinks, she said she'd comp one b/c we never got the original order. Then I got my "total" with no bill, which included no comp'd beverage. When I said I was charging it to the room, she said "uh... oh" and didn't come back for 20+ min. So, I went to the bar to pay and she "couldn't find the tab." So, the bartender (who was great by the way) finally settled the whole thing. On day 2, same thing... long story short, we ordered a round that never came, finally ordered again, were then charged for the drinks we didn't get. We got it "fixed" but then it showed up on the room bill incorrectly and I had to sort it out at the front desk. The front desk staff was great, made a note of the error, and had it resolved within 24 hrs. With the exception of the pool service though, everything was great. I'd still stay again but if the same waitress was at the pool, I'd 100% get every drink from the bar! To be fair, 1 of the waitresses was great, too!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location and awesome rooms”
Reviews.Author: jodijparker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for 5 nights and the hotel was spotless. The staff were very polite and we got an upgrade to the Vdara corner suite which was fantastic - we had views of the Bellagio fountains! Everything at the hotel was great - lovely pool and sunbathing area's, and, if you can get the comfy double sunloungers it's like laying on your bed. The hotel is centrally located and 2 min walk to the Bellagio, this was very convenient as we went there everyday to eat and gamble. There is no casino in the hotel but this was a relief, Vegas is crazzzzy so it is nice to come back to the Vdara - it almost became a little oasis. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The rooms are luxurious, very comfortable and tastefully decorated. Also, the complimentary toiletries are all 'Aveda' which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and sparse”
Reviews.Author: Traveler11235813
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our toddler stayed at Vdara. At first, we thought the location was bad but quickly found out that it is close to the Bellagio (via walkway). We stayed at the Vdara suite and it was very spacious. Unfortunately the lighting was very poor. Some of the lights did not work. Due to the minimalist decor, we feel that there were not enough places to hang towels. Self-parking is not an option but valet is free. Overall I liked the hotel but not sure if I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: dreamwellali
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and extremely comfortable. The full-soaking tub and separate shower in the bathroom were great. Housekeeping services were simply amazing. This is the best hotel on the strip, in my opinion. It's entirely smoke-free, which is SO welcome after getting caught in the haze of the hotels with casinos. There is no casino here, but easy walking to the Aria or Bellagio casinos, and not far from the rest of the strip - we walked fairly easily from the Venetian one night, Mandalay Bay another night, and MGM Grand the final night. There is also a tram in the Bellagio that goes all the way to the Monte Carlo. The only thing I would complain about is that the restaurant (Silk Road) was closed the entire time we were there and the prices in the market cafe were extremely high. Also, because there is no casino, there is no buffet. The Aria and Bellagio buffets are the closest. It also took room service a very long time to deliver our requested kitchenware for the kitchenette. For food, you're better off going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “House keeping services”
Reviews.Author: tweet8734
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. A haven away from the hustle of the casino hotels. But only a short walk to the Bellagio and the strip. It was a pleasure to return to this haven after a day on the town. We had a city corner suite which was very good. My main complaint is with housekeeping services. Failure to respond to requests for simple things like sheet changes or bottles of water that were not left in the fridge when the room was serviced and such like.

Reviews.Title: “Classiest Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: katej160
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a Sat-Tuesday stay at the Vdara. This hotel was top notch all the way. The location is off the strip, which we actually liked. It's attached to the Aria and there are also walkways top the Bellagio. The room was large, and we had a whole kitcheonette. We didn't use it, but it was nice to have! I wasn't impressed at all with a lot of the larger hotels. This place (and the Aria) are definitely worth a stay. Pros: • The pool is awesome. We went on a busy Sunday and we were actually given a free daybed b/c someone had left. This was truly the highlight of the weeekend! • The staff is really nice, especially the concierge & pool guys • No casino, so it doesn't stink of smoke • INCREDIBLE view of the mountains and the airport, etc... Cons: • The pool was super busy on Sunday and we couldn't get a waitress to pay attention to us. • We rented a car for a day and had a lot of trouble finding the entrance to the hotel. It's kind of hidden. • The $18 a day hotel fee. It includes water and wifi. Yipee. • There was only 1 little cafe/restaurant in the hotel. It was really crowded in the mornings and closed latenight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Bad location”
Reviews.Author: JKGil
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Vdara Hotel and Spa and the facility is beautiful and the rooms are clean and well done. The only problem we encountered was getting to and from the Hotel to Las Vegas Strip. We would not stay there again as we wasted too much of our time lost in other Hotels and Casinos trying to get back to our Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Beddoesa623
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel and paid for it before arriving. When I arrived the hotel wanted to charge me 18$ a day extra for pool fees, wifi fee, and gym fee. Also they held 200$ on my card for a week. When I asked about the crazy fees the lady looked at me as if I were poor or something. The rooms were nice but no better than any other hotel. I stayed at way cheaper places and was more impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Rare Peace and Calm Tranquility in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DJP/jdp
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay in the Vdara and can only endorse the previous 5 star ratings given. We visited virtually all the hotels around the strip area and this was definitely the right choice for us and a quiet place to return after days of walking and taking in the sites of Las Vegas. We had a room on 40th floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains and the views were spectacular. The main difference with this hotel is that it doesn’t have a casino and so you are in the reception area as soon as you enter the hotel rather than having to walk a long distance through a casino as you have to in others hotels. The hotel rooms are all suites with lounge, bedroom, en-suite bathroom ( with a huge deep bath and separate large walk in shower), large wide screen TV's in both lounge and bedroom areas and kitchen with cooking facilities but having said that, finding any fresh food to cook in Las Vegas is quite a challenge. Tips for visiting Las Vegas. 1 - Take comfortable shoes as you walk miles 2 - Visit mid week as it is much quieter and cheaper. This was part of a trip including San Francisco and Los Angeles and our first impressions of Las Vegas were not favourable but by the end of our 5 days stay we loved it and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Peach and Quiet right on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: lee_44106
Reviews.Content: For those seeking a sanctuary away from the typical casino resort, Vdara has to be a serious contender. The all suite configuration was awesome. We were upgraded without charge to a corner penhouse suite with a 270 degree view. Night view as spectacular with the convenience of automatic shades via remote control. We loved the small kitchen with full size refrigerator/freezer, microwave, range-top, small dishwasher and even a garbage disposal. There was also a one-unit washer/dryer that allowed us to pack light (no check-in luggage) with just a 3 day supply of clothing (we brought our own liquid detergent in a disposable travel-sized bottle). Room was very clean with a contemporary decor and bathroom was wonderful with tub and stand-alone shower. Wireless and wired internet are free of charge. Because the entire hotel is very environmentally designed, the water pressure from the shower is a bit on the low side. Those used to being sprayed heavily will find the shower woefully weak (we were used to it). The freebie bathroom products are by Aveda (included shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, hand bar soap, hand/body lotion, and bath salt for the tub). All were wonderful. There is the typical amenities like a hair dryer, lighted cosmetic magnifing mirror, digital weight scale, and a TV in the bathroom (awesome for when taking a bath in the tub). Hotel front desk was very helpful and friendly. Housekeeping was unobstrusive and does a great job. Requests were delivered promptly (Need to ask for dishes/utensils for the kitchen as they do not come standard to the suites) In the kitchen there is a small Kreug single-serving coffee maker. We brought Starbucks VIA instant coffee and went out and purchased some half&half. Heated the water in the microwave. I thoroughly researched the hotel before arriving so knew what to expect and bring along to maximize our comfort (definitely bring laundry detergent, for example). DON'T bring slipeprs as there are two complimentary pairs in the closet. I used the gym everyday of my stay. It's small for a hotel but is excellently equipped with the best. They are all Cybex equipments with 4 Arc-Trainers (two wholebody and two lower body models), 8 treadmills, dumb bells up to 65lb, and other basic weight stations. Again, all top of the line Cybex. I have a Cybex wholebody Arc Trainer at home too, so I really enjoyed the gym. The hours are not so convenient (6AM-8PM). There is also no shower attached to the gym and the gym is physically located inside the Spa. There is a small pool in the hotel, but I did not use it. Convenience wise, there is a indoor walkway into Bellagio. There is a tram that will take you to the nearby hotels. Aria casino is within literally across the front entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fab”
Reviews.Author: AussieSonja
Reviews.Content: After many hours spent reviewing hotels on trip advisor, I was drawn to Vdara for it's great location, only a year old at the time, and happy with the price. Also drawn to the fact that it was a non gaming location, as my husband and I were travelling with our 15 year old daughter. I booked directly with the Vdara site and called them up about a premium view room, I found while getting rates via trip advisor, expedia had a premium view room, however on the Vdara site it did not offer the premium view option. So upon inquiring on this matter with Vdara directly they offered me the premium view and waived the additional occupant fee for my daughter. Check in was a breeze and upon walking into our suite we were blown away with the room and the view....we were on the 50th floor and overlooked the Belagio fountains, we were even more blown away when we walked back into the suite at night. Truly Spectalcular. My only gripe however not major just felt it would have been common sense. As I had booked for 3 people being that the 3rd person ie my daughter would sleep on the pull out sofa, however upon pulling this out there was no linen on it. As it was late and we were tired we all just hopped into the large comfy bed. The next morning as we were heading out I approached reception and advised them of the oversight. And would they mind having the bed made up. I was a bit taken back when the young receptionist stated I should have asked them upon check in to have it made up. My reply was I thought it would be common practice that if my booking details indicate that 3 people are checking into that room that it would be general practice that the room needs be made upto cater for the 3 booked occupants. All in all it was a great stay and I would highly recommend it. Note: I am suprised by other comments about the distance you need to walk to get anywhere.....we found everything so close and it was great to venture out to have a look at all the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: zefiren2
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Vdara hotel. It is very nicely located and close to everything you want to see and do in Vegas. The best thing is that it is not a casino hotel so it is relatively quiet. The room was nicely decorated, comfortable and meticulously clean. Service was very good. People was very friendly and helpful. Only one drag is the line up in the little shop where you can buy some food and drinks in the morning. Other than that I really enjoyed my time there. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with State of the Art Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TTS3
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very attentive and professional. We were very impressed with the hotel and the room we stayed in. The bathroom was huge and beautiful. The bed was very comfortable, the closet was great sized and the kitchen area was fabulous. State of the Art remote controlled blinds and lighting. It was nice walking into the hotel and not being in the middle of a smoke-filled casino, since this hotel does not have a casino. Room service was slow but the food was decent. I do have to say the smell inside the lobby area when you first walk in did not sit well with me. It is too strong of a smell. I do not exactly know how to describe it, maybe lilac smell? It was convenient that there is a walkway to other casinos/hotels. Overall, a very nice, new hotel, in the middle of the whole Vegas Strip area and very close to a casino when someone has the itch to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto to the other reviewer - A true breath of fresh air.”
Reviews.Author: bmoretravler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, modern and smells really yummy. No smoking and no casino made it a relaxing place to come back to after a day of shopping, drinking and gambling. The rooms are beautifully decorated, as are the other common areas. The bathtub was incredible and the bed comfortable. The hotel has a very European feel to it and if you are looking for a little more upscale crowd than you might find at other places on the strip, this is the place for you. Our only disappointment was the fact that one of the days we came back to the room at 5pm after being gone almost all day and the room wasn't clean. The housekeepers arrived at the same time we did and came in a quickly cleaned the room for us. The staff was very friendly and eager to please. The food in the Market cafe was a bit pricey, but not much more so than the rest of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible everything!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights of our honeymoon at Vdara. Everything from check-in (3 hours early!) to the most amazing spa and couple's massage, to check-out was nothing short than the best experience and value i've ever seen. The room was amazingly spacious, with a super-classy bathroom and kitchenette. The lobby and pool area offer a lot of areas to relax, and the overall class and finish of the building itself is supurb. Highly, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Breath of Fresh air - literally”
Reviews.Author: coupleofalbertans
Reviews.Content: As much as my husband and I like to read the reviews it's always a gamble to try a new place but we were very pleased with our stay at the Vdara. (And as I've read some new reviews on the property I would like to make a note that it is very important to report any major complaints to the front desk - especially if they are issues pertaining to privacy or hygiene.) Now onto our review. When we arrived by cab from the airport we were happy to see that there wasn't a mile long lineup for check-in (as was the case when we stayed at Planet Hollywood a year ago). The one complaint I have is the way the front desk personnel made it sound like he was doing us a favour by adding an $18 daily fee for our "free" water/paper/pool access/wi-fi. Just add it into the room price or say that these amenities are an $18/day fee. But we didn't have a problem with this fee because we felt we had good value on our room. We had a corner suite which had a great view and we loved watching the Bellagio fountain show from our 34th floor room. It was also nice to have so much space to move around without feeling like we paid an arm and a leg for it. We also loved how it felt like an escape from the regular Vegas pace. The Vdara is connected to the Bellagio by a covered walkway and when we came down the hallway, returning to our room, it was nice to have a retreat from the smoke and noise of the other hotels. We didn't have any privacy issues except for a housekeeping person coming into our room while we were there. It was quickly remedied (we must have turned off our "do not disturb" button - which by the way was a cool, modern feature to press a button rather than have to hang a sign on the door) and then they just left us a phone message to contact them if we wanted any service later. It is a major pet peeve of mine when housekeeping enters a room that you'd asked them to not disturb so I really appreciate when it is honoured. We did allow them in the room the following day and we didn't have any issues (although I did lock my suitcase for piece of mind). There were security personnel asking to see your room key before you entered the elevators. The pool area was nice, the cafe downstairs was good and included Jean Phillippe pastries (yum!) which can also be bought across the walkway at the Aria and in the Bellagio by the conservatory. We didn't find this hotel an inconvenience in location at all. So many of the hotels are enormous and you have to walk a great distance through the maze of casinos to get anywhere so we didn't have a problem - especially since we were connected to the Bellagio. Staff were friendly and helpful and based on our experience we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Bad”
Reviews.Author: travelingmannow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara September 2010. We travel to Vegas every year and up to this trip we hadn't experienced any issues. This trip started out with my wife getting a bump here and there on her body. This was a new hotel, so she didn't suspect anything except maybe a rash, but after the 2nd night she had been bitten up and down her leg. Bed Bugs? We only stayed 3 nights and my wife did not want to complain. On another note we picked this hotel because it was new and we hadn't stayed there yet. We thought the non-smoking and non-gambling hotel would be nice at the end of the day, but instead we found ourselves having to walk a ton just to get the strip and for me I always like to gamble a little more after my wife retires for the night. I didn't do any of that due to the walk involved. Oh I'm a runner. We also rented a car like usual, but this hotel Does Not Have Self Parking just Valet Parking and if that wasn't enough the ramp to get to this Valet Parking was what I considered very confusing and dangerous. That said the Hotel room was very nice with 2 flat panel TV's and the view from our room was very nice. Just better choices available.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Modern Amenities in this new non-smoking, quiet, recession affected hotel spa.”
Reviews.Author: surplusmarketing
Reviews.Content: Booked a great price on their website which upgraded me complimentary to a "Corner Suite" for $119.00, which is a great value for such a new hotel. Credit that to a slow Las Vegas totally affected by the Great Recession. Upon arriving, i didn't have to wait in line to check-in even though there were only 2 receptionists working. The reason: the hotel was very slow and it was a weekday in Vegas. I later found out i was checked-in by the hotel assistant manager, who was very skilled at her job of upgrading me...for an extra $25 to an "Executive Suite". I later also found out because i stayed and extra night, that the Corner Suite is basically the same as an Executive Corner Suite. Same floorplan, basically the same new amenities such as desk, refrigerator, stacked washer/dryer combo, range, microwave, and even small dishwasher. You will have to call housekeeping to get the utensils and kitchenware, and it's always proper etiquette to tip $2-3 dollars to the delivery person. Back to the hotel review...First time at Vdara Hotel and Spa, and was met with a calm feel without the smoke and gaming clamor. In fact, this hotel is sort of an quiet oasis from the typical Vegas "hustle and bustle". Swanky furniture, chic lounges, and i almost got a feel of a more refined Palms Place, where 20's to 40's yuppies would find themselves spending their time. I was there for a photography gig and to shoot the architecture of Vegas on my spare time. The room was very spacious and well laid out. I had a dining table, kitchen, living room area, desk, very comfortable bed, 2 LCD HDTVs, separate shower and soaking tub, and 2 sink vanity with huge mirror. And the most impressive part of it all was a wrap around view of the Bellagio and front City Center strip view of about 180 degrees. The Executive Corner Suite had motorized shade and drapes for privacy and shading from the sun. This is a 4-5 star hotel in terms of quality of ambience and accommodations for sure. The staff was very professional, however, at times because it was so slow, the housekeeping staff could be overbearing with wanting to invade too much into your privacy, and that was a big turnoff. Guests book rooms and suites for comfort and privacy. Privacy is of utmost priority on top of security, and both go hand in hand, IMO. In short, the hotel staff should not be too eager to provide services unless called upon. When i leave my room, i expect no one to enter it unless i request it. This is to ensure my privacy and confidence that nothing could or would be missing due to someone other than me being in my room or Suite. Though nothing went missing, i did find it intrusive that housekeeping wanted to use my phone on the second day i booked, to call her supervisor. She should have a radio or use one of the rooms or suites on the floor to call her supervisor, not impose that she had to use mine. I work with very important intellectual property that no one can see until it's out. It's usually on my laptop while i'm working. Any eyes other than mine that see it could lose me my job. So next time, and this is directed at Vdara and other high-end hotels, please consider first the privacy of your patrons and guests. Having read several reviews regarding possible theft there, well to be fair, i didn't experience any of it, but that's because i warned the front desk that i had read it on TripAdvisor.com , and told them to please not enter my room during my entire stay unless i request something. I suggest everyone do the same. In times of recession and economic hardship, and it was slow here at Vdara more than at other places, it's best to keep from having any misunderstandings arise, and the only way to do that is to be direct and proactive in the approach to resist the possibility of it occurring. I would recommend this hotel, however, with the financial difficulties surrounding Vegas in general, spend some money tipping for services as many do make their living in Vegas from tips, especially in a down market in Vegas, where it seems people there are ready to provide services to make up for the lack of plentiful work. I also ordered in-suite dining services, and even though the 2 dishes i ordered at 2:00am clearly stated $14 each dish, i was charged $16 each dish. Only a $4 price mistake, but i really think the Vdara should just charge the same price for all hours instead of discounting it on the menu to encourage demand at night, only to charge the higher day rate. I wasn't going to address a petty difference, as that's the Hotel's staff to make sure they get it right, but that told me there was an issue of deficiency in demand which results in a revenue deficiency. Things will get better, and i feel the Vdara has good potential when the market turns around. Until then, i will enjoy the new developments and support them, so they can run a more robust operation. Vegas pioneer Steve Wynn has the right formula. Many in Vegas should imitate it. He believes the customer should get the best treatment, and the most privacy and quiet enjoyment of good, quality customer-attentive service from front desk to housekeeping and in-suite dining. Vdara will get there in due time. Until then, they should focus on building a great reputation, and work out all the kinks in these slow times, so they will become more refined when boom cycles occur again. They will.

Reviews.Title: “THE BAR HAS BEEN RAISED”
Reviews.Author: Tangerines
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in March and luckily managed to check in before 12 noon on the Saturday morning (years ago this would have been unheard of!). The check in assistant was very helpful and upgraded us from a Corner View Suite to a Panorama Suite The bags were sent up to us extremely quickly and the bellman noticed that our "Do not Disturb" lights were not working and said he would arrange to sort this out. We went out for a couple of hours and when we came back it had been dealt with - an example of good service As previous reviewers have already said, on check in you need to request housekeeping to bring a crockery and cutlery set, bathrobes and slippers - it is understood that you can also request pans etc The suite itself was fantastic - the kitchen having a table and 4 chairs, coffee machine, huge fridge/freezer, dishwasher, washing machine and tumble drier . We were on the 36th floor and the views were amazing, yet there are another 20 floor or so above. We've stayed in the Mirage Tower Suites a number of times (which are excellent), but this raises the bar somewhat, however, Vdara does still have the advantage of being relatively new, and it will be interesting to see how it compares in 2/3 years' time The only downside so far as we were concerned, was that we did get audible noise from what we think was the nightclub at the Cosmopolitan at the weekend. If you are a light sleeper you may wish to bring earplugs What makes Vdara stand out from the rest is that it has no casino, and is completely non-smoking which is a refreshing change, but you are literally two or three minutes walk to either Aria or the Bellagio The pool area is quite compact, probably OK for a visit in March, but in busier times, you could see space and availability of loungers being an issue We have been visiting Vegas for 20 years on a regular basis and have stayed at most of the major strip hotels, which are all of an excellent standard, but we feel that the bar has been raised somewhat by Vdara

Reviews.Title: “Pool at Vdara was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ohverywell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to the Vdara pool and got a cabana for the day. Everyone at the pool was amazing! Justin was our cabana boy (not in a sleezy speedo sort of way, I just could not resist using that phrase to describe him), probably the best I have had in Vegas! His supervisor Kim was amazing too, you can tell that everyone who works there gets along and they all seem to have the same priority...the guests having an amazing time! Many of the pools in Vegas are all about the "scene" and you almost get an attitude from the servers and pool attendants...I was so pleased to see that Vdara did not have this vibe. The food and cocktails were amazing and I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a pool day at a resort in Vegas! Good job Kim and Justin!!

Reviews.Title: “Sleek hotel, and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: SunPrincess9000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vdara Hotel and Spa for three nights in April, and we wanted a large, clean hotel room in the mid-strip area. The Vdara did not disappoint! Its a clean, modern, non-smoking property. The best part is, that there is no casino you have to hike through to get to the elevators! We booked a 'City Corner Suite', and had more then enough room to spread out. It was basically a one bedroom apartment, with a small dishwasher and a washer and dryer.. Not that we used either, but it might be nice if you were in Vegas for an extended time. The bathroom was perfect, huge and well laid out. The bedding was, frankly, the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept on- and I'm super picky about beds! The finishes were sleek, modern and nice quality. The maid service was great too- she spent 3 hours cleaning everything. The hotel is super quiet, we never heard a single noise( were on the 15th floor), and we both slept great. Do check out the lovey spa if you like such things. It is a smaller, more intimate spa then most on the strip, with prices comparable to my home town. The steam room is the best I've ever been in and the facility is well appointed , using Aveda products. I had a fantastic facial with Louise, and a hot stone massage with Jessica C; I highly recommend both ladies! The fitness center is a decent size, with several cardio machines, free weights and machines. The Vdara is part of the massive City Center complex, with the Aria Casino , and Cosmo Casino very close by. Next time we stay on the strip we will stay there again- for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a five star”
Reviews.Author: teelips
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a chic hotel with modern decor. We had a room on the 41st floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains--amazing! The agent noticed we were from Nevada and gave us a complimentary upgrade, but it would be well worth the $20 or so price tag. Unfortunately, the design of the room requires you to stand to see the fountains (the windows do not start until about 3 feet up). The shortcut to the Bellagio was convenient and the valet was relatively quick. This hotel would have deserved five stars except for the fact there were no blackout shades and the room was fairly noisy. Actually, there were shades, but there were large gaps between the shade sections so the room was light in the morning. Also, there was a lot of helicopter noise our first morning (Monday), but it was much better the next. I suppose the windows were a little thin. I have stayed at the Bellagio and Trump and never heard helicopters while trying to sleep. Also, the beds are more comfortable at those hotels as well. We used Priceline and paid $85 plus the resort fee (nice weight room, pool is adequate). I can't complain for the price, but I probably would not return (except maybe with a sleeping mask and earplugs).

Reviews.Title: “Generally good...”
Reviews.Author: piratehan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Vdara for our honeymoon trip from March 29-April 4. The hotel lobby smelled great and the hotel was very quiet. Check-in was simple enough and the clerk was polite. We weren't offered an upgrade but were given a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains (my husband had requested this if possible during booking) on the 26th floor. After reading previous TA reviews I asked if dishes, silverware and robes could be delivered to our room and the clerk agreed. Our room was lovely - very modern and clean with lots of space and a great view. We had a kitchenette with a small fridge - no space for leftovers but fine for drinks. There was a king size bed (ultra comfortable) and a sitting area separated by a screen with a flat screen TV either side. The bathroom was also nice with a separate shower and bath - the shower pressure wasn't good however. The room had blackout shades which we did appreciate - however they didn't quite cover the large windows and the sunshine did come though the gaps in the morning - not a big deal just worth mentioning. Once we were in the room the bell brought our luggage up right away. We waited 30 minutes for our dishes/robes before calling housekeeping again; they then took a further 10 or so minutes to arrive, bringing dishes, silverware and robes. When we returned to the hotel after dinner we realised we had no mugs or kettle. When we called housekeeping they explained that they did not provide kettles but could provide a saucepan/pot for boiling water. This, or the mugs, never arrived however and we gave up rather than call them again. A few days into our trip we had a knock at the door from housekeeping wanting to set up a pull-out bed for us - they appeared confused when we said we hadn't requested this and seemed to have the wrong room. The cleaning service was pretty good although we did leave a tip every day - we got new magazines and water every day. We also got fresh towels every day but I happened to be in the room when housekeeping arrived once and the bedsheets were Febreeze-d rather than changed. The hotel itself was OK. We did not use the pool or concierge so cannot comment on them. As non-smokers it was lovely to come back to a non-smoking hotel as many of the casinos were very smoky. The Market Cafe was fine although a little expensive. As mentioned the hotel smelled good. When we returned after 10pm or so at night our room key was politely checked before we could use the lift - a good security measure. Accessing the strip was easy enough via a walkway through to the Bellagio or a (free) tram to City Center and Monte Carlo; it was also simple to walk to the Cosmopolitan from Vdara's front entrance (approximately 5 minutes). That said, there did seem to be something missing in Vdara and although we got a good deal I doubt we would stay there again. I don't know whether it was the lack of casino, but the hotel seemed to lack atmosphere and we found it to be somewhat soulless. We had no major problems but did find Vdara lacking compared to some of the other hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss on the details but nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Vinovixen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Mandarin a few times since it opened and was excited to try another hotel in CIty Center. Vdara was $279 per night, while the Cosmo was $350, so I went with Vdara. First, I do like the rooms. They are similar to the Mandarin just a little less posh. Very West Elm. Liked the little kitchen. Front desk service was excellent. The lobby bar is sleek and fun -- bartender makes a mean blackberry mojito. You can tell this was supposed to be a condo building, not a hotel. Not sure if that is good or bad. The pool area is a concrete jungle. Very uninviting. We didn't see any servers or a bar or any way to conveniently get drink service. The hot tub was not hot. House keeping made a few mistakes. They didn't turn down/get bedding for our sofa bed as requested. They also reorganized all of our toiletries onto different sides of the sink, which makes no freaking sense. If you want to touch my junk, fine. But don't move it across the freaking room. The entry to the hotel is convenient to access the tram to get to Bellagio, but that's about it. The second level of Aria is across the street from the main level of Vdara, so you have to walk far around a very windy tunnel between to the two buildings only to get to the bar of Aria on its upper level. A little inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: smadarcat
Reviews.Content: The vdara hotel is truly wonderful.Loved the location,middle of the strip and straight connection to the Bellagio. We got a corner suite so we had a great view even of the fountains.what can i say...the room was truly amazing-spotless,spacious and really WOW. The only bad comment i have is that there was really weak pressure from the shower..drizzles... Besides that it was all great!!!nice staff and stylish luxorius hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the hospitality suit equip with full kitchen, washer and dryer, 2 beds, and 3 baths. The ONLY dishes we had were coffee cups. A lot of the staff was very rude and snotty! At one point I lost my phone and a cab driver took it to the front desk and they said they wouldn't hold it for me! The pool was tiny and half of the space was filled by unused reserved canopy areas. When we checked out and front desk asked how stay was we said not good and the only response we got was "oh...ok"

Reviews.Title: “Vdara is a little piece of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Missybee16
Reviews.Content: After travelling for more than 24 hours from Australia, we were extremely tired, but from the moment we stepped into possibly the best smelling lobby ever, the staff were very polite and helpful. Check in was a breeze. We did have to call the bell hop who said our bags were not on record after a 45 min wait but that wasn't a big deal to us as they brought them up to us within 10 mins of us calling. The room we have is an executive suite and although you do pay for it (don't forget the resort fee usually not included on the room rate), the extras for us are worth it (we come here every year as my partner comes for business and are here for about 11 days which is a tad to long for Vegas but the facilities are extremely helpful to us!). The Executive suite has a small kitchenette, washing machine and dryer, you do have to ask for kitchenware howver and also for the laundry detergent. The room is like a small apartment, ours overlooks the Bellagio fountains, is very clean and new and we are thrilled with it. Location is great, with the tram running past from Bellagio to Monte Carlo. Theres no casino and not a lot of dining options ( a really great cafe and Silk Roads ) but the Aria across the way has lots of restuarants and a casino. Plus of course there is the strip which is a short walk to get to. In a nutshell this place is amazing & we will be back without a doubt!!! Thank you Vdara, well done!

Reviews.Title: “Disregard the negative reviews, this place is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Seattlemarathoner
Reviews.Content: I was really interested in staying in a newer, more modern hotel on the strip. We decided on the Vdara. It is not technically on the strip but only a ten minute walk from the hotel via sky bridge to the Bellagio or a few minute tram ride (free) to Aria or Monte Carlo. Actually we looked forward to having a completely smoke free hotel without a casino. It was really nice to leave the strip and get a break from everything. I read that the 20 dollar trick wouldn't work at Vdara so I took another travelers advice and asked for a complimentary upgrade to a room on a higher floor. The young woman at the desk graciously put us on floor 58 with a peek-a-boo view of the Bellagio fountains. The room was nice, modern, clean, everything I wanted. The housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful from the start. Yes, you do have to request dishes and dish soap, so what! The small fridge won't keep leftovers fresh but who cares, it cools your beverages and mixers of choice. The rooms do not have coffee makers, but hey thats what Starbucks Via is for. Oh yes, the bed was incredibly comfortable! The housekeeping was wonderful, we would sleep late, work out in the gym (really nice and lots of equipment) go to the pool for a couple hours, then get ready to goof off. We would leave around 3 and the room was always made up when we would be back to dress up for dinner 4 or 5 hours later. OK, just a word of advice, the death ray at the pool is unfortunately true. It was in the mid 70's while we enjoyed the pool and depending upon where the reflection hits the surrounding buildings it can get a bit uncomfortable. Our room key was not put in the shade and it melted! So, you will enjoy the pool under the umbrellas (there are lots of them) on a hot day. LOVED this hotel, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: MizzouMike
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the rooms - they are very sleek and modern - that is either your thing or it isn't. Bed was comfortable, had a seperate shower and soaking tub. Housekeeping - the room was clean, almost immaculate. My only issue is that one day, they arranged all our tolietries on the counter, looked very neat, but they actually went into my shaving kit and removed items to arranged. Big no-no. Although nothing was missing, I felt my privacy had been invaded. Bell staff was great, front desk was understaffed and check-in took too long. The auto check-out on the TV wasn't working, so you had to go downstairs. Again, understaffed and must have been 40 people waiting. There is a resort fee per room, which is just plain silly. Just put the cost, in your rates. For the resort fee you received access to the fitness room, pool, bathrobes and a newspaper. You had to call fro bathrobes to be delivered, which we had to do twice to get them. The newspaper is not delivered to your room, instead you had to go downstairs to pick it up. There is an effeciency kitchen in the room, but you have to call for dishes, pans. etc. Worst of all - no coffee maker in the room. The view was great. Overall the room was okay, but I probably won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great addition to Vegas hotels.”
Reviews.Author: ChiliPalmer
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at the hotel, but would love to stay longer. Great suites with small kitchens. No casino at the entire hotel, easy connection to Bellagio. Car directions are not that easy though. And check in procedure is not well organized as people stay in several lines to each front desk specialist instead of being in one line "first came first served". No selfparking, but valet is free.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: Neil791
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara from 29 March - 01 April and managed to get what I felt was a decent online rate. Booked two (2) rooms for the four (4) of us and arrived at the hotel approx. 7pm. First impression of City Centre was nice and the initial arrival to Vdara was what I expected from a supposedly 5* ranked hotel with prompt valet service and a clean exterior. Check in was fairly straightforward until the desk clerk offered a room upgrade (at a fee) which made me think they must get a commission for any upgrades they sell. At an additional $30 per night I decided to go for it which seemed like a good idea until we got up to the rooms to find that one of them wasn't even ready and it looked like it had been forgotten about. Considering check out is 12 noon and check in is after 3pm i thought it was pretty poor service to not have the room ready. This was just the beginning. After making the situation known to the desk, the staff offered a further upgrade gratis which i expected at the very least as the first impression was already shaded. This was the only positive experience we had as the rest of our time coming and going it seemed the only people who valued our business were the valet and the rest of the staff seemed as though we were all just a necessary evil. In summary I will not return to Vdara due to the poor service, complete lack of customer focus shown in general from the front desk staff down to the housekeeping which was a joke, and the fact that valet is the only parking option. For a true 5* experience I will be returning to Wynn/Encore in future!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for ANYTHING better!”
Reviews.Author: MariaKhan
Reviews.Content: I don't know how many times I can say this, but the staff, hotel and experience here was fantastic!! Checking in to the hotel, my friend realized he had booked for the wrong dates - leaving us worried that we would not get the same room OR rates we had originally booked. Danielle was an amazing help because we still got the SAME room we wanted AND they honored our rates instead of hiking them up! The hotel is beautiful and clean. It's nice to be back at a quiet hotel after a long day out without seeing the crowds from a casino. The Bellagios casino is within walking distance and their sister hotel Aria, has some amazing food! I definitely recommend this to anyone going on a trip to Vegas who is looking for excellent customer service! Their check out line was getting long so they do offer checking out via email and will just bill you any charges that may occur. Very good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: HowellyBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on the second leg of our trip. Overall, the hotel is fabulous. Our deluxe room was big and very clean, with a large bathroom. Locationwise, it is only a hop and a skip from the Strip and you can get to the Bellagio and Aria from the hotel itself which was very handy. A couple of points to make - there is a kitchen in the room but no cutlery, crockery, kettle, pots, mugs etc. We called up for a kettle and teaspoons and they delivered a pot and a ladle... No idea why. We called again and were told that they had no kettles or coffee pots, so if you want a cuppa tea - boil the pot. Also service was a bit slow in getting things delivered. Calling up each time you need a mug, plates etc is quite annoying so be sure to request everything you need in one go. The only other issue we had was the bed... The linen is fabulous to sleep under but our king sized bed was sunken on one side, so you felt like you were sleeping on a slight slope... Neither one of us slept that well as a result. Pity because it was a gorgeously soft bed. Overall we would highly recommend the Vdara. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel smoke free & quiet .”
Reviews.Author: UrbanWomble
Reviews.Content: Overall a great hotel & enjoyed our stay , great to be a little bit set back from the strips madness & noise . Arrived 30mins before 3pm after along 5 hour drive but still couldnt check in early had to wait for the queues at 3 ! Room was smart & very comfy beds Kitchenette was useless as no plates , cups bowls or coffee maker even the cheapest motel you can make a drink in your room . We brought some dishes only to find these were cleared by housekeeping never to be seen again. Cafe in hobby very basic & expensive and closes early . Bar is ok but lacks any warmth . Valet parking great until you want to get something out of car they have get it out every time as you are not allowed in car park ,no self parking . Pool noisy with piped music & bit small for the size of hotel. With no direct route to strip this can take a while having to go through another hotels casinos & shops . Overall we enjoyed our stay at Vdara , if you dont want to gamble & smoke stay here .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mddogmk
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great place to stay! After reading many of the reviews about the Vdara, we thought we’d give Vdara a try. We arrived at the hotel late at night. Valet was right there to greet us. No problem finding the front desk. I read that a few folks had a hard time finding it. Well it’s right in front of the big front doors kind of hard to miss. Check in was fast and easy. We were told about the $18.00 resort fee right up front and were asked to initial a form stating there was a resort fee. Yes I do believe that the hotel looks at these reviews. I remembered that in one of the reviews that someone said that they got the old bait and switch on the room. I also recall looking at Vdara’s website and seeing that there are two versions of the Deluxe Suite rooms. I simply asked the clerk checking us in if we could have one a Deluxe Suite with the “divider” in it. She accommodated us with a room just like in the video. Also she gave us a room on the 37th floor with a great view of the Bellagio’s lake. Great view of the strip too! While its spring breaks I expected a ton of college kids and noise. Being that this not a casino hotel. I think that most kids opted for hotels right on the strip like the Hard Rock. Our visit was very quiet by Vegas standards . We visited the gym and the pool during our stay. The fitness center was small but had just about everything you need to get a good work out in. The pool area was a bit small for the size of the hotel, but we had no problem getting a couple of lounge chairs. The pool is saltwater pool with a bit of chlorine added. The staff was friendly and the towels were nice too. Dining is available for breakfast and lunch at a small restaurant in the lobby. Prices are crazy high. It cost me $4.75 for a cup of coffee. Room Service is pretty pricy too. But with all the dining options in Vegas, we simply went elsewhere. We did ask for kitchenware and room service had it to us two shakes of a lamb’s tail. Not slow at all. There are two sides of the little refrigerator. The free side and the mini bar side. You have to ask to have it unlocked. This is down by calling the front desk. Pretty simple. The hotel is not right on the strip, but off set near the back of the property in the City Center complex. So it’s a short walk to the strip. We’d usually walk to the tram and cut through the Bellagio to get to the strip. Or we would catch the tram to the Monte Carlo and exit onto the strip that way. You will land on either mid strip or south strip depending what route you take. You can walk to the strip via the Cosmopolitan too. The tram is free. We stayed three nights. It was nice to see that they have security checking that you have your room keys before they allowed you up the elevators (Late evening). We asked for a late checkout as we had a late flight out of Vegas. For a nominal fee we were able to check out at 4:00pm. Very handy! We were able to get in a couple of extra hours at the pool before checking out and heading to the airport. Pros: Awesome rooms Great location Great staff NOT a Casino Valet parking easy in and out Late check out Plenty of outlets for electronics Cons: Dining in hotel crazy expensive Very short walk to the strip (I know I’m being lazy) Light switches are in kind of a funky place Free side of the refrigerator is kind of small If you want a beautifully appointed hotel that is a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, this is the place. Remember to read all the small print. Most of the folks who had negative reviews appear to have not read all the fine print or have not stayed at an upper scale hotel in Vegas before. We had no surprises a check out. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a view!!!”
Reviews.Author: GaryMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my wifes 50th birthday. We took a shuttle from the airport, so parking was not a problem. We checked in at noon with no problem. THANK YOU, Natasha for the GREAT 52nd floor room overlooking the Bellagio fountains, the North strip and the mountains to the NW. The room was great. Big bathroom, clean and I WANT THOSE PILLOWS!! Room was quiet and comfortable. All the employees we dealt with from check in, cleaning lady, life guards at the pool, Spa, health club, concierge, bell boy, were GREAT!, even if we did have some dumb questions for them. Pool was a smaller area but nice, except for those noisy tour helicopters flying over. The wife used the health club and Spa and was impressed. Only a small market cafe downstairs, but GREAT breakfast and we just got it to go for going back to the room. We used the walkway to the Bellagio to get to the strip. We had the buffet at the Bellagio and Hilton, Hitlon was better. The Elvis show at the Hilton was the BEST!! We rented a car from the Bellagio for a day to go down to the Hoover dam. On the day to leave, check out was a breeze and the bellboy took care of our luggage and Concierge lined up a CLS shuttle for the trip back to the airport that afternoon. (CLS seemed better than Gray Line which we took to the motel).

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Vdara... if you don't mind getting robbed”
Reviews.Author: Queen_Jay
Reviews.Content: My friends and I traveled to Las Vegas for a 25th birthday weekend this past weekend (Mar 24-27). We left for a night out on the town and returned a few hours later to find our entire room ransacked of all our belongings and cash. Much worse, their customer service rep's and management treated us like insignificant peasants. I've had better service at a motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “ROBBED @ Vdara”
Reviews.Author: TripL0ver33
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again...my friends and I payed top dollar for an amazing stay and were robbed hours after our arrival. We came back to our room from a fun night out and realized our room had been ransacked!!!!! They took everything but our clothes and a few other belongings. Security was rude to us and continued to treat us as if we were insignificant. We were moved to 4 different rooms because there was something wrong with each one! I felt unsafe the entire trip and couldn't enjoy myself. Management did not try to ease our stay until WE went down the next morning to complain. I've learned my lesson...i will NEVER stay at Vdara again.

Reviews.Title: “VIOLATION OF PRIVACY- robbed by housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: lynnjon
Reviews.Content: We had a similar situation to the person that posted on 3/25/11. We left our room for 15 min and came back to find 300 dollars in cash and change missing. Here is the deal, we never have housekeeping enter our room fearing they may take something. We had the light set to blue- do not disturb. Housekeeping was cleaning rooms down the hall.
