When we returned housekeeping was in front of our room and the next room with the carts. The light was switched to green- please service our room. However they were not inside our room or the other room. After we noticed the money missing we asked the lady outside did you get a chance to service the room. She said no, did you want me too. Said yes, she said I'll come back. Didn't make sense cause they were working from one end to the other. I plan to pursue this more since many people have been a victim here. Look out for another posting!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: cvikkim
Reviews.Content: The Vdara hotel is a great off-strip hotel in Vegas. Location of the hotel is great, just near the Bellagio (covered walkways between) and opposite the Miracle Mile shops. Don't be put off by the "off-strip" bit - it took less time to walk from our room at the Vdara to the Bellagio Casino (which it adjoins) than it took to walk from a room in the Venetian to the Venetian Casino on a previous trip! The spa is great & well worth a visit - best massage I've had i a long long time (and I get a lot of massages!). It's a bit steep at $150 for 50 mins but comparable to other resorts on the Strip - and totally worth it! I also should mention that the cafe in the lobby is great, and has a good selection of sandwiches and salads as well as hot food (which I didn't try) and food which you can cook in the room. As many other reviewers have mentioned, the kitchenette is good, although there's no coffee maker (but the cafe coffees are very good!) Room - comfy beds, fabulous views across Vegas and to the mountains, nice bathroom (massive tub!) The only negative was that our dirty laundry was stolen from outside the room but the hotel handled it well - police report, gave us a credit on the room and waived the resort fees, which we appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New Hotel Right Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: anygren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara on a recent trip to Las Vegas. It was honestly amazing. Since we were moving from another hotel to the Vdara for our final night, we called early in the day to see if we could check-in early. The woman on the phone was really nice and tried her best but couldn't guarantee an early check-in. We also requested a crib for our baby and put in a request for a room on the Bellagio side (half the hotel faces north towards the Bellagio and Rio, the other half faces south towards the Aria). After having a light lunch we decided to head over to the Vdara and at least leave our luggage with the bell hop even though it was only 12:30. We went up to Reception and the clerk immediately checked us in to a suite overlooking the Bellagio! Talk about under promising but over delivering. Really pleasantly surprised. The room was spectacular! Brand new with windows wall to wall, great soaking tub, fabulous beds, two flat screens, and a nice little kitchenette (you have to ask for cooking utensils). If you are bringing a baby, the Vdara has really nice wood cribs with great mattresses, unlike some hotels I have stayed at that have really dingy metal cribs. Pool area was really great and not too busy at all. The pool was warm and service was great, they even let us use one of the cabanas without charge. Check out the next morning was a breeze because they have someone who is solely dedicated to express check out. The only downside is the location. If you want to be steps from the strip, staying at a resort on the strip might be your ticket. It is a slight walk from the Vdara to the strip, but nothing too bad and coming back to a smoke-free resort at night after being in the smoke and noise of the casinos was a welcome relief. Good - View (get a room on the North-east side overlooking Bellagio) Staff Beds Pool Crib Smoke-free Check-out time of 12 pm Bad - Little walking distance to the strip Blackout shades had a slight strip of light through the break in the shades that couldn't be closed.

Reviews.Title: “A change of pace from "Vegas glitz"”
Reviews.Author: runner1909
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually visit Las Vegas once or twice a year, but due to work commitments, had not been able to get there for 2 years. The last time we were there, City Center was under construction. We decided on this trip we wanted to stay in a hotel there. Being in City Center is like being in a cosmopolitan city, not Las Vegas. To me, it seems like the third phase of LV, the first being loud, gaudy, garish, over-the-top and the second being lush, opulant, and luxurious. Not to say that CC is not the last three, but it is a setting that could easily be in Asia or Europe. Very sleek, sophisticated, and urbane. But back to the Vdara. Our stay was the 14th through the 18th of March. Quite frankly, we chose this hotel because we received the best deal. First impression: when we exited the taxi cab, no one from the hotel greeted us, held the door, directed us to check-in, etc., even though it was not extremely busy. However, the wonderful scent that greeted us upon our entrance made me forget about that--until we had to ask which way to check-in. Check-in was pretty simple. We were surprised about the daily resort charge that was added without explanation (didn't see this until check-out and then we were in too much of a hurry to get to the airport to inquire). We never knew there was a free newspaper in the lobby until check-out. I suppose there were other amenities covered by this resort charge that we never knew about as well. We stayed on the 46th floor. The view was amazing! We could see the mountains and the northern part of the strip (from the Bellagio northward). The window coverings were automatic, which was pretty cool. I have read here where people have said it is a difficult system to understand. I am not sure what is so difficult about selecting black-out or blind and up or down. The kitchen was practical. If you desired to have cooking utensils, you could contact housekeeping. The microwave was very handy for heating up leftovers. I was surprised that there was not a coffee maker. I can't even remember the last hotel I stayed at that did not have one standard in the room. I suppose I could have requested one, but we never did. As far as cleanliness, this place was spotless! I am very particular about that--I am the one who goes over everything with handi-wipes immediately upon entering. I did not feel the need here. Our room was always made up in a timely manner. Another curious thing to me was that there was only one sink in the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. The two HD televisions were great. We loved the location, right in the middle of the strip. Again, others have said it is a long walk to the tram, to the strip, etc. This is very subjective. We found it quite easy to get anywhere, downright convenient in fact. The walk to the strip is easy, although the sidewalk stops half way there and you must cross the street to continue on. The tram is just next door at the Bellagio and there is a covered walkway. Not far at all. Easy to get to Crystal's (the shopping area), too. There is not a casino or restaurant in the Vdara. We found this no problem as, one, we are not gamblers, and two, any number of food options are within easy walking distance (for us, anyway). My favorite thing was, strangely enough, that wonderful scent in the lobby. So refreshing. The only reasons I did not rate this hotel a 5 are the lack of help upon arrival, no explanation about the resort fee, and one sink in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara>Aria”
Reviews.Author: Birdyyy
Reviews.Content: If you're picking between the Vdara and the Aria I highly recommend the Vdara. It was quite but not too quiet still had that Vegas flair. The rooms were excellent and the bed is the best bed I have ever slept on in a hotel. The service was excellent and every employee was really accommodating. The pool was very relaxing. If you are looking to enjoy the Vegas hype only when you want to stay at the Vdara. You don't get the casino smoke and it's definitely a great place to go when you just want to go back to a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed at the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: mlafa1985
Reviews.Content: My friends and I arrived at the Vdara ready to have a great time in Vegas...what a joke. We went out our first night and returned to our room to find out we had been robbed. Everything of any value was missing, ipods, purses, credit cards, cash, I.D. cards, luggage, even some articles of clothing. We called security immediately to report the theft and instead of handling the issue in a professional manner, they blamed us for our loss, were rude, condescending and basically told us there was nothing they could do about the situation. We are still trying to get the issue resolved and I will NEVER EVER stay here again and I would recommend everyone else to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “um...try harder...”
Reviews.Author: HaveGreatTimes7
Reviews.Content: me = 26 year old, grad student on spring break traveling with partner. room = Deluxe room, 50019, 50th floor. i love tripadvisor. but i also have my own mind. i used yelp, oyster.com, and tripadvisor to help decide on hotel booking. pros: +great looking hotel. +great looking room. +great bed and sofa. +huge windows with great view of skies, highway, planes taking off, and helicopter tours. +fast elevators - we were on the 50th floor. +great spa with FEW ppl. might be alone if lucky. +digital "do not disturb" and "housekeeping" buttons. and a DOORBELL :) +GREAT bathroom but only one sink. +dirty dishes washed by housekeeping. +fast tram. cons: +even if u REQUEST kitchenware when chking in, u still have to call multiple times AFTER they drop off the pots/plates to ASK for eating utensils. just two sets +yes, u can hook up ur IPOD to play through the TV speakers, BUT bring ur own AUX cord, if not, their AUX rental cord is a $10. (u get the $10 back upon checkout)..annoyance. +it said "refrig in room" on the website. i think my suitcase was DEEPER. all i could fit was a bottle of wine, a 16oz Sprite, and a cup of GELATO. right, cause there is no FREEZER. by the way, why is the other half of the refrig LOCKED? +really creepy noises at night. +pool is open 9-5. like a bank. what gives. +the spa is great but the shower/dressing area is TWICE the size of the room holding the jacuzzi, dry steam, and wet steam rooms. hell, even the meditation room was bigger. +the airport shuttle is $7.50 pp plus it stops at other hotels. no private airport shuttle. +City Center is BEAUTIFUL but dont be fooled. You're either gonna have to walk a lot (through Crystal Center OR in/out of Cosmopolitan.) cab a lot (they really do take the long way as the meter runs, never stops) or take the tram to hotels (Bellagio or Monte Carlo) to enter the Blvd. this might be cool at first but when jus tryin to run to CVS or to Planet Hollywood across the blvd, -sigh-. i saw lots of women in mini-dresses and pumps DYING by 1 or 2am. +if using a debit card, they put a $300 hold on ur card. +be prepared to hold on the phone for about 10 minutes waiting for concierge. its only one person to handle the walkups and phone calls to concierge. walking up is better. +only room OWNERS can use the dryer/washer. wtf, why have a POOL! +pool bar was closed. as well as the Silk restaurant. +came back to the room, and it was clean. so why everyday we had a message saying "Housekeeping could not clean your room." crock of bs. +no HBO, Showtime, Starz, Cinemax here. if u want REAL movies (no commercials), pay for em! +housekeeping will remake ur bed but no new sheets until the 3rd day it seemed. no comment on the bar/market cafe as we did not try but they both were packed. glad we got there on Wednesday, left on Monday morning, because the chk in lines from Thursday-Saturday were LONG! Honestly, i probably would have preferred Mandarin Oriental for a non-casino and Aria if you want a casino while staying in City Center. It seems like Vdara is the step child (no offense). i had a great time. and im not a critical person but for the price of this hotel and calling itself 4/5 stars, no way should have some of these things went down.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but boring”
Reviews.Author: travelkevin
Reviews.Content: Great price through Southwest Vacations. Flights, a room for 4 nights and two show tickets for only $100 more than airfare alone. Check in was flawless, for Vegas at least. No frightening waits. The room had a small kitchenette at the entry. Small living area with sofa and a large TV. Comfortable bed. Spacious bath with separate tub and shower. Aveda products. Filthy exhaust vent. The Vdara (what a stupid name) was all in all a super value. The Vdara is quiet. Too quiet. There is no restaurant or gift shop. There is a small bar and a market for coffee in the lobby. I missed having all the amenities that other Vegas resorts offer. I'll stay someplace else next time, but then again, I always do. BTW, I used my free tickets for Terry Fator. He has a talent, but the show was painful to watch. Bad jokes and worse songs. I liked Love, Mystere, Ka and Zumanity much more.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a value!”
Reviews.Author: VinceInLA
Reviews.Content: The new Vdara is a great value which is centrally located on the Strip. It's set back a bit from the Strip itself, so it's not as convenient as Aria, but it's a good value. There is a walkway that connects it to the Bellagio, and there is a tram that takes you to Aria or Monte Carlo. The rooms are incredible! The deluxe suite is very nice - with a kitchen and beautiful furniture. Great value for the price! We had a nice view of the back entrance to Aria, as well as the new Ritz-Carlton with mountains in the distance. The fitness center is very well-equipped, and the staff is very attentive - constantly tidying up and providing chilled water bottles and towels. I would highly recommend Vdara to anyone looking for an upscale, modern hotel that is close to the Strip. It's well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Tracey0808
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Vdara. This was our first trip to Vegas and we really enjoyed this hotel. It is a short walk to the strip either through the Bellagio, down Harmon Ave and through the Cosmopolitan or you can catch the tram/free train to the Aria/Crystasl or the Monte Carlo if you are heading in that direction. We had a view suite and had an amazing view of the Bellagio Fountains (make sure you ask for the view and not the pool view if that is what you want -we paid about $10 extra a day I think for the view suite but it was worth it!). The restaurant in the hotel (Silk Road) has closed but there is a small cafe and bar and it's a quick walk to the restaurants on the strip etc. We stopped at a grocery store on way in from airport so that worked great and I recommend it for drinks and breakfast items etc. Note there are no utensils etc. as mentioned in other posts, just ask for dishes, cutlery, mugs and robes when you check in and save yourself having to ask each time. We had difficulty at the beginning with our safe, but they were there to fix it within 20min.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: montanalady1982
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at VDARA. Went during a very busy weekend and the calmness of this hotel was a treat. After the longest cab line I have ever seen in 10 years in Las Vegas I thought for sure we would have to wait again at the hotel check in. Checked in at 2:00 pm and was very impressed. The person who helped us let us choose our view and floor level with no extra charge. They were very helpful and answered any questions we had at that time. Room was great. Very modern and simple. I wouldn't say it was as luxurious as Palazzo or Wynn but very nice and modern. Was nice to have two tv's as we could watch different programs during our relax time. The rooms were nice in size and very clean. The vibe of the hotel seemed to be more classy 30-60 age group rather than the young party age. There was only one option, a cafe to grab a quick bite. Room service was also an option. However, with the close location to Aria and Bellagio it wasn't too much of a problem. We did get room service and it was fabulous! They came in and set the table with flowers and all. Another great thing about this hotel on a weekend where cab lines were crazy , they were not here. You could always go out and grab one within a few minutes. The pool was great. Easy to find a chair and umbrella. It was very small compared to some of the resorts but didn't seem to be crowded. The music was relaxing and they had magazines you could use by the towels. All in all the hotel was wonderful for out purposes. If you are not there to party this is a perfect hotel! If you are there to party you are close to that scene as well.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara tries its best to be a 5-star oasis in the middle of...”
Reviews.Author: Caribou0203
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from Vdara where we stayed in a city-view suite for 7 nights. Service and room quality were excellent, and anything we needed for the kitchen was immediately delivered. Valet service was quick, and any staff that we encountered were professional and courteous. The beds were unbelievably comfortable as were the pillows, and the Aveda products were fantastic. As this was my first trip to Vegas, I did not know what to expect. In my opinion, "The Strip" highlights some of the worst in human nature yet tries to provide a clever and pretty "cover-up" of true crass and ugliness. I have traveled to many different countries throughout southeast Asia and Europe, and have never seen such embarrassing middle-class (and middle age) debauchery (did people not do this sort of thing in college?). Needless to say, I will never return to Vegas, so please keep that in mind when reading the rest of this review! Vdara does its very best to provide a quiet, 5-star oasis in the middle of complete chaos. Although it is non-smoking, a scent is pumped into the lobby and rooms, which unfortunately caused an allergic reaction for me (but not my husband). The hotel is busy 24/7, and sleep quality is an issue, but again this is not the fault of Vdara. Noise from the strip and the streets is non-stop, so ear-plugs are a must. If you love the Vegas scene, but want a relaxing place to stay, definitely give Vdara a try. If you are like me, a first-timer who wasn't sure about the Vegas experience, please think about what I have written. I found it impossible to enjoy the shows or restaurants, as you are forced to travel through smoke-filled casinos to get anywhere. Nevada is a beautiful state - so stay off the strip and enjoy the incredible desert and canyons. Scoot City Tours is a must, as is the Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon and of course the Grand Canyon. Although this review is primarily meant to provide our impressions of the hotel, I also wanted to provide other Vegas "first timers" my impression of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star?! More like a 2!”
Reviews.Author: KristineK11
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas at least once per year and always like staying at new places just to get a different "view" of the Strip. When we got a good deal on a package to stay at Vdara, I was pumped! It is part of the new City Center complex right in the heart of the action and from some of the other reviews and the pictures, I thought we were in for a real treat! WRONG. Although the location really can't be beat (adjacent to both Bellagio and Aria and minutes to the strip) and the some of the spa services were decent, here is a quick rundown of some of our experiences this weekend: *DIRTY sheets- even after we called to make sure they were cleaned and changed, the "new" ones were still stained with some previous guests' bodily fluids *We arrived on Weds and room was not cleaned until we called twice to ask for it to be cleaned on Friday *No robes in rooms- you have to call to request them and they bring them up on cheapy wire hangers, with the ties dragging along the floor. Very classy. *No coffee maker in room, so even if you think you're going to luck out by having a "kitchenette", you have to pay extra to get anything to use in the kitchen *Since no coffee maker, forced to go downstairs to buy coffee every morning- VERY expensive and VERY long wait. The entire Market Cafe setup is an organizational disaster. *The food at the Market Cafe takes forever to arrive and arrived ICE COLD- not even a hint at the breakfast sandwich ever having at least seen a microwave *We thought we'd just buy some food from the Market to have in our "kitchen" in the room- but they sell mostly things that you can't use: i.e. cereal but no milk, meat and cheese but no bread, dry muffin mix but there's no oven, etc. *The "Champagne" manis and pedis in the spa include champagne... for $20 extra per glass! At every other 5-star spa I've been to, this indication usually means bottomless champagne but not at Vdara! *The resort fee includes useless items such as free valet (didn't drive a car), free turndown for the sofa bed (not necessary for the two of us), free newspaper in the morning (not delivered to your door, but if you pick it up from the front desk before they run out), etc. Basically a total scam. Plus they tax you on the fee, so the $18 resort fee is really $20+ *I used a Groupon for the spa and even though this company claims to be "LEED certified" and ultra "green", I was forced to go to their business center to print out paper copies of my Groupon (instead of scanning from iPhone like a "green" company would)... and was then charged $1 to print out the coupon that they demanded they have a paper copy of! *I lost a diamond tennis bracelet in the lobby (completely my fault) but wanted to let the front desk know in case it was turned in to lost and found. Their reply was "And what do you want us to do about your problem?" in a very rude tone. I could go on... but you get the idea. If you're looking for an upscale, classy place to stay in Vegas, go for the Wynn or Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Non Gaming, Non Smoking Oasis but Service Needs a Bit of Polish”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: This property is in the heart of the "City Center" development and has a number of great features, the top of my list being it is entirely non smoking. It is also non gaming, providing an oasis for those who don't do either. If you want to gamble it is a short walk to the Aria Hotel and Casino in the same complex. It was sold at the height of the boom as a "hotel condo" so the rooms have small kitchens. Contemporary decor. If you get a room with a tub, they are very nice. Room service is superb but there is no restaurant on the property (they just closed the one) only a "market". For proper dining you need to walk over to the Aria. The Vdara spa is great, I had some excellent services and the gym is well equipped. Issues included having to ask for robes and turn down.The service is not quite up to 5 star. That said, I will not stay anywhere else in Vegas due to the non smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough staff”
Reviews.Author: tonysmw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from March10 through March 13. This hotel should be grateful to their staff members (what few of them that were on duty at any given time), that tirelessly work their butts off, and with a pleasant attitude. There were a lot of little inconveniences that added up to why I will not be staying at this hotel again. The Pros: ~Staff was outstanding, always positive, worked really hard. Not their fault that there were only a few bell hops working on Sunday with hundreds of checkouts and check-ins' ~Never, ever, did I observe any staff member slacking off or loafing around. They work very hard and probably have to put up with a lot of verbal garbage from frustrated clients. ~Rooms are nice but showing a little wear. ~Beds are comfy and rooms are quiet. Not a lot of outside noise. The Cons: ~Not enough staff. Long wait to drop off/pick up car from valet (give or take approx 15-20 minutes). One day, we went to "Plan B" (and walked) because we did not want to wait any longer for our car. ~Only valet parking. Would park my own car if City Center parking garage was open. ~Taxi's waiting in line for the Aria Hotel block the driveway going into and out of the Vdara. Traffic flow was dismal. ~Splurged and ordered room service for breakfast one morning. Wish I had not. Denny's taste better at a quarter of the price. ~Upon checkout on Sunday morning. It took 40 minutes for the bell hop to pick up our bags. Another 10-15 minutes to get the car from valet (and he gave us priority to get our car) ~Sunday was a cluster in the lobby and outside. Lots of people waiting, waiting, waiting. ~The City Center is a cluster getting in and out of. I don't mind walking and really can't tell you which access is best to get to the strip. We walked through the Aria, Belligio, and Cosmopolitan. Again, we don't mind walking but be aware there is no straight shot to get to the strip. If the hotel had more staff to accommodate the clients, I would stay here again, in spite of the cluster that the City Center is to get around. We are returning to Las Vegas in July and won't be staying at the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Property and Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to get a chance to stay in CityCenter during my last trip to Las Vegas, currently there are four options: -2x with Casinos (Aria & Cosmopolitan) -2x with no Casinos (Vdara & Mandarin Oriental) I wanted to visit a property that I could feel like I was away from the intensity of the city, while still be able to get my feet wet at the nearby Casinos should I have felt the need. Vdara was perfect for this, and is situated in the heart of CityCenter and a two minute walk to either Aria or Cosmopolitan (which are both fabulous by the way). The service at the front of the hotel was outstanding and the valet and porter greeted us with a very warm welcome, as did the clerk at check-in. No room upgrades were offered; however, the room was stunning and contained a kitchen and dining area, living room / bedroom divided by dual LCD TVs mounted on a dividing partition and a huge bathroom with separate shower and soaker tub. I believe this is a standard room, as I checked out some of the other rooms during maid service and noticed they were equally stunning. When booking, I checked out standard rooms from the other hotels in CityCenter and in comparison, the Vdara can simply not be beat anywhere on the strip for less than $200 per night. You essentially get a suite from one of the other 5 star properties for a fraction of the price. Only drawback... No gaming or restaurants. I saw this as a positive as it allowed me to explore the nearby casinos and restaurants without feeling confined to the hotel. I was originally going to give the hotel a four star rating, because there are a few growing pains (new hotel); however, in the context of value - the hotel has got to earn a five star rating. The points below are some criticisms I feel should be addressed to truly bring the hotel to the next level: Slow housekeeping service to the rooms: Ordered some wine glasses, knife and a couple of plates and it took nearly an hour after having to call an additional time for service. Being that the hotel was not near full occupancy, I would have expected a faster response time. Cheap fixtures in kitchen and bathroom: Felt that they really went cheap with the faucets and shower fixtures. In the kitchen, the faucet felt loose to the touch and gave me the impression that it could just snap off at any time. Low water pressure in the bathroom: For a five star property, the water pressure in the shower and to the toilet are simply unacceptable. My assumption is that this has something to do with trying to get some type of a green rating for the property. When I go on vacation, I'm not concerned with the efficiency of a hotel... I just want to be comfortable. Phone switch for valet: I had to call valet to pick up my car at around 11pm one night, and I could not get through to the valet desk at Vdara. It would ring, then there would be no answer, then I would be transferred to Aria's valet who had no idea what to tell me. It would appear that there is only one valet on duty in the evening, so if they are getting your car, there is no one answering the phones. Better to just go down to the lobby and flag a valet in person. No restaurant or pool bar: It would have been nice to at least have one dining option outside of the cafe in the lobby. I believe they just recently closed their restaurant and will replace it with a grocery store. I don't think this suits the feel of the hotel, but hopefully the prices will be affordable and they will offer a good wine and alcohol section at non inflated prices. For food options, it's best to drop in to Aria across the street. Iron is cabled to the ironing board: Seriously, this is ridiculous! My wife had to drag the ironing board from the bedroom into the kitchen just to fill the thing with water. Concerned about someone stealing a $20 iron? Isn't that what credit cards (incidentals) are for? Ok, other than these criticisms, Vdara is an absolutely exceptional hotel to spend a relaxing time at! When you walk in, the hotel smells fresh and carpets are the plushest and cleanest I've seen at any hotel. I was worried that Vdara would be too "ultra modern", but they balanced the overall look to appeal to a wide variety of tastes. I think the designers did a wonderful job! My previous go to property on the strip was the Encore, but I have noticed lately that the prices have begun to rise their into the upper $200s. If Vdara can stay consistently under $200, I think it stands to become a real trend setter in Vegas by offering a huge level of value for those comfortable being close to the action, without actually being in it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for couples; Go somewhere else for girls/guys trip”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter3333
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my boyfriend (we're both 28) and we've both been to Vegas many times before and thought we'd try this hotel out b/c it's one of the newer ones. Pros > Check in was easy and they were very friendly > Check out was even easier b/c you can do it from your room on the tv > The room was immaculately clean every day > The suites were nice and spacious for a couple... but still like Venetian's suites better if you were to put 4 people in a room and i've read that their rooms only have 1 king size bed and not 2 doubles > The bed was very comfortable > The kitchen was perfect to heat up left overs > Loved the Aveda products in the bathroom (and I'm very picky for shampoo/conditioner) > Very close to Haze Club at Aria (3 minute walk) > Pool area is nice but small compared to Bellagio/Venetian/MGM > The view was amazing!!!! Cons > You have to call the front desk for mostly EVERYTHING you need in the room >> There are 2 cups and an ice bucket in the kitchen but if you need plates, cutlery, or anything else for the kitchen you have to call the front desk >> We also had to call for robes and slippers when most 5** hotels have them in the room > The walk to the strip is long when you've been walking all day from shopping and sight seeing and especially long when wearing heels to go out at night (from the strip to through the Bellagio it's a 7 minute walk and if you go through City Centre it's about a 12 minute walk) > There's no casino ... BUT Aria is literally a 3 min walk to the casino > There's no where to eat in the lobby after midnight Overall it was a nice, modern hotel and good for couples but definitely not a very fun hotel. I think a lot of it has to do with no casino being downstairs. There's nothing happening and there's nothing to eat after midnight and you'd have to walk to the Bellagio or Aria. If you're with a group of guys/girls I would recommend a different hotel like the Venetian or Caesars. My favourite thing about this hotel is the microwave in the room b/c we could eat our leftovers.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: travel1065
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary. She's not a gambler, she hates cigarette smoke, so a non-smoking, no casino hotel was a big plus. Check in was a breeze. Based on previous reviews we asked at the front desk for a coffee maker, and were told that didn't have one available. So the clerk comped us $25.00 so we could have room service. Our room was beautiful. Nicely appointed, very comfortable bed. My wife loved the soaking tub. We were on the 42nd floor with a view of the Bellagio fountains, and the mountains surrounding Las Vegas. Easy stroll to Aria,Vdara's sister hotel for my gambling expeditions. About a 5 min. walk through pedestrian bridge to the Bellagio. We rented a car one day and drove to Red Rock Canyon about a 30 min. drive. The hotel provides free valet parking, you gotta love it! Only negative really, was the lack of a real restaurant at the hotel. They have a cafe that had just opened, and didn't really have its act together. I'm really glad I picked this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great for business”
Reviews.Author: trvlNstyle
Reviews.Content: While traveling on business this week I wanted to try one of the new City Center properties. The Vdara is a beautiful new hotel. It is set back a bit from the strip which is both good and bad. There is no gaming which is good/bad. The hotel ends up being very quiet which is certainly a different vibe for Las Vegas. There is no restaurant other than a take out cafeteria style cafe. There is only one bar in the lobby which was totally dead. The high point with the Vdara for me was that it was non smoking. The Vdara is affiliated with the Aria across the street which is HUGE and busy, actually the extreme opposite of Vdara. All in all I enjoyed the hotel, it was perfect for a business trip but I would not stay there if it was a personal trip. Incidentally I spent some time in the Cosmopolitan next door which was fantastic. I would definitely stay there next time if it was not business.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and Excellent concierge.”
Reviews.Author: imaging54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just checked out after spending a week at Vdara. The hotel is new and the rooms are large and comfortable. The concierge was amazing - able to book us discount seats to O and Love. The hotel lacks restaurants - just one overpriced cafeteria. The other restaurant seems permanently closed. This was a bit annoying, but the hotel is directly connected to the Bellagio, so we ate there a lot. The pool area was plain compared with other high end resorts. Gym was excellent. We pricelined the hotel so the rate was excellent. Also liked that the hotel is nonsmoking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MajaCube
Reviews.Content: Beautiful almost new hotel. We are traveling with our kids and appreciate the smokefree and casinofree hotel. staff was very nice and helpful. the rooms have a good size. we slept very well in the king size bed and our kids on the queen size sofabed. the design is very appealing. modern, Japanese style. there is passage straight to the Bellagio, so no problem to get to all the Vegas action you may crave.

Reviews.Title: “Love Vdara”
Reviews.Author: ahca818
Reviews.Content: A trip with my hubby on 02/21 - 02/25 and we stayed at Vdara. We got a deal from hotwire with this new 5 star hotel. We stayed at the deluxe suite, it's super clean and nice. A little complain on the day we checkout, the checkout time was 12pm, and around 9ish cleaning lady just knocked and opened your door to wake you up. I think it's kind of rude and scared me to hell. If she just knocked on the door or give us a call, that's OK to me but opened the door..... anyways, we both enjoyed our trip at Vegas and would love to stay at Vdara again. The Resort Fee is an ouch! It's about $20 per day after tax. PS: love the smell of Vdara, it has a fresh nice smell of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for a better hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ShoeGURU
Reviews.Content: Love love love Vdara!! The rooms were spacious and really nice. The bathroom was amazing! We had a great view of the Bellagio fountains (which we requested). Even though its like a 1 minute walk from the strip, there is a tram that takes you to monte carlo,aria/ crystals shopping center, and bellagio ( which is right next to vdara). The staff was awesome; very friendly and personable. Its nice to get away from the gaming smoke-filled hotels when its time to rest for the night and this hotel is the best for it on the strip! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Treblecle
Reviews.Content: Excellent view overlooking Bellagio foutains from 25th floor, room was big, modern and clean, staff friendly, no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Suite!”
Reviews.Author: df1ace
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to venture out to Las Vegas for the first time for a 5 night stay @ the Vdara! Her brother & his wife ended up staying across the street at the MGM Grand. Upon arrival, we were greeting by friendly and helping staff to assist with our luggage. From there the front desk associate was extremely helpful in welcoming us and ensuring that our first stay in Vegas would be unforgettable! We were told there were a few available upgrades to choose from- and based on our preferences- he suggested the Panoramic Suite on one of the higher floors. The elevator ride to the 46th floor was quick! We found our room at the end of the hallway! The entry cards do not need to be slid into a magnetic strip- just wave it in front of the sensor. Another cool feature is the glowing doorbell for each room. It naturally glows a white color- however, once inside the room you can adjust this color to glow blue for 'Do Not Disturb' or green for 'Housekeeping'. The electric shades were all down when we got in the room. Once we found the switches to raise the blinds- we were overcome with the sights we were surrounded by! Views of the city and mountains from the entryway, kitchen, living room, bedroom, and bathroom! The only thing that was a bit quirky was the placement of the switches-- seemed to be in odd locations. The bathroom was superb- with 2 separate sinks, a large soaking tub looking out onto the strip & mountains, and a spacious shower with marble seat. Unfortunately- her brother & wife did not have the same great fortune we found back at the MGM Grand. Once they came and saw our hotel & room- their excitement dropped as they noted the lack of equivalent high-end accommodations, and likened their room more to a Hotel 6 stay. I for one had an amazing time at the Vdara and am eagerly looking forward to a return trip! We did not utilize the kitchen at all unfortunately- but did read other reviews that said that the promptness for obtaining kitchenware wasn't superb. My only other semi complaint would be the house keeping. Leftover food was left out for several days, and no replacement of soaps/toiletries or the robe once worn once. Little things to note, but didn't hamper my stay in any way! The view and amazingly comfortable bed was well worth the trip alone! :)

Reviews.Title: “My new favaourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zmu
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many 5 star hotels in North America and this was one of the best. I am surprised that some sites rate this as a 4 star. The service was excellent. Check-in was speedy and I was impressed to be offered a choice of floors. The room was large with a beautiful view. It was new and modern and very clean. The hotel was pretty quiet so there was lots of room at the pool. The market cafe, while pricey, had some of the best fruit I've ever eaten. Overallour 2 day stay was easy, relaxing and comfortable. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking place - just wish it lived up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTraveler123
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. WE looked forward to staying there. All suites have kitchen appliances. Nice for business travel. HOWEVER, no plates, kitchenware, unless you call housekeeping many, many times. Ours arrived the day we left. Had a drunk at the door at 1:30 one morning pounding to get in. I called security and they hung up on me. Called back, but they never showed up. Housekeeping took one of our coffee cups, leaving one for me and my wife to share. Never brought it back even though I went to the desk, and called more than once. Nice Keurig coffee maker, but only 2 cups worth of coffee allotted per day. They wouldn't bring more. WAAAY too expensive for such poor service and lack of understanding that the customer is paying for them to be open. Definitely a non-return.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara vs Aria......????”
Reviews.Author: keyleys
Reviews.Content: was a bit hesitant to book the Vdara since its so far off the strip and doesn't have a casino inside. I ended up being greatful for all this. It was so easy to check in. The walk from the valet to the checkin to the room was about 1 minute. You can easily access the Aria casino by walking outside for about 2 minutes. The city center tram is also very easy to get to, about a 2 minute walk from the room. When we checked in at 10:30 PM, I asked for a room with a divider and a view. I was told the rooms with divider were full (yeah right- the hotel wasn't even close to capasity). I was also given the option to upgrade to a Bellagio view for an additional $15 night. I opted to stay with my original room with an interstate view. The room was very nice and comfortable. The bed was very soft, almost too soft. The pillows were good for a hotel. We enjoyed the bathtub and the walk in shower, The toilet lacks privacy. Beware of the mini-bar, very spendy! There is a seperate side of the fridge that you can use for your own snacks. Overall it was a great stay and we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Non-Gaming Non-Smoking Hotel On the Strip”
Reviews.Author: etan92612
Reviews.Content: Most people choose to stay on the strip for what Vegas is famous for...the gaming, shows and other entertainment. But, if things other than fun and entertainment bring you to the strip, then this is an excellent choice. It is still an excellent choice if you DO want the Vegas scene because it's in City Centre right in the middle of the strip. This is a non-smoking property and you can feel the tranquility when you enter. You can request kitchen utensils from housekeeping for serving and preparing meals in the kitchen that is a part of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but Staff definitely need a better training”
Reviews.Author: minimia007
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the comments I read about this hotel- excellent location, amazing views, the non- gambling and non- smoking establishment makes it a great escape from all the casinos and the big crowds in Vegas. What spoilt my 4 nights at this hotel was the Staff- - Front Desk Receptionist called Jessica was extremely unpleasant at check in. She totally ignored the early check in request, wanted to check us into a dirty room and just pointed out that we should go to the bellman outside and leave our luggage. I asked if the luggage can be sent directly to our rooms once they become available, she said NO, you will go to the bellman and get your luggage from him?! Is this a 5 star service or what? - The bar in the Lobby with a seating area overlooking the entrance was a lovely place to be however the staff members were not very helpful there either- I had to wait for 15min until a bartender arrives, the member of staff who was nearby just said he didn't know where his colleague was. Later on few of them were just chatting nicely next to the bar and totally ignored my request to bring the drinks to our seating area. So I ended up having no tray but a folder with a bill, two drinks to carry and a handbag- again is this a 5 star service I wonder. - one of our rooms smelled on mold and it took 3 days and complaints to finally be moved. - in the other room, some of the lights were not working, the bath tub tap was not either and the toilet was not flashing properly. After all, the only helpful and very very pleasant staff members were the Bellmen. Wether or not they were so nice because of the tips, I do not know. I have stayed in many places around the world, I have also worked in the hotel industry and one thing for sure, the staff at Vdara does not really know what a 5 star service is. Shame, as the hotel is so so lovely. Also, I did not see any manager at the hotel, they were either very well hidden at the back or they just do not care how their associates perform. There was no feedback form to fill in on their website so I thought I would just leave my comments here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, luxurious hotel will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: bkavanagh1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite tranquil which makes a difference from all the other hotels. We were asked where we would like the location of our room to be so we chose a higher floor. The room was spotless, spacious and well laid out. They leave all the numbers for you to ring if you need cutlery etc which is sent up within 30mins not that we would need it. The bed was so comfy and the view amazing. The hotel was linked with a walk way to the Bellagio on 1 side(which is located down the corridor beside the restaurant) or across the entrance to the Cosmopolitan. The fees are a bit excessive if you don't use the gym or wi-fi but the hotel is well worth the money. If you are looking for a hotel that has a bit more of a buzz, then this is not it. But if you want a hotel that is clean, quiet and a bit more plush than your average hotel than I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location but Starting to Show Wear”
Reviews.Author: iliketropical
Reviews.Content: Prior reviews have thoroughly covered the positives of this property, including its excellent location and relaxed atmosphere. The only thing I would add is it seems the developer was in a rush to get the rooms on the market. The rooms are nicely decorated in a trendy style, but the furnishings are not top quality and already show major wear and tear. The doors on the undercounter refrigerators sag, the stylish lampshades are stained , the furniture veneer is chipped, and the shower faucet trim is loose.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously nice”
Reviews.Author: oglestheitalian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara in mid-February and were lucky enough to leave the cold just in time to catch a cold snap in the desert. Luckily for the Las Vegans it warmed back up the day we flew home. Vdara itself was absolutely perfect, we've stayed in 5 stars on quite a few occasions and this was on par with the best of them. Upon check in, while conversing with the clerk I advised this was our first time to Las Vegas and he gave us an upgrade without the super secret $50 tip I had read about for a room upgrade, and honestly I wasn't even fishing for it, but he started our stay off right. The suite itself was immaculate and the view of the Bellagio fountains on one side and the mountains on the other was remarkable. For my wife's 30th birthday she had a massage at the spa and while we payed about 75% more than at home, she said it put any other massages she's had in the past to shame. We didn't try the restaraunt but apparently it's days are numbered as they are building a market in the lobby. We did have a drink or two in the lobby bar, the drinks were very pricey and unfortunately not very worth it. City center was nice and the trams really handy in catching a ride south on the boulevard. Also as a heads up there is a CVS about a block to the south in case your looking for snacks for the room. I would absolutely recomend this hotel to anyone looking to escape from the masses at a casino hotel, there's nothing like fighting your way through the Bellagio lobby at 2 or 3 in the morning than to walk into the Vdara which was quiet, and smoke free. Worth the money, and so close to the Bellagio casino you don't even notice your not staying in a casino hotel until you realize you don't smell like smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yihahn
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay. Had a room on a pretty high floor with a panoramic view. However the location is a bit far from the strip. The best part was everything was really new and clean as the hotel was a few months old. I would consider other hotels on the strip should I visit Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new hotel but..”
Reviews.Author: Vangirl604
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas with a girlfriend for her birthday and stayed at the Vdara from Feb 16-20. The Vdara is very new, clean, has lovely modern decor. As many reviewers have mentioned, it is non gambling, non smoking hotel which is great for the non smokers. Since it was my first time in Vegas, I couldn't decide on which hotel to stay at, the lady at the Flightcenter told me the Vdara was less than 2 years old and has very good reviews so far so we decided to stay there. And yes the Vdara is new and very nice. This is not to make this hotel look bad, it is solely just my opinion. Two girls in early 20's going to Las Vegas for the experience and shopping... Vdara is not the best hotel to stay at. It is very quiet.. too quiet. If you travel to Vegas often and you are looking to relax (but why would you go to Vegas to relax?) then Vdara is your hotel. There is nothing going on other than the small bar with maybe 5 people at a time and if you want to socialize, gamble, meet people, etc etc. closest place is the Aria, which is right across, but still it is quite the different experience. To go to the Aria or the city center it's a bit of a walk. It's not "right across the street" like the flightcenter told me, especially on a windy day, you have to walk atleast 5 minutes and it sure feels a lot further than across the street. Check in was very easy and fast, there are 50 something floors, and we were on 33rd floor. The view wasn't that great, and the room felt quite small. The bathroom was decent size with 2 sinks and our room had a small kitchen with microwave and fridge. They charge $18 a day for hotel fee for newspaper, 2bottles of water, etc etc, and we did not receive newspaper or bottles of water other than the ones that were there when we checked in. I called front desk on the 3rd day and told them about it and they brought 4 bottles of water up. If you're gonna charge $36 a day for bottles of water, you should make sure it's there. Also there were no robes or slippers but a note saying it's available by request, so we called for them also. Which is understandable because not everyone wants robes or slippers but it's a 4.5 star hotel, (told it's not 5 because it doesn't have casino, otherwise it would've been) and they can't provide robes or slippers? To me its odd and seems like a way for bellboys to make couple extra bucks on tips, which kinda annoys me. Another thing is that the Vdara and Aria is located slightly off the strip, have to turn in and go up this circular ramp to get to the two hotels. Since we didn't rent a car, and it was quite windy out, we cabbed everywhere! And even to get to the strip was $5-10 and include tips, the amount spent on cabs alone was more than $500 for the 4 days. (We did go back and forth from malls, outlets and clubs though but still!) Like I said, this isn't to make this hotel look bad, it is a very nice hotel, it just wasn't for us. We visited Caesars, Encore, Cosmopolitan, Aria and Luxor and the vibe was totally different. There were people everywhere at all hours and we enjoyed meeting all sorts of people from around the world. Next time we will be staying at the Cosmopolitan (another new hotel with the hottest club right now: Marquee), Caesars (has the Pure club as well as the Forum shops) or Encore. They might cost slightly more but considering the amount spent on cabs I think it might even out at the end! The only reason I would not recommend this hotel to a friend is because all my friends are my age and would feel the same. If you are older, or a family visiting Vegas, Vdara is a good hotel to stay at. Oh I do have to mention, my friend forgot her sunglasses in the room, and the security guy called later that day asking if I left anything behind. He told me they'd ship it right away which was very nice we thought she lost her $600 sunglasses! so Thank you Vdara!

Reviews.Title: “quite side of city center”
Reviews.Author: riverwest
Reviews.Content: Hotel is non smoking, non gambling, upscale. rooms are nice mini suites. It has all amenties, such as pool, spa, fitness, bar & restaurants & store. (just a lot smaller than most casino's) Location is very centrally located, Hotel is nice retreat to come back to, after a day or night of packed and noisy vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: sam86228
Reviews.Content: I booked at Vdara for my annual work conference because it was a non-smoking hotel, but found it to be so much more! First - I now love valet parking! The valets are friendly and efficient and it was great to hand off the car at the end of the day and get on with my night. Next - the room was large, super clean and had a great memory foam bed and big bathroom w/ a wonderful tub ( and separate glass shower for people like my husband who do not bathe). We had a great view of the mountains from a high floor in just the deluxe room. The junior kitchen w/ small fridge was a nice extra for holding water and other cold drinks. We did order room service and had a delicious meal served w/in 20 minutes ( a full table w/ flowers was set by the wait staff in our room). The workout area is bright and was not crowded and is included in the resort fee. Truly - this place is superb and sits only steps from either Aria or Bellagio. Try the Aria Jean-Phillipe bakery in the AM for delicious coffee and food. Red Rock Canyon is close by if you have a car and had a large selection of trails from easy to challenging/ bouldering.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara...Don't expect a Vegas experience but you won't be disappointed either”
Reviews.Author: HeyMan76
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the don’ts. Don’t stay at the Vdara if this is your first time in Vegas. Why? Because the Vdara won’t give you the “Vegas Experience” that you’re probably looking for. There’s no casino. There’s only one restaurant (and it’s only open for breakfast and lunch). There’s only one bar and the “scene” at the bar is more reminiscent of a Hilton or Hyatt in someplace like Chicago or Houston, not Vegas. While there is a pool, it’s nothing more than a slab of concrete located on the third floor with zero atmosphere. A real Vegas pool is what you’d find at the Mirage or Mandalay Bay or Hard Rock or Wynn but definitely not at Vdara. The spa is small and lacks basic amenities (like juice, fresh fruit, iced towels, etc.) and only has one small whirlpool. If you’re looking for a Vegas spa, head to Caesars or Bellagio or Mandalay Bay. Even the Luxor has a better spa. But don’t get me wrong…the Vdara is one of the nicest hotels for the price of any hotel in Vegas. The rooms are outstanding. I’ve stayed at just about every hotel in Las Vegas and the Vdara rooms and the personnel (front desk, bell staff, restaurant, housekeeping, etc.), are some of the best you’ll find anywhere. The common areas of the hotel and the rooms themselves were tastefully decorated and impeccably clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. The plasma TV actually had over 50 stations and most in HD. Most hotels in Vegas that have LCD’s or plasmas have a very limited number of channels and almost never have any in HD. While I know you probably aren’t coming to Vegas to watch TV, why have an HDTV and not supply HD programming? All the rooms in the Vdara are suites complete with kitchens. From the standard deluxe suite (like the one I was in), all the way up to two bedroom penthouse suites. Not that you’d have any intention on cooking, but it’s nice to have a microwave and a fridge handy to warm up or cool down drinks that you’ll bring in from the strip. The large bathrooms have freestanding tubs and large separate glass showers. The only negative I have on the bathroom is that for rooms this size and so nicely appointed, they only included one sink. The rooms all have windows that run the length of the room and include automatic drapes and blackout shades that rise and fall by remote control. The fitness center is small for the number of rooms in the hotel. It’s very nice and modern (all the elliptical machines have personal TV’s, there’s free bottled water and a small assortment of machine weights and free weights). But there is usually a wait to use one of only 5 elliptical machines, 3 treadmills or 2 bikes. The fitness center is free but you are paying for it as part of your $18 a day resort fee. The fee also includes internet, bottled water in your room, local and long distance calls (does anyone really use this?) and free newspapers although you have to get these from the front desk. The spa, unless you’re receiving a treatment, will cost you an extra $25 per day to use. Most Vegas hotels that charge a resort fee only tack on an extra $10 or so to use the spa facilities since you’re already paying a resort fee. Charging an additional $25 is a rip off, especially for this spa. It’s small (only one whirlpool), and as I stated earlier, lacks basic amenities like assorted juices, fresh fruit (typically you would be offered bananas, oranges, kiwi, etc.). It has a small relaxation room and no audio system (soothing music), in the steam, sauna or anywhere else in the spa. It was also very bright. Spas in my opinion should take on dusk type lighting. The spa was probably the biggest disappointment of anything at the Vdara. The one restaurant in the hotel, Silk Road, is only open for breakfast and lunch and the prices are on the high side. But don’t miss it! Both mornings I ate there (because I had a $25 per day resort credit), people were coming in from other hotels just for the coffee and cappuccinos. I’m not sure how they do it, but their cappuccinos are as good as the ones I’ve had in Italy and certainly the best I’ve had anywhere in the U.S. You also have to try the breakfast sliders. These are something right out of Top Chef. Three small breakfast sandwiches made with outstanding beef tenderloin and quail eggs. Unreal! Vdara is located in the back of City Center. Across from the Aria, behind the Cosmopolitan and next to the back of the Bellagio so there’s no direct access to the strip. But don’t be put off by the location. Vdara is connected via a short walkway directly into the Bellagio from the hotel lobby or you can jump on the tram and take it down to the Monte Carlo. You can of course walk across the main entrance driveway and into the Aria. Another advantage to staying at Vdara is the wait time for a cab. There are none. Unlike the mega resorts where wait times during prime rush hour traffic (checkout, dinner, etc), can be up to a half hour or more, there never was more than one person waiting for a cab. Vdara is the perfect place to stay on business or if you’re a long time Vegas visitor who’s not necessarily looking for the typical Vegas hotel. They always seem to have some sort of promotions going on and the below average price for an above average room makes the Vdara a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, just non-gaming”
Reviews.Author: RJ-EM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights and despite the fact that it is a non-gaming hotel we quite liked it. It is connected to the Bellagio Casino which is just a 5 min walk from the Vdara. If you are looking for a gaming casino, this should not be your pick, if you are looking for a nice new boutique like hotel in Las Vegas this should definitely be your hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good from Far and FAR from Good”
Reviews.Author: JosephSloboda
Reviews.Content: On the surface this is a very nice looking hotel that is convenientaly located just off the strip but within walking distance to Bellagio, Ceasers and many other cool places. The hotel was clean and has really cool art and music playing when you arrive but once you check in everything changes. First you need to understand that this is not a regular hotel, this is a "condo hotel" so these are like small apartments (very small apartments). When we boked the room we stressed to the hotel that I needed a room with 2 beds because I was traveling with a work associate and we needed to share a room. When we arrived we were told that ALL of the rooms in the hotel that have more than one bed come with a pull out couch as the 2nd bed. I haven't slept on a pull out couch since college and at $200 per night I was not happy that I was expected to tonight. Especially since it was midnight local time when we arrived and I had been traveling for 8 hours and had a business meeting in just 7 hours. I was assured that the bed would be made for me and that extra padding would be added right away. That I was the #1 priority. I figured well, OK we can deal with this for 2 nights, lets make the best of it. We waited close to an hour and still no housekeeping with linens and pillows, when we called we were told it would be no more than 20 minutes, we called again at 1:30am and were told they were coming right up, we called again at 2am and wa assured they were coming "right now". At 2:30am when they arrived the housekeeper asked if we wanted her to make the bed, we said no, don't worry about it, we have been waiting more than 2hours and she said it wasn't her fault, she just got here. Not the answer I was expecting to hear. On top of all this, noise travels well in the Vdara hotel, especially through the air vents. It was like being back in my first apratment in NYC when you can hear EVERYTHING going on in the room next door and the room upstairs. Between listening to the late night antics of the couple in the room next to me and the Fraternity Keg party going on upstairs it was impossible to get sleep, it was like the sounds were bein gpiped in throught he PA system. When I called to ask Mgmnt if they could do something about the party upstairs we were told "well this is Vegas". (Are they kidding ! !) The next morning I went to see the manager, I was told there are no other rooms anywhere in the hotel but that they were sorry and that they woudl waive the resort fee for the day . . . WHAT ?!? How about comping the room for the night? Or waive the resort fee for both nghts and give me $200 food and Beverage - no sir, sorry the best we can do is one night resort fee. This place is a joke. I seriously expect more from an MGM property I can't say how disappointed I am in the service and the accomodations. I guess if you come here to party and don't mind sleeping on a pull out couch - if you plan on sleeping than this is the place for you. Otherwise stay away and go around the corner to the Palms or Ceasers. Joe Sloboda

Reviews.Title: “Nice new Hotel with outstanding view if you're at Floor 50 and higher”
Reviews.Author: Chemicalx81
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was really nice. We've got a room at the 52nd floor and a outstanding view! The room itself was comfy and the interior was modern. Bathroom was very nice and a lot of space. Nice Bathtub. Cons: No Power outlets next the Bed to charge Phone. No Light switches next to the Bed. Otherwise, it was really good. Service was nice and the Hotel was very Clean. All rooms are suites as I know.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice rooms, rooms are way better than the Bellagio!”
Reviews.Author: sez_babe00
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Vdara's condo-style rooms! The service we received was fantastic, the front lobby area was very quite, and we didn't have to wait at all in line. This hotel does not have a casino, it has only one (soon to be two) restaurants, and it has a bar. This was absolutely fine by me, because the lack of restaurants/casinos resulted in a lovely SHORT walk back to the elevators, and my room (probably about 2 minutes in total from the lobby to your room!) It has a direct walk-way connecting to the inside of the Bellagio, and a monorail/tram from there to the aria/monte carlo resorts. Aria casino is about a 3-5minute walk via some pedestrian walkways. The quickest route to the strip is straight outside the front doors, and walk down the side of the brand new Cosmopolitan hotel along the road. This is a fantastic hotel in a great location, with really reaaaally nice rooms. I didn't see the pool area, but the gym facilities were very nice. The best part: The rooms! Last time, I stayed at the Bellagio in an equivalent room. Trust me, the Vdara's rooms are WAAAAAAAAY better. (Probably because they are so much newer). Two (minor) downsides... 1) no utensils in the kitchen (I think it may be worthwhile to request them upon check in, just in case you need them. ) We ended up eating left-over food with shovels fashioned out of ripped up cardboard because by the time you realise you need a knife and fork, you can't be bothered to wait! (plus at least you get a kitchen!) 2) INCREDIBLY expensive room service for breakfast menu. Unrealistic prices for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style Las Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: jlfv
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a non-gaming hotel located in City Center between the fabulous Bellagio Casino & Hotel and the very modern Aria Hotel & Casino. My husband and I stayed there late January to check it out. I loved it - it's not as lush as Bellagio but the rooms - all suites with a sitting area and kitchenette - were very spacious and nicely appointed. Very sleek and modern. Our suite had a bank of windows from the sitting area end to the sleeping area with a fantastic view of the strip and the mountains in the distance. I loved loved loved the view. I had my hair and make up done Las Vegas style in the hotel's salon for an evening out - great job and great salon staff - very reasonable pricing. The gym and in-room wireless Internet and 2 bottles of water per day were included in the $18 per day resort fee. The gym is small but very well set up with treadmills, weights, mats etc. It's not the Bellagio's fabulous gym but it didn't cost $25 additional per day either. The staff was very professional and helpful. It is a NO smoking hotel - and that means even on the patios & at the pool - and they mean it and enforce it very politely, which is nice for me, a non-smoker! It's a lovely hotel and very quiet compared to the usual casino hotel in LV - so if you want a quite getaway from the rest of Las Vegas, but situated very conveniently to restaurants, shows and casinos, Vdara may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you book this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FoodCriticVentura
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one of most horrible experiences while staying at the VDara Hotel. Yes, the room was beautiful but you will spend most of your time on the phone requesting items for the room because everything is "by request." The hotel operator is a shared service between VDara and Aria so they don't always get your items to your room and you will have to follow up. For example, if you book an Executive Suite with a pull out bed. You have to request your bed be made up. The rooms have a beautiful kitchen but no fork, plate, spoon, pot, pans etc. You have to request each item and you ask for more than four you have to justify it and then it has to go to a manger for approval. More time wasted on your trip. The rooms also have a washer and dryer but no soap. Not even a dish towel or sponge in the kitchen. I didn't realize I needed to make a list while on vacation. They make it so difficult that it is simply not worth it. Not with so many other hotels that want your business in Vegas. Now let's talk about the Staff. We pulled up to what we thought was the valet and as we were loading our suitcases the employee yelled us for being in the wrong spot then blew his whistle at us. We stook in line for 30 minutes to check-in and 55 minutes to check out. The hotel room has an AC unit but the entire hotel (hallways, elevators etc.) do not. If they do, they were not on this weekend. It was like walking into a sauna. The lobby looked like the airport. People sleeping in their chairs waiting for what I am not sure. Lastly, the hotel will charge you a $20.00 a day resort fee on top of your room charges. Do yourself a favor and find another hotel. This place will go BK in a matter of time. P.S. The hotel does not have any soda or snack vending machines or general store. You have to take a tram to another hotel to go buy some gum or band-aide.

Reviews.Title: “Serene in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: chappaquamaestro
Reviews.Content: I am not one to like the hustle bustle and smoke of the big casinos. Vdara offers a welcome change in the remarkably interesting City Center. No smoking facility through and through. The suite we stayed in was spacious, had every amenity and from the 50th floor the views were clear to the mountainous horizon. Service was excellent, complimentary slippers and robes plush, spa and workout facilities perfect. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: dudesd
Reviews.Content: Im glad we didn't pay attention to the negative reviews. We could not have been happier with our stay. We travel to vegas often and this has been one of the best trips. The location is fantastic and is convieniently linked with bellagio by a walkway so makes getting to the strip easy. This is a quiet hotel which we especially enjoyed. I guess if you are looking for tons of action then this is not the place for you. No smoke, no noisy casinos to trudge through to get to room, But still close enough to all the action of the strip. Pool is great as well. The rooms are beautiful and spacious and restaurant downstairs was delicious. Staff kind and helpful. Just stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: GTKarol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vdara February 10-14. What an unforgettable experience. We arrived around 1030am after a long flight from Pennsylvania and were able to get right in to our deluxe suite. The check-in process took only a few moments. The staff was cheerful and pleasant. I had asked for robes,slipppers, dishes and utensils at check-in. They were promptly delivered to our room within moments of our arrival . Our luggage was delivered and we were given instructions on how to operate the lighting features in the room. The deluxe suite that we stayed in was absolutely beautiful. The bedding was crisp and clean. The pillows were fantastic. The view from our room was the Bellagio fountains- what more could you ask for. The kitchen was a great touch. I had ordered groceries to be delivered to the room so the kitchen came in handy All of the staff members we encountered were so helpful and professional. We were blessed with warm weather and were able to spend a day by the pool. The lounge chairs by the pool were so comfortable. Large pillows came with each chair. The pool water was heated and crystal clear. We were given large, soft pool towels to use. Room service was also available poolside. Peolple beside us had wings and beer, we opted to take a quick walk to Aria and get sandwhiches to go from Jean Philippe Patisserie. My husband and I also spent a few hours at Spa Vdara. What a great place to unwind! The spa staff was very accomadating. Organic hot teas, fresh granola and ice water were readily available. The spa also had awesome toiletries for each guest to take advantage of including Aveda shampoo and lotions, shavers and even mouthwash. I found all of these items to be very convenient. The entire stay was wonderful. We will definitely come back to Vdara. Give it a try- you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't put much stock in the negative reviews!!"”
Reviews.Author: DrLuv2fly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful experience at Vdara. We spent 3 nights there for Valentine's day as well as her birthday, and we picked Vdara because of the location and non-smoking rooms. I read all the reviews beforehand, and I must admit I was nervous about some of the negative ones commenting on poor service, lack of amenities, etc. We were seriously impressed from the minute we got there. Front desk staff were courteous and helpful. They got me the Bellagio-view room I asked for. The deluxe suite was perfectly appointed for our needs. The room was turned over impeccably every day. Room service was great. The walk to the Bellagio was NOT that bad. Anyone who says so must not be used to routine ambulation. I would agree with previous reviewers that a coffee machine in the room would have been nice. A set of robes should also be customary in a hotel of its class. Otherwise our only negative experience was the breakfast buffet in the lobby-level restaurant. The scrambled eggs were quite literally green, and our waiter ignored us most of the service. All in all, I think the place is excellent, and we thank Vdara for a memorable romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “My best ever stay in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: carlosMiami_Us
Reviews.Content: Excellent in all respects and another advantage for me, no casino but is connected to the Bellagio and only steps from the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “The idealplace for families in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Shugsterhibs
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to LV, two years after our first when City Center was just a construction site. We decided to get somewhere five star this time, and booked through expedia.co.uk. Since we had a six year old in tow with us, the idea of a quieter hotel resort, but still right in the middle of the Strip appealed to us, and I'm really glad we did! We got a Corner Suite on the 31st floor , with views from three sides over LV. The room was large, with bedroom with a super comfy king sized bed, lounge area with pull out queen bed for our daughter, large bathroom and dressing area and kitchen. The place was spotless, and was kept that way by housekeeping (make sure you press the housekeeping button by the door in the morning when you leave!). We called down as soon as we got there to ask for bedding for the sofa bed and plates/cutlery etc., and despite what some of the reviews on here say, it was delivered to the room in minutes. There's electrically operated blinds throughout and two TVs (great for our daughter wanting to watch her kids programmes) It's easy to get around with a small walkway connecting the hotel to the Bellagio and the tram to Aria and Monte Carlo, it's a one minute walk to the Aria if you want to do the casino thing, and a three minute walk to the Strip itself, where you're right in the middle of it. All in all, I can't recommend this place enough. Service was great, the location is fab and when we come back to Vegas again, this will be number one in our thoughts to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: CultUSA
Reviews.Content: The Vdara Hotel & Spa in Las Vegas is one hotel I will love to stay in few more times. The room off the chain, meaning (fantastic) The views are awesome too! Don't hesitate to stay there when ever in vegas. its perfect for non-smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug619
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the hotel! I loved that there's no casino to walk through to get to your room. It's still so close to the action if you want some. The rooms were beautiful like being at home. Definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: PlusModelChic
Reviews.Content: Since this was one of the newer hotels in Vegas I was anxious to check it out. But I should have stayed somewhere else. I have stayed in many hotels in Vegas, and this is the worst experience by far. Upon arrival we had to wait almost 20min to check in. It was 9pm on a Friday night and they only had one person working at the front desk. I prepaid for my room before my arrival and upon check-in she informed me that I had to pay an additional $18.00 plus tax per night for some BS resort fee. I am not usually a person who complains and I am usually easy to please, BUT there are so many more things that made my experience an unpleasant one. 1. The room was very small and cluttered with too much furniture (Not what was posted on the site in square footage) 2. The water pressure sucks. 3. Every time I wanted my car from valet I would call in advance to request it and no one would answer the phone, I had to call multiple times in a row. 4. The same goes for customer service at the front desk (no one would answer the phone), poor customer service skills and not accommodating to your concerns. 5. They have a full kitchen minus the oven but it seems to me they do not want you to use it since there is no cookware, utensils, glasses, or plates. Just 2 coffee cups. 6. Back to the BS resort fee, it is suppose to cover the daily paper, bottled water ,and coffee but no one brought those items to my room each day I was there (3 nights). 7. They day I noticed that there was a big scratch on my BMW and it was not there when I got there, so I had informed the valet and he told us we would have to speak with security and file a report. It took over 35 min for the security guard to show up!! Needless to say I WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Non-Casino Hotel is a Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: Krichdog
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a sleek, modern hotel that is unlike almost everything else in Vegas. It isn't themed, it isn't kitsch, it isn't faux-this or that, it doesn't have a magic show. The biggest difference from the rest of Vegas is also it's greatest benefit: it doesn't have a casino. This means the entire hotel can be non-smoking, not to mention non-chiming and non-disorienting. But if you want a casino, the Bellagio is right next door (less than a minute walk) via covered walkway. And the Aria is in the same City Center complex as Vdara. The City Center location is another part of what makes Vdara great. City Center is a large new development located in the middle of the strip. It has hotels, a casino, restaurants, and a large mall. And if you want to sample the rest of what Vegas has to offer, you're in the middle of the strip to it's easy go elsewhere from Vdara. The hotel itself is very quiet, due to the lack of a casino and the plush carpeting that covers every surface. The rooms are spacious and have a very modern dark-toned interior. Everything is new and nice. The pool is small by Vegas standards, but it was easy enough to score a chair and hang out on a weekend morning. After many trips to Vegas staying in casino-hotels, I found Vdara to be a welcome breath of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “A nice haven away from the bustle, but still in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: kac310
Reviews.Content: The bed/bedding was soooo comfortable. It was really nice to stay at a place that didn't have a casino so when you came 'home', it was a little quieter and was a nice break from all of the craziness in Vegas. At the same time, it's connected to the Bellagio and right next to Cosmopolitan and Aria/Crystals. There is no taxi service like at other hotels...but I'm sure it wouldn't take long to get one there. Great hotel--the rooms were just awesome!
