Reviews.Title: “I thought I saw everything beautiful in Vegas until I saw City Center & Vdara”
Reviews.Author: ANNKC1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara during a week long seminar. The Vdara was so nice to come back to every night after all the noise and crowds in the casinos. The Vdara is beautifully elegant and understated. Beautiful bathroom, elegant bedding. Only thing, with a kitchen I wish there was at least a coffee pot. The kitchen is for looks I think.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great staff, great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: fqwntflyr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Vdara for 4 nights in early February and got a great deal (about $60/night). We got there around noon and had no trouble checking in early. There were 3 employees working at reception and about a line-up of 4 people in front of us... so really, not a long wait to check in at all. We requested a view of the fountains and were easily accommodated with a view on the 29th floor. The room was great. Everything still looked and smelled like new and was very clean. We requested dishes when we got there and they were brought up within 10 minutes. The only annoying thing was that when they cleaned the room they took the dishes away the first time (even though they were clean). We learned that if you wanted to keep them you had to put them away in a cupboard. Dirty dishes were taken away if placed in the sink or left on the counter (which makes sense cause there's nothing to clean them with anyway) but you had to phone housekeeping again to get replacements. Out of the 3 times we phoned to get dishes the longest we waited was maybe 15 minutes... and one time we phoned at 1am when you know there's not a lot of housekeeping staff on duty! The fridge in the room was a little bit small (half was taken up by the mini bar) but it fit enough stuff for us to make simple breakfasts and lunches for 4 days. The hotel is a bit off the strip but there's a FREE tram that takes you to Aria, CityCentre, and Monte Carlo. Walking to the Bellagio was maybe a 5 minute walk with only a short bit of it outdoors on a covered walkway (it was the same walk to get to the tram albeit a little longer to get to the Bellagio than the tram). The pool was pretty much dead while we were there but there were still staff and it was a nice area. Being still quite cool out we welcomed the direct sunlight however I could see how it might get rather intense in the summer months. We went to the fitness centre almost every morning and the staff there were very professional and attentive. There were plenty of different cardio machines and weights. It never seemed like anyone was ever waiting to use a machine someone else was on. Water bottles were provided along with clean towels free of charge. There was a juice bar located just outside the fitness centre and I believe they also had an espresso machine there if you wanted to get a coffee in the morning. Unfortunately we never bought anything there so I'm unsure what the prices were like. Probably the best part of this hotel was the no smoking. It almost became shocking to go into other hotels with casinos filled with smoke. Yes, they do pump scented air into the lobby but I really only smelled it when first walking into the hotel. I would say it was noticeable but not overly offensive. There is currently one restaurant and one bar in the lobby of the hotel (neither of which we went to during our stay). They are also building a cafe in the lobby which looks like it should be open soon. All in all we had a great stay. Out of the 3 previous hotels I've stayed in on the strip over the years this is one that I would definitely stay at again if I were to do a repeat of one hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Ruchei
Reviews.Content: It was just great. These are the things I loved: 1. No casino on premises, which means a more quiet setting 2. Modern design of the room - loved the super sleek bathtub, the automated window screens, the bed. The walk to the strip was a bit of a walk through other hotels, but otherwise, the place was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “We Plan to Return”
Reviews.Author: renostyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara over Christmas 2010. We had a Vdara Suite (one bedroom/one bath/full kitchen/living room/washer/dryer). My parents had a deluxe suite (studio room/small kitchen/small living room area/awesome view of the fountains). Everything about the Vdara was great. The lobby was clean. No smoking on the property. The rooms were outstanding. Maid service was good, but they tended to finish cleaning the rooms around 4 or 5pm. You can access Bellagio through the lobby with a quick walk outside. Aria is just across the front driveway...about 4 minute walk. All parking for Vdara is (free) vallet. No self park. There's an $18/day resort fee that includes wifi, news paper, bottled water, and gym. It was too cold to swim, but the pool looked nice. We didn't eat in the cafe. Nor did we drink at the bar. The Monte Carlo has a fastfood court if you're looking for a quick/cheap meal (access MC by walking through the Aria). We look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJN
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel which is right in the middle of the strip but set back far enough to be quiet. Unlike other reviews that suggest you have to go through Bellagio to get to the strip there is direct access from the front of the hotel. The rooms are beautifully clean and the bed very comfortable. The only weird thing was the kitchenette had no kettle or cutlery etc. You could request it but never did. Like I say. . . odd. We upgraded to a suite with a view over Bellagio fountains and this was well worth the $25 per night. The bar is a rip off though. It was $50 for 2 glassess of wine and 2 beers. The barman also asked for a tip, which just hacked me off as we were going to leave one anyway - he didn't need to ask! We didn;t drink there again so their loss! All in all this is a beautiful hotel that hasn't suffered the decay of some of the themed hotels along the strip. It isn't quite standing in its own air space like the photo suggests but it's not unpleasant. Would highly recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service there is outrageously bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennlee510
Reviews.Content: The customer service there is outrageously bad!! They make their own rules as they see fit to their needs. My personal items were stored in concealed compartments by the maid, when I realized my things were missing the staff would not return my personal items to me and brushed off my concerns. I stayed at Vadara for two night switching rooms in between one of the nights. My original room was an unlucky number so on the second night I requested to switch rooms. On my way checking out, I realized that the maid had placed an item of mine in a concealed drawer in my first room. I requested that the staff go in and retrieve my personal item. However, their staff told me the room is occupied. They would however leave a message to the room to have someone in there check it. (They might as well tell me to scream to rock) My BIGGEST problem was that they refused to admit to any wrong doing when I tried to reason with them and suggested that my requested to have my personal items returned to me as outrageous. (even though they were the ones who took my things and basically hid it from me) After an hour of pleading with them to retrieve my things the maid’s supervisor accused me of arguing with them and threatened to call security. At that time I was MAD, I went downstairs to the lobby they gave me the same speech but did apologize. When I returned home 5 hours later, I call the front looking for an update. They told me they did not know what was going on and told me to explain the situation to them again and they would leave a message to the room. Outrageous!! They told to expect a phone call two days later. Outrageous!! Grievance: 1) My/Guest items should not be tucked away- I FEEL ROBED 2) They make their own rules as they feel fit: staff can go into rooms when they see fit 3) When I checked out the first time the room should have been thoroughly checked and my personal items should have been placed in lost and found! 4) After paying to stay there my concerns are no longer important to them. Loss 1) My things 2) My time 3) Increase stress

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: MHABCanada
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Vdara was awesome! The room was as pictured on the website which was a nice surprise. The nightshade lifted with a touch of a button, very cool! No coffee maker or robes which would have been a 5 * touch. We found it very quiet and modern, would stay there again for sure. The resort fee was a bit shocking $18 + tax, so expect it. Sounds like all the hotels have it now in Vegas. Over-all, loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Rude Spa Managers”
Reviews.Author: Nick4734
Reviews.Content: The front desk was great. The hotel room was awesome. The food was magnificent. I'm not sure the same manager still works there but she was awfully rude to my husband and I who were celebrating our 20th anniversary. We booked a couples massage and she told me that I did not. She argued with me on the telephone like a rude customer service agent from a retail store. I spoke with another manager who instead of charging us a 300.00 cancellation fee she charged us a 150.00 cancellation fee. I felt very disrespected and insulted. I was grieving from a loss in my family at the time. I was having a great time until that day at the spa. I did not think I would get this type of service from such a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new Hotel if you are looking for a quiet nights sleep ...”
Reviews.Author: Swissfrank
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January for 2 nights after moving from Palazzo. We preferred Vdara in lots of ways. Its not got a casino but it has a decent restaurant for breakfast and clean, modern rooms with kitchenette. The Aria is only a few step away if you want a casino and Bellagio is almost attached too from the other side. This is the Hotel if you want to get away from the noise but still be within crawling distance of the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER!!!”
Reviews.Author: ciekawa
Reviews.Content: * Perfect hotel for little rest after noisy strip * nice swimming pool area (nice & warm) * hot , big jacuzzi * super comfortable king size bed * super fast check in, out * very helpful consierge

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: UpUpAway_11
Reviews.Content: Way way over priced...We were to get a deal HAHAHAH. After all the "extra" fees". It was well $180++++ per night. There were three couples (family) for a week. NEVER again. Save your money and stay in the remodeled Golden Nuggett or MGM Sig. for strip staying. Way over $$. It had a kitchenette no toaster/coffee maker CUPS . We had to request a tea pot. But NO CUPS nothing what a joke. They do not provide what the add special was. Wasted $900. for four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Superb customer service from Alyin at the front desk!”
Reviews.Author: jetset431
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by the valet and bellmen. We procceded to check-in. We only waited 3 minutes before being served; the line was moving rather smoothly and quickly. Alyin, the front desk agent, was the superstar in customer service. We arrived early at the hotel and the room is not available to check in yet; however, she offered us a room at a higher floor with the view of the beautiful view of the Bellagio fountain. The room would be ready in 90 minutes. She gave us suggestions to nearby restaurants and attraction while we wait for the room to be ready. The room was large and clean. The dark out curtain was awsome to sleep in the morning. I loved the soaking tub. It was rather deep and roomy. My huni and I took a spa evening before we went out one night. It had enough room for two of us. Nothing feels better than a warm bubble bath after a hard day of hitting two outlet malls in a day. The housekeeping staff was courteous and friendly. We had to ring the housekeeping few times for slippers, bathrobes, new iron, and wine glasses. They were at my door with in 5 minutes after I hung up the phone. The speedy housekeeping service was impressive. The only drawback of this hotel is the mandatory $18 resort charges. I wish they can make it optional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but some deal breakers for me.”
Reviews.Author: Luehr2
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that we travel to Vegas frequently, and have stayed at many hotels there. By far the Vdara was nicer than most, however there were a few issues that are a deal breaker for me. Firstly location, the Vdara is set back from the strip, and you have to walk via the Bellagio to get to it. (at least we found that the shortest route). Also with no casino there is not late night gambling and the stumbling back up to bed. It a 10 minute walk from the Bellagio casino. The hotel itself is beautiful. The lobby has a very inviting aroma, much different from all of the smoke filled hotels on the strip. The room was large, but poorly designed. There were no kitchen utensils or coffee maker, but I wasn't expecting them anyway. The front desk staff was very courtious, and very willing to work with me about the incedental charges. They charge $130 per night upfront, to be refunded later. I simply requested less and so they deactivated our minibar, and when we ordered room service we had to pay with cash or credit, no big deal. They were very willing to accomodate. Upon check in I also requested robes and slippers to be brought up, they arrived about 10 mins after us. Our room was clean, and very nicely furnished. The bed was very comfortable, and luxurios. My biggest issue was with the shower. The shower had very little water pressure, and the adjustable shower head was garbage. After the first shower, I started washing my hair under the tub faucet just so I could get all of the shampoo out. It was pittiful. I wouldn't stay here again simply for that reason alone. Vegas is a dirty place to begin with, I want to feel clean after a nice hot shower. Other than the location and the bad shower, the hotel was great, staff were all courtious, the concierge was very helpful, and the housekeeping staff did a great job each day freshening up our room. Also the room service was great, I would reccomend the quaesidillas! The Silk Road restaurant did an excellednt breakfast, but they are only open 7-2 and there aren't any other places in the hotel to eat. One more quick note: while we didn't use the pool, we did check it out, it was dull and uninviting, small in comparison to some of the other hotels on the strip we have stayed in. Definatly not luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough stars....Off the chart great!”
Reviews.Author: Mroberts1954
Reviews.Content: There aren't enough words to descibe how far and above Vdara is from the other Vegas 4 star hotels. First, the aroma you have read about is a tranquilizing scent that relaxes you the second you walk in. Rooms and views are just amazing....breathtaking! And, the rooms are huge! The location is a huge benefit....away from the maddening crowd....but once you walk through the Bellagio...you are in the middle of it all again. Also, we loved walking over to the Aria to Jean Philippe for breakfast and had 2 meals at Cafe Vettro for reasonable prices and delicious food. I got a great deal through Expedia vacation packages. I didn't want to leave! Oh...and the bedding...I am ordering the pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Definately An Oasis In The Desert”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2Travel718
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara with my bf from Jan 02-11th. We Chose the Vdara because it is a non-smoking hotel and the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. The Vdara doesnt have a casino on the property so the lobby is very quiet and peaceful, and not congested or overcrowded with people walking aimlessly everywhere. There is a 2 min walkway from the Vdara to the Bellagio Hotel, where Vegas becomes Vegas(the hustle and the bustle). We reserved the Vdara Suite and it was BEAUTIFUL. They definately do pay attention to details at the Vdara. The rooms are clean, spacious and nicely decorated. I especially liked that the main bathroom have dual sinks and a separate shower from the tub. Our suite also had a "guest bathroom" . There is also a washer/dryer in the suite which came in handy once. There are alot of complaints of the lack of utensils/plates in the kitchen but it didnt bother us. We mainly just used the fridge for drinks. Our suite did not face the Vegas strip but the alternative view is of mountains and you could see planes taking off and landing and it was just as nice. My only complaint about the room is the windows do not open at all. All of the staff we came in contact with were very nice and professional. Front Desk staff, bell staff, door staff, housekeeping, and food service staff were all so pleasant. The hotel is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Zen-like Relaxing Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ann_and_aron
Reviews.Content: We're not gamblers or smokers - I don't think you'd want to stay in this hotel if you were. Usually staying in Vegas, I quickly get annoyed with all the swarms of people and smoke all over the place. This time, we stayed in the room, had some excellent room service (try the Kobe Sliders), relaxed, went to the spa, went to Town Square - again, away from the crowds, did a little bit of gambling at a sports book to act like we were in Vegas, and ate lots of food - very Vegas! The hotel was very clean, the rooms nice, the Aveda products FANTASTIC! The Spa was wonderful and relaxing. My main thing is that there was only one restaurant open in Vdara- another is opening soon. Also, the pillow cases in the room, although soft, are quite open at one end, so you feel kinda gross when your head touches that pillow accidentally. I tried to be careful. I'd really give it 4 1/2 stars since those are teensy things. Our service was awesome at this hotel also. My husband had to stay at Bellagio afterwards - a sister hotel connected, and it's older, stinky, packed, and we had to wait in line forever to check in. I quick peeked in his room there and it looked like a typical hotel room- where the Vdara one seems cleaner and more zen-like - he preferred Vdara after also staying at Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Not living up to it's potential”
Reviews.Author: Engineer911
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a week on business in mid January. I had just been there a month earlier and stayed at Trump, which while not perfect, was a far better experience. First of all, I had booked a King Deluxe room. Obviously it's not their high-end room type, but I lived in Vegas for years and I know how this works. On check-in, (mind you it was on a Monday, not a holiday or convention week), I politely asked for an upgrade along with tipping the front desk kid a $20. I was "upgraded" to a room of the exact same type but with a semi-obstructed view of the Bellagio show. They call this a "lakeview" room. Call me picky but partially obstructed view on a mid-level floor is not an upgrade. Then about the room. Sure it's new, and it's all dark woods and modern decor. Pretty to look at but not easy to live in. The automatic blinds and "blackout" shades do not adequately block sunlight during the day because of spaces between the multiple windows/shades. Another problem- power outlets. I plug my cell phone into the lamp or at least outlet next to the bed at hotels. Here, there were no outlets in the nightstand lamps and no easily accessible outlets within arms reach of the bed. The lights on either side of the bed don't have light switches in them, you can only operate them with the light switch located next to the front door, so you're in total darkness through the kitchen then living area when going to bed at night. If you don't get the picture from how I worded this, you'll get it when you stay here. Imagine laying down and as you're about to sleep realizing you have to walk to the kitchen to turn off your bedroom light. As for the bathroom, it's small. If you have more than one person trying to get ready at once you will be fighting over mirror and sink space. They aren't double sinks either. Plus the toilet is not separated at all from the main bathroom area which I don't like at all. The living area has a pullout queen bed which I didn't use but a friend did one night and it is horribly uncomfortable. The stories of having a kitchen but no utensils or plates etc are true. I didn't bother trying to ask for any. The location was central and next to Aria. Yay. But because of how ridiculous things were built I wound up having to take a cab to Cosmopolitan which is literally 500 feet away across the street. My room, stay, and overall experience at Trump were all far better than here. At Trump I got upgraded to a strip view on the 46th floor and never even had to tip. Vdara can keep it's "obstructed upgrades"...

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a king.”
Reviews.Author: rekard
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a solo trip on the first week of December on a Vdara suite. I got a freeway view on the 45th floor which was amazing. Everything here was certainly wonderful and spectacular. Everything I requested was swiftly and courteously met. I already knew about restaurants and resort fee from other information on here so I didn't mind that. The room was so spacious that it felt free. My bed was so comfortable that I overslept the next day! I had to go straight to lunch and skip breakfast haha. Bellboys were so attentive to what I needed. Every day the room cleaning was spot on and timely. Robes replenished along with all the promised amenities. They even took care of putting my own cleaning stuff (toothpaste, shaving cream, razor)in an orderly manner. Sometimes it got so late that I had to order room service at almost 2 AM and they did it promptly. Waitresses came to my room with a smile, chatted and delivered the food with no complaints. Concierges were the best too! They got great discounts for me and gave me all the information I requested. Afterwards I gave them a great tip for such attention to all my questions. Also they had a bit of patience to my accent and lack of practice on speaking English. I got to get breakfast one morning, and while small, the mini kobe beef burgers were soemthing to behold and remember. Calm hotel with a 1 minute access to the Bellagio (And 5 mins to Aria) so the lack of the casino meant nothing. Everything I desired was at hand. I only have praise for this hotel. It was really that good.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are not wrong”
Reviews.Author: bs081288
Reviews.Content: Booked the Vdara through SWA Vacations and chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. Was thrilled with this hotel and would definitely go back. It is truly a breath of fresh air not to have to trudge through a million miles of casino and smoking just to get to the elevators. Rooms were fabulous and very quiet. Went with a group of friends, three who had never been to Vegas and I was concerned they might miss out on the "ambience" of a casino hotel. Not a complaint from the group. As others have mentioned, Bellagio is right next doot (covered walkway), Aria is across the parking lot and Cosmopolitan is about a 5 minute walk. I found the staff, overall, friendly and accomodating. We had one waiter at breakfast one morning who seemed to be a little grumpy but he was not going to spoil our great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel - Great Location & No Casino”
Reviews.Author: BeckyPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 4 nights from 1/9/10-1/13/10. The property is nice and located in what seems to be the heart of the Vegas City Centre. There is no casino at this property, but it is well within walking distance to The Aria Hotel that has a full blown casino, which is located right next door. It is a non-smoking property and there is no smell of smoke anywhere inside, so that's nice. The elevators are fast. I stayed on the 33rd floor. The rooms are super nice, beds are really comfortable with nice linens. The window curtain and black out shade are electronically controlled, which was pretty cool. Nice view of the Vegas city lights at night. There is no option to NOT have a credit card authorized for incidentals, so prepare for them to authorize at least $100 a night on your card, whether you plan to have incidentals or not. They authorized my card $400 for the 4 nights and then only refunded $399.70. It seems really petty to care about a missing $0.30 cents, but what bothered me was that the front desk agent couldn't explain where it went. Strange. Meeting rooms were suitable. Meeting room food was great. Chairs were uncomfortable to sit in for 8 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect rooms in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_UK_09
Reviews.Content: Before booking this I checked the reviews on Trip Advisor, so already knew about the kitchen with the lack of utensils, resort fee and limited food at the hotel restaurant. I wasn't bothered about those things as I only needed a nice room to stay in, most of my other time would be exploring the strip. I stayed in the Deluxe Suite with a partial view to the Bellagio fountains. It was such a lovely room, better than the pictures shown on the Vdara website. I loved how there were 2 TVs (so you didn't have to fight over the remote control), and that there were 'do not disturb' and 'housekeeping' buttons by the door, the bathroom was spacious and everything was clean. I liked the blackout/shade blinds and heard nothing from other guests or the traffic during my stay. Also the bed was really comfortable, I normally have back aches if the mattress is mediocre so was quite impressed. I didn't mind that it had no casino, as I wanted somewhere away from the hustle and bustle but still close enough to the strip to go where I liked. The walkway to the Bellagio was close enough, even Aria hotel was just across the road. I didn't mind the air freshener smell throughout the hotel, maybe I only walked through after most of it had evaporated as it didn't seem too strong smelling to me. It gave it a nice refreshing smell when returning to the hotel each time. It seemed quite simple and understated yet elegant compared to other hotels. If I were to come back to Las Vegas I'd have no qualms about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view and architecture but services need improvements, $15 resort fee”
Reviews.Author: fengaw
Reviews.Content: We booked two city corner suites on Dec. 26 2010. These are one bed room suites with 270 degrees of views. This is basically a high rise condo without casino. Followings are my summary: Good: 1. Stunning views: even we didn’t get the Bellagio lake view or the strip view as promised on their website, the 270 degree “freeway view” was still great. 2. Fancy electronics: powered shades, window screens, and electronic “Do Not Disturb” or “Ready for Housekeeping” sign. 3. Full kitchen, dinning area and over sized bath room. Bad: 1. There is no road sign on the strip to show you where to turn to Vdara. You have to turn into Harmon street to see a small sign with characters about 2” high that points to the Vdara ramp. It is not self-lighting and the illumination is bad. I spent about 30 minutes to get to Vdara from the strip. 2. Valet parking only. Which means you have to tip often, or won’t have the convenience to retrieve something in your car anytime you want. 3. There is only one restaurant (Silk road), offers breakfast and lunch only. 4. Services not delivered: I asked for an extra set of blankets for the sofa bed, called twice but it was never delivered. Next morning I asked for the coffee cartridges which were supposed to be in the refrigerator, was told they ran out. But the other suite got them replenished every day. Next day they still didn’t deliver the blanket. Fortunately I bumped into the house keeping lady who gave me the blanket. The front desk clerk never smiled when rejecting my requests, citing “we’re too busy, there is a 97% occupancy rate”. If there is a 3-star hotel, it’s an exceptional one. But it’s a 5-star hotel, if the staff was actually overloaded with 97% occupancy, then by design they are not ready to deliver the service to every guest. There is so much to improve on the hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “A must!”
Reviews.Author: Marek89
Reviews.Content: Truly great hotel, got a great special on a room so was totally worth it. Not being a gambling hotel is no problem as you don't even have to go outside to get the Bellagio. Only drawback was the sleeper couch. Really bad mattress, you could feel all the springs in your back but otherwise a great stay! Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Home from home in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ORiain
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Ireland on a 5 night stay. We were given an upgrade upon check-in and had great views over the Bellagio fountains, along the strip to downtown Las Vegas, and onto the desert hills splashed across the horizon. The suite was modern, very spacious and absolutely spotless. Our friends (another couple) were also upgraded and upon request, were given a suite alongside us. The hotel does not have a casino. This made no difference to us as we are not big gamblers and there is a direct walkway to the Bellagio and a monorail link to other hotels further down the strip. The Aria casino is also just across a bridge from the reception area. The Vdara bar and restaurant is small by Las Vegas standards but will certainly do the job for 'pre-big night out' cocktails. Overall, this was the perfect hotel for us. Near to the madness, but still a relaxing get-away if batteries needed charging.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara- Oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: jaimebrochu
Reviews.Content: Vdara was truly an incredible experience in Vegas. We normally stay at The Bellagio when in Vegas, so I was a little nervous to make the switch to this non-gaming, new hotel. WOW! It was incredible. As soon as you walk through the doors you realize what an oasis it is. The non existent smoke smell was a literal breath of fresh air and the warmth from the lobby, without lines and a bazillion people walking around was a treat. The hotel is also situated on a perfect location on the strip; accessible to all areas and easy to get a cab to downtown. The rooms were impeccable. My only complaints for the whole trip was the housekeeping service wasn't prompt and we had to ask, plead, and beg to get someone to bring us linens for the sleeper sofa. It took 2 trips to the front desk and repeated calls, at 1am to get someone to help. We ended up making the bed ourselves once we finally got the linens. We informed the front desk the next morning and then issued us a credit on the "resort fees." Overall, it was an incredible stay and we will DEFINITELY be staying at the Vdara over the Bellagio every trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: stuartputnam
Reviews.Content: Vegas has not been one of my favorite destinations for quite some time and if it wasn't for a business convention I would avoid it. Vdara has changed my opinion. From the moment I entered the lobby I knew it would be different. No clang and noise from a casino. No cigarette smoke. As a matter of fact it smelled more like a spa than a hotel. It is just far enough off the Strip to lose the feel of cheesy Vegas. Yet, it is close enough to access everything you would want. With Aria on one side and Bellagio on the other there are excellent dining options. A great hotel regardless of the location!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Quiet, Luxurious, and close to everything...”
Reviews.Author: Albuchris
Reviews.Content: We do alot of research before we make hotel reservations as we are quite picky about where our heads touch pillows. Vdara was one of the best hotels we've stayed at due to its sheer cleanliness. The best thing about this hotel was that it didn't have a casino downstairs. So, the hotel smelled fresh and clean and there were no roudy people to contend with. However, just a short walk down a covered passageway led to Bellagio and Caeser's Palace, shops, restaurants, and the Vegas strip about two blocks from the hotel. Also, the CityCenter Tram was nearby so you could take the free aerial tram to the Aria and Monte Carlo Casinos. We asked for a room with a view and were not disappointed...We got the 28th floor looking north across the strip. The room had motor controlled large sheer curtains and shades operated by a wall switch. So, you could let all of Vegas into your room or shut it out completely! This room was the Deluxe Suite. I spent alot of time enjoying the hustle and bustle from our room and a view of the Bellagio Fountains across from the Paris Casino. Everyone was so friendly and the service was great. We really enjoyed this new hotel and would like to return.

Reviews.Title: “I hate writing negatives but........”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying "I hate writing negative comments". When I first booked, I could see there were some mixed reviews. That's fine. Since then, I've noticed it has gone downhill and unfortunately, I've experienced it. *Check-in: 20 minutes with 1 person and 6 waiting at 6pm. Not good enough. *Had organised one extra night prior to checking in under the same name - was told it would be linked to the original booking - was it? No. Had to explain the whole situation. I had already paid for the all 3 nights and he wanted to charge me again. More explanation and it was resolved (so I thought). * There is a lack of staff - everything takes so long - tried getting some service at 10pm and gave up after being on hold for 15 minutes. * Got home and then found out they had charge me for the first 2 nights that I had already paid for - inexcusable, considering the front desk had assured me that after the initial confusion, this would not happen. I sent an email and have never heard back from them....luckily my friend had booked us originally and he was able to have some terse words with someone and our credit card transaction was reversed a few days later. Positives: * The valet parking was speedy - thumbs up to this. * The rooms are ok - there are better rooms and I would rate The Venetian and Trump rooms better. Would I stay at the Vdara again? No. I did wish I was at Aria and Cosmopolitan when we were there. Hope someone at Vdara is reading these comments and will try and improve the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worse service at a hotel you can find!”
Reviews.Author: abbynieves627
Reviews.Content: Our experience was devastating. We were overcharge by $1600! Were promised a view of Bellagio water fountain that was not met, they were rude when we complaint. My boyfriend called the spa for weeks trying 2 schedule a couples massage and haircut and when he finally got a hold of someone they were booked. My boyfriend also ordered chocolate cover strawberries to be sent to the room that wasn't. When we tried to change rooms they said there were no rooms available and minutes later were told insultingly but it's 20 extra a night as if we were to poor to afford such. When my boyfriend asked if rose petals would be set up in our new room after fighting for an hour was told to crawl on his knees and pick them up himself. The bellman acted like rose petals were for him and was going to chill in the room! You can see into your neighbors restroom. The shower was cold and bath water temperature jumped. The blinds do not cover the sides of the windows. You wait forever to speak with a manager. I haven't even been here for 24 hrs and already have these issues. It's sad because the rooms are nice looking but concierge and service is tragically horrendous!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: y2kpingu
Reviews.Content: our flight got delayed and got to the hotel near 1:30 am so of course expect a little delay at front desk. We had two room and we were lazy enough not to check if both room keys were working. We had the bellboy bring the luggage up so we told him to drop them all off in one room first and hanged out there for a while. 15 mins later I decided to start moving back into the other room to find out the keys were not working. We walked all the way to the first desk to solve the problem. Long story short, I ended up walking 3 times from the room to the front desk (at 2am ish all tired from flying) and had to wait over an hour for the problem to be fixed. (lucky that it was not far walking compared to other hotels and these were the only side by side rooms left) Finally got into the room near 3am to find out the sofa bed was not made and we needed house keeping to give us extra beddings. And turns out that the heat was not working properly( first 2 nights too cold, 3rd night too hot). Another problem was that the washroom handle fell out; turns out the glue did not stick anymore. They attempted to fix it after we gave it a call but it barely stayed in. Their staff is friendly and helpful but the maintenance is very poor. They gave us resort credit for both rooms in the end and didn't charge one room for resort fee. But a hotel only a year old with this many problems, i don't think i'll ever go back. Their location is a bit off the strip; its behind the Cosmopolitan in the City Centre. But they have their own monorail to Aria and Monte Cristo and a bridge that links to Bellagio. Conclusion, not a very good location either.

Reviews.Title: “Soulless place”
Reviews.Author: gaspargonzalez
Reviews.Content: I checked in shortly after midnight, initially impressed by the huge building. The reception area was huge too, but to my surprise there was not a single person at the desk. After some minutes a clerk appeared. Not a word of welcome, just doing the formal procedure and handing over the key card to my room on the 53rd floor. A weird way of arriving in what is supposed to be one of the key alternative resorts in Vegas. Sleep and bathroom were pretty fine, although furniture is nothing special, rather dusty. Strange thing is that you enter your room in the kitchen area, that is complete void. Other reviewers have stated already the curious fact that youhave to call for kitchen utensils if you need those. Well, I didn't need them, but kept on asking myself what the idea was behind the entrance kitchen if apparentlty hardly of the guests makes use of it. Alternative? If youyr jetlegged, as I was, and wake up at 5 am, it is a pity not having a coffee machine in that prominent kitchen. Going down for a cup of coffee is useless as well, the coffee shop close to the restaurant only opens at 7. Then you start fdeeling the negative side of the off-strip location the hotel has. It is obsolete, a soulless place. Wouldn't mind that too much in any capitol of the world if you are there for business, but hey, this is Vegas. If you're in Vegas, then do it the Vegas way, not the Vdara way.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegas-Brazil
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Vdara on three different ocasions betwenn Oct/2010 and January/2011. The hotel is fantastic: rooms are clean and service is ok. I have two major complains: 1. Internet connection: Vdara public IP is blacklisted, so when you send an e-mail, sometimes it bounces back. This situation still persists. 2. Business Center: I've bought some products from Amazon and UPS shows them as delivered, BUT I had problem with two of them: the first one Vdara received the day after UPS showed as delivered (something impossible to happen), and the other was never delivered to me: UPS showed as delivered, but Vdara business center informed me they never received it!

Reviews.Title: “WOW- Non gaming hotels are really worth a look at!”
Reviews.Author: misskeys78
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic! We are travelling across the USA from Aussie, this is the first time we have been to Vegas. We stayed at the Vdara (a non-gaming hotel) for 3 days in the delux suite. I booked online with a good winter special, so we got excellent value for money. The lobby is fantastic and the front desk staff are efficient. We were offered an upgrade for $50 extra per night, we declined but it would have been worth it. The decor in the hotel is very tasteful, new and modern. The Delux suite is very nice indeed! The huge windows in our room showed us the back of the Bellagio and we could see the water show from the hallway. It was self contained with a living room as well. There was nothing we could fault with this hotel, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. The recent opening of the Cosmopolitan nearby might keep Vdara on their toes too.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, loved this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jossieliverpool
Reviews.Content: Ive just stayed at this hotel from 1st jan to 5th jan 2011 and it was amazing!!!! Rooms were massive and sooo clean and they provide you with your own little kitchen area, plus a walk in shower and huge bath. The staff and cleaners were great, so happy to help..... I dont normally sleep in a strange place right through but every night i slept like a baby! Its a little bit of a walk to the strip as the hotel is up a little hill, but there are lifts and escalators, so u dont have to walk it if you dont want to. Plus they do the best hot chocolate at the bar in reception ever!! My sister and her husband came too and they said they felt really spoilt while they were there. The hotel is new and is very modern and i would reccomend this hotel to everyone..... :)

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven”
Reviews.Author: newcastlebloke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for five nights as part of our honeymoon just before Xmas. We would not hesitate to return or recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a peaceful retreat from all the madness of the strip. I've seen complaints about it being too far from the strip itself, duh! That's not a bad thing, you've either got a five min walk from the foyer to the shuttle or a little further and you're right inside The Bellagio. We found the service perfect, at no time did we need to ring down for anything. Room service was quick and efficient. The rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. I can't say I've experienced many hotels on the strip but I'd describe The Vdara as an affordable higher end hotel with a touch of class. The restaurant serves good quality food. We used the pool in December and we found it plenty spacious, the hot tub came in handy! The only one minor gripe would be the lack of tea/coffee facilities in the rooms or they could have machines dotted about. Oh and complaining about the lack of a gift shop???? Id complain if there was one.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: loopyloo083
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to Las Vegas and decided to try the Vdara. The Vdara is a haven of peace amongst all the hustle and bustle. Although the Vdara is a non-gaming hotel it is only a short walk through the walkway which is linked to Belaggio. Our room was located on the 52nd floor and we had a lovely view of the strip which at nighfall was amazing. The rooms are excellent and as the hotel opened in late 2009 everything is very new and clean and remained so during our entire stay. We were amazed at how quiet the hotel is. Once you close the door to your room you don't hear anything. The rooms are very big and roomy with comfortable settee and a separate kitchenette area. The only drawback we found that the hotel do not provide coffee makers. If you choose to use the kitchen you have to call housekeeping to deliver the kitchen utensils such as silverware and crockery. We were a little disappointed with the pool area it is a bit on the smallish size compared to the size of the hotel and other hotels which we have stayed in on the strip. We didn't visit the spa because the saunas were out of action during our stay. The bar area is excellent, nice atmosphere, good service and serves excellent choice of cocktails. If you want some peace amongst the bright lights then I would strongly recommend the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star but a good 4 star”
Reviews.Author: doglover_2010
Reviews.Content: My husband decided that for this trip to Vegas he wanted to try one of the new hotels in City Center and after some research chose the Vdara. The Vdera was listed as a 5 star and this was our mini honeymoon so we were looking for a hotel that we could feel a little spoiled at. This hotel had no casino which is great due to my asthma. The prices on line were listed at $189 for Saturday night and $109 the following nights and were so good compared to that of hotels further north on the strip that we thought we would give it a try. At check in the front desk staff was helpful and friendly. Once in our room I was very confused by the kitchenette concept but yet there was not one dish, pot, or piece of cutlery in the room. There was no coffee maker in the room and yet there was a bathroom scale in the washroom. Who weighs themselves on vacation? There was no extras in this room at all. On the web it stated that there were robes, slippers, etc and non of that was in our room. The next morning we started to get ready and while having a shower the base of the shower began to fill with water and wasn't draining properly. I called the front desk and they had a maintenance man come to the room in minutes. He pulled a massive mound of black hair out of the drain. I felt like the first 24 hours we were noticing all of the things we didn't have and were promised on the web. At this time I looked up the advertisement on my iphone and we went down to the front desk. I told the lady that there were things missing from our room and that I was not happy with it. I was then told that if you want dishes then you need to ask for them because they didn't know who would need them. When I asked about the robes, I was told that it was only offered with a Vdara suite and we had a deluxe suite. I then pulled out my phone and showed her what was advertised and stated that if we were not upgraded that we would be checking into another hotel. I told her that this is not what we had signed up for and it now being Sunday, the price of the other 5 stars were not significantly different than at the Vdara. At this point I was willing to go elsewhere and pay for what we wanted. She called her manager and we were upgraded. I know that some of this might sound petty, but when you are going away on what is a romantic trip and you think you are paying for one thing and you get something different, it is frustrating. We stayed there for 5 days and I had to call down to the front desk for extra towels, a shower cap, plates, cutlery etc almost on a daily basis. There was one morning when housekeeping actually took our bowls and didn't replace them and then had to call housekeeping again. Another morning I asked for dish liquid so i could was our bowls and housekeeping left the dish liquid and took the bowls. In our suite we had a coffeemaker. There were 2 mornings that I had to go looking for coffee because there was none left in my room and the housekeeping staff told me that they were out. Finally had a coffee maker but no way to make coffee. If you buy one downstairs at the coffee shop be prepared for the $8 coffee bill. The bottom line for me is that there is NO WAY this is a 5 star. There was just too much stupidity and running around and while the location is good, nothing about this hotel seemed convenient or easy. No one asked us on check in if we needed these items, the guest are actually encouraged to call housekeeping every time something is needed. No wonder they were slow getting the items to the room. The positives are that rooms are clean and comfortable, the tram came every 3-5 minutes making it super convenient to get to the Bellagio and Monte Carlo. If you are looking for a good 4 star this is a great hotel. If you are looking for luxury of some kind, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice rooms, OK Service.”
Reviews.Author: MysticManc
Reviews.Content: Just come home from our latest trip to Vegas and our first stay at the Vdara. Check in was excellent for us. Arrived around 7pm and went right to the desk and checked in, no line. We tipped the girl on front desk $20 and asked for complementary upgrade. After tapping away she gave us 47th floor and view of Bellagio fountains. Thought it was well worth it. She was very friendly and seemed genuine in her wish to make our stay a good one. She asked if we wanted plates, cutlery etc, we didn't have to ask her. She said she would just send everything up. We thought the room was clean and a good size. After we had been out for an hour and returned to our room we had most of the things we had asked for including robes and slippers. I left a tip for the housekeeper the day after and a note to ask her to leave the plates etc. She did take the dirty ones and replaced them later with fresh ones. Once or twice during the week we had to ring housekeeping for the odd item which had not been replaced. There were times when they could have been quicker, the wait was sometimes quite long. Also one day we had a problem with the cooker hood fan, which seemed to come on by itself and would not go off. We waited a long time for the maintenance man to arrive and had to make more than one call, the last one to the manager, which seemed to do the trick. When He arrived he said he thought it was the aircraft setting them off??!! Anyway it was fixed. The room set-up was good. One criticism was the closet was not big enough for a couple, especially the hanger space, very poor. The fridge was just about adequate, the shelf space was not very deep. No kettles provided but we used a pan to boil water for tea etc. The bathroom was big, but the shower was a walk in one with no door, which made it a bit cold at times. There was only one sink in our bathroom and it was not very deep. If I was having a shave i had to keep the tap running rather than fill the sink up. Not very good for a city with a water shortage! I enjoyed the location and the quietness of the hotel. No casino or other attraction meant it was easy to get in and out and no smoky atmosphere. The Aria is only just a 1 minute walk away, the Bellagio is a short walk too. The city centre tram is close by. I heard very little noise from other guests from the other rooms or in the corridors and there was never a wait for the elevators. The service is a bit slow, true. The staff I did deal with were always polite and always helpful. The rooms are new, a good size and well appointed. You can get some good deals at this hotel too if you look around. Well worth giving it a try, I would stay at the Vdara again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Shabby”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business with my husband because the hotel I originally wanted to stay at was all booked. This hotel was offering a special, so I thought I would try it out. Finding the hotel can be a little tricky, especially at night. The hotel itself is nice and I didn't encounter the issue about the reflection at the pool everyone keeps talking about. My staff stayed here as well and we all liked it. It is accessible to Bellagio with a short walk, so that's convenient. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: GreatTraveltime
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in a great location while avoiding the smoke and casinos, this is it! If dining gambling and shopping are your thing, you can walk next door to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable New Years Stay”
Reviews.Author: kenhecra
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, check-in was a breeze considering New Years weekend. The Front Desk Agent was very welcoming. The professionalism with the staff throughout my stay was splendid. I’ve stayed at other 5 star hotels on the strip and I’ve waited for up to 15 minutes to check-in. Check-out was even better. I simply asked the representative to check-out, she asked for my email and off I went in less than 1 minute! The hotel is very stylish and the suite was very comfortable. I stayed on the 32nd floor and although the hotel was almost at full capacity, you never heard a sound from the hallway. The only downside of the suite was the low water pressure in the shower and the bathroom did not have a TV, but quite an enjoyable stay. The walk to the strip was fairly quick. A few ways to get there, 1) Walk across to the Aria 2) Go through the Bellagio 3) The sidewalk from Vdara to the Cosmopolitan. All of which take less than 5 minutes. The least congested was the sidewalk. The bed was comfy and the room was clean. The only item I did notice were the wires not being properly hidden under the television. Other than that, the quality was well worth the price and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH AND DO NOT BE AFRAID TO ASK”
Reviews.Author: mb1reviews
Reviews.Content: I hope all find this review helpful who decide to choose to stay at the Vdara, want to have an experience at Haze, enjoy food, shopping alcohol and VEGAS BABY! I warn you, it is a long review, but worth it! This is my 2nd review on this place. I traveled with another friend and stayed at the same location for New Years Eve celebration. On hearing others in the check in queue, I asked for a city view room and did receive it. A note some rooms are owned privately and rented out - on entering the room we noticed it being quite dusty, a few hairs on the bathroom floor and smeared windows. When the bellhop came with our bags we mentioned these things and straight away he placed a call on his walkie-talkie and offered a $50 credit for the room - he was wonderful. Then we asked him for info. on alcohol purchase and he informed us purchasing from CVS - the pharmacy - we said what - that is incorrect=it is a pharmacy! Well, he said, in Vegas it is a CVS pharmacy that sells alcohol - we did not believe him and checked it out and guess what - they sell alcohol - so a great one stop shop for pharmacy shopping, snacks, milk and alcohol. However, we walked to the Miracle Mile Shops a mall across from the Bellagio and the ABC stores sell alcohol too and it is is short walk because, the Vdara has a walkaway that connects to Bellagio. The ABC stores had promotions on the alcohol we bought so a few dollars saved. ABC is touch pricier on other pharmacy products, but still a convenient location to get too and it is inside a mall for those hot and cold days. There are long shaped glasses filled with an alcoholic drink that you can buy at some shops at the mall - try the one with vodka it is blue but, we heard they are all good - another Vegas experience. Back to housekeeping, we had also ordered plate settings and pots to be delivered, since the rooms have a stylish kitchenette, and they had not arrived yet. All was done later, the room supervisor had come with the housekeeper and gone over cleaning the bathroom floor and dusting the room, the window was cleaned on another trip and the plate settings were delivered - Most room service staff leave around 5pm - that was the reason there was a delay in delivery and for room service there was a 50 mins. wait for food. there is an operation tax on room service receipts - this is a service charge for preparing the food, like admin. costs or fees and is not the same as a tip, so it does not go to the person who delivers the food. I know things may sound steep, but we were considering convenience, too cold to walk wanted something light with alcohol - so if you add up all the room service costs and compare to what it could be if you went outside , in the cold, using up time it would be OK to allow yourself convenience of room service. One can also cook something light because there is a kitchenette but, we had not prepared for that- I did save up to come here and still have some savings - so that is another way to do things! The Vdara is located in the Citycenter area right behind the Bellagio so you may not see it (www.citycenter.com). The nice thing though is it is trendy and new, beautifully decorated and non-smoking with no casino on site - Some may say boring but wait, It is quite and has a kitchenette and all hotel amenities and styles PLUS - YOU CAN WALK TO ALL THE BRAND NEW STYLISH MODERN HOTELS AND CASINOS NAMELY- ARIA HOTEL AND CASINO - beautiful, lightly smoky, buffet is fantastic breakfast $15 ( I round up everything) and lunch $20 - HUGE VARIETY! COSMOPOLITIAN - NEWEST MEMBER OF THE CITYCENTER AREA - OWNED BY MARRIOTT (AT THE MOMENT-look it up on the internet if you would like to do some research of your own) - lavish, beautifully decorated, and as already mentioned the BELLAGIO - LOVELY gardens changed every 3 months - beautiful winter decorations - all free to view and photograph. Citycenter.com hotels have easy access to main strip which can be seen by all and more visited - like PH - Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile Shops - a mall- very convenient. Also a short walk to CAESARS AND THE FORUM SHOPS AT CAESARS HIGH END DESIGNERS LOUIS VUITTON, ARMANI, ETC. FYI - All walks have a short time where you walk outside. VDARA CONCIERGE - WELL I WILL NAME DROP - ASHLEY IS GREAT - very informative and booked great seats for us at O at Bellagio-remember AAA discount- this event did happen in August 2010. - with O bookings! EVAN LANGER - amazing too - he said he has been there since the Vdara opened and we asked him for the buffet prices at the Aria, which he gave us,and in addition, without asking, he gave us a line pass which gets you to the front of the buffet queue if there is one of course, a long line - so no waiting! The line does go pretty quick though. The reason I say do your homework is because of the following: We decided to call front desk and ask whether Haze nightclub in Aria was happening on Sunday night. WELL - ZACK SAID - Oh Yeh, it is all happening at Haze tonight and come on down and I will give you some passes to get in! We were excited! Got dressed went down a few hours later asked for Zack by name, and the other concierge staff - one was bald headed and another lady TRACY were there and they stated he should be right out and was with another customer and we waited patiently - no problem! Eventually he arrived and when we reminded him of our conversation he said it must be the one at Concierge (well we thought we were at the concierge). This meant there may be 2 ZACKS(still not sure). They all stated well the Zack that supposedly spoke to us on the phone had left but hold on everyone, maybe something could still be arranged - all of a sudden TRACY pulls out 2 passes and we just said Thank you and left - Guess what - when we got to HAZE IT WAS CLOSED - DISAPPOINTED - no biggie for us, we just went to the casino and played a little and went to bed - it was our last night- so it was fine. WE HAD A BLAST AT HAZE ON NYE WHERE WE SAW NELLY - AMAZING AND HAD GREAT CONVERSATIONS WITH GUYS AND GIRLS. Haze has always been closed on a Sunday night. - the ? is whether, the Vdara concierge that was present, made a genuine mistake - therefore need to back to school or training, since this does give a bad name to all those who are good at what they do at Vdara and The Vdara corporation= this is the reason I name drop because all the rest of the Vdara staff, from being greeted at the Vdara entrance to the Vdara stay to the farewell at the Vdara exit, all staff were superb. If the concierge were playing a prank or joke or whatever you would like to call it, it is very childish behavior, could hurt their (the mentioned concierge staff) reputation as well as Vdara's, effect the guest's mood and could be very costly. Little did they know that, we had already had a FABULOUS TIME IN VEGAS SINCE, I LOVE WITH A PASSION, TO DO MY RESEARCH AND MAKE SURE MY PARTY(WHETHER FAMILY OR FRIENDS OR PEOPLE I MEET AND HOPEFULLY, OTHERS WHO WILL READ MY STORIES HERE) will have a great Vegas experience. Hope you all have a great experience but, do your own homework and never be hesitant to ask questions!!! Happy New Year! P.S. for shows I heard from a traveler on the plane that LE REVE AT THE WYNN IS AMAZING - JUST AS GOOD OR BETTER THAN O - BOTH PERFORMANCES TAKE PLACE IN WATER.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the chaos of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jitiv
Reviews.Content: My 4th trip to Las Vegas.It was not what I had expected, but extremely happy I stayed. It is like finding an oasis in the midst of the chaos known as Las Vegas. Beautiful room overlooking the fountains of the Bellagio and across the desert and mountains of Nevada. The staff were fantastic and really made my trip. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Service for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Dianne56
Reviews.Content: There were five of us and we rented suites with an ajoining door. It was perfect. The beds were very comfortable . The hide a beds comfort was increased by the added downfilled cushions they put on top. The non gaming atmosphere made it very relaxing, the spa and fitness rooms were also top notch.The view was second to none. Location gave you access to everything you needed along with being only a very short drive to the airport. All service people were extraordinarly pleasant. As we approached New Year's the staff became so busy they could not keep up the with all the demands. They apologized profusely. Room service deteriorated to about 1 hour for extra kitchenware or things needed in the room. The pumped in perfume was overwhelming along with the repetitive musical loop that was used in the hotel and all elevators. There were no plush bathrobes and slippers as advertised. The spa had great atmosphere but the massage was overpriced and the hot tub in the spa was luke warm. Very disappointed. The resort fee allowed for the unlimited local calls, internet etc .

Reviews.Title: “Mighty nice stay at Vdara”
Reviews.Author: hachimachi
Reviews.Content: Spent a night en route to California at Vdara. We wanted to stay at City Center, and this pleasant hotel was great. For the size of the hotel, the features were not terribly impressive, and the pool was closed because of some wind and rain, but the large room was stylish and very comfortable. Our daughter enjoyed the very deluxe portable crib.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and serenity at an unbeatable price”
Reviews.Author: BrittaniMV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Vdara over Thanksgiving. We have stayed at the Bellagio for years but the appeal of a non-gaming hotel was too much. We did not regret our choice. The room was spacious and well decorated. The room's color scheme was very complimentary and modern. The bed was comfortable. My only complaint is that they only had down like filled pillows. I prefer foam pillows. The furniture was comfortable. The bathroom was spacious. We did not have any issue with noise, with the exception of the loud patron walking down the hall and yelling at his friends. We had a lakeside view room and could see the Bellagio fountains. I agree with the reviewer that articulated the relaxing atmosphere of the hotel. I loved the fresh orchids at the front desk. It's a nice change from the hustle and bustle of other hotels. Which, by the way, you can access by walking a few hundred feet to Aria.The hotel has a chic, spa-like vibe throughout. The restaurant (only one) has very limited hours. Room service is available 24 hours. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. Both bellman were exceptionally friendly and helpful, as were the employees that checked us in and out. The walk to the strip means walking through the Bellagio. We are moderate pace walkers and it took us about 10 minutes to get to the strip where you cross at Planet Hollywood. For the price, this is the nicest, most luxurious hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Want to feel like your in Vegas - go somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: SFtraveler49
Reviews.Content: Well, my review is different from most. Perhaps my expectations were different to begin with. I received an email from the Vdara offering stay 3 nights get the 3rd night free. I booked it from the link in the email and received many confirmation emails from Vdara over the next several weeks (saying how much they are looking forward to my stay). I arrive and am looking for a place to park. There is no place. I park in the Aria (assuming it to be the closest and as it is in City Center, connected to Vdara...It is NOT). I arrive at the front desk and give my name. He can't find it. I hand him a paper copy of my reservation confirmation. He does not look at it. I spell my name. He finally finds it. I ask about the free night, he says yes it shows here. I ask about internet cost, he hands me the check in paper and tells me to read the paragraph about services. I get my card key and go up to the room. The room is very nice. There is a kitchen and dining area. There is nothing in the kitchen (no pots, pans, dishes, silverware, NOTHING). What good is the kitchen? What good is the dining room? There is no coffee maker or coffee, there is no robe, no slippers. There is a bed and a couch. There is an uncomfortable chair at the desk. There is a good supply of towels, but as the three days went on the maids left less and less of soap and shampoo, etc. There is nothing at the hotel. For all practical purposes, if you want to eat, drink, gamble, see people, you have to walk outside to either the Aria, or and Bellagio (there is no where you can go that you do not have to go outside to get there). Upon check out, I was not shown my bill, but the lady said your balance is $$$. I said that sounds OK (as it was what I thought my three nights less the one free night should be). She then printed the bill and put it in an envelop. I opened the envelop and looked at the bill, and saw that one night was credited. OK. I get home, and on my credit card statement is one night charged when I made the reservation. So, in fact I did NOT get the third night free. I call the Vdara, and have to FAX my paperwork (email offer, reservation, bill) to the Vdara. They then did credit my card one night. I consider myself lucky to have had the paperwork, or I am sure I would not have received my free night. I will NOT be back to Vdara. And I recommend if you want to stay in Las Vegas and "feel" like you are in Las Vegas, you not stay at the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Escape from the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl03Omaha_NE
Reviews.Content: Loved this place and can't wait to go back! A quick walk to the strip, but its nice to return to a non-smoking, non-gaming QUIET hotel at night! Beds were comfortable, were able to check in upon our 8:30 AM arrival, which was more accomodating than we expected! No problems whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: alinyc214
Reviews.Content: The rooms are definitely the best part of this hotel. Although we weren't able to get a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains, we were still happy with our room. We didn't really use the kitchen but it was nice to have the fridge. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. The bathroom was pretty large with a shower and bathtub. There really isn't much to the rest of the hotel but we liked that there was no smoking and that the hotel was relatively quiet. Yes, there is a kind of strange smell in the lobby but I found the hotels with casinos also smelled (mostly trying to cover up the gross smoke smell!) We loved the location, it was very easy to get to casinos and to the strip. The Vdara is connected to the Bellagio and right next to Aria. It's only a short walk to Crystals and the Cosmopolitan. This is certainly not the fanciest hotel in Vegas but we felt like it was the best of both worlds being so close to other casinos but not having to deal with the casino/crowd in our own hotel. It looks like they are opening a cafe in the hotel which is definitely needed. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Near Enough to the Strip but still an oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: sdubray12
Reviews.Content: Great four night stay. Did not experience any of the check in issues mentioned in the other reviews and the staff and concierge were great. The room was spotless and quiet. It is well connected to the Bellagio and the Aria and a short walk to the strip but that short walk means you can easily escape the craziness. My only gripe is that there is no coffee maker in the room and you can get coffee in the lobby but still.....the resort fee gave us unlimited a fast enough wireless Internet. The view was good to the south but if I stayed again I would ask for a mountain view room which overlooks the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A few too many glitches for a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NasirH
Reviews.Content: Having been in the hotel business, I am aware of a lot of things, that, other people might not notice. I arrived from Toronto, Canada, and check in was a breeze. The room was nicely appointed , and the bed was extremely comfortable. The room needs more garbage cans, since only one is provided in the room , and one in the bathroom ( none in the kitchen area or the living room area ). The bathroom was adequate. The sink drain was sluggish, and the water pressure in the shower was extremely weak. They have a kitchenette in each room, without any utensils or cooking supplies. I called down to housekeeping, and they brought me a coffee cup. couple of plates. a knife and fork. The next day, these were gone, from the sink , where I had left them , since I didnt have any cleaning supplies, It appears, that , you have to request these items daily, since housekeeping will remove them, when they clean the room. The hotel is nice, since it is centrally located, only a short walk from the Bellagio and the other major hotels on the Strip. It is quite, and the health club is well equipped. However, it doesnt stand up to the 5 star rating it enjoys.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Rooms with slow service and missing the Vegas Excitement”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Vegas in a year and I stayed at THEhotel at Mandalay Bay during my previous stay. The rooms at the Vdara are impressive. I stayed at the Vdara suite to be exact. It's modern with electronic shades and two flat screen TVs. There are two bathrooms but only one with a bathtub and shower. The main bathroom has two sinks, toilet, a tub, and a shower. However, the small bathroom has the toilet, a sink, and a empty room next to it. The bedroom was large with a comfortable king size bed and a pull out queen in the living room. The kitchen had a refrigerator with filtered water. I really liked having a washer and dryer in the room as it was very convenient to wash my clothes. The one thing I dislike the most about the room is that the windows are not tinted. I was able to see another room with the bed right in plain site. Make sure you get a room that is now directly across from the other room which would be the ones next to the elevator on the elevator side. Service was slow. We had to wait over an hour to get some extra pillows, so expect them to be slow. However, there were some times when they were pretty quick. We called housekeeping twice. The first time took over an hour where we had to leave the room. The second time took about half an hour. The last time took approximately 5-10 minutes. I would recommend calling in the early morning or late afternoon when they don't have to service any rooms. The evening is when they have the most traffic. aOverall, the Vdara is a pretty impressive hotel. I just dislike the fact that it's missing the Vegas excitement due to the lack of a casino and lively atmosphere around the hotel. If you're OK with the lack of a casino, lively atmosphere, unpredictable service, and impressive rooms... go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dsequeira
Reviews.Content: If you are tired of the same old Vegas dredge as far as hotels are concerned then vdara is a welcome change. A non-gaming hotel right in the middle of the strip within walking distance of just about everywhere on the strip. I think a lot of peopel skip onthis hotel because its a non-smoking, non-gaming hotel but for families travelling with little kids, I highy recommend it. The little kitchenette with dual stove top and mini fridge are a God send. Couple of things to keep in mind: - Only valet parking available but if a short walk doesnt bother you then you can park in the self parking at Aria which is the next hotel over in the City Center. - There is a very distinct green tea/lavender odor prevalent everywhere in the lobby area. I loved it but I can see how it can be irritating to others. - Things you should call down to housekeeping for as soon as you check in to your room since these are not placed in the room: -- Robe and slippers. -- Pots and pans and glasses and cups and saucers. -- Extra bedding/pillow for the pull out couch - if you are a coffee drinker, like me, bring a coffee machine and coffee filters as none is available in the room. - if you intend to use the pots and pans everyday then bring a dishwashing detergent and scrubber with you as housekeeping takes it all back if they are left outside. What we did was to wash them everynight and then store them away in the kitchen cabinets. Saves you having to call down to have them deliver it every morning. - same deal with the extra bedding. Do not leave them out. House keeping will take it away. We folded them up every morning and then tucked them away on the top shelf in the closet. - CVS and Walgreen are a short walk away on the strip and thru the aria casino. Youc an get your necessities like milk, eggs, bread etc. Mind you they jack up the prices for the convenience. If you have a car, i suggest a short drive to safeway on flamingo road to get your grocery. The fridge is small so you cant store too much stuff in it. Keep that in mind. - Only one restaurant on the property and its a bit pricey. Bunch of them in Aria ranging from reasonable to expensive. We would have breakfast in the room made by us and then grab a quick inexpensive lunch in one of the myriad of restaurants/fast food places on the strip. We splurged on dinner a bit. It was an excellent hotel and highly recommend it. The difference in walking from a smoke filled hotel into Vdara was noticeable and very welcome. We paid 100 bucks a night for 4 nites. There is a 16 dollar daily resort fee plus sales tax on the resort fee and the room sales tax. Still think it was well worth it. Ask for a room higher up and one facing the Bellagio if they have any avaialble.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace amidst the sea of lights, noise and crowds.”
Reviews.Author: chrisbpower
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara for four nights over the Christmas holiday. The Vdara is a non-smoking, non-gaming hotel and is truly a hidden gem in the middle of the bustling Vegas strip. I'd consider the Vdara a boutique hotel--if it's possible to consider a 56 floor Vegas hotel boutique. It's located in the City Center and in easy walking distance to Bellagio, Aria, Cosmopolitan or Monte Carlo. The staff were extremely friendly and courteous. The only customer service hiccup we encountered was at check-in. Upon arrival our room was not ready and we were told we'd be called as soon as it was ready. Not a big deal--except we never received a call. Even after going back to the front desk--well beyond check-in time, it took the staff about 20 minutes to determine if the room was available. Other than this one glitch, the staff from the bell persons, concierge to housekeeping were extremely personable and professional. The quality of the room was outstanding. Although we didn't have a need for a kitchen space, it was nice to have a refrigerator. The room was well appointed, modern and very clean. We did have a couple of maintenance issues--a stopped-up sink and an overpowering sewage smell. Maintenance fixed the sink within 15 minutes of the call. Impressive. The sewage smell, however, was a different item. We were told they were aware of the issue and would spray our room and hall daily. Since they were aware of this issue, it would have been nice if it would have been corrected--instead of covered-up. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Vdara. It's a nice peaceful escape from an otherwise over-the-top city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and unexceptable sleeper sofas”
Reviews.Author: ccmcgrath
Reviews.Content: The quality of the sleeper sofas are terrible. The sleeper sofas offer no support and springs pop into your back. The rooms are beautiful but they "cheaped out" on sofa beds... and we had to call several times to get the sofa bed made up. (We had 3 rooms) Beautiful kitchen but requesting dishes, pots and pans is liking pulling teeth. (not kidding!!!) Called front desk and housekeeping several times to get dishes... After several calls we finally got the dishes but house keeping took them back the next day when cleaning our room... and we did not get the dishes back for the duration of the trip even when we requested to have the dishes returned several times. Also the rooms do not have coffee makers and it cost about $5 for take out coffee in their restaurant. Also we booked/reserved a rental van through the Vdara to go to Grand Canyon but it was not ready on the day of our trip. When we arrived at the Vdara we checked to make sure our Van was reserved and they confirmed that it was... sadly as mentioned no van on the day of our trip.(9 people were very disappointed.) Oh Ya.. we paid extra for a premium view... and they tried to give us a room without a view of the Bellagio Fountains. (When booking the rooms I mentioned several times that we wnated a view of the fountains and they assured us this is what we would get.) We had to wait 3 to 4 hours to get the rooms we wanted. The Vdara is beautiful but the service is the worst service I have experienced at a hotel. I don't usually write reviews but I felt I needed to advise people about my experience of this hotel. Before going to this hotel I read similar reviews to as mine but thought it must be an exception to get this kind of service but now I strongly believe it happens a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: Adventurebuzz
Reviews.Content: Ditto to the other recent reviews, but here's a bit more from my view. The Vdara is just plain boring and feels a bit overshadowed by MGM's bankruptcy. Fortunately, we were into boring on this trip-needed to kick back. Pluses include a refreshing change from typical strip hotels. The smell as one walks into the lobby is wonderful - an immediate plus. The architecture is very avante-garde, albeit with Stalinist overtones. Just not very warm, but interesting. Front desk experience was a bit frustrating as the "kids" were very nice but empowered to do jack nothing. I'm not sure any of the front desk crew was of legal age - but lots of smiles. We stayed for three nights on a low floor and on the first morning I explained that the honking from delivery trucks coming and going from the Bellagio starting at 5:30 A.M. woke me up. "May we move to higher floor for our last two nights?" Blank stares all around. Oh well. Minus- we needed a toothbrush and had to walk in the rain to the Aria sister hotel to get one at the gift shop - no amenities at Vdara except an overpriced restaurant ($23 for a full bk).
