The valet staff was a big plus-always remembered my name and hustled! Housekeeping did an outstanding job on day one and then a mediocre job on day two - not sure why. All in all I would stay here again if I'm looking for down tempo Vegas. Service will get better (?). Next time will make sure and get a high floor with Bellagio view, bring my own silverware and some breakfast food. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: mokoma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in November, and cant really complain on anything. Got first room on 52nd floor but there was disturbing noise due to the windy weather that day - and got it changed immediately. New room had very nice view towards Bellagio and its fountains. Anyway, rooms are all suites if I understood correctly, our included kitchen, living room, huge bed and toilet with shower cabin and bath. Super comfy beds! Room service was ok and punctual, no problems at all. Guys at the concierge downstairs were super helpful and got everything we needed to get us smoothly to California. Vdara is non casino hotel but it is connected to Bellagio and Aria. Bellagio is classic but Aria is just wonderful - everything is so cool there. Would recommend restaurant Sensi at Bellagio as well as the Bank nightclub if in party mood :) Some people keep on complaining on resort fees but 95% of Vegas hotels have them. So nothing new. Wifi and valet parking are free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but problems with dishes.”
Reviews.Author: Welshnewfie
Reviews.Content: When we checked in at the Vdara I asked for a full set of dishes for the room as I had read previous reviews about the lack of them. we had been in the room about 15 minutes when the dishes arrived. 2 cups, 2 bowls, 2 plates, 2 sets of knives and forks. We had to ask for a toaster, which arrived but we could not be supplied with either a coffee maker or a kettle. We were supplied with a saucepan for this purpose. Not 5 star. Everyday when we arrived back at our room the dishes had been removed but not replaced. We had to call room service every day to get the dishes replaced. A real pain. The room was beautiful and tastefully decorated. the shades are remote controlled. We had asked for a room with a view of the Balllagio fountains. We did get a room with a decent view of the strip and half the fountains. We could see the Eiffel tower at the Paris from our room which was nice. Quickest access to the strip is through a walkway to the Ballagio. Not too long a jaunt. You can also take the tram to the Monte Carlo for the south of the strip. All in all not a bad experience. The hotel being a non smoking hotel meant it always smelled fresh. No casino also a plus. Valet parking was quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere calm...”
Reviews.Author: Scots4sun
Reviews.Content: The Vdara in the new City Centre is a great hotel. Somewhere calm in the chaos of Vegas. It was good to get away the noiser and smoke. There is no casino but you dont need one as you are so close to the Belagio and Aria. The restaurant was great though. The rooms were so nice and spacious. The pool area is not great though, you dont get the sun for long between all thje high buildings. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: JPR2003
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in the 2bdr, 2 story penthouse. The penthouse views were amazing. Plenty of room for our family of four. You must request dinnerware and this proved to be the only negative of our stay as it took multiple calls to receive it. After the first night the used dishes were removed and only replaced after repeated calls to the front desk. Hotel was very quiet and perfect for a family with children. Location is mid strip wit access through the Aria or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Elcy21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and new. Front desk was friendly when we checked in. However, the housekeeping wasnt very responsible. They didn't clean our room on the 2nd day of our stay even we requested. The desk was dusty, and they don't provide water boiler or coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place for Family, Very Modern, Best family hotel ever in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: will678021
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels but this hotel is the best in vegas for families. No casino and no smoke smell found in nearly every hotel make this a difference maker. I upgraded the room at $75 per nite to a 1000 sq ft unit and needless to say this was more than ample. 2 bathrooms, full sized kitchen with laundry. Amazing room, location and NEW. If I were to nitpick anything it would have been for some occasional slow service and the resort fees. But having stayed at nearly every hotel in Vegas for families this offers the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Clean, Centrally-Located”
Reviews.Author: Az84
Reviews.Content: Me and a group of people stayed here for a few days while in Vegas. We were able to get a deal where if we got one room, the second room was half off. Being relatively new, the hotel is pretty spotless. There's a nice bar in the lobby that plays soothing music that gives the place a sophisticated ambience. The hotel itself doesn't really have a theme, though there are some underlying Asian imprints like the Silk Road restaurant. The rooms here are all suites, some have small differences (ie. some rooms have an extra bathroom that is seperate from the living room). The kitchen has an oven, microwave, fridge, and table; you can supposedly call for plates and cups. There is a big screen TV in both the living room and bedroom. The living room has a nice couch that can fold out to a bed. Depending on how close you are to the people you are staying with, you could probably fit 4-6 people in each suite. Bathroom was clean, large, and fully stocked. There's no casino on site, but like others have mentioned, there's a walkway (outdoors, but covered) that directly connects the hotel to Bellagio. There's also a free tram that can take you to Aria/Crystals, the City Center, and Monte Carlo. Planet Hollywood, Paris, and Cesars Palace are all within walking distance. For the most part the staff here is pretty good. It didn't seem like there was any nearby parking, so you're dependent on valet. The valet is slow; if you plan on using your car call ahead at least 30 minutes so they can get your car otherwise you'll be waiting. Overall, the place is pretty awesome, definitely a luxurious way to do Vegas. The location is pretty ideal; if you're looking to get a true Las Vegas experience and are willing to pay a little more, this would be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara needs work”
Reviews.Author: DLATraveler
Reviews.Content: OK, so they're a new hotel, but they're run by a long-standing group of hotels that should know how to run things. They don't. This place is a mess: sewage smells, missing housekeeping, awful (or no) signage...and a $25 per day resort fee that is supposed to include, among other items, comp newspapers....if you're willing to go down to the bell desk to retrieve them yourself. Nice rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Place Away from the Chaos”
Reviews.Author: nicolas617
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at Vdara and I love it. Everything is tastefully done. The staff are gracious. The first time I stayed I had a Deluxe suite - which was nice had a bedroom divided from a small living room by a open wall type thing. Gorgeous bath - nice kitchen. I thought it seemed a bit small and a little bit on the cheaply furnished side--thinking what will this place look like in 5 years. This time I got a Vdara Suite. It has a separate bedroom that is completely separated from the living room. Beautiful huge bath of the bedroom. Very nice kitchen with a half bath off it. Good sized living room. I would definitely recommend going for this room or better and avoid the smaller ones. Not a lot going on in this hotel other than the gorgeous rooms. But you are within easy walking distance of all the fun.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Stress free stay!”
Reviews.Author: sammy_jean20
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel and everything was spotless, the rooms were comfy and spacious. The staff were nothing but friendly and helpful. This is one of the few hotels in the area that is not accompanied by a huge casino. There's many casinos in the area (obviously, being Vegas!) and the hotel was a nice relaxing place to spend your time when you were, uhh, not losing money gambling! Convenient location (next to the Bellagio and near to Ceasars palace - they're all connected by walkways). There is a special relaxing spa room which i didn't experience myself but my friend did go in there and said it was fantastic. Steam room, baths etc! Everything is modern and clean, and there is a little cafe/bar at the front of the lobby with free little snack as you sit down to order. (Little expensive, about $4-5 for a coffee, but its a classy place so isn't that to be expected?) There is plenty of space to sunbake for anyone wanting to check out the pool (or should i say all 4 pools at the hotel - main pool, spa and two lap pools) the heated spa is nice when the weather is a bit chilly. You can control the jets and temperature yourself, and if you want to lay by the pool without getting burnt, there's a few tents to lay under - sort of like a double bed with a canopy over the top. The pool did close at 4pm however which was a little disappointing! All in all a pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “Had the potential, but couldn't follow through”
Reviews.Author: kellyo1126
Reviews.Content: So, we walk into this beautiful hotel and are overwhelmed with the delicious aromas in the air. The architecture is mind-boggling and everything looks clean and brand new. Then, reality sets in. We stand at the front desk FOREVER to check in - at 10 pm keep in mind. There was no one else there but us. We finally get to our room and it is looks beautiful. It is modern, clean, green, bed-bug free... However, there is a fine line between trying to be "green" and being cheap. Vdara crossed the line into cheap. They give you nothing in your room. We had to request lotion and q-tips and it took over an hour for them to bring it to us. No one there, except the cocktail waitress was friendly. Everything was overpriced - EVERYTHING! It's a shame- because it could've been so great.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a hotel well worth the money! Can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: sheffieldmiller
Reviews.Content: Hi Guys, always knew this hotel should be decent with it been a 5star and the hotel stood up to its good reputation..... a truly amzing holiday. We flew from the Manchester to Vegas and arrived late at night, landing in the airport was amazing because you could see on the neon lights from above. Thiere were loads of taxis at the airport so commuting to the hotel was easy. First impressions of the vdara were great, bell boys opened the taxi doors, took our luggage and no ques at the reception. I requested a view of the bellagio and my wish came true, as you enter the hotel there is a real nice smell & the hotel is so modern and clean. We stayed here for 8 days, the only thing i didnt like was how we had to pay a £1000 deposit to the hotel encase of accidents to the room or give them my credit card details. The rooms them selfs are great, we only had a basic room- but let me stop you there this included 2 x plasmas in the room, his/hers bathroom etc you couldnt wish for a better hotel room. The hotel is connected to the belagio via a walkway and the walk isnt too bad.... remember this is vegas and all the hotels are massive so you cant get away from the walking. Overall i would give this hotel 9 out of 10. I would def go back here and truly enjoyed my stay in spin city!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the midst of all the bustle of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: GottaGetOutOfDallas
Reviews.Content: Very short walk to the casinos at Bellagio, Aria, and The Cosmopolitan without having to venture out onto Strip. No gawkers or drunken party-goers to wade through just to get back to the guest elevators at the end of a long night. The bed was so comfortable that for the first time I can remember I wasn't looking forward to sleeping in my own once we got back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but only one tiny thing needs to be improved”
Reviews.Author: kathliao
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel, new and clean. The room is large and comfortable. Although it is not located on strip, and the way to strip is under construction, I can use a gallery through Bellagio to strip, a little bit inconvenient. Only one thing I have to complain, there is no kettle in the room and I cannot heat water for tea or coffee. It's not convenient. Except mention above, it is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better service and better value at Encore”
Reviews.Author: livingthegoodliezzz
Reviews.Content: Approximately a month ago I called to inquire on the possible purchase of a two bedroom condo at your Vdara property. It took the sales staff ten days to call me back. I told them I did not hear from them and booked the condo for a few days. Fyi....they have never contacted me again. I am a business owner with disposable income. Am I not the type of customer you are looking for? My concern and reason for this letter is several fold. The front desk is lacking of speed and promptness. Where is the private check in? I rented the two bedroom condo as I brought some key people that work for me. We dropped our bags and went out for a late lunch. Later that evening we returned and the room was 76 degrees. From what I could tell the room had three thermostats, one in the living room and one in each bedroom. They were all set on cool at approximately 68 degrees. We called down, voiced our concern, then left for dinner and a night on the town. We were out almost all night. We retired early morning for some rest. We were all awoken to the sound of some kind of power washer or construction. It was so bad I called down to the front desk. The noise continued so we took quick showers and left. Keep in mind I rented the two bedroom penthouse on the top floor. The showers are a joke....almost no pressure. I looked at the temp and it was still extremely hot in the room 75 degrees. Well, we ventured out again and grabbed some lunch. When we hit the hall way you could smell the fumes from whatever they were doing. We arrived back later that evening to find the room 78 degrees again. I called down and they sent up a maintenance man. He looked at the thermostat in the living room and said...."well, it’s on”. He then went into the bedroom where I was and took the grill out by the bed. He messed with it for a while and said “your all set” I asked him to check the other bedroom and he said “it’s all good” Needless to say we went out on the town and had fun gambling. The cooling unit by the bed sounded like a waterfall all night. It was making noise and weird sounds. The next morning I woke up sweating....77 degrees. This time I went to the front desk and asked for the manager. They said he was busy and he would call me.......No call. I went again and they said he would call me. He finally did call and said he would look into it. I received a voice mail later stating that they would credit my bill 100.00 per night. This is an 800.00 per night room.

Reviews.Title: “The Vdara is great. Beautiful, modern, and quiet...”
Reviews.Author: TraceyPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at the Vdara. We loved it again (our second stay). It’s currently our first choice in all of Las Vegas. It’s new, it’s modern, and the rooms are large with a kitchen (you must ask for plates and utensils), great bathrooms and comfy beds with super nice linens. It’s a non-smoking and non-gaming property so it might not be for everyone. It’s an easy walk to the Aria casino as well as to the Bellagio and soon the Cosmopolitan will open adding yet another epic gaming and casino experience just steps away. We had a bit of a wait at check-in. Vegas hotels never seem to have enough help at registration – we have waited a lot longer at Wynn… The valet and bellmen were stellar. Our room was spotless and we had a great view of the Bellagio fountain, the Strip lights and mountain views from the 32 floor. We went to see Elvis impersonator Trent Carlini at the Las Vegas Hilton. We were surprised at how fun it was as well as how excellent Trent did Elvis. Kind of cheesy but lots-o-fun for $50 per person. We had a perfect steak dinner at N9NE steakhouse at the Palms. It’s pricy but always worth it. Have fun. Viva Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay Second Time Around!”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2Travel23
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Vdara was a disappointment and my previous post reflects this fact. We also happened to be there the night of the false fire alarm at 2:00 am, where we were awokened by a blaring alarm and had to evacuate the building via the stairs. We were near the 30th floor. When I inquired about the fire drill inconvenience during check out, the staff were unsure what the management was going to do to improve guest relations. About a month later, the Vdara notified us that we received a complimentary one night stay for the inconvenience of the false alarm. Our second stay was a vast improvement over the first. The check-in line was short, the front desk helpful, and the room spotless. I asked for a low floor and we received a beautiful suite overlooking the pool on the 6th floor. The room was well stocked with coffee and creamer this time around! My complaint was never with the suites at this hotel-they really are well appointed, clean, modern, and comfortable. My complaint with the Vdara previously was mainly due to disorganization and a slow staff. I believe we stayed too soon after the Vdara had opened and the hotel just needed to work out a few kinks in the system. The Vdara treated us much better this time around and we left very satisfied. Driving into the CityCenter still looks like LAX to me, but the Vdara is worth considering for a future stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but NO coffee maker or DVD player”
Reviews.Author: pdblue2
Reviews.Content: It is a walk off of the strip and you have to go outside to enter any casino. It is nice that it is a non-smoking hotel. Gym/fitness area is very small and gets crowded if busy. No coffee maker in the room and had to call to have dishes delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NICESTLGUY
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect stay. I have stayed at Cesars and Pallazo in the past and I liked this place far better. It was literally a breath of fresh air with the no-smoking. Rooms were very nice and good size. The prices were very reasonable. We had a room on the 52nd floor. The view was awesome. I wanted an even numbered room so that we could watch the Bellagio water show, but the odd number room we got had a great view of the south strip, airport and mountains. I never get room service so I can't speak about that. Having a kitchenette with fridge was very nice. I would advice going on Youtube and watching the videos of how to get around to so you have an idea of how to get in and out of the place. We never ate there since it's connected to the Bellagio and right in the middle of about a thousand other places to eat. If you want a great hotel, thats not smoking and has an excellent view pick the Vdara. By the way the staff was top notch. We only needed their assistance three times. First to check in, second to print our boarding passes and third to check out. Every time they were fast, professional and accurate. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: twisted_diva
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a delightful mid-November stay at the Vdara. As this was our first trip to Vegas, we were hoping to find a hotel that's non-gaming as well as non-smoking and away from the Strip so we took a chance on the Vdara based on several reviews here. The hotel lived up to our expectations. The room was spacious, clean, well-appointed (2 HDTVs), with a microwave, fridge, and spacious bathroom. Had no trouble sleeping thanks to their wonderful beds (although I'm sure exhaustion played a huge part!). No problems at check-in. We requested an upper floor and were given a panoramic view of the Nevada desert and the fountains at the Bellagio. The hotel is relatively new and situated at the City Center, but set back from the Strip itself. A 2-minute walk through a connecting pedestrian tunnel takes you directly to the southern entrance of the Bellagio and the hotel tram serving the Aria and Casino Royale. Walking north from there you can take advantage of all the Bellagio has to offer, or continue your journey through to Caesar’s Palace, The Mirage, and Treasure Island (and on the other side of the street the Paris, Flamingo, Venetian, and Wynn/Encore, to name a few). Walking outside, to the south the Aria is across the elevated traffic circle, beyond which lie Casino Royale, New York New York, Excalibur, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay. The staff at the Vdara was polite and helpful. Housekeeping was awesome. We had no problems with the valet service and our rental car was regularly retrieved within minutes – no scrapes or dents and always with a smile and helpful directions and suggestions! While we did not use the spa, we did use the treadmills at their fitness center. They were in excellent working order, and attendants kept the place very clean. If we ever return to Vegas, the Vdara will definitely be on our short list of places to stay. A final note for those who don’t gamble: try to visit Hoover Dam and/or Red Rock Canyon, both of which are a short (45 minute) drive from the hotel (or you can take the many tours offered). Both are nice getaways from the craziness of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever !!”
Reviews.Author: adamjadam
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic week in the Vdara Las Vegas. The hotel is just off the strip but only a few mins walk through the Belagio to get into the middle of the unbelievable Vegas action. The rooms are quiet and there seems to be very few people around even though there are 1500+ rooms. The Vdara offers a sophisticated; calm; discrete oasis away from the noise of the casinos and older hotels. The Vdara is an all suite hotel, the suites are a good size and well equiped. Huge TVs; big bathrooms and fantastic views across the mountains or strip. Service is fast and nothing is too much trouble; the staff are friendly and helpful with no great push for tips !! We didnt use the pool but it looks lovely and would be great in the summer. If you are looking for a sophisticated; high class; exclusive hotel stay here. Probably the best hotel we've ever stayed at. Had a fantastic week. Free wifi - free valet service......

Reviews.Title: “Are we in Las Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: AVRLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This is a non-gambling hotel; it is fairly new and they are still working out the kinks. It is linked to Aria and Bellagio by tram. The look and feel of this hotel is modern, austere and glass-and-steel urban -- perfect for a business trip to Vegas but perhaps not for a "Vegas weekend". There is no restaurant in this hotel, only a cafe ($10 for morning yogurt cup). With it's kitchenette, sitting area, and views, the room is fantastic for an extended stay on business. Urban roof-top pool deck. Would def. recommend to a business traveler who has business to focus on -- no distractions at Vdara. If you are visiting Vegas for fun, you may want something with more Vegas-style and color.

Reviews.Title: “Last time I will be staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie21
Reviews.Content: First off, before you book a stay here, be advised that there is no self parking here. It is valet only. Tip: park at the Aria and walk over. We checked in and the hotel smelled of perfume and it was too over the top and it gave me a headache. If you are allergic to perfume, stay away. I was very disappointed. We checked in and the receptionist was not friendly and very slow. The customer service she provided was awful and not welcoming. We got to our room on the 48th floor and I immediately felt claustrophobic. It was very small and warm in the room and you just want to scream and run out of the hotel to get fresh air. I set the temperature to a cooler temp and it appears they have it set at a certain temperature and I couldn't get the room any cooler than 75. The room is dark and has a TV console right in the center of the room which takes up space and it's very crowded. Hated it. The lighting was awful. Although they have a microwave and tiny refrigerator, they don't provide any utensils or plates (you have to ask for it). They don't have shower caps and don't forget to bring your own hair dryer! Also, this hotel has only one king bed. I called housekeeping for a shower cap and a sheet protector for the pullout out couch and they never delivered it...they later called me and told me they delivered it to the wrong room. I have stayed at 3 star hotels that are so much better than this. I couldn't wait to leave this hotel, to be honest. It just isn't worth it. There are no strip views...it's either pool or Bellagio fountain along with a crowded highway to look at. Be aware there is an expensive resort fee. Included in that fee, however, is free internet. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...Amazing Suite...Excellent Service.”
Reviews.Author: cookiez101
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived mid-week for a 4-night stay for his 30th birthday. Vegas is one our favorite vacation spots, and since there are so many choices in hotels, we try a different one every visit: Bellagio, Mandalay, Mirage, and so on. We chose Vdara because it was non-gaming, non-smoking, but had a great location in the middle of the strip. Upon entering Vdara, we were pleased by the mellow vibe of the lobby area and the sweet smell pumping through the vents. The front desk rep was extremely courteous and personable. Our room was a panoramic suite on the 43rd floor. The ENTIRE suite had a view and it was AMAZING! The view itself was worth the money. The room itself was very spacious for the two of us. We took full advantage of the kitchen in the suite, stocking up on snacks and beverages in the full-size refrigerator and even cooking a couple of quick meals. Any thing I needed for the kitchen was quickly brought up by housekeeping. The bathroom was very large with a separate shower and tub. There were also his/her sinks and a separate vanity area just for me! Another convenient amenity was the washer/dryer. I must mention the exceptional customer service throughout our stay. From the valet attendants to the front desk to the housekeeping staff, everyone was helpful, polite, and friendly. I would definitely recommend Vdara if you are looking for a peaceful escape from the usual hustle and bustle of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “NO VDARA. NOT WORTH IT”
Reviews.Author: Vdara
Reviews.Content: Great view from the room and that's all i can say. First of all, there is EXTRA charge of $15 dollars/day resort fees that is not acceptable ( included 2 tiny bottle of water, news paper and internet access) which we didn't know about in adavance. Secondly, inconsistancy of housekeeping everyday, 1st day we have 1 bottle of water instead of 2, 2nd day we have new set of shampoo, conditioner & lotion, 3rd day we have no new set of those but we have 2 soaps. what the, and we have to ASK for Shower Cap in a 5-star hotel??? and 3rd thing we have been disappointed is I lost my sleeping tee in my room. I remember i put my tee on the bed in the morning and then went out, i can't find my sleeping tee after i come back to the room. I am sure they accidentally removed it when they are doing the bed.. So i am not surprised that on the previous review people commented they lost whole drawer of clothes. So I will not recommend to my friend and this is one last time.

Reviews.Title: “A BIG Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TXLonghorn2010
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas and thought I would try something different. The hotel looks nice from the outside and its a great location, so I decided to stay the night of Thanksgiving. One night was enough at this hotel with such slow and poor service. My expectations were high because its a new hotel and with the rate you pay, you would expect much more. I travel 70% of my time and I've stayed at many hotels and this by far was a BIG DISAPPOINTMENT. Primarily due to the slow service at the hotel and lack of follow up. Some of the normal extras you would expect from other hotels cost $$ at this hotel. Let me explain...I decided to get an upgrade for $50.00 and the room I should say was AWESOME! Had a great view and it had a washer and dryer, nice tub, a full living room and kitchen. However, there were NO utensils and pans in the room. I called and asked for utensils, plates, and pans and was told they would be right up. I had warmed up my Thanksgiving lunch thinking i would not have to wait long and after 25 minutes, I decided to call again to get the status. I learned my initial request was not on record, so had to start the process all over again and had to wait another 15 minutes before someone arrived. By this time, I had requested a Manager and no one was available. Surprise!!! I asked for someone who was in charge to call me and after 30 minutes I got a call from the Manager on Duty. I simply wanted to let her know that I wasn't impressed with the service at the hotel and she offered me a 50.00 credit to my account. Later that eearly evening, I decided to try out the gym. I went downstairs and the gym was closed. No one at the check in desk had informed me of this and there were no signs indicating the gym would be closing early!! (By the way, the gym is VERY SMALL and can get crowded very quickly)I was ready to check out and move over to the Marriott where I was to stay for 2 additional nights but i thought, lets see if I can get a late check out. I called downstairs and I could get a late check out , but it would cost me 50.00. At that point, I was ready to leave the hotel asap. At checkout, I learned that the credit was on my account, but i had to use it for a spa or restaurant charge. No indication of this when I spoke to the manager in charge. There were only 2 people at the front desk when I arrived and then there was only 1 person, the one assisting me. The line was getting longer and the young lady mentioned she needed to get a hold of a manager. She called and of course, there was NO manager available. She had to hang up and then leave the front desk to look for one. There was about 3 minutes or so where there was NO ONE AT THE FRONT DESK. Had I been a guest checking in at that time, I would have wondered, is the hotel closed???? Nevertheless, I got the issue resolved and I was ready to check in at the Marriott Suites. Where, I was able to check in early, get free breakfast, a complimentary bottle of wine and cheese and crackers for being a Platinum member. Now folks, that's what you call service. If you simply want a great room and dont care about the service, then the Vdara is your place. However, if you expect more from a hotel, I would recommend you look somewhere else considering the service and charges you incur for every little thing.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: AesRochester_NY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Vdara Hotel. It is an oasis amidst the craziness that is Las Vegas - all-suites, no casino, no smoking. Instead, a high, quiet,elegant lobby with a faint, elicious dflowery smell, well-equipped, chic suites with a small kitchen/eating area, sitting area, bedroom with extremely comfortable king size bed and a luxurious bathroom. We were given a suite on the 50th floor with spectacular views over the Bellagio lake and fountains and beyond to the mountains surrounding Las Vegas. After the hubbub that ius Las Vegas, it was bliss to return to this calm oasis. Our only criticism: the signposting to get to the hotel is very confusing until you know where you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “All that expense for nothing”
Reviews.Author: d3vd
Reviews.Content: The room rates were better than the Bellagio which is a stones throw away, but your food options are extremely limited so I hope you like paying $15 minimum for any real food in the restaurant. Good luck finding things that works, the ice machine on our floor wasn't working for half the day and the hot water failed for the entire hotel and was not working for hours. The room service I ordered made me schedule a time to pick up the dishes, but never actually showed up to do so, so I ended up taking 5 minutes to organize and stack the mess outside. It smells great in the lobby, but the construction seems louder than it needs to be. The smell in the hallway to our floor was pretty awful, not quite sure what it was supposed to smell like.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: cbonk
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in. Basically a studio apartment/suite. Kitchenette, living area, sleeping area. Flat screens face each area on the wall dividing the space. We stayed on the Tuesday before Thanksgiving and it was dead. It's a non-gaming hotel so it has a different vibe from the rest of the casino hotels. The lobby bar is nice, but their restaurant Silkroad is really kind of lame. We also stayed there the Friday after Thanksgiving and it was much livelier. They charge a $16 resort fee, which is kind of ridiculous. It's for WiFi access and gym access, but you can't opt out on the fee. Aria is a 100 yards across the street and The Cosmopolitan is right next door. Bellagio is attached to the back of Vdara. We had a northern view of the Bellagio's fountains both nights and it was a wonderful. We booked through Orbitz. The Tuesday before Thanksgiving was $129. The same type of room was $229 on Friday. I'd stay again if I could get a great rate. Service was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Something new”
Reviews.Author: fabry73
Reviews.Content: I’m mad about hotels when going to Vegas. Most people don’t care much about it, because your time will be mostly spent around the strip. But I love opening those rooms doors, take a breath and splurging into a beautiful suite. So, new luxury hotels are a must for me. But, the same way, I’m an avid “offers seeker”, considering you can have wonderful rooms at a laughable rate if you keep doing your homework. Said that, although really eager to try the new CityCenter, I didn’t do it during my march trip. Rates were really high. Luckily, for my august trip, I’ve been able to find a great occasion both for Vdara and Aria. 170$ per night for a cityview suite at Vdara, including 50$ food credit was too good to pass by. The lobby is quite classy. Nice décor, quiet, kind employees, and a couple of bars. The room is not very large for Vegas, being a 1 bdrm suite. I liked furniture and modern style, as much as the tech devices for drapes and lighting. The living room was nicely appointed, the bedroom not so large (but with a confortable bed), the bathroom was massive, nice and well lit. Shower, tub and two sinks. I didn’t like the small kitchen, with a lot of wasted space there. I don’t really think a dishwasher could be useful in Vegas, sure a little bit of that space could have been used for something else. Other notable situations: I’ve received a parcel at the business center. They took 10$ for this kind of service. More or less, the same amount I gave to UPS to let a parcel travel from East coast to LV in 1 day… You don’t have many choice to use your food credit; it could be used only at Vdara and you have a bar and a bar/restaurant. Had lunch at the lobby bar, asked for a jumbo shrimp cocktail. The price was $22, the cocktail arrived in a huge bowl with a little bit of green salad, ice to fill a bottle and four (!) shrimps. I had the credit, but should I had to pay for it I would not have been happy… Anyway, a nice experience in a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...front desk staff need some manners and customer service training!”
Reviews.Author: Canuckadventurers
Reviews.Content: The room was really great and the speed of the elevators each time we needed one was incredibly fast. The bellmen were really friendly and helpful and so were the housekeeping staff. The only complaint I have and also the reason for which I will never stay there again is the front desk staff. Those girls really need an attitude adjustment. I had read some comments mentioning the same concerns on Trip Advisor and just dismissed it as a possible bad day for someone. This was not the case. Two days before we wanted to leave I had stepped up to the desk to inquire about extending out checkout to a later time, as our flight didn't leave until midnight. Now after reading several other reviews, people were getting complimentary champagne sent to their rooms for celebrating milestones and having late checkouts for the same reason I was. However, I was told that I would have to call down on the morning of the day we were leaving and find out if we could extend out stay from noon to 1pm (wow a whole hour). I was also given the option to stay until 4pm for an extra $30 if I wanted to and if we wanted to stay until 6 then it would of been half a day's rate of about $60. I figured I had already spent enough money at the hotel I wasn't throwing in another $30 to relax before we had to leave. You would have thought as well they would have taken down my information instead and used some customer service to maybe call me and advise me that morning of my options??? The morning we were leaving I called down and I was now being quoted $50 to stay until 4pm and $89 if I wanted to stay until 6pm. I said no thank you we'll leave at noon and hung up the phone. They were rude with every encounter I had with them from check in to check out. They didn't even ask us how our stay was when we went to checkout and to top it off the computer systems were down and they couldn't bring up any of our info. A smile and courtesy goes a long way, they need a huge refresher course on this! For a hotel that hardly had any guests while we were visiting I thought they would have gone a little ways to make their guests happy. I even noticed when we were checking in there were 2 sets of couples also experiencing issues with the separate girls as I could tell from where I was standing neither of them were happy. Next time we visit Vegas for a birthday we will be selecting another resort. Should have stayed at the Golden Nugget as we originally planned. I had stayed there before and was a much more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, calming and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Vdara twice this year (August and November), both times the hotel came through with great customer service, clean/comfortable/ huge rooms, excellent food quality and a general sense of relaxation - something that is a welcome respite from the sensory overload of other Vegas hotels. There is no casino at Vdara and its a much more manageable size than other hotels on the strip. The rooms are apartment sized. The gym is very well-equipped and there is convenient access to the tram (monorail) that connects Vdara to Crystals shopping center, Aria and Monte Carlo hotel/casino.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: alibeth
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in Vdara on the 29th floor. I loved it. New, clean, well located with connections to the Bellagio casino and the city center. It's a high class place with high class people. It's a little expensive, but considering the quality it's a great buy. If this wasn't in las vegas, this hotel would be extremely expensive elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Alternative to a typical Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ojodepescado
Reviews.Content: The quality of the Vdara and the City Center is Top Notch and provides some of the best views in Vegas with a romantic vibe. Our experience was fantastic, but not perfect, and we would recommend this location to anyone who does not want the typical smokey, hectic and loud Vegas experience right outside your hotel room door. We found that the tram made access to the stip simple and not an inconvenience as many reviews suggest. The room is spacious and clean although the kitchen was lacking with limited amenities such as no dishes, coffee maker, silverware or towels. We also were dissapointed when we made a foolish mistake and left two AC adapters for our computers behind in the room and the cleaning staff did not turn them in. I hope they get a good price for them on eBay. The management is almost non-existant with no way to contact anyone with authority. This is a great spot for couples on a getaway or business persons looking for a quiet place to work.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, new standard for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sonolum
Reviews.Content: Every high end hotel in Vegas should (but coudn't) measure up to Vdara, in terms of luxury, value, and service. I've been to almost all the high end niche hotels in Vegas - Wynn, Venetian, Mandalay Bay, you name it. I got a corner suite at Vdara with a breath taking view, and I didn't even ask for an upgrade. My room has everything you need for a 4 night stay - stainless steel refrig., a washer and dyer, almost a full size kitchen. People are helpful and I got several calls during my stay asking me if I needed something more. The hotel is an easy walk to Bellagio and to Aria through the tram, so you are close to all the actions.. Of course, there were a few shortcomings. Room service didn't usually get there until the afternoon. Whoever designed the entrance to the hotel should be thoroughly admonished. It was hard to get to the hotel from either direction, and the signs were WAY too small, and too hard to read, The so-called "art" (with all the canoes) at the front of the hotel seems out of place. They should replace it with a CITY CENTER Logo.. But overall, a very pleasant stay. With price better than Encore, Wynn, and Palazzo but yet better service, I'm looking foreward to going back (soon).

Reviews.Title: “A Mid-Strip Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Annagins
Reviews.Content: We’ve been to Las Vegas 4 times in the past 5 years and always stay at The Bellagio or the Venetian. Since we wanted to check out the City Center, loved the idea of a non-smoking hotel, and thought it would be convenient to have a kitchen, we booked the Vdara. We arrived by cab so we didn’t have any problems finding the place, which is located behind Aria and connected to the back of Bellagio. Drop-off was easy and there were a lot of bell hops there to help. Inside, we took in the smell I’d read about here in Trip Advisor. It fit in nicely with the modern, nature-inspired atmosphere. It didn’t seem like a big deal, though. It just kind of went with the décor, which in my opinion was very soothing in a modern, nature-influenced way. The lobby area was small (as expected). But compared to other bustling, airport-like lobbies, the small, intimate feel of the lobby was a definite benefit and later in the trip, it really did feel like an oasis and an escape from casino noise. Speaking of casinos, there’s no casino in the Vdara, but the Aria casino is a 3 minute walk out the front door and Bellagio’s is about 5. Walking was pretty much a non-issue for us because we enjoy it. I don’t like being too cold or hot, though, and I did appreciate that most of the walks from Vdara were inside (save for a few uncovered walkways). Our room on the 22 floor was quiet, had a sleek and modern design, and a whole half-wall of windows with a breathtaking view of the Bellagio pool, Bellagio fountains, and the mountains. The bed is super comfortable and the bathroom is large with a walk-in shower (water pressure is just okay, unfortunately) and soaking tub. The sofa is a pull-out sleeper and the little kitchen is extremely handy. We asked for pots and cups to be delivered upon arrival and they showed up 10 minutes later. Each morning, we were able to boil water and make our instant coffee, plus we had a little refrigerator to store things like milk, juice and fruit. After reading some of the reviews here, I was a little worried about the room, but it was first class all the way, despite the iron being on a cord attached to the wall. That was a little tacky and it irritated my husband, but it was a minor thing. Having a luxury room with a kitchen right in the center strip AND at a reasonable price (if you search, you can find lots of good deals for Vdara) was great. Given all that, plus the fact we liked City Center so much, we would probably stay at Vdara again (for the kitchen) or perhaps just try Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Great new Vegas hotel just off the strip - a quiet oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: all_ar0und_the_world
Reviews.Content: Fabulous new property just off the strip with a walkway through to the Belagio which fronts the strip at the all important 'right end'. Very nice hotel with all the general amenities you would expect with great attitude from the staff. Pros: new, quiet, good location. Cons: missing atmosphere somehow (seems like dormitory in many ways) - maybe because it has no Casino.

Reviews.Title: “The View from the 30th floor - Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: SharonC68
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Vdara from the 23- 26 Oct. The Hotel was superb, very swish, made you feel like a celebrity. The view from our room was well worth all the planning and we did do an upgrade($40 tip) at check in to get the premium veiw of the Bellagio fountains. The best thing was it doesn't have a casino and is non-smoking, a haven to get away from it all after you've had your fill of the strip.The only negative thing is it is back from the strip and there is a bit of walking to get to the strip thru Bellagio (not good in high heels). We wished we had longer there though to have tried the spa treatments & amenities. Highly recommend for a couples retreat.

Reviews.Title: “A top class hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Balding_Bon_Viveur
Reviews.Content: you can choose to either chill out at the vdara, or else dive full on in to the Las Vegas experience. The hotel is brand new, has a beatiful bar and breakfast area done to standards we've only ever seen previously in Singapore and Hong Kong, the rooms are generally very spaciuos and also fitted out to a very high standard. Location wise its located adjacent to Bellagio so right in the cnetre of the action, yet the hotel is not noisy, or vulgar its very classy in fact. There are some down sides, breakfast is very pricey indeed, as are drinks at the bar (about £5 for a glass of not fantastic beer) we did have one problem with our breakfast not being brough tio us promptoly as we needed to eat a little later on one of the days, but in fairness problems we experienced were resolved. Valet Parking an be a bit of a `nause' if youre not used to it, but then after 2 days we did, and it was better than having to find a spot yourself. Word to the wise, it isnt a cakewlak getting to the strip from the hotel, just go with the flow, you'll need to pretty much walk into the bellagio first, or else dice with the traffic on the roads beneath the vdara! Other than that brialliant views form the room and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara, Quiet, Clean,fabulous view, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JupiterJoe
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days at the Vdara in November. A little tricky getting into hotel. If you turn at Harmon and go up the ramp to the right your there. Arrived with rental car, valet service with the car was outstanding. Never had to wait more than a few seconds for them to bring car around. Most of the other hotels its quite a wait but not here. Super prompt. Check in was a breeze, room was ready at l0:30 a.m. as when we told them thats what our arrival was. Got a room on the 40th floor. View was magnificent, panoramic view of everything. The best I've had in vegas so far and I've stayed all over. The room was as it looks in the pics on TA. There were no surprises. Bed was comfortable and bedding was all new and very clean. The air vents were even clean which is something I always look for. Bath area was equally clean and shower and sink were fine. The soaker tub was a little difficult getting in and out. They should have some sort of bar on the wall. This is where I could find a small problem with a small misstep. Other than that it worked for me with caution. Tub and shower were cleaned every day to perfection. Kitchen area was pretty useless. I guess if you ordered all the dishes, pots, etc from downstairs you will receive them. No coffee maker in room and that is really a mistake. I have my own so it was not a problem for me. The only thing that was useful was the small kitchen table and chairs. Very nice. The kitch sort of says, please don't use me. But for us it was perfect. I would not let any small negatives deter me from staying at this property again. It was again a joy and the proximity to the Aria is a half walk around a parking circle. About l minute. It was refreshing to walk. In heat nothing to consider. It's a mater of steps. This also connects to the Bellagio thru a walkway. Would I stay again, you bet. After long days in vegas, this was a welcome quiet place to come home to. The only other negative which is repeated over and over. They need a new scent in the entrance. This scent that was selected was only in the lobby but really not one that I enjoyed. I wish they would change it. It still would not deter me from staying there again. This is really a great property.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...Vdara is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: tbrown1879
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the Vdara, I was completely impressed. The bellman was sincerely friendly and welcoming, the lobby was spotless, the place smells undescribeable and it's impressively designed. The check-in process was fairly quick (I've experienced lengthier). The elevators are a sight to be seen, themselves! We were given a room on the north (?) side on the 46th floor. The view was amazing! Mountains straight ahead, Rio and Palms hotels just off to the left and Bellagio/fountains and the strip off to the right. The room was excuisite. The king size bed was VERY comfortable. We enjoyed the free wireless internet (free if you don't count the daily $15 resort fee). The bathroom was luxurious and I enjoyed the Aveda shampoo/conditioner/soap. The Conference rooms were as expected; high-tech, beautifully adorned and the food was FANTASTIC!! We had a three-course lunch at the attached gourmet restaurant, Silk. It was absolutely delicious! The free tram connecting the Bellagio/Vdara to the Aria and Monte Carlo saved us quite a bit of walking after the conference. When it came time to check out, we were graciously granted a late check-out of 1 p.m. (regular check out is noon). The bellman, again, was happy to store our bags until we needed to leave for the airport. Overall, the stay was top-notch luxury. I'll be hard pressed to stay anywhere else in Vegas again!

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: Penguin1950
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Vdara because it was non-smoking, and the bonus was that it was a beautiful NEW hotel located mid-strip, with a kitchen! We were treated wonderfully from arrival to departure, and anything we asked for was there pronto! Setting up the kitchen was a simple request for a kettle, cutlery, plates, cups, a pot and a pan, although we learned to wash and 'hide' the items in a drawer, or they were scooped up by the housekeeping staff. We had read a little about needing supplies and took very basic items, like a coffee cone and filters, but nearby stores (ABC, 7-11) had basic food items like cereal, yogurt, etc which made a quick breakfast for early risers. a 5 minute walk to the Bellagio and out onto the strip for all the noisy, smoky fun stuff, but it was really nice to come back to the peace and quiet, and nice-smelling Vdara. Just a little heavy on the air freshener...it was lovely but more is not always better :) The restaurant, Silk Road was open for breakfast and lunch, and while a little pricey, the food and service was FANTASTIC! I would go back to this hotel any time!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: jcallcutt
Reviews.Content: The Vdara isn't really an hotel in the traditional sense. It's more of an up market annexe to the Bellagio to which it is umbilically attached by a walkway. It doesn't have all the usual hotel facilities. Its Silk Road restaurant is in reality only a cafe which is open in the morning and early afternoon, no shops, no casino and a single small bar. Gone is the hustle, bustle excitement of a big Vegas hotel, in its place, quiet, stylish tranquility. We found what staff there were, to be helpful and courteous. The room was spacious, modern and beautifully appointed with stunning views over the new city centre architecture. Although well appointed some of the fitted furniture had taken a knock or two and the shower was not well designed or easy to control. Toiletries were insufficient and room service was not up to scratch. On one day we had to telephone housekeeping at 5.30pm to ask for our room to be made up - not good enough. It is not located on the strip; one reaches it by going through the Bellagio. However, we considered this an advantage. The Vdara by way of compensation offers calm, tranquillity and a chance to recharge the batteries. It is aimed at a more discriminating clientele than many of the other "in yer face" hotels but to hold onto this market, service needs to be ratcheted up a couple of notches. We will stay there again - in spite of its shortcomings we really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JMeee
Reviews.Content: We requested for a room facing the pool as I had read here that it would be quieter at night. We got a good view of the water fountain at Bellagio and the view of the strip as well. The good thing about Vdara is that it's pretty much located in the middle of the strip. However, there's not a lot of entertainment in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, too far away from strip.”
Reviews.Author: MagicalDream
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a beautiful new, nongaming, nonsmoking hotel connected to the Bellagio. The suite was large and clean with a kitchen, we had deluxe suite. The kitchen didn't come equipped with anything, not even drinking glases! We had to call down to housekeeping to get utensils and things to cook breakfast with. I've never had a kitchen not equipped before. We also had to call housekeeping for our robes that are "included with the room". Every time we turned around it seemed like we had to call housekeeping for something. The check-in people were nice but clueless. They couldn't help us with transportation or info on the city. The concierge was better but still directed us out to the Bellagio's bus stop when that stop had construction in front of it and was not in use. The in house restaurant was beautiful. U get a whole carafe of coffee to drink and you pay for it too, about $10.00. We had the 3 egg breakfast. My bill at the end was $60.00 for 2 breakfasts and a coffee and a tea. I liked the Vdara but I think I would stay on the strip next time I go to Las Vegas. We had to walk to the strip for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It's about a 15-20 min walk from Vdara to the strip through the Bellagio. The Paris Hotel was beautiful and right on the strip, I will be staying there next time.

Reviews.Title: “the Zen hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raxtuk6
Reviews.Content: Completely different from all the other hotels on the Strip. Quiet and relaxed, an oasis of normal. Had a corner suite...view spectacular. Room was almost too big. Meeting rooms are great; banquet food also upscale. Fitness Center nice. Bar has an outdoor area. Be advised restaurant is breakfast and lunch only...but Aria is 100 yards away for nite life.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: saavec
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel if you are travelling to Vegas for a special occasion. Very elegantly designed (Not a Disney sort of), classy atmosphere without the busy environment of the casinos but just 5 minutes walk from the Bellagio or Aria Hotel & Casinos. We chose a suit with panoramic view. We were asked on arrival which was the view of the city that we preferred to have. The receptionist suggested the Bellagio Fountains view. We were allocated then on the 52nd floor with a spectacular view over the Bellagio fountains, Eiffel Tower as well as the Strip’s most remarkable landmarks. The suite had a dinning area and a kitchenette. We ordered breakfast in room every day and we loved it. We didn’t want to go to another hotel for breakfast. The service was excellent; the staff in this hotel really goes to the extra mile. VIP treatment is the bottom line. We had an incredible stay and we were sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Great location but what up with checking it???”
Reviews.Author: IHEARTLA_4EVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my partner and her sister, we were given a corner suite on the 42nd floor facing the strip and the Bellagio fountains. Freaking amazing views!!! The room was very comfortable in size, having 3 people in there we didnt feel croweded at all. The pool area was very nice looking up at the hotel and the parking lot too, wasnt a make or break. Had some cocktails by the pool ($14 for cocktails) they did taste pretty good. I would recommend this place to someone who wants to experiance Vegas but doesnt need the hustle and bustle of gamblers and smokers. The only thing that let us down was checking in, we had pre paid everything before arriving and they kept on telling us that we needed to pay more, even though we had emails and receits showing that had paid evrything. I still loved it tho, and I would go back there anytime with hesitating.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat from the strip”
Reviews.Author: mom2oneOntario
Reviews.Content: Check- in was fast and we upgraded to a fountain view room. No more than 10 minutes. The room was spacious and clean. We didn't use the kitchen other than to store drinks in the VERY small fridge. Bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was a great size, the bathtub was nice and deep, great for the aches and pains from all the walking. The views on the fountain side were breathtaking, I would highly recommend getting this side of the hotel. The hotel was very quiet and smelled great, we never waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator. The lack of a casino and smoking were a welcome escape from the other hotels. The hotel is a bit inconvenient to get to from the strip, but the walk is pleasant and the tram is very close. Staff were friendly and helpful. We found it annoying that we had to request everything, robes, newpaper, water, glasses etc. A 5 star hotel should just include these amenities in the room. I would highly recommend this hotel to others, and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really a conventioneer's hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goober818
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at The Wynn or most recently at The Encore. With this being a five- star resort I expected a comparable property but found this hotel really focused on the business traveler. The rooms are spacious and decently appointed but are lackluster. The bathroom is amazing and stands up, or beats, properties of the same price level/star ratings. One odd thing is the lack of typical toiletries like cotton balls, shower caps,etc. I know it's and odd thing to mention but ut's worth noting you shouldnn't count on any toiletries other than shampoo/conditioner. I like the non-smoking property policy and the fact the hotel is an oasis of calm away from casinos but there isn't a sundries shop on the property and very limited food options (a breakfast/lunch only cafe and a bar).

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Strip location but quiet and low key”
Reviews.Author: CooterCat
Reviews.Content: Vdara is located in the City Center, a few steps from Aria and it's glitzy casino, and conveniently connected through a "back" walkway to Bellagio. This property is less like a hotel and more like residences. The decor is modern, and the spa influences are evident. The room (suite) had contemporary furnishings, a luxuriously appointed bathroom, and comfortable bed. The Aveda products, including the bath salts, added a special touch. The concierge staff was very helpful and took care to find great seats for the shows we requested. Check in and check out, and valet were all very efficient and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Upscale Hotel with Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ViajeNut
Reviews.Content: Vdara is one of the newest hotel resorts on the strip.It is a non-gaming facility. Its located in the citycenter development which is in the center of the strip. However, it is a bit recessed from the strip. To get to the strip, you must walk through Bellagio or walk around the driveway to Aria and through Aria. There still is some minor construction going on around the building on the street level. It does not impact the resort at all!!! It is a modern, boutique facility that has a Zen-like spa feel. All facilites are new and extremely well-designed. The rooms are very good size with kitchenettes and dining areas. But, they do not provide any utensils,cookware,etc....in the room. You must request it from the hotel. To me, it doesn't make sense why its not already in the room. My guess is that most people don't cook or eat in their rooms in Vegas. There is a beautiful pool, spa, and fitness area in the building. The restaurant is excellent and well-priced for the facility. The lobby bar is beautifully appointed and has a luxurious feel. Because it is so new you might think it's pricey but, that's not the case. It was competitively priced with the other hotels on the strip. I believe that is a sign of our economic times and that I visited during the low season. Vegas is still a great vacation destination with so many different options for dining,drinking, shopping, and gaming. Vdara is a great new alternative to the mainstays on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara--basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexTraveling
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Vdara: Pros: good location right in the middle of City Center (Located between the Bellagio and Aria, which are within easy walking distance), quiet, non-smoking, all suite, very sleek, helpful concierge Good for you if you do not care about gambling and just want a nice, well located hotel Cons: no restaurant (there is a coffee bar where you can eat breakfast), only one small bar, no gambling, rooms were nice but had no ipod dock, no robes, and no coffee maker (they do have a Bosch microwave??), small pool area. If you want to stay where there is more action, the Aria in the same complex is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “This place is spectacular, especially the Vdara corner suites.”
Reviews.Author: SaMoTraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. The design was fantastic. We were able to book a corner suite at the same price as a regular suite. The corner suite was all-glass with great views in two directions. The bedroom had a huge bathroom, plus a kitchen, dining room, living room and powder room. The gym was small but fine. The pool was also smaller than other Vegas pools, but still very fun. Drinks in the bar was great. No casino, no smoking - so nice for Vegas. The only downside was that it is a long walk to the strip, through circuitous or awful routes.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of quiet away from the craziness of LV!”
Reviews.Author: Kiki2804
Reviews.Content: LV is a very busy city with the casinos and Stip - this is a little oasis away from all of that. The hotel does not have a casino, but there are plenty around all within a very short walking distance. The downside to no casino is that there is only one restaurant (which was closed for 2 out of the 3 nights that we were there) but again, there is a huge selection to choose from nearby. The rooms are spacious, clean and all still very new looking. The kitchen area is great, although there is no kitchenware - you have to contact housekeeping; we needed a corkscrew and thought that there would be an eternal wait, but no - within 5 minutes, it was in our room. There are no coffee facilities in the room - which was disappointing. A great thing is having a real hairdryer - none of these tiny things that really generate more noise than wind or heat. The pool area is quiet and relaxing - good selection of loungers and daybeds. It was disappointing to have the pool close at 4pm, especially since it was still warm and light, but the hotel had just changed its hours, so I suppose that we were just lucky with the weather!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible first stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: asdcc
Reviews.Content: The Vdara was absolutely incredible. The rooms were breathtaking and the hotel was a nice change from the wild Vegas lifestyle. A quick cab ride and you were back in the craziness of it all. But it was nice to come back to a more mature and spa like hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great new, modern, quiet hotel with no casino!”
Reviews.Author: CharmedNederland
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because it was new and the reviews are quite good, also because we wanted a quiet hotel, because I don't sleep well when not at home or because of jetlag. We really liked that all rooms in this hotel are suites. The decoration was very modern and we loved this style. This was our first time to Vegas and as some other reviews say, the room isn't too big, but we thought it was big enough and just like the pictures we saw on the Vdara website. Not all amenities are in the room, but when needed, you can call housekeeping, like we did, we like to use slippers. The Aveda bathroom amenities were plenty, we had more than we needed. We had a great view looking north on the 46th floor, so we saw the Bellagio fountains too. The staff were pleasant and helpfull, the concierge service is great, especially Louis, who helped every customer with loads of patience. On our first day we went up to the pool area, did some sunbathing and had our lunch there. We never had any other meals in the hotel as there are loads of other choices nearby. We've expected to spend money, cuz it's Vegas! But there are choices enough between cheap and expensive. There is a bridge which connect the Vdara to the Bellagio, just a 5 minute walk, the Aria is accross the street from the hotel. From the Aria you can get to Crystals shopping mall. The hotel is actually really close to the strip, except that at this moment they are working on the streets, so it's all broken, you could walk passed the adjacent Cosmopolitan hotel (which isn't open yet), but it's difficult to walk to the strip directly. It would be better when that work is all done. You can get to The Strip through Bellagio or Aria and Crystals. If you then cross the street you're at Planet Hollywood. It was also easy enough to get a cab, you never had to wait long, we rented a car one day through the concierge, which was also good. We've booked the room through the Vdara website, we found a great deal online, cheaper than Booking.com. So if we'd find this kind of deal again in the future, we would stay at the Vdara again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for quiet visit”
Reviews.Author: bcdtortola
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Vdara with other collegues. Nice quiet change of pace in Vegas but extremely close to Aria and Bellagio if you want the action. Rooms were comfortable; bed was amazing. Housekeeping was very good in my room. The lighting in the room and bathroom was not good. The only room lightswitches were near the hallway to the front door, not near the bed. Had to get out of bed to turn off room lights. Shower water pressure was not good either. Front desk was very accomdating when I wanted to change rooms due to poor view. Warning, if you want to see anything at all, you must request a high floor. Heatlh club was immaculate and the staff there was wonderful, providing water bottles and fresh towels. Bar staff at pool bar and lobby bar were fantastic also.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful getaway on the strip”
Reviews.Author: NKS50
Reviews.Content: While visiting family in Las Vegas, as per ususal my wife and I tried out a new hotel for a night. It's a little tricky finding the entrance to the Vdara, but it's a beautiful, modern and peaceful place to stay away from the craziness and crowds on the strip, yet oh so close with the walkway over to the Bellagio. Very attractive room--we had one on the 48th floor with a spectacular view of the strip, the mountains and the city. Staff at the front and concierge desks were helpful when needed. Only two criticisms: the scented air in the lobby area was a bit much for us, and on the side of the bed closest to the bathroom there's no electrical outlet. I need to use a CPAP (breathing machine) because of sleep apnea, and we had to run an extension cord along the headboard under the pillows so I could plug it in. Enjoyed the deep soaking tub, and the sliding door to the bathroom has translucent glass which was pretty cool. You really do need to get out and about to find meals, but that's not really a problem. When in Vegas we like to get out and explore anyway. If you want a nice calm quiet spot on the Strip, this is a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: travel_allsn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara in their Penthouse suite. It was a nice room with a great view. The whole living and dining area was just windows to see all over Vegas. The hotel is brand new so everything is modern and up to date.Our group wished the room had a sound system to play music but it was not a big deal. Vdara has a bridge to the Bellagio that is the quickest way to get to the strip, otherwise its kinda a long walk down city center to get to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ocheart
Reviews.Content: We love it. It's very modern & clean! The location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2010_10
Reviews.Content: For $150 per night, this must be the best value on the strip. I booked a Vdara suite. It was about 970sqft, very well appointed and had a clean and new kitchen. The views are wonderful and the people are very friendly and attentive for a Las Vegas hotel. The pool is also new and nice and very inviting. The Silk Road restaurant needs more variety but the lobby bar is wonderfully hooker free and inviting. Easy walk, even 115 degree heat to both Aria and Bellagio if you are looking for entertainment. CityCenter, well that remains to be seen. Harmon is still in the works, the mall is unremarkable and I'm sorry to say that most of the food is overpriced and not very good. A $16 dollar beer at Todd Englishes pub, not to mention a $25 burger that was meh. CityCenter plays at what Wynn does for real. I imagine that if CityCenter is ever going to turn a long term profit, there will need to be major changes, something that makes it stand apart. Vdara though is a major win....for now.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel on the strip...but”
Reviews.Author: dspurs21
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas 3 times in the past 14 months, and several times before that...Vdara is by far the best hotel I've stayed in to include all the other 5 stars on the main strip. The spa was by far the nicest i've been in as well...best massage i've ever had, make sure you ask for Jessie! The massage was so good the first day, I had to go two days later and try the 4 hand massage...phenomenal! We stayed in a suite overlooking the Belagio fountains...it was fantastic. From the moment you walk in and smell the aroma...you will fall in love. The only negatives (for some) I observed was lack of "in-hotel" partying and gambling...however it's only a 3 minute walk to the Aria and Belagio which are both connected. They need more concierge as well. Regardless of the fact it's $40-50 cheaper than other all suite 5 star hotels, this place outclasses them all...I'm all about going out all night and coming back to a clean and quite enviornment which is what Vdara offered.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, trendy and got a great deal”
Reviews.Author: ScottTravellingScott
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go to Vegas for the night from LA and wanted to stay at a 5 star hotel! We decided to wait to the last minute and book a hotel on hotwire which gives you great deals! When booking you dont know the name of the hotel, just the location and number of stars! Once we booked we found out it was the Vdara! $90 for the night inc taxes etc! Wow so beautiful inside! We booked a room for 2 with 3 of us going. Luckily the couch folded out into another bed so we were fine! Good sized room, great bathroom! Stand alone bath! Could plug ipod into the media system and listen to our own songs! Free wifi! We didnt use any of the amenities like the pool or anything! The hotel itself didnt have a casino, but it is located right behind the Belagio and you can walk straight through to get to the strip! Only down point was we asked for a sewing kit at midnight and had to chase it twice and it never arrived so I have given a low rating for service. No breakfast inc in our deal but we just went for all you can eat lunch once we checked out. Everything else with the hotel was fantastic! There are so many hotels on the strip you could stay at. I have stayed at the Venitian before and that is better, but I cant rem what I paid for that! This was a bargain deal! Defo reccommend staying here! Super nice!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some issues”
Reviews.Author: Simonalex
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vdara for 3 nights in October. Hotel is very good, view is the best I had in Vegas (39 floor to Bellagio fountains). Room is perfect, bed is the best. The main problem: Vdara supposed to be hotel and spa. The real spa is absent. Yes, the pool is here, but small and uninviting. In real "hotel and spa" there are no charges for using the spa facilities, only for extra services. We had know that the simple entrance to the spa cost $25, but I had not idea of what is inside (there are no good pictures on the website). So my wife decided just to come by and check before pay. And what? She was not even allowed to get inside! Pay first! So I went downstairs and checked the man's side (yes, there are 2 separate facilities). For a change, attendant on a man's side let me see it. What a jock! Nice finishes, a lot of lockers, but one small pool with running water, small sauna and steam room. And that's it! The rest is a private massage rooms. I really suggest the people who runs that 5-star hotel and spa to see real spa (I suggest Kempinsky Hotel in St, Moritz, and spa is free there). Some other small problems: business center is close later in the day, hotel does not have dinner facilities (it was actually a plus for me - there are many good food options in Bellagio and Aria). And last: we had a very late flight, so we asked the front desk if we could stay in the room a little bit late. Usually Hotel would allow you to stay a couple of extra hours free of charge if there are not a lot of people in the hotel. Not here - they asked me to pay an extra $149 for up to 5 hours (from 1pm to 6pm) and that was more then daily rate I paid for the room. I refused. Also, the resort fee I paid at check-out supposed to be tax-free (according to Orbitz, where I booked the hotel), but I was charged a 12% tax on that fee anyway. i did show the reservation letter from Orbitz, but it did not help. Overall, a nice hotel in amazing City Center, but not a Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara a great base for Las Vegas break”
Reviews.Author: berniej
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 nights at the Vdara on a Virgin Holiday from the UK. This package included all resort fees so no $15 per day charge on our account. On arrival our booking request for a high floor was honoured with a room on the 51st floor with views of the Bellagio fountains and to the Rio / Palm hotels with mountains behind. No check in queues (lines) seen at any time in our stay, and we checked out through the in room TV facility. The staff were all friendly and the concierge knowledgeable and helpful. We had the smallest Delux Suite at some 580 sq ft but this was more than adequate with two 42 inch TVs a good size bathroom with separate shower and small kitchenette. Agree with previous reviewers that the plug in the bath is badly positioned as it has a knob on it to lift for drainage which could be painful if you relax too much! There is a separate shower head attachment for rinsing hair. Water pressure for filling the bath was good it filled in a few minutes with steaming hot water. The shower pressure was lower but still good, but not to power shower ratings. Good supply of Aveda products except foam bath - shampoo did the job! The kitchen equipment was delivered upon request the first night along with bathrobes and slippers. There are now cards in the room reminding guests that these are available on request as well as advice on requesting bed linen and towel changes - daily if you wish. Take a travel kettle and your own coffee and tea. Supermarkets nearby provided milk, cereal, bread, butter, fruit juice, eggs etc to make our own breakfast. We used ABC and Walgreens. Housekeeping took away the dirty pans, dishes and cutlery and replaced with clean each day. The fridge is small but held two one litre bottles of water along with the provisions above simply by taking out one glass shelf. Housekeeping provided at least two small bottles of water each day and we picked up more at the health club on a few ocassions. Lighting, blinds and housekeeping controls are not difficult, however we agree that some of the switch positioning could have been better thought through. The hotel works well if you consider it as a "tower" of either the Bellagio or the Aria without the noise, smoke and number of people. Both these hotels offer excellent facilities including buffets and other restaurants within 5 to 10 minutes of your room. There are multiple ways to walk to the Strip depending on which direction you wish to go, through Bellagio, or via the tram at Bellagio to Monte Carlo, through the Aria / Crystals, or now simply out through the main entrance and turn left down stairs onto Harmon Ave . We didn't use the health club, pool used twice - slightly longer opening hours would be good - 9am to 6pm probably of little use to business guests. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel either. We spent our vacation walking everywhere to shows and viewing the hotels up and down the Strip and used the Deuce buses for Fremont Street and Outlet Shopping mall. The central position of the City Centre complex suited our plans perfectly. The absence of a casino did not bother us and both the Bellagio and Aria have excellent facilities if this is your main purpose for visiting. Recommend The Unofficial Guide to Las Vegas by Bob Sehlinger for those new to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: NYOutnabout
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Halloween weekend, the hotel room was PERFECT, and the entire staff always attentive with a smile!! Ashley at the conceirge desk was extremely helpful!!!
