The location is PERFECT!! Just a couple of minor issues - Housekeeping knocking at 10am for service, missing turndown service more then once, and finally my jacket got filthy in the DUSTY closet! Otherwise, I LOVED IT, and I would definetly recommend it to family and friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & relaxing”
Reviews.Author: JimHarris
Reviews.Content: We mainly went to see the Liberace Museum before it closed. Not having been in Las Vegas since 1982 we talked to friends who stayed at hotels with casinos attached. Our travel agent suggested the Vadara as we like a lower key experience over the glitz when we travel. A lovely surprise; from our late check in after midnight (lovely 3 hour delay at YVR) an upgrade to a deluxe suite. The controls for the interactive curtains and lights a bit of a challenge but what a view, we were on the south end on the 40th floor.. The beds are great; you do have to order your housekeeping utensils, they bring them quickly. Nice coffee maker, fridge, microwave, stove. And quiet!!!, Two flat panel TVs. Very close to "Miracle Mile" for inexpensive meals and of course hi end dining everywhere. Stayed four nights and loved every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KonaLucy
Reviews.Content: We arrived around midnight and checked in very quickly...were upgraded to a suite. The suite was enormous!!!!! We had a coffee maker (Keurig)although housekeeping did not leave coffee to be able to make coffee daily. Also had to call housekeeping for utensils as only 4 coffee cups were in the cabinets. That was a bit aggravating. The bathroom was huge - separate vanity section-lighing in the mirror, very nice touch! The bed was the best I have ever slept in....wanted to take it home! The scent in the lobby as you walk in is so refreshing after sniffing up all the smoke from casinos.. and the walk to Bellagio was not at all long. The tram that connects to Aria and Monte Carlo was free and really convenient. We loved Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the Vdara”
Reviews.Author: IowaBoy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Vdara in late October. The hotel's biggest drawback for us was its location. Although only two blocks off the Strip, it seems further. Driving there requires following a confusing, circular drive that it shares with its sister properties nearby. Walking there from the Strip is difficult right now, depending on your desired direction, as there is major sidewalk construction that requires long detours. There is an indoor connection to the Bellagio, which is nice, but very long, which again accentuates the feeling of remoteness. I suppose this could also be viewed as a positive, as you completely get away from the noise and craziness of the Strip, and there is no loud, smoky casino to deal with. The hotel has inexplicably removed coffee makers from the rooms - they are available by request. Despite having a kitchenette, no utensils were provided - you had to request them too. We requested neither, as our stay was quite short, but we wondered why they weren't available - we stayed at the Trump a few days earlier and every possible amenity was provided. Our room also had a serious hot water problem - you had to leave the shower on five minutes or more before getting in. We hated wasting water since it is so precious out here. But the hotel has many, many positives, starting with the enthusiastic valet and desk staff that greeted us. We were accommodated on the 24th floor with killer views of the Strip and, in particular, the Bellagio Fountains next door. Everything was new and very clean. The elevators were ample and fast. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, the Silk Road. Although it was tasty, portions were small and fairly expensive for the amount received. The remote control drapes were a nice touch and did a good job of shutting out the glare from the Strip. We would stay at the Vdara again, and would recommend it to others, depending on what type of Vegas experience they were looking for. Note that the Vdara, like many other Vegas hotels, charges a daily resort fee. Valet service for your rental car and high speed internet are included in the fee.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DasBahnstormer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely loved the Vdara - a really good hotel and refreshingly different to the casino resorts in Las Vegas. The Vdara offers comfort and refinement and, as a non-casino hotel, came across as being solely focused on making sure it's guessed had an enjoyable stay rather than channelling them towards a casino. The concierge desk was very helpful and knowledgeable and the hotel's gym is good too. The casinos in the Aria and the Bellagio are only 1 minute's walk from the Vdara so you are still able to easily access the usual Vegas activities but also have the benefit of being able to get away from the gambling scene when you want to at this peaceful hotel. When in Vegas we can also recommend - the Lemon Tree Thai restaurant (in the Aria), the Atomic Testing Museum, the vintage car museum (in the Imperial), the Porsche Design shop (in Crystals) - lovely friendly staff, the Hard Rock Cafe on the strip (which displays Paul Stanley's Gibson Moderne!!!!) and Cabo Wabo (Sammy Hagar's bar on the strip).

Reviews.Title: “Definately one of the nicest rooms yet.”
Reviews.Author: danandchenae
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at the Vdara for my anniversary, and I really had no idea what to expect. My in-laws live in Vegas, and one even works for the Harrah's empire, but they did not know what to expect either. When we arrived, we were greeted warmly, and immediately noticed the great architecture and design cues of the lobby. This IS NOT your typical Vegas resort with thousands of slot machines and people on oxygen gambling their social security checks away. This is an all non smoking resort, and there is no casino in it which we loved. You are steps away from all that, with walkways connecting you to the Bellagio. The room was absolutely awesome, with TWO flat screen HDTV's, and a bathroom the size of my first apartment with a romantic soaker tub. There is also a kitchenette, but I recommend not bringing leftovers back as the fridge only fit the smallest of items (smaller than a dorm room fridge!) The view we had of the Bellagio fountains made the nighttime spectacular! We had a view of the entire strip. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to you too.....just bring good shoes, the strip is a good 8-10 minute walk one way, but that did not bother us a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Smoke-free Spa Hotel a Great Vegas Getaway”
Reviews.Author: singingredhead
Reviews.Content: We picked the Vdara for a number of reasons, it was the only smoke and casino-free hotel on the strip and we knew we'd want to get away from both. It was in a great location, with a connecting walkway to the Bellagio for shopping, the buffet and the fountains. It is across the street from the Aria and shopping at City Center, where you can find gambling if you want to. We also chose the Vdara because the price was very reasonable and they offered a $50 resort credit, which could be used at the spa, pool, bar, you name it. We were upgraded to a larger suite than we had booked, on the 19th floor, upon checking in. We stayed through the week, Tuesday-Friday morning, so I think that helped us on a room upgrade and the price. The room was amazing. 260 degree views! It was like a condo, complete kitchen, two bathrooms, plush linens, a huge soaking tub looking out over the pool area, a gigantic shower with a bench and huge glass door. Everything was very spa-like, contemporary and trendy feeling. The bed was comfortable. They had automatic blinds and blackouts, so it got very dark when you were ready to sleep. The spa experience is not to be missed. If you don't take advantage of their beautiful spa while here you are missing out! We had facials and they were GREAT, but just the spa amenities alone would've been enjoyable. A huge jacuzzi, steamroom and dry sauna, heated lounge chairs, cozy robes. Teas, snacks and anything you need to get ready when you're done, even a hair straightener ladies! They don't have much for dining, which is really the only downside, however, we had so many places we wanted to try around the strip that we hadn't really planned to eat here anyway. We did get breakfast at the Vdara one morning. The french toast was very good, but the menu is small. The pool is small, but lovely. Lots of nice chairs and large towels. A large jacuzzi poolside as well. The smell was divine. I kept smelling the same thing every time we came in the doors and I had to ask what it was. They said they pump a signature scent of fig throughout the lobby area. I wish I could've bottled it. The staff told me every hotel has their own signature scent, and sure enough, you could tell... At the Aria across the street it smelled like some kind of vanilla scented something. It doesn't pump up to the floors or rooms, just the lobby, but I wish it was throughout. I could see that some people might be sensitive to the smells the hotels pump out, but it beats cigarette smoke! The concierge staff was superb and very helpful. They treated us like VIP's and met every need, request and question promptly. There were long delays a few nights to get through by phone, however. The cleaning staff were so attentive. They come late morning and early evening. Twice a day! I really loved the bath salts left by the tub and asked for more each time they came. They were exceptionally attentive and left our room spotless each day. I would highly recommend the Vdara! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing change to the busy casino hotels”
Reviews.Author: SouthwesternNative
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at the Vdara! We tried to get into Aria but there was no availability so we had to opt for the Vdara which, at the time was disappointing but what a great surprise! The lobby was quiet, the rooms were very nice (comparable to Venetian) and the service was excellent! Having no casino in the hotel made us feel like we were miles from the action but as soon as you step out of the elevator it is a 2 minute walk to the Bellagio and about the same to the Aria so you are not missing any gaming opportunity. We didn't try any of the dining, it seemed small and uneventful. We did however order room service for breakfast which I felt was below average and way overpriced. But there is no shortage of great dining on the strip so we weren't missing anything. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Vdara is peaceful and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Poodle_Mommy
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is quiet and extremely comfortable and if you get a north view, it is spectacular. The beds were extremely comfortable. When we left in the morning, we would turn on the light requesting maid service and the room was always ready when we returned. The staff was very eager to please and treated us with kindness and respect. The location will be improved once the Cosmopolitan in front of it is done, because of this construction, there is no direct route to the Strip. You have to go through either the Bellagio or Aria. Neither is a quick walk, and it can be exhausting after a long day walking the strip. That would not prevent me from staying here again. I loved it...prior to this the Bellagio was my favorite.. I don't think you can really go wrong staying here. The one negative I would say is that the only restaurant closes at 2:30PM....which surprised me. But we walked over to the Aria and had no trouble finding a place to eat. Not a deal breaker at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Vdara”
Reviews.Author: ejb4499
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara from October 9th to October 15th 2010. Room # 16-032 This was my 4th trip to Las Vegas and the first with my wife. We were also travelling with Vegas first timer friends. The Vdara met all of our expectations and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Let me begin by saying that we chose this hotel for 2 reasons: it was smoke-free and had kitchen facilities. The check-in process was quick and efficient (no more than 10 minutes from entering the door and getting to our room - we arrived at 2:00 PM). The front desk clerk asked us immediately if we needed any dishes, etc and they were delivered within 1/2 hour. The rooms were more than adequate in terms of cleanliness, size and decor. It was just such a welcoming and relaxing place to come home to after a long Vegas day walking the Strip. I have to agree with all the previous reviews that state this was the most comfortable bed they've ever slept in in a hotel. Both the bed, linens and pillows are fantastic. It beat our bed at home no problem!! We were about mid-way up and had a view of the Rio and Palms as well as a blocked view of the mountains. And yes, the window shades and curtain are electronic and cool to play with! We were in Vegas for both fun and relaxation, so we used the pool facilities two full days. We rented a cabana for both days, and were treated like royalty. True it may be a little expensive to rent, but we practically had the entire cabana area to ourselves, including a plunge pool to ourselves. I would absolutely like to point out the excellent service we received from Katie the cabana hostess - she was absolutely amazing and really made the cabana rental worthwhile - in fact she's the reason we decided to rent the second time. We were out in the sun all day, and it was not unreasonably hot. We ordered room service numerous times during the trip (both in-room and at the pool cabana) and the service was always quick (within 1/2 hour) and professional. The in-room service even had the kitchen table all set for a romantic meal (even though it was just burger and fries!). There were only two minor issues during our stay - 1) Telephone in the room was not working for outbound calls - took a few days to fix and 2) They take away dirty dishes but do not replace them. Very minor issues that would not prevent us from staying there again. The location is somewhat away from the strip, but it's not an interminable walk, and Bellagio and Aria are minutes away. We did not try Silk Road or the lobby bar. All in all it was a fantastic trip and a great place to stay. The Vdara will be on my list of choices for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “best yet”
Reviews.Author: heel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Encore, Belligio, MGM, Harrahs, NYNY, Treas Island.. This was our best experience at hotel yet. Suites, nonsmoking, clean, modern, not a cluster of people. I highly recommend nonsmoking resorts. Gaming , smoking is just next door so you are right in the middle of it. The belligio has best health club on the strip and it next door with connections.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: TruFNP
Reviews.Content: I cannot rave enough about this hotel... a rare gem in Vegas!! This was my first time visiting Vegas, and I went for a conference. My conference was at the Planet Hollywood, so my walk over was about 15 minutes every day. I'm not the gambling type, so when I booked my stay, I wanted a hotel that was calm and relaxing, and boy, did the Vdara deliver!! Check in was a breeze. I checked in at 11AM, and A.J. gave me a complimentary upgrade to a Lake View room. Staff was very accommodating. My room was clean, spacious, and very tranquil. There was only one night I was awoken by drunk people in the hallway, but other than that, I didn't hear any of my neighbors. Housekeeping gave me 2 free water bottles every day, so long as I hit the "housekeeping" button on my way out the door. I arranged turn down service one night, and housekeeping provided me plush slippers & robes. Nice touch! Pool was relaxing and QUIET. No annoying children---YESSS!! Didn't experience the "death glare". Gym was also nice, but only worked out one day. They also provided free water bottles. Eat at Koi at Planet Hollywood -- Every weeknight 1/2 price happy hour from 5-7pm. VERY GOOD SUSHI. Union at Aria also featured a similar half price happy hour, but service lacked. ALL IN ALL - Vdara was an excellent, PEACEFUL hotel. If you're looking for a relaxing, high end hotel, you should definitely check out Vdara. The walk to the Bellagio casino is less than 5 minutes if you want to gamble. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquillity in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cdwc
Reviews.Content: Room The room was spacious, contemporary and luxurious. The huge window provided a spectacular view over Vegas whether day or night (our rooms was 41st floor looking towards Mandalay Bay). The bed was extremely comfortable with sumptuous linens and a good selection of pillows. The kitchen was beautifully designed and very good quality. The bathroom was spacious and contemporary with luxury fixtures. Service All staff were extremely professional. Facilities The hotel pool area was very nice with a quite spacious pool that was not too busy. The hotel bar was nice and cosy with a good selection of cocktails. A great place to sit back and people-watch. There are plenty of lifts and they are extremely fast but smooth. The hotel is smoke-free and non-gaming so it feels beautifully peaceful and tranquil compared to most hotels in Vegas. Location The hotel is located in a great spot with easy access to neighbouring Aria and Crystal mall. It is also very short walk to the rest of the strip but has the benefit of being set-back a little so is much quieter than the on-strip hotels. There is also a pedestrian route directly from the hotel into and through Bellagio. Negatives There is no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Although the kitchen was very nice, it is not provided with any kitchenware but this was made available upon request. It seemed that whilst every suite has a kitchen, the hotel management was trying to persuade you not to use it but to use their restaurant instead. There were too many sunbeds by the swimming pool so it felt a little cluttered and claustrophobic. It would be nice to have fewer sunbeds and a little more space between them. Also, due to the tall buildings surrounding the pool, it was only in the sun for a few hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmithBride
Reviews.Content: Everything was just great, will definitely recommend this to my family and friends. And will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to rest youe head after a day on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: STWINS
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas with my adult children to celebrate my daughter's birthday. I chose the Vdara based on tripadvisor's reviews. There is a $15 day resort charge. If I hadn"t read on trip advisor what amenities were included in the resort fee--I wouldn't have received any of them. I had to call the front desk for the 2 bottles of water, spa robes, cooking utensils, and for the sofa bed to be made up. The news papers are located at the front desk. I also had to call for the sheets to be changed on the bed. I stayed there for five nights. There was a tv in the living and sleeping areas. The entire suite was spacious living room area was separate from the sleeping area . There was a table and two chairs, fridge, microwave and stovetop. There is no coffeepot in the room. It is not a casino hotel but there are lots of casino hotels on the strip if that's what you're looking for... The Vdara is a great place to come to rest your head after a day out on the strip shopping, partying, gambling , sightseeing, and attending plays. The bedding is plush and the pillows are to die for .... The Vdara is located between the Aria and Bellagio. I suggest that you take your meals there as there is just a coffeeshop in the Vdara. The staff was very helpful in provding directions and suggesting eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay any place else in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: techtraveler67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is elegant, quiet and comfortable. The location in the City Center can't be beat. The value for your money is unbelievable. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite and it was so luxurious. We had two bathrooms and a full kitchen. There is a K cup machine for coffee. There are two wonderful flat screen tvs. One in the bedroom and the other in the living room. A nice dining room table is also included. The decor is stunning. The shades draw up with a push of a botton with a black out feature as well. The bathroom is huge with double sinks, wonderful towels and separate shower and tube. The only recommendation I would make is that there could be some extra plugs near the nightstand. The mirrors in he bathroom never steam up. The staff is wonderful, very attentive. Check in was a breeze. The hotel has a walk way to the Bellagio and the Aria hotel for those who enjoy the casino life but want to stay somewhere quiet and smoke free. There is an awesome pool, hot tub and spa area. A beautiful gym is also available. If I were to return, this is where I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for kids stay at Las vegas,”
Reviews.Author: leetaitai
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and reasonable price!! Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: kandtsa
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to stay here as my usual hotel - The Signature was booked. It has everything The Signature has, cooking facilities (minus all crockery, cutlery, pots and pans - you have to ask for them to be delivered to your room), king bed and slightly more modern rooms. However, it seems to lack a little heart and soul. The location is perfect - with a 3 min walk and you are in the foyer of the Bellagio. As I was travelling alone and was spending a lot of time in the Bellagio (I have stayed at the Bellagio before, but wouldnt stay again - small rooms and too crowded and expensive), I felt safe walking home at night on my own back to Vdara. Vdara was lovely, but I will happily head back to The Signature for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and smelled great!”
Reviews.Author: Vailprincess
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with this trip to Vdara this last weekend. Check-in was super easy and rooms were available even though we were a couple hours early. We drove so we valeted our car but didn't use it all weekend. There is no valet charge which is different from most hotels on the strip. We were aware of the $15 dollar resort charge which we were required to sign for as we checked in so there is no need to complain about it. The Aveda amenities were fantastic and the hotel was super quiet. To get in the room, you just waved the key card in front of the circle on the door and it unlocked, kinda cool. Also, the mini bar was on a pressure system just like in the movie "The Hangover", which my husband didn't think existed :) Just don't move the pretzels because they're super light and you will end up having to ask the front desk to take the charge off your bill. The Aria casino is super close and smells delicious. Not only do you walk in front of Jean Phillipe dessert shop but the casino has esscentual oils pumped in that you smell as you walk in the door. The casino is fairly smoke free and they have smoke free craps tables. All in all, this was a great experience and we will definitely go back to Vdara!

Reviews.Title: “I really hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: turtle222
Reviews.Content: First the bad. No coffee maker in the room?? If there were a coffee shop in the lobby, I could live with that, but never one time in six days did I see the hotel restaurant open. The pool staff was a bit on the snooty side, I did not return. No electric outlets by the bed. Light switches not logical. No news paper with the resort fee? The Good. I had a premium view room, in six years of trips to Vegas this was the best view hands down. My friend visiting from the MGM Signature said this is THE room he will book on his next trip. Housekeeping was great, much better than Planet Hollywood, and they didn’t steal my stuff like at Excaliber. I notice people like to compare Vdara to hotels like the Wynn. I don't think that is fair when you consider it costs much less to stay at the Vdara. The same goes for strip access. You can get to the action of the strip much faster from Vdara than a place like the Wynn. However, a map supplied by the front desk on routes to the strip would be helpful for the first day. I loved my room and hated to leave. I would return in a heartbeat if the price is still competitive.

Reviews.Title: “City Center Contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyenurse
Reviews.Content: We chose the Vadara after reading the favorable reviews. For the most part it lived up to our expectations. The check-in experiece was efficient and fast. We arrived early, but rooms were available. The room we were assigned was a disappointment, as there was no partial divider between the bed and sofabed, like our friends had in their room. We called the front desk and they volunteered to move us to the room we desired. They sent a bellhop to assist us within a few minutes. The 2nd room was just as we wanted. The room was very clean, unlike our friends who had a shower floor that was quite dirty. They requested it be cleaned several times, but nothing was done. It also took two days of complaining to get someone to plug in one of the TV's (inaccessible plug) and repair a reading lamp. The bedding was very luxurious and comfortable. There are two large screen HD TV's on either side of the room divider. A desk with wi-fi hookup is available at no extra charge. Of course there is a $15.00 daily service charge which is also taxed. The bath is large and well equiped with plenty of plush towels, and notions. There is a kitchen area with a microwave/convection oven, two burner stove and small refrigerator and sink. BUT, there are no dishes or tableware, evidently they are available upon request. The biggest disappointment was no coffeepot. If I stayed there again, I would bring one, or buy one and throw it away when done. It would be much cheaper and more convenient than paying the $3.50 per small cup of coffee in the coffee shop. The coffee shop and small restaurant closes at 2pm. I went to the business center to print out our boarding passes and the pleasant lady at the counter volunteered to do it for me. This was accomplished in only a few minutes. The Vdara is connected to the Bellagio by a short walkway. Access to the tram is very convenient. The hotel is quiet, since there is no casino, and totally smoke free. Overall, it was a very nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Iamirish
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Vdara. It was very quiet. We booked a Vdara suite and it was just what we expected. The walk to the strip was very easy, right through the Bellazio. We did not dine at the Vdara, not much selection there. We loved the Bellazio especially the Prime Steak House. Check-in and out was quick and efficient, no long line ups like the Bellazio. It is great to stay in a non smoking hotel expecially in Vegas. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: KelseyJSeattle
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Vdara. Came here for a business trip with one other coworker and it went well. The hotel itself is fantastic, clean, very modern, quiet, non smoking... the staff was great too. The one and only complaint i have is that they scent their lobby heavily. I normally do not care about smells. I’m not a sensitive person but it was so perfumed i could taste it in my mouth a few times (like soap) and it drove me nuts! (if it wasn’t so strong it would get an easy 5 stars) It’s a brand new non smoking hotel....why scent it?? Getting passed that...the rooms were huge, bathrooms great, the free internet was pretty darn fast, quick access to Cabs and also to the strip via Bellagio. I would stay here again even with the smell...hopefully they tone it down a little. I have already recommended it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Some good things and more not-so good things about Vdara”
Reviews.Author: Harolyn007
Reviews.Content: The Good: -Nice Valet/Door Men -Non-Smoking -Semi-Spacious Rooms -Super comfy bed -Beautiful towels and sheets.... must be Egyptian cotton, 1000 count or something. The Not-So Good: -No robes or house slippers -Housekeeping did not clean well (hair on floor, barf left over on the toilet from a previous guest, clogged sink with a glass placed in the sink hole, in the kitchen with murky white water - yuck!) -Front desk - there was always a line. They have no stancions, so you just make up your own line and stand there. Then one of the front desk agents comes out from her cave when the line gets pretty deep and guides you to stand in a certain line waiting for an open agent. The problem with this is, someone who was in the back of me, 4 deep was helped before me, because I was standing in a line that did not move. Urgh..... I was getting pissed at this point. -The room is spacious, but does not compare to the feel of the Palazzo or Venetian. Different class/decor. -Limited counterspace in bathroom. Hardly enough room for 2 persons to place all of their toiletries down. I know I have a lot of stuff, but very small countertop area. -Dead Bar/Lobby You would think if you had no casino, you would have an attractive lobby bar to give your guests a reason to drink at your bar.... ah, no. No entertainment during the 5 days we were there. Sad, dead and no reason to drink at the bar. -Smelly Lobby - I did not like the scent. Much too perfumy.... a clean scent would have been nicer. So the question is, would I stay here again? Probably not. We spent all of our time at the Aria and ate all of our meals there, except for one evening, when we had dinner at Joel Robochon at the MGM. For $159.00 including the $15 resort fee, you can probably find another hotel that will give you more love.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay overall, needs some improvements/not a good pool”
Reviews.Author: ropqsr
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband @ VDara for 5 days; our first trip to Vegas. I had a conference on the South End of the strip during our stay. We tried to find a five start hotel that was within walking distance to the conference when booking. We were attracted to the non-gaming, non-smoking Vdara as I can't stand the smell of smoke-filled casinos. The hotel itself is very nice with many positives. It is easy to get to the strip from the covered walkway over to the Bellagio. (If you think it's too far as others have written... you must never walk anywhere) The rooms were modern, new, clean and the bed is great. It was smaller than I pictured however from the website. We were on the 30th floor with a view of the pool and mountains. I think that all 5 star hotels should have a double sink as a basic standard. Our room did not. The soaking tub was nice and fit both my husband and I with ease. Plenty of aveda products too. The gym was also nice and well-equipped. The kichen is pointless in my opinion (other than having a fridge)... It is evident that VDara was clearly designed as a condo initially then converted to a hotel when the market crashed and the developer knew the units wouldn't sell. We knew not to expect any kitchen supplies from previous reviews (we didn't intend to cook anyhow), but there wasn't even a coffee maker. After calling to request one we were told this wasn't possible (really?....ugh) When you have a hangover, nobody wants to go all the way to the restuarant in the lobby and pay for a cup. We did go down to the pool a few days. My husband and I travel often and have stayed at many resorts with amazing pools. If the pool is important to you, don't stay here. The pool is a very sterile atmosphere with absolutely no shade or greenery. We planned to book a cabana but after seeing them are glad we didn't. VERY basic with uncomfortable looking futon couches. We enjoyed many cocktails by the pool and the waitresses were all great (can't say the same for the arrogant guy at the bar who told us rather rudely at 4:30PM that they were no longer serving food). The food coming out did look good though/ wish we had ordered something earlier. Beware of the wind at the pool. We were almost decapitated by the umbrella that fell down on top of us as were several other hotel guests... It was about 80 and sunny so perfect pool weather. Not hot enough to experience the "Vdara Death Ray". We did a TON of stuff while in Vegas, shows, shops, restaurants etc.. and all in all found Vdara to be a great place to come back to at the end of a long day/night. It was quiet and just what we needed. The bed was wonderful. If we were to return however, I would stay at another hotel; a true five star ie/ Encore of the Wynn. Recommendations to the hotel For IMPROVEMENTS: * Put coffee makers in ALL rooms (this is standard in even 3 star hotels). * Add some landscaping/ greenery to the pool/ make it more Vegas and inviting *Invest in umbrellas that are up all the time (instead of having to request the pool staff to put one up for you) and are sturdy enough to not fall on top of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas has better to offer”
Reviews.Author: shrop
Reviews.Content: There's a lot said about this new hotel so these are my personal opinions having prevoiously stayed in numerous other resorts in Vegas over the years. True this is a hotel without a casino, it's also non smoking and slightly away from the strip but easy walking distance (I can't believe anyone can say otherwise) through Bellagio or City Center. It's also true that the valet service is excellent and the smell in the lobby is nice. So the not so good, this is a new hotel, however, there are already signs of wear in some places, both public places and within rooms, this hotel won't wear well at all unless it's maintained better than it is being. Rooms are not as good as the photographs portray, they look larger than they really are. Many things in our room weren't working, particularly the lighting with at least 4 not working correctly. What's the point of the kitchen without any utensils, at least cups and a coffee maker would go some way (you get that at the Signature) to making use of the kitchen, otherwise this is a totally wasted space. Bathroom is slightly odd by newer Vegas standards, hard to say why but you will know what I mean if you have been to many Vegas resorts how good the bathrooms usually are. Service is not brilliant, check in was OK but I had to return and then waited sometime even though it wasn't busy. We didn't eat in the restaurant, preferring to use the facilities of both Aria and other restaurants but to me it looked very clinical and unwelcoming. We only looked at the pool area as it was over 100 degrees every day it was too hot to sit out, especially with it's position and no shade but it also looked very small and cramped. So in all there are better places in Vegas, much better to be honest, it's good to try new properties but I'm glad we only stayed for 2 days before moving to a true 5 star Vegas resort at the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel overall, but it had a couple downfalls”
Reviews.Author: littleles412
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful hotel but it had a couple things that keep me from saying its perfect. It is very clean, the staff is very friendly, and the bed is the most awesome thing I have ever slept on. It's also nice and quiet because it's back from the strip and no casino. Cleanliness is the most important thing in our book and it definately got 5 stars there. It's location really isn't bad but they are currently doing construction on the quickest route out to the strip so for us it was a little longer. We were on the fence about the valet parking, it's nice to have someone get your car and bring it back but every other hotel has free self parking so it was a little annoying to have to essentially pay to park in tipping...but we would also probably never drive in Vegas again...They also have free wi-fi and we used it a ton! Now the downfalls, 1. The kitchen is a joke, the fridge is not even the size of half of a standard mini fridge! We made a point to say we wanted kitchen "stuff" upon arrival, because other reviewers said you had to ask, they brought up 2 bowls, 2 plates, and 2 napkins with a fork, spoon and knife...thats your kitchen stuff!? So much for being a usuable kitchen! 2. No coffeepot, and can't get one, we asked... but you can get really expensive coffee by room service of course. 3. You can't take your own drinks to the pool, now this might be standard in Vegas, I'm really not sure, but come on, I can walk down the street with my drink! Whether I would recommend this hotel or not to a friend would be based on what kind of person they are and what they are in Vegas for.

Reviews.Title: “Second trip - twice as nice”
Reviews.Author: shelnbay
Reviews.Content: Spent another two nights/three days at the Vdara Oct 10-12 and loved it just as much as the stay we had in June. The aroma in the lobby was just as welcoming and calming as it was the first time and the staff was as friendly and helpful as we remembered. We requested a high floor with a view of Aria and our wish was granted. The only thing I'm extremely disappointed in is that the amenities (robes, slippers, coffee maker, bathroom scale) have been removed and I'm sure it's because the patrons steal them and the hotel had no other choice but to remove them and provide them on request. The only thing I called for was a ladies robe and it was to my room within 5 minutes. Can't wait until there's a retail outlet for those, I will purchase one! And the pillows, I would spend a nice chunk of change on those. The hotel was much busier than it was last time we visited; word must have gotten out! We STILL never waited for and rarely shared an elevator or heard a sound out of any other patrons on our 35th floor hallway. My goal for this trip was to at least see everything at the hotel so I could level an opinion about it; still managed to miss Bar Vdara and the spa :( We had breakfast on Columbus Day at Silk Road and it was divine. I had the waffles and a latte and it was pure heaven. After being used to burnt Starbucks coffee, the latte was the best I've ever had; the barista knows how to make a GREAT latte! The waffles were incredible, with fresh blueberries, blackberries and strawberries and a fantastic lemon curd with the lightest, sweetest whipped cream I've ever had. The sweetness of the syrup and whipped cream was perfectly complimented by the tartness of the fresh fruit and lemon curd. My husband had the cripsy french toast and it was divine as well. The atmosphere is relaxing and the chairs were comfortable. We had a view of the canoe sculpture and pedestrians walking by the window we were seated near. The service was prompt and the wait staff was friendly. It was more than we usually pay for Krispy Kremes, but for me, it was worth every dime! The pool area is extremely lovely. We didn't spend much time out there, but in the few minutes we did walk around, we experienced no wind or sun vortexes. There are lots of chairs and cabanas, but it did appear that umbrellas were going to go fast because they're in short supply. We weren't on the deck to see the Death Ray, but we did see it from the room. I couldn't get a good picture of it, but you could see where it was on October 12 at 11:45am because of the lack of shadows in areas that should have been in shadow. Clearly, the sun was reflecting off of the building and I can see how it would be bad if a sunbather drifted off for a nap and ended up in it's path, caught unawares. A few things about City Center; FANTASTIC design. We could have very happily never left the property in the 60-some odd hours we were there. Everything you could possibly want was within a 15 minute walk, at the longest. Bars, restaurants, gift shop at Aria, night clubs, shopping, pools, entertainment, casino, it's all right there. It's extremely easy to navigate and just beautiful to walk through. Crystals was busier than it was during our previous trip, and I don't think it's because they opened just a few more stores. I think it's because people are finally starting to discover the entire City Center property. We did walk into the lobby of the Mandarin Oriental, but we didn't venture up to the 28th floor because we weren't sure how to go about doing that since we weren't guests and the bellmen/doormen were all occupied with paying customers so we walked back out. The Veer Towers are open for residential sales, but we didn't go in because we didn't want to waste someone's time giving us a pitch we couldn't afford to buy. The Harmon is slated for opening late this year, but we couldn't tell just how close that opening will be because you can't get close enough to any of the windows to really see anything. I have to say that I still find the Cosmopolitan kind of obnoxious. Since this hotel/property isn't open yet, I can't give an opinion of it other than that it's annoyingly in the way, blocking views of City Center from all vantage points north of the property. Overall, October is a MUCH nicer time to visit Vegas than June, and not just because of the cooler weather. A different class of people travel in the fall; we did not miss the roving groups of drunken college kids who usually show up in the summer. We were there on 10-10-10 and saw DOZENS of brides, something that didn't occur to me would be happening until the date finally dawned on me. I realize that the Vdara isn't the type of hotel everyone will enjoy. It caters to a different class of Vegas travelers. You're not likely to find a hot party scene there because most college kids can't afford the room prices. High rollers and people who go strictly to gamble aren't going to flock there either. But if you're a casual Vegas visitor who goes for the sites and the shows and the people watching, Vdara is for you. It's a calm, quiet oasis admidst the craziness of what Las Vegas is. If I approved of kids in Vegas, which I don't, Vdara would be a good hotel to take your family to because of the non-gaming, non-smoking environment. I already miss it and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “ruby wedding and bithday celabration”
Reviews.Author: chorleyLancashire
Reviews.Content: my husband and i booked this hotel as its new and good reveiws, we have been to vegas 4 times now but this time disapointed really its set back from the strip their is only one bar and resterant ony does breakfast and brunch.The pool attendants very nice and polite and maids excellent they came in the evening to ask if you needed anything you got free bottled water in your room and ice water at the pool bar. To days the pool closed at 4pm and one day all day due to private paying function. we complained as this was our ruby wedding day we had to get permission from manager to go to the Aria pool and that proved difficult as the security at the Aria had to ring Vdara although we had our room keys to show.would not recomend family holiday as more of a buisness hotel.Also the rooms are not as big as you expect the photo shots make it look bigger and we had a deluxe suite.We would not go back to this hotel again .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but boring...”
Reviews.Author: ejh09111
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay at this hotel based on the website pics. First, our room was not ready until almost 4pm!!! Luckily, we were able to hang out at the pool AFTER the rain stopped. However, once we arrived, I realized how little there was very little to do in the hotel itself. Its ok though bc you are walking distance from Bellagio & Aria. However, it made it kind of a pain if you just wanted a quick bottle of pop and snack. There is a small lounge & resteraunt in the lobby but very pricey. Pool service/food...insanely pricey! Room service is crazy pricey as well! We did not experience the "death ray" that everyone has complained about but we were careful of the sun and stayed in a cabana a portion of our time at the pool. Its truly a beautiful place but expensive and be ready to go elsewhere for entertainment/shopping/dining.

Reviews.Title: “Best non gaming hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ReedPlainfield_NH
Reviews.Content: This place was great and stunning. It is LEED certified and, believe it or not, part of the environmentally friendly City Center development in Vegas. Really who knew. They recycle everything. The rooms were stellar, 2 large screen LED TVs fabulous views, great quality linens and bath towels, and really large. I got a great deal on a discount site for the delux rooms at about $106 a night wight made the deal stellar. The work out facility was great as well. I didn't use the spa. It does lack a restaurant for the evening but it faces Aria which a a zillion and is really only a 1 minute walk. The bridge leads to the Bellagio in the other direction. I had a view of the Bellagio fountain. Pool was great as well but limited hours.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hidden Fees!”
Reviews.Author: marissall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for 4 nights. Initially, I was very impressed with the hotel, it smelled WONDERFUL! The concierge was helpful because our phone wasn't working and they even sent up a repair man to let my husband borrow a screw driver because his clippers got bent in the suitcase. We knew ahead of time that we wouldn't touch the food in the hotel. Their restaurant charges outrageous prices...$9 for oatmeal, $13 for ala carte eggs..come on! So we bought our own eggs and bacon and they sent up kitchenware (no charge) for us to cook with. We sat at the pool for one of the days and we weren't affected by the "death ray" but the water was FREEZING and we'll definietely save our money for cheaper drinks, I ordered a margarita and it was $12 for only 16 oz. Upon checking out we were explained that our credit card would be credited back the $500 deposit (so make sure you have the money in the bank or on your card in the first place). But then we saw a charge for $15 every day. This is RESORT FEE. I had read on their website that they charge this fee if we were to use the gym or grab a paper from the lobby or drink the waters the cleaning people leave in the rooms each day. But it is automatically TACKED ON to the bill, I was FURIOUS because we made the extra effort not to drink any of the water or read the paper so we could save the $15/day. Lastly, the Vdara is EXTREMELY inconveniently located. There is realy no easy way to get to the strip. We either walked through the Belagio or too the tram to the Aria and got to Las Vegas Blvd. We will definitely stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Peace in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mcbainjoe
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its claim of being completely nonsmoking and non-gambling. None of us girls smoke and none of us gamble, so this was perfect. We enjoyed going to the other hotels to see the people and sights, and shopped until we dropped, but it was so lovely to come back to serenity. No noise, no smoke, just lovely elegant comfort down to the Aveda products in the bathroom. I would stay again, and just might stay again in December.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: mrmonkfish65
Reviews.Content: well after reading the reviews for vdara before i went i was really worried,On arrival our check in was quick and efficient so straight up to our room on the 33rd floor(33041) on entering the room the view was great,But the bathroom was not clean..So off we went to complain , (we were grumpy from the long journey) The receptionist offered us lots of sorrys and a new room on the 12th floor right away,we went into the new room but it was smaller and not as nice so after a short think we went back to reception and told them if they cleaned the original rooms bathroom we would prefer to get that back . Which to be fair they did within the next hour without any hassle. The next ten nights were bliss ,The hotel is so quiet and great for anyone who needs complete rest. The kitchen area is great for making the odd meal ,we were given plates and utensils on arrival delivered to our room,as rooms are not stocked with them you are asked on check in. Rooms are made up whilst you are out and they leave plenty of Aveda products so dont pack shampoo or lotion. There is a $15 a night fee but our travel agent sorted that so our fees were paid ,this covers the wi-fi which never dropped once and was great for my i pad,also the gym and pool which we never used, but they looked good and never looked like many used them. The only bad points were cost of coffee in morning this was really expensive and so was the food.On a night we had a one drink before retiring to bed i had a bottle of beer and the wife a cocktail this cost $25 which is quite expensive.The location of the hotel is great also ,after the negative reviews i read...The walkway between the bellagio is a five min walk undercover but in the open and it can be hot but i was expecting a two mile walk to what some people had written,If you want to you can get the tram from bellagio into the monte carlo this also stops at the city centre hotel Aria where the new shopping arcade is .Overall this hotel is a must for people who dont smoke,Enjoy a good nights sleep,and like a modern clean hotel,There is no gambling in this casino free hotel so its very quiet in the lobby but a short walk and your in the aria or bellagio which will kindly take your donations.Enjoy we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: Valleygirl35
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights celebrating husband's birthday. The Deluxe Suite is very eloquent with a separate sitting area w/flat screen TV as well as a flat screen TV in the bedroom. Nice large bathroom with a deep bathtub and separate shower. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The property is totally smoke free and does not have a casino but you can use the walkway and go over to the Aria which does have a casino. There's also a Tram (free) which takes you over to Crystals (the City Center Shopping Center), Bellagio & Monte Carlo. Will definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Naked People in our room”
Reviews.Author: beaver_downunder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara from Oct 3-9th, six days in total for a family reunion and a big birthday celebration. On arrival check in was swift and quick, nobody offered to take our bags, front desk was polite and professional, we where asked if we had any prefrence to levels we said "the higher the better" we got a room on the 46th floor. After lugging our bags to the door, we swiped our cards to realise that they would not let us in, after flying in from Toronto, Canada the last thing I wanted to do was to go back to front desk and ask for them to be reloaded. But holding my patience I did so. My partner stayed with our bags on the 46th floor while I made the dash down stairs, told front desk (a new girl) what had happened she reloaded some new cards and said "If these don't work then come back and I'll have to get security to let you in" (which for starters is not an ideal situation, would I have to be let in by security every single time???). Came back to the room swiped the card "Presto" the door unlocked upon first coming into the room we where amazed at the view from the room, and then we where even more amazed by the view of two naked people in our room!!! YES NAKED PEOPLE IN OUR ROOM!!!!!! They, just as shocked as us, leaped up and began yelling "who the hell are you" so terrified we backed out of the room trying to explain there was a mix up. Chased down the hallway leaving our bags behind, when everything was cleared and still shaking like crazy hearts pounding we took our bags and went back to the front counter, the same girl at front desk responded with "your cards still arn't working?" with a puzzled look, I replied with "oh no they work but the problem is you gave us a room that already has people in it!!!" I explained what had occured, she seemed shocked and did apologise. She called management who then advised her to give us another room, this one on the 22nd floor, and said it was a premium upgrade to a lake view (strange though because we had already booked that upgrade), and then gave us a $50 credit to use towards the Vdara hotel spa or restaurant etc. Did I feel compensated? No not really. My biggest concern was if I could open someone elses door with my card, then could it also be that any other random stranger checking in could also swipe their card and get into mine? Got to the new room "No naked people" (boy where we cautious). The room itself was clean, great view. Things missing : coffee machine, cutlery, robes and slippers, conditioner. I called the front desk asking for our robes and some cutlery was told they would be up, then was told there was no coffee machine included in our package yet the internet says that it is included in our package? Now have been at hotel for under 30 minutes and I am not impressed with how they have handled this especially taking into account what has already gone on. Cutlery never arrived (oh pardon me it did arrive 5 days later, yes 5 days later someone showed up with two forks wrapped in a white napkin), our robes arrived after another 3 calls to front desk, and on first day our kitchen breaker cut out and we had no light in kitchen dining area, called that in someone came straight away, but then the two bulbs hanging above the dining table did not work that took about 3 days also and a few calls to replace. I never once got any turn down service over the 6 days but was paying for it in my $15 mandatory fee per day. Newspapers are not delivered to door you have to get them from front desk every morning, and you have to be quick as they go fast, somedays I missed out and had gone to check at 10am ish. On the 6th day, I asked 3 times to have the queen sofa bed made up, once at 9am, again at 7pm that night and after returning from dinner at 10pm nothing was done, it took me letting out some steam (which I hate to do) for someone to be there straight away. I even said just leave the linens and I'll make it up, couldn't even get that right. I was not impressed with little things like that, which other hotels will snap at. The facility itself was however very modern, and gym was great, nice selection of Cybex equipment top of the range. Silk Road was so so. Nothing to rave about. I don't think I'll ever go back to Vegas for a pleasure stay again, and if I do on business I hope that it is at the Aria or elswhere. Sorry Vdara I really like you but your staff needs to sharpen up.

Reviews.Title: “I love vdara!! This boutique hotel is...”
Reviews.Author: sambuddi2u
Reviews.Content: I love vdara!! This boutique hotel is exquisite! I like how you can party at night and come back to your room and feel so relax! I felt like I was on vacation when I stayed at Vdara. I go to Vegas once a year and this is the first time I felt relax in Vegas after partying it hard for 2 nights. Once you step in the lobby, you know it will be a very relaxing stay in Vegas!! No smell of cigarette and no loud casino sound. I love how you can go to Aria pool as long as you have your room keys from Vdara. my friend and I did the spa manicure and it was so relaxing. They have nice gym next to the spa. The hotel offers free bottled water. This hotel is to-die-for!! After vacationing to the Caribbean and staying at nice all inclusive hotels, this hotel did not dissapoint me! Will return to this hotel when I go to Vegas again!!

Reviews.Title: “Peace in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Astraman
Reviews.Content: We tried this new hotel to compare it with previous ones we had stayed at. It was very quiet compared to others (there are no casinos). It was so quiet that you wouldnt think you were just off 'The Strip'. The rooms were very good although my family complained about the lack of comfort with the fold out bed settee. Really the room is only suitable for couples. The pool area was very hot as it is all surrounded by concrete but the water was very cold. You had to take a deep breath before entering! On site restaurants were good.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: cooleun
Reviews.Content: This was the first time visiting Las Vegas. My friends recommended a few good hotels but the hotel price on the day I wanted to visit was four times higher than the usual price. After days of searching, I just booked this hotel at an affordable price. Since I had never heard of this hotel and there were some negative reviews, it made me little worried. However, when I got there, I was happy with my decision. The lobby and room design was very modern, clean and comfortable. The room size was okay and there was a big window which allowed me to watch nice sunset. The hotel location was great! It's connected to Bellagio and other places through the tram. If there was an option for self-parking, I would give an extra point. Overall, this was very pleasant experience and I will definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lineaway
Reviews.Content: I hesitated writing this but from alot of these reviews I feel Vdara is getting a bum rap and needed a good review. My wife and I stayed 5 nts at the end of Sept. I was very satisfied with our stay here and will break it down based on our above rating. Rooms: We were upgraded to the 51st floor overlooking the Bellagio Fountains. Amazing view would be an understatment. The room is big, about 500-600sq ft. The kitchen has alot of cabinet space but not utinsels. I was told to just ask and they deliver what you need. We used this area as storage for "beverages." Two small refrigerators are here too but only one is empty. The other is for the overpriced goodies all hotels offer. The bathroom is larger than most and has a drawer by the sink with the hairdryer in it. There is a closet that looks like it was to be a linen closet just inside also. The main room is separated by a small partition that has dual plasma tv's on each side. There are more storage drawers here. You will have ample space to store all your stuff. The safe is in the closet. I had a bit if a problem getting used to the two types of window shades that are electronically raised or lowered. You will figure it out but the switch takes a bit to get used to. The bed was very comfortable. Rooms and sleep quality 5 star. Cleanliness: I am a clean freak. I bring Lysol wipes and usually wipe things down but this time I found no need. I never saw any stains on bedding or carpet and the bathroom was spotless. Not even water spots. Service: Checkin was quick and they were very helpful. Front Desk 5 star. Valet was never more than a couple minute wait for our car. They were very polite and always asked if we needed directions anywhere. There is complimentary cold water bottles here too. Valet 5 star. My only reason to not give a 5 star rating overall was housekeeping. Perhaps I expect a bit much but the rooms have a light you can activate when you want your room made up. We left every morning before 8, activated the light and our room was not made up until late afternoon. This wouldn't be a big issue but we would come back around 2-3 and then have the maid wanting in. For her credit, they did a great job cleaing and keeping the toiletries filled so I would still give them 4 1/2 stars. We had a problem with our bill on the last day. Someone had charged over 1300 bucks to our room for spa, food and beverages that we never signed for. The front desk took the charges off w/o a problem. Location: Here is the only issue I see. Some have insinuated that its a short walk to the strip. It really isn't. You have to go through Bellagio, take the tram to Monte Carlo or navigate your way through Aria and City center to get to the strip. Its a 5-10 min. walk if you are a fast walker. My other issue was driving into Vdara. You have to know which ramp to take and then how to find the Valet area. It is not well marked. I used google earth and looked at the satelight view along with going on you tube and watching video of people arriving. I was warned about this so I was prepared. We always came in off of Harmon from the west instead of from the strip. It was alot easier. I think they could have done a better job of designing the entrance but its too late now. They should at least put in more signage. Value: This is real subjective. For 100-150 nt. I can't see how people could expect more unless they have unrealistic expectations. The pool is another issue. I didn't go to the pool but my wife did. If you had any compalints they were letting you go over the the Aria pool which is amazing. Again, this to me is good customer service. I didn't think the 15 a day resort fee is so bad either, the wi fi worked great and it was nice having the bottled water each day. You also get your choice of newspapers too if you ask. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - bring money”
Reviews.Author: nettermo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights as part of a package plan...gorgeous, but more upscale than what we are use to. Everything about the hotel was beautiful, very modern, European-flavor decor. All the rooms are "suites," in that the sleeping area is divided from the living area by a large wooden unit in the middle of the room that houses a flat-screen TV on both sides. There is a small kitchen/dining area with micro/convection oven, two burner stove, mini-fridge, sink and dining table w/2 chairs. There is also a fully-stocked mini bar - more on that in a minute. What is missing in the kitchen is everything else, and I mean everything. You can request dishes, etc., from housekeeping, but the only thing that is automatically provided are two drinking glasses and two wine glasses, not even a napkin or spoon. Having just moved over to the Vdara from a regular condo with a fully stocked kitchen (where we stayed the previous nights of our vacation), it just seemed a little odd. Guess it cuts way down on buying dishes, though, so I understand that. We were on the 30th floor, about half-way up and the view was beyond beautiful! Every room has one whole wall of windows. The shades are raised/lowered by a wall switch. Central heat/air, so no bulky wall unit. Nice lit closet with wall safe. Bathroom was LOVELY. One big plus, the shower came out of the wall about 7 ft. up, so my tall husband didn't even have to duck to wash his hair. Water pressure was a little weak, but tolerable. Separate glass-enclosed shower, tub, huge vanity. Bed was plenty comfy, lots of drawers to unpack in. Lots of tech inputs, which is needed for us, including ipod input into TV, both wired and wi-fi internet (free), 2-line phone, lots of elec. outlets, etc. Now for the "bring money" part - this is a full-service hotel, which is great if you just want to pay/tip people to do everything for you. If you're a do-it-myself person, not so much. The bellman WILL bring your luggage to your room (not an option) and there is no self-parking garage right there at the hotel, it's all valet, although it is labeled as complementary (included in the resort fees), still you're expected to tip. Don't misunderstand, we know the value of tipping and we're generous tippers, but it just seemed like every time we turned around there was someone else to tip. And there is a $15 per night resort fee charged on top of the room rate. I'm not sure what distinguishes it as a resort, didn't notice anything extra. However, I really did appreciate the fact that it did not have a casino, so it was quiet and peaceful (also non-smoking). And finally, beware the mini-bar...it has pressure sensitive tabs in it, so if you take something out and don't put it back immediately, you are automatically charged for it. And the only place this is stated is it's printed inside the mini-bar fridge door (behind the $12 cashews and $7 M & M's). I had picked up several things to look at them before I saw the notification. When I told the front desk clerk, he smiled and said it happens all the time, and it usually takes about 30 seconds before the charges kick in. <whew!> By the way, the front desk personnel were all very professional, but extremely friendly. Summary: gorgeous accommodations, but it will cost you. Will we stay here again? Hmmm, probably not, but that's just us. It was fun once, though, and if you're considering the Vdara, I'd say "go for it!"

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelDiva2000
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I visited the Vdara September 28 - Oct 1 2010 for our anniversary. I must say I was a little nervous after reading the negative reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. The Vdara is a wonderfully relaxing hotel among the drama and chaos that is Vegas. You walk in and are greated with a sense of peace along with a fragrance that is pleasant to the senses - especially after walking through the smoke filled casinos. We requested the kitchen utensils at check and within 20 mins they were delivered to our suite along with our robes. Because it was our anniversary we were given a room on the 32nd floor with a view of the Bellagio Fountains and the Strip. The room is truly a treat. The wall of windows is spectacular and having the ability to black them out is great, when you are trying to get that afternoon nap. We had only one little hic-cup that was swiftly taken care of. We left our room late in the afternoon on 1 day and requested the room be clean. That morning we had had room service bring breakfast. When we returned that night, they had cleaned the room - somewhat- they left some of the breakfast dishes and for some reason made up the sofa bed( this was not requested). When my Husband called down and spoke with Brittany she said it would be handled. After 15 mins they had not come up..he called a 2nd time..this time Brittany apologized and offered to waive the $15 a day resort fee---we didn't even have to ask for an accomendation..they volunteered. And housekeeping was ringing our doorbell within 5 mins of that 2nd call. I didn't like that the pool closed so early..it would have been nice to take a night dip in the jacuzzi. As for getting to the strip...people need to stop complaining. There is a tram that takes you to the hotels within the City Center, which all sit on the strip, or you can take an 8 min walk over the bridge that connects you to the Bellagio. I would definitely say, for anyone looking to go to Vegas to relax and enjoy the sites, but don't want all the chaos of a hotel with nightclubs and casinos--the Vdara is the place. The staff was wonderful and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Hip...Modern...Quiet...”
Reviews.Author: CDEW
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas several times. Decided last minute on a quick getaway for the wife and I and had never stayed in a non-gaming hotel in Vegas. Vdara is new and modern. We had a wonderful stay in a strip view suite. Rooms are very spacious and well decorated. Nice kitchen and bath areas would allow for a long term stay. Greal location on the southern end of the strip with monorail service to Aria and Monte Carlo. Connected to Bellagio via covered walkway. The hotel was quiet and almost seemed empty at times. Nice pool area too. What a relaxing place!

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: billlis
Reviews.Content: just behind and linked to the bellagio. no casino in this hotel which made it quieter than most. restaurant closed very early. car parking was very slick. consierge could not do enough for you, as a consequence you had to queue maybe 30 mins. used the in room checkout, but did not see the problems that other revues have told of. I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit fur coat no knickers”
Reviews.Author: Johnboy42
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to my stay in Vdara having watched it all being built. The rooms were well appointed and clean and I had a fantastic view on the 49th floor. Unfortunately thats where it ends. The "rooftop" pool is on the 3rd floor, somewhat misleading with the expression rooftop, and Yes I did experience the Vdara "death ray" where the sun shines off the glass onto the pool area. For a hardened sunbather like myself it was a bit of a shock and drove me indoors after an hour feeling a bit sick. (interestingly, the pool was shut all over the following weekend with no explanations, since all the internet interest in the "death ray" Found the public areas lacking facilities and warmth, and for a "strip" hotel, its actually a very long walk (usually thru Aria) to the strip itself. The spa charged guests a whopping $25 to use the facilities, more than most other hotels and certainly NOT good value for money with spartan facilities and less than usual amenities/refreshments. I'm glad I've been there, but I don't feel the need to go back and for those that do go there, make sure you get a bargain, your money certainly goes a lot further elsewhere on the strip. Resort "fee" of $15 per night, covered nothing but a bottle of water and wifi, again poor value.

Reviews.Title: “A little confusing to maneuver City Center, but a lovely stay at Vdara”
Reviews.Author: monieb1922
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Vdara 10/1-10/3. Overall, a lovely stay. A very contemporary, art-filled hotel; very high-tech. Room was on the 47th floor with a view (upgraded without even asking). Beautiful furnishings, comfortable bed, very clean. Bathroom was a bit small for the price point (one sink, toilet was not in separate water closet), and the water pressure in the shower could have been a bit better. The refrigerator is quite small; kitchen items and utensils provided upon request, as are robes. Free bottled water is provided daily, and free use of the gym/fitness facility ($25 charge for the spa if you do not book a service). A very quiet, non-gaming property, but it was a bit difficult to find your way to the Strip and out of the City Center complex, both on foot and by car. The signage was not very clear (or large). Overall, a good experience at Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: vkwon
Reviews.Content: Hotel is slightly off the strip and the only way to get to really get to it was to go through the Aria hotel. Check in was very slow and disorganized. The deluxe suite was nicely furnished but we had to call maintenance because the shower stall was not draining. Housekeeping and the maintenance crew were friendly. Didn't understand why their pool hours were so limited (9 - 6pm)???? After walking the strip all day it would have been nice to be able to go and soak in the hot tub or lounge by the pool to unwind.....but noooo couldn't do it unless you were there before 6pm. I would have to say that I will not be staying there again. It was definitely not a 5 star hotel in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxGigi
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Vdara for 4 nights. Our room was new and clean, and service was very good. There is limited selection of restaurant in the hotel, but many restaurants are within walking distance. The higher floor rooms have very good views, but weak water pressure. The gym is well equipped and clean. We will stay at the Vdara again during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: lorraineandbede
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vdara it's a lovely hotel room nice a spacious, room cleaned every day and bed too, even though it didnt have to be changed every day, location in the middle of strip great location, the bed is the best bed i have ever slept in wish i could have brought it home had good view from room looking over the Bilagio hotel could not fault anything with this hotel pool was lovely too, would recommend this hotel to anybody

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and roomy suite”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoWinger
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip in February 2010 for September. According to website we were to have a coffeemaker in our room. Upon checking in, we found a small kitchen with nothing in it. Had a fridge, but the freezer part was locked (we like to freeze bottles of water to carry around while we're walking). When we asked where the coffeemaker was, we were told that they removed all of them and if we wanted one we'd have to upgrade? Felt they should have honored the fact that when we booked they had a coffeepot, but didn't push the issue. Wasn't the biggest deal, but we like our coffee before we leave to see the sights. We bought instant coffee and the hotel gave us two cups and a pot to boil water. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in. From our room we could watch the Bellagio fountains at night. This was great! Would have loved to be on a higher floor, but this wasn't bad. I have to say our stay was a very relaxing one because it was so quiet on the floor. We've experienced other hotels where people come in at all hours and are very loud. Not here -- it was quiet. In fact we never saw anyone on our floor the three nights we were there (except for cleaning people). It was almost as if we had the floor to ourselves. The televisions were great -- we had two flatscreens. All in all it was nice, but don't see the point in having a suite when there is nothing in the kitchen area. I wasn't going to pay $75 a night more for a coffeepot.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara in Vegas for a Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jepockn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Vdara in September and had a great stay. We are in our mid 20's and are not big into gambling and smoking etc so this hotel fit us perfectly. I will start with the negatives first. - Sunday night our room was not cleaned by 6:30 pm. We called down to the front desk and they had it cleaned immediately. - We found the scent in the lobby a little irritating, like cheap perfume or something. That was all the negatives, now i will talk about our stay. We arrived and valeted. It was fast and efficent. However this was our only encounter with the valet as we self parked in the bellagio for the remainder of our stay. This was maybe a 5 min walk tops from car to hotel room. Checkin was fast, however we did have to wait, but once they noticed people waiting they brought more staff out. Our room was the one with the divider in it and we felt it was very large for a hotel room. We used the bathtub every night after the strip and it was fantastic. The shower also have very good pressure. The workout facility was excellent as well. With little waters and towels beside each machine. There was a good variety of equipment with free weights and ellipitcal machines just to name a few. We did not have breakfast at the hotel due to price, but we did go over to the aria for the buffet and we would definitely recommend it there. There was also little waters at the valet if you would like some water while on the strip. There is a small store just outside the vdara in the bellagio if you need to pick up any necessaries. The rooms also had the blackout shades, however they do not work as I would have hoped them too. They are split up between each window and have gaps allowing light to come in. The walk to the strip was no more than 10 minutes and was not a hard walk at all. All in all I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a smoke free hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara was a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jhammack
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2 bedroom penthouse suite on the 56th floor. The hot water pressure was so low, I couldn't run a bath and the airconditioning could not keep up with the outside temperature of 100 F. Even with the black-out shades down, the top level of the suite (master bedroom) reached 90 degrees and was unlivable. When I complained I was told apologetically that it was a "green building' so I should expect problems of this nature! The staff was very courteous and helpful...I felt sorry for them to work there. Definitely not worth the money. The curvature of the glass building magnified the heat in the pool area, which melted plastic cups.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality, not a 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: bobvgf2
Reviews.Content: The concierge had to be called to assist us, since apparently no one was around in the lobby. We saw very few people in the elevators and lobby, which even given the absmece of a casino, made us think that we were the only ones staying here. the mattress was lopsided. The room had no coffee machine or hand moisturizer, which we even got at a Comfort Inn a day earlier in Arizona, which I think is a 2 star or perhaps 3 star hotel. The additional $15 fee, tacked on to the room rate (we had booked through Hotwire) was unexpected and unfair. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: leadmub
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time to Vegas and thought we'd try Vdara because it was in the new city centre and because we found such an amazing deal online. We decided to treat ourselves and upgrade to a Vdara suite. When we checked in the reception asked if we were interested in one of the higher floors, we agreed and got a room on the 53rd floor. The views were incredible! We had 180 degrees views because we were in a room at the end of the hallway, we could see from Mandalay Bay, the Palms, the Bellagio fountains, all the way up the strip to the Stratusphere! I could have just stayed in my room and stared out the windows all day. The room itself was soooo comfortable, Very modern and sophisticated deor. We had a full size kitchen, with seating for four, a full size fridge, dish washer, garberator, mini bar fridge, and Keurig coffee maker. The maid left us 2 K-cups for coffee with creamer and sugar everyday. We asked for more coffee and coffee mugs and they brought them up right away. The bed itself is probably the most comfortable be i have ever slept in, so plush and cozy. Even the pillows were amazing. Every window has a remote controlled shade and a "blackout" shade. If you want it pitch black you got it! The bathroom was gorgeous with a full size tub, seperate shower, double sinks, closet, and vanity desk, with chair and mirror. They supply Aveda skin care products which were amazing. The hotel itself is tucked in from the strip but you can cut through Aria which is a hop skip and a jump away or connect throgh Bellagio which is what we did when we wanted to head north up the strip. When we travelled south to Mandalay Bay one day we took the "Bellagio" tram stop and took it to Monte Carlo stop, then crossed the street and got on the tram at Excaliber to Mandalay Bay, we saved tons of walking. We did not try the restaurant in Vdara but did try the buffet in Aria (amazing) and the restaurant in Aria near the casino on the main floor (also delicous). We loved the fact that Vdara is a smaller hotel because it doesnt take you 20 mins to walk throught the hotel to get to the elevators, the hotel was always quiet and relaxing. There was no smoking and noise of the casinos which was really nice. The fitness centre located on the 2nd floor was very nice. The had 7 treadmills, 5 olypticals, 2 stationary bikes, free weights, and machines. They supplies, bottle water, towels, cold wet towel to freshen up with, and ear phones to plug into their treadmills. The treadmills also had an ipod docking station to charge.
