The pool was very nice as well, its located on the third floor and offers appetizers, and fresh blended drinks for sale. All in all we loved our trip and I cant really say anything negative. We had a great experience and will def. be back!

Reviews.Title: “How good is the City Center complex?”
Reviews.Author: slieder
Reviews.Content: Pretty Good! Rooms were clean, great view looking down on the Bellagio fountain, incredibly fast internet, wonderful bathroom with a deep tub. Breakfast was more expensive than it should have been, more about the presentation than the substance. Go to across the entry the Aria for the buffet, still good food for but for less. The bar in the lobby was perfect for coming back from a late night on the Strip. Great drinks (Martinis were great) and the late night snacks tasted great. Spa was pretty good. Wife and I enjoyed the meditation room, relaxing before and after the massages. The mens lounge was pretty good, but the sauna was broken. Check the price, but I thought $25 a day gets you use of the spa and gym all day. Great for checking out early but staying late and cathing the red-eye flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, very friendly staff and close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: alpha87
Reviews.Content: I rented a two story suite panoramic view on the 56th floor. The suite wasn't that big compared to other suites in the same price range but acceptable and furnished in a modern style. I could not check-in before 4pm. The was a long queue at the check-in desk so you can expect some waiting time. Just as some of the reviews stated, if you would like to cook or eat, you have to ask for silverware when you check-in. Different to other suites in the same hotel, the two story suite has a coffee machine in the room. There is a mini bar as well as a large Fridge. The Safe is to small in my opinion, you can't store a large number of stuff in there e.g Notebook and it is mounted upright flat to the wall so you cannot stack things but have to put everything upright. The Safe was closed and I had to call Security to have it opened. It took two attempts to have actually someone fixing the problem but I did get voucher because of the extended waiting time, which was nice. There is Internet in the room but you will be charged automatically not matter if you use it or not. There are not many drawers or closets so if you have lots of clothing or travel with family, you run out of space quickly. Also the single closet is in the bathroom upstairs. You have a washing machine and a dryer in the room which is nice, in case you need it. The panoramic room view is toward the airport and the center of the City Center Complex including Aria or Mandrin. The bathroom is towards Bellagio but although if the view are really nice, when you sit on the couch or in the bath tub you can't really see a lot only if you stand up. The rooms with direction to the Bellagio might offer a better view but after all it was still very nice. The room was not that clean but clean enough when I arrived but the next day everything was fine. If you can afford you should have Breakfast in the room once .. really nice treat! TV was ok too I have not watched lot but the music selection is a little limited but I suppose everyone will still find some acceptable tunes. All in all the room and view was very good and so the staff. It is however, more on the pricy side compared to similar suites in Vegas There is not much going on in the Vdara but within about 5 minutes walking distance you are right in the Aria or Mandrin and about the same to the Bellagio. There is also a train connecting some of the hotels in the Business Center complex. The Strip is about 10-15 minutes walking distance either via Aria or Bellagio. Finally, you should see the bar in the Mandrin for a very nice view in particular in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “I go to Vegas a lot & this is the best combination of relaxation & excitement in the city!”
Reviews.Author: FlemBrimstone
Reviews.Content: Wow! This was the second stay here. This time for 8 days, 7 nights. Even the cheapest room is delightfully accommodating. I still can't believe how nice the place & people are! The awesome coffee makers were missing this time, this is too bad, a health dpt issue I heard. Since there is a kitchen we just bought the Starbucks instant stuff (pretty good) and 2 souvenir mugs, this worked out fine all week. The in-room coffee service is great too but I'm cheap & don't want to wait for coffee. This time I got one of the rooms with the 2 TV divider between the sleeping area & the living area. Both floor plans were ok for me but people who like a little more privacy or are traveling with family or friends would love the divided suite. Great view this side of building too. Best view I think I've ever had in Vegas, maybe EVER any hotel. I think maybe there are only good views here! If you get a lower room you see the pool, the people or the art scattered about. Higher rooms stunning views of Vegas and the Space-Age architectural designs of the City Center. I watched the Bellagio fountains from my room. If it wasn't Vegas I would have spent a lot of time in that room! Bedding & linens & sundries ultra superior. Aveda products for free! Bed and pillows just right. Way plenty of towels, bathroom quite large. I could even soak in the tub and watch TV with this room design! The Vdara & City Center design astound me. How can they have a good view in every room? Have easy walks to everything I want? Pool, Spa, everything! Both the Aria & Vdara spa good, used them both. Couples will like the Aria's co-ed sky-hot-tub a LOT! The staff activities seem well thought out in advance of my arrival too. They were ready for every request before I made it. For example I found some nice flowers touring the city & called the Vdara to see if they had vases. They were in my room before I got there. (They also carefully got permission to enter the room to do so, totally respecting and protecting my privacy & security. I like that.) Ate twice in the lobby restaurant. Their signature "eggs eggs eggs" dish was awesome, also had a seafood tapa appetizer which was really good. I did think on a couple of occasions I would drop in again because I was hungry but found they were closed. I think people who live in Vegas forget how we tourists loose track of time, maybe they'll keep it open later, or maybe they're embarrassed by that gold wallpaper. I have so many other places like Cesar's and the Wynn I want to stay at but they treat me so good at the Vdara and it is such a good value that it will be a long time before I get around to the others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TouristTed
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the negative reviews previously regarding the Vdara on the site, we were a little apprehensive prior to our 5 night stay in mid September. We needn't have worried though. The hotel is excellent and would have no hesitation in staying there again. Although the hotel is set slightly back from the strip, accessibility was not a problem through the walkway that took you through the Bellagio which took about five minutes. The tram system connecting the hotel to the Monte Carlo/Aria/Bellagio was also very efficient which we used lots of times. The hotel itself is quiet, since it is not a gaming hotel. We had no problems with noise at any time so enjoyed peaceful sleep! Service is excellent. We were found a fabulous room at check-in that overlooked the Bellagio Fountains to the front and Rio to the side. The room was spacious with a living/kitchen areas and sleeping area, both including a huge flat screen TV. My husband was impressed by the array of music channels on the TV, particularly the rock channels. However, he failed miserably in trying to convert me to AC/DC!!!! Could not fault the housekeeping service and the room was serviced each day before we came back to the room in mid afternoon. The bottled water provided in our fridge every day proved to be very welcome. A local newspaper was also provided to wake up to. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - wish it home away from home”
Reviews.Author: dsrbroadway
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Vdara for four nights, and I agree with pretty much all the praise. The beds were extremely comfortable, I never wanted to get up. The room service meals tasty and beautifully presented (of course, a little pricey, but isn't all room service?). My spa experience was heavenly, with a wonderful meditation room post-service I didn't want to leave. And I never ran into an employee that didn't meet my smile with a gracious response...The room was a little dusty when I checked in, but on the way out a little while later, I asked at the front desk if they could "swiffer" and when I got back a couple of hours later, it was done. Oh, and the Vdara bar drinks were delicious, refreshing and strong. Again, great hospitality there, and be sure to ask them to for recommendations and/or their mixes. I was lucky enough to be there before the pool opened, and I got to taste some great cocktails they were planning for the pool menu. And it's so quiet in the lobby, you forget that people are coming in and out. (Mind you, this was in March, so don't know how it was over the summer). I'm going back to Vdara in three weeks. Hoping the pool will be open so I can rest and get some sun. And I plan to finally get around to eating at Silk Road. PS A little tip for getting to the hotel from the Strip from the South. I found that the Monte Carlo was a great alternative for getting to the hotel. The entrance is on the Strip and it's a quick walk to the monorail bay. Then use the elevators to the monorail at the Monte Carlo and Bellagio stops - no one else was ever using them. A lot faster than walking off the Strip through Aria or going all the way to Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Good views of the strip for the price”
Reviews.Author: Paulina9077
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was great. Kind of wish we had a choice of self-park or valet, but it is only valet. Got there exactly at check-in time and NO ONE in line, so that was a plus. However, 30 mins later there was a huge line. So get there early! One complaint was the lobby. It smelled like farts and was very stuffy. Felt like there was no circulation in there. Once in the room I immediately noticed how roomy it was for being the smallest room. It is like a mini suite. For being only 4 months old though I was surprised that there was a dent in the wall. But it is Las Vegas what do you expect. And what caught my attention was of course the view and windows. Wow are the windows big and the views fantastic. We were on a high floor by the way. Wish the blinds could block out the light in the early morning though. The blinds kind of sucked - no curtains. Staff was very friendly. Kinda missed having a casino downstairs but at the same time no haha. And also there is entrance to Bellagio and Monte Carlo from the hotel itself. And it is not far from the strip at all. Just walking distance. I was worried it would be too far from the strip but it's not. Would recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SomeFriendly
Reviews.Content: I read loads of reviews on tripadvisor before we left, and have to say the positive reviews definitely reflected our stay than the negative ones. We didn’t visit Vegas for the nightlife or gambling, but for a relaxing holiday and the Vdara suited this perfectly. THE ROOM We had a a City Suite, booked as part of an offer through Expedia and the room was stunning. The views were amazing, across CityCenter, Monte Carlo, Luxor, etc. and over the mountains to the West of the Strip. Housekeeping were efficient and responded kindly to daily tips we left, making sure we had plenty of complimentary water bottles, coffee sachets for the coffee machine, toiletries, etc, etc. We didn't really make the most of the kitchen, but had a huge fridge (very handy for Cheesecake Factory takeaway!). Bed was amazing, bathroom was large, lounge area was great to have to relax in. I know we were on holiday, but having separate washing machine and dryer in the room was brilliant, no washing when we got home! You also get a complimentary paper delivered every day, either Wall Street Journal or local Las Vegas paper. POOL The pool only ever got busy at the weekend, but even then it wasn't completely packed. The staff that work around the pool are brilliant, they'll take your drinks/food orders (and remember them & you for the rest of your stay!), they regularly came round with complimentary samples of virgin cocktails. Staff will also reserve you your favourite sunloungers/umbrellas for your stay. It’s not really a ‘family’ hotel, so the atmosphere around the pool is really relaxed, no kids splashing and running around! LOCATION You can reach the Strip via a walkway to/through Bellagio, or walk 30 seconds over to the Aria and walk through there/CityCenter. Very, very easy. We loved the Vdara for its location as it was a bit of a retreat and calm place to be. SERVICES We didn’t use the valet, spa or bar... but did order in-suite dining on our last night as we were exhausted! The order came through in about 20-30mins and the food was excellent quality, well presented and the staff extremely friendly and polite. When we arrived, we were met at the taxi/front door and bags were taken to our room, we didn’t have to lift a finger. The same guys are there to get you taxis from the rank, and again are really helpful and friendly. AMENITIES There aren’t any shops, etc. in the hotel, but a 30second walk over to the Aria and there’s a sundries/convenience store. It’s at the back of what looks like a Men’s clothes store... even the staff there said they were frustrated that no guests knew it was there! Prices may be a little inflated compared to the CVS/ABC stores (which are about 10-15 mins away), but it’s very convenient... and you can pick up international newspapers there too as well as Vegas souvenirs. OTHER NEARBY RECOMMENDATIONS As stated in a recent review, the breakfast buffet at the Aria is amazing. It’s about $20, maybe more than other places, but the variety and quality of food is incredible. The staff are excellent too, always making sure you have the juice/coffee you need. The Aria also has a cute little gelato place called Sweet Chill which does coffees/sandwiches too. But the BEST place is the Jean Philippe Patisserie (there’s also one at the Vdara end of the Bellagio). This is a great place to grab a breakfast... pastries, breakfast criossants, coffee, muffins, etc, etc... the best patisserie/bakery we’ve ever ever experienced!All in all, we had an amazing time at Vdara... and will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but flawed”
Reviews.Author: Allis0nB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for only 2 nights, the 2nd stop on our 3 centre holiday and to be honest it was rather disappointing experience despite the high hopes I had for our suite in the luxury new hotel. The trip was booked in March 2010 (6 months in advance) and at that time I requested an early check in (check in is at 3pm and we were due to arrive at 1pm) and a view overlooking the Bellagio fountains. When we arrived, we had to wait for about 15 minutes and were then told no room was available despite the requests and that "nothing was guaranteed". They took all our details however, including credit card details and said this would not be required when we came back at 3pm. I was very disappointed and not impressed with the girl's attitude. We requested our cases back from the bellhops and changed in the toilets (not ideal!) but since we had limited time in Vegas decided to just change and go and get some lunch before checking in again at 3pm. The girl at the bellhop desk and the bell hop were very helpful and pleasant (and she was sympathetic, she suggested we change in the conference facility toilets as they were quieter and larger than the lobby ones). When we came back at 3pm we again had to wait for about 10 minutes and then they asked for all our details again! Annoying. We were given a room on the 38th floor, not overlooking the fountains but the view was spectacular both day and night - of the Luxor, Monte Carlo and Mandalay Bay and the mountains in the background. Good points:- Very quiet/peaceful/tranquil No smoking - this was lovely to come back to Smell in the hotel is lovely (as many others have pointed out) Exquisite decor throughout the hotel Possibly the most comfortable bed you will ever sleep in Lovely room Spectacular view Aveda toiletries in the bathroom Cool blinds/housekeeping remote controls Bellhops and concierge both very friendly and helpful Bad points:- Snooty and unwelcoming staff on reception Not getting an early check in or view we requested - and being told abruptly this was "not guaranteed" $15 per day resort fee - what is the point? We only got 2 bottles of water for this! Hubby did manage to use the wifi on his ipod touch briefly but not worth it. They should just add this to the room rate. Pool hours too short - when we went for a look at night and before 0900 the door was padlocked Kitchen - what is the point of having a fantastic kitchen with nothing in it? We put water in the fridge but that was it No restaurant or shop in the hotel, we had to trek to the Bellagio to get some water! Coffee makers no longer in the rooms The journey to the strip was OK - we went through both the Bellagio and the Aria and it didn't take too long either way. Everywhere takes ages to get to in Vegas! We didn't find the location to be a problem. We never ate in the hotel but had a couple of take away coffees from the Silk Road. Check out did not take long and there was a taxi waiting for us to take us to the airport. Randy the bellhop was great. All in all, a disappointing experience. I loved the fact the hotel was no smoking and thought the room was lovely but missed the madness and the noise from the casinos that is unmistakedly Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and interesting design”
Reviews.Author: PJZinLA
Reviews.Content: Good rates for a suite right now. Traveled with family and 2 & 4 year olds. We had three rooms among us and our room was slightly different than the other suites. One large room rather than the split design you see on the website. The open room was much better for our 2yr old daughter who could run around a little while spending the evening in with the grandparents. The split design was great for the rooms that had adults who were sleeping on the sofa beds. I would ask for the open style suite if you have a small child. Since there is no casino in the hotel it is better for the kids as well - not so restricted when walking around. Kitchen is compact and useful. Mini fridge is MINI - so shallow I don't think a regular leftovers container would fit inside. There are no amenities in the kitchen at all, not even a trash can or paper towels. You can ask for cookware and I assume other utensils. We just needed the microwave and fridge so it worked fine, but not having anything to wipe up or place to throw the trash was odd. Free wifi (part of the resort fee) was nice. Make sure to go through all the registration screens when using the web on your mobile phone, there are 3 i think, otherwise it wont work. Some great views of the Bellagio fountain at night. The city center design was interesting. Loved the Canoe art out front. That may be a polarizing piece of art, but its Vegas who cares, at least it is interesting. Aria seemed to be the most complete hotel/casino if you want everything in one spot. Not much happening at Vdara. Need to do a better job around the hotels cleaning up - maintenance (dirty windows, cigarette butts, housekeeping door with a coat hanger for a door knob) and service was average, not bad and not great. Easy walk to the strip, connected by bridge to Bellagio, and very short walk to Aria. The Wynn is my benchmark and would rate Vdara below that for service and facility, Vdara is a good value for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquillity and luxury away from the strip madness!!”
Reviews.Author: JR3079
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a week at the Vadra I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel after reading numerous dubious reviews on Trip Advisor. We arrived at the hotel and found parking a breeze with the Valet Parking guys. Check took less than 10 minutes and were we given a room with a view of Paris and the Bellagio fountains. The rooms are well appointed, however, if you’re planning on cooking you just need to request kitchenware. The room had a kitchen area with table and chairs, lounge area with sofa and LCD TV, bedroom with the most amazingly comfortable bed and another LCD TV and the bathroom had a walk-in shower and bath tub. We had no complaints at all with the room, the air conditioning worked fine and the electric blinds and house keeping service requests were easy to use. One day our room had not been serviced by 4pm, we thought this was a little late and mentioned it and some came right away. There is a resort fee of $15 a day, however, this includes valet parking, in room wifi, telephone calls, newspaper and water – some places charge this just for wifi. The pool area is nice, however, we found it full of unpleasant ‘Vegas wannabees’ full of hot air and disrespect and it appeared as though the majority of them were not staying at the hotel. Sun loungers were available, however, sun shades were at a premium and the reserving of sun loungers early in the morning with towels was very reminiscent of Spanish hotels!! The hotel is no smoking which is great, however, there are always the minority who think they are above the rules and think they can smoke anywhere including around the pool and actually in the water. The facilities at the Vadra are somewhat limited, however, the Aria is less than a minute away with all the services you need. Again, I was worried about reviews stating that it took 20 minutes to get to the strip, this is so wrong and can only take this if you get lost. It took us about 10 tops walking through the Aria and the Bellagio and about the same down Harmon Avenue however, you still need to cut through the back of the Aria. The Valet Parking guys were very helpful, we waited no longer than a couple of minutes for our car, they offer plenty of free bottled water and if you get to know them can pick bottles up without going out in the car. Check out was very simple using the in room facility through the hotel. We had no issues at anytime with the hotel staff and found them all very helpful and responsive. I would recommend the Vadra to anyone; however, if you want a casino’s and the usual Vegas entrapments then this is not the place for you. I am not sure if we will be returning to Vegas anytime soon, if we do we would return to the Vdara in a heart beat. Recommendations would include the buffet at the Aria don’t take any notice of the bad reviews, we found it exceptional for price and quality. Viva Elvis was great, however, the theatre was no where near full so try for discount tickets. On our many visits to Vegas we have never been to Red Rock Canyon, we took it in this time and it was excellent and well worth a visit if you want to get away from all the madness on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Barely acceptable”
Reviews.Author: kriskav
Reviews.Content: Barely acceptable just about covers our stay at Vdara. We booked through Hotwire hot rate and so didn't know which hotel we would get till we paid. First off this hotel should not be rated 5 star. I have stayed in 4 star hotels with much better service and amenities. The positives: Not too far from the strip. Can access the strip through Aria or Bellagio. Very quiet. The lobby is not crowded. Quick check in and quick check out Comfortable bed Couple of complimentary water bottles with the Vdara label on them.( Minibar has other brands of water that are not complimentary.) Perfumed lobby The negatives: Front desk never picks up the phone. Room had a peculiar smell. Actually the entire floor smelt strange. Utensils not available by default. You need to ask housekeeping. We had to ask twice. Kitchen did not have a trashcan. No complimentary coffee. Also no coffee maker. We were charged for pretzels from the minibar which we never had. We're working to resolve that, but it is annoying. Overall it was just average. We'd prefer to stay in another hotel in our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but some improvement needed on housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Frostie181
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Vdara after being delayed for three hours on the way out from the UK so sending us to a room which hadn't been cleaned maybe wasn't the best start. But the staff on the front desk couldn't have been more helpful (they were clearly embarrassed that this had happened) and the room we ended up with was worth the wait. The rooms are great - really large and well equipped (though it was a little strange there was no kitchenware in the kitchen) - and also the quietest rooms I have experienced in Las Vegas. All the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful which makes staying there a pleasant experience. The location of the Vdara couldn't be better - a short walk from the hotel takes you to the back of the Bellagio and the mono rail to Crystals/Aria/Monte Carlo - which makes it easy to get to anywhere else. The only niggles were around some rough edges on the housekeeping. The hotel has a hi-tech system for indicating when you would like the room cleaned but this doesn't always seem to be taken into account, e.g. we were out for almost the whole day and had indicated that the room could be cleaned but, when we returned we found it hadn't been. These weren't serious problems though. Both the business centre and the fitness centre were well equipped - and again the staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I along with another...”
Reviews.Author: pittsteelersfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple stayed here and found it to be very quiet, relaxing and very comfortable. The valet only parking was nice as well as east access to the tram. The restaurants and bars were very expensive. A can of soda was 7 bucks and a glass of house wine was 11 bucks. A little much. Over all, very nice and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Jarred W
Reviews.Content: I appreciated Vdara's quietness. The location is OK. It's easy to get to Bellagio, Caesar's, and Monte Carlo. But it's pretty far back from the Strip in the City Center property. The pool is quite and relaxed, and the lobby is nice. The rooms were big, and our view (looking South) was great. If you want neon lights, a casino, and drunk frat boys, you may not want to stay here. But if you want a nice place, stay. The spa was good too, but small.

Reviews.Title: “Different but certainly nice”
Reviews.Author: madmadcat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent at the Vdara 4 days. We usually stay at the Wynn or Encore, but for the dates we selected these hotels were too expensive. We decided to try the Vdara. We stayed in the Aria before, and we didn't like it at all, so we were a little concerned. My husband got annoyed right away when we found out that there was only valet parking, because he doesn't like to wait for the car. It turned out that the Valet service was EXTREMELY efficient and the most we had to wait for the car was 3 minutes (timed). So, this was not an issue at all. The hotel is very nice, the room is comfortable although a little less "well thought" than others. For instance, the switch for the lights is only at the entrance of the room, and it's not possible to turn off the the lights, or open/close the shades from the bed. I was surprised too that the kitchen was COMPLETELY empty. Since they ask for a daily deposit of $100 for the room (refunded at the end of the stay), I would have thought that there was something in there. The bathroom is great, even though the selection of amenities isn't at par with other hotels of the same class (no sowing kit, no shoe mitt, no shower cap). The bed is one of the best you'll ever sleep in. If you're in a lower floor, on the pool side, you might hear the music from the pool, which starts at 1pm. The rooms facing the Bellagio hotel don't have that issue, but they're pricier since they've the "view" of the Bellagio lake. I noticed that some reviewers said that the only way to have breakfast is to spend $75 at the restaurant. This is simply not true. There is a restaurant (Silk road) open for breakfast and lunch. The service is impeccable and the food is excellent (much better than many other restaurants in Vegas). The full American breakfast (eggs, bacon, potatoes, toast, coffee and juice) is $22/person. But you can just have a coffee and a good pastry at the bar. Even take it away. There the coffee is cheaper than at Starbuck's. We had breakfast at the restaurant only once and the other days we spent around $10/person at the bar, including s generous tip. The pool is not very big, but adequate for the size of the hotel. The day beds and the cabanas cost as much as in any other luxury hotel in Vegas. There is the possibility to get umbrellas, asking the pool staff. It's free (but tips are appreciated...these umbrellas are HEAVY). The pool staff is extremely helpful and cheerful. I'd like to mention especially Zac, who approached us asking if we needed help the first day, and every day he remembered us, our name, how we wanted our chairs and would regularly check on us to see if we needed anything. They aren't pushy with their services, but if you need them, they're there. The food and drinks at the pool are very good, better than the average pool side fool in Vegas, and with the same price range (which means, not cheap...but it's Vegas). Between the waitresses, Brandie has been very nice and helpful, and she also works at times at the lobby bar. She remembered our order and our preferences from one day to the next. There is a $15 resort fee per day. This is lower than in other hotels (it's generally $20), and it is supposed to include two bottles of water/day, access to the spa/gym, and internet from the room. The problem is that the internet in the room worked only one day out of four. I asked other guests, and it was the same for them, too. If they FORCE me to pay for a service I might not want, at least that service should work. They should really work on that. Internet is like a commodity nowadays, it shouldn't be rocket science. At night there is no restaurant in service, but one can have dinner at the Lobby bar, with some nice simple "tapas style" dishes. Anyway, the hotel is right in the middle of everything, few steps from the Bellagio and the Aria, so finding food and fun isn't really an issue. This hotel clearly focuses on the level of service given to the guests, not on the number of "amenities". We had a very good, relaxing time and we will certainly consider the Vdara for our next trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay. Cant wait to get out of here!”
Reviews.Author: Bluesky02
Reviews.Content: I am presently staying at the new Vdara hotel and Spa in Vegas. I am on an anniversary t rip wife. I paid for a room with a view and am now looking at a view of a parking garage and a pool. Not quite what they promised ! I asked a couple of times if they could change the room but got stalling tactics and am still waiting for a reply after 2 days. That is why I am now writing this. The room not only does not have a view but there is loud techno music playing all day whether you like it or not, so do not plan to sleep in. They advertise the place as having suites with state of the art kitchens. The problem is that there are no utensils pots etc. You have to ask for them. They also do not supply any coffee or tea making facilities. If you are booking this hotel because it is a suite hotel DO NOT DO IT. I am spending close to $800.00 for a 3 day stay. I could have gone to a much better hotel for the same price and better amenities. I am a seasoned traveller and have spent about 3000 days in hotels and this is not good value. On the plus side. The rooms are clean and new. The bathroom facilities are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh contemporary space by Aria, Bellagio. No smoking or gambling.”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaGourmet
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a new hotel with a fresh, clean feel. The workout area on the second floor is excellent. It is between the Bellagio and the Aria, so you have a myriad of dining and entertainment options nearby. Vdara has one restaurant. Good, but as with most hotel food, pricey. You can pick up fruit, milk and other basic groceries down the strip at Miracle Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan, Dark, Sterile & NOT a 5 star hotel by the wildest stretch!”
Reviews.Author: EclecticLadyy
Reviews.Content: Suggest you READ all the unfavorable reviews before you reserve here. Stayed here because I was paranoid about all the recent bed bug reports for Las Vegas hotels. This "hotel" is new and ultra modern, so I thought it would be safe. On the plus side, there were NO bedbugs. However, the mattress and pillows were the ONLY thing luxurious about this hotel. This is NOT a luxury 5 star hotel. This place is nothing but an architect's showcase. The building is stark, sparse, depressing and extremely people unfriendly. You have to walk forever all the way to the Bellagio just to get a cup of coffee in the morning. Alternative is to drop $75 at the Vdara restaurant for a small breakfast. That's okay if you are on a business trip and your company is paying all the bills. The housekeeping service is slow, slow slow. Our "suite" reserved for four barely had towels for two and only one cheap roll of toilet paper. The kitchen is stripped bare with no coffee machine and the refrigerator temp can't be changed and is so warm is it useless. MULTIPLE calls had to be placed with the desk to get even the barest of soap and towels in the room. This hotel housekeeping appears to be severely under-staffed. Items were brought to the room one or two at a time, and we ended up multiple tipping over and over again to get things to the room. Forget the robe and slippers. You have to request everything and it gets to be irritating. All the room doors here are hard-edge and very heavy. The hand shower in the bathtub leaked all over the floor and flooded the bathroom. The ice room was a mile away and smelled foul. The halls are hot and under-lighted. In fact, the lighting in the entire hotel is very dark and gloomy. The rare hotel staff member is young, attractive, and very grim and unfriendly. NOT ONE smile or acknowledgment from any staff member in this hotel. Even though we stayed mid-week-- after Labor Day when the place seemed empty-- we still waited almost 30 minutes for the valet to get our car. There are NO benches, chairs, or a single place to sit ANYWHERE on the premises, inside or out. I pity any unknowingly families who stay here with children. The pool is tiny with ugly parking lot views. All of this made sense when I found out later (after we left) that the building was originally built as a For Sale condo and ws then converted to a hotel when the real estate market tanked. I recommend this hotel for business people who need serious work space and quiet ONLY. NOT a pleasant experience if you want to unwind and have a good time. The hotel atmosphere is like a funeral parlor. I would NEVER come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but something was missing.”
Reviews.Author: PhillipP
Reviews.Content: We had three great nights at the Vdara, Las Vegas. The positives: Great location on the strip. Non-smoking. No gambling which meant you didn't have to walk through crowds just to get to a lift. Brand new modern contemporary design. Stunning rooms with top amenities. Easy access to the Bellagio and Aria. Free valet parking. The negatives: Although the rooms were big, by American standards, calling them suites is a major overstatement. It costs a fortune to have a day bed by the pool. I felt that little thought went into designing the room - for example, the bath plug in the middle of the bath made it a hazard to lie in. I also felt that the rooms are not well looked after - the hotel has only been open a few months yet our room had permanent palm prints on the walls, stains on the cushions of the couch and a number of empty bottles used by previous residents were left in the wardrobe. What will the state of the rooms be in a few years' time? Overall it was an enjoyable stay, but I think next time I will be staying at the Mandarin next door.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are REALLY nice!”
Reviews.Author: littledumpling
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really big and have a separate kitchen (even a small stove)! Bathroom is bigger than average and there is a sitting room separated from the sleep area. The VIEW is spectacular! Our view was from the 22nd floor facing the Bellagio water fountain show/Rio Hotel. The only bad thing is that this hotel doesn't have gaming (that is good or bad based on preference). This hotel also does not have any buffet or many eateries. You would have to go to Bellagio or Aria (both on the expensive side). The blinds go up and down with a switch which is really cool (you even have the option of black out). It is also panoramic with windows stretched the entire length of wall. There are Aveda bath products, but everything else is basic as far as amenities. There are 2 flat screen TV's (one in sitting area and one facing the bed--it is back to back). The kitchen area has a table and 4 seats, which is nice because you could use it as an extra office space if traveling for business. There is also an office desk closer to the windows (if you have a nice view it could make working distracting...lol). Overall nice rooms, but service and feel of the hotel when you walk it can seem very cold and uninviting. The staff does not say hello or make you feel welcomed. Great place to stay if you don't want to deal with the gambling/smoke/roudy people, and just close enough to everything else. A rating for the rooms, C for the service, C for Food choices---oh yes and there is no parking garage...you must valet (however in Vegas there is no charge for this, just tipping). Downside is there is a resort fee of $15.00 p/night as well (however, this includes FREE WiFi).

Reviews.Title: “Vdara was awesome”
Reviews.Author: jilljjohnson
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Vegas, and I absolutely loved the Vdara. It smelled awesome, the rooms were spotless and comfortable, and it was nice and cold! The Aveda toiletries were a welcome surprise, especially the face wash and body lotion. The towels and robes are plush, all that you would expect from a luxury experience. As others have stated, you have to ask for kitchen wares. Not a big deal. Housekeeping was unobtrusive, and on spot. We enjoyed a nightcap at the Bar Vdara, where it was nice enjoying a drink while watching folks check in. We enjoyed a movie or two on the dual flat screens, and the furniture was comfy as well. Overall, though we will never go back to Vegas (ICKY) we will always have fond memories of our stay at the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Nice upscale accommodations, but could be more family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sushar
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is definitely a high-class hotel with friendly service and nice rooms. The rooms are well furnished with great views from the large sized windows and everything is neatly maintained. The service is good and the staff try to be very friendly and helpful. The location is great as well right in the center of the strip and is close to many other casinos and attractions. There is an interior walkway connecting to Bellagio and there is also a tram with stops at Aria and Monte Carlo. This is all very convenient and you don't feel the absence of a casino within the hotel. At the same time you can escape all the smoke and dinginess associated with casinos by staying at this upscale boutique hotel. One complaint though would be that the kitchens in the rooms are not well stocked and we had to make multiple requests to housekeeping to get all the things needed to make some quick meals. This can be a bit of a pain for families with small children if they choose this hotel for the kitchen facilities in the rooms. Another issue was that despite our requests on the phone and then in person to get a free room upgrade as we were visiting Vegas to celebrate a special occasion, our request was finally politely declined although they did offer to upgrade our room for the regular price. The fact that they did have the rooms available but chose not to accommodate our request kind of left a sour taste. Overall this is definitely a nice place to stay at with good facilities and service.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful smoke free environment!”
Reviews.Author: Meringue123
Reviews.Content: I read most of the reviews before going so I had a idea what some of the complaint might be. I didn't experience any of it. We got upgraded to a room with a view of the Bellagio fountain and it was fabulous. The housekeeping did a amazing job!!! Locating was really nice , 5 minute walk to the bellagio and the hotel smell so fresh and clean. The pool was small , but wasn't crowded, the servers were very attentive. It did get abearabily hot at the pool around 11:30am with the reflection from the surrounding towers, so wear alot of sunscreen people!! Overall I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice condo-turned-hotel in chic City Center”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: I booked a "mystery" (i.e. you don't get to see the actual hotel you've booked until you've charged your stay) five-star on Expedia for my most recent trip to Vegas, and it turned out to the the Vdara. (It wasn't a surprise, as there still aren't that many 5-star hotels in Vegas, and the few facts given by Expedia during the initial booking process were enough for me to be pretty certain I'd be getting the Vdara for my "South Strip 5-star" booking.) I'm glad I did. I'd read mostly very good things about both Vdara and Aria, but I liked the sound of Vdara's quieter, smoke-free atmosphere more. (And the mystery-booking price of $79/night is probably unbeatable, expect via repeat chance appearance.) As other reviewers have noted, Vdara has several major strengths: quiet, unrushed public areas and rooms (I heard hardly a sound during my 3-night stay), smoke- and casino-free property, and great City Center location with beautiful rooms. I had a room on the 52nd floor, looking south down the Strip toward the Mandalay Bay, etc. The room, with its smart but nonequipped kitchen, was clearly designed for the overheated, investment-purchase/"flipping" real-estate market in Las Vegas before the crash. But the property has made a good transition to an all-suite hotel, and it's actually a minor plus to have the kitchen, with its two small refrigerators (one for the minibar, and one for the "complimentary" hotel bottled water and your own stuff), which in any event is small and leads directly to the living portion of the suite. The room decor is lovely: modern and sleek, without being austere. And the view from the room-length picture window is wonderful, especially with the south Strip all lit up at night. The bathroom deserves its own mention: huge, with a separate walk-in shower, soaking tub, and Aveda bath products. There are neatly folded piles of thick white towels and washcloths on nearly every flat surface! Vdara has just one restaurant, Silk Road. I tried it for breakfast on my penultimate morning at the hotel; it was expensive (as one would expect) but excellent. I had a fruit salad with tahini yoghurt and breakfast sliders with sirloin and applewood bacon on brioche buns, as well as a blood orange mimosa. The service and food quality were both superlative. The hotel staff are very polished, polite, and professional; the valet guys (and girls) especially so. I don't think I ever waited more than a couple of minutes for my car. (Granted, the hotel was only 35% occupied during my stay, according to one valet.) Vdara does feel somewhat anonymous, but that's perhaps only in contrast to the glitter palaces elsewhere on the Strip, The quiet atmosphere -- and, yes, great-smelling lobby and other public areas -- are a welcome relief from smoky, overcrowded casinos and winding shopping arcades. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at Vdara and would probably return -- especially if the $79/night "mystery hotel" options were to pop up again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Theleds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 6 days of our Honeymoon. We picked this hotel as there was an offer on buy 2nights and get some free. As with other reviews the smell of a crisp clean hotel is a great change from other hotels we've stayed in on the strip. The check in was quick and we were moved to a room with view of the Bellagio fountains (fantastic!). The room was amazing and very large. The bed gave us the best sleep we had had in ages on our travels. I read the comments on the walk to the strip to the hotel being very long. Yes you do walk through the Bellagio hotel to get to the strip, but unless you are really unfit or cannot walk then it really is not a problem. Took us less than 5 minutes. All suites have a kitchen and we planned on making some lunches for ourselves, however, there is nothing in the kitchen! You have to call room service to bring a pot, pan, spatula etc. You get NOTHING! Not even a coffee maker. I asked at reception and was told the manager has had them taken out of the rooms???? There is no point in the kitchen being there- they don’t make it easy to use! Overall this was a great hotel to stay in. no Casino and smoking made it a nice retreat from the Vegas noise and smoke. The pool was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased! Peaceful boutique getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Sandmann00
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice experience. The hotel was very clean, and after a long day of seeing the sites and casinos, it was nice to come back to this hotel. Because it's not a gaming hotel the lobby was not busy with people loafing, and it was just the opposite from the rest of the strip. It didn't feel like they were trying to sell something all the time, which was a great feeling. The interior of the hotel was very up to date and probably one of the best we've seen. Great to have the kitchenette with the dining table. The hotel was very well thought out. Also it is connected to Aria, Bellagio, and Monte Carlo by Tram. I would stay here again over any of the other hotels on the strip. Even if you go to Vegas for the Casino's it's nice to come back to this hotel knowing there isn't a party in the lobby full of drunkards. Beautiful Rooms, Clean, and Very nice Decor!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, non-smoking hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbyrd
Reviews.Content: A quiet non smoking, non casino small suite hotel in a great location. 3 minute walk to Bellagio or Aria. Only one pool with plenty of chairs and best of all, NO LOUD music. Would have liked more shade @ pool. Would have loved a coffee pot in the mini kitchen. Frig & Micro was nice. Nice spa, exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: LovetoGolfMontreal
Reviews.Content: Where to start? First its well located, right smack in the middle of strip, right across from the Aria, their is no casino within the hotel so needless to mention how quiet and peaceful this place was after an exciting evening in the town ;) The rooms are spacious and very clean..only thing is that they do not have 'ALL' in ameneties in the room if u want to make food. We wanted to have breakfast in the room instead of heading out, come to find out it was 5$ per day to have the toaster delivered in the room..bummer! The pool is well located and big enough for everyone..they also have very nice cabanna's with spray water within them ;) many hot tubs and fantastic service! Just expensive...The staff are sweet, eager to please. We had a surcharge on our room and found out when we got home, I called back and they took care of it right away, i so appreciated their way of taking care of things. Its a boutique hotel, so if you are looking for a huge hotel with all kinds of restaurants, casino's and so, you may be a little disapointed. For us, this was perfect and we will be back again for sure. We are even thinking of investing at the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GregRI
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I read some mixed reviews on tripadvisor about this hotel. Overall this is a great hotel. The moment you walk into the lobby you get hit in the face with an amazing smell of freshness. The room was ultra modern, great bathroom, amazing bed (had some of my best sleeps on this bed), good amount of space. We stayed in the studio room. The location is great right in the middle of the strip. We walked everywhere on the strip, and it wasn't bad, the weather is hot but you can dip into a casino to cool down, when we traveled off the strip we took a cab. The pool was nice not too crowded which is great. The weight room was sufficient, a lot more equipment than a normal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Taqone
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for only 2 nights to sample Vegas and the grand canyon by helicopter. we managed to get this hotel cheaply by hotwire. We loved the Vdara hotel mainly because it’s a great refuge from the madness of what Vegas has to offer whilst also being in a great location. The room was great, it had a kitchen (with no equipment, you need to request them what you need) and dining area. It has a great bed, large TV, cordless phone, and also a fantastic bathroom with a separate shower where you can sit and relax, and also a bath tub on the other side. As my girlfriend said, “its simply fantastic!” The room was on the 38th floor, and you don’t really have to wait for the lift. Our view was facing the sister hotel, the Aria, and we also had the Luxor in view. There is a swimming pool and fitness centre in the hotel. The hotel is connected to the Bellagio hotel, which I think is the best hotel for the mixture of cheesiness and class. It has the casinos, great buffet food and the best water display in my opinion. Vegas is very hot, and you could get around by walking inside from hotel to hotel. The Vdara has expensive restaurants but it’s very easy to walk to the restaurants of the Aria or Bellagio, which has fantastic food for a good price. Also the Vdara is in a great location in the centre of all the main sites to see in Vegas and not far from the airport either. If you are looking for a highly comfortable room away from the madness but only a short walk to the main attractions, I would highly recommend the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvenate @ Vdara”
Reviews.Author: dana_rae4
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I have been to Vegas many times and have stayed at many different types of hotels, ranging from Imperial Palace (YUCK) to Wynn (Mmmmm). I usually go to Vegas to shop, club, people watch,and eat/drink (not always in that order), but this trip was different. My boyfriend had been through a HORRIBLE couple of months. Everything horrible that COULD happen, DID happen. So I wanted to treat him to a vacation so he could just rest. I know I know... Hard to do in Vegas. But at Vdara, it was was not only possible, it was PERFECT. I picked Vdara because it didn't have a casino and the rooms were like condos. I wanted a peaceful place so I boyfriend could just "veg" out. There's nothing more jarring to the system than a loud casino filled with smoke. CHECK-IN When you first pull up to Vdara, it DOES give you that Jetson feel. Glass and Metal. Cool exterior. You walk into the lobby and notice that is smell fresh. I think the lack of cigarrette smoke does that. Lol. It's a non-smoking hotel. The lobby is gorgeous and has a very high end boutique feel. The check in was easy. We arrived around 11 a.m., well before checkin . The young ladies at the checkin counter were gorgeous and very helpful. We asked for a room facing the Bellagio fountains. No problem. THE ROOM Took the elevator up to our room 33034. The ELEVATORS were even gorgeous. When you get to the room, it doesn't have a place to insert the key. You wave it in front of the key panel and in you go. The room has a door bell too. I thought that was a nice touch. When you walk into the room, you're greeted with a view of the kitchen/dining room area. Adequate kitchenette with two small fridges (mini bar and an empty one to store food/drink), nice sink, tons of counter space, garbage disposal, two electric glass burners, microwave and lots of cabinents. They tell you upon check in to request WHATEVER you may need for the kitchen. We just ordered plates and silverware. That's one of the reasons I wanted to stay here. I always hate that I can't finish my meal and have to leave it. We saved ALOT of money on late night snacking with that microwave. lol The living room and bedroom are seperated by a dividing wall that has a two large screen tvs on either side. There are hidden hook ups for EVERYTHING. Ipod, phone, MP3, video camera, etc. Very nice. Decor of living room was nice. Dark wood, light floors, green pictures, beautiful lamps and accessories. The room had THREE huge paned windows that stretched the length of the room. The bedroom was beautiful and pristine. Comfortable and crisp linens. Loved it. The shades were automatic. Beautiful fabrics as well. WONDERFUL views. By the front door, they have a buttons you can push to let the maid sevices that you want them to clean the room or not to disturb. No more door hangers. Ample closet and draw space throughout the room. Bathroom was spacious. Aveda products provided. HUGE soaking tub and seperate shower. The ONLY negatives about the room were the lighting and water pressure. VERY MINOR. The lighting system was COMPLICATED. Took me about 10 minutes to figure out. They had too many switches and dimmers. They need to streamline it a little. I understand WHY they did it the way they did, but it was a little overkill. The water pressure in the shower was a little weak, but nothing to complain about. LOCATION The location is fine. I know people complain because they feel like they have to walk a MILE to get to the Strip. These people are lazy and over dramatic. Vdara is connected to Bellagio (CENTER STRIP). You walk through Bellagio, out the main entrance and TA-DA, The Strip. It's not that serious. After a long day of shopping, it may seem a little long, but the welcoming quiet nature of Vdara is well worth it. AMENITIES When at the hotel, we used the pool, the main bar, and the hung out in our room. Because this was a "chill" vacation, we wanted to just relax alot. Because the room is like a condo, I didn't feel like I was wasting time by hanging out in my room. The room set up makes it conducive to just "hang out". The pool was nice. Adequate. Nothing to fancy. I liked that I didn't have frat boys and teeny bikini girls spilling drinks and singing along to Miley Cyrus songs. It was cool. Main bar was good. Drinks were average price, and STRONG. The hotel doesn't offer much in the area of restaurants. They have Silk Road, but that place is EXPENSIVE. We usually ran over to Planet Hollywood to eat. They do not have a convience store so to speak either. You can run to Bellagio to get some things if necessary. Overall, Vdara was EXCELLANT. I loved it to pieces. My boyfriend had a great time NOT doing his average Vegas thing. If you want a relaxing place to retreat to, but STILL be able to access the craziness of The Strip, Vdara IS IT!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was peaceful, the spa was disorganized.”
Reviews.Author: 00melena80
Reviews.Content: The Vdara hotel had an upscale atmosphere with friendly staff and beautiful accommodations. A selling point for us was the kitchen, which unfortunately provided no cookware or dishes. The room was spacious and very clean, however, so we were overall pleased. Another selling point was the spa, which unfortunatly proved to be disorganized despite their strict cancellation policies (24 hours notice required or full charge for services.) I arrived 30 minutes early at the spa's direction, was rushed upstairs, and left waiting while other customers were being given tours, offered tea, etc...A staff member finally asked me if I had wandered upstairs when I informed them that I was shown upstairs by the front desk and given no further direction. I discovered other customers were given tours of the facility, an explanation of services provided, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel overall but be realistic with expectations...”
Reviews.Author: SBRitz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vdara for 5 days in early August. The hotel is fantastic overall. It feels brand new. Lobby is expansive and airy and smells incredible. Everytime we left we missed the unique scent that the Vdara lobby contained. We came to the hotel very late on a Friday night around 1am. Our taxi dropped us off the entrance but there was literally no one to be found. We were not overly concerned nor upset at this - no matter what the time, a premium hotel such as this should have available staff to greet new guests to the hotel but generally we like taking our own bags anyway. Check is was a few minutes. This of course had to do with the time involved, but we noticed throughout our stay that the lines never looked longer than a handful of individuals at a time. The attendant was quick and polite. Our room was on the 38th floor. We asked for adjoining rooms with my father in law but instead were given rooms a few rooms apart. Both our rooms were outstanding with excellent views overlooking the rear of the Bellagio Hotel and Pool. The rooms themselves looked virtually brand new. The excellent sofa did not have any indentations to make it appear used in at all. All furnishings were like new. The room consists of a large space that is artificially divided with a large entertainment type center with LCD TVs on both sides. One side contains the "living" space with excellent high end sofabed, twin glass coffee tables and desk that is part of the aforementioned entertainment center that bisects the room. On the other side is the "sleeping" area that contains a huge King size bed along with two end tables with drawers. The bed was amazing. Sealy Postturepedic Mattress Pillow Top. The same kind we have at home that we paid over $1000.00 for. We had our baby with us and she spit up on the sheets so we peeled them away for the maid. We looked at the mattress and frankly were surprised to see that is was completely pristine. No marks, stains or any kind. That made us sleep even better. The linens, pillows and mattress quality literally made for the best sleep I ever had at any hotel. The room is connected to a small kitchen/eating area that contains a decently sized sink, mini fridge and two electric burners along with a very nice dining table for two. This was the main reason we selected this hotel since we were traveling with our baby and wanted a sink and fridge to clean bottles and store food. For this the kitchen was indispensable. We purchased some eggs, bread, cold cuts, beer and water - light groceries and barely fit what we needed in the tiny fridge. But it still served its purpose. The kitchen initially is completely bare. Any items needed must be requested. We made a list of what we needed and called the front desk. Within 15 minutes someone came by with a saucepan, frypan, spatula, four sets of silverware and four sets of plates and bowls. Everything was newish and the the cookware was high end stainless steel. The bathroom is really the defining feature of these room. It is huge. Styling is very modern-euro. There is a huge tub that could easily fit two people with separate spout and shower head. The stand up shower is large with a separate enclosed sitting area and encased in glass. We loved this bathroom. The hotel is connected by walkway to Bellagio. You can go from the lobby of the Vdara directly to the Bellagio without really being subjected to the elements. From the Vdara hotel to the Bellagio Casino is about 10 minutes or less depending on how fast you walk. I walk fast but with the baby and stroller it took me about 10 minutes to walk from the our hotel room to the buffet area of the Bellagio. The Aria Hotel is directly next door as well. This brings us to the main reason we stayed at the Vdara outside of the mini kitchen - the lack of a casino. Since we were bringing our baby, we wanted to minimize her exposure to smoke and other negative elements commonly associated with Vegas Hotel life. The Vdara was exactly as advertised - extremely chic, modern, clean and smoke free. There is a small bar in the front of the hotel as well a small restaurant that only serves breakfast and lunch. There is no casino. There is no nightlife. You can easily walk next door to the similarly new, chic and modernly styled Aria hotel for all this or walk 10 minutes to Bellagio and beyond. For us it was perfect. We were isolated outside of the strip and strip traffic as well as casino goers in a serene hotel. But once we wanted to venture out, it was very easy to go to Bellagio and the other hotels from there. Anyone going in with these expectations will no doubt love this hotel. Anyone expecting to find a standard big gaming hotel environment akin to MGM Grand with a large casino, tons of restaurants and bars will be sorely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lll0412
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is off the strip, but it's quiet and its easy to get to the strip through the Bellagio, which in 100+ temps is preferable anyway. We were on the 50th floor over looking the Bellagio fountains - the panoramic view was incredible. The "suite" was comfortable and luxurious, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were there for a week and would, without question, go back again it was that good.

Reviews.Title: “Great room.”
Reviews.Author: huskerbuddy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and a great time. Room was beautiful and very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Pool was nice, but quiet. A quick walk thru Bellagio gets you to the strip. Spa was fantastic. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Gollyman
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean with very helpful staff. The decor in the hotel is unbelievable right down to the elevators. We stayed in a deluxe room which had a kitchen and electric blinds and all sorts of luxury bits including a very comfy bed. The pool area is very nice with lots of loungers and couches. Less than 10 min walk to the strip via the Bellagio corridor. We chose this hotel as it had no casino and was non-smoking throughout. Having walked through every other major hotel on the strip I can safely say that the Vdara is far newer, far nicer and far quieter than anything else we saw. The concierge booked an airport shuttle for us and got us show tickets without any fuss. We ate in the buffet of the next door Aria which is very nice too but has a casino and is very expensive to stay. The buffet food was exceptional, far nicer than the Bellagio which was average. All in all if you want a quiet ultra-luxurious base to tour Vegas than this is the place for you. The Bellaglio casino is less than a 10 min walk away and the Aria casino is literally a 2 min walk across the car park! However if you want the hustle and bustle of casinos and tourists and long queues then maybe the Bellaglio, Caesars or MGM is a better choice for you. The Vdara was excellent value for money compared to the other hotels on the strip and is quite simply the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “THis hotel is Perfect for a Business Traveler Only”
Reviews.Author: healthmate13
Reviews.Content: This hotel although state of the art, belongs in the center of Chicago and not Las Vegas. It is difficult to walk to and off the strip.IT lacks restaurants. THe rooms are very clean, spacious, and smoke free. Perfect for a business person who needs quiet. There is no casino ...Staff is friendly and helpful. .

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: lynne499520
Reviews.Content: The vdara hotel was the best in every way and we would recommend it to everyone. The hotel is ideally situated in the new citycentre complex and was adjoined to the Bellagio and the Aria by a short walk way. It was also central to the Las Vegas strip. The room was spacious and spotless and we also had a great view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip. The hotel was suitable for our holiday as it was peaceful and relaxing without a casino yet close to all the entertainment. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We hope to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stay, but very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mburton0000
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Vegas on our way home from a vacation. We used Hotwire to find a room and we did get a good deal for the hotel. We arrived late at night after a day on the road and were greeted by the valet and assisted with our bags. We had no trouble checking in and our room was upgraded to one with a view of the fountains at Bellagio. The bed was VERY comfortable and we both got a great night's sleep. The room was nice and large, very luxurious, however, there was a bit of a smell in the bathroom. We probably should have called the front desk about it, but were worn out from a day on the road. Since there is no casino in the hotel, it was very quite and relaxing. The next morning we spent some time at the pool which was not crowded that early, and generally just enjoyed relaxing. We were able to check out via the TV and had no problems. Overall, it was a very nice hotel, however, I don't know that I would have stayed there were it not for the excellent deal through Hotwire. If you are looking for the full Vegas experience, this is NOT the place for you. It is a short walk to the strip and there is a walkway to the Bellagio, but it isn't really in the middle of the action, so to speak. We walked over the the hotel across the way (Aria, also part of City Center) to check out the Casino, it was nice, but, as you can imagine, higher stakes gambling than some of the other places on the strip. If you are looking for a relaxing place to enjoy some down time, this wouldn't be a bad choice!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel - but a trek to the strip!”
Reviews.Author: pompeyone
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel as it should be for the price, however upon arrival a couple of small niggles such as lights not working, plug in sink not emptying, stained throw on bed. Complained at reception was offered change of room, but as we were only staying a few days declined and just asked for the things to be put right, however had to ask again the next day! They were recitified at the second time of asking. The restaurant and bar were both pricy compared to the rest of Vegas, although they both looked nice. Room was out of this world with fabulous views over some of the hotels and Bellagio fountains. Even though this hotel is just off the strip, it does take a good 20 minute walk to get to the main street. All in all its a nice place but for the money you could stay at any of the equally gorgeous hotels on the strip itself. Felt some of the staff were a little impersonal at times, however the bellhops, valets, room maids were all excellent and deserved their tips.

Reviews.Title: “Cant imagine staying anywhere else but Vdara!”
Reviews.Author: el1427
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 4 year old daughter. The location was perfect within walking distance to major hotels and attractions. It is linked to the Bellagio and across the street to Paris. The hotel is very nice and clean, they’ve done a great job to create a relaxing atmosphere….its the perfect getaway from the busy streets and bright lights of Las Vegas, but never leave the strip. We enjoyed the room so much that we subconsciously took longer to get ready than we normally do. I honestly don’t think I will ever stay anywhere else while visiting Las Vegas, why should I if I found something I absolutely LOVE!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Luxurious Hotel in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: enmichels
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed at the Vdara with my mom for 3 nights. Our trip was to see Tom Jones and The Phantom of the Opera. We love Vegas and travel here once a year. Compared with The Mirage, Palazzo, and Caesars, Vdara was by far the best. It was as if we were staying at a luxurious hotel in Mexico or Caribbean but in the middle of Vegas! When you walk in you smell this amazing aroma. Then there is a bar, and lobby, everything is quiet, you do not have 1,000 people bumping into you, no line, nice people at the check in counter. Our room was on the 41st floor, overlooking the pool and mountains. I have had better views at other hotels but the room is what made everything just great. We had a Vdara Suite, 811 sqft, full kitchen and fridge, living room, bedroom, and large bath. The Bed was very comfortable, great pillows and blankets. The air conditioning worked very well. If you need plates or anything they will bring them right up for you, just call the day you get there and you won't need to worry about it. Pool was amazing! If you like to tan, you will enjoy it here. It is located on the 3rd floor, so you don't need to walk through a casino like all of the other hotels to get to it. There is no one there, plenty of lounge chairs, you can have as many towels as you would like, and they have water and cups out at all times. They also pass around amazing margaritas and pink lemonades for free, very refreshing. It gets very hot though, say it is 105 in Vegas, it is 130 in between the glass hotels in the City Center! I loved it! The Vdara is connected from a sky walk to the Bellagio, literally a 1 minute walk. It also is a 1 minute or less walk to the Aria, you just walk on a pathway outside. Aria is a very nice hotel also! It does not take long to get to the strip. You can walk through either hotel (Bellagio or Aria). Vdara is set back exactly in line with Bellagio, so the distance from the Bellagio to the strip is the same as the Vdara to the Strip. Believe me it is no big deal! If you go to Vegas and want to see Phantom of the Opera, I suggest getting the cheapest seats possible because it wasn't worth the 175 per person for 2nd row that we spent. The show bored me, people literally were falling asleep around us. The week before we went we saw Wicked, and that blew Phantom away! Next time I am there I will spend my money on a Cirque show , maybe 'O'. I will be returning to Vdara, it is my favorite hotel is Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed very much for our honeymoon and 1st trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kychica
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Vdara for our honeymoon. This was my first trip to Vegas, and the town and hotel surpassed my expectations. I had a preconceived notion of Vegas as faux-glitz and showgirls. This hotel has a very nice, luxe, understated feel. I enjoyed the sleek and modern furnishings, and our whole experience was great. My husband and I have both traveled quite a bit, and we both agree that this is our new favorite place to stay. Our room on the 38th floor had a view of the Bellagio fountains, which was a great bonus. Check in was fast (but we arrived really late at night, so I would have been really surprised if there had been a line). We knew ahead of time that there would be a $15/night "resort fee" to allow access to the gym and pool and provide a daily newspaper, bottled water, and Aveda toiletries. We were pleasantly surprised to learn that this would also include our daily valet parking (except tip). It was also very convenient to have a kitchen and table in the room. There is a Whole Foods about a mile down the road, so we went there for some breakfast foods and snacks. It's easy to request dishes and silverware from the front desk when you need them. The glass shower and separate soaking tub were great. The room has cool motorized shades/curtains that you control with a button. Bed was very comfortable. Large flat-screen TV. Plenty of drawer/closet space. Lap-top sized safe was easy to use. We loved that the hotel was smoke-free and gaming-free. That made everything so nice and quiet and peaceful even though you are just moments from the action of the strip. It's attached to the Bellagio by a walk-way, and it is also accessible to the tram. The pool was quiet as well, and the waiter was walking around with free samples of frozen pink lemonade and non-alcoholic daquiris. We will definitely stay again when we go back to Vegas. OH! One last thing, there is a button by your door that you have to push to light it up if you want housekeeping to turn your room. We weren't aware of that the first day or two, and we were perplexed about why our room was being skipped.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites hidden inside of CityCenter”
Reviews.Author: jeremydbrooks
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite for one night so the wife and I could get away from the house for a day (we live nearby), and found a special posted on Facebook. There were some negative comments on Facebook that didn't really seem to make sense ("off-strip", "boring"?) so I was a bit hesitant. It's CityCenter, you can't be much more on the Strip without sleeping on the median in the middle of Las Vegas Blvd, and that itself cast enough doubt on those comments for me to book the room. After checking in and exploring, I think I get the comnents: there's no casino in the building, and it's offset behind the rest of CityCenter and kind of hidden from the actual street. But, again, it's right in the middle of CityCenter so, in my mind, Vdara is a perfect mix of a quiet place to sleep and hang out while being within steps from the action (Bellagio and Aria were maybe fifty yards in either direction, and Crystals is just a bit further but there is a free tram between the three). Apparently the bar does close at 2am, but, again, you're just around the corner from plenty of alternatives. The room was great: clean, well-appointed with full-size appliances, and very quiet. We had a view of the Bellagio fountains in one direction and the Bellagio pool in another (as well as the unused pool in what I assume is a CityCenter condo building). Room service was pricey, but they don't just drop the food off--they set up our kitchen like a little restaurant and asked when they could return to clean up for us. Food was very good. Malted Belgian waffles were unique, but very good (almost too sweet, though, more like a pastry than a regular waffle). Breakfast burrito weighed about 3 pounds. I still, however, give them 5 stars for price since we really just wanted the room, and room service was an unplanned impulse thing we tried since we saved money on the room. All staff we interacted with were professional and helpful--concierge, front desk, MoD, and room service. Lastly, the room was a great value--it was an advertised special of 10% off, but it was still almost 40% cheaper than every other nearby (wanted to be close to the Paris for a show) casino that I price-checked on the web before booking, including, if memory serves, Luxor, Excalibur, MGM, Bellagio, Monte Carlo, Paris, and NYNY. Was very happy with the experience, would definitely recommend to friends and family coming through town. We stayed at the Palms earlier this year, and Vdara blew them away. If you don't need to be able to push money into a slot machine within six steps of the elevator door but still want to be right in the middle of pretty much everything you could want on the Strip, Vdara is worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: usuktravellers
Reviews.Content: My team and I had a wonderful experience in the Vdara, which is one block off the Strip but only a 5 minute walk to the Bellagio over an enclosed skywalk. The staff were unbelievably trained, efficient and personable. The service was top notch, even pampering. Nevertheless, the best part about Vdara is how quiet and serene the hotel is - check-in took 3-4 minutes with no line like at every other property in LV - but literally 5 minute walk from all the action. Restaurant in the hotel is really good, as are the cafes in the Aria behind the Vdara. Rooms were spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, but Far From the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Hadro
Reviews.Content: Vdara has wonderful rooms. I found a great deal through lasvegasforcheap.com and stayed there for $75 a night over the weekend. It was January, but this is still a great rate. The room was separated into a living room and bedroom. The living room had a pullout couch and its own tv. The bedroom also had its own tv. The bathroom was awesome. It was very large, had a tub, and a shower. The main problem with Vdara is that it is far from the Strip. The best way to get to Las Vegas Blvd. is to go through Bellagio, which will take at least 15 minutes. The nearest casino is Aria, but getting to the Strip that way is also annoying. Perhaps it will be better when the Cosmopolitan opens in December because that will add another casino to City Center. Overall Vdara is wonderful, and the hotel is great. The only problem is the distance to the Strip. There is a $15 resort fee per night. So consider that when booking because it will not be included in your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: JAT600
Reviews.Content: The minute we stepped foot in this hotel we relaxed. Las Vegas is crowded, noisy, and busy, but the Vdara is like an oasis of calm luxury. They don't have gambling or a lot of restaurants and shopping so it's so much more quiet than any other hotel we walked through in Las Vegas. Every room is a suite and we loved going into our room after a day and/or night on the strip. We had a great view of the Bellagio fountains and the most delicious bed, towels, decor, and service.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: toverstreet3
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas and we had planned on visiting a friend that I hadn't seen in 16 years so our stay was slightly longer than the average LV traveler. The Vdara was definitely not a 5 star hotel. It was nice but I would compare it to a pricey 3 star. The hotel just opened in 2009 but our room appeared a lot older. There was a big stain on the carpet and the table looked like someone had taken keys and purposely scarred it. My husband and I own a commercial cleaning business so we're usually lenient on janitors and maids but, this must be said. The maids did lousy jobs on cleaning the room and we had to place calls to housekeeping several times over the course of our stay to have the face cloths and cups replaced after the room was so called cleaned. The room was not mopped at all while we were there and there was dust everywhere. It is a green hotel so they cleaned with vinegar which is not very appealing to the nose (they do have green products that are not as offensive). :( The iron is secured to the ironing board so it makes it a little cumbersome to iron your clothes.
