One of the reasons I picked Vdara is because it had a stove and refrigerator. The refrigerator was very, very small and the bigger side was a mini bar. We thought that we could move the items in the mini bar to accommodate the food that we purchased but found out that we had been charged over $200 because if you open the door and move anything, the refrigerator automatically registered the items as being consumed. Fortunately for us, we got that straightened out but ended up having to throw away some of the food. Its only restaurant closes at 2pm and there is no entertainment in this hotel but you don't have to go far to find it. Overall, the hotel was not the worst but it definitely did not live up to our expectations. We could have paid a little less and been a lot happier.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere but here...”
Reviews.Author: dr10596
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the poorest customer service of any resort in Las Vegas. To anyone reading this consider if you would stay here if during YOUR stay a family member passed away and you had to leave immediately. Not only did Vdara doubt the story and refuse to issue a refund for the remaining day(s) THEY ASKED FOR A COPY OF THE FUNERAL PROGRAM. All just to check out early without a penalty. Vdara - your conduct here was detestable. You and your management should be ashamed of the way you conduct business. Especially in today's economy we consumers have choices - and my choice as well as that of my family and friends will be to never spend our vacation dollars with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: msmall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara from July 21-25 and it was truly heaven on earth. Everything from the check-in to our actually stay could not have been better. We got what I would consider a deal on this hotel (less than $100 a night - not including the resort fee) and our stay was just great. We were given a room on the 27th floor facing the pool, no complaints from us, and it was clean and very comfortable. The lobby was never crowded and the staff were always helpful. I cannot comment on housekeeping as we did not use them during our stay, except for once to get fresh towels. We had a rental car and never waited more than 2-3 minutes for our vehicle. Each time we came out or returned they recalled who we were and addressed us by name, which I thought was nice. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but I rarely saw anyone else in there either. I was a little bit worried about the walk to Bellagio from prior reviews but I need not have bothered. I took me less than 30 seconds to actually walk the breezeway and then only about another 2 minutes to actually get to the casino. It was never a problem for me. The tram ran quickly and was easy to use to get to Aria and Monte Carlo. I have been to Vegas at least once for the past 4 years staying at various hotels (Mandalay Bay x3, Palazzo x3, and Aria) but the Vdara has been my best stay yet. It allowed me to get some much needed rest but still enjoy the feeling of Vegas when I wanted to. It was really great and I would return again in a heartbeat. Thanks Vdara for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “about as great as i expected! all it takes is a little research & homework!”
Reviews.Author: dinadlc3
Reviews.Content: we just got back a couple of days ago from a 4 night girls trip to vegas. OMG, the hotel was exactly what i was hoping for. it was really nice, relaxing, No Smoke lingering anywhere (which was a big factor in choosing our hotel). check in was a breeze. 1 person in front of me, 2 people at the counter. when a line started forming, they quickly found another person to start helping people check in. at check out there was a bit of a line (from hearing people talk behind me they were all there for the same conference), but they put 4 people out to help. checking in & out was very easy. OH! and i forgot to tell the credit card company that i was leaving Texas & traveling to Nevada. the girl at the check in counter gave me the option of using a debit card OR cash for the deposit. so those of you that don't use credit cards, they take cash now. (i actually found that easier because you got the cash back at check out rather than waiting for them to process everything to put it back on your card!) i asked for an upgrade, but the girl at the counter said there weren't any available because they had a conference in the hotel. (which is exactly what the girl next to her told the couple SHE was helping. so I'm assuming it was true!) when i got into the room, i called housekeeping to ask them for everything i needed for the kitchen. (all you'll find is 2 mugs). they came RIGHT away with it all. you need to tell them EXACTLY what you need. our room was gorgeous, just as big as i expected. the view wasn't of the strip (i was hoping for a view of the fountains) but i did get a great view of the mountains & the backsides of luxor, nyny, Mandalay bay, etc. all the lights were still really cool. housekeeping did a great job! every morning they came in to clean the room & every night they came in to turn down the main bed & the sofa bed (at our request). everything was always done really well (except one day where they didn't make the bed & they left a cleaning towel in the tub which was no big deal.) & they were REALLY nice! the bed was SOOOOO comfortable! it was soft & the blankets and pillows were fluffy. heaven! the shower was AWESOME! we didn't go to the spa, pool or gym (boo.) so i don't have a comment about those. if you want more bottled water, just ask the housekeepers in the hallway! they'll run & get you some. from what i heard, they also had some in the gym for free too. I've only been to vegas 3 times now, and this is the best hotel so far! we're planning another trip with spouses/boyfriends in December & we've already decided we're staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Luxury with Craziness Close By!”
Reviews.Author: Drakestar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara for four nights at the end of July 2010 including a weekend. We LOVED the valet. They were fast and very courteous. The hotel is very easy to access, Harmon basically dead ends at the hotel entrance/valet. The lobby and check in staff were great, we were given a room on the 38th floor with a view of the Bellagio fountains and Paris as well as the freeway and mountains in the distance. The room was very clean as it should be since it is a new hotel. We never had to wait for an elevator during our entire trip. The kitchen is only equipped with two coffee cups, although you can request plates etc if you like (we were advised this upon check in). The two televisions are beautiful. The bed is super comfy and the linens are spectacular. The bathroom was spacious as well. The only negatives with the room: the shower door slams loudly when you close it, only one bar of soap supplied, and the bathroom floor is SLIPPERY!; the blackout blinds are fun (automatic) but where they meet up lets light in, so not completely blackout, the fridge (for our use) was not cold, but we had to fiddle around with it, and eventually it cooled down). The service staff were great as well. One day we were in and out of the room a lot and kept missing housekeeping so they texted us to see when would be the best time to clean the room. The stopper in the sink stopped working, once we called maintenance was in our room within 10 minutes and fixed it in 5 minutes. We loved the modern aspect of it, especially the doorbell and door indicator lights. We also loved getting back to our quiet hotel after visiting the other casinos (Aria and Bellagio are a close walk (5-7 minutes max). The pool was nice, never too crowded. They really should add some palm trees to provide shade, the umbrella’s they provide (lots of them) are confusing and difficult to use) and they should cover up the UGLY parking garage. Just a couple of notes regarding the extra fees. We made a 8 minute call to Canada which cost $40. Insane. We ordered two drinks at the pool (margarita types), they were $30, and two coffees in the lobby were $10. The resort fee is a joke. You get two small bottles of water and a newspaper. I wonder how many people actually have time to read a paper in Vegas. It also includes internet service which we used once. You can pickup bottles of water for free at the valet stand as well. I’d stay here again, but the resort fee is a money grab.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but lacked basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: RCD_08
Reviews.Content: My main concern is the lack of a sundries shop to buy incidentals on your own like a soda, snacks, or a bottle of water. Food and beverage were overpriced. After hours room service was a very, very limited menu and the only drinks available were a bottle of water. I paid $5 for a tiny bottle of water and $18 for a club sandwich. Mixed drinks were $15. Service and presentation were excellent. Room was spacious and comfortable. I loved the automatic blinds. They also had complimentary valet parking, which was a plus. I like that the hotel is an all-suite hotel, but did not like that you did not have an option for 2 queen beds.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a condo”
Reviews.Author: alicia_darcy
Reviews.Content: You know how apartments and condos feel different from hotel rooms -- not quite as clean, not as luxurious, and filled with stuff you don't really need on a vacation? That's how it was with the Vdara. It all made sense when I spotted the sales pavillion promoting Vdara residential sales. We stayed three nights. The lobby was clean and smelled great. The employees were nice. The Deluxe Suite is small. It has tiled floors -- no carpets. There was some hair gel on the counter from the previous tennant. The bathtub stopper wouldn't work. The kitchen light was burned out. There were four hangers and no slippers. Housekeeping was unpleasant: "We will put in a work order, but we have no idea how long it will take." "You have to request slippers if you want them." The view was horrible. Who wants to watch the Bellagio fountains from the back and so far away, especially without the accompanying music -- pointless. You can't see the strip. With so many great strip hotels available to choose, all running great specials, most with superior pools, much better views, and actual restaurants, there's really no reason to choose Vdara again. I won't be staying in City Center again but would advise someone wanting to try it out to stay at the Aria -- it has similar bells and whistles (electronic blinds, doorbells, fast elevators) but also better pools, easier strip access and an outstanding buffet. It's like the cab driver said: "It doesn't even look like Las Vegas. It doesn't fit in." If you want something that doesn't look and feel like Las Vegas ... if you don't want the "Vegas" experience, why go there at all!? Usually a trip to Vegas will tie me over for six months -- not this time. I am going back next week and will be staying at the Venetian. They have some great deals right now.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in - first class service!”
Reviews.Author: Kay-Marie7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend whilst we were visiting Vegas for his 40th. We only booked this hotel the day before on the internet and got a cracking rate. When we arrived valet service was free of charge which was a first. Check in was speedy which was a nice change from everywhere else in Vegas and the service in the bar was brilliant. We were taken up to our room which was beautiful with fabulous views, however there was a small issue in that it hadn't been laundered and we'd accidentally been given the key too early. I wouldn't have been bothered by this as they were extremely apologetic which was enough for me, but they insisted on upgrading us immediately to a better suite. The suite we had (53003) was out of this world! Spotlessly clean, fabulous and amazing views. We had a gorgeous kitchen with dishwasher, fridge, freezer, washer, dryer, en suite bathroom. We had a lounge area with brilliant view, flat screen TV and comfy sofa, this also had an area with a desk in. The bathroom had twin sinks, a big shower which you could easily fit two in with a seat and a bath you could sit in and gaze at the wonderful view. What can I say - I didn't want to go out!! The only thing that was wrong with this hotel was we didn't stay long enough in it!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Trinkettes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were a little concerned prior to arriving at Vdara because of all of the bad reviews we had read. BUT it appears Vdara took their guests' comments to heart and really made huge improvements. We found the staff to be friendly and we had a great stay. We spent the 4th of July long weekend at Vdara, and it was truly an oasis in the over-crowded Las Vegas strip. As soon as we entered the walkway leading from Bellagio to Vdara, a calm peaceful feeling came over us. The location is great - we do not like the hustle and bustle of the strip, but we enjoy the restaurants and shopping so Vdara is very well situtated. We never had to take a cab because we used the very convenient tram (free) to get from place to place. We are not gamblers so Vdara is the perfect hotel for us - no casino! We spent the majority of our days at the Vdara pool. While it is not big, it is good enough for a fast weekend getaway. Just make sure to get there early as it does fill up with people looking for chairs and umbrellas. You should secure an umbrella as soon as you find your chairs because umbrellas are not very plentiful and the sun is a killer in Vegas. (Ask one of the very helpful pool guys to help you with the umbrella as they are very heavy to move.) The food was OK at the pool, and we ate there for lunch more out of time-management to stay by the pool for as long as possible. The pool water was warm which I love! There are also a couple of secluded smaller pools which had zero people so look for those if the main pool gets too crowded. My last comment about the pool - the music was just right for me (easy listening dance/pop). It was not loud and pounding like most pools in Vegas which try to go for a club scene. The room was nice and new - the best feature was that is was large. We had a standard room, but it was very spacious. There were actually 2 TV's in the room! The bedding was great - white comforters and the most fabulous bed. I have slept in my fair share of hotel beds and this bed was one of the best - that is a big compliment coming from me. The only downside to the room was that it had some housekeeping issues. I noticed the carpet was not vacuumed when we checked in and it was not vacuumed throughout our stay. Plus the bathroom was not fully cleaned - there was hair in the shower drain from a previous guest (sorry for the gross detail). I would not say this is a 5 star hotel. They need to improve the housekeeping, but I let that slide because I enjoyed the room so much. We did not eat at any of the restaurants at Vdara. But a couple of final fast comments about the surrounding new places...The Aria buffet is not great, but OK in a pinch. Do not bother going to the Crystal Court shopping center - it is not 100% occupied and the stores are all over-priced designer stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: darwin96
Reviews.Content: Vdara is a nice property but in terms of service it is a 4 or even 3.5 star trying to sell itself as a 5 star. I did not have any pleasant interactions with the front desk staff. They have some sort of bizarre (club like) strict enforcement of no early check-in policy. We were only there one hour before check in and were curtly told we had to wait for the official check in time. My inquiry about whether that was because there were truly no rooms ready or because it's just a rule did not get a friendly response. So we wait, along with about 50 other parties trying to check in. Check in time comes and we all get in long lines to check in. So they did have rooms ready. This is an assanine policy for a so-called 5 star hotel! Why would you make your guests mill around in the lobby for an hour and then endure a line if you had the rooms. It felt like a 28 year old club manager ran the front desk. There were other similar interactions...don't have the time to tell about all of them. The bar and pool wait staff were very pleasant. We liked our room; it was very nice. The pool is too small for the size of the hotel but is unique in Vegas in that it is situated for all-day sun which was nice. The location in the new City Center is not as convenient as we thought it would be. City Center is just like the rest of Vegas. If you think you'll be in some sort of walkable truly urban neighborhood, think again.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews! Vdara is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: We recently took a long weekend and stayed at Vdara for a few nights, and I have nothing bad to say about this amazing resort! Check-In: We arrived more than 3 hours before the check-in time, but they had a room ready for us. At the front desk we were asked if we would like a high floor with a good view or a lower floor. Obviously we said higher floor and that's exactly what we got. We got a room on the 39th floor with awesome views of the Bellagio Fountains. The Room: The room was so beautiful. The pictures on the website, or even on here don't come close to doing these rooms justice. They are set up in a very convinient and practical way. The seperate living room area is perfect for relaxing and watching TV, or you can just lay in the bed. There is 2 huge tv's in the room! The bathroom is also very nice. A big shower and a soaking tub, with plenty of counter space, which is good if you are bringing a girlfriend or wife with you! There was a lot of smaller things in the room that we were very intrigued with. First off the black out blinds and shades were controlled by the push of a button, which was very modern and fun. Also, each room had a door bell on the outside, and there was a light ring around the door bell. From a button inside the room you could set the color of the light to blue or green. Blue meaning no housekeeping or do not disturb, and green letting them know it was ok to clean the room. Service: The service was top notch! The front desk agent was very polite and not at all what we expected. All the front desk agents were very good looking and they all looked snobby, but that was not what we encountered at all. I wish I remembered her name, but the gal who checked us in was very polite and helped us out, and got us that awesome room. Another thing to say about the excellent service is how prompt and effective the housekeepers are. We left to go get some lunch, and were gone less than an hour before we came back to change, and the room was already clean and waiting for us. I dont know if this was luck or if there is someone waiting for that light to turn green so they can clean your room, but whatever they are doing it is working! Atmosphere: Like every review states, the atmosphere at Vdara is so peaceful and calming. There is an amazing smell that is pumped in to the lobby and that was our favorite part about returning to the hotel was the fresh smell you get when you walk through the doors. It also helps that it is non smoking and there is no casino so it was always very peaceful. Pool/Fitness Center/etc: We did not use any of the spa or pool, but we did visit the pool on the way up to our room at one point. It was very busy but looked nice. Although I would have expected more from a pool in vegas, but it didn't bother us, we didn't come to vegas to swim! Value: This hotel has great value! We stayed a Sunday and Monday night so we got the cheaper rate, and it was well worth every penny. I would easily pay over 200 a night to stay at Vdara, and we payed barely over 100! The service fee is 15 dollars a night, but not a big deal at all. You get two small water bottles in your room every day. A newspaper, but mainly you get free Wifi and Wired internet. I know you are probably thinking, It's Vegas, why would I need the internet, but it is convinient to have at the end of the day when you are getting ready for bed, or even to help plan out your day in the morning. It also covers Valet cost and bell service (tip not included) Other: The elevators are super fast! Everyone said it in their comments but I had no idea what to expect. We would literally go from floor 1-39 in about 10 seconds. It feels like you are on Tower of Terror (Disneyland or Disneyworld Ride). So those were a lot of fun. Valet and bell service was fast and friendly. Vdara is also very close to the free city center tram and Bellagio, which makes getting to the strip very convinient, and also fun, getting to walk through Bellagio or take the tram. Negatives: I had to think for a while to come up with anything negative about Vdara, but there is a few things, nothing major though. First, like someone previously mentioned, the hallways did seem pretty warm. But once you got into your room the A/C in there was fine. Although we had issues with ours (the guests before us turned the heat on and we kept turning the temp down and couldnt figure out why it wasnt getting cooler until we realized the heat was on) but this was our own fault. Once we got it going it was very cool and nice. Another small negative is it is kind of a pain to find the hotel off the stip. We had to call and ask, but once you find it once its easy to find again. Overall: Vdara was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had, and you can take that to the bank!! We will be coming back again very soon, and everytime we return to Vegas from now on we will be staying at Vdara!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Away from the hustle and bustle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Mandie088
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for a few days prior to travelling on to Palm Desert. I was concerned by some of the negative reviews found on trip advisor however we had a very pleasant stay at the Vdara. The staff were polite and helpful at checkin, our 14 year old son asked if we could have a room overlooking the Bellagio fountains and this request was immediately accommodated. The hotel is very tranquil tucked back away from the strip, however it is within walking distance (but not for those who dont like walking), we usually cut through the Bellagio. The suite we had was very nice however my only complaint is that these suites are only really meant for 2 people, we found it a bit of a squeeze once the sofa bed was made up for our son, and it was impossible to open the cupboard doors in this side of the room without having to lift the end of the bed out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for 5 Star ratings!!”
Reviews.Author: RalphDailey
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on the Aria and they were not so great so I decided to go next door to Vdara (pronounced Vdahhra!) - My expectations were high due to the new construction of city center. The check in went smoothly, nice lady, well dressed and I got a city suite on the 48th floor. There are 4 room type options as I recall and this was a one bedroom 1 1/2 bath set up with a kitchen, living room, dining area. The room was right at the end and the views are pretty good from that floor. A friend came the following day to stay with me and the pull out couch was very convenient. OK, here's how it all went wrong!! The room developed a really bad smell when you walked in. Short story after maintenance arrived was that the laundry stack machines were not being used and therefore the backed up water started smelling. I later asked why they didn't provide detergent to which I was told that "I was supposed to ask" when I checked in!! The internet connection stopped on day two and I just couldn't get it working. In addition, I asked for "no" newspaper yet I got one daily. There are no dishes or anything in the kitchen to allow you to use the property for what it was intended. There are two coffee mugs in the lonely cupboard, two water bottles and two coffee canisters in the refrigerator. BUT, you guessed it, no sugar, sweetener, milk or anything to stir with. You better like your coffee black!! The automatic coffee maker was cool When I arrived, there was a sock and underwear on top of the dryer. Yes, they were clean! When I called the front desk to ask about a move because everything smelled, I was told it would be tough but they could get me to a room on the 31st floor. Well, packed up and went to the next room which only had doors that wouldn't shut, no kitchen light and a couple of other minor inconveniences. At this point I thought I was the problem. None of this is troubling, really, more then the staff not really appearing to care that I paid for a premium room and that my stay was impacted by their lack of customer service. The lady at check out did credit back the resort fee of $15 per day (plus tax). A small victory for someone listening. I was not there to complain, I was there on a kayak trip and to see some shows. Perhaps there are bugs to fix but the price sure didn't look like it...... I have had better rooms and am probably going to go back to those hotels I know are prepared to service their guests. Aside from that there's a great statue in the front made up of canoes. You can walk via walkway to the Bellagio but I found Aria a hot inconvenient walk across the driveway. The gym is great and most of the machines have TV's or there are big screens around. Really a nice place to work out. The pool was very inviting as well but I only walked out there. There is a restaurant downstairs but it just never seemed to be open so I don't know what to make of that. They don't serve dinner which is probably a way to draw people to the casino and restaurants at Aria. Have a good look around before you pick this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, almost 5 star, but not quite”
Reviews.Author: MMMNV
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Vdara all week. The hotel itself is quite nice, wonderful to be at a non-casino hotel, still on the strip. The rooms are huge, bed is comfy- lots of pillows. Great bathroom. A small kitchenette, with a fridge. It feels almost like a 5star hotel. Except a couple things. 1.The blackout shades roll down (remotely) and there there are gaps between segments, which means the room is never completely dark. 2. The soaps and shampoos are Aveda and not really the best quality for such a nice hotel. It's a little thing- but the shampoo/conditioner leaves my hair dry and stiff. 3. I have to valet the car. If there is self parking nearby, it's not evident. (the valet people are really nice though!) Those are little things- but when the choices are endless (and rates are low), every little thing matters. All in all, I would stay here again- at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, rundown city”
Reviews.Author: griggsfiona
Reviews.Content: this hotel was gleaming smelt wonderful, we had s room in the 36 floor with a bellagio view. Make sure ask for a bellagio view room. As the other view is motorway only. The room was very high tech , even the blinds where electric. The bathroom was beautiful although the shower was not very powerful, but with good bath products. The bed wasnheavenly but my son slept onnthe sofa bed which was not so heavenly. Very quiet corridors with no noise at all, no banging doors. Pool was small and sun umbrellas rarely up due to winds so therefore not much shade. The aria over the road is better option for the pool. One of the best hotels we have staid in, but Vegas is very run down now and tatty. We where stopped every 10 feet with men passing my husband cards for girls to come to the room, which really peed me off. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel, only If it wasn't in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “RUTHLESS PRACTICES. IT'S ALL ABOUT THEM ($$$$$$$$) NOT YOU !!!”
Reviews.Author: Gustavas
Reviews.Content: It's NOT a 5 Star Hotel by any definition. If you're expecting Ritz Carlton standards or similar customer service, YOU WILL BE SEVERELY SHOCKED. I travel the world and usually stay at the best hotels possible if only fore a day or two. While no hotel is without its problems, this hotel actually stressed me; ruined my stay in Las Vegas, and has compounded my stress even upon my return home. V'dara's staff are without question, some of the most cold blooded, finance oriented hotels that I have ever stayed. They exude as much customer service as a tax collector's calculator. My travel agent suggested this hotel and I agreed. I am his second best leisure client out of hundreds he serves. You can be certain, after my report, he will not be suggesting V'dara to anyone ever again. The entire four day reservation in one of their suites was completely pre-paid a month before arrival. I understood they also have a daily resort fee of $15.00 plus 12% tax. This is added upon arrival and can not be pre-paid. This was naturally not a problem. Upon check-in no one greeted my car at curbside to assist with bags or welcome me to the V'dara. My driver did. I wheeled my bags in, held my own front door and approached the counter. The desk was not busy as there were only about three people being helped. I approached the next available clerk with a warm smile and a hello. The cold front desk person behind the counter was a tall, condescending, arrogant young man who made no eye contact and NEVER said welcome to the V'dara. Asked my name, then asked for my card. He swiped my card. Put a piece of paper infront of me and bluntly asked (without any measure of warmth) "How many keys." He was ALL business and I was not here on business. I was never shown to my room, never offered any details about the hotel services or even "offered assistance" with my bags to my suite in this so-called 5 star glass tower. My suite was on the 33rd floor. The view is beautiful but deceiving from the website. You look at the back of Bellagio and not the strip. The frontside rooms are no better. The room is modern and high tech with some toys that most would appreciate including power blinds/shades. I would not label it as luxurious. Upon opening the closets I found some loose almonds on the carpet from the previous occupant. I picked them up with a tissue and disposed of them. I just wanted it done immediately. I had pre-booked a massage at the same time I booked the hotel but the spa emailed me and insisted on a credit card weeks before my arrival to guarantee the massage even though I was already pre-paid in their hotel. Strange. This was the first indicator. I read on TripAdvisor that Bellagio, Aria and some other close hotels allow charges to your V'dara room account. Later that afternoon I went to the bar at Bellagio for a cocktail to decompress from a day of travel. When I was ready to close out, I was informed that the computer said I could not charge to my room because the "V'DARA HAS NO CARD ON FILE FOR ME." Must be a technical error I thought. Not a problem, a mere $10.00 drink doesn't matter. Rather than deal with this immediately, I moved on with my vacation. Second indicator. Later that day I went for my massage. When I completed the massage standing there is a robe and slippers, the desk robot at the spa informed me that I could not bill anything to my room even though they had taken a $467.20 hold on my card at check-in for a fully pre-paid room. Trying desperately to hold back explosive anger at this point, I had to go all the way back to my suite on the 33rd floor to get a credit card and some cash, come back down and pay for this massage. Totally defeated the purpose of the massage. RE-STRESSED was more like it. When dealing with the front desk you will encounter pre-programmed robots more concerned with their outward appearance than their ability to serve the guest. They are aloof, distant, cold and stereo-typically arrogant. They're not particularly intelligent either. They spit out pre-scripted plastic answers to questions with the artificiality of one of the StepFord Wives robots. With the exception of the girl in the business center, most front desk employees (face to face) lack sincerity, warmth or seasoning. God forbid if you ask them something not in their data-base. Nothing said to them seems to be understood from a guest's perspective. Nothing said to them is absorbed. Very anticeptic attutudes at all levels. I've never quite seen or experienced anything like it in my years of travel. Upon my return home, I was shocked to see that they actually FULLY CHARGED the entire $467.20 to my card as though I owed them this amount. What I owed them was $67.20 ($15,00 per day plus 12% for four days.) I was furious. This was to be a hold, NOT A CHARGE PUT THROUGH. At no time did I charge ANYTHING to this room because they did not permit me to, yet they saw fit to take my money, without my knowledge or permission after their entire hotel stay of 4 days was fully pre-paid. I so dreaded calling the hotel, but when I called the hotel, I had to debate with a world class robot. Indifferent as pre-programmed as she could be. She finally mentioned, without apology, that I was given a credit upon check-out (two days ago) of $400.00. This credit has not appeared. A senior manager in my bank says it has not appeared in their system either and there is no evidence of a credit from V'Dara two days ago. However, upon further investigation they DID INDEED charge this card upon CHECK-IN. As is typical, robots always your bank. My bank is not at fault by any means. It's never the merchant's fault it seems. My bank today did a further investigation and firmly states there is no credit whatsoever showing from V'dara. I continue to attempt to rectify this unfortunate, unfair, unnecessary and unfounded charge. They have simply taken money from me with no valid reason and to date, have not returned it. They offer no apology, no assistance and above all, no return of my money. This hotel's marketing masks their practices. Practices that are both a disgrace and deceivingly border on the criminal. It's all about their bottom line and they get away with it. I did not and do not now owe V'dara $400.00 for anything. They have systematically taken my money. With loads of documented proof, I have today filed a claim against the invincible and unfeeling V'dara of Las Vegas. The hotels restaurant is a joke and it closes very early. The pool also closes at 7 PM. This hotel is a very strange concept. Aside from V'dara, Las Vegas is wonderful. Fabulous restaurants, nightlife etc...most people know all this so I wont waste time here. On a lighter note, I also made an overnight trip to California to see the old Queen Mary at Long Beach which was a real treat for me. Gustavas

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view, comfortable room, odd kitchen, pool”
Reviews.Author: GD2004
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful partial strip view (Paris/Bellagio) and partial back of town (Rio). We got an excellent rate thru Jet Luxury Resorts. It was comfortable and quiet with nice bathroom/tub. The location was awesome - we never took the car once, just walked out thru Aria or the Bellagio; Crystals is lots of fun to browse. The kitchen was functional BUT you have to request everything from the confused staff (colander/calendar; you want two pots/pans?) who are clearly not used to people arriving with two bags of groceries from Whole Foods. It is also VERY small - the fridge is a dorm fridge though there was plenty of space for a larger unit. We kept our cooler filled with ice along with using the fridge. Maintenance man had to be called because fridge wasn't working well on check in - he was fantastic. Other housekeeping hit and miss: you really want more than one wash cloth for three people? etc. But we really enjoyed the room and how quiet the location was (partying dudes next door were promptly addressed by hotel staff) and the view was unexpectedly lovely. The tiny kitchen I would work around and stay again but it was the pool that makes me want to try something else. As others have remarked: all cement, windy, no view, just not welcoming at all. On the plus side it wasn't very crowded on the 4th of July! More of a standard upscale motel in Houston kind of pool, not a Vegas pool. As we ate in except for two pizza forays (Il Fornaio at NY NY is great; Postrio at the Venetian not) the hotel restaurant being always closed wasn't an issue, but it was a bit odd. We did late night snacking at Aria. If you don't mind the pool and you want a sleek, nice, reasonably priced upscale hotel w/ an almost-kitchen - this works great!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not the best... missing something.”
Reviews.Author: travelguy20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for two nights on our recent vacation to Las Vegas. After reading a lot of the reviews I really had no idea what to expect, but I was immediately impressed with the service. We were immediately greeted by the Valet, helped inside, and encountered a very positive check-in experience. We stayed in a city suite room which was large but had an odd layout- more of an L-shape than open and roomy. It has a separate dining area, kitchen, living room, desk area, and then a large bedroom with an extremely nice bathroom. The decor is very modern and trendy which is not our favorite. Overall the hotel is missing an identity- even after two nights I just couldn't get a feel for what kind of place it was trying to be, much less the kind of place it actually was. It wasn't a bad stay, but it was far from something special. The pros: Great service, nice, clean, quiet hotel, great rate. The cons: This hotel really is pretty removed from the strip, the hotel (due in large part I would imagine to such low rates right now) is attracting a pretty young crowd of college aged guests which is fine, but may not be exactly what you are looking for. The room service was the worst part of our trip- late, wrong food, and it tasted awful! With so many great places to stay in Vegas, I'm not sure why we would ever return. We spent the last three days of our trip at the Bellagio, our personal favorite, and enjoyed it even more after a couple nights at Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Luxury at its Las Vegas Best!”
Reviews.Author: ExoticTravelLover
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the famous Las Vegas Strip and connected to Bellagio. Its location makes it an excellent starting point to visit all the hustle and bustle of Vegas. However, the beauty of this place, is that - for too many reasons to count - it evokes a sense of peace and tranquility in an otherwise crazy town. If you are a couple looking for the best of both worlds (i.e. crazy Vegas and luxury spa calm) this is the BEST hotel for you! The hotel is located in a complex with Aria Hotel & Casino (Vdara does not have a casino itself, hence its peaceful existence), and the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. All three are top 5 * hotels. We stayed on the the 46th floor suite overlooking the Bellagio Fountains & Cesar's Palace - the view was BREATHTAKING! We also had breakfast at the restaurant downstairs (excellent) and many late night drinks at the lobby bar (also excellent). Be sure to try the decadent chocolate desert from the room service menu. AMAZING! Their pool is nice and peaceful as well but not as extravagant as some of the other hotels. The only thing to caution you on is to not travel in July because it's TOO HOT! So lucky for us that we had such a fabulous hotel to spend most of our time in.

Reviews.Title: “I created a tripadvisor acconut to say this”
Reviews.Author: Desipor
Reviews.Content: Is Vdara nice? yes. Is it Vegas quality? no One restaurant, its so lame. One bar, its even worse. The lobby is literaly the size of a mcdonalds. Its so depressing in there I feel like I'm in a hotel in North Korea which would be great if it were in No. Korea but this is vegas. We dont want it to feel like Im in Chicago or New york or Denver. Where are the lights? Where is the noise? where is the Buffet? And what happened to the pool, why does it look like its the size of a match box? This is a great hotel for any other city in the world but Vegas should know better than this. I gave it 5 star on cleanliness, location, rooms, services and sleep quality but a 0 on Value. Ive been coming to vegas monthly since 1988. This is not where Vegas should be going and its pretty obvious peple agree with me since that place is not making money and Bellagio is carrying it. People want a vegas feel, not a Hong Kong feel

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: deyavuee69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara from Jul 19- Jul 24, the hotel it self is amazing. We got a room with the most beutiful view of the Bellagio Fountains. At check in the lady was very courteous and polite they fulfilled all of our demands at every time. Special Aj who was very helpful. The concierge it self did everything for what we ask. PROS: Beutiful view, internet wireless and cabled, non-smoking property CONS: A bit far from the strip it like a 10 min walk to the actual strip through the bellagio or 10 minute walk through aria. Small pool No tv in bathroom, nor groming products After all the hotel is great if you plan to go to rest and have a good time this is the hotel if planning on partying and big pool get another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazy101
Reviews.Content: well I just got back from a weeks stay at the Vdara and the Hotel was sort of quirky to speak!! well here how our stay went: when we checked in we were very early from the 3pm ck in time we where there around 11ish and they did get us a room right away since it was not crowded I'm sure that wasn't an issue! but the girl at the counter ask for a credit card and I gave her my charge card and she preceded to ask me for a charge card I said that is my credit card and pulled out my debit card to show her the difference!! so then she proceeds to call a manager and say the customer only has a debit card after we told her it was a credit card. so finally my wife said listen I work for that bank and that is a credit card it says credit right on it- then she says "oh it looks like a debit card" but anyway the hotel was a lil out of the way from everything and it had 1 restaurant that closed at 2pm everyday for a 50 something floor hotel go figure. some of the staff were very friendly and some not so helpful. the air conditioning must of been turned off to the upper floors as the week went on it was warmer and warmer in the halls and elevators? would i stay again NO! there's no real views and its just too far from everything and to have to go through other hotels just to get out needs to be improved fast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel as it doesn't have...”
Reviews.Author: nothingcomesforfree
Reviews.Content: Overall a great hotel as it doesn't have a casino. Hower i found the staff at times rude and the small things like the complicated wifi login system, i asked on two occassions and was greeted with nothing short of an abrupt and unhelpful answer as i still failed to get wifi access. The pool is lovely but very quiet compared to other pools in other hotels on the strip. i travelled with a girlfriend both 21 and found it boring and full with a more mature crowd. The hotel demands a charge per day and for that you get a daily newspaper (american only) not great for overseas travellers. I arrived on a sunday and i was told papers arrive monday so all they had left was wall st journal which i agreed for as long as USA today came the following days, it didn't the staff failed to pick up on a simple instruction. Aside from the few issues the hotel was fabulous ideally located next door to the ballagio and joined to all the main hotels on the strip. The hotel is ideal for familes as its quieter or mature couples who don't want to be on a gambling focused trip. However if your young and want to party i would say pick a different hotel. But it depends what you want, but rooms and the food from room service was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel: Would never consider staying there again, even if the room were free.”
Reviews.Author: Double Scrutiny
Reviews.Content: We've been traveling to Las Vegas for years and years. Have stayed at many different hotels. We booked a four night stay at the Vdara and left after the first day. We detested the place. First, the hotel appears to be hurting, as the air conditioning was either turned off or was set at an extremely low setting in the elevators to the rooms and in the room hallways. The impression: The hotel was cutting back on costs. Second, the rooms are extremely cheaply furnished. Unlike the lobby which is nice, the rooms are shabby---something that is surprising for such a new hotel. The woodwork appeared to be cheap veneer. Like another review below, doors fell off when opened and woudn't go back in place. The bed looked like it had been slept in. Third, the pool is awful. There is a huge parking structure that looks down on the pool. There is no view that is nice. There are cheap-looking slats surrounding the pool area. The umbrellas are dime-store, fire-sale quality. The wind has bent some of them out of shape, like umbrellas that get wind-blown. There is cement and cement and cement. I do not recall seeing an ounce of greenery. The pool was overcrowded. The cabanas looked bargain basement. Nothing vacation-like about the pool space. Though the room price seemed to be a bargain, there is no rate that would have kept us here. It's just not what the Vegas experience is supposed to be about. There are multiple hotels that would offer a vastly more positive experience. It would not surprise us if this hotel were out of business within a year---and what a white elephant it will be when that happens, as I'm sure it will. We left after one night and couldn't wait to get out of the place. We happily paid slightly more at another hotel, and it was well worth the extra money. Our advice: Unless your desperate, stay away. And, even if you're desperate, stay away. They blew it big time with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ballilm
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, no problems, no worries. It is quite due to it being a non gaming hotel (Aria is right across the street and a walkway to Bellagio is connected to the Vdara) but we enjoyed that aspect. Great Location.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrible pool!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karenmjohn
Reviews.Content: Part of coming to Vegas is an amazing pool. Vdara was below average! The size of the pool on the 3rd floor roof was small. But what made it awful was the sun reflecting off the building baking the sunbathers. It was like being under a magnifying glass. No matter what time of day it was unbearibly hot even in the water. So disappointing!! Rooms very nice & great service. But won't stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks so much.”
Reviews.Author: WaryInvestor
Reviews.Content: After driving 19 hours to reach the Vdara, which included 3 separate 30 minute road-construction delays on Rte 93, I can safely say we looked like a couple of cooked desert rats upon arrival. I expected a suite next to the laundry room, but we were upgraded to a view of the Bellagio fountain and had our best ever stay in Las Vegas. The rooms were beautiful, the bed was heavenly, the staff was friendly, and the quiet location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Totally awsome”
Reviews.Author: Shera86
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 day trip to Vegas and had a wonderful stay at Vdara. I have been reading these reviews before our trip so I was prepared for everything, but my expectations were exceeded as far as the room goes. Our room was on 34th floor with a view of the Bellagio pool and a bit of the fountains, great to look at day and night. The shades and lights were not too difficult to figure out, nor was the button by the door for housekeeping. Room was clean and beautifully appointed, the bathroom very luxurious. I have read the comments about the bed and after the first sleep I commented that I haven't slept like that in a long time. I don't know what it is but even the pillows are so comfortable (better than my own at home) as opposed to other hotel pillows that feel like a sack of potatoes at times. Housekeeping was done very quickly and effectively, no matter when and for how long we left, when we came back the room was already cleaned and ready, which was great. A couple of times we had to ask for extra lotion or shampoo but were given more than enough upon request. As for the location, yes it is a bit of a walk to the strip, but after a couple of times we found the way through Aria to be more convenient if you wanted to go southbound (towards Mandalay Bay) and the walk through Bellagio works better if you want to go anywhere on the strip towards the Stratosphere. Both walks are no more than 10 minutes. The only negative comments we have are about the pool and the restaurant. The pool area is nice and relaxing, but it is very barren with no shade except for umbrellas which they did not allow to be open when we were there, due to high winds (the pool is on 3rd floor and in some kind of a wind tunnel) and we just could not bear to sit in the sun in the 45 degree Celsius heat. We mentioned this to the front desk and we were accomodated getting access to the neighbouring Aria pool which is an oasis of palm trees and serenity. The other negative is the restaurant in the lobby, which is only open limited hours, and for the entire stay we did not see anyone in it. Other than that we would come back and would recommend Vdara to others, but perhaps we'll try Aria next time only because of their pools.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the gambling”
Reviews.Author: Davenubio
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, all clean, non-smoke hotel, no casino at the Lobby, excellent service, amazing pool. A Place to come back "home" after a crazy and exciting night in Vegas. The rooms are big and always clean and the crew is very polite. Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara from 27th June until 7th July 2010 for our yearly Vegas trip and found the hotel to be stunning. CHECK IN The first thing you notice is the lovely smell in the lobby and bar area - it is wonderful and very refreshing. The other thing you notice is the quite amazing architecture of the place - it is stunning, just like the whole of CityCenter! The check in was fast and the girl on the desk was very helpful and informative. They even came over with a couple of bottles of water for us whilst we checked in. Only had to wait about two minutes to get checked in and was on our way to our room within a few minutes. They even gave us a room on the 27th floor, overlooking the Bellagio pool and even a view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains! ROOM/SUITE The suite (duluxe suite - the basic one!) was large and very clean with a massive king size bed (which are just the same as the amazing beds at the Mirage, as again they are the most comfy beds you will ever sleep on!). The room has a massive bathroom with tub and separate shower. The view towards the strip and fountains from the room was amazing. None of the rooms are far from the elevators, and we didn't really ever see anyone in the elevators or hallways during the entire stay. Max wait for an elevator was 7 seconds! Plates and cutlery etc for the room are available - just ask, and the kitchen has a fridge and coffee machine - all included in the price, and you even get a newspaper every morning. LOCATION Vdara is situated in the amazing MGM CityCenter right next to the Bellagio and the new Aria resort. Although it's not directly on the strip, it is close enough and takes well under a 10 minute stroll to get to the strip via Bellagio or Aria (and it is so easy tpo find your way around - only took us one trip through Aria to find our way around - just follow the signs). The direct access to both is open 24hrs a day and the CityCenter tram runs from the Monte Carlo, to Crystals (Aria) and to Bellagio. The tram stop at Bellagio is only a 2 min stroll from Vdara. FOOD/DRINK We again ate at various places along the strip, and didn't get to try the Silk Road restaurant in Vdara (never really up before lunch!). Silk Road is open for breakfast and lunch only, which is a bit of a shame. It does now do morning coffees though. One of the best meals we had was at Cafe Vettro in Aria. It's a lovely cafe with great food and a view of Vdara! The bar at Vdara (BarVdara) is lovely for a pre-meal drink or a late night cocktail (and they even do food now). It is very relaxing and chilled, and a nice change to the usual Vegas type bar. All of the staff are very friendly and will do anything for you. POOL The pool area is quite small, and we were worried about the lack of sunbeds and shade for such a large hotel. We didn't need to worry, as over the 4th July weekend, there were plenty of spare sunbeds and umbrellas, and the pool is a lovely size. The drinks service was a bit hit and miss, so most of the time we just went and got our drinks from the pool bar. Further to other reviews on Tripadvisor, the music is not at all loud (unless you pick a sunbed next to a speaker!), and although it did get windy one day (as the pool is on the 3rd floor), all you needed to do was jump in the pool to get away from the breeze, or move over to the pool bar seating area. ENTERTAINMENT We went to see VivaElvis at Aria, which was a great show, although not the normal Cirque type show. Check the website for discounts etc, as we got $135 tickets for $88. GAMBLING Had a good few $ in various casinos, but didn't win a lot at all - MGM have to pay for CityCenter somehow! We seemed to have better luck this year at Rio, Caesars and Planet Hollywood Resort. OVERALL An great stay at an amazing hotel. It is one of the newest hotels on the strip (only opened 7 months ago), but they appear to have now sorted all the niggles from opening time. Cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Escape from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Westby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room 32019 for two nights as part of a driving tour out west. This was our first time in Vegas and we wanted to be close to the strip but not necessarily in the middle of all the madness. First the negatives: The Vdara was recently built as part of the new City Center complex - an upscale collection of shops, restaurants, hotels and condos. The hotel is more towards the north and west side of this complex a little removed from the strip. At the time of our stay there was construction going on nearby that made access to the strip very difficult without going through the Bellagio hotel. I should mention that the Bellagio and the Vdara are connected by a short walk way, and the Vdara and the rest of City Center are connected by a very short monorail thing. The problem with the whole location is that it is not conducive to just walking out the hotel and taking a stroll. Even our taxi driver got confused by all the ramps in that sea of concrete. Also, I should note that while the Bellagio is just next door it still takes a good 10 minute walk to get through the Bellagio, around the fountains until you are finally on the actual strip. Overall, we found getting from A to B in Las Vegas a difficult proposition. Now the positives: While I was at first uncertain about whether I wanted our hotel to be this removed from the action, I grew to like the fact that we could escape from the casinos and all the other crap that is Vegas. The Vdara does have a soothing ambiance to it that is very welcoming after a long day of dealing with the noise and hassle of the strip. Our room was extremely comfortable and furnished in a very modern, but still inviting style. Although there was no view of the strip, the view that we did have (to the south) was pleasant enough. In terms of amenities at the hotel - we wife really enjoyed the spa, and I thought the gym was very nicely appointed (other reviewers who thought it wasn't plush enough haven't been to most gyms). Believe me, the level of service and attention to detail at the gym were far higher than I've seen at most regular gyms. The one disappointment was probably the pool. It seemed like a bit of an afterthought. First, it didn't seem large enough to accommodate everyone. Second, it needs a lot more shade and greenery - it was just too much concrete which made it unbearably hot outside of the water. I was however surprised at how much I enjoyed the margaritas poolside. In terms of food the Vdara doesn't have a lot to offer, however we did have breakfast at the hotel's Silk Road restaurant one morning and really liked it (despite the high price - $13 for an omelet !). In sum, the Vdara is not for people who really want to be right in the middle of the Las Vegas action. However it will suit those who are happy to experience some of that but are willing to wander back through the Bellagio at the end of the day to a more peaceful, more relaxed setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mikeg82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara for 5 nights the first week of July. The Vdara is a beautiful hotel and the rooms are designed really nice and spacious. There are no surprises. Its clear the hotel does not have a casino, so if you are looking for one that does, this is not the place to stay. Just remember that every other hotel in Las Vegas does, so it's not like it will be hard to find a place with a casino. The Aria is located right next door and has a casino. My friend stayed at the Aria when I was there and all I can say is that you can use all of their amenities while staying at a nice quite, cheaper hotel. The only one issue I ran into was the internet was down for two days during my stay. Your resort fee includes internet access, so after calling the front desk and asking them to refund the resort fee, they did so right away. One more thing... the Vdara is located right in the middle of the strip!! All I can say is my next time in Vegas I will be staying at the Vdara again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for location, service and QUALITY. Full Marks”
Reviews.Author: therealmart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vegas for our friends marriage. We booked the room prior to the hotel even being completed so we were a tad apprehensive! We needn't have been!! From the minute we walked into the spacious reception area with its open plan and modern feel, we were completely at ease. Massively friendly and helpful staff everywhere but a special mention has to go to the valet parking crew who were the best around (and we parked at several other resorts during our stay). The suite was clean, well designed and roomy. Its a crying shame some have called this hotel and the city centre 'boring'. I understand Vegas is a (sin) city that never sleeps, but we chose this venue exactly because we wanted that peace and quiet away from the strip yet still feel we were staying in the heart of Vegas. It gave us just that! A great place to crash and a very short walk via a connecting bridge brings you into the Bellagio so I really don't understand the moaning. BTW we're both in our 30s and did our fair share of partying whilst we in Vegas too . Being at the Vdara didn't hinder that whatsoever, in fact it was a welcome contrast to the rest of town!!! The free wifi was a godsend too, used with our iPhone it allowed us to keep in touch with friends staying further down the strip and family at home via email saving a ton on roaming charges. No complaints at all with fresh linen, towels, 2 gratis bottles of mineral water and a Wall Street Journal every day either! We were very sad to leave and if ever in Vegas again baby, this is where we will be staying no question. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “totally amazing”
Reviews.Author: urshna
Reviews.Content: the vdrara was amazing, right in the heart of the las vegas strip. rooms have everything you need... gorgeous views, and also very modern and clean. Would recommend everyone to stay there. it does not have a casino, but to be honest with all the other hotels having one and the time it takes to hustle the croud im glad it didnt. swimming and spa area was lovely too. everything was slightly expensive but of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Gambled and Won”
Reviews.Author: nnm3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fabulous stay at Vdara from July 6-11. We had a great time and could not have been happier with our choice of hotel. Our check-in was fast and smooth. The staff members were extremenly friendly. The elevators are gorgeous! When we opened the door to the room, we were instantly greeted with an awesome view of the strip including the Bellagio Fountains. We had a large kitchenette that was separated from the main room. The main area included a large closet with a safe, a couch, two desk and chair sets, tv, dresser, and king bed. The bathroom was huge with a separate soaking tub, tons of extra towels, powerful hair dryer, Aveda products, and it even had a digital scale. The decor was modern and simple. The bed was super comfortable and it had a duvet instead of a funky bedspread that most hotels don't wash. It had 4 king sized pillows as well. Two plush robes were provided, so comfy I really wanted to take it with me. The room was spotlessly cleaned everyday. There is a housekeeping button on the door that sends a signal to let someone know you would like your room cleaned. The best thing about this hotel is that it is quiet. Not that anyone goes to Vegas for peace, but it was such a great thing to return from the craziness of the strip to a tranquil escape. I've read some of the other reviews that had complaints about the lackluster lobby and lack of restaurants. My theory is that the hotel was designed that way on purpose. No one is coming to gaze at the lobby or to wait in line to eat. Not that the lobby wasn't nice, but you wouldn't go out of your way to see it and people aren't hanging out gambling and smoking on the way to your room. This design keeps it quiet and low-key. Despite its tranquility, the Vdara is centrally located. The hotel is connected to the Bellagio via a covered walkway. You can be in the Bellagio is less than 5 minutes and they have several eateries, stores, and bars. It is also next door to the Aria, also less than a 5 minute walk. The Aria also has several places to eat and of course a casino. We ate at the Aria buffet for breakfast every morning and it was quite good. The fitness center and pool were small, but adequate. We sat by the pool every morning and didn't have any trouble securing a chair. Valet was prompt and easy. The concierge was always available and helpful. I really don't have any complaints about this hotel which is highly unusual for me. We had a great time and would definitely stay at Vdara when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “noisey”
Reviews.Author: elsgly
Reviews.Content: i am not sure who is writting these reveiws but one thing the pool isnt is quite and relaxing, music blares out (and i had ear plugs in) when the wind blows (which is most of the time) you can not have an umberella and there is no shade anywhere (107) we paid $13 for a lemonade slush, our room was lovely but we had no shower gel or bath salts for the ten days we were there. the veiw was great but i dont think the double glazing worked as it was like sleeping on a motorway very very noisey. the black out blinds didnt fit so it was light all night. and no way can anyone do the walk to the strip in two mins when you get into the belagio you are right at the back of it and you have to walk at least 10 mins before you are outside. for the whole of the 11 days we were there the resturant was not open at night 22nd jun 2nd july, so how anyone can say they eat there i dont know. no smoke was the best thing about the hotel and i liked the style, i think i is pot luck with the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Jenvs
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting in a nice big comfy bed as I write this....Wow. Beautiful, modern and spa like. It's NOT a gaming hotel, but it's across from Aria and connected to Bellagio so in 5 minutes you can win (or lose) all you want! . No smoking too, which I liked. It's a nice place to getaway after all the sensory overload that is Vegas. I wish my hubby were here!

Reviews.Title: “Boring”
Reviews.Author: Traveller00713
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of staying at the Vdara, just because it's new and looks nice, forget it. The place is the most boring hotel in Vegas. There's no atmosphere or buzz about the place. it's miles from anywhere. There no real restaurant and as for the bar you can pass it and mistake it for being closed. The pool on the face of it looks nice but, the little surrounding pools are for the cabanas (all empty) and the main pool is hot windy and exposed, and most of the time you will be almost on your own, there's so few people there. The reception staff have obviously been employed for their appearance rather than their ability or personality. Brain dead is the best description. All in all, a great disappointment, never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and amazing service”
Reviews.Author: byronandamanda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vdara for a week when it first opened just before Christmas and we loved it. The hotel rooms are lovely and the hotel staff are extremely polite and helpful, particularly the hotel concierge who can't do enough for you. If you need any information about restaurants, shows, excursions etc, they will sort these for you. The Aria also opened the week that we were there, however; we are glad that we decided on the Vdara. This was the second time that we have visited vegas. Previously, we stayed at the Venetian. I prefered the Vdara as it was brand new and is non-smoking. Although, I don't mind smoking in the casinos and bars etc, you really notice a difference staying in a non-smoking hotel. We also liked the fact that the hotel didn't have a casino, which meant that it was quiet and relaxing. After a busy day and night on the strip, the Vdara provides a comfortable base away from the hectic strip and crowds. The room was finished to a really high standard and was cleaned everyday. We liked the way that the open plan room was divided into different areas, kitchen, lounge area, bedroom and large separate bathroom with large bath and separate shower. The room also featured 2 large flatscreen televisions in the lounge and bedroom. It was like having your very own mini apartment in vegas! Even though we didn't do any cooking, I still liked the small kitchenette and dining table area. The fridge also came in handy to store drinks. The bed in the room was really comfortable and with our jetlag, we sometimes found it hard to get up! The only small downsides are that it is a little bit out of the way compared to other hotels on the strip. Although the Vdara is located on the main strip, it is behind the bellagio and city centre. This means that to get onto the strip you have to walk over the skybridge to the bellagio and either go all the way through the hotel to get outside or catch the sky train from the bellagio to the city centre. Also, the Silk restuarant in the hotel is very expensive, but the food is amazing. We ate there twice, once for breakfast and once for dinner. The service you receive is immaculate and the food is presented beautifully. However, if you want a cheap and cheerful breakfast or dinner, this is definitely not the place to go. All in all, the hotel was great and the issues mentioned are minor drawbacks which didn't affect our holiday as the quality of the hotel far outweighs these small details. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MissBirdy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the price was very good and my friends are on a budget. The Vdara does not allow smoking and there is no casino, so this is basic accomodations for Las Vegas. * Service: Check in was quick even though we had a special request for two adjoining rooms. We arrived early and waited at the pool for about an hour before we were called to let us know the rooms were ready. Housekeeping was efficient and thorough. All requests were handled quickly and with a smile. * Rooms: The rooms were very new, modern and clean. There was a small kitchenette but no way were we cooking. The tiny 'fridge came in handy tho and stored several bottles of wine and beer. The sofa bed is comfortable, but no match for the super comfy regular bed and soft thick linens. The bathrooms featured a sep. shower and soaking tub both big enough for two. Ha ha! TMI! The amenities were okay but not enough. Ask for more if it's not one to a room. More towels too. * Pool: This is Kommunist Pool. Just a cement pond and maybe two palm trees. Find soe umbrellas to hide under because the sunlight reflects off the huge glass towers and you will burst into flames. Better yet, head over to Aria for Liquid Pool Party!!! Drinks are twice as expensive but there is 100 times more fun. * Food: The room and pool service food was really delicious. Unexpected! But you will wait forever for the pool waitress to decide you can order something. Go to the bar, the bartender is very friendly. Spa: I had a massage and a pedicure. The clinicians are professional and the spa is gorgeous. They serve you beverages and snacks while you enjoy your treatments. The treatments are on the pricey side but the whole experience makes them worth it. * Overall: This hotel is full of nice Midwestern and European families. For a smoking hot scene go somewhere else. For a nice clean modern hotel this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandraP23
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. The location is spot on and the service was excellant.I went here for my 40th birthday,The staff were lovely,I recieved a room with a view of the bellagio fountains and they sent up a bottle of champagne!!!! I had read the review about there being nothing in the kitchen.All you have to do is contact house keeping and they will supply you with whatever your heart desires. The rooms are fantastic and even without a view of the strip you cat fault them. However I only have two minor criticisims, firstly the quickest way out on to the strip is via the Bellagio and this does take a good walk just to get on the strip. I am hoping this factor will be fixed when they finish the "city center" and secondly they charge on top an extra 15 dollars a night for pool,gym and Wi fi, per night! We had booked this hotel as part of a tour of USA through a travel agents and was surprised to be informed of this extra when we arrived. We were there for 9 nights and it all mounts up! Having said that I would book it again!!!!! It was fab

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Stay at Vdara, ignore Negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: GirlyDublin
Reviews.Content: I really liked our stay at Vdara, I was slightly concerned about staying here after reading some negative reviews but I was delighted with this hotel. First of all the location, I don't know what prevous reviewers problem was, its literally a 2 minute walk into Bellagio, we usually went through that way to get onto strip or through Aria if you wanted to get to the other side. We were on 46th floor and had a fantastic view of bellagio fountains and paris eiffel tower. The bed was so comfortable and we never heard any noise so slept really great. I love that you can go out and enjoy all the madness vegas has to offer and come back to your hotel and where its calm and restful, I also liked the fact that the elevators to the rooms was so near the lobby unlike some vegas hotels which are 10 minutes walk away. There is a resort fee of $15 per day but you get two coffee pods in your room and 2 bottles of water per day and newspaper delivered to your room, also use of fitness centre is included in this. Resort fees annoy me but it seems most hotels are charging them now and at least at Vdara you are getting something for it. The Pool area was fine, lots of sunbeds available at anytime of the day, probably a little too many, they are a bit too many crammed together, they should remove some and free up space. They do play music at the pool and generally is a nice relaxed and chilled atmosphere. We stayed here 4 nights and then moved to Encore for another 3 nights which we had already booked and paid in advance, we wished we hadn't and were so disapointed to have to leave Vdara, we loved our room, view and location and would recommend to anyone looking for a classy stay in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “the 3 L's - Location, Luxury and Love-It Factor”
Reviews.Author: virgo21
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Vdara witha group of girlfiends. Location is perfect - no matter what direction you're coming from or going to the City Centre group of hotels is right in the middle of everything. Luxury at its best - Everything is sooo clean and top notch. Automated blinds, 2 flat screens, marble and granite, super comfortable beds (even the pull out), in suite kitchen, doorbell etc etc. Lovely colour scheme - think new york luxury hotels and condos. What I loved about the Vdara and other City Centre properties is as soon as you walk in you smell different scents associated with the property. Staff - always super friendly and wanting to help. We never ran into any attitude and if anything they would offer to help before we would even have a chance to ask for it. We were all really happy with this hotel. To the point where we would return without hestitation. Its nice that its smoke free and free of the casino noises. If you want a casino you can eaisly go to Aria or Bellagio right next doo but as far as I am concerned a hotel should be a hotel. Pools - the main pools were quiet in terms of what you would expect from a Vegas pool. We went to the Liquid pool party and that has a good vibe. Not trashy like Wet Republic but more loungey. Food - we didn't really eat on property, except at Beso, so I couldnt really say. Beso is top notch - order the chilli skirt steak INCREDIBLE. I think anyone who goes here will be happy. I am not sure what the complients are about from other reviewers (bad luck?). Enjoy yourself we definitely did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise! Almost felt like we were not even in VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: KySOTraveler
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end this was the best choice of hotels we have ever stayed at in Las Vegas. I have been there at least 8 times before and this was the first time that I would intentionally pick the same hotel again!! We were able to check in at 9 am which never happens. The concierge was extremely helpful even to just ask simple questions. The atmosphere was tranquil. There is no casino and no smoking so the air was fresh and clean and quiet, soothing atmosphere without the casino crowd noise. BUT if you want a casino, ARIA is right next door in the same CITY CENTER Complex. The pool area is small in comparison to other hotels in Vegas but not crowded at all and very relaxing. There is a tram that connects the complex to Monte Carlo and Bellegio so you can move along the center of the strip easily. Super comfy bed!!

Reviews.Title: “Suite rip-off”
Reviews.Author: McNiner
Reviews.Content: I booked a Vdara Suite based on the photos on MGM's internet and direct contact with Vdara reservationists. The photos show full windows and a view of the Paris and part of the strip. The room I first got was half the size of a suite and didn't have full wrap-around windows. I returned to the front desk and asked for the Vdara suite I paid for. I got the suite, but it looked out on a parking garage, the freeway and the Rio. I asked where the suite with the strip view or Bellagio view was and was told I could get one for an additional $100 a night. What a rip-off...I might as well have gotten a room in Phoenix. Staff was unwilling to try and fix this problem. The representation of the suite on the internet is false and MGM should be ashamed for renting a room under false pretenses.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel, but ridiculous charges and snobby staff!”
Reviews.Author: brucemom1280
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that overall, this is a pretty nice hotel. My husband and I liked the design, it was pretty, modern and comfortable. It also smelled great walking in the door, and it was super quiet. A nice couples resort. We absolutely loved the bed and pillows! The bathroom was also nice with a soaking tub and great shower. We did not experience any problems with water pressure like others mentioned or maintenance issues. The pool area was also nice, but nothing really extraordinary. Here's what we didn't like... Our experience checking in was a nightmare!!! First we had to wait in line forever (there was a line at the desk everytime we walked through the lobby), then the front desk person told me that since I had a Visa debit card instead of a credit card I would have to be charged a deposit of over $100 a night, for a total of over $300! This was in addition to the $15 a day that you get charged for water, internet, newspaper and fitness center, too bad the only thing that we used was the water. At least I was aware of the resort charge upfront, the deposit blindsided us and since we were there on a strict budget and carry no actual credit cards I was practically in tears at the front desk. The person there called to a manager and got the amount lowered to $200 + resort fee. After discussing this with my husband we were still not satisfied and asked to speak to a manager who went through the whole explanation again, that basically it is to cover their butts if we trash the room. Once I pleaded my case she said she was able to credit my account back another $100, but they "needed something." I asked if we should wait in the lobby and she said yes, but after waiting about 20 minutes I asked the conceirge if she was coming back. He went and looked and said he didn't see her and advised us to go ahead up to our room. After another 20 minutes or so I called to the front desk and was told she was in a meeting! At this point we decided to go out exploring and by the time we returned there was a message on our phone that the problem was taken care of. We were not the only ones that were having an issue with this, we saw several other people during the check-in and out process that were complaining about the same thing, this could be part of the reason that the lines were so long! Other things that we weren't crazy about... The hotel was not very convenient to the strip. Having never been to Vegas we weren't sure where to stay, but I did not feel like the City Center was any kind of hot spot. It seemed pretty dead most of the time. I felt like they were trying to be overly fancy, and it just felt like a ghost town walking through the Aria. The food and drinks were way over priced as was the spa, so we really only had one drink poolside. My last complaint was that many of the staff members were really snobby, several that we encountered had very arrogant attitudes. There were a couple nice people, but overall they came across very high and mighty. Needless to say that the bad outweighed the good and we would not stay at the Vdara again in the future because of our bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the new Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: kenika91
Reviews.Content: Finally, a resort/hotel got it right. Not only did they get it right, they nailed it on the head.
