Vdara is just one of the several towers located inside City Center - a new and much smarter way to build a resort on The Strip. I could go on and on about City Center and it's crown jewel, Aria, but I'll spare you my witty banter and stick with where we stayed - at The Vdara. This was one of the best stays and hotels I have have ever experienced in Vegas and I go there quite frequently. Upon checking in, the clerk noticed I had celebrated my 40th birthday earlier that week. With no prompting from me, me and my partner were instantly upgraded to a deluxe suite on one of the tower's highest floors. Upon walking into the room, it was heaven, 50 stories up. A mini kitchen with top of the line appliances, 2 flat screen tv's, a lovely living room, a huge bathroom with a separate soaking tub, and a wonderful bed. And the view - one of the best. Out one window were the dancing fountains of the Bellagio, and the other set of windows were a view of the Rio. The property itself reminds me of a sleek, chic hotel in Soho or The Meatpacking District. And whatever scent they pump into the air system should be sold in the hotel's gift shop. It is relaxing without being obnoxious. The pool - very relaxing and best of all, there's none of that gross Vegas "pool scene" like one would see at other mega resorts. All quiet and people wanting just to get a tan. The tower is a no smoking, non gaming tower which makes it a welcome oasis from the Strip. If you want action, go to the centerpiece - Aria. We did not leave our resort once to go anywhere else. Why would you have to leave? All the top eateries, shopping, casinos, art, and spas are located on site! (confession - we did leave once so that we could enjoy Cher at Caesar's palace!) Overall, I will be back again, bravo Vdara for getting it right. And bravo to City Center for bringing a touch of sophisticated elegance to The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, service not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: shanBLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous with a lovely ambiance. It is definitely a nice place to go back to after you have been on a long flight or out on the strip all day as it is non gaming and therefore non smoking. The beds ar also ridicoulously comfortable. The room service was also extrelmely thorough. I was however very disappointed with the service at the hotel. Thsi is my second trip to Vegas and the 3rd Vegas hotel I have stayed in. Compared to the other 4 and 5 star hotels I stayed at, the srvice was just not up to scratch! There were three of us to a room. Extra sheets and bedding was not provided. We had to ask for it and then waited about 2 hrs for it to arrive. Although the deluxe rooms feature a very nice kitchenette, there were no bowls,plates, knives, forks or any utensils for that matter. Again we had to request these. One morning I woke up with a terrible hangover and not being a fan of tap water I called room service to request bottled water. The water again came about two hours later. The rooms were nice but there was a very poor use of space and our view left a lot to be desired. I hurt myself on the room divider several times and please do not be fooled by the videos on the vdara website of the suites as they really are not that spacious. At the end of the holiday, we were told we had to pay a 15 dolla a day resot fee. We were told by the agents that we booked through that we would not have to pay this as this was included in the price we had paid upfront. When we queried this upon check in, we were again reassured that we had already paid the resort fee. You can therefore imagine our horror when we were hit with this at the end of our stay. We argued with the less than understanding manager until she agreed that we would only have to pay half of the total cost. I would not recommend this hote and would certainly suggest the signature at mgm if you are looking for a luxiourious non gaming hotel with good service!

Reviews.Title: “Quality at it's best, even for a clean freak like me!”
Reviews.Author: Kiaren
Reviews.Content: It was a truly good experience, the hotel was fabulous, we stayed in a deluxe suite. All staff were more genrous than I had expected with a lot better service than hotelier's here in England!! Concierge and Bell desk were excellent, rooms were cleaned every day (to my high standards!), 24 hour room service and restaurant inlcluded. We overlooked the Bellagio hotel. Best hotel stay I've ever had. Highly recommend 35th floor! xx P.S. Bear in mind Vegas is all built on tips, so take more money than you anticipate is needed!

Reviews.Title: “Items Stolen From Our Suite”
Reviews.Author: jhu22314
Reviews.Content: I went to Vdara with 3 girlfriends for Memorial Day weekend. First, I booked the 2 story, 2 bedroom penthouse and 2 days before we were to arrive I was informed the suite was no longer available (despite my reservation from January). While we were at dinner the last night of our stay, someone entered our "hospitality suite" and stole over $3,000 worth of items (i.e., handbags, wallets, ipods). We reported the incident to the hotel and the police. The hotel has refused to compensate us and I was forced to claim the items through my homeowners insurance. Risk management was dreadful. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. I paid over $6,000 for our 3-day visit and they refuse to compensate for our items. Back to the Wynn for me.

Reviews.Title: “Alright, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Rauz
Reviews.Content: First of all, quality is relative. This might be a five star rating in another city, but in Vegas, this place is not the best by a long shot. First off, the "suites" are not always suites. More like big rooms with kitchenettes. And another thing. Why provide a microwave, 2-top burner, fridge, etc. but absolutely no dinnerware or utensils? I guess you can fry your own egg as long as you remember to bring your own frying pan, plate, spatula, fork, etc. We tried both the restaurant (there's only one) and the bar (again, only one) and both were awful. The service was all messed up and it wasn't just us. The manager was going around from table to table saying "Sorry" so often that it was scary. The pool area is nothing special. On the bright side, the rooms are nice. Ours was hot, but maintenance fixed it quickly. The view over the Bellagio fountains is great, so try to get a room with that view. Crystals City Center mall is right nearby - they offer many dining choices. Also, this place is quiet, nonsmoking, and there is not casino, so that's pretty good if you like serenity. Overall, it's acceptable. but there are other properties that are nicer for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for this hotel, we had an amazing time”
Reviews.Author: BurnsieMae
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again, the rooms are large, beautiful. Staff were extremely helpful. Good ambience. It may not appeal to gamblers as it`s non gaming, but you are literally 2 mins away from Aria and Bellagio which both have gaming facilities. As it is non gaming, it is also non smoking, which is great, and just has a much more calming feel to it, which was nice to retreat to after visiting the other gaming establishments in town. The ultra modern architecture of the entire City Centre area where the Vdara is located (along with the Aria and the Crystals shopping area) is fabulous, and the tram that runs between the Bellagio/City Centre/Monte Carlo was great, saved a lot of unnecessary walking, and runs every couple of minutes. The location of City Centre/Vdara in the middle of the strip we found to be very convenient. If you are looking for something smaller than the other massive resorts, and something unique, the Vdara fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, modern rooms but pool area dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: yourstrulyEastYorks
Reviews.Content: Our basic suite was modern and spacious. You enter the room through a kitchen/dining area, but this a pointless waste of space - it has a hob, microwave, base and wall cupboards, coffee machine and a fridge, however there is no crockery (apart from two cups), no cutlery, no pans - not that I fancied doing any cooking! - so what's the point in having it? We were left only two cartons of coffee per day, powdered creamer and a straw to stir! The view from our suite however (floor 42) was great, especially an night, through a full wall of windows. The bed was one of the comfiest hotel beds we've ever slept in. There was a double wardrobe containing a safe - however this was only a few inches deep and was tricky to get your belongings in. Could have done with a few more hangers. The bathroom was compact, but clean, modern and bright, with plenty of towels and toiletries provided - the robes were lovely, but I had to ask for the free hotel slippers. The maid service was quite late in the afternoon - quite anoying on the evening we wanted to get ready and out early. We enjoyed a morning in the spa, but this carried a separte charge (sauna, steam room, jacuzzi) however, the men and women had separate areas. A big letdown was the pool area. It was way too small for the size of the hote. It did have plenty of loungers, but they were all crammed close together. The music speakers around the pool were also very loud. There were'nt many umbrellas - even though it was 110 degrees, and the staff were always coming round and putting them down or taking them away, as it gets very windy in this area, and someone told us an umbrella had blown up and over the barriers - quite dangerous! The pool area was very plain with mininal planting - it was just not relaxing to sit around. The lobby bar was comfortable, but had no atmosphere and the main restaurant was always empty. Yes, it is quite a walk to get onto the strip, either through the Bellagio or through the Aria (the Aria buffets by the way were very good), but you do a lot of walking anyway. The hotel in general was fresh and welcoming, and the staff all pleasant. We enjoyed our stay here, but next time we'd prefer a hotel with more atmoshpere, and a better designed pool area. We would not stay a Vdara again.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Serenity”
Reviews.Author: tramost
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara for 3 nights last weekend to celebrate my birthday in Vegas. First off, the hotel is uber modern. Very clean, quiet (compared to casino hotels) and totally smoke-free (love!). We got a free upgrade to a corner suite, which has a kitchen/dining area, separate living area, bedroom, 2 flat screens, a soaking tub, separate shower, well stocked Aveda products and best of all, a wraparound view that is to die for. Vdara has a walkway connected to Bellagio; a short walk to Aria and Crystal and also a free tram that goes to Monte Carlo. We had breakfast at the restaurant - food and service were great. We also had massages at the spa and the service was wonderful. We thoroughly enjoyed the stay and I recommend Vdara to those who love the high-energy and excitement of Las Vegas, but would like to come "home" to peace and quiet at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Philfromoz
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 nights at Vdara (for about $1000 US) and was extremely happy with my stay. At check in i was upgraded to a premium view suite which was nice as i got to see the Bellagio fountain show from my room. The rooms themselves are great, the beds are soft though, so if you like a hard bed this might not be for you. The extra room in the kitchen also helps the stay. The bathrooms are fantastic. Room Service was always done well. The hotel located off the strip with no casino was a huge plus for me. Cant really stand in a place with cigarette smoke for too long, so this hotel was perfect for me.Its an easy walk thru to Bellagio or Aria if you need to gamble or shop also. Didnt try the Silk road restaraunt or Bar Vdara, but they made an awesome espresso coffee but it was about $6. The pool is nothing special but does its job and is a nice spot to unwind after hitting the strip shopping. This hotel is perfect for couples or singles who want to enjoy Vegas at a slower pace. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: ssenit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 night from 25 May 10 and had a high floor suite which was great for outlook but the suite itself was one of the best ever. The layout can be seen on the hotel website and we were very delighted with it. The tower block was under occupied and this was good although at weekend it became rowdy as the party team moved in and made a bit of noise around the pool as they became more drunk. The pool area is a bit small and we asked if we could use the Aria but they said no which I thought was pretty mean. The hotel does not have much in the way of eating places and the ground floor cafe was only open for limited hours at breakfast and lunch but the Aria hotel.is across the courtyard. Free internet wireless was availabe in the rooms and the kitchen area provided a fridge for carried in drinks etc. A coffee maker was also provided and was drinking water bottles each day. The only drawback here is the walk to the strip and the best route is through the Billagio via a connecting bridge which also links to the monorail. You really do get an idea of high rise living here and I would certainly use this one again and considering I have stayed in most of the best hotels in Vegas, this is a real compliment.

Reviews.Title: “A modern Spa Hotel that is unpretentious”
Reviews.Author: sloh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here over a weekend in June 2010 on the 37th floor with panoramic views (from the Eiffel Tower in PARIS and the fountains of Ballagio to Rio, Palms and the mountains beyond) Large, modern, clean and well appointed room and bath. Hotel is situated away from the strip. Its smoke-free, quiet and not crowded and noisy like most hotel/casinos. Its a great place to chill and its easy to get in and out of the hotel. You really forget that you're in Vegas! But its an easy walk to Ballagio and Aria/Crystals (high end shops). Or you can take the monorail to Aria/Crystals and Monte Carlo. We did not get spa treatments but they do have a very nice upscale spa facility with steam/sauna/jacuzzi. The gym is also well equipped. The pool area is small but did not have trouble finding a couple of lounge chairs. They have cabanas but you'll have to book them in advance. There's only one restaurant (SIlk Road). It was deserted most of the time so we didn't even look at the menu to give it a try. They do serve a sit down breakfast but we wanted something quick. They had pastries wrapped in plastic and they didn't look appetizing at all!!! :-( All the staff in the hotel were nice and friendly. No service issue. Would DEFINITELY stay here again!!!! WHAT I LIKED: - Smoke Free/casino free environment - quiet location with less crowds - large modern well appointed room & bath WISH LIST: - iPod dock would have been nice! - Better food outlets - A firmer bed (It was comfortable but too soft for me)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Shannykate
Reviews.Content: I felt super fabulous in this hotel. The decor is very chic. It felt like a cute little apartment rather than a hotel. However the best part about it was the little kitchenette. It saved so much money. We went to Walmart and stocked up on snacks, cereal, milk, sandwich fixings, alcohol, etc. We had trouble with the mechanical blinds not closing, but the bellman had an engineer come up to fix them. He got it taken care of ASAP. The rest of the staff was very helpful. The only problem is that we had to leave to go out at night, shop, and eat out away from the hotel and it is set back away from the strip so you have to walk down the street a couple of blocks to get to the strip so if being close to the "action" is important, this isn't the place for you. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “W-O-W!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel!!! It's quiet, non-smoking....none of that busy casino traffic you find at other hotel lobbies, the staff are friendly and professional, the place is totally clean, and the decor is totally awesome! It's just like staying at your very own high end luxury condo! The best however, are the beds....soft and totally TOTALLY comfortable....definitely the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on in my life! All the rooms have a king size bed with a queen size pull out sofa bed. All I did was call housekeeping and they were up within 5-10 minutes to make it up. My friend who slept on it said it comfortable, but not as comfortable as the main bed, and kept sneaking over to mine. The pool is a bit small, but very nice to sit out at and take a dip. It's a popular place for everyone to hang out and cool down. The pool staff are all very friendly and helpful and will make your experience a very enjoyable one.....we asked for an umbrella, and it was set up within minutes. The gym is very nice....not huge, but excellent machines and weights. Towels, bottled water, headphones, etc. are all provided. And the great thing about the machines is that they have TVs with a channel guide, and are Nike+iPod ready. I totally loved the spacious rooms. Very comfortable, large and wide windows to catch the vegas night lights, controls for the blinds and blackout curtains, a kitchenette with microwave, mini fridge, cook top, dining table, spacious bathroom with separate shower and free standing bath tub, etc. The only thing that wasn't working was the room safe. I called housekeeping about this and they said they would fill out a work order right away, but so far no one has come to fix it. If you're into the busy casino action type atmosphere, then try the Aria. It's a beautiful and uniquely designed hotel with one of the best pastry outlets downstairs! A definite try! I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone....if you like the private stay type accomodation, and still close to everything, then stay at the Vdara. If you're the type into busy casino action, restaurants, and entertainment, then definitely stay at the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable hotel room I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: holyport4
Reviews.Content: The new six star Vdara, opened late 2009, has no casinos or nightclubs. It is joined to the Bellagio by a walkway and it is absolute heaven to come from the noise of Las Vegas into the tranquil peaceful Vdara. The suites (all suites) are great, the bed soooo comfortable and big, bathrooms spotless and well equipped and we had a great view over the Bellagio fountains. Pool great. Didn't eat in. Suite had kitchen but strangely only 2 mugs in the cupboards!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, crisp, and oh so refreshing!”
Reviews.Author: Musikflier
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the beginning of June. Ignore the bad reviews! Just do a teeny little bit of homework, most of the others' gripes will not be your own: 1) Kitchenware, cookware, wine glasses are all available for the asking. Just ask! Like, at check-in. 2) Don't be confused by the electronics. A switch by the entrance door is always the Master, which turns everything on or off. 3) There are both shades AND blackout features for the electric curtain control. 4) Tip your housekeeper: you will probably get extra water and coffee pods. 5) Free coffee is always available in the mornings at the Spa, on the 2nd level. 6) There is indeed a coffee bar downstairs with for-purchase coffee and breakfast, as well as the restaurant Silk Road. 7) Don't whine about not getting your spa treatment because they are full. You can make spa treatment reservations 3 months in advance using the online Concierge, once you have booked your room. Vdara's location is indeed in the back of city center. But I am certain that the time needed to get from Vdara to the Aria casino might rival that of the some of the rooms in Aria itself! Same goes for the Bellagio casino. Everything that has been said about Vdara's qualities is right on. Clean, modern, helpful staff, pleasant lobby, quick elevators, great pool, descent gym.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: hellsangell24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I married at the Little White Wedding Chapel and enjoyed a wonderful 10 day stay in Vegas. This was made even more wonderful by our choice of hotel. We found the Vdara a truly, relaxing experience. Staff were friendly but professional. Rooms were beautifully experienced. Pool was small but perfectly formed. Location was perfect - close enough to access the buzz of Vegas but far enough away that when you went 'home' it was peaceful. I particularly loved the smells of the hotel - clean and smoke free - which is hard to find in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: girlsumps
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a peaceful haven amidst the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas and after staying there for 7 nights, I would definitely return. From walking into the lobby for the first time, the fresh, slightly floral (not overly powerful as it didn't set off my rather sensitive allergies) scent. Check in was slow, not because of the clerks, however, but because of the people in the queue in front of us who queried every last detail of every last word on paper you sign stating that you acknowledge the Vdara is a non smoking hotel and has no casino and what the resort fee entails. The room was uber clean, uber modern and the bed was even more comfortable to the one we slept in at the Bellagio last year. I also wish I had a suitcase large enough to take the entire bathroom home with me! Just to clarify a few things. When you leave your room, press the house keeping button by the door, our house keeper said that it all gets collated by a computer and when there are enough house keeping signals, they come and clean those ready to be cleaned on your floor. The walkway to Bellagio is literally a minute's walk and it's also faster to walk to Aria through the front doors of Vdara than it is to take the tram - we found that out the second day! If you want to save your legs, it takes 3 minutes on the Tram to get from Bellagio to Monte Carlo or about 10 minutes (at a very leisurely pace) to walk from Vdara, through Aria to Monte Carlo. We didn't use the turn down service but housekeeping in the morning will bring you two small bottles of water and the keurig coffee pods and creamer packs so you don't need to have the turn down service to get them! Also, if you do want to kitchenware and utensils, it took about 5 minutes for housekeeping to bring them to our room. We used room service, and I thought it was very good value for money. We didn't use silk road though but it now has a grab and go coffee bar for those who don't want to use the coffee maker in the room. Again, if you don't want to use Silk Road, your best bet would be to walk through to Aria for the fastest coffee. Location, yes Vdara is set back from the strip but it's still close to the action. When the sidewalk opens properly, you'll be 5 - 10 minutes from the madness and mayhem of Las Vegas Boulevard. To sum up, don't let the negative comments put you off. We had the best hotel experience we've ever had in Las Vegas. In a way, it's a bit like being in the Caribbean where the slower pace of life take a bit of time to get used to but when you slow down with it, you'll realise how much of an oasis the Vdara really is.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to live here.”
Reviews.Author: margaretchantel
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I've ever stayed at! Right when we pulled up in our cab, we were greeted by the friendliest bellman ever. He was chatty, and helpful, and took us to the check-in counter and check-in took less than 5 minutes. We were upgraded to a Jr. Suite for the price of deluxe room. The smell in the lobby is phenomenal & superior to any of the hotel lobby's I've smelled in Vegas lol... The walkway joining the bellagio and Vdara is 30 seconds at the most - however, the walk inside the Bellagio is quite long.. I spent a lot of time at the Belaggio & while it's nice in there - I would pick Vdara over that place any day. Our suite was huge, with state of the art appliances, and a washer and dryer! On our last night in Vegas, we had caught a cab back to the hotel at some ungodly hour & the bellman recognized us and chatted w/ us more -- we loved him. I sooo can't wait to go back. People who criticize this place seriously have unrealistic expectations and should get over themselves. This place is top notch & excellent value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks VDara for making my stay comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Mitanrc
Reviews.Content: It's been just couple of hrs & I am already missing it. There are days, when people get disappointed even with Hotels like Bellagio and Venetian. Their bad. My stay at VDara was a memorable one. If I ever comeback to Vegas, it will be VDara again. Myself and my husband just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: Rico1999
Reviews.Content: The wife and I recently stayed three nights at Vdara, and what a treat! The rooms are absolutely amazing, towering high above the Las Vegas skyline to provide a beautiful view from every side. To say that the room itself was clean is an understatement. Everything here is new, shiny, and extremely impressive. The oversized hot tub was well recieved by my wife. We ordered room service our first night from the Silk Road restaraunt that was just absoultely delicious! The Bellagio is connected to Vdara via skywalk and Aria is just a few steps away if a Casino is what you are looking for. It's quite refreshing not having to manuver my way around slot machines and card just to get to my room! The swimming pool is on the second floor, so you don't have to go through the lobby in your swimwear just to relax poolside either! Vdara is an amazing experience in the heart of Vegas, but secluded enough to provide the comfort of a complete getaway. Teriffic, friendly staff. Clean facilities. Quiet, comfortable, modern. Yes, Vdara is a bit on the pricey side as far as hotels in Vegas go, but worth every penny if a World-Class experience is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “great oasis of calm in midst of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Canada55plus
Reviews.Content: this was an excellent hotel with no smoking policy or casino - Aria and Bellagio so close by to enjoy the crowds and casinos but so nice to come 'home' to a peaceful quite place. Standard deluxe room was more than adequate - ask for a room with a view of the Bellagio fountains. Each room has a fridge, micro oven along with a stove top if wanting to keep any food in your room. Only one restaurant but we mostly brunched it at Aria at the buffet - excellent value. The staff at Vdara very pleasant and helpful. Businss centre good. Hotel rooms and lobby very clean. Pool small but adequate - again staff very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “One of Vegas' best - missing it already!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiansunsets
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Vdara. Went for a mom/daughter getaway. Can't say enough positives about this place. We had an early flight so I had requested an early check in and they exceeded my expectations with our room ready immediately. Requested a top floor and was given the 51st! We had an awesome view of the city and the Bellagio water show. The room was clean, comfortable, and met our needs. Very comfortable bed and enjoyed the soaking tub. After reading other reviews I came prepared with a few disposable kitchen items. We piled lots of snacks into the frig. and used the microwave once. The concierges were wonderful - especially John. All of the staff were friendly. Don't know why some people said they were rude. Enjoyed pool time every day and always had a great time. My daughter enjoyed the Wi-Fi for her I-phone. We didn't mind the daily service charge. Other hotels charge them too. Overall, it was a fantastic hotel from quick check in to quick check out. I recommend it to everyone and hope to return again. Thank you Vdara for getting it right!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Diva1979
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas so I don't really have anything to compare this stay to but I found Vdara to be great. I was getting worried just before our trip after reading the bad reviews (fire alarm, rude staff, far from the strip) but experienced none of that. We flew in May 29 at around 10:30 pm and the strip itself was packed because of the UFC fight but the hotel check in was a breeze, only one person in front of us. The front desk explained the $15 daily resort fee (which I knew when I booked so we brought our laptop) and that the hotel was non-smoking, non-gaming. The hotel is literally a breath of fresh air as others have mentioned comparable to the smoke filled casino hotels. We cut through Bellagio to get to the strip, about 5 min. walk so it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. We were on the 30th floor overlooking the Bellagio pool and could see a bit of the fountain and the Eiffel tower. My bf was impressed with the room right when we walked in. Room was very clean, big, comfy bed, clean bathroom with all the amenities mentioned on their site, 2 big screen tv's and small fridge in the kitchenette. We didn't use the pool, room service or spa so I can't say anything about those. We hardly used the kitchenette except for storing our water and drinking coffee. Front desk was helpful whenever we had questions. Overall, I really liked Vdara and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to be 5 star-but doesn't quite make the grade.”
Reviews.Author: tritzilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we had our two young children with us, and wanted a hotel that was non-smoking, no casino, and quiet. It was that, and boosts it's a 5 star hotel. It's really just a 4 star hotel. It was clean, and great amenities, ( spa and pool). However, the employees were ok, didn't seem like most of them were happy to be there, most were polite when spoken to, but none compared to other 5 star hotels. We had tea at the Manderin Oriental, also in City Center, and one hotel over, and their service and employees even in the short time we were there, were waaaaaaaaaaay better than Vdara. Rooms at Vdara were beautiful, large, clean and spacious, very quiet, rooms were occupied all around us, but never heard anyone in other rooms or the halls. Check out was slow, and I had to request for another staff to come as the line was growing, only had one person dealing with some unhappy people. The rest of us could see they were unhappy and the way I had to request for another person made me unhappy. This hotel looks like and tries to be a 5 star hotel, but is lacking in so many ways. I would have to agree with others who have reviewed, this hotel just doesn't live up to what it portrays it to be. I would stay here only again if it's a good deal, otherwise, I think we would try the Manderin Oriental or Aria next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseSeeker80
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights here at the end of our West Coast holiday & had a great time! The hotel doesn't have a casino but links straight to the Bellagio, so you get the peace & quiet of a lovely hotel & aren't too far from the madness of Vegas! Rooms are a good size, clean & comfortable beds! The staff at reception could be a little more clued up & helpful but apart from that no bad feedback! It is a business hotel & very different from the typical Las Vegas hotels. So if you want the OTT of it all in your hotel, this isn't the one for you!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with service and room, would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: twetnall
Reviews.Content: We too we're here evening of the fire alarm. It was a total fiasco, they didn't appear to have any procedure in place at all. Although that evening has no bearance on the poor review for this hotel. The best bit about this hotel is the central location on the strip it's only a short walk to the Bellagio. unfortunately that is where my praise ends. The room was cheaply fitted out, the glass sliding door into the bathroom didn't provide much privacy. We had to call down 4 times to get the amenities stocked up. We we're told that turn down service was upon requested so we requested it told it would be A 3 hour wait seen as we we're off out for the evening we said that was fine, only to come back 4 hours later and it hadn't been done. However the thing that annoyed me the most is that it says it's an all suite hotel with kitchen. It does indeed have a kitchen but that's where it ends. All crockery, cutlery, and glassware are on request. There is no bin, washing up liquid, paper towels, nothing. We asked for a toaster so we could have bagels for breakfast we we're told that room service would have to bring it to the room wait while you toast and then take it back which is completely ridiculous. This is the only hotel in Vegas that I would never stay in again. If your looking for a mini suite stay in the Trump with a fully equipped kitchen

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MvilleNY
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very clean and a breath of fresh air after leaving the casinos. One of the reasons I chose the Vdara was the non smoking policy. The rooms were nice, well kept and clean. Room service was prompt and good quality. The pool was nice, but get there early as the chairs go fast. If your flight arrives before 1pm make plans to spend time sightseeing as check is not until 1pm. The Bellagio and a short 5min walk and the tram runs to the Monte Carlo and City Center - beautiful. If you are looking for a modern clean - Non smoking hotel this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest employees at Vdara - hide your valuables.”
Reviews.Author: rhino63
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for two nights at the Vdara City Center in Las Vegas. We were on our way back from college with a truck full of my daughter's possessions. You are required to valet park your car at the Vdara - there is on other option. We drove straight from Las Vegas to Denver two days later and when we unpacked the car we noticed someone had attempted to steal a pad locked safe out of her truck (tried to break the lock off but thankfully never got it fully off) and then damaged the back driver's door. They did over $1,300.00 worth of damage to the vehicle. It had to be while in the valet area, as they were the only ones that had access. I notified the hotel and they didn't care. They basically turned me over to their insurance co. who said I couldn't prove it. The hotel wouldn't even look at their security tapes. I'm furious - now I have to come up with $1,300.00 for a repair caused by somebody dishonest who is employed by a hotel that doesn't care about their guests - DON"T STAY HERE IF YOU VALUE YOUR POSSESSIONS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff treated us like a King and Queen”
Reviews.Author: Mzmarlo
Reviews.Content: When our cab pulled up to Vdara it exceeded my expectations completely. The pictures of the lobby don't do it justice, so beautiful. The staff was so attentive to all of our needs, can't thank them enough for such a wonderful experience. Room was super clean! Our bed was so comfortable I hated to have to come back to the one we have here at home. The best aspect of Vdara is the Non-Smoking policy. So great to come back to the hotel with crisp breatheable air after spending hours and hours in smoke filled casinos. Absolutely the Best!

Reviews.Title: “This turned into a relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: ArtimusPrime
Reviews.Content: After the insanity of people, lights and noise of the Strip, this place is a breath of fresh air. It has a great location next to the Bellagio, and the free tram which takes you to Aria and the Monte Carlo area. We arrived late and were upgraded to a Vdara Suite which is basically a one-bedroom apartment, including full fridge, dishwasher, washer, and dryer. This is a great place to stay if you have kids. No casinos to walk through and it's completely non-smoking. The only complaint is about the housekeeping. The bellhop said he'd tell them to make up the sofabed for our kid. They never showed and we had to call. We also had to call to make sure the room was cleaned and towels replaced. Both items were taken care of quickly, but you shouldn't have to call. I'll give them a pass because everything else was terrific and they are still relatively new.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive...”
Reviews.Author: GrayGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of Honeymoon that had started in California and was to end in Miami. We stayed a sun and mon night and our rate was pretty good for what we got but the sat night rate was excessive and that was why we had stayed in the signature @ mgm for the one night previous. We payed $159 / night but they wanted $259 for the sat hence the two different hotels The hotel is located in the new city centre location beside the aria and the mandarin. The whole city centre set up reminded me of delta city from the film robocop. All very futuristic with a fancy shuttle linking most of the hotels. We had a room on the 43rd floor that had amazing views onto the bellagio fountains. The room itself was nice and modern with the usual nice bathroom & kitchen. We really liked the kitchens in the room and had one previous in the signature but this was more modern and out of sight from main room as in the hallway which the signature didnt have. An annoyance of the kitchen however is that there is no cutlery or cooking utensils or crockery??? were we to pack our own pots n pans? Seemed mad to have a kitchen with no bowls etc....we only used the fridge for waters but we liked buying cereal to have in the morning but there was no bowls or spoons....crazy! The other annoyance was that we were hoping to relax by the pool during the day but both days the pool was closed due to high winds so we got to use the Aria hotels pool which was actually pretty impressive. Liked also that there was no casino attached so you could get away from it all. Liked also that there was 2 lift lobbies...1 for the lower floors and 1 for the higher....made commuting from a high floor pretty quick.....maybe seems a petty comment but at the signature when we travelled from the 35th floor down there was at least 7 stops on way down. Apart from the above it is a really nice hotel and would recommend a stay here if you can source a good rate

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: newmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara May 12-15 to celebrate our anniversary. I chose the hotel based on the corporate website (it looked lovely) and then read some of the reviews on here about service, so went in prepared that things may not be ideal. That said, my experience with TripAdvisor is that its best to look at what "most" people say, versus wrrying about minor complaints from a few. We paid $117/night and received a $75 resort credit so the price was definetly right. $30 cab ride from airport - seems closer but because of the street setup seems you have to go in a few circles to get there. Check in was FAST, only a few minutes (we arrived at 6pm), room was ready and we were upgraded to a Vdaha suite (separate bedroom, full kitchen, two bathrooms) - we were impressed. Room was super clean, fully equipped. I had to call to the front desk to find the hairdryer (in a "hidden" drawer betweent the two sinks in the main bathroom, fyi!). Free wi-fi (incl in your $15 resort fee), but note you need to sign up every 24 hours. Our room was not cleaned/made up on the second day, but that was my fault as I had used the electronic system to "do not disturb" and forgot to turn that off when we went out for the day - I would guess this would explain some of the other posts, too, where they have stated their room was not cleaned. When we got back to room, there was a message from housekeeping, I requested new towels and got then within 15 minutes, so for me the service was very good. Hotel smells lovely, as others have stated, not at all overpowering, and much better than the "smoking hotels". Pool was nice, agree it is is on the small side if the hotel was booked solid, but was fine during our stay - expensive drinks though, $14 - coffee to go downstairs cost me $8 - all of a sudden Starbucks seemed Cheap! Our only complaint was around the 2am evacuation on the night of the 14th - like others we were required to head down the stairs (was glad we were only on the 10th floor and glad we did not have small children with us, as some other guests did) - as we headed down there was mild panic in the stairway as no one knew if something had actually happened or if it was a false alarm. When we got to the bottom there were ABSOLUTELY NO STAFF, ANYWHERE, directing people what to do.We stood outside for about 20 mintues, then a man in a City Center Safety truck drove up and said it was a false alarm, we started to go back in, but then a younger man (night manager?) said no one was allowed to go back to rooms - poor communication and no one clearly in charge - this caused unneccessary panic and then frustatration for many of the guests - we just took it in our stride. They did seem concerned about making sure the property was safe before allowing people up to their rooms. This was a study in people watching, the staff had brought a few racks of robes from the laundry to assist people who had come down in various states of dress and unfortunately MANY people took advantage of this (after the crisis when we were lined up at the elevators) and took robes, even stating it was "the least they were owed" - Shameful, particularly the man with the young daughter who was the ringleader and encouraging this behaviour! I sincerely hope that the management of the Vdara learn from this false alarm to be better organized & prepared if there ever was an emergency. When we checked out, the front desk did acknowledge the incident (without our prompting) and requested our contact information as the managers were working on compensation for the inconvenience. The manager (?) at the bell desk also acknowledged the evacuation, which we thought was great. We did not receive the email/ phone call we were told we would receive, and although I understand it was an unfortunate event and do not expect anything from Vdara, I do think it reflects poorly that they have not followed through. We would stay aa this hotel again, the location was not a problem for u (though may be for someone older). We saw VIVA ELVIS (really great), but do not get sucked into visiting their "VIP bar" before the show to use the 2-for-1 coupon for a drink - our two drinks cost $17 WITH thecoupon, and this was the only time we received poor service (at Aria) - would like to stay at ARIA next time, though, looked very modern and nice. Ate at Todd English's P.U.B in Crystals Mall - very good. Also ate at the Wolfgang Puck resto there (cannot remember name), it was ok, SPAGO at Caesar's was better (our favorite). Tip about the airport - limited choices to eat there, eat on the strip before you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overpriced hotel room, overrated for sure!”
Reviews.Author: KSG00
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my 5 night stay at the Vdara. Normally my husband and I stay at the MGM mainly because we LOVE their pools and we like to spent a main part of the day in the sun. Check in isnt until 3pm but I had emailed ahead and asked for earlier check-in, thank goodness because other people had to check their bags and kill 2 hrs which isnt ideal after a long day of traveling. Once we got to our room we had an AMAZING view of the strip with HUGE windows. Loved amazing at night. We were on the 53rd floor and could see for miles and miles. Downsides to the room.. The mini fridge doesnt get cold, we tried cranking it cold to keep milk for my cereal. Needless to say - the milk went bad very fast. I thought it'd be alot cleaner for the price we paid. You could tell the bathroom counters had just been wiped without moving anything, same with the shower (there was nastiness in the corners), a huge stain on the carpet as well as the pillowcase. HUGELY dissapointed with the cleanliness. Loved the location, connects right to Bellagio and so its not far to get anywhere.. The pool wasnt very busy during the week we were there, mind you it wasnt very warm weather. Its almost as though its in a wind tunnel though, on two separate days there were pool chairs being blown into the pool. Drinks are also quite pricey $14 before tip. The pool area was nice and quiet though which was nice. Very comfertable. Another downside was no starbucks or snack shops. Just one overpriced restraunt open for breakfast and dinner. Tastes good but be prepared to pay about $40 for a small breakfast. Make sure you check out on your tv in your room to beat the huge line ups at the desk. I wouldnt stay at the Vdara again. I would've expected alot more for the price I paid, and there were too many deal breakers (restraunts, starbucks, only one pool). I would describe my stay as "fine". Definately not the best hotel I've stayed at, nor the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: missyu16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara a total of three times. The first time was back in Dec 2009, when it first opened. It was nice and clean but the service was slow. We asked for more pillows and blankets- it took room service TWO hours. We did a review about them after our trip and Vdara gave us two free nights to return to their hotel to see if anything has changed. The service was still SLOW. The line to check in and check out was insane. There is only ever ONE person to work at the registration desk- I even have a picture! The other bad part about Vdara is that it's at the city center and to get in and out of the hotel is very confusing- you are driving around in circles. I would not recommend this hotel. The only reason to stay at the hotel is because there is a frig and a stove top. But why would you cook in Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - We loved it...”
Reviews.Author: TraceyPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the Vdara Hotel and Spa. I’m very picky about hotel accommodations; must be clean, stylish and functional. The Vdara was a hit. We LOVED it. We had a beautiful, spacious and spotless room on the 37th floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains and the North strip. It had a small kitchen (you must request kitchen ware if you want it), and a huge bathroom with separate shower and free standing bathtub. The bed was dreamy with great linens and they provided plenty of fluffy bath towels as well as Aveda bath products. The overall décor is very sheik and modern. Check-in was a breeze – no line when we arrived and the room was ready right away. It is a non-gaming hotel; however it’s only a 5 min walk to the Aria Hotel and Casino. Only issue is you must walk outdoors which proved to be uncomfortable due to extremely high winds – like 40 mph+. It seems the City Center buildings form a bit of a wind tunnel. Kind of funny actually… Would also be a bummer during summer heat or when it’s raining. You can also walk to Bellagio through indoor tunnel and/or ride the monorail between Bellagio, Aria, and Monte Carlo. Shopping at City Center “Crystals” is strictly HIGH end. Makes Nordstrom look like a Wal-Mart… The Aria casino is gorgeous. We went to see Viva Elvis @ Aria; the newest Cirque show in Vegas. It was fun and I would not hesitate to recommend it, although in my opinion, it’s not as great as “O” or even LOVE. It certainly did not have the technical difficulty of other Cirque offerings. Everything about City Center is pretty high end. You’re not going to find affordable dinning. If you want a great steak, check out “Brand” at the Monte Carlo. Yum! Have fun! Viva Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “We were delighted with our experience...”
Reviews.Author: LarryTfromCanada
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our experience. The beautiful suite exceeded our expectations. Especially nice were the large soaking tub, the comfortable bed and spectacular view and the dual HDTVs (facing the sleeping and sitting areas). A couple of minor complaints: we had to request dishes and utensils, and bell service was a little slow at checkout time. But the smoke-free environment and absence of an on-site casino made this a relaxing refuge from the hubbub of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for Vegas getaway”
Reviews.Author: ATLAXE
Reviews.Content: Vdara really was a perfect stay for our 3-Day Romantic getaway. I would agree with others that it isn't a Vegas 5 star hotel in itself, but with rates in the mid-100s, it isn't priced that way. We had a very quick check-in and service was steady and responsive throughout our time there. It wasn't over the top 5 star service but it was friendly and reliable. Many complain about Vdara being too far from the strip, but there is a covered walkway that connects Vdara to Bellagio and it is a short walk to Aria. IMHO, we simply felt we were staying at Bellagio only with a nicer room at 50% the cost. It is almost like you are staying in the Bellagio spa tower. If you compare Vdara to TheHotel, the walk from your room to the strip is about the same and Vdara is more centrally located on the Strip. I would choose Vdara over TheHotel when you consider how much less it typically costs. Our room was really pretty amazing. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. We didn't hear any noises the whole time we were there. The large LCDs have tons of channels and awesome HD picture. Vdara is probably the best value in Vegas right now.

Reviews.Title: “VDARA - NADA”
Reviews.Author: Dean_eh
Reviews.Content: When we stayed the weekend of May 14, 2010 at Vdara we were very disappointed in the staff attention to customer service, they made us feel like they were doing us a favor by their mere presence. Then to top it off Friday night /Saturday (15-May) morning at 2 AM an alarm went off to evacuate the building. When got down stairs we had staff members instructing us to go back to our rooms and then another staff member at the elevator telling us to stay out – it was not a poorly managed situation. Back in our room they then proceeded to make 3 separate announcements over the next 20 minutes re-stating the error. When we checked out on Monday (17-MAY) we were told we would be receiving an e-mail on Wednesday (19-May) from the Vdara management offering compensation as a resolution. Here it is Monday (25th) and we have not heard a word of follow-up from anyone associated with this organization. I cannot in good conscious recommend this facility - go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kyppybear
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was smaller than I had expected. The lobby consisted of one restaurant (Silk Road), a small seating area, a bar (Bar Vdara), and a small front desk all within relatively close quarters. The hotel room was modern looking, but definitely 'confused'.. You'll know what I mean if you stay there. The service was mediocre.. B- at best if even. We did use the bellhop/valet service who were surprisingly attentive. The front desk was nice (gave us a complimentary upgrade on the 47th floor with the Bellagio fountain view..) but room service (housekeeping, coffee refill, etc) were mediocre. The linens were dirty (all of the guests we stayed with came home with small rashes on our bodies) and the resort fee which included coffee/water never showed up in the two nights we stayed there. The room also had a pull out sofa bed but strangely no linens whatsoever in the closet.. Two requests and a "I'll come down myself if it would speed up the process" later, someone arrived with them. The bathroom amenities were sparse and missing quite a few things that the website promised. There was no face wash, lotion, toothbrushes, or even conditioner. There was two shampoos in the shower and a new bar of soap in the dish. And a strange number of towels... In haphazard locations. The dust also noticeably began to collect on the dark wood the following day. We do not order housekeeping room service during our stay unless the hotel has proven its ratings... And after reading some reviews we decided it was best not to. Also.. the lines during check in and check out were not as bad as some people have experienced. The restaurant was OK. We were confused at the decor and its name... We got to eat as part of the room voucher so can't really complain at the quality I suppose. FYI I didn't know, you have to pay the gratuity even if the dollar amount should be covered by the voucher.. So much for the happy tip I thought I left because I wasn't happy after I found out when I was checking out. Anyway, it was a journey to get from the hotel to the strip as other reviewers have stated. We just played at the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace but when we tried to find out way to Planet Hollywood / Paris, it was quite an epic journey.. Somehow we ended up at Aria finally and then after walking through Aria did we finally make our way back to Vdara. Unless you plan to only play at Bellagio and Caesar's Palace.. Probably not an ideal location unless you plan to take taxis everywhere. Of course, we were rejected from a taxi because they said Vdara was too close.. from across the street. Overall I wouldn't stay here again. Dirty linens is just my number one pet peeve. If you plan to make no requests to housekeeping and keep to the connecting hotels, this may be the place for you. We were able to stay for $125/night + 15% hotel tax + $15.99 resort fee and booked on the Vdara website two weeks in advance. I was going to get the resort fee taken off but my guests wanted to use the sorry-for-a-gym fitness center they had. If you pay more than this, it definitely won't seem worth it. P.S. We never got to stay at the pool b/c it was too windy, however it looked incredibly small for a 50-something story hotel. Also.. They expect a heavy deposit so be ready to pay for that at the beginning of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of issues to be ironed out!”
Reviews.Author: maccaj73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for a few days and left happy but they certainly have a lot of problems to iron out before they display the attitude we recieved from the coffee shop guy when we questioned why the coffee cost $9USD!!!!! I called at 11pm to order room service after reading the menu in the service guide to be told we dont have room service?!!?!!?!?! I said i am staring at a extensive "in-room dining menu" and he said "ohh yer no we dont really do that anymore, we stopped offereing room service anymore because its quiet it should have been taken out of the book"?!?! How bizarre and a hotel of this size they have stopped offering room service period! Its not exactly close to the strip so its a fair walk though a maze to get fast food! Issues include - Lack of staff on front desk - Conciege desk to small for the size of the hotel - Rooms badly cleaned (strange for such a new place!)

Reviews.Title: “Vdara - comfy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPenguin
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Vdara was very good overall. We were comfortable, treated very respectfully, and considered it a good value. (We got a crazy good deal on Expedia - 6 nights, airfare, and free Beatles Love tickets all for $450/person, so we really couldn't have gone wrong.) The deluxe suite had a cute little kitchen. We were told upon check-in that we could call the bell desk for any kitchen supplies that weren't already there. There were two refrigerators, one was a pay bar and one was a regular fridge. Our room service meals were set up on the table in the kitchen area. The living room was small but comfortable. At one point, we had seven people sitting in that area fairly comfortably. The bed area was spacious enough for us and comfortable. The bed itself was very comfortable, and they also provide robes and slippers. Some people might find the entire space a bit too small, but having stayed in European hotels, I found it perfectly adequate. Also, the living room and bedroom areas are not completely enclosed; there's a divider (with a flat screen TV on each side) that divides them. If you're traveling with a group or kids, that may be surprising and off-putting, but my friend and I though the setup was great. The bathroom was also very comfortable. It did have my one pet peeve that's present in almost all hotel bathrooms: No fan. What is up with that? The shower also took quite a while to heat up, but otherwise it was a very comfortable bathroom. Overall, I felt extremely comfortable in the room. Being from Seattle, I feel very dry in Vegas, but I didn't feel as dry in this room as I usually do. One weird thing about the setup of the room: The switches to the large lights by the bed, and to close the window shade, were basically in the kitchen. Why not have these by the bed? Small complaint, but a weird design choice. We had room service a few times. The portions are smaller than you'd expect from room service, but adequate and tasty enough. As room service food generally is, it wasn't exceedingly fresh but good and delivered with a smile. We also had breakfast in the Silk Road restaurant downstairs. It's the same as the room service food only fresher. Not stellar service but passable. I used the pool on a couple of occasions. Even though I'm not a Vegas pool hard-body type, I didn't feel awkward. There was a variety of shapes, sizes, and ages, and the staff seemed friendly to all. The staff was generally very helpful and kind. They always ask where you're from, so be prepared for that. :) We did have a couple of times when we called down for something and nobody came to our room, which was kind of frustrating, but definitely not a dealbreaker. Also, there was a fire alarm one night, and I think the staff handled it very well. Being a new hotel, they didn't quite know what to expect from the automated system, but they kept us as informed and comfortable as possible. I felt that they valued our safety. The next day I requested to move to a lower room (we moved from the 25th floor to the 7th floor) because after the fire alarm, being so high up made me anxious. The staff handled this very politely and sympathetically, and very efficiently too. Pros Very comfortable, extremely clean Good location Friendly, helpful staff Cons Didn't answer a few of our requests Weird light switches Hot water in the shower took a while

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, design, zen!”
Reviews.Author: titoob
Reviews.Content: Waaaaaw! THat kind of sums up our impression of this new hotel in Vegas. We have stayed in the Bellagio & Planet Hollywood before, but the rooms & hotel atmosphere in Vdara are unbeatable. Quick & friendly checkin by Marina, got a complimentary upgrade to a suite & I must say: those suites are amazing! Full kitchen, laundry machine & dryer, living room with hugh flatscreen, awesome bedroom with another huge flatscreen & supercomfy bed, wonderful bathroom with delicious Aveda products. Complimentary wifi, water & coffee in the room. We even had a newspaper by the door in the morning! The hotel is smokefree so it always smells fresh & zen! Smokers can just step outside, no problem. A short walk to Bellagio if u want to go to the strip. Just a pity the restaurant was not open for diner when we were there. It looks delicious, will have to try it next time we are here! All I can say: Vegas has another competitor in the luxury / design hotel business - I would definitely recommend it and I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Msanc14
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was great! The rooms were elegant, but could have used some extra amenities (plates, bowls, napkins). They responded great to all our requests. Unfortunately, they had a malfunction of the fire alarm system at 0130. Not the best at informing their guests what was going on.

Reviews.Title: “Great low-key vacation”
Reviews.Author: destination
Reviews.Content: Based on the mixed reviews, we seem to have been on the high end of the spectrum. Our Pros and Cons are below, but this is all based on the kind of vacation we were looking for: relaxing and not too hectic. We also were looking for moderate night activity - dinner and a show at most. The lack of casino was a pro for us since it kept the hotel quiet. The off-the-beaten trail aspect was also not a problem, but would be a con for anyone who doesn't want to walk too far beyond City Center We also got a great deal on the room which made all "cons" pretty minor. Pros: Non-smoking, not too loud - usually, kitchenette in room, large room, pool area Cons: Pool hours were 9am-5pm while we there. While seasonal, it was too short for us - A private party was hosted at the pool one evening/night. Our room was pool-side and 34 floors up from the event, but the music was loud enough to permeate our room -City center is not intuitive and the concierge did not have maps readily available. For example, he told us to take the tram to MonteCarlo, then walk through MonteCarlo (i.e. past the lobby, through the casino, and out the other side) to get to the strip when really it's a short walk if you go through the front door of Vdara and take a left -We did not mind the walk, but you need to budget the extra time -Refrigerator in the kitchenette is pretty small - holds the leftovers from dinner and maybe a drink or two

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but staff need Emergency fire drills”
Reviews.Author: KandKOntario
Reviews.Content: We too were at the Vdara on May 15th when the fire alarm went off. We recognize the necessity for alarms, however the staff were clearly not prepared. We exited the stair well into the restaurant after walking down 21 flights of stairs. 4 staff members were standing with arms crossed not assisting upset or disabled guests or giving direction as to where we should exit from there. There was no clearly identified person in charge and guests were left standing outside without explanation. We were surprised that there was no note under the door in the morning apologizing for the inconvenience and no mention at checkout. I would have expected the hotel Public Relations department to be all over this. Anyhow, hopefully the hotel has been attentive to the feed back and are taking steps to have a solid emergency plan in place. The hotel itself is very nice, staff pleasant. Very quiet room. Did not hear any noise from other guests or noise from the street. Non smoking hotel is a definite plus after walking through the smoky casinos. The hotel sent up a bottle of champagne when they found out we were there for a special occasion. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Had a few problems here”
Reviews.Author: UKLizzie
Reviews.Content: I'm going to be kind here and assume that being fairly new, they are having some trouble getting everything operating smoothly (and they are offering some very good rates) but all in all, I didn't have the best stay. It took almost an hour to check-in. Partly my fault for picking the 'wrong' queue, but it's really annoying to see people who joined other queues 20 minutes later than you did getting checked in first. If they can't have enough reception staff on duty, how about one queue for all the desks? When I eventually got to the front of the queue, the welcome was indifferent. Whatever - I just wanted to get to my room. Having got there, I discovered it hadn't been cleaned. It looked like a bomb had hit it - if that's how people regularly leave their hotel rooms, I feel very, very sorry for housekeeping staff the world over. Anyway, having got back down to the lobby and asked the concierge (he was very nice) to help me as there were still huge queues to check in, I did eventually get a room, but it wasn't a good start. And there were numerous other people milling around in the lobby complaining that they couldn't get into their rooms yet (it was 7.00pm) so my problem was not an isolated one. On the plus side, the room I eventually got was lovely, on the 47th floor with a great view of the Bellagio fountains. The rooms are large, with a dining/kitchen area, separate sitting and sleeping areas (both with their own large, flat screen TVs) and nice bathrooms with separate shower and tub. I thought the room was excellent value for the $135 I had paid. My only complaint would be that the electronically operated blackout blinds don't completely cover the windows and therefore don't block out the light particularly effectively. There's also some noise from the main road which runs behind all the Strip hotels. The location is not as inconvenient as I'd feared. With no casino to walk through in Vdara, it's a very short journey down in the lift and along a covered walkway to the Bellagio Spa Tower wing, from which you can either continue through the Bellagio and out onto the strip, or take a tram to Aria/Crystals and continue from there. I certainly wouldn't let the location put your off if you want to be center strip. Anyway, even when I got into my room, Vdara hadn't quite finished with me. The fire alarm went off at 2.00am, very loudly indeed, and with flashing lights to boot. It was not a pleasant awakening, and nor was the thought of walking down all 47 floors to get out. Weirdly, the lifts were still working while the alarm was ringing, so with a couple of other guests from my floor, I exited that way. I'd had the presence of mind to get dressed & grab my purse on the way out, so I went off to the Bellagio and played on the slots for a while, but it was 3.15 by the time they figured out what was wrong with the alarm system and we all got back into our rooms. I guess the fire alarm isn't strictly Vdara's fault, but it wasn't a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara - don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: griffjd
Reviews.Content: The Vdara is a brand new hotel in the City Centre development in Las Vegas. Its a non gambling, non smoking hotel adjacent to the Bellagio (connected by a covered walkway)but set back around 400m from "The Strip". We had to change rooms twice after travelling for almost 24 hours. The door was open on the first room, someone had obviously been in the room as the bed was unmade. Security anyone? The second room was an upgrade overlooking the pool (actually on a much lower floor). The sink in the kitchen area smelled terrible. Its a waste disposal unit and hadn't been cleaned out. When temperatures are at Vegas levels this isn't good. Back to reception for another upgrade this time on the 36th floor overlooking the Fountains of the Bellagio. Thank you Rachel on Reception for being so helpful. I actually think she was terribly embarrassed about the whole situation. The hotel itself is pretty lifeless. The restaurant is only open for breakfast and lunch. Room service ends at 10pm. During our 7 night stay we were awoken by the Fire Alarm at 2am. The very few staff on duty at this time were as confused and disorganised as the guests. After decending 36 floors some staff members were telling us to return to our rooms (while the alarm was still sounding), others told us to evacuate. Not good. No one seemed to be in overall control of the situation. After about an hour we returned to our rooms only to be woken again about 20 minutes later by the PA system telling us that the cause of the alarm was unknown and that they were still investigating. The next day we were still unclear whether it indeed had been a false alarm. The Concierge also managed to book us a restaurant reservation on the wrong evening which could have been quite embarassing if we hadn't double checked ourselves. The pool is also much too small for the number of guests (especially at weekends). There are much better hotels in Vegas - we'd try the Aria next door which was on offer for just about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden diamond, still somewhat in the rough”
Reviews.Author: MsBethW
Reviews.Content: So my BFF's and I went to Vegas for three nights and stayed at Vdara and we had an amazing time! I go to Vegas fairly often and have stayed at Bellagio, Palazzo, Venetian, Encore, TheHotel etc. And strangely enough I had the best time at Vdara. Maybe I was just sick of the smoke and tired of the ringing sounds and endless crowds the hotels with casinos bring. So Vdara was a welcome change. After a night of shows, drinking, dancing, and partying it was nice to come back to a serene, spacious and beautiful room. When we first arrived, however, I have to admit that it took about 45 minutes to check in. I was fuming mad but knowing how the hotel industry worked, I asked very nicely if there was anything they could do for me since I was so patient and I was promptly upgraded to a one bedroom penthouse suite! They also delivered a free bottle of champagne to our room. The next day I called the concierge and Evan, who is awesome, booked us spa appointments and got us on the list to a few of the hottest clubs in town. We weren't in our room when the alarm went off at 2 am but that sucked I'm sure. The spa appointment was great! You can't beat 130 bucks for a 60 minute massage at a 5 star hotel. Had breakfast at silk road. The food was fine but the service was so slow! Don't know if I'd eat there again. It's about a 5 minute walk to bellagio and a 2 minute walk to aria so there are plenty of casinos and traditional vegas excitement nearby. There is also a tram that connects bellagio, vdara, aria, and monte carlo. Monte carlo has a ton of cheap eats and also had a 24 hour cafe that fulfilled my 4am craving for steak and eggs. Essentially, I got to relax and unwind at vdara after hitting the strip pretty hard all night. Keep in mind that it is a new hotel so it's going to have a few glitches. Also, it's a condo/hotel so that may explain why it's not as heavily staffed as other hotels. Finally, even though the lag time on service makes you angry, ask nicely and they'll pretty much give you anything you ask for. For me, I paid 120 a night for a penthouse suite, got free champagne, free brunch, discounts on spa services, and vip at haze, the bank and xs. Pros: huge, beautiful, clean rooms. A peaceful environment and friendly staff. Great location. Vons.com delivers to vdara since it's a condo/hotel. (I got alcohol and snacks delivered free). Cons: super slow service. (but if you "complain" about this issue nicely youre likely to get freebies). Not enough restaurants in hotel. Small pool. The pros definitely outweigh the cons and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “With all the choices in Vegas, we will pass on the Vdara in the future!”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2Travel23
Reviews.Content: We have stayed all over Las Vegas for almost 20 years. We decided to stay at the Vdara to check out CityCenter. Driving into the CityCenter is like driving into LAX. If your idea of a great hotel accommodation is the heart of LAX, then you have arrived. Upon walking into the Vdara, the smell of men's cologne is overpowering. Why the hotel chooses to use this scent as air freshener is beyond me. The front desk line was long and slow. On the plus side, the elevators were fast and our room was new, modern, and nice. Everything we needed was there, except coffee creamer. The hotel charges a $15 per night resort fee for coffee, water, a newspaper, etc. Fine-so where is my creamer? I called housekeeping several times for creamer. It never arrived. I had to approach housekeeping in the hallways and hit them up. The lack of customer service was just getting started. At 2:00am Friday night, as stated in a number of other posts, an emergency alarm blared and told us to evacuate immediately. We shuffled into the lobby and were milling around aimlessly. Not a SINGLE employee knew what was going on. The hotel is clearly understaffed, and the employees actually present are clueless. Not a single employee said "I don't know what is going on, but I'll look into it and get back to you." We decided after 10 minutes to go back upstairs. When we got there, I phoned the front desk and they said that we should not have gone back to our room. I inquired why a hotel employee wasn't at the elevators telling the hotel guests this. They weren't telling the guests anything! We went back to sleep and were woken three more times by a blaring message stating that the emergency alarm had been cleared. The next day, we went to the underwhelming pool and were served an overpriced drink by a surly and slow cocktail waitress. I'm willing to pay Vegas prices obviously, but with a bad attitude and no lush palm trees? No thanks. We'll head over to Mandalay Bay for our expensive drinks and hotel rooms. Don't do us any favors by overcharging us to stay at your charmless hotel. None of the staff mentioned anything about the false alarm (via a letter in our room or a telephone call or a posting somewhere). Nothing! It was like it never happened. I understand that things happen, but the lack of any response by a single staff member is just poor customer relations. I asked the lady at the front desk upon checking out (another long line at 8 am) about what the hotel might be doing to compensate guests for the false alarm and she told me vaguely that a manager will be contacting me within a week. What that means, I have no idea! Honestly, an explanation and maybe a free drink coupon would have satisfied my husband and me. Extra coffee creamer packets even! Anything resembling customer service would have been appreciated. By the way, there is one bar in the lobby, so if you want to buy coffee or breakfast or anything else, you're walking. There was a restaurant in the lobby, but it never looked open and the reviews for it are poor. I have been telling all my friends and family to AVOID the Vdara. The worst part is that the Vdara should not be this awful. The rooms and bathrooms are really nice, but the service is really, really awful. I will never, and I mean never, pay to stay at the Vdara again.

Reviews.Title: “Crapshoot , can be fantastic or bomb”
Reviews.Author: HikingtheParks
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights and as you can tell from other reviews your stay here is a crapshoot which really is a shame because the concept is great. My son is a head bartender at a Ritz Carlton resort and I stay there quite a bit so I am familiar with 5 star hotels. I also do not mind staying at a lower end hotel as long as it really delivers service for that level. I gave a 5 star to a Travelodge that did that. The good news on the Vdara is the hotel and the rooms are beautiful, most of the staff and the concierge Sarah was very nice, the views from rooms up high are great, the spa is really wonderful, the hotel is clean and smoke free but not too far from the strip. Middle of the road is there is a kitchen but with the world's smallest refrigerator, a nice bathroom but the lighting is not very good, a nice pool area but the music is too loud. The dark side is we checked in and the fridge had leftovers still in it and a dirty robe left in closet. When I asked about getting decaf to the maid cleaning the leftovers she said you need to call for it, I said how about you take care of getting that for me instead of me calling? The next maid told me they trained her on what to do with bedding one way but she did something else anyway. Good training program. I tried to talk with a manager on my second day and was told she was busy but she could call my cell phone if I wanted to not wait, so I left it but do you think she called? Last day I got a flat tire returning to the hotel, the valet came up and said he wished he could help but he was too busy and ran off, I just laughed and said well of course you are, what else would I expect. Finally talked to a manager before I left who said he had worked at a Ritz and you could just tell looking at his expression that he was pounded all day with complaints for the service there. He did take off my resort fee which saved me $50.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nichols2010
Reviews.Content: Our service we had at the VDARA was horrible. First night there we had an evacuation of the whole hotel and it lasted almost 2hours. At the end we asked the reasoning for the evacuation and they had no answer for us. My wife also wanted sugar and cream for her coffee that was suppose to be in the room already. We called the front desk and asked for some and they said they would send someone up right away, well waiting we were just relaxing and then got ready to go out for the day and in 2 1/2 hours there was no one that came to our room so we just went out for the day. Next morning we got up and there was no power in the washroom. So we called the front desk and told them we had no power. They said we will send someone right up. Well we waited for someone for 30min then decided to shower and get ready for the day. Once again no one showed up at all to our room and we got ready in a washroom with no lights! I thought be almost a brand new hotel it would be very nice to stay at for the MONEY we paid to be there. We definitly overpaid for the service we got. But our sheets had stains on them from them not changeing them during room service. never got changed the 3 nights we were there.We arrive and there was like mustard yellow color stains on it. The room we stayed in was very nice and comfortable though. The location was good. except to go anywhere you would have to walk the whole ARIA hotel to get out on the strip everytime. the thing we liked best was the View from our room onto the fountain show at the BELLAGIO. Thing we liked the least was the SERVICE. Just to let people know this is my first time ever writing or complaining about something like this, i am really easy going. But it just seemed like 1 thing after another so, I just dont want people to go away dissappointed like me and my wife. The only thing i would like is good service for the money that we pay to stay at nice places.

Reviews.Title: “Excruciatingly slow service”
Reviews.Author: BBYA1
Reviews.Content: Overall - the Vdara Hotel & Spa is beautiful - but it doesn't make up for the lack of service and poor organization. When I arrived at the hotel at 7pm to check in there was a big line up of people waiting and only 2 front office staff checking people in. Once we FINALLY made it to the front of the line we were told that our room was not ready - and that we would be called when it was. Keep in mind that the regular check in is at 3pm - so 4 hours late is just unacceptable. Once we WERE called to check in we discovered they had given us the wrong room type. That was resolved 30 minutes later after 2 calls to the front desk. The service issue doesn't stop there - when we arrived into our room we made a call down to front desk to request additional blankets and pillows. An hour later and three calls to the front desk and we still didn't have the additional blankets and pillows..so we continued to wait. Once again - the service issue didn't end there. We went to the hotel restaurant (Silk Road) the following day for lunch. We proceeded to wait 20 minutes in the restaurant lobby and once brought in we saw that the restaurant was only 10% full. Forty five minutes after we ordered our food we FINALLY got our dishes..only to find them luke warm and bland.
