In all honesty - the hotel is lovely but the service issues do not compensate for the product. When we COULD get someone to help us they were friendly and polite - but the issue lies in the fact that there weren't enough people on staff to handle the number of guests they had staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Catered Service - Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: gfkahn
Reviews.Content: We recently had a wonderful experience at the Vdara. It has amazing views and the concierge REALLY took care of us. FIrst off - its clean (NO SMOKE) and quiet (NO CASINO) buts its a 5 minute walk to the Bellagio or to the Aria which both have all the excitement you could ever want and its also right off the strip. It was a great place to retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city and al the gambling. The Spa/message was good - they have a lot of options - but not outstanding. The one thing that stuck out for us was the general cleanliness and newness of all the amenities - it really made us feel comfortable. As for the concierge - well - it was our engagement weekend and they really did a fantastic job arranging the room to our specifications, making it incredibly romantic and giving us a SPECTACULAR room with ridiculous view of the Vegas skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Location a little inconvient, but worth the inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: AltarServer
Reviews.Content: The room was great and the view spectacular, especially at night. From our room, we had a view of the Bellagio water show. Other conveniences in the room were a microwave, a frig, two 46"flat screen tv's, a pair of slippers for each of us, an in-room safe etc. The inconvenience was that we had to walk a "Las Vegas" block to get to the Strip and there was no casino (a substantial savings). Overall - great!

Reviews.Title: “Great, quieter place with no casino!”
Reviews.Author: abgrl
Reviews.Content: Went down in February for my sisters wedding. Great no casino option in the middle of the strip. Nice and quiet after a long day of touring the strip. Also, the Vdara is directly conntected to the Bellagio.....so if you want a close casino you can just head to the Bellagio. Did have some kinks being a brand new hotel. Three of us were sharing a suite, and they put us in the smaller suite. We stayed there the first night, but had to move furniture so I could sleep on the pull out. Not great, so we did get a bigger suite the next night. Problem with our room keys too, in both suites. We ended up a the front desk 15 times, before they finally got our room keys figured out. It is a very posh place, so make sure you have enough for tips!! Also, no self parking. Valet only!! Didn't eat in the restaurant as it was very pricey. Suites were excellent. Comfortable beds, huge shower and seperate tub in the bathroom, nice furnishings. They don't have any supplies in the kitchenette at all. You can request everything from housekeeping, than you tip again!! All in all it was a great 4 day stay. Would definitely stay again, if it wasn't so darn expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: 2gocup
Reviews.Content: Before even walking into hotel, bellman says your room wont be ready, i'll take your bags. We double check at desk, sure enough, room was ready. Later that evening, 2 hour wait to get bedding... 3 calls to front desk, plus an additional trip down 50+floors to front desk to see what the hold up was. Bedding finally arrived at 1am. 2:00am just as im getting to sleep, sirens start going over loud speaker "There is an emergency in the hotel, please evacuate". 50+ floors, all the way down the stairs. Not knowing what all us guests were walking into. Stairwells jammed with guests to the point of a complete standstill at a few points. People were scared and crying. The feeling of not knowing, was likely one of the most terrifying 15 mins of my life. Once outside, there were no hotel staff directing or informing guests of what to do or where to go. Clearly they did not have a emergency response plan in place. After sitting outside, almost two hours later, we were instructed to go back to our rooms. They say there was a glitch in system, it may or may not happen again. Oh so comforting! Morning arrives, breakfast at the hotel cafe, took over an hour to receive cold food & coffee. Off to the airport that evening, 10 mins to wait for a cab. Choose to stay here, you will likely be very dissapointed. Ps. the pool is very small and very overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option off the strip”
Reviews.Author: lrr720
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice, as is the hotel in general. Pool area is good too. Would give it a 4 or 5 rating had the service been better. I arrived after 10:00 pm and my room was not ready. I could understand it if I arrived before the normal check in, but at 10:00 pm - not acceptable. Also, the registration desk is very slow and understaffed. Everyone was very nice, though. Pros: not smoky; very comfortable beds; nice amenties; free valet. Cons: service; no washcloths in room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, but not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: theburger
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just finished a four night stay. What a disaster! We arrived late on our first night (around midnight) and were told that our room still wasn't ready. The hotel suggested that we have comp drinks in the lounge while we waited. After waiting 30 minutes for our first round of drinks, it was last call. We ended up waiting an hour and a half for our room to be cleaned up, 9 hours after check in time! On a positive note, the room was beautiful! Great bed and linens, large bathroom with a soaker tub and a large standing shower. Although it has a small kitchenette, don't expect anything stocked aside from coffee mugs. It would have been nice to have at least a couple plates and some utensils. The pool and spa are great! Nice and small compared to a lot of the other Vegas properties. On our third night, the fire alarm went off at 2:00 AM and they evacuated the entire hotel. It was a mess and we did not receive any clear communication from the hotel on what was going on. My partner and I noticed that the fire alarm strobe lights in the hotel had turned off, which was the only signal that we had that we could go back in. About 30 minutes after we were back in the room, the management got on the PA system to say that the alarm had been resolved, waking us back up again. There were a total of eight such announcements, we didn't get back to sleep until 4:00 AM. The hotel's response to each issue was lukewarm at best. With the room not being ready, I had to search out a manager to speak with. We agreed that a couples massage would be a good way to resolve the issue (unfortunately, they ended up booking us separately). With the evacuation, the hotel was still trying to figure out why the alarm went off and they were not providing any immediate compensation for the issue. Apparently they are working on a package for all the guests at the time. I would assume that this would be a discount on staying there again, which I have no plans to do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - great location, smoke-free and central - so quiet too.”
Reviews.Author: Welly_China_Girl
Reviews.Content: If you are wanting a smoke-free, quiet but central hotel, then this is the place. I choose this hotel as I wanted a really nice Vegas experience, and the other 5-star hotels seem to be showing their age (based on other tripadvisor reviews). I wasn't disappointed - this place was great, and even my hard-to-please boyfriend was impressed. Because we preferred smoke-free, it was a toss-up between Signature at MGM Grand and Vdara - Vdara won out because it was newer and I think better-located. In summary - we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend to anyone wanting smoke free and a quiet retreat but still central to the rest of the Vegas action. Staff friendly, rooms and lobbies beautifully appointed and well-maintained, what more could you want! No issues with service or staff. Aria casino and restaurants is only 2 mins walk away if you need a casino. If we come back to Vegas, we will definitely stay here again. Lobby: Being a brand new hotel, the lobby is beautifully decorated, perfumed with something heavenly, and very pleasant to be in. We checked in on a Sunday afternoon, and there were 2 people in front of us. (Later that afternoon we wandered past Caesar's Palace - there was a queue of 100 people waiting to check in). Checkin was quick and efficient. Yes there's a $15 resort fee but that seems to be standard at this level of hotel. We booked a Vdara suite (via Travelocity) and were hoping for an upgrade (as previous reviewers were lucky to get!) but unfortunately not this time - maybe we stayed too long (5 nights). Ask for a higher floor to get the best views. Vdara suites have a choice of City or Mountain views (no strip views, apparently) - we chose City views and got room 52005 on the 52nd floor. Not sure what the mountain view looked like, but the city view was mesmerising. We could see the back of the Luxor (see photo) and a few of the strip hotels. In the corridor outside our room, we could see the Bellagio fountains at night. Every night I would turn off all the room lights just to look at the view - very calming. Either Vdara is a hidden gem that not many people know about, or it's not doing so well - the lobby was one of the quietest i've seen on the strip, we never saw any other guests on our floor and only sometimes had to share a lift. Lift by the way is very quick for 50 floors! So nice to come back to Vdara every night after the hustle and bustle of the Bellagio. Room: Room was beautifully appointed. This suite comprised an open plan living-dining-kitchen area, a king-sized bedroom with desk, and a bathroom with shower and bath. All three rooms had 180-degree views, and being on 52nd floor, you could even use the bath to enjoy the view without any worries. There were 2x 42" TVs and a media hub that output HDMI as well as charging ipods etc. Great selection of HDTV channels. Wifi internet only (there was a ethernet cable but it didn't seem to have internet access). In-room safe is vertical which means laptops/netbooks need to be standing up. Sofa and seats weren't that comfortable, although i think the sofa was a foldout queen bed which could explain the hardness. Blinds and blackouts electronically controlled - although black-out had a couple of gaps. We slept really well but there was a weird fan noise on one side of bed that wouldn't turn off with the air-conditioning. I didn't get around to asking about it so can't complain. Downside would be the kitchen amenities - Keurig coffee maker provided but standard package of sachet cremer sugar and plastic stirrer provided. No teabags (I'm a teadrinker, but had brought my own) and had to request a kettle for boiling water (Later on i figured out how to do this with the coffee maker). Despite providing a fully-functioning kitchen suite, only mugs and glasses are provided. Would have been nice (given quality of rest of hotel) to have provided plates and knives and forks etc - we often came back with a dessert or leftovers, but nothing to eat them with. When I checked in, I did ask for the kitchen to be stocked but this request was never filled - after day 2 i figured i probably wasn't going to cook anything so didn't request again, but plates would have been nice anyway. Even a dishcloth would have been useful. There is a working dryer and washer - but no detergents. While Bellagio has a couple of shops neither stocked washing liquid or fresh milk. The CVS has a much better selection of snacks and stuff. I ended up buying a bottle of Tide and hopefully leaving it for the next guests. (CVS is best located by catching a tram to Monte Carlo, and walking through casino to the strip, and it's on the left as you exit Monte Carlo). You can try going by Bellagio & strip but that requires crossing two road walkways and takes longer). Bathroom: Quality fitout, two sinks and nice Aveda toiletries that were always well replenished. Towels still lovely and soft. Almost forgot, our suite had a 'guest' toilet as well - having 2 bathrooms came in handy sometimes! Location We didn't have a car so can't comment on valet parking. This hotel is located behind the Bellagio (a 2-min walk) but probably about 10 minutes from the strip by the time you navigate Bellagio's lobby corridors. It's a 2 min walk to the free tram that runs between Bellagio and Aria/Crystals and Aria/Monte Carlo. Or it's just a 2min walk to Aria, where there's a casino and lots of eating places. I felt this was really centrally located, smack-bang in the middle of the strip - you have to do lots of walking in Vegas anyway if you want to see stuff. The bus that goes up and down the strip (the gold ones go to the Premium Outlet more) departs from Paris across the strip, and drops off at Bellagio on the way back and costs $3 for a 2-hour pass, or $7 for a 24 hour pass. We never go to try the restaurant or bar as we were often out and about. We did use the Aria buffet a couple of times and charged it back to the room which was handy. Standard buffet fare there ($15 for breakfast, $27 for dinner I think - dinner included king-crab legs). Also didn't use the pool as it got really windy and cold the week we were there. It looked nice though! Didn't use gym or spa either. Service was great. The housekeeping was really efficient and friendly, tidied up all our mess every time and always replaced anything we'd used up. I was a little worried given some of the other comments on tripadvisor, but no issues whatsover. We had a great stay and I would thoroughly recommend, especially if you get a good rate. We used travelocity and got a nice rate of $1060 for 5 nights (Sun thru Thurs) for Vdara suite including flights from SFO (baggage and resort fee extra).

Reviews.Title: “Vdara S*U*C*K*S Worst Experience at a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittykreidler
Reviews.Content: I have worked in the hotel industry and this place IS TERRIBLE! My best friend and I decided to take a short trip to Vegas for our birthdays. She lives in Seattle and I live in LA, so I drive, pick her up at the airport in Vegas and we excitedly proceed to check in at the Vdara. We chose this hotel because of the non-smoking and non-casino atmosphere. First, we couldn't FIND it. We could SEE it but getting on the road to FIND it was ridiculous. Lotsa u-turns later, we pull up. I don't like valeting my car. I was FORCED to valet. Then the check-in line was almost OUT the front door. After TWO HOURS we finally get to the desk. By this time it's 5:30. We drove up at a little after 3!!!!!!!!!! -- In part here is a complaint letter I sent to Jim Murren Chairman of the Board and CEO of MGM Las Vegas (who I might add WAS one of MY clients at a 5 star hotel not so long ago... -- Navigating the maze of surface roads had us going in circles. The check-in line was outrageously long and took us more than two hours from entering the lobby until getting in our room. The front desk staff were EXTREMELY RUDE, totally unprofessional, kept mispronouncing our names, and the longer we stood there, the more money they wanted us to provide as a deposit! As it was they wanted $650 for us to stay for three nights!!!!!!!!!!!! The front desk manager was so obnoxious we were actually standing there with our mouths open, and other guests checking in could overhear him belittling us, which was horrific. Even before checking in he accused us of "wanting to trash the room" and insinuated repeatedly that we "may smoke in the room". Neither one of us smoke, and in fact are both ALLERGIC to cigarette smoke, which is WHY I specifically chose a non-smoking hotel! The only reason we didn't walk out then was because it was a Saturday and rooms were pricey and already booked up. The staff sneered at us despite my having pre-paid our first night on my debit card (which is a VISA). They spoke condescendingly and loudly and unprofessionally about us using our debit cards. I had to ask for mine back twice, and he (the front desk manager) held my friends card up and loudly said "THIS IS A DEBIT CARD"!!! When I reserved the room (with a lovely reservation agent on my debit card) never once did anyone disclose 'the fine print' about prices, security deposits and the true resort fee price and taxes. Those prices changed several times depending on who we spoke to at the front desk, and WE WERE HUMILIATED!!!!! I worked for the Montage Beverly Hills from its opening and provided outstanding customer service on a daily basis and I must say I have NEVER BEEN treated SO poorly upon checking in anywhere. In addition, the hallways and room smelled like raw sewage. They sent us an inexpensive bottle of champagne (we think) to 'appease' us for the room smell but nobody called to explain, apologize or try to remedy the situation. So we decided NOT to spend another cent at Vdara, and moved to another hotel which upgraded us, took our debit cards WITHOUT a security deposit and treated us beautifully...even comping us a free breakfast AND dinner!! I wrote my letter and know that Mr. Murren got it. So I gave them a chance to rectify the situation and make it up to me and my friend. I received a letter apologizing today. They asked us to COME BACK and they would upgrade us. FAT CHANCE! Never will I set foot in Vdara again. I will GLADLY got to the Venetian...and I recommend you all do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel right in the heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: PaulYorath
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here as a surprise 40th birthday present. Brand new hotel, very well located just back from the strip which connects very convenienty to The Bellagio and also boasts free access to the Hotel Monte Carlo via the free City Center monorial. The hotel lobby is very chic, with a cool bar, nice restaurant and very helpful staff in particular the concierge. Rooms are all suites and were ultra modern and fantastic in terms of layout space and size. Very cool pool area too located on the roof. A non casino hotel and as such it really is an oasis of calm in the party capital of the US. One nice touch is that the hotel has a constant aroma of figs in the lobby - sounds bizzare but it is actually a really nice smell. Would wholeheartdely recommend this hotel anytime. Wondeful.

Reviews.Title: “Calming of the Chaos”
Reviews.Author: vvasabi8
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay at. Once you walk in the smell gets you but in a good way. It sort of a jasmine vanilla scent. My gf said it gave it spa like feel. The hotel itself is really clean and modern. We never had to wait for an elevator to go to our room! but i think that might be because it wasn't as packed as most hotels there. For our trip we had booked 2 rooms, the panoramic suite for the first night then the regular deluxe suite for the rest of the week. The beds are super comfy you might not want to leave the room. Panoramic Suite: Nice size room, Apt like feel but in a good way. We had a full size fridge and also a washer dryer. Windows were everywhere! the Blinds took awhile to figure out. i didn't know which ones were controlled by which switch, but once i got that figured out it was smooth sailing. Deluxe Suite: Great room not too big no too small. We had plenty of room for friends to come over and hang out. main difference between this room and the panoramic room was of course the size of the room and this one only had a mini fridge. Overall the stay was great and relaxing. Only complaint was that the walk from the strip was a little longer than expected as the only way to get there was either through the aria or through bellagio. I think this will be resolved once the Harmon gets finished and that art of the sidewalk gets opened up. Staying here you are away from the chaos that is Las Vegas. Not that the chaos is a bad thing. But once you're here its a nice way to unwind from the day and nights activities! I would definitely like to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: LISALIPZ
Reviews.Content: The deluxe suite at the Vdara was amazing. The bed was one of the best I have ever experienced at a hotel/resort. Very modern. I was happy to be away from all the usual noise of Vegas. No smoke, no noise from machines and couldn't hear my neighbors at all. My big complaint would be the slow service at check in but other than that it was an experience I have never had in Vegas. I would stay here again when I am in Vegas in future. Would recommend that you take the tram to Aria to see the incredible "art deco" atmosphere. Every where you look something else takes your breath away. I found myself touching walls and asking myself "how did they do this?". Great price too.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: 2healing
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect, since some reviews mentioned problems with the automatic features of the hotel. Well most everything went well as soon as we arrived. We gave our baggage to the valet, and even though we had to wait for about 20 minutes for our bags, they arrived safe and sound. The valet took the car too, later on we parked in the bellagio or Aria self parking since you have to go through those hotels to get to the strip comfortably. It is about a 10 to 15 minutes walk through either casino, we preferred using the Bellagio. The rooms were excellent, the bed was super comfortable, and the blinds were automatic (they worked fine. There was a cooler and a wet bar where you pay for any drinks you use. The TV was great, having plenty of channels, unlike some Vegas hotels that make you pay for the choice. There were tv's in both the living room and bedroom, even though it was more like a divided studio. Lots of room though, had a kitchen, with dining table, a huge bathroom, with separate tub and shower, we had a great view of the back of bellagio, Rio, the Palms western Vegas and the mountains in the distance, the Interstate below was not noisy. Only negative was a bit of a wait at check in. In general it was a quality hotel

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jptChicago
Reviews.Content: This project is in big trouble. Overall I would suggest staying some where else while in Las Vegas. Service was poor, hotel was dead, pool was a complete joke. . Not what we expected. If you can stay for $100-150 per night , do it. Average AT BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Brand Spankin' New”
Reviews.Author: anonymouse
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. It's nice to stay in a place that is brand new and doesn't yet exhibit any kind of wear and tear. Only one person at reception when I checked in, and had to wait quite awhile. Granted, it was late at night, but still.... Then, when checking out (at check-out time no less!), only two people at reception and long line. It seems that better thought could be put into this. The spa is HUGE and gorgeous. Spend some time there... lots of amenities, snacks, teas, etc. And, all the girlie things if you forgot something (hair gel, curling irons, deodorant, qtips, baby powder, etc). The gym was very busy in the mornings, practically empty afternoons and early evenings. It would have been nice if the air-con was set to something cooler... kind of warm for a gym. Complimentary coffee and bottled water, which I made use of through-out the day. The pool is nice... not poor, but not amazing. Just nice. The first time I went, the guys at the front bent over backwards to help "how many towels? let me help you find a chair? do you want shade? here that towel got wet, let me bring you another" and I felt bad that I hadn't brought a couple of bucks cash for a tip. So the next day, I was prepared, but the two ladies at the entrance couldn't care less... "grab a towel, sit anywhere you want". Hmmm. The food at the pool is extraordinary, so even though I didn't eat at the restaurant, I'll assume it has great food too! The music is only too loud if you sit on the far side where the speakers are. Service pool-side from servers is slow.... I don't know if there's not enough people, or if the hold-up is at the bar and restaurant. Seriously, I sat half an hour and no one offered me anything, I finally snagged a waitress and asked for a menu, then she never came back to take an order. I waited about 15 minutes, finally snagged a guy to order, and then another 20 minutes for drink and food. Wow, good thing the drink was good and the food amazing. One day they were handing out free slushie drink samples at the pool, I thought that was a nice touch. Kitchens have no utensils... so if you bring any food home, grab some plastics. Nice oversize aveda products in bathroom. Comfortable bed. The housekeeping service was over-the-top... they've clearly picked it up a notch in that department. The housekeeper folded my clothes, organized my shoes, stacked up my paperwork, laid out all my toiletries according to size... very impressive. I phoned housekeeping to identify who cleaned my room so I could give them a tip, but they wouldn't tell me who, just said leave a tip at the front desk. I wanted to know who it was for, and they said they'd get back to me. No one ever did :( sorry housekeeper, whoever you are. Any downsides I've mentioned here are very petty, not a big deal at all. I loved the place, and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “This is an oasis in the chaos of Las...”
Reviews.Author: Mikewrenn66
Reviews.Content: This is an oasis in the chaos of Las Vegas. We would breath a sign of relief each time we entered the hotel. It's calm, simply but beautifully decorated interior is a joy. No casino in-hotel will automatically put some people off but it was a pleasure for us. Let's face it, there's no shortage of casinos in Vegas. Rooms are large and decorated in a contempary style. The kitchen/dining area was useful although there was no cutlery/crockery/cooking utensils so I'm not sure why they bothered with the cooktop/microwave etc. The pool/hot tubis small but adequate and the gym is nicely stocked with modern treadmils/weights/x-trainers. Attached to the Bellagio by way of a covered walkway, the Strip is not too far away or there is a free tram to a couple of locations. Probably our last stay in Vegas and I couldn't has wished for a nicer place to stay. The only negative aspect; housekeeping had left a bag of garbage, from the previous occupants of our room, on the kitchen floor. Not the best first impression but easily forgiven with such a gorgeous room and view.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Vdara Hotel and Spa.”
Reviews.Author: angels128
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel upon the recommendation of a friend who is a travel agent. We were very pleased overall with the staff who were friendly and eager to please. My only complaint would be that the check in desk had only one person working so we had to wait quite a long time. The room itself was large, roomy and clean. We had a beautiful view of the strip and our room overlooked the Bellagio fountains. After a long day of walking, shopping and gambling it was nice to come back to a quiet room. If you are looking for a hotel that has gambling, night clubs or lots of shops this is not the hotel for you. It is within walking distance to the new Aria which does have everything under the sun. It is also close to the new Crystals city center. It was a hike to get to some areas on the strip from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: CDNTRVLR570
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book my stay with Vdara considering the mixed reviews. I'm sure that because this hotel is new, they have had some growing pains, but I didn't experience any of them. The staff were fantastic, especially the cleaning staff. I had a ton of coins on a table that they organized and stacked for me when I returned. I've never had that happen at a hotel before. The location was perfect, just a few minutes from the Bellagio and Aria, we could still participate with the strip without having to deal with the crowds and smoke that other Hotels/Casinos have. If you're looking for a hotel in Vegas, but still want to be close to the action, this hotel is absolutely perfect. It was quiet, the service was friendly and quick, and we were never left asking for anything. It was my first time in LV, and although the Fremont Experience was fun, I don't think I'd ever want to stay in another place. Great value for the price we paid (we booked through Expedia and got a great deal from Toronto). I would absolutely recommend it, and have all ready done so with friends. The grounds are no-smoking, so if you can't live without a smoke before bed and don't want to walk outside, this might not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “a sanctuary.....”
Reviews.Author: Susie06
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked into this hotel we recognized that this hotel is unique among Las Vegas hotels. No casino, no smoking.....a lovely fragrance which permeated the lobby. This was followed by walking into a spacious room with a beautiful view of pools and faroff mountains. The style is modern and functional with all the amenities necessary to make the stay perfect. The sheets are soft and the pillows excellent. The sofa provides a sitting area and the wi-fi and flat screen TV allow for entertainment. The pool is a good size, not mammoth like many of the other hotels, so it allows a nice number of people to enjoy it. The restaurant, Silk Road, is currently only serving lunch, but the food was excellent and a good value. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Vegas and would recommend the hotel to anyone who does not want to be in the noisy hotels with casinos. It is a short walk down a bridge to The Bellagio, so the Vdara is not far from many of the reasons people come to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sheek hotel - a great escape in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: seatravel99
Reviews.Content: If you want the ability to get away from smokey casinos and ringing slots, while having great access to the strip and the swanky City Center, this is the place. Walk continuously all the way through the Bellagio and Caesars without even going outside. Or head the other direction across the courtyard and hit the tables at the stylish Aria hotel. With your winnings, you can drop $5K on a hand bag in the Crystals shopping center while taking in the unbelievable architecture. The City Center is stunning and will leave you with an entirely new image of Vegas. The rooms are super clean, service was excellent, and the pool is relaxing with cool views of the City Center skyline. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wow! No place better!”
Reviews.Author: noni58
Reviews.Content: Quick check in. Free upgrade to a room with a view. That was a very nice surprise. The room was the best we have ever stayed in while in Vegas. This is an all suite hotel, we had a washer and dryer as well as one and a half bath. Large glass shower with seat as well as a soaking tub . The location was ok. Had to go through the Ballagio to get to the strip. The bath amenities were fantastic and they gave us plenty. Loved the automatic shade openers. The service was the best couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but...”
Reviews.Author: Angiex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing, brand new, big room with awesome view. We had only 2 problems. One of them was the smell in the room. Something was wrong with the washing machine and at 2 am we had to call the reception to do something about the "smell situation". Within 10 minutes came a repairman and turned the washing machine on with a tablet. It was very smelly for a while. The other problem was the car rental. We rented a car for a day, we left the hotel at the morning and we returned the car at the night. When we arrived we told the guy that we don't need the car anymore and we return it. He said ok and he will notify the concierge. At the morning we checked out, sign papers and left the hotel. Later we saw our bank account and it seemed that they took 2 times the rental charges and we don't understand why. We sent an email and the answer was that we returned the car later than we rented, but it was impossible because we returned it at night. It seems the guy didn't say anything to the concierge about our returning time. We have chain-letter to solve this. I don't know what will be the solution...I just hope that they will understand this situation and give back our money. So, I think, if you want to rent a car, go somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Serene and cool”
Reviews.Author: skelly3055
Reviews.Content: What Vdara has, is a smoke free and non-gaming place to stay while visiting Las Vegas without being too far away from the hustle and bustle of those casinos and buffet crowds. Infact it's such a nice retreat that I enjoyed the tucked away and almost secluded area of this hotel's location in City Center too. I didn't mind the stroll back to Vdara from Bellagio or Aria at all. I looked forward each time upon my return to the hotel for that specific reason. To get away from the noise and unwind until my next adventure out to see the shows or gamble. I would certainly return again and stay here. The rooms are well decorated, the staff friendly and helpful. Each time I called the desk for an item, it was brought up quickly. Which earned a nice tip for the prompt service. It''s the perfect stay for couples and singles who want to escape and relax, but still be near everything Veags has to offer. Well done Vdara, you certainly have a repeat customer in me each time I return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in SOME ways”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer98121
Reviews.Content: The concept is perfect for us. We came to go to shows and relax not gamble. Having a kitchen we can do our own breakfasts and lunches TIP: Vons Grocery delivers to the hotel, this was great, just use their online order site and tell them to call your cell when it arrives, also let the front desk know its coming (this way you can hang out at the pool during their 2 hour window for delivery). I am an interior designer so the style is important to me. The hotel is beautiful, great art and the rooms and views are gorgeous. Terrific gym and spa area. Pool is nice but could use more living trees/greenery and I agree with others that the pounding loud rock was too much, for me Vdarra is about relaxation in a zen like way not a rockers hang out. The only things that are quriously still bad after so many months of being open are the lack of signage (other than in the lobby it's confusing which elevator banks to use) and houskeeping really is VERY hit and miss, in fact that was the only real complaint, why haven't they tweaked that problem yet?!? Since we were there for more than a week it was more obvious but they forget to leave things, didn't remove garbage from beneath the kitchen sink, didn't replace glasses that they removed etc. All said they should change their star rating from 5 to 4 (who comes up with these ratings anyway?) It was a great value for the money and if it remains a value we'll gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Was not 5 star quality......”
Reviews.Author: tyorkdog
Reviews.Content: I thought the price was fair. 129.00 plus a 15.00 resort fee. But this includes unlimited internet. Decent location right off of the Bellagio. But if I had to do it over again I would have paid 30.00 more a night and stayed at the Aria. Looked like a higher quality and definately more options for food. The Vdara is good if you prefer a quiet hotel but the Aria feels so much more alive. Not enough umbrellas at the pool. 13.00 so-so tasting pina coladas. Played obnoxious loud headbanger at the pool so no way to relax but we told them about it and they fixed it. First room we checked in smelled like vinegar and horrible view of the highway noise. So we tried another one. When we checked in there was about 7 people waiting and only 2 people at the desk at peak check in time. Went down at 7 pm and no concierge. It is good for the price but will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Encore is my favorite, but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: eljuezcubano
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Vdara are first rate. Modern, sleek, and elegant. One complaint about the room is the bathroom could use a separate water closet. Had to wait at check in because only two stations were open. However, we received an upgraded room. Service was great all around, except in one area -- pool cocktail waitresses need a lesson in customer service and friendliness. Wish the bar would stay open past 2:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “This is a a wonderful tech hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Klowningaround
Reviews.Content: We (my two teenagers and I) stayed during our spring brake for two nights, we are from Reno, so gambling is all around us. We loved Vdaras tech hotel idea, from the central charging station to the cool door locks. The staff was perfect! The only thing I could even say that would be bad about the entire stay would be the elevators, they are really fast and make you feel odd. Breakfast was amazing in the Silk Road restaurant, Chance our waiter was wonderful. The food is worth it, at any price. The Concierge was amazing, they were able to book (at late notice) three spa reservations at the same time so my teenagers and I could be there at the same time. The valet was wonderful too, very quick, and accomodating. We had a wonderful experience from the booking of the reservation through the stay! We will stay again, and again. I do suggest tipping well!

Reviews.Title: “still in planning stages”
Reviews.Author: leslie17
Reviews.Content: good price as it just opened. Quite a walk from the strip. wonderful smoke free environment. Pool was not opened yet but we were charged anyway. They did reverse these only after complaining. Lovely suite and the service was great. Nice that there is an enclosed walkway to Bellagio. Would stay again. Avia only other hotel opened in City Centre. Very large hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice splurge on the larger 2 bedroom penthouse”
Reviews.Author: Will-Travel-for-Food
Reviews.Content: We weren't in Vegas for the partying, but had to stay overnight on our way back from a long & tiring trip. We opted for the larger 2-bd penthouse so we could unwind before the next day's flight. It wasn't as large as one would have hoped for, but it was nicely finished & had great bathrooms. We asked for the full pots/pans, silverware/flatware & laundry detergent so we could do3 full loads. Everything came relatively quickly and at no extra charge. We did our shopping at Whole Foods with plenty of wine & beer, stayed in and kicked back. It was perfect for that. And although a bit of a splurge, between two couples it wasn't all that bad.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF HIDDEN CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: rumproof
Reviews.Content: POSITIVE: Nice, clean room, new facility, smoke-slot machine free. Heated pool, attentive staff. Fast check in. NEGATIVE: Outdated information booklet in room. For example, I tried to order room service after 10pm, per the instructions in their information booklet in the room, but was told that that page should have been destroyed. Also, for some reason, the Vdara charges all guests an additional $15/night for a Resort Fee. WHAT? They even make you sign a waiver to pay this amount. This is even if you do not use the SPA workout room. If you refuse to pay, you could be refused entry! Apparently, they'll sacrifice $166+ per night over a $15 charge? On a slow weeknight? In this economy? Interesting. The morning clerk said that it was for Internet, SPA, newpaper, coffee (things that other hotels include free). I feel they should just include this $15 into the price of the room. I didn't complain about the left over trash I found in my room. Otherwise, besides a smart mouthed morning clerk, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, New, Expensive, working out the bugs”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBob6
Reviews.Content: Very Nice, New, be ready to pay $10 per drink, I ordered a double Vodka and was $22, I almost fell over! Restaurant only at once and Good but expensive too. Service very Good from bartender, concierge, but cleaning staff Rude! Showed up at 8:30am to clean room on last day, so I called to get later checkout of 1pm as was not flying til later and she came back at 11;30 and rudely asked me "When are you leaving?" Very tough to get in and out of with all other Hotels etc in City Center, definately best to Taxi! Once you get there its Ok. Construction next door constant BEEPING of machines but I guess out of the hotels control. Spa Very Nice, small but Good.

Reviews.Title: “Go to theHotel instead.”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like Vdara, because I love suite hotels and have been staying at theHotel and the Venetian in the past so I wanted something new. Well the bottom line is theHotel is still MUCH better than Vdara (and I had a City Suite room, not the cheapy room). And I compare the two because when I made my reservations theHotel and Vdara were exactly the same price, and I suspect they would be most other dates as well. Frankly Vdara feels like a Courtyard by Marriott room with a few extra $$, whereas theHotel is actually a luxury hotel. Where does theHotel outshine Vdara: 1) Location - Vdara is really in the back alley of CityCenter, very long walk to anything. theHotel being attached to Mandalay and the tram there is pretty well located. 2) Rooms - theHotel just feels a lot classier; and there are touches like the desk chair at theHotel is a real desk chair, at Vdara they cheaped out and just put another side chair from their tables - it doesn't have proper support or any height adjustment. 3) Bathroom - TV in the bathroom at theHotel and the tub is significantly larger at theHotel as well. Plus the washbasin and shower are larger as well, and the toilet has a door at theHotel, not at Vdara. 4) Room organization and layout is just a lot better at theHotel as well, and theHotel gives you an extra 1/2 bath, not at Vdara except the most expensive suites. 5) Gym is really a 'workout room' at Vdara - no freeweights, it's very small and ill-equipped. 6) Pool at Vdara is also weak in comparison. Ok the one group I'd pick Vdara for is families - as my room has a (cheap) table for four and a washer/dryer - so for them it's better. But for anyone else - go to theHotel for the same $$. I wish I did.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic new addition to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: veglifo
Reviews.Content: If you are wanting a Vegas hotel that is clean, smells great, quiet, and modern, then Vdara is it. My partner and I are very much into boutique hotels and one thing that sets Vdara apart from other upscale Vegas hotels is that all the rooms are suites. We stayed in a Deluxe suite on the 14th floor with views of the Bellagio, Rio, and the Palms, and mountain landscape in the background. I was hoping for a suite on a higher floor, but once we got into the room we were so happy there we didn't bother moving. I loved that there was a kitchen, just a nice staging area that made the place more spacious. And the windows running the length of the room were spectacular, loved watching the city breathe from our amazingly comfortable bed. The bathroom is great as well, housekeeping always gave us plenty of towels and toiletries. Everyone working there I found to be very helpful and friendly. We had breakfast at Silk Road almost every morning and the food was delicious and beautifully arranged. There is a hallway leading to the Bellagio, and the new Aria hotel is across from the front entrance, so entertainment is always close at hand. Vdara is not directly on the strip, so we found that going out through Crystals, part of the CityCenter, was the best way to get to the strip, right across from Planet Hollywood. Taking the very frequent tram between Bellagio and Monte Carlo with stops in between was great as well. The pool is heated and huge fluffy towels are among the ample deck loungers. It was very quiet when we were at the pool, just the way I want my lounging space. This hotel is not for the wild and crazy, rather for the fun and fabulous who want their space to be relaxing, but can easily find a party nearby. Eat at the Aria hotel, lots of new and wonderful restaurants that are very close by. The CityCenter complex is spectacular and modern. I will be returning to Vdara, and look forward to seeing the new developments at Crystals and the other buildings in the compund.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Conk99
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not have a casino and is non smoking, the perfect place for me when I go to Vegas. Don’t get me wrong, I love to gamble and love casinos; however I like to go back to a nice, quiet, smoke free area to sleep. The staff at the front desk looks like they should be working as supermodels. They are very sweet and friendly. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The floor plan is very convenient by separating the kitchen, from the living room, and the bedroom. The views from the upper floors are breath taking; we were on the 54 floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable, and Average”
Reviews.Author: Nina J
Reviews.Content: I travelled here for a girl's getaway with my best friend. She suggested this hotel because the price was good when we bought our package in October, and it was new! We figured it would a great opportunity to try a new Vegas hotel. I knew very little about it before I went, besides some of the comments from reviews I read here. First thing I noticed that it is set quite far back from the strip. It is connected to the Bellagio which you have to walk all the way through to get to the strip, and there's also a tram that stops at Aria and the Monte Carlo. Bring comfortable shoes or be prepared to cab it everywhere. I read something on here about the hotel smells amazing, and it really is true. They pump in this scent that is VERY noticeable, I liked it. Not sure it would be to everyone's taste. The hotel is very much a hotel, not set up for the bar or casino crowd (which is what we were going for this time around). The one bar/lounge they have is pretty small but open and has a seating area outside that's very cozy looking. It wasn't very busy ever, despite the hotel being sold out when we were there. Didn't try the restaurant, only because there were other places I really wanted to go to. On arrival, we were upgraded to a bigger suite since all the regular rooms had been sold out to people booking a special package deal they were offering. Nice! The suite was huge and beautiful, on the 45th floor with a pretty nice view. It had a kitchen, dining room, two bathrooms, a washer and dryer, separate bedroom. Bathroom had a massive soaker tub. Decor was contemporary and tasteful. The room smelled new. My complaints are not huge but they impacted me. This was an expensive room, and there were NO TOWELS anywhere in the suite, in either bathroom. We had to call down to get them, and they only put them in the main bathroom on the second day, and finally put a hand towel in the second bathroom the day before we left. The microwave had food in it. We couldn't get through to the spa for three days even though they were open from 6 am to 9 pm. Couldn't get through to housekeeping or the front desk at midnight when we needed extra bedding for the pull out. There is no place in the hotel to go grab a coffee or a snack or even a magazine late at night, which I'm used to in most hotels. I'd have to take a ten minute walk over to the Bellagio. All the staff we talked to were very pleasant, friendly, and helpful. They seemed genuinely interested in making our stay great. I was a little disappointed to be told that we had trouble reaching the spa, front deak and housekeeping because they were "fully booked and the level of service this week has been substandard." Wasn't sure what to say to that! I would say it's a nice place to stay if you want to avoid crowds and the bar/casino atmosphere. It's very quiet here. I wouldn't stay again because I thought it was a little too far from the strip and was missing some of the amenities I like to have close by when I stay in Vegas. They were really just bordering on a four star in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: i_m_good
Reviews.Content: I chose the Vdara because it was new and wanted to stay someplace different, and the intro pricing was great! When I booked it wasn't open yet, so I didn't really know what to expect. Once it opened and people starting putting reviews up I was a little concerned after reading all the negative reviews. That being said, I have to agree, the Vdara is a beautiful hotel, the rooms are modern and clean, the kitchenette is a great feature, the bathrooms are nice, and the bed is comfortable, however... there are some flaws that need to be fixed. When we arrived at the hotel the bell man got the doors for us and took our bags, then we went to the front desk and the check in went smoothly and they even gave us a free upgrade! Good start. Went up to our suite and it was gorgeous, we had a beautiful kitchen, which was a HUGE plus, having the fridge and the microwave was convenient, especially for left-overs. Called down to the bell desk, they brought up the bags right away. Then, when looking around the room, we noticed we didn't have any towels or soap, lotions, etc. Called down to house keeping and they said they would bring some stuff up. Also, noticed the toilet hadn't been flushed either, which was gross, there were drink rings on the glass tables and the microwave hadn't been cleaned inside, so it really wasn't perfect. Then we left the hotel. Came back to the room and we had our towels and a plastic bag on the counter with our soaps and stuff, as opposed to having it set out. We then called down to housekeeping to have the sofa bed made up, but there was no answer, so we called down to the front desk, no answer there either. Tried a couple more times, no luck, so we used some of the bedding from the other bed. We were able to get ahold of them the next day to ask them to make up the sofa bed, which they did for the rest of our stay. On our second to last day, we tried to call the spa to book massages for our last day, but there was no answer, we tried to go down to the spa in person, but didn't make it before closing, so we didn't get to try out the spa, which was more frustrating than anything. When we checked out we mentioned it to the front desk clerk and she said the hotel was booked to capacity, so their service standards were falling short. As far as location goes, it's not bad, the tram to the Monte Carlo is convenient and walking to the Bellagio is good to. The only problem is there isn't a coffee shop or convenience store at the hotel at all, so you have to go pretty far to get something like a pop or tylenol. Overall, it was a great hotel to stay at and would consider staying there again once they've been open longer and hopefully have fixed some of the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Traquil, clean, and well run”
Reviews.Author: Kuttermax
Reviews.Content: We usually travel to Vegas a couple times a year for 3 - 4 day getaways. The last 3 or 4 times we have stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay, which has consistently offered good service and great rooms, but we did find it a bit of a hike to get to some of the other places on the Strip. This time we decided to try Vdara, one of the new hotels in the recently opened City Center complex. Vdara sits towards the back end of City Center, about a 70 yard walk from the North Entrance of Aria. It also connected to the back of Bellagio (near the pool and convention center) and is very close to the City Center monorail station that leaves from this location as well. We got to Vdara on Thursday evening, around 8pm. There was no lineup and we immediately were checked into our Deluxe Suite. We did not pay extra for the Strip View and our room, which was on the 46 floor, still had a nice view. We faced out towards The Palms and Rio and also had a great view of the mountains. We could also see the part of the Bellagio and a small portion of their fountains. The room itself was very nice. Compared to the standard suite at The Hotel, it was a little smaller. It had a small cooktop, microwave, and small fridge. Iron/ironing board were in the room. It had one bathroom with a seperate large tub and shower. It did not have the second half-bath that The Hotel suites have. There was a seperate sitting area with a 42" flatscreen tv and then a partial wall with the bed on the other side. There was a second 42" flatscreen on the otherside of the wall where the bed was. The suite in The Hotel are more of a classic one bedroom layout while the Vdara room is more of what I would call a "bachelor suite". The room had nice big windows with motorized blinds and shades. During the day the room was a lot brighter than the rooms at The Hotel. The blinds kepts things nice and dark when sleeping. Housekeeping was efficient and provided us with free extra coffee pods for the single serving coffee maker in the room. Vdara has a small bar in the lobby and a restaurant that is open only for breakfast and lunch. We ate a late breakfast/early lunch meal their one day and it was good but the rest of time ate elsewhere. Vdara does not have a casino. This could be a big negative for some. For us it was a plus. We enjoyed the tranquility and both Bellagio and Aria are a very short walk away. We enjoyed the location of Vdara and did a fair bit of shopping at Bellagio and Caesar's this time, so it was nice being close. The biggest advantage of Vdara was on Sunday when we were getting ready to leave at about 2pm. We had just walked over from Aria, where there was a huge lineup for cabs and the valet was swamped. At Vdara there were just a couple people waiting for cabs and we got picked up right away. There were also no lines at the checkout. Big plus. Vdara charges a $15 daily resort fee, but this covers internet, gym use, a daily newspaper, and what not. I used the gym a few times over the weekend and it was clean and well maintained. I never had to wait for machines but it wouldn't surprise me if at times it could get full. I went in the mornings on Friday and Sunday. There is wireless and wired internet in the rooms. I stuck with the wifi and it worked great - very fast and no issues. At The Hotel you pay per computer that you connect which was a real hassle with two people and two different laptops plus my Zune and my wife's iPod touch. No issues at Vdara. All could be hooked up with no issues and not having to pay more than the $15 resort fee. We would definitely return to Vdara in the future. I still liked the suites at The Hotel at little better, but my wife said she preferred the Vdara room. The location is great, the less crowded atmosphere nice, and the lack of lineups a major plus. Hopefully they keep things up to the high standard.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful high-tech inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: znine
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived at the Vdara, the hotel sent me an e-mail that was so over-the-top it bordered on the suggestive, containing sentences such as, "We are committed to providing personalized experiences, leaving you emotionally connected to our employees and our brand." As it turns out, I definitely felt some emotion about the employees working at the hotel, but it probably wasn't the kind the author of the e-mail intended. The Vdara is a beautiful, quiet, high-tech hotel located a half block off the Strip. But it's actually really hard to get to the Strip from the hotel -- you either have to walk through the Aria (and its dark smoke-filled casino) and then do a complete circle through the Crystals mall, or you can take a circuitous route through the Bellagio for 15 minutes, or you can try to negotiate a construction zone. I'm not even sure the third option works at the moment. So if proximity to the Strip is important, you might want to stay somewhere else. We had a two-bedroom penthouse on the 54th floor. The view, particularly at night, was stunning, and I imagine it would be even better on the other side of the hotel. The room was equally lovely, and included a huge kitchen that was devoid of any cooking utensils other than coffee cups and wine glasses. A nice touch was a fridge with free water bottles. There was also a washing machine, but it was one of those wash-and-dry-in-the-same-unit machines without any venting to the outside, so the "dryer" proposed taking 3 hours and 50 minutes to cook our clothes dry -- not a great thing to learn two hours before you were planning to check out. Maybe a warning sign would be in order? Our kids loved the pool, which is cleverly perched above the entrance to the hotel and is about as secluded as you can get a few hundred feet from an Interstate highway. The Spa was also a hit, as was the French toast at the restaurant, which is only open for breakfast and lunch. My main complaint about the hotel involved the staff's complete inability to deal with the numerous high-tech failures that afflicted our room. 12 hours into our stay the management decided to turn on the system that forced you to swipe your room key in the elevator before it would take you to your floor. At this first this wasn't working for anyone, but then it seemed we were the only remaining victims. Every time we wanted to return to our room we would have to seek out someone, usually at the front desk, who would first accuse us of improper card swiping. Then they would use their secret power key to let us push our floor number. But at that point, they assumed the problem was solved. I guess they thought we would stay in our room until we checked out? No one ever followed up or tried to find a workaround. Our phone stopped working the last day -- calling the front desk would just ring endlessly. The response? "We've been having problems." A visit to the front desk resulted in someone "resetting" the internet, which didn't help. After complaining to the management, we were offered about 5% off our bill, which I suppose is appropriate given that we probably spent 5% of our stay trying to figure out how to get up to our room. Another annoyance was that after contacting the hotel about an item I left behind after departing, it took three phone calls over the course of three days to get someone to deal with it properly. If you are willing to gamble that nothing will break and you won't need any special attention when you stay at the Vdara, you might have a perfect time. I suppose making bets is what Las Vegas is about, but shouldn't a perfect hotel be about predictability, no matter where it's located?

Reviews.Title: “A qualified thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: sydneytraveller69
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for a few days and wanted a central hotel so we could walk everywhere. Vdara certainly fits this bill, and the No Smoking policy was also a big factor in choosing this hotel. Everything was top-notch in quality. We were in a Panoramic Suite - nice large bedroom, separate sitting area, decent size bathroom (with Vdara branded towels that felt and smelled fresh and new) and an kitchenette/dining area. The bed is wierd though - on one had it is incredibly comfortable, but also felt very hot - probably due to the mattress protector (or whatever it is). The whole CityCenter complex takes a while to work out how to get around - another important thing to note is that Vdara is set back from the Strip. Which means its a bit of a hike to even get out onto the street. It may well improve once the final construction work finishes, which doesn't look that far away. We didn't interact much with the staff - what little we did was pleasant enough. Two complaints: firstly, when we checked in, the girl checking us in absolutely gushed about the view from our room. I mean she REALLY raved about how good it was! Unfortunately she put us in a room on the 9th floor, which meant that all we looked at was the side of one building from one side, across the large circular driving entrance to the sister ARIA hotel on another and across to a car park on the third side. Considering the hotel has 57 floors, we needed to be much higher up to warrant the staff raving about the view. Particularly as Vdara is set back from the Strip itself. Once we discovered to walkway connecting it to the Bellagio, we tended to use this to get out to the Strip. Secondly, the pool area, which had only just opened a couple of days before we arrived (and is very nice), was spoiled by a DJ who felt the need to pump up the volume to an earsplitting level. I don't know about anyone else, but I was trying to use the pool to relax from the hectic-ness of the rest of Vegas. We didn't try the spa or the restaurant so can't comment on those. All in all, it was a positive experience without scaling any great heights - it felt like it could be a little better, and may be so with a bit of experience.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel -- wait until they work out all the kinks.”
Reviews.Author: UtahMomOf3
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Beautiful, new, modern. Great location! Walkway to Bellagio and short cab ride to anywhere else on the strip. Service: HORRIBLE! This is supposedly a 5-star hotel. The staff is very inconsistent--some being very pleasant and helpful, but the majority seem annoyed that you are there. On our last morning there, we were locked out of our room for 90 minutes. Security and maintenance were both sent up while we waited, sitting on the floor in the hallway with a baby, until they finally figured it out. During this time, I missed my spa appointment (sniff). As if this weren't bad enough, the spa called and told me I'd be charged (even though the front desk had already assured me this would be taken care of). After several calls from the snotty spa employee, I'm fairly certain I'll be charged anyway and will just have to dispute the charge. We spoke to other guests who had similar experiences--locked out of rooms, keys not working, checked out early, other people being allowed in their room. Bottom line: The hotel is nice looking, and if they can work out the bugs, we may be back. Until then, we'll stick to Signature at MGM or another smoke-free property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with a slower pace!”
Reviews.Author: redefinition
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times but I have always stayed in a themed hotel with a casino. This time I opted for something different and was intrigued by the architecture of the CityCenter that I saw being built last time I was there. I chose the Vdara because it is slightly further from the strip and does not have a mall or casino inside. It is GORGEOUS. The staff were super friendly and helpful and we asked for a Bellagio fountain view room when we checked in and we got one (no extra charge). The room (cheapest size) was stylish and the soaker tub was amazing. It filled and drained very fast and even had a nozzle to make hair washing in the tub easier. There were two large flat screen TVs and all the bathroom toiletries were Aveda brand. Plenty of towels, cozy robes to use, and The WSJ was hung on our door daily. Room also had a microwave, 2 spot stove, minifridge, and minibar (overpriced, of course) but the minifridge was stocked with complimentary water. The hotel is connected to the Bellagio by a walkway and in the Bellagio there is a tram connecting the Vdara to the Crystals shopping center (again, amazing architecture), Aria hotel, and Monte Carlo. The Vdara is pretty central on the strip and getting to Las Vegas Blvd was no chore as long as you walked through the Bellagio. Gym was nice, pools were closed due to high winds (the water was splashing out the side of the pool it was so strong). There was also free wi-fi which makes me happy since some hotels charge for it!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: scoobydooJerseyC_i
Reviews.Content: great hotel . great service , clean .beds and pillows you will want to take home . ignore bad reviews ; all rubbish' just go there and judge it for yourself . all the complaints have been so petty .take a good look at all the problems in the world ' and just enjoy a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best value ever”
Reviews.Author: btd2009
Reviews.Content: Impeccable design and service. Very spacious room with a great view. Nice contrast to the other hotels in LV. Price was very reasonable for a 5 star hotel. Hey, I booked the least expensive 5* hotel in LV and my girlfriend was so impressed she thought I spent a fortune on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katjubu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vdara Hotel and Spa most recently to celebrate my birthday and i had a wonderful time. The hotel is not a gaming hotel so it gave me the feeling of being at a private resort while being right in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. From the time i got there I was given GREAT service. The Front desk agent noticed it was my birthday when i checked in and put me in a room that allowed me to view the Bellagio water show from my window. In addition to that the next day sent me up a bottle of champagne with a Happy Birthday note attached. The rooms are gorgeous and nicely decorated with top of the line perks like closing your blinds with a touch of a button or even blacking out the room with a touch of a button. Unfortunately, i waited too long to make my Spa reservations and Vdara could not accomodate myself and my two friends for the spa that day so we had to go across the way to ARIA hotel's Spa. The Spa at Aria was nice but i have a feeling i truly missed out by not being able to go to Vdara's spa. I had both room service at Vdara and i ate at their restaurant Silk both was good for me, however the people i was with had larger appetites and felt that it wasn't enough food. All in all it was a GREAT experience I love this hotel and i will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Was Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: makaufma
Reviews.Content: There are many things I liked about the hotel V'dara. The bed was very comforatable and the robe and slippers in the room were plush. Unfortunately the costomer service was a major spoiler for our trip. We had booked a package deal which included show tickets. When we went to pick up our show tickets we were told they had been given away since we canceled our reservation with V'dara. We assured the people at will call that we had not cancelled our reservation and were in fact staying at V'dara. Luckily I had my room key and itenerary with me but what was making this impossible was when will call called V'dara they told them we were not staying there. After over an hour of this and 2 phone calls to V'dara where they denied our patronage. Will call issued us new tickets the only seats left for the show. They were horrible seats! When we returned to V'dara and explained the ordeal at the front desk they passed us off to the concierge who assured us the manager would give us a call. The manager never called. Instead the concierge called and admitted the error was theirs but offered no consolation. My husband and I were tired of complaining. One day of our vacation was already tainted. We were dissatisfied but felt we were stonewalled repeatedly. We tried to speak to the manager one last time at our checkout but we were stonewalled again. In addition to the ticket debacle in the four days we stayed at V'dara our rooom was cleaned only once. We continually requested it be cleaned and we were out of the room in 5 hour blocks but it was not cleaned daily. Overall V'dara was looked nice and was new but I would not stay there again. It did not feel like a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Amere1
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel we stayed in Vegas. Huge rooms, amazing beds, awesome shower, and non-smoking. 1 minute walk to Aria where there are restaurants and casino. Also like the free tram to Monte Carlo. Connects to Bellagio as well, so that is a bonus. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: blueesmrs
Reviews.Content: Had a fab weekend in Vdara. Have been to vegas many times & wasn't so sure about a non-gaming hotel, but it was sooooooooooo relaxing, would definately receommend it & the action is only a few steps away. The perfect combination. Selfparking would be good as there was a back-log on Sunday at 12 ( check-out time, waiting a good 20 mins) Nicest breakfast I ever had in Vegas & thats saying alot!

Reviews.Title: “Vdara was great!”
Reviews.Author: talbottsw
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Vegas and we chose to stay at the Vdara, part of the new Las Vegas City Center. It doesn't have a casino but is attached to the Bellagio and Aria which both are a few minutes walk time. There is also a Tram that connects Aria, Vdara, Bellagio and Monte Carlo. I liked the fact that we could go onto the strip and go from casino to casino each day but when arriving back to our hotel, it was very quiet. Also, compared to check in lines I saw at casino hotels, Vdara was quick and easy. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Flawed”
Reviews.Author: chicagoflaneur
Reviews.Content: They're still working out the kinks. We stayed here on a Wednesday night and had reserved a fountain view room. Apparently they'd run out because instead they checked us into a pool view suite. It was a larger room but they didn't tell us about it until we got upstairs and figured it out for ourselves. They also just opened the pool last week and the hours are only 9am to 6pm. The room itself probably photographs fantastically well, but there were alot of flaws when you actually looked. A broken bathroom sink, some painter's tape still on the wall, some trash left behind by the previous guest, an alarm set to go off at midnight, etc. And Vdara's located in a strange place, not quite on the Strip and not easy to get to -- CityCenter is weirdly designed and Vdara's sort of in this black hole in the back. And yes, I noticed the funny lobby smell as soon as we walked in. Next time I'm in Las Vegas, I'll definitely shop around for other hotels before trying Vdara again.

Reviews.Title: “Refeshingly clean and smoke free”
Reviews.Author: JMOSKI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for my wife's 40th Birthday, it was fabulous: clean, modern, and smells great, such a refreshing change from the smoke filled casinos. Everything worked and there was plenty of hot water - i was a bit nervous about my selection after reading some of the negative reviews - glad I gave it a chance. Only down sides from my perspective were: 1) Valet parking only, I'm a do it myself type of guy and would have preferred to just park it myself. Granted they were always fast in retrieving the car. 2) The Silk road restaurant is very pricey and the only place to eat in the hotel. I would have preferred a less expensive place to eat breakfast as part of starting the day. The food was great, but it was hands down the most fancy and expensive breakfast I've ever eaten. 3) If your room is high up on the side as the highway, you will hear the cars & trucks all night. Initially we had the "pool view" which didn't have a view down the strip, but was completely silent at night. The last night was an adhoc stay (since our flight got screwed up) and we got a room on the 44th floor with a great view of the strip, but it came with the aforementioned rumble of the highway. Great place, though - we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Savannah001
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st time that my husband and I stayed here. There were also 2 other couples that we were travelling with that also stayed at Vdara. From the moment we drove up to the valet Friday evening we were greeted by the friendly staff. We proceeded to the front desk to check in where "Kevin" completed our reservation process. He was friendly and well knowledgable of the hotel, he even provided us a complimentry upgrade to our existing room. My husband and I proceeded through the lobby and we noticed how clean and fun the environment was. There is a distinct smell throughout the entire hotel that is very inviting , I am still thinking that there is something in the air vents. I loved it! When we arrived to our suite on the 37th floor we had a 180 degree panaoramic view of the city. The linens were high in thread count, Aveda amenities in the bathrooms, the Furniture was inviting, the layout of the room was perfect, and the bed was cozy. The only downside was that the alarm clock decided to go off at 6:30am the next morning. Apparently someone (Maybe Me) forogot to make sure that the previous guest did not set the alarm clock. So I pulled it out of the wall & removed it's batteries, HA-HA! Saturday morning I went down to the "Coffee Bar" to have breakfast with the girls, the food was really good. The waiter was a little off so to say in a polite way. I then proceeded to the concierge as I needed to find a house phone since I locked myself out of my room, she was very rude. The way I see it, there are always a few in every group. I was not going to let this discourage me since everyone else had been so polite and accomidating. I went to the workout room and the spa for a treatment. Again, everyone was so polite and knowledgable. The 90 minute lavender massage that I was treated to by "Jasmine" was amazing to say the least! She definately is an asset to the spa! Soon after our spa treatments, we went to the pool. It was clean and the pool attendent found us 3 chairs and provided us towels, Within minutes the waiter came over for our food and beverage order. Great food and yummy drinks! At this point with everything I was thinking that this place it just to good to be true. The room attendents thouroughly cleaned our room and provided amenities. Our checkout on Sunday was very easy, I called over the phone. The bellhop that attended to us at arrival and departure were very prompt. The male concierge Saturday and the Michael the bell captain were so nice in assisting us at the last minute Saturday evening with a limo for the 6 of us to go to another hotel for a concert. The Vdara bar in the lobby provided wonderful service with the drinks made just right. I normally stay at the Bellagio and have for the past 5 years. However, I feel that Vdara is my new choice. It is very convenient as they have a direct pathway that leads you into the Bellagio with no hassles. I am a frequent traveler myself and have stayed in numerous hotels. IE: Hilton, Marriot, Starwood and the list goes on and on. Infact, I work at a 5 star resort in Phoenix for the past 3 years so I am very familiar on hotel and resort operations. I would recommend Vdara to anyone that appreciates strong customer service within a beautiful hotel. I have decided for me that I will stay at Vdara in the future when we visit Las Vegas again which is very frequent. I would like to add that Vdara definately has taken the time to provide the simple things as well that make your stay just a little more comfortable. Fabulous hotel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good new Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimTin
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I stayed in Vdara for four night. We had booked two "Twin" rooms. Check in process went smoohly and fairly friendly. However, the receptionist did not give any info regarding the hotel facilities or services, eventhough they did not have any other guests waiting to be served at the reception. We had booked two rooms thru the booking agency. Since we where 4 guys we had asked for two twin rooms, but as we went to the rooms we noticed that we had been given two double rooms instead. (It was probably the travel agents mistake though). We went back to reception and asked if we could change the doubles to twin rooms. The receptionist told us that they did not have actual twin rooms at all and that the sofas could be converted to extra beds. We went back up and called housekeeping and requested them to make the extra beds. Still I ended up sleeping on a plain sofa on the first night and after calling them again the next day they actually managed to do the extra beds. This also happened to my friends. The personnel at the conciarge desk as well as the person at the business centre were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice and roomy. However, I do not really understand the kitchenette... 1. There is no cutlery etc. 2. The fridge is so small that there is room for like a few cans of soda and that's it. 3. Whom goes to Vegas to cook in a hotel room?. Also the light switch wiring was a little mixed up:) The location itself is no problem. Especially if you are a mobily person you can walk from the hotels front entrance straight to the strip in 2-3 minutes or opt. to walk thru Bellagio, but that will take more time. The hotel does not have a casino. This naturally makes the vibe very different from most of the other hotels, as stated here many times before. The hotels calm ambiance and chic design makes it suitable for a romantic getaway for couples.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel That Falls Short Of Providing A Five Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: Fifiann
Reviews.Content: I am being extra tough on Vdara because it claims to be five star hotel. If it only claimed to be a four star hotel (which is what it really is), it might just have squeaked a four circle review from me. The problem is that it falls far below the standard it has set for itself. However, that said, the room rates that are being offered at the moment are also much lower than you would expect for a five star property, so it balances out somewhat. First, the good things. Vdara is a brand new property of exquisitely modern yet comfortable design. The lobby/bar/restaurant area is extremely elegant. The guest rooms are very spacious with a separate kitchenette, and the bathrooms have a separate walk in shower and deep soaking tub. The outer wall is slightly curved and the window runs along the length, providing a glorious panoramic view. The reason for the unusually large rooms is because this property was built primarlly to be a condo/timeshare resort - but given the current economic climate it is only likely to attract regular hotel business. Now, the bad. The doors to the guest rooms will not swing shut behind you as is normally the case - especially in a modern hotel. You need to pull them firmly closed (and it is easy to forget this). That is a terrible design flaw and a serious security issue. The lighting in the bathroom is poor. It is too dim for applying makeup (even using the lit magnifying mirror) and yet it still manages to be completely unflattering (they clearly did not have a female designer check it out!). The pool was closed during my visit, even though the weather was sunny and in the 70s (the reason cited for it being closed was poor weather). The pool is highly featured on the website and is something I, like a number of others, wanted to make use of. It strikes me that they don't want to pay for a pool attendant while the hotel is under capacity and it was extra galling for me as I had a view from my room of the Bellagio guests sunning themselves by their pool. Your resort fee covers entry to the fitness centre but not to the spa. That will cost you another $25, which is inappropriate for a five star property, especially when you are already paying a resort fee of $15 a day. Service is poor.
