Don't get me wrong, everyone at the hotel is extremely nice and polite. They just haven't got their act together yet and are inefficient. The first day, the maid was a no show until late afternoon. She managed to forget to replace the empty tissue box and replenish the coffee condiments. The next day, the room had still not been serviced by 9pm! We called and got them to come up while we went to dinner but again, they did not replenish the condiments and nor did they provide a fresh toilet roll even though the current one was down to the wire. The next morning we called to get this fixed. The rigamarole we went through to get a roll of toilet tissue was almost comical, with a plumber showing up at one point to unclog the loo - no, all we need is a roll of toilet paper!! It took a couple of hours to acheive this simple goal. The Silk Road restaurant at the hotel (which is recommended, although I did not get the opportunity to try it) only opens for breakfast and lunch. I just don't think a hotel without an evening restaurant gets to be rated five star. I guess it may start operating in the evenings when the hotel begins to acheive a higher occupancy rate and to be fair, as I said earlier, the room prices are not five star yet either. There are some complaints from other reviewers I would like to address. No, the kitchenettes do not come stocked with equipment but, they now inform you at check in that housekeeping will gladly bring it on request so that is no longer an issue. The walkway to the Bellagio is NOT difficult to find. It is clearly signposted and there are plenty of staff to ask for directions, but I entirely agree it should be kept open past midnight. Getting over to Aria is a bit of a pain. The official sidewalk takes you on a long walk. The most obvious looking path tricks you and takes you off into the parking lot and what is actually the shortest route, is a hairy dodge in and out through the taxi rank. That's just poor overall design of City Center though, rather than of Vdara itself. As to the resort fee issue. Well, the value of that depends on what you want to do at the hotel. It covers wireless internet access. You can expect to pay at least $15 a day at other Vegas hotels for that alone. It covers gym access, which you would also expect to pay extra for at the other hotels. You also get, in addition to the minibar, a fridge for your own use which is stocked with water and coffee, which is not common in Vegas and although not worth $15 on its own, is good in combination with the wireless and gym (which for me, are amenities I want and use). One more thing. There is no self parking at Vdara. Valet Parking is complimentary - but obviously you have to tip. In summation, Vdara is not bad value at the moment and offers spacious and attractive accommodation. If you are familiar with the five star experience and go in expecting that, you will be disappointed, but if you accept it for what it really is (a four star serviced condo property) you will be fine. And one tip: request a room on a high floor at the back of the property - they have fantastic views over the Bellagio fountains.

Reviews.Title: “One Awesome Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasLovers
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of the vehicle we were in, to the final step we took off the prperty on the final day, it was like being in heaven. Our stay was for 6 nights and we were not disappointed at all. From the Front Desk to the Bell Hop as well as the maid service, it was all 5 Star impecable service. The linens in the room was superior. We had a room that had the divider that divided the living room from the dining room. We had a view of the Effel' Tower and a partial view of he Fountains at The Bellagio. Because we were on our honeymoon, we were greeted with a bottle of Champagne on ice when we returned from getting some dinner. Check out was very easy and everytime we called the front desk or anyother service, they always greeted us by our last name. What we liked about it as well, is that there was a FREE Tram running from the Vdara to the Monte Carlo. It stops at Aria (hotel next to it) Crystals (Mini-Mall) and the Monte Carlo. If you are looking for cheap eats, we would recommend going to the Monte Carlo. They have a food court with resonable food selection and prices. We ate at Aria's The Buffet on a Sunday. It was brunch and cost os over $50 for two. The food was very exotic, so if your not into international food, then its not for you. They do have breakfast buffet for $15 during the week, but do not forget that Las Vegas has a 8.75% sales tax on EVERYTHING. All and all, the experience at the Vdara was awesome and we are already planning a family vacation next year to Las Vegas and plan to stay at the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: MCLEODAJ
Reviews.Content: The customer service and the hotel itself were superb!! The moment we arrived they meet us at the curb had our luggage on a cart. Once in our room we were very impressed! There are two floor plans for the deluxe suit-one with a partition dividing the bedroom and living room and the other plan without it. We had the one with the partition-I asked for it when we checked in. Adds a little bit of privacy plus you get two t.v.s. The room was wonderful! The bed was so comfortable! I was very impressed by the maid service! They even lined up my shoes! The concierge desk was very helpful in finding restaurants. The pool was amazing..small but very laid back and very modern! The hotel smells wonderful too! I liked there being no casino-Aria is close enough.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the heart of Vegas without the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Chachachingching
Reviews.Content: My visit was 16 - 24th March. I got back yesterday and couldn't wait to right a review of the hotel, especially to counter the negative ones that nearly dissuaded me from staying there. As I said above, if I were to listen to have listened to the negative reviews placed about this hotel I wouldn't have opted to stay there. The hotel is very clean, very relaxing and very serene. The staff are ALL polite and friendly, made more impressive by the fact that many of the staff are in their 20's and 30's. The first thing that hits you is the smell of the place .... it's a light non-intrusive perfume which is very soothing and not at all nauseating. The other things that you'll notice is that this is not a gaming hotel so there is noisy casino to trawl through nor smoke (as it's a non-smoking hotel - great!!!!) and it's very serene and offered a nice peaceful oasis of calm - even though it's slap bang in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. I felt very fortunate to have chosen this hotel. I stayed in their standard room, but upon seeing my room had to ask whether they'd given me an upgraded room by mistake. My room was on the 31st floor and the views were amazing .. I was able to watch the Bellagio water fountain display from the comfort of my sofa. So let me describe the room: upon entry to the room you are in a kitchen area, where there is a huge microwave, a small cooker hob, cupboards, drawers, coffee making machine, a sinke (complete with it's own food disposal port) and two fridges - one fridge was for my own use, the other housed the mini-bar. 'My' fridge housed never ending supplies of coffee (for the machine) and bottles of water. Once past the kitchen you're into the bedroom, which has a table (complete with two chairs), a 36" flatscreen television and a sofa and coffee table, a king size bed and desk and leather office chair. Additionally there is a wardrobe which includes hangers, suitcase rack, his'n'hers bathrobes and slippers. The bathroom is in a seperate room, which is joined to the bedroom, this houses a bath, walk-in shower, sink, toilet, mirrors (including one that can be lit up), and lots more cupboards lots and lots of towels of various sizes, hairdryer and lots of Aveda products for your use. There are three telephones in the room; by the lavatory, on the desk (this one can be used wirelessly) and next to your bed. The hotel charges a $15 per day resort fee which covers daily newspapers, magazines, wireless internet access all over the hotel, free use of the computers for flights (online check-in, boarding pass printing etc.) amongst other things I cannot quite remember. The staff were very very good, efficient and friendly. The concierge desk was very very good in meeting my needs from booking show tickets to helping me out when I sprained my ankle in another hotel. If you wish to hire a car (like what I did) no need to stress, the hotel has its own pool of cars which it hires out - the smallest being a Ford Focus - I would recommend you hire with Hertz if you want the car for longer than a few days as it may be cheaper. Having said that the hotel allows you to drop their car off at the airport should you prefer - so no need to worry about transport to the airport at the end of your holiday. As said before the hotel is situated right on the strip in an area called City Center. It ajoins the Bellagio Hotel and is next door to the equally modern & stylish Aria hotel. The Aria & Bellagio are both on the free monorail that runs long the strip in Vegas. The hotel has a pool, spa and hairdressers on site - you need never go anywhere, but I recommend you do and see the delights of Vegas. The lifts are very very quick and are split (this saves an incredible amount of time) - in the left corridor the lifts take you to the floors 1-28 and the lifts in the right corridor take you to floors 29-53 - each corridor has 6 lifts! In addition, you can charge food, shows and services attained at other hotels to your room at the Vdara. My friend and I ate and saw shows at the Mirage, MGM, Aria, Mandalay Bay etc. and was able to charge it all to our hotel rooms at the Vdara. The only thing we were unable to charge was afternoon tea at the Four Seasons (which was good, but not as good as the afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab in Dubai). On the last day my friend and I had lunch at the Silk Road restaurant .... the food was amazing, the stass were impeccable and I can't recommend their homemade ginger ale enough yummy beyond yum! The hotel lobby has lots of seating and a bar which has a very zen outdoor space. When I went on a helicopter ride I got talking to some other people who were staying at the Riveria (a hotel I stayed at 10 yrs ago) and they complained about the lack of peace and the fact that there was no where in the hotel they were able to have a quiet sit-down drink at, without having to put up with the noise of the casino or walking through the casino hall just to get anywhere. I felt very fortunate to have found the Vdara, it's a gem of a hotel! I can't recommend this place enough as it's a great escape from the noise of Vegas without being out of town. Go and experience it. I intend to go back next year without a doubt ... Vegas is more than just gambling and this hotel helps facilitate such thought! Fantastic!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Batfink12
Reviews.Content: If you want a quiet hotel on the strip but feels off it come here. Good points- modern rooms no noise from other guests 2 plasmas in room polite service next to bellagio no casino great bed Bad points- poor housekeeping(room still not done at 4pm). poor shower water pressure 10minute walk to the get onto the strip Doesn't feel like vegas

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Upscale, Relaxing Condo”
Reviews.Author: roni55
Reviews.Content: We booked a Vdarah Suite. It was the perfect size for the two of us. Our room had 2 flat screen TVs to our delight. One in the bedroom and one in the living room. The galley styled kitchen had a stove top, microwave/convection oven and small refrigerator to accomodate meals or chilled beverages. We enjoyed maid service daily by simply pressing the "request button" The automated window coverings were also simple to use. Check in and out was quick and easy. The staff was very polite and professional. The entire Hotel had a light pleasing auroma and is totally non-smoking. For your convenience ,there is "Silk Road "restaurant and a bar for mixing and meeting. Vdarah is designed as a condo Boutique hotel so there is no casino. If you desire to gamble, step right next door to the Aria casino and hotel. It offers all the ammenities as a 24 hour casino. If shopping is your diversion, there is , Crystals an upscale shopping mall. Belliggio is also connected to Vdarah by a covered bridge for your convenience. We would highly recommend Vdarah for those travelers seeking more than just a room with a view. The galley kitchen made it feel like living in a modern, upscale relaxing condo.

Reviews.Title: “pretty rooms :: poor management”
Reviews.Author: andwojdyla
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful. I could upload a dozen photos that'd convince you this is the place to stay. (That's how we got here.) Our mistake? We assumed hotel management put equal emphasis on customer service. Our experience after just 21 hours-- --at front entrance: got stub for 4 bags, told bags would be brought to room in 5-10 minutes. --at front desk: had been "promised" 2 adjoining rooms (2 people in each room) but didn't get connected rooms (btw, reservations were made in NOV 09). --after half hour in our rooms: went downstairs to find day manager and ask about 1) switching to adjoining rooms and 2) when luggage would be brought to rooms. --Clerk at front desk said "no adjoining rooms available" and she called manager...was told "manager will be right out"... --15 minutes later...no manager and our luggage still sitting by Bellman Desk. --gave Bellman another $5 to bring bags up About "sleep quality" --we were on the 34th floor so you'd think street noise wouldn't be an issue. It was. There's a lot of new buildings going up in this area...so lots of tool-related noise including at least one "rogue" construction worker who was banging on what sounded like large metal pipes sunk in concrete (no, it wasn't the Blue Man Group) until 2 A.M. (Doesn't this town have noise ordinances regarding new construction?!) This morning: Had breakfast in hotel restaurant, Silk Road. (For two adults, two teens = $99.52.) My complaint? On the way in, I mentioned to hostess that we're celebrating a "Sweet 16" Birthday. Was told "kitchen would get a note ." You guessed it. (sigh) No acknowledgement of special event. Bottom line: Vdara is not on my list of favorite hotels in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Decent new hotel, really good staff”
Reviews.Author: jazzwarrior
Reviews.Content: The four of us took out two rooms through Expedia, good price, just over $100 a night per room. Each room is a suite, at least sort of. There are kitchens which can come in handy, plus a little sitting area and very large bathrooms. Super comfy beds, amazing housecoats, lots of cool little features. All in all, great value for money. The staff were super, unlike the typical Vegas experience which is pretty condescending usually (I've been there 30 times). There is no casino in Vdara, maybe that's why (even though it is owned and operated by MGM). Oddly, there is no place for dinner in the hotel, though there is a really great restaurant for breakfast and lunch. It connects easily to Bellagio and Aria, and the Miracle Mile shopping mall is across the street. If you are looking for a quiet place to stay, but with easy access to two casinos, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel, Two Star Location”
Reviews.Author: ndfanwabashman
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends at Vdara from March 18th through March 21st for the March Madness basektball tournament. This was my seventh trip to Las Vegas, and my first stay at Vdara. I have previously stayed at Flamingo, Imperial Palace, Bellagio, THEHotel at Mandalay Bay and Tripicana. I got an offer through Southwest Vacations that gave one night free, which worked out to be a very good value. The hotel was priced similar to the GO room at Flamingo, which is the other hotel I also considered. To begin on the negative aspects, as others have noted, the location is not very good. If you have stayed in the South Tower at Bellagio, it's about the same distance but the walk is not nearly as convenient. It will improve once all the construction is complete, but at this point if you are almost always better off taking a cab unless you are in the immediate vicinity. Be aware of the route to the hotel as well. Some cab drivers are not aware Harmon is completely connected all the way East to West from Las Vegas Blvd over the freeway. If you are coming from an off strip property, this route will save plenty of time. This is the sole negative to this hotel. I found the level of service by everyone to be exceptional. Everyone was friendly and helpful at each turn, if you are willing to ask, they are willing to deliver. I arrived at 9 a.m., and they were able to check me in immediately. They also accomidated my request to have the larger room with two TV's and a wall removing the living area from the bedroom area. This gave us a room on the 51st floor with the most incredible view of any hotel I've ever stayed at. We looked right down the strip to the Stratosphere (with a view of the fountains at Bellagio) on the right side and then a gorgeous view of the mountains on the left. The bed is very soft, if you prefer a hard bed, this is not going to be an enjoyable sleep. However, I found it wonderfully comfortable. The bathroom is on par with the rest of the hotel, which is to say it is of top notch quality. For me, water pressure in a shower can make or break a hotel, and I found it to be perfectly acceptable at Vdara. I was worried that along with the LEED Gold rating, they would fit some sort of low flow showerhead in the bathroom, but my fears were quickly put to rest. The soaking tub is an odd choice, and no one in our room tested it out. All in all, I loved my stay at Vdara. If it was more convenient to visit, at the same room rate, I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is WOW and get the panoramic suite”
Reviews.Author: suppdawg
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the newest hotels when we travel to Vegas. For this reason we have a good sense of what Vegas has to offer. I booked Vdara for this trip because I like the fact that it is a smoke free property and I was impressed by the low cost for what you can get. We booked the Vdara suite mid week for 249 a night and when we arrived discovered that had upgraded us to the panoramic suite which is the same as the Vdara suite but with 270 degrees of view. The rooms are fantastic, great furnishings electric blinds are very cool, the room says quality. I highly suggest the panoramic suite, it is really cool to have windows everywhere, you can get a spectacular view from the kitchen, tub, living room and bedroom. Who could ask for more. The staff were fantastic, they all called you by Mr or Mrs ------. Which was a very nice touch that is often lost in many hotels these days. Once you learn your way around you can get from the Vdara to the strip and casinos very easily. We have decided to stop hotel hopping and will visit Vdara on our next and all future trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “MGM Ruin's 3 month old hotel”
Reviews.Author: GolfingYogi
Reviews.Content: Just walking into the hotel you go, "this is only 3 months old?" This is what happens when bean counters run the company. The labels on the switches are unreadable, the wall paper is wearing off. They charge you for the drink and the mix?? $20.00 bloody mary. The food is inedible. The staff doesn't know what they offer. You can't park your own car. Everyone has their hand out. The internet doesn't work. The eggs are separated the ham is spam the potatoes are tater tots and all for $25.00. Don't bother this is a ripoff in a tacky already old environment. SUCKS!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is EXCELLENT, 5 Star. Don't listen to the bad reviews...”
Reviews.Author: TechWolfie
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a bit hesitant about staying at the Vdara. However, I received a rate of $159 with a $50 credit, so it was worth a try. The room was absolutely amazing. We booked a Deluxe suite and got a 1 bedroom Vdara suite at no charge upgrade. The Aria is close by and is full of dining and gambling. The rooms are well beyond my expectations, and I usually stay at 5 star hotels only. The bathrooms were well appointed and the staff was wonderful. I even left my shoes with the bellman and they called me asking if I had forgotten them. We dined at the Silk Road, again, amazing. I do NOT like the mandatory $15 per night extra charge, however it did include valet parking, in room private IP internet access and Keriug coffee w/bottled water. The kitchen was well appointed and I was surprised to find a washer/dryer in the closet for free use. Getting into the property was a bit difficult, as I don't like driving down the strip, but after finding out about the back way into the property, getting in and out was a snap. Service was excellent. Food was excellent as was the room. I say go to the Vdara, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara Good and Bad, not ugly”
Reviews.Author: Lauri101
Reviews.Content: I'm a once-a-year traveler to Las Vegas and have stayed at many properties on Strip and downtown. Vdara is definitely an experience unlike any I've had. We went to Las Vegas for my youngest daughter's wedding and my 55th birthday. My oldest daughter and I shared one room and the happy couple in another - both on 51st floor overlooking the Bellagio fountains. The view was spectacular! We could see the mountains all around as well as the view of the Strip looking north. Check-in was fast, as noted by others. I tried the "$50 trick" for an upgrade - no luck, although the desk person Ashley did appear sad that she couldn't help. She did place us on 51st floor, though, so I gave her $10 for effort. The rooms were not ready and took over an hour to get made up, but the bell staff held our luggage so we could walk around and go eat. The main reason we wanted to stay at Vdara was the smoke-free property. The air was fresh and had a faint fruity odor - pleasant but unidentifiable. The rooms were fairly clean, but hadn't been dusted. The refrigerator and one light in kitchen area were not working. We told the front desk about it that evening before we went out, but no one fixed it. A bottle of wine and two glasses were left on the table - no explanation, no charge. I wish they had asked - we ended up leaving it as none of our party drinks wine. We did get both of the above fixed the next day by a very nice engineer named Bob. The blackout shades didn't blackout the light due to the three piece design. The pull-out sofa was horrible, although the sofa itself, without being pulled out, was fairly comforatable to sleep on. Warning - don't sleep in the bed if you have back problems! Maybe some find it comfortable but there was absolutely no back support - like sinking into a marshmallow or fluffy cloud. That's when I moved to sofa and gave daughter the bed. The coffee pot took special pods(Keirug, or something like that). I am always generous to housekeeping and was supplied plenty of coffee, water and toiletries. My youngest daughter (the bride) did not tip and did not receive good housekeeping service. Maybe Vdara doesn't pay enough? We asked for plates, forks and a knife to cut the wedding cake and it took almost 2 hours and 2 calls. There is no excuse for that. When we called the second time, the person acted like she didn't know we'd asked. Now - for the distance from the Strip and access. This is the reason why I probably would not stay at Vdara again. There is no straight shot to the Strip! The walkway to Bellagio was covered but open to elements and the wind speeds during our stay were from 20-40 mph! Vdara needs a coffee shop/convenience store for sundries - even getting a newspaper or evening snack was a 20 minute trek. Daughter #2 used fitness center - said it was very nice with good equipment. None of us used spa. Pool wa closed. High-speed internet was fairly good most of time. The $15 resort fee was irritating, considering cost of room. Aria was ok but very dead - no energy. Table minimums during day were $25 for BJ - and a lot of dealers were standing around doing nothing! Hmmm - maybe if you lower the limits your dealers could work and earn tips? We ate breakfast at the Aria buffet and it was outstanding! We also went to Monte Carlo for quick meals in food court a couple of times - it was the nearest spot but still inconvenient. There was an overhead walk to Planet Hollywood/Miracle Mile of Shops but you couldn't get to it unless you went outside and walked around construction area. Dangerous and a long way to walk. Vdara is lovely. If you had unlimited funds and could afford a taxi to go everywhere, it would be a great place to stay. (Or if you had a chauffeur-driven limo) I can afford neither so would not stay again or recommend it to friends. They still have issues to work out with training the housekeepers and maintaining the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely classy hotel near but not on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Mira0708
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas. I am not a gambler at all and was a little leery of the 24-hour glitzy ostentatious casino culture. The Vdara hotel was the perfect place for us to stay. Close to the Strip, so easy to access the other hotels where we saw shows, but a calm, classy retreat to return to away from the noise. Clean, elegant, and peaceful. I very much appreciated that it was a non-gaming property and smoke-free too! The decor was modern and elegant, without all the gaudy decorations we saw when we passed through other hotel-casinos. There were fresh flowers throughout the property. Luxury without overly showy opulence. The lobby bar was particularly beautiful. Our room was comfortable and appealing, and the bed was amazing. The level of hospitality and service was outstanding. All staff were friendly, helpful, and polite, never pushy or overbearing. We found the walkway to the tram connecting the Vdara, Bellagio, and Montecarlo very easy to access. (This also gave us access to the Strip.) I had a manicure/pedicure at the spa and will absolutely plan a full day of spa treatments there if I ever decide to return to Las Vegas. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great potential”
Reviews.Author: KC305
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night stay at Vdara. We had contacted the hotel ahead of time as it was my parents' anniversary and asked if they could possibly be accommodated on a high floor with a nice view of the Bellagio fountains. The hotel replied to us that they had noted our request on the reservation. Upon arrival however, there was nothing noted on the reservation and we found that we had been assigned rooms on the 12th floor. Fortunately the front desk host had no problem in moving us up to better rooms on the 36th floor with great views. We were pleased that there was only a short (5 minute) wait to check-in, and also that the lobby was very spacious and smoke-free, as there is no smoking and no casino on property. One complaint is that even though our stay was prepaid through American Airlines Vacations, the hotel needed to put a credit card hold of more than $500 for each of our two rooms. We were not aware of this policy in advance, and that could be a problem for some guests. The elevators were very fast and the rooms well appointed - except we could have used an extra trash can in the kitchen. Bathroom toiletries were plentiful and readily replenished. Although we had booked our reservation through American Airlines Vacations, we were disappointed to find that we were charged an additional resort fee of $15/day per room - especially as (1) the pool was closed and (2) our water was not restocked. The hotel advised us that we could use the pool at next door Aria, but really who wants to walk across to another hotel for a swim. Still, the gym was very good and both the wired and wireless internet were free, which in many properties you would pay $15/day for that alone. The room was well furnished and the bed was comfortable. The windows had automatic shades and blackouts, however (1) the switch broke on our second day, when we pushed the button, the faceplate broke off and disappeared into the wall, and (2) the blackout blinds were separated into three panels, each with about a one inch gap between them, so they really didn't blackout the light, which came streaming through the gaps early in the morning. Trying to walk back to the hotel from the strip was difficult. I had to either walk into Bellagio and then back across the walkway into Vdara - or walk into the Crystals shopping center and then take the monorail to the Bellagio station and walk back. Perhaps pedestrian access to the Vdara will improve once construction has been completed. On the evening of our second day, the toilet got blocked. We called housekeeping before going out for the evening and they said it would be fixed by the time we got back. When we returned back to the hotel after midnight, it had not been fixed. We were tired and didn't want to wait again for them to send someone who may or may not show up, so we had to use the public bathroom in the lobby. The next morning we called housekeeping again, and they were surprised to find out that it had not been fixed, because according to the notes in their system, the maintenance person had reported that he had fixed it - clearly not true. At that point they did send someone up who arrived in less than 5 minutes and fixed it. He was very nice and again apologized for their failure to fix it the previous evening. The kitchen had a nice coffee maker with pods of coffee. As a tea drinker, it would have been nice to have tea available in the room as well - I'm pretty sure they make pods with tea the same as with the coffee. Instead if I wanted tea I would have had to pay for in-room dining to provide it. A few times we had to wait for a taxi because there were none there, although they were lined up waiting across the other side of the circle outside Aria. We found over the course of our stay that several taxi drivers either didn't know where Vdara was, or weren't sure how to get to it. We often found ourselves giving the directions to the taxi drivers. We didn't eat on-site, but we did go across to the breakfast and lunch buffet at Aria which was AMAZING, and we highly recommend it. Not gaudily themed or cramped - very spacious, light and modern, with four chefs, one of whom is chocolatier Jean Phillipe - outstanding food in a wonderful atmosphere, and the friendliest server we met throughout our whole trip. Whereas some buffet servers seem to disappear during the meal, she was always available and kept our cups full and made wonderful conversation with my parents. She also told us all about the chefs and the food that was available. In summary, Vdara is a great hotel, with spacious modern suites. It is smoke-free and very calm and quiet - a welcome retreat to come home to after the hustle and bustle of most strip based hotels. It is nice not having a lobby full of tourists or a casino to navigate through to get to your room. Most of the issues mentioned here are service related which can easily be corrected once management have been made aware, and the appropriate steps taken to prevent their recurrence. I think we would stay here again once we feel that these concerns have been addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Vdara”
Reviews.Author: VegasInza
Reviews.Content: I’m a Vegas girl from way back. I’ve lived through Steve Wynn’s visions of pirates, volcanoes, and a giant lake complete with dancing fountains in the middle of the desert. It takes a lot to impress me. I must admit, MGM Mirage’s newest creation made me stop in my tracks. Over the last few years I have watched this blank piece of land take shape into some of the most beautiful buildings to ever dot the Las Vegas skyline. On Wednesday December 2, 2009 I got my chance to check out Vdara. The first thing that hits you when you walk through the beauty entry way is the lack of smoke. For those of us who enjoy having pink healthy lungs this place is heaven on the Las Vegas strip. With Vdara’s massive size it is oddly quiet and quite serene. The lobby itself is a feast for the eyes. The architecture is simply breathtaking with the blending of calming colors and clean lines. The Vdara stats themselves are equally as impressive as it’s beauty. * Non gaming * Smoke free * 10,000 square feet of meeting space * 1,495 private suites * Full service wellness spa, salon and fitness center * US Green Building Council LEED Gold Certified Building * Sky pool and lounge featuring a sparkling pool, bar and lounge, cabanas and event space. * Silk Road, a modern and innovative restaurant by chef Martin Heierling. Christian Umlauf a Las Vegas local said it best when he used the word “elegant” to describe the magnificent wonder of Vdara. This luxury resort is a must see for locals and tourists alike. It gets the Vegas Cocktail stamp of approval. http://thevegascocktail.com/vdara/

Reviews.Title: “No Smoke, no casino, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramblingranny
Reviews.Content: Our two- day stay at the Vdara was wonderful. We had an accessible room on the 51st floor with a view of the Bellagio fountain, The mini-kitchen has top-notch appliances, the bed is extremely comfortable, the bathroom is spacious and well-equipped. By reading some of the previous reviewers' comments, I knew to ask when I checked in for the kitchen utensils we needed and for extra bedding for the sofa bed. Everyone was very polite and efficient. The hotel is completely smoke-free and there is no casino. but the Aria hotel is about a 5-minute walk and it has the casino and accommodates smokers. We did not eat in the on-site restaurant, Silk Road, but there are excellent restaurants at the Bellagio, Aria and the Monte Carlo, which are all linked by the tram. The free tram was extremely convenient--it runs around the City Center complex among the various hotels and the shopping mall called Crystals. There is free valet parking at Vdara, no self-parking at all. Vdara was one of our favorite hotels--we can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with just an OK location”
Reviews.Author: HIltonMagic
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the new Vdara Hotel. The hotel itself was beautiful; nicely decorated lobby and very clean. We were greeted by staff every time we walked through the lobby. It was very quiet all over the hotel and to be honest we never saw another person in the hallways or elevators throughout our entire stay. The suite was spacious and spotlessly clean. While we enjoyed some of the things that made the room interesting (automated shade up/down, etc) it was apparent even after only a few months that these items will not hold up well. Our shades were already showing signs of hanging obviously crooked on one of the windows and I can only imagine how they will look and perform after a year or more of use. It was nice to have a refrigerator in the room, but this is Vegas - is someone really going to use much of the kitchen? In my opinion I think they could have made the kitchen a little smaller and devote that extra space into the actually living area. The bathroom was a nice size and very clean. We did not use the tub, but as others have commented, I am not sure how comfortable it would be as the drain is in the center of the floor of the tub. Also, for a tub that large it would have been a nice touch to have included jets. It was nice at times to not have a casino downstairs as it was very quiet, but there were also times when we missed it. The walk to Bellagio is short, but still not terribly convenient when you just want to run get a soda or pick up a newspaper. The location made it a little more involved to get anywhere as you essentially had to walk to Bellagio first and go from there. There is no pedestrian walkway from Vdara to the Strip itself. We did not try the bar or restaurant, so I can't comment on those. Overall, we had a good stay at Vdara but I think our next trip we will stay somewhere actually located on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “perfect escape from the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: LaurieLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 nights at Vdara. It was perfect!! Hotel is stunning, and the suite is perfection! Amazing wall to wall windows, fabulous view, 2 big flat screen tv's, out of this world bed, and so much more................ Cozy robes, fluffy slippers, turn down service, Roman tub, every appointment in the room is great! The hotel is so quite and calm and fresh and clean! It makes every other casino hotel seem like a dark dungeon type experience. We loved it! Husband said gym was great. Staff very friendly and helpful. This is the only place, I would ever stay in Vegas! (non smoker, not a big gambler)

Reviews.Title: “great stay at Vdara”
Reviews.Author: JamieHerts
Reviews.Content: its strange reading the other comments as we really enjoyed it. Driving up to the hotel at night the hotel and the city centre development stood out and looked very modern. The main problem we had was driving into the development, I missed it off the Strip and turned the wrong way off the I-15 but eventually got there and was pleased to see the parking was not charged for on top of the room and $15 resort fee. There was no queue at check in which I've heard can be over an hour at some other hotels in Vegas and check out was very quick. There was no issue with the staff but I didn't really ask for much, the door men were friendly and chatty. The whitener for the coffee was missing one day and it took 20 minutes for some to arrive but I forgave them as house keeping got fresh ice to keep my half bottle of wine cool which was nicely chilled by the time I got back from shopping. Nice touch. I didn't notice any issues with the cleaning, we loved the room, modern and well laid out although its strange they had a kitchen area when very few people will use it (so they told me). We also had a partial view of the Bilagio fountains and a good view over Vegas every evening which we loved. The bed, pillows and bath robes were excellent and I'd have loved to bring one home if the robes weren't $101 each. One improvement they could have made was to the safe, it needs to be bigger and at least horizontal rather than on the wall as you are limited on fitting an SLR camera and laptop in at the same time - obviously two expensive items I like to secure. I didn't try the restaurant but did eat at the Bilagio and Aria buffet and both for excellent value and good quality for $14 before 11am, in fact we preferred Aria's because the Bilagio's was a bit old fashioned for me. Not sure what they are like for lunch or dinner. Although it seemed like the hotel was out of the way we liked the fact it was 5 minutes to the strip via Harman Ave and 5 minutes to Bilagio and Aria. We'd happily stay again!

Reviews.Title: “City Center Grand Opening”
Reviews.Author: Roz808
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vadara for the grand opening of the City Center. The Vadara is a beautiful hotel with dark wood interiors, natural stone, simple yet beautiful floral arrangements and some wonderful art pieces. I should also mention that it is a LEED certified hotel with the US Green Building Council.

Reviews.Title: “A Breath of Fresh Air in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 032711o
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we pulled up to the Vdara, we were in awe. The Vdara is by far the best hotel in Vegas. Having stayed in numerous other hotels/casinos, we decided to try Vdara, even though the reviews on tripadvisor were mixed. Please do not listen to the negative reviews, this place is amazing. I apologize for the length of this review, but I really wanted to set the record straight on this fantastic hotel. First, upon check-in, we were greeted with no wait and two smiling front desk clerks. We asked for a room on one of the higher floors and our request was granted without a problem. The check-in was fast, courteous and extremely friendly. We were given a room on the 53rd floor, one of the upper floors of the hotel. As we entered the room, we were blown away with the sweeping views of Vegas from so high up. Since Vdara is one of the tallest buildings in Vegas, the view is incredible. However, the view was just one of the best parts of our amazing room. We entered into the kitchen of our room, which was just the perfect size. I know that some past reviews stated that they thought the kitchen was “wasted space,” but we found it to be perfect. The appliances were all top of the line, with a combination convection oven/microwave oven and a double refrigerator, one of which was fully stocked with a mini bar and the other was left empty for our use. Leading off of the kitchen was our amazing bedroom. We had a king sized bed, a chair, a sofa with a queen sized pull out bed and a desk. The LCD TV looked to be about 42” and the entertainment center included a very convenient “charging center” with numerous outlets and usb ports for charging cell phones, ipods, etc.. The bed was one of the most comfortable we had ever slept in. The linens were soft and luxurious, as were the pillows. The bathroom equally matched the greatness of the bedroom. There is a large shower with bench, as well as a large soaking tub. The soaking tub was truly fantastic and easily fit two people. We enjoyed a relaxing bath each night of our stay. The lighting in the bathroom was exceptional, by far the best I have experienced in a hotel. Finally, all of the Aveda products were an awesome touch; we loved the shampoo and conditioner so much that we took them home with us. I also wanted to address the service that we received during our stay. I know that some reviews stated that customer service was lacking at the Vdara. However, we found the service to be nothing but top notch. Our bags were brought to our room within five minutes of calling the bell hop. Twice, we called the front desk to bring us silverware and dishes, and both times, they were brought to our room within five minutes. In addition, our room was kept spotless and our coffee and bottles of water were restocked daily. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and all of our requests were fulfilled promptly. We could not have asked for more. We also wanted to recommend the Silk Road restaurant. We ate there for breakfast one morning, and while it was pricy ($60 including tip for the two of us), we did not mind because everything was top of the line. We walked away saying that it was the best breakfast we had ever had. I had the french toast, which I highly recommend. Again, service was impeccable. I also wanted to address some comments about the location/aura of the hotel. Although the hotel is set back from the strip, we found it quite simple to walk to and from the strip from the Vdara. We usually used the walkway to the Bellagio, which also led to the tram. In addition, it was quite simple to walk to the Aria and through the casino to get to the strip. From staying at other properties, we found the walk to the strip actually shorter than other hotels. Finally, one of the best parts of the Vdara is that it is a non-gaming, smoke-free resort in the middle of lively strip. We were able to enjoy all that Vegas has to offer in gambling, shows and dining, but it was so nice to return back to the Vdara each night to the tranquility that this property offers. The fragrance of the hotel is so welcoming compared to the smoky and low ceiling hotels/casinos of other places in Vegas (Aria not included, as we found this casino to be relatively smoke free with high ceilings). Granted, I understand that the Vdara does not offer night clubs etc., but if you want this, it is a couple minute walk away to either the Aria or Bellagio. In conclusion, I would highly recommend the Vdara. From the beautiful design and furnishings, to the great customer service, no part of this hotel was overlooked and the attention to detail is quite extraordinary. We really believe that this place is the best that Vegas has to offer and will stay here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Beware.....oder is really bad”
Reviews.Author: BerthaMcNasty
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very beautiful, but beware of the scent in this hotel... (as you enter lobby) First of all, I spent five nites at this hotel and the spa like fragrance they have thru-out the hotel is horrid!!! To me the so called spa fragrance smelled like a OLD VANILLA CIGAR... and each day this scent would get stronger and stronger.BY the end of my stay, my head felt like it was gonna blow up!! Oh and another strange thing is that for 5 days and 5 nites, we rode the elevator to the 27th. floor ( to our room ) AND NOT ONCE ==YES NEVER== NOBODY ON THAT ELEVATOR WITH US!! We felt like the only guests in VDARA. That seemed a little bizzare , for a hotel in LasVegas.....remember dont book this hotel if cigar smells bother you!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff, outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: JosephineTomato
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vdara this past weekend and were thrilled at every turn. We arrived early on Thursday morning (2/18) and were able to check right into our room. It was lovely, spacious and nicely appointed. Knowing that the entire hotel is non-smoking made a huge difference - the rooms smelled fresh and the public space was always clean. Not having a casino on property proved to be no problem at all - the large new casino at Aria right next door was closer than most of our rooms have been when we have stayed at Bellagio and Caesars. The walkway over to Bellagio was convenient and the tram to Crystals (shopping) and Monte Carlo was speedy and efficient. We found the staff eager to please and genuinely gracious. When we checked into the room the safe was already locked and closed and the water had not been replenished in the small fridge. Our bellman told us he would be personally responsible for making sure these things were rectified and he did just that. The room accommodations were lovely - one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in with loads of fresh white linens on both the bed and in the bath. I especially liked the robes in the rooms - soft, comfortable and warm. We had breakfast in Aria most of the days we were there - a huge cafe with lots of choices, excellent service. Apparently the largest 24 hour restaurant in Las Vegas, they serve all meals at all times. Nice when you just want simple breakfast food at 10 pm. We would definitely go back, loved the location on the strip, the accommodations and especially the gracious service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Staff still not up to speed”
Reviews.Author: Fayekp
Reviews.Content: This was my last stop on a months road trip, so I needed quiet and relaxed and that's exactly what I got. This is a fantastic hotel, have read a few of the other reviews both positive and negative and can agree with bits of all of them. I had a deluxe lake view room, which was worth every penny just for the view but the room was clean and tidy and nicely furnished. Bed really comfy and the bathroom laid out nicely. No problem with my shower on the 39th or 32nd floor (I forget now). Did have a couple of service issues. Plates not cleared away after room service and had a message that housekeeping couldn't clean due to my due not disturb blue light being on (rather than a door handing your doorbell changes colour, very cool) even though it hadn't been on and they had actually clearned (!!!) got the same message the next day too. Again light hadn't been on and they had clearned. Little details, couple of loose bathroom fittings and strangely I also had a cloth left by a maid during my stay but these in now way detracted from the overal niceness of the room and the friendliness of the staff. Feels like the final snagging list wasn't followed up. It was very quiet, but everywhere seemed to be and had no problem finding the Bellagio or the Tram (once I asked). I completely agree about getting out of the Aria, is convoluted and you have to go through the casino and citycentre shopping centre (there may have been another way but I couldn't find it) this also involved either going up or downstairs depending on where you were coming from, all a bit much when you've been wandering the strip all day. A more direct route would be much preferable especially as you would probably book the Vdara to get away from the casinos. Over all I had a lovely stay, I probably wouldn't stay again but mainly because there are too many other hotels to try.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: CaNo
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at Vdara. Next to great shopping at City Center, connected by walkway to Bellagio and able to use Bellagio pool. Easy walk to Bellagio and Forum shops and nearby restaurants at Aria. Would allow 10 minutes for cab however depending on time of day since its a bit hidden off strip. Rooms were well furnished and modern. Great rates available as well. Casinos are near enough but smoke is far enough away.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off my the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: VickyBristol
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive to say the least about some of the negative reviews. We had booked it before it had even opened and really took a gamble (there was a very good deal on lastminute.com) We rely soley on tripadvisor reviews to pick our accomodation and cancelled a room last year as there was a string of bad reviews. We did actually email the hotel (twice) to ask for their comments about some of the negative reviews ie asked for some re-assurance however they did not reply which is very poor customer service. We got married in vegas last year and stayed in the Four Seasons (amazing) This time we wanted something more central and the fact it was brand new really appealed to us. The check in desks when we arrived were quiet and we asked for a room on a high floor. We were offered one on the 17th floor however came back 30 mins later and at this time one on the 40th floor was free so we took this one. Great views of mountains, Rio and Palms to the left and to the right we could see the Bellagio fountains and the eiffel tower. The room was fab. Ok the kitchen area for us was a waste (we did no cooking etc) however it was nice to have the feel of an apartment when you walked in rather than just a bedroom. The bed was amazing - the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in and we do travel a lot. We kept the blinds open at all times just to take in the views both day and night however this wouldn't appeal to everyone! The cleaning was done every day and we have no complaints about this. Lots of clean towels every day. The shower was amazing too (not sure re some of the reviews re a poor shower - different floors = different water pressure???) Would just say one thing, the cleaners didnt do a very 'thorough' job as the window sills etc were getting very dusty in the week we stayed there (was tempted to DIY!) The location was great. We were a little unsure of the connection to the bellagio however this was by a covered walkway and only took 2 minutes to get to the bellagio (why some people couldnt find it was v odd) Despite sign saying it closed at mid-night we still used it after this time on a few occasions. It was then another few minutes walk to get to the lobby of the bellagio and this was great as it meant you didnt have to walk through the casino. City centre itself wasnt completely finished and to be honest it does kind of spoil the strip in some ways ie very very modern in contrast to the themed hotels. NB did not like to Aria at all. V hard to find way out and dark, dark casino. All in all we were very, very pleased we had stayed at the Vdara. As mentioned before, we got a really good deal. Would mention that whilst it is great to stay in the Bellagio or Venetian, you get what you pay for. Some of the rooms at the back of the Bellagio for example would have pretty poor views. We also loved the fact that it was non smoking and no casino (especially loved not having to treak through a huge casino at the end of the day to get to your room)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Lousy Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: richardandmaggy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is beautiful. However, Housekeeping is awful! Also, the towels look old, hard and dirty. Strings all over them. The bathrobes look worn and ugly. Sheets are dingy and made me itch. Your room gets cleaned late if at all and they don't do it very well. One housekeeper left her cleaning rag in my bathroom and there was hair! The food trays stay out all day, not picked up. Awful place! Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “poor service -false advertising”
Reviews.Author: nickimac13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vdara for 3 nights on February 4th to 7th.We expected to be enjoying the Sky pool,its actually on the 3rd floor and even though they are advertising the pools and private cabanas, bar,hot tub,saunas none of them are open yet as the whole 3rd floor where its located is not finished until sometime in March.We asked to be transfered to the Bellagio as its also an MGM PROPERTY and we were told that we could use the pool there but as we had booked through ALLIGIANT AIRLINES PACKAGE there was nothing they could do for us.Very poor service,a new Hotel and no competent managers,no compensation for their false advertising other than after complaining for the second day they gave us a 100$ room credit for food and beverage at any MGM PROPERTY.I would never stay there again,poor management and poor service overall,not worth the money.A non-gaming hotel that we expected to be enjoying the facilities that are not even open yet.

Reviews.Title: “the best place in vegas”
Reviews.Author: alexandermcqueen
Reviews.Content: I have been to las vegas many times and usually the stay is good but really busy in the hotels and too much noise. Vdara is very clean and quit place. Its nice to come back to a place after being out all day thats has clean air and quite. The service there is so personal and everything i needed during my stay was provided immediatly. The front desk people are great and very helpful. The rooms are very spacious and very modern looking and the lighting in washrooms is perfect which is important when getting ready. I will never stay anywhere else but vdara hotel. Best place in vegas by far !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: tidma
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb 12-16th. We arrived miday and were greeeted by bellman. Checked in immediately. Stayed on the 47th floor. The check in was very fast and bags delivered to room immediately. Desk and bellman very polite. Loved the architecture and unique design and blend of materials. The Silk Road restaurant was very good. (ate lunch twice) We live in San Francisco, and eat out at many places that are the same restauranteurs that are in Vegas. So we are used to higher prices and the style of food that these chefs deliver. (we use trip advisor frequently before we travel and I am sometimes amused by the comments so I will give a few opinions based on others reviews here) The food could be considered pricey, but it's what you are used to paying. High prices don't always mean "BIG FOOD". many times it represents quality of ingredients and preperation. If you want big and cheap go to a chain. Seems that most good/great food is expensive now in Vegas. Anyway everything regarding our room,service. ans spa experience at the Vdara was very good/excellent. Only 2 issues. The TV controller doesnt always cooperate with the TV menu when changing channels. (I know this is a digital issue that can be resolved) Second the soaking tub drain plug is in the center of the tub. So if you lie in the tub, the plug will be right in your tailbone and you have to cover it with a towel or not lie down while soaking. (not a well thought out tub design) Our room was cleaned everyday and ammenities replenished. We asked for more soap/shampoo and we were delivered a weeks supply promptly. No other problems with blinds/ maid service/ etc etc. Spa was very very good. Getting around the City Center: Yes the Vdara is in the back of the property buts very quiet. As far as walking the the strip. The way you have to walk is about 3-4 blocks compared to how the crow would fly. but after doing it once its very simple. As far as getting from the Vdara to the Aria, you go out door and to the right or left around the circle on the sidewalk.(someone said theres no walkway and you have to walk in traffic???? huh?) You can pretty much cut right through the Aria( and yes it's smoking allowed in the Aria bt come on it's Vegas and eventually you will be able to avoid going through the casino) one of two ways and pop right out the front and then down to the right or left and about 2 blocks down to the strip. (people here always complain about walking??? if you don't want to walk in Vegas get a cab there are plenty. and unless you can't walk then maybe some of the overweight or unfit folks that seem to be more abundant as we have aged would benefits from more walking and could benefit from some smaller food portions that they complain about as well). Most of our time was spent at Vdara, and Aria, and the Bellagio. eating, walking, going to the spa and gambling and the over all trip was great and all the employees were on the ball and friendly. However the Bellagio (that people always rave about is clearly aging and seems very old (age wise and design wise) compared to the City Center hotels. Many of the other hotels seemed somewhat rundown as well and the Strip very dirty and low budget especially walking toward the Mandalay Bay from City Center. If you like super high end modern architecture by world class architects then you will find the Center very interesting. And walking around exploring the various art/sculptures is very interesting as well. i would deffinently recommend the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: Property opened in December so some kinks are still being worked out and the downturn seemed evident in lobby traffic which was sparse. After a 5 night stay housekeeping was spotty. While WiFi is available in room it is very pricey AND you must sign in every day. Nothing spectacular but steady for a biz meeting hotel. The layout of this property and Aria across the 'way' is confusing and disorienting. But rooms are large and bath is great with nice shower (altho low water pressure on 40th floor) and trendy tub. Do not expect to get new toiletries each day. Soap and shampoo was replaced ONCE in 4 days. Penny pinching. Silk Road is an excellant in house restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Pedestrian Nightmare Unresponsive Management”
Reviews.Author: Xurando
Reviews.Content: Despite negative reviews I didn't think a new expensive hotel could be bad, it was. Not much to add to other comments except that if you are a pedestrian non-smoker you have almost no choice but to walk through a smoky casino. The walkway between Bellagio and Vdara is closed from midnight to 7 AM so you can't take the tram and your easy way in is through the smoky Aria casino. There is a sidewalk on Harmon but it is blocked for construction. Service is abysmal or non-existent. Attempts to talk to managers were met with stonewalling and haughtiness. I could not recommend this beautiful hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “premature release”
Reviews.Author: ak41
Reviews.Content: decent architecture, nice suite, no swimming pool. biggest flaw: the vdara opened prematurely to the public. there was a very apparent lack of attention to details. to itemize: - complete lack of utensils in the kitchen suite - a single garbage can in the entire room - the iron chained to the ironing board (for theft prevention) made for difficult ironing sore spot: our iPod touch was stolen from the room after the first night. despite numerous talks with housekeeping manager and the 20-something hotel manager, nothing yet has been resolved. verdict: more time selecting and training staff should have been spent instead of the quick hire done for the holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome!!”
Reviews.Author: DCFCEnglandOnTour
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Vdara in July 2009 and were really excited, until we started reading the reviews, staff were poor, slow check-in, house-keeping etc. Well lets put this to rest for anyone in our situation who has booked early and is worrying, DONT! The hotel is fantastic as are the staff. The ONLY downside is getting to and from the hotel from the strip, but this is purely down to construction work which is taking place, and once this is complete it will be easy. This is a fantastic hotel which will only get better.

Reviews.Title: “WOW--Eye popping hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: WYOMAGS
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Vdara in the new City Center Las Vegas anticipating a great stay--but a bit concerned because some of the reviews weren't great. Anyone who reviews this hotel badly I honestly just don't get it. First of all it is new and VERY stylish so my wife LOVED it! The moment we walked in the door the great smell hit us and was so refreshing. The doormen were VERY friendly and whisked our bags away. We arrived around 3:00--their busiest time to check in and we had no problems. It was our anniversary so we asked for an upgrade--and we GOT one--no charge. We were on the 46th floor over-looking the Bellagio fountain and WHAT A VIEW of both the fountain, the strip and the mountains. We went up to the room and were blown away when we entered as to how beautiful and awesome it was. While we were checking out the bathroom about 30 seconds after our arrival I thought I heard a doorbell ring and sure enough it was Joe with our bags! He gave a great presentation/rundown of our room and the facility and was SO dang friendly--as everyone at this hotel was! The next morning we had booked a couples massage at the Vdara Spa and we SO recommend that! The spa staff was friendly and got us set up prior to our massages where we could relax beforehand. I took a 30 minute steam sauna then met my wife for a cup of hot tea then we went in for our massage. Being a guy I had never done that before and MAN I CAN'T WAIT TO DO IT AGAIN!!! Spoil yourself and try it! I was STUPID relaxed afterwards! When the massage was over our massage therapists (mine was named Cassie--very good--just the right pressure) put us in a meditation room that had trickling water and was VERY relaxing. Then I hit the steam sauna again for 30 minutes to finish out the experience. It was awesome and SO worth it. Our room had a mini kitchen that we did not use but we were offered plates, flatware, etc. if we needed it. We called for turn-down service every evening when we left the hotel to go out and our water was always replenished and the bed turned down. The light swithes were a little funky but it certainly does not take a rocket scientist to figure it out. There is a "do not disturb" and "maid service" light on the door that is very nice. It is tucked back in-between the rear of the Bellagio and the new Aria resort. The Aria is a quick five-minute walk and it is worth seeing as well. Very nice. Access to the strip was easy either through Aria or Bellago. All in all we absolutely LOVED this hotel AND the spa and cannot wait to get back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but unusual for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Noodles013
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara for 4 nights from 31/1/10. We've been to Vegas a number of times and always try to stay at a different hotel as there are so many fantastic places to choose from. This time the choice was between Vdara & Aria as we'd previously seen the CItyCenter development being built and decided we'd like to stay there. In the end we decided on Vdara but in hindsight feel the Aria may have been a better choice. We arrived more or less bang on check-in time and the first thing we noticed was how quiet the lobby/reception area was, we were given a room on the 35th floor facing down the back of the strip looking towards The Mandalay Bay, however the room was still being cleaned at the time (we only found this out on arriving at the room). This wasn't a problem as we knew we were a bit early, however the maid must have forgotten to vacuum the floor which was quite a mess from the last guest, so we called reception to ask for the floor to be cleaned. Without hesitation the receptionist apologised and instead offered us an upgrade free of charge to the next level of suite on the 48th floor, which we thought was a fabulous gesture for a fairly minor problem. The room itself wasnt that different from the first one, however the view was out of this world - looking up the strip with the Palms & Rio to the left, Paris to the right, the Stratosphere & downtown straight ahead, and right below us The lake at Bellagio. The view in daylight was amazing, but at night it was truly spectacular, especially during the fountain shows. The view was by far the biggest positive of our stay at Vdara, there were a few negatives, the worst of which occurred on our last morning so therefore left a lasting impression on our stay. For some unknown reason the in-room safe malfunctioned overnight and wouldn't open so i called reception who said they'd send someone immediately. To cut a long story short it took 2 phone calls, and a personal complaint at the reception desk before someone finally came to open the safe - almost 2 hours after the first call. What was particularly annoying was the guy who came said he'd only just had the call from reception and seemed genuinely shocked when told we'd been waiting so long. It was fortunate that we didnt have an early morning flight as passports etc were in there, but it ruined our plans for our last few hours in Vegas as we only had time to grab some food then head to the Airport. If you like the hustle and bustle of a typical Vegas hotel such as the Bellagio or MGM Grand, then the Aria would be a better choice as we passed through it daily and it was much livelier. We were really surprised by how quiet this place was and whilst we knew there was no Casino here we couldnt believe there was only 2 bars, 1 restaurant and no gift or amenities shops. This is a beautiful hotel and the problems are mainly just teething ones in its early days, but we couldnt help but wonder how it will compete with its neighbours - you can walk down the strip without passing Vdara as its behind CityCenter, and there's nothing to draw you in either. In fact you could probably stay in Vegas without even knowing the place exists. This would be a fantastic place for a get-away-from-it-all break, but thats not what you go to Vegas for is it ? However if going back to Vegas meant staying here, we'd be there in a heartbeat !!

Reviews.Title: “You won’t be disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiggsy
Reviews.Content: Exquisite brand new hotel with all the extras we expect from a 5* boutique star establishment. I stayed there last week, with my husband, for 4 nights and now I’m home I can’t sleep in my own bed!! Those beds are simply the best I've ever had the pleasure to settle down in and the pillows are so magnificent I’m now trying to buy some from the supplier, even though I’ll have to pay a huge amount for postage it’ll be worth it. Those Jo Malone (?) scented candles around Reception are perfect too! The staff are all excellent with their friendly, approachable attitude and the whole transactions between staff and guests are completely seamless. The customer service is above and beyond the call of duty and a couple of tiny niggles were dealt with immediately and with such a good manner. I totally agree with other comments about the $15 resort fee – it’s unnecessary and could possibly make guests decide not to bother since none of the other hotels charge it. But, in the great scheme of things, it’s not that much when you have a kitchen with ample equipment to make a meal and a great coffee machine and good sized refrigerator. Beakers/mugs are now supplied - management have obviously taken notice of our requests – and decaff coffee is supplied upon request. We chose the Vdara because when we were in Vegas in December we were there for opening day and just loved the whole look and feel of it. We weren’t disappointed, namely because we had a full view of the Bellagio fountains without having to pay for the room with a view. Just one complaint from 2 weary Brits who like to stay out late to gamble – PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE allow Vdara guests to return to their hotel via the Bellagio walkway after midnight. One night it took us over 40 minutes to traipse back to Crystals via the tram, then walk outside via Aria back to Vdara across a very wide walkway. I expect it’s to save money on having a full-time security person at the entrance but honestly that really hacked us off. And others too I overheard. Good luck with your future business – you all deserve it for providing guests with the most outstanding luxury hotel and some of the most excellently trained staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, fab location, but a few bugs (becuz its new still)”
Reviews.Author: baboon812
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, shopping and restaurants!!! and the luxury of the room itself but sink would not drain properly and for that reason I would not/could not come back.... unless fixed:) MGM Signature highly recommend, however if they fix the sinks then I'm back at the Vdara !!!! Although I love the patio of the Sig.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax, enjoy and pamper yourself”
Reviews.Author: pes7777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on the 47th floor. Quiet, and a great view both in the AM & PM. The staff from top to bottom was great and after only 2 days called me by name. The bed was amazinfg and we called it our cloud bed. A nice soaking tup, a large shower and tons of large absorbant towels. The lobby was quiet and yet only a 5 minute walk through a connected walkway to Bellagio for the action. Not having a casino, smoking, tons of activity all lea dto a great time. And yet we went to shows, ate out, gambled etc. A perfect Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the quality of their service”
Reviews.Author: vctraveller
Reviews.Content: The facilities are new, clean, great location. BUT, I have never had such poor service. Being woken up at 8 a.m. and asked by the housekeeper what time we were leaving, being told to stand in single file at the registration desk, waiting 10 minutes for room service to answer their phone, and 2 hours for a salt shaker.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpj79
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! The fact that it is a non gaming hotel on the heart of the strip means that it is a little quieter than other hotels around it, which after being out all night & day, being bombarded by the lights and sounds of the Strip means that the hotel ends up being that little oasis of tranquility that is such welcome bliss! From the moment that you step through the doors, it seems that this is a hotel that doesn’t seem to cut corners on quality, service and every little aspect of the hotel seems to ooze quality. Our standard room was very fashionable styled with modern furniture and fittings. The rooms contained a kitchenette (Microwave, fridge, stove top etc), a sofa bed, two LCD TVs, a decent size bathroom and the most comfortable bed I have sleep on in any hotel! We have room service on several days and the quality of the food was great, the food was piping hot and well presented two unusual factors for room service! I have stayed in hotels in Vegas before and this is the finest I have ever stayed in, not just in Vegas but anywhere. Usually stay in Fairmont properties when I travel and even Fairmont could take a lesson or two from this property! I cannot recommend this hotel enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Usual Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PALMR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vdara hotel for 2 weeks. The trip was part business and part leisure. We have been to vegas several times before and the Vdara was certainly a different experience in this new City Centre development. There is no gambling and no smoking at the hotel whatsoever. What the hotel lacked in ameneties it made up for in the deluxe suite we stayed in which was large, clean and with a view to die for overlooking the Bellagio fountains. An added bonus was that the hotel was joined to the Bellagio by a short covered walk way so good for access to the strip and the hotel's buffet breakfast. The food in the restaurant at the Vdara is not cheap but was a nice experience. Lots of staff to tend to your needs. The Aria is another hotel in this development and I have to say we were pleased we had chosen the Vdara! On the downside the hotel needs to be signed better as it took us an age to find it from the airport by car. At the moment this is still a work in progress area and as such there was a bit of building going on both in the hotel and outside whilst we were there but it was not major. All in all a great hotel to return to after pounding the convention centre and the strip! Beds and pillows to die for!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Such a WONDERFUL place!”
Reviews.Author: ptrainerpam
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It is visually a masterpiece, especially if you like modernism. I just walked around in awe at all the touches, nothing went unnoticed. The room was gorgeous, spacious, clean and comfortable. I want my bathroom at home to be like the one in my room. There is a huge soaking tube and a large european shower. The bed was extremely comfortable and everything still smells and feels brand new. I just loved everything about this hotel. Service was great. Go stay, relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “One night of Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: 1funtravler
Reviews.Content: An unexpected extra night in Vegas due to our arrival airport being shut down led us to Adara. Quick, efficient reservations with a great rate were made from the airport and upon arrival (15 min later) greated pleasently at the door by the bellman and swift check-in. We were given one of the top floors- AMAZING views! Best one we've ever had in Vegas with snow covered mtns in the distance overlooking the Bellagio pools and fountain (room actually towers over Bellagio), the Eiffel tower was just to the right and all the glittering lights surrounding was just dazzling. Black out shades, automatic lights throughout, large luxurious soaking tub, seperate shower, CLEAN! comfortable bed and bath, desk area with internet which is 'free' with your resort fee of $15 upon arrival (also overlooks amazing view which is visible from every spot in the large room), bar area that's actually a kitchenette with microwave, 2 burner stove, extra refrigerator room in addition to stocked mini-bar, and sink would be great to make small meals or breakfast to save while you were in vegas, as well as comfy sofa, Two flat screen TV's and small dining area round out this comfy, modern room. No complaints here, only wish we could have stayed longer! No casino in this hotel makes it a nice break from all the hustle and bustle of vegas, although you only have to walk next door to Aria to join in the excitement when you are ready. Modern feel throughout, 2 bars and one restaurant in lobby area, pool and spa area which we never actually visited for our short stay, and it also connects to the Bellagio for even more casino/dining/entertainment access. Bellman helped get us at taxis (only took 5 minutes) when we had to depart at 4am the next morning for the airport. Great location, staff and accomodations. Would highly reccommend and look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Clean air, relaxed atmosphere, a respite from Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Nordi
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at Vdara for 4 nights. Our Check-in was quick and efficient and our room was ready for us at 12:30 (check-in time is 3:00, but we got in a bit early). Dishes and cutlery was dealt with at that point - Housekeeping came up within 10 minutes with plates, bowls, a pot and pan, as well as cutlery. The room was on the 30th floor, with a view of the pool and the backside of the Aria. A bit of traffic noise from 15, but not too bad at night. Few problems - a couple of lights didn't work, but nothing overly important. Wireless worked flawlessly, no problems with weak water pressure and it was always hot for a shower at any time of day. The bed was extremely comfortable and is making us both rethink our own personal choice of mattress. REALLY enjoyed the fact that it was a non-smoking hotel. Walking out of the Aria or the Bellagio and into the Vdara was definitely a breath of fresh air! A lot of complaints about Vdara's distance from The Strip. From the amount of walking we did over the 4 days, a small walk through the casino at Aria or through the Bellagio to get to The Strip wasn't bad. One thing - it was our first trip to Vegas, and it must have showed, because we got 'taken for a ride' when we left the airport to goto the Vdara by cab. A trip that should have cost $15 hit $25 for us. I would suggest taking the shuttle or a cab to the Aria and then walking through to the Vdara. Wireless, Parking, Fitness Centre, Turndown service, etc were a couple of things included with the 'resort fee'. A bit steep, especially if you don't use all of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “It's lovely”
Reviews.Author: tarheel2000
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Vegas for a 4-night girls' trip. After reading rocky reviews, I was apprehensive about staying at Vdara, however, I booked before it opened, so we were locked in. First, what are people complaining about? It's a lovely hotel - the loveliest in Las Vegas, in my opinion. As soon as we crossed the walkway from the Bellagio every day/night, we smelled the spa-like fragrance of the lobby and said "it's so good to be home." Every other hotel in Vegas smells like smoke... ick. Vdara was our respite from the craziness of Vegas. Our room was very well-appointed and clean. We stayed in the basic suite and never made use of the kitchen space and barely used the living/den space. It was more than big enough for us two. Yes, there is only one sink in the bathroom, but there are large surfaces on both sides. We had plenty of room to prep for the evenings at the same time. We did experience some of the technical glitches mentioned in other reviews. Our housekeeping/do not disturb light wasn't working upon check-in. A nice serviceman came up to repair it after 4 calls in 2 days. Also, the light switches are odd but certainly not rocket science. We had figured them out by the second day. If I had to compare Vdara to another hotel, I would say it most closely mirrors a Kimpton. In closing, don't be frightened off by the less than stellar reviews. Although, I'm not sure how much I would pay to stay there. Prices may skyrocket once the place is more established. We happened to get an amazing deal. Tip: Try the spa and arrive early for the sauna and whirlpool. The gym is also GREAT. Silk Road is very good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JJMD10
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Vdara in mid January and can't express how much we enjoyed this peaceful escape.
